reviews.text: My job ordered street pops as a Friday pick me up for employee appreciation and it did just that! The mini pops were the perfect size for a snack. I grabbed the peach crumble flavor and it was delicious!

So so so good! Everyone loves a classic popsicle. It's takes you back to the days of being a kid and playing outside. Streetpops takes a unique perspective on the average popsicle and twists it into an amazing concoction. 

They feature a variety of flavors at given times like orange cream, lemon lavender, and chocolate sea salt. You can tell that every flavor is thought out and creative. These are a sweet treat for any day and for anyone. 

One thing I will say is that it can get a little pricy for families. I still think it's worth the trip but just walk in knowing that the popsicles are not your typical. 
 
Everyone is always super nice and informative about true flavors that are currently being featured. If you want an alternative to the typical ice cream treat...make sure to give them a try.

OMGosh, I just had a popsicle at the Sweetpops Truck from the Columbus Food Truck Festival and it just may have been the best popsicle I've ever had. Seriously. I have a sweet tooth and this satisfied every.single.morsel of it. I had the pineapple passionfruit and it definitely did not disappoint. I'm sad they're not in Columbus, but when I'm in the Cincy area I'm definitely stopping by!
Awesome my son loved it and says he couldn't stop eating it. Kid approved! We will be back for more

We bought a gift certificate off cincysavers.  On our 1st visit, we went around 4:30 (open until 6p) and they were closed!  We are from NKY so this was a terrible inconvenience.  I contacted them via email several weeks ago, no response.  Very disappointing.

The flavors are spot on. We got ginger mint mojito, banana piña colada, strawberrry + rose cream, pomegranate tangerine, and cookies and cream. Thoroughly enjoyed them all. Great service. We will return :)

This place rocks.

First off, I'm a sucker for nice architecture. The shiny, butterfly-adorned tiles on the walls, i am told, are worth $75,000 apiece. That's right, everything in this parlor is authentic, original architecture.

Oh yeah, there's ice cream, too! I had some of the Blue Moon Cookie Dough and it was amazing. It was soft and creamy, and full of flavor.

The Rookwood tile and vibes sent me to another place and time when I stepped into The Rookwood Ice Cream Parlor. This ice cream shop has so much potential but could use some work to make it a welcoming environment. When we stepped up to the counter, we were informed of how many of the flavors that they were out of (which was quite a few). It was a busy day, so I can forgive that. What really alarmed me was the poor attitude of the staff. Our interaction with the staff was short and cold. Given that this is a family-friendly environment, it feels like the vibes should be a lot warmer and friendlier.

The Rookwood Ice Cream Parlor has lots of potential. The environment is SUPER cool, but also needs to be well-kept. The parlor was kept in poor shape and the floor desperately needed to be swept and mopped. Maybe we just caught them after a rush of business and saw it at the wrong hour. The ice cream was delicious, of course, and I would definitely come back to bring someone to this super cool environment. This Ice Cream Parlor is such a great asset to the museum, and I would love to see it step up its game to wow visitors and locals alike.

The Rookwood Graeter's @ Union Terminal is one of the less-known pieces of Cincinnati history. It's Art Deco to the max and couldn't possibly be more quaint and unique. It's surprisingly well-preserved given its age (you can see a bit of wear on the old Rookwood tiles) but it definitely takes you back to when Union Terminal was a bustling train station almost 100 years ago. Service isn't great and the prices are high, but it's a fun experience nonetheless.

Is the ice cream and atmosphere great? YOU BET. The issue? I checked in (with the Yelp app) and had a coupon for a free scoop of ice cream. It does not expire until July of this year. Sure, they did not have the dino egg ice cream that day, but they could have honored it with a different flavor perhaps. Customer service is king for me. It is quite rare for me to give such a low rating but the whole situation left a bad taste in my mouth (and not an ice cream taste).

A classic ice cram parlor located in the Cincinnati Museum Center at Union Terminal.  It gets its name from the classic Rookwood tiles that adorn its walls.  They serve the same ice cream that you'll find at UDF.  It makes for a fun break while you are checking out the museum.

Recently visited this little gem of an ice cream parlor.  So happy that Union Terminal still keeps this shop open.  I do think it would be nice if the silverware and glassware were a little more authentic of the era that this soda shop was in during its prime, but I understand with a lot of children visiting the shop, it might not be convenient.  I also think maybe having parfaits and ice cream floats on the menu would be a little more reminiscent of original ice cream parlors, than just smoothies and soft serve.  We visited this shop to actually take photos for a retro photo shoot, & the manager Andrew E. was so super nice, accomodating & professional.  I can't say that for some of the employees that were working in and around UnionTerminal that day.

Wonderful selection of ice cream and treats!  The lady working there was cheerful, helpful, and shared with us her knowledge of the shop.  Originally a tea parlor, the floors, walls, and wall dividers are covered with beautiful Rookwood Pottery  tiles in pastel colors with an art deco floral, butterfly, and dragonfly theme.  The chairs, center light fixture, tables all fit so nicely into this retro gem.

This is a clean, well stocked UDF. The gas pump area was clean, and the gas flowed quickly.
Inside, there is a wide array of both prepackaged and prepares foods. 
The fountain soda was a bit flat, but the soft pretzels were delicious. 
Staff is friendly and efficient.

It was Wednesday. I was having a busy day of work projects on two different sides of town Having received the @UDF #u-drive email I really wanted to pick up the the Wednesday freebie at a UDF location convenient to my route from the eastside to the westside of town.This location seemed to be the best for that. Following my Google map directions I easily found this UDF store which is easily noticable as you approach the intersection.  I was immediately surprised by the large exterior lot and the large number of gas pumps on it. Also the price for regular was very reasonable and I had #u-drive points to use which were decreasing every month that I held on to them. Most of the points had come from buying their delicious @UDF malts. The first thing I did was park in front of the store to go in and get the freebie. Customers were leaving the counter as I approached  it. The two employees greeted me. I asked them where to find the chocolatey treat. Turns out it was right in front of me on a super convenient display. I was quickly & easily checked out using the  #u-drive app and then headed to my car. Next I drove over to a nearby gas pump. The payment transaction went very fast so I was soon done filling up my tank. I will gladly return to this location. The exterior lot and the store were very clean. The employees were friendly. My freebie chocolate snack was delicious! Until next time be kind to each other. @udf #u-drivefreebie @yelpcincy #wednesday #cincyeastside

This is one of most recently remodeled UDFs in Cincinnati. It's maybe 18 months old and still looks fresh out of the oven. The parking lot is spacious which is important to me. The gas prices are consistently some of the lowest in the city. Their beer cooler has a decent selection with some local craft options including Truth. The chocolate milkshakes here are thebomb.com. Just ask for a bit less milk so it's thicker. There's an automated tire air station to the right. 

No restroom, sadly. I dream of a world where every business that's open to the public has restrooms.

Located on next to the elementary school on Smith Rd.  Its a really nice UDF, but it's not easy access to get in and out of.  
I went inside to buy a couple of things, and the attendant was really nice and efficient.  Area clean and love it when they have Ice Cream sales.

United Dairy Farmers convenience stores and gas stations are a local icon in the Cincinnati area. Many, if not all, have ice cream counters where a delicious shake or cone can be had from fresh UDF product. More commonly, customers interact with their petroleum services for refueling or the coffee and snacks from the convenience store.

From what I can tell, this location has almost become a flagship like store for UDF who is still locally based in Norwood. In 2012, this location was shut down for a bit of time and completely overhauled with a refurbished store, new lot, parking and pumps. The results are a very nice corner station that is well maintained and relatively easy to access despite the odd 5 way stop.  

The UDF has snacks, drinks, gas and brewskis as one would expect. The secret of this and a few other UDF locations in the area is that they often have significantly better prices on gas than competing locations just yards away. If you're in the area, they're always worth checking for a fill up.

Having the nicest neighborhood gas station should not be a difficult feat to achieve, but so few seem to really care. UDF has invested in improving their local facilities and have delivered a nice upgrade to a neighborhood stable.

Alright, who reviews a UDF?  Well, this guy today...because I was looking for a bathroom in between meetings.  This UDF does not have a restroom...major bummer.

I did find this place cleaner than most of the Norwood corner stores and gas seems to be competitively priced (I use GasBuddy to make sure I'm saving...)

The service: a little on the slow side.  I bought a water, probably waited 4-5 mins in line.

Giant milkshakes! My wife and I stopped here on a hot afternoon to get 2 small milkshakes and the ladies behind the counter told us there was some special happening where their largest sized milkshakes and malts were priced less than the regular small drink's price!!!  Guess we showed up at the right time!  We left with a giant cookie dough and a giant peanut butter milkshake!  The cups were so big that it lasted us 3 separate milkshake devouring episodes over the next 2 days!  They might not have lasted two days but we helped each other exercise some moderation.

I guess these specials aren't rare.  Next time you stop to get gas at a UDF check out the ice cream counter to see if this deal is going on.

Stood there for almost 10 minutes waiting to order a milkshake while the employee refused to acknowledge my existence and instead talked with and helped people who had only been in the store for a minute.

Attention ICE CREAM LOVERS!! This place is AWESOME. Thanks for making my 2nd rolled ice cream experience great. It was so fun to watch your ice cream be created and the staff were friendly, creating an overall inviting atmosphere.

I ordered the Brownie Bash and it was absolutely DELICIOUS. Creamy, loaded with delicious toppings and filling! Each bite contained brownie morsels, chocolate chips, delicious fudge-like chocolate syrup and scrumptious caramel sauce. It's a combo made in heaven and perfect for any chocolate lover.

I will definitely be back to try a different flavor. I recommend this place to anyone who wants a picturesque delicious ice cream creation! They are located in Findlay Market in a stand outside on the weekends. Definitely don't miss out and order yourself a yummy treat! 

The only con is I wish it was cheaper, but maybe this is a good thing since this will prevent me from ordering a treat every weekend ha.

Rolled ice cream seems to be one of those novelty foods that is half about eating and half about watching it be made. That being said it is a good fit for Findlay Market as many people come down not just for the food from Findlay but also the experience. It's definitely fun watching them make the ice cream and is a nice treat on a hot day.

Y'all I was so impressed by their rolled ice cream! Deliciously cream and not overly sweet. 
I went in June 2018 and was lucky enough to have caught them, we came on a Friday in July and no such luck. Very sad to have missed them as we don't often come to Cincinnati. 
That being said, every trip we make, we will always have time to find Lenny's. Absolutely the best! We've tried several places before and this just rolled to the top. I had the cookies and cream. The layer of fudge in the roll just made this so much better. This is how you do ice cream!!!

How do I know they're the best?! Because I enjoy ice cream as much or more as our last VP Joe Biden. Ice cream is life. Have you ever seen Biden with an ice cream cone? No? Look it up, it's a thing of beauty. Anyway, you must stop by and try this place!! Well worth the 2+ hour drive!!

I've seen rolled ice cream on the internet, and have wanted to try it ever since! Well, today was my lucky day since I came across Lenny's Cold Rolled at Findlay Market! The concept is awesome, because they make your ice cream to order, so you get to watch. But, more than that, they way it's laid out and then rolled up, means you get a layer of toppings evenly distributed throughout each roll!! It's brilliant. It does taste a little different from regular store-bought ice cream, though, as it is made on the spot with heavy cream (as opposed to milk and various chemicals in store-bought). This means you get a little fatty/oily mouthfeel for a while after you eat it. But, on a super hot day, it's totally worth it!!

Cheese is my favorite food - so when I saw this little shop, located texted door to the brewery in Lockland, I had to check it out. 
The young man who was in the shop was very knowledgable about the cheeses and enthusiastic when describing the flavors of what they had available. 
They make most of the cheeses in the shop and he let us peak through the window where it's made to get a look at the equipment. 
I chose the Brie, Goat and Mozzarella cheeses. All of them are fantastic! 
They don't have regular hours, we just happened to see them open. But we were told to call to check when they are in the shop. They are also at Montgomery Farmer's Market on Saturdays.

Artisano Foods, what an authentic flavor. It reminds me of my childhood in Venezuela where I grew with so many kinds of fresh cheeses, all delicious. When you walk into the store, Eduardo, the owner and artisan, is quick to make you feel at home and help you choose sampling the many types of cheeses he makes right there in the store. All of his cheeses are freshly made; and when I say fresh, I mean fresh. Just made a few days ago.  You can even watch how the cheese is made.  Not only fresh cheese, you can also get Harina PAN (corn flour) so you can make delicious fresh cheese-stuffed arepas. It's truly a Latin American flavor made in Cincinnati. 

I would strongly recommend you visit the store and get a sample of products, and if you're preparing a party or any type of gathering, Eduardo sets you up with a wonderful variety of products to delight your guests.

The art of cheese is not unlike fine wine making; and the experts at Artisano food make some fine cheese. Like fine vintage wine, the soft cheeses you find at this store are quite unique.

I had not realized that the art of cheese making draws many parallels with wine making. Selecting the right cultures to achieve the desired flavor, followed by maturation and aging are all crucial for the delivery of good cheese, and good wine.

This is a great addition to the expanding Cincinnati culinary choices.

First of all they have NERD Blizzards which I have been trying to find at multiple Dairy Queen's and no one had them but them! Good service and busy so just be prepared to wait in a small line but well worth it!
The ice cream is very good! Fast great service... My favorite summer time treat!! I would recommend!!

It was the first day of Spring and Dairy Queen had a free cone day. I was lucky enough to be able to stop by the Saint Bernard location on the way to work. The neighborhood high school had just let out and the shop was a little busy but the line moved fast. I chose the chocolate soft serve in a cup instead of the vanilla and added chocolate sprinkles for $0.30. They also had the option of cherry sprinkles which  sounded good too!                                            It was very cold for the first day of Spring so I ate in my car. The soft serve was mildly creamy and the chocolate flavor was better than average. Until next time be kind to each other.#yelpcincy #dairyqueen
We love our neighborhood DQ! Traditional cinder block building with friendly service and the classic DQ soft serve. It's the best!
Good seasonal place for ice cream. It does not have the full menu of hamburgers and fries you would see at others but they do sell a BBQ sandwich, hot dogs and metts as well.
One of the best places in Cincinnati to get ice cream! Friendly service every time!!!

This ice cream hotspot beyond satisfies a sweet tooth. The sizes are all huge, you'll be fine with a small. The staff is always friendly, & really makes you feel as you should when treating yourself. If you order the brownie delight, add extra brownies, the huge portion of ice cream is disproportionate. However, we've never left unsatisfied!

Mt. Healthy Dairy Bar is one of the better ice cream places in the Cincinnati area. It's locally owned, making it better than the chains. The service is fast and friendly. It has a good assortment. The menu has ice cream and hot foods. 

It has all the ice cream basics. I had an orange slushie, which is one of several slushie flavors. These are about $1.50 for a regular size. It should be said this place is cash only. This wasn't a problem for me because I had a few dollars, but you should know this. 

I like places like this more than the corporate chains. It's nice not having to deal with a fake corporate atmosphere. There are plenty of independently owned ice cream stores in the area but there still need to be more.

I Love this place.Its a great place to get something chilli on a extremely hot day.Some of the best soft served ice cream I've ever had.I recommend the chocolate swirl,but you really can't go wrong with plain vanilla

Initially I thought this dairy bar was good and about average for a dairy bar. After visiting many others, I would say this place is above average and very consistent with portions and recipes and the staff is always great!

In my humble opinion, MHDB (as it is known in our house) is the best dairy bar for miles around. The soft serve is creamy and delicious and my personal favorite, the Reese's Cup Flurry made with chocolate ice cream is the stuff dreams are made of. The serving size is generous and there is just enough soft serve to bind the big chunks of fresh peanut butter cup together.  It's probably a good thing they close for the winter!!  The service is always prompt and friendly too.

This is a little hidden gem located on Hamilton Ave and it is easy to pass right by it. I decided to stop and try their ice cream. Oh yea, I think I fell in love. The soft serve is very flavorful. It has the perfect amount of softness and sweetness. The price per portion exceeds my expectation. I would always go to the other ice cream place that is less than 10 mins away, but not anymore. If you are in Mt. Healthy, this is the place to get ice cream.

Visited the Mt Healthy Dairy Bar last night. The line moved very quickly, and the staff were friendly. The young gentleman that took my order suggested a candy apple sundae, and it was delicious! Prices were reasonable and there were a variety of options.

This place is fantastic. We love these roadside ice cream type places - they are always delicious and reasonably priced. This one didn't disappoint. The Dairy Bar was staffed by friendly people and the servings were very generous. Since it's fairly close to home, I think this will be our new go-to ice cream spot.
The best west side ice cream.  Creamier tha most other dairy bars.  And a great value.  Even their small cup will fill you up.

A little slice of Americana on Hamilton Avenue!  No scenery to be had here, just the bustle of the busy street, a few tall trees, and grass patches with picnic tables.  I have been going here since I was a little girl (back then I ordered a Snowman) and whenever I get a craving for soft serve this is all that I want.

They offer some food, just the usual ice cream stand fair like coneys, nachos, and soft pretzels.  None of that is very impressive.  The ice cream treats and the soft serve is where it's at.  My favorites are the Glacier, which is a slushy with soft serve piled high in the center and whipped cream or a PFC Sundae, which is pecans, fudge, and chocolate sauce.  I also love the flavor burst ice creams, which are vanilla soft serve with an intensely flavored stripe on the sides or the monthly frozen yogurt flavor. They also offer lots of other frozen treats like milkshakes, flurries, slushies, and banana splits.  They also have recently brought out a "Blue Ice Cream," which is a dupe for the King's Island's Smurf Ice Cream.

A little additional info: they are CASH ONLY.  Also, as far as I have seen they are pet friendly since it is a walk up stand.  Along with being a walk-up stand they are only open seasonally.  They usually open sometime in March or later and seem to close around September.  There is a drive thru, but the lines can get long and don't go very fast.  It is a pretty busy area of that street and it is also next to a funeral home, so if there is a service there can be more traffic in the parking lot, which is something to keep in mind if you are bringing rambunctious little ones.

This place is awesome. We ordered small dipped cones and they were huge and perfect. I want to try all of the iced creams but I can picture myself getting the butterscotch dipped cone many 100's of times. Either way is good with me.
Best soft serve ever! And really great soft serve sherbet! And the people are so nice. Love this place!!

I don't crave ice cream often and -- to be completely honest -- I think that most parlors are the same. That is until the Mt. Healthy Dairy Bar comes into the conversation. 

I grew up frequenting this stand situated on the bustling Hamilton Avenue. The surrounding businesses aren't what one would call welcoming, but somehow it works. From its standard ice cream cones to flurries, shakes, blizzards and dip tops, there are more than enough options to satisfy even the most discerning ice cream connoisseur. The Dairy Bar even recently started making and selling a Blueberry/Blue Raspberry soft serve that is reminiscent of the famous Smurf ice cream from Kings Island. And, well, if you're not in the mood to pay a $40 entry to KI, the Dairy Bar is a fantastic alternative.

While the ice cream selection may be expansive enough, there are also plenty of food items as well for a quick bite before indulging in a sweet treat finale.

I typically opt for either a small chocolate/vanilla swirl cone with chocolate sprinkles or a chocolate milkshake made with chocolate/vanilla swirl ice cream. I recently ordered the latter and, boy, I may never get the former again. The milkshake was outstanding. In fact, I'm craving one now. And if the Dairy Bar can bring me to crave ice cream, it has to be great.

It's just good soft serve at the Mount healthy dairy bar. There's a place down the street closer to me who's soft serve doesn't even compare to their ice cream. The Mount healthy dairy bars Softserve is actually creamy. I love it.

The Mt Healthy Dairy Bar offers pretty standard ice cream stand fare, but just done a little better.

The Dairy Bar has a small menu of actual food items.  I ordered the foot long chili dog with mustard and onions.  The dog featured Cincinnati style chili which was pretty standard, not great not bad, just okay.  If you're looking for chili dogs I would suggest going to a Cincinnati favorite like Skyline.

Soft-serve ice cream treats are the real focus of this roadside stand.  They have a wide array of shakes, freezes, flurries and cones.  The ice cream items remind me of similar Dairy Queen huts I used to go to as a kid.  This place is definitely good for hot days where cold soft serve is a must.

my childhood favorite. my neighborhood was mt heathy. i always visit on my trips back home . great service and knowledgeable staff.  great varieties of ice cream, homemade sherbets. ..love the blackberry. and food . great memories !

Only gave it 4 stars because it requires CASH to go there but that's really only an inconvenience. The cones are large and delicious. The ice cream is good. The chocolate is chocolaty which I like. The entrance is on the street next to the building the other driveway is an exit only. Enjoy!

Whatever brand machine/mix they use for their soft serve really makes their soft serve outstanding. Very creamy and thick. It's better then I've had at any other around. Wish they took check/credit cards. It's 2015.

Visited today for the grand reopening of the newly updated location. 

Good news. The "sticky" ice cream is no more. Flavor and texture were the quality one expects from Graeters.  My banana split made with salted caramel ice cream, coffee ice cream, butterscotch, hot fudge, and pecans was delicious.  I would go so far as to say the best split or Sundae I have ever had. My son asked for two cherries on top, and they gave him three. Those are the little things that make Graeters  (and this location,) so much better than the competition. 

Employees were all smiles. Sophie was particularly memorable.  She was helpful in making choice, didn't rush us, and made beautifully full sundaes. No skimping on the kid's sundaes just because they are children.  She was attentive to us, and helped other employees.

Best ice cream in Cincy. Graeter's has many great homemade ice cream flavors.  Today I strayed away from the norm and tried a mocha coffee ice cream drink.  Besides the calories, it was delicious!
They offer their delicious donuts and coffee in the mornings.
This location is always clean and has very friendly service. Convenient location with a large parking lot.

I came here for the Graeter's Cone for the Cure day when donations are made to help find a cure for pediatric brain cancer. This is such a great cause and I suggest you come to a Graeter's location of your choosing to support it every September. I Prefer not having my scoop of ice cream in a cone and always get it in a cup where there is plenty of room for a second scoop. This day was no exception. I had the Cone for a cure flavor of Elena's Blueberry Pie with pieces of pie crust in it. The flavor is rich and the texture is creamy. It is very good for not having any chocolate in it. My second scoop was the s'more ice cream. This is one of my favorites although I think it is only a promotional flavor. For a $5 donation you could get a coupon book. I was happy to do this!                  There was a problem with how much I was charged though. My extra scoop was priced as a regular kid's cup at $3.50 not as an additional scoop at $1.25. When I asked the manager she confirmed that charging me for kid's cup was correct. However at other locations in past years this was not the case. I will not be returning to this Graeter's location in future if the choice is mine. Instead I will be going to other locations to get my Graeter's fix. Nor I can I recommend this location for any other free scoop day like National Ice Cream day! Until next time be kind to each other. #yelpcincy #graetersicecream

OK, as someone from Texas who was recently living in Tennessee the Bourbon pecan chocolate chip May be the best tasting substance on earth.

And Graerter's is about the best ice cream I think I've ever had.

This is my third time at this ice cream place in a week which shows how delicious the Buckeye flavor it is! It's chocolate ice cream with chocolate chips and peanut butter cookie dough in it--amazing! It's a good thing that there are none of these restaurants near where I live so that I can only get this treat while on vacation. If you have to choose between Graeters or something else, choose Graeters you will not be disappointed!

Seriously - there's no ice cream better than Graeter's. As much as everyone enjoys Creamy Whip...it's not real ice cream. ;) 

My personal favorites are raspberry chip (isn't that everyone's fav?) and lime sodas (vanilla ice cream with extra lime flavoring and a shot of soda - sort of like a lime float). I love their bittersweet chocolate flavoring too. 

Okay. I like it all. Bring on the Graeter's, summer!

I love Graeters but probably will not return to this location. We went in for an ice cream cone for National Ice Cream day.  This is the conversation verbatim:
My friend orders an ice cream cone.
Server: which one would you like?
Me: The $1.47 one
Server: they're all on sale--sugar, waffle, chocolate coated waffle, sprinkle coated waffle.
My friend orders a sugar cone and I order a waffle cone.
At the till, we are charged two different prices.  I mentioned that the server said they were all the same price.  The server comes over and says, "No, I said they are all on sale."  While technically true, I pointed out that I asked which ones were $1.47.  She continued to to insist that she just told me they were on sale seemingly like I was trying to dupe them.  They did give me the sugar cone price but she walked away saying one more time that all she said was they were on sale.  What she didn't do was answer my specific question and then treat me like I was in the wrong.

We were headed back home to Chicago from Tennessee and had to make a stop in Cincinnati to visit one of the Graeters locations and we picked this one. 

Service was fantastic and the ice cream was to die for. The many different flavors was awesome. After having an ice cream cone each , we ended up taking a few pints of ice cream home and the employees was kind enough to package our ice cream with some dry ice for the 5 hour drive home. 

Can't wait for Graeters to come to Chicago

I love Graeters and have appreciated the gift of a free sundae on my birthday. However, they have changed the "rules" in redeeming birthday sundaes and only give you less than a week to redeem! They may tell you otherwise, but the manager at this Graeters is not kind! 
I was not in town the week of my birthday and she would not allow me to redeem it when I came back, though the other staff had already approved it and made my sundae.(It was only a few days after the limited 5 days.)She made me pay for it. It was quite embarrassing, as I had an out of town guest with me and had been bragging about the family atmosphere at Graeters.
This manager has snipped at me and my friends before, as well as belittle those working for her. She is not kind and really is ruining Graeters on Westbourne.
They called again blueberry pie Alina's blueberry pie was awesome and raspberry chip ice cream

We visited this Greater's on a busy Saturday night (5/5/18).   When we asked the young girl working the counter if the ice cream we chose for our 4year old with a severe peanut allergy contained any peanuts, she immediately went to the back to get her manager.  The manager came to the front and insisted on making our child's ice cream from a fresh tub to insure no cross contamination.  In addition to this kind gesture, the location was clean and the staff was very friendly.  I didn't catch the managers name, but she, her staff and her store will get as many stars as Yelp will allow me give them!   We will be back to this location again!

This is a nice-sized location. They have ~5 four-top tables for dining in. They also have plenty of floor space for seasonal displays and such.

I also like that this location is right next to a mini-golf place and a bowling alley. Makes it an easy spot for a little dessert after a game or two.

They have all the great Graeter's stuff, and its not just ice cream! Their baked goods are delicious, too.

Since everyone is mentioning their fav flavors, I'll throw mine out, too. Raspberry Chocolate Chip is mine. Although Mint Chocolate is also delicious. Their sundaes are a great value, check them out the next time you're in. Huge portions at good prices.
All that needs to be said, Raspberry Chocolate Chunk!  Best ice cream I have ever had.  A just get when visiting Cincinnati!
Hands down, best Ice Cream in country!  You cant find better anywhere!

Yes. 5 star. Awesome. The ice cream was amazing. I had the Blackberry with chunks, and I strongly emphasize, CHUNKS, of chocolate swirled throughout. A single scoop was larger than my fist and completely filling. The staff was very friendly. I was asked if I had a frequent buyer number, to which I replied no, and suggested that the clerk use her own if she had one. She said she couldn't and I told her that I respected and appreciated her integrity. And then I added a couple bucks to the tip jar. The ice cream was so good. I will go here again without hesitation.
Some of the best ice cream I have ever had! The mint chocolate chip is to die for... seriously a reason to go out of your way in southern Ohio to get this amazingly delectable dessert.

Graeter's is a Cincinnati specialty - half ice cream parlor and half bakery - that Oprah revealed as her favorite place to get ice cream on one episode.  And while whatever Oprah says doesn't necessarily go, Graeter's is second-to-none in the way of deliciously rich ice cream that has unforgettable chocolate "chips" the size of small candy bars.  My favorite flavors are mocha chocolate chip and raspberry chocolate chip, and when I couldn't decide between the two on my last visit, the oh-so-kind gentleman behind the counter gave me a giant "sample" of raspberry after I chose mocha.  These flavors aren't messing around, and unlike other ice cream chains whose only redeeming quality is their variety of toppings, Graeter's can afford to keep it nice and simple.  One of the best things about this particular location in Western Hills is the fact that a woman named Ada has been working there for as long as I can remember; she's a real sweetheart who's probably over 80 years-old but who still scoops a killer ice cream cone.

Cowboy Cones is a convenient way to get a delicious ice cream fix. Their walk-up window makes it easier than ever for a quick purchase of a sweet treat. My go-to flavor is none other than their Kitty Kitty Bang Bang. Though it is listed as an ice cream flavor, they were more than happy to make it into a milkshake for me. It consists of smooth cheesecake-flavored ice cream with a sweet raspberry ripple. To top it all of off, there are also bits of Oreo cookies and a mix of some chocolate chunks. If you have a sweet tooth, you will surely not be disappointed. I always make a point to stop by whenever I'm in the area.

My doctor is not going to be happy that we found Cowboy Cones!

That $%*! Just Got Serious may be the best ice cream I've ever had. My wife's Exhausted Parents was almost as good. 

Might have to walk from home to get the exercise to offset the calories.

It was fun to get ice cream at the cow painted shop!  the ice cream was delicious and there were so many flavors it was hard to pick! 
The kids loved it and we will be back!! 
Very Covid safe!

Great service and fantastic ice cream!! I had the Iced Latte-Da, which was perfect for my chocolatey-coffee craving. I also tried the This $&@! Just Got Serious, which was also delicious. They were even knowledgeable about which flavors were gluten-free. If I visit Wyoming again soon, I will definitely visit again once they've opened the actual store (they say that hopefully this will be in 3-5 weeks, as of this posting).

Nice local ice cream joint on Wyoming Ave. Currently there is a cart with a brick and mortar store coming soon. There were several gluten free items (which I really appreciated)....they said that once the store opens they will stock GF cones too! I had the Superman which was colorful and smooth. Prices are a bit high, but I'm sure the portion:price ratio will stabilize once they get on their feet. Yeehaw!
Very nice little shop with great flavors Highly recommend Bourbon Pecan and Fat Elvis.

I generously give this shop 2 stars because- ice cream. Truth is, it wasn't good ice cream. I don't know how you can mess up chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream- but it was not tasty. There were 2 pieces of cookie dough in my scoop. TWO. We ordered 3 cups of one dip each. It was $12! I feel like that's a lot for bland ice cream. Then, after we paid - my husband said, " oh I was supposed to get sprinkles on one cup."  The reply was - they have to charge more, but will overlook it this time. Ugh. Really. You're charge more for sprinkles on bland, tasteless icecream? . 

There are too many GOOD icecream places around. We won't be back.

I do need to say Covid measures were good.
They offer icecream,soy based ice cream,sorbet and other items.Seasonal flavors make it exciting.
I went yesterday with my little one who absolutely loved the ice cream. The young ladies working at the time were very attentive and kind. All in all, a great experience and we'll definitely be back.

My family and I have been 3 times since the grand opening. We all love love the ice cream. And what is better than having the very nice high school ladies serve you with a smile. So many flavors to choose from and they don't give you the side eye when you ask for more than one sample. My favorite flavor is the blueberry cheesecake. My husband's candy apple pie shake was unbelievable. He said it was the best shake he ever had. My son sticks to cotton candy and my daughter loves the lemon meringue. I enjoy the waffle cones which are very fresh. The only downside to this place is that my kids will be begging to walk here after school in 2 years when they are in middle school. I do admit, I'm a bit jealous as I only had the pastry shop and the corner store when I was coming up in Wyoming. I knocked down a star for the price but that won't stop us from partaking. It's quality ice cream and you can taste that in every bite but I almost feel like my scoop should be a bit bigger for the price.
Go there, NOW.

Every Monday I have two hours to kill in this area (about an hour from my home) and I'm always searching for something to do. I just found it! This place might just have the best ice cream I've ever eaten. The outdoor seating on Main Street is adorable, the staff is polite and quick, and (not that it's the most important thing, but still) the building is painted to look like a cow, which is a huge bonus for me and my kids.
There are so many unique flavors to try and we love them all! My family is lucky this is close enough for us to take a short walk to. My kids ask to go multiple times a week!

Coming soon in Wyoming, Ohio! They have 6 flavors available currently and days open and hours are yet TBD. They have an Ice Cream stand outside the store and should be up and running in about three weeks. I tried the Strawberry, Birthday Cake and one of the mixtures with Brownie, Cookie Dough and Carmel. I liked all three. I will be back when the store is up and running and update my review :-)

Honestly, I was a little skeptical going in.  All the reviews are so SO favorable, and being a little neighborhood joint 20 minutes out of town I wasn't sure if it would really hold up to what I thought was going on.  I have never been happier to be wrong!  This ice cream is now my favorite ice cream in Cincinnati.  They have inventive but classic flavors, their ice cream base is rich and delightful, and their waffle cone was next-level delicious!  Now I'm just wishing that they had a location in Cincinnati a little closer to home, but given how good it is I'm glad there's at least something stopping me from having ice cream all the time!  Their walk-up window was hygienic and all staff were wearing masks so I still felt comfortable going out and getting ice cream, and they have some sidewalk tables outside if you'd like to stay near the store and eat it.  There are also some picnic benches and a park nearby if you wanted to get away from foot traffic as well.  Overall, highly recommend checking it out!
GET A FLIGHT OF ICE ICREAM! So unique and perfect for indecisive ice cream lovers like me lol.

I'm SO hooked on this place! Finally!!! Full fat DELICIOUS ice cream with toppings I can't get at Graeter's, like caramel! Staff is super helpful and friendly and their homemade waffle bowls and cones are amazing!

Storefront just opened! What a nice looking spot - love the paint on the outside. I got the Zoreo and Coconut Chocolate chip (forget the name) and it was unbelievable! Super rich and creamy, right up my alley for ice cream! 2 scoops for $4.99 is a great deal for an upscale ice cream shop like this so I give this 5 Stars for price and taste!

Lots of great ice cream options! My personal favorite was the banana cream pie and the birthday cake flavors!  They offered samples for any of their flavors... another plus when trying to figure out what to get!

Nothing could have been Graeter than the service we received during our visit. We were welcomed by not one, but four employees.  The only exception was an employee who was helping another customer. All employees had smiles on their faces, and genuinely seemed happy to be there.

The areas were clean, and free from stickiness.  Displays were organized, and well thought out. Lots of opptions for grabbing a quick present if one forgot to pick one up, and is also picking up a cake. 

The ice cream was everything one expects from Graeter's. Not too sweet, creamy, bold flavors that delight the tastebuds. Lots of ice cream flavors to choose from. Along with the traditional French pot ice cream there is gelato, and sorbet.  Cone selections even include a pretzel cone. The bakery side was filled with scrumptious looking pastries and cakes. 

To top it off, this location has a drive up window. Yes, even when in a hurry one may get their delectable treats on the go.

Got the famous the Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip today with family in for the holidays.
Been eating this ice cream for many years
 It was like eating UDF or Kroger brand Hone Made knockoff.  The ice cream was not hard almost like soft serve and the chips were very small on a two dip portion.
Of course, I will try again but have never experienced this in the past at Grater's.  I buy my soft serve at Zip Dip.

Glazed Happiness donuts are literally glazed happiness! Their jelly donuts are really good too! I haven't had any of their ice cream recently. I really just go for the donuts and coffee. Very friendly staff. The drive thru is a plus after being on my feet 12-16 hours at work.

I had not been to this location before today. I came in for my free Birthday sundae! The store has a clean, bright, spacious & friendly  atmosphere. There is plenty of parking and tables to sit at outdoors when the weather is warm. The staff is very friendly. I added an extra scoop to make it a three scoop sundae for a minimal extra charge. I also enjoyed the cold refreshing water from the water cooler that that was full of ice. I will gladly return here for more delicious ice cream.
Above average ice cream. Service is great, and the staff is friendly! It is enjoyable to have a treat once a while.
Everything here is delicious. Their tea cookies, iced cookies, ice cream, sorbet, doughnuts, coffee.You can't go wrong, plus this location the employees are very friendly and it's always clean.
Wonderful friendly service in a bright clean store. Fresh well made ice cream. Nice choices for a sundae. Enjoyed sitting outside and sharing our goodies
The ice cream is always delicious.  Service is typically a bit slow. But I forgive them because it's the best ice cream around.
Ice cream is great. Service was bad guy would not explain new rewards or get someone that could. So I got no rewards. So sad they don't have manager watching how they treat peoplr
Do I really need to tell humans about Graeter's? If you're a canine, I'd like to recommend that you get the Frosty Paws or Barktic Bones. Pumpkins ice cream for puppies? Yes, please!

I just went to this location of Greaters and it was phenomenal. There was a girl named Erica whom treated us with pure smiles and a positive, upbeat attitude. This location was the cleanest I've seen as well as was organized. Great experience!!
My adult daughters both have puppies---I guess they are our Granddogs! It was nice to give them the Barktic Bonz frozen dog treats that Graeter's carries.  They loved them.

This place is a west side icon. Come for the golf and stay for the ice cream. The prices are ultra reasonable. 

This is the only place in Cincinnati to get Dole fruit flavored soft serve. 

See owners Keith or Kathy. They will take great care of you. You can have your kids birthday there or have an office lunch!  They do all kinds of golf outtings!  

Countless desert options sure to please anyone!

I did something I literally have only done four times while living in Cincinnati for ten years now. I went to the west side. My least favorite side. 

I was sent a photo of creamy whip from this place and started reading about it. Decided to go as soon as it opened that day to hopefully have to have minimum human interaction.  

My plan worked and my boyfriend and I were the only two people there our a whole game until we were done and a small family came right then. 

When we got there a boy was working by himself and trying to get stuff ready for the day but he didn't act annoyed at all that we were already there. He was helpful on what course he prefers and nice. We ended up doing the 18 holes. Which was long enough for me in 94 degree weather at 11 in the morning. 

This place is very old school Americana style of putt putt. Everything is very self made and cartoon characters around the courses are crazy. They've obviously seen some stuff in their day; seeing how most of them are falling apart. 

Because they're falling apart we had a couple malfunctions with them when playing. The hole that had a giant rock looking thing on it, the foam was falling out of the bottom of the rock and my ball got stuck in it so we had to fish it out. 

Also, the hole with the T-Rex, it's hard to even hit the ball into the hole because you can't get under the dinosaur to hit it in. Then when you hit it in you have to get on your knees and crawl under it to get your balls out. 

The Putt Putt place was decent. I enjoyed it and that's what is important. I would drop $14 on it to do it again at some point. 

We got Creamy Whip afterwards and the woman working the window was super nice and helpful. We both got "Dreams Cones". My boyfriend got the one dipped in hot fudge with nuts. I got the one dipped in hot fudge with rainbow sprinkles. Both were amazing. 

They had a pretty big menu and it was decently overwhelming when we got up to it. So I'm glad the lady working was so helpful. 

They have lots of outdoor picnic tables and seating but we just sat in the car in the AC because we were melting. 

When Covid isn't a thing, they apparently have a game room and a  Bungee jump thing for kids. 

My only real problems I had with this place are the course pieces are falling apart and my major thing is that they have a giant "Blue Lives Matter" flag on their course. Which grossed me out and was a big "What am I looking at on this Putt Putt course?"

But also, not surprised coming from a place named after a guy who murdered a bunch of Native Americans. Ya know? 

I just want to play putt putt be taken away from reality for a minute.

If you're stir crazy and need go get out of the house but don't want to be around a crowd of people. Or if you just want some good creamy whip, hit this place up.

I like to support local businesses, so when it hit 70° I popped over to a nostalgic old favorite: General Custer's. The soft serve prices are relatively expensive ($2.40 for a small dish) but they have a few unique flavor options. In the machine they have chocolate, vanilla, Dole lime and the infamous "King's Island" blue raspberry. You can also get ~35 other flavors as a mix-in (+$.60).

I had the KI-clone blue raspberry, and have to say: it's not exactly a good rip-off of King's Island. It looked a bit too anæmic (pale blue). I was also disappointed to see a bit more of the historic exterior chipped away this season (RIP vintage neon General Chester's sign, my sweet prince). I mostly come here FOR the nostalgia, so once it's all gone I suppose I will be too.

Wow, this place has received a huge makeover in last two years! With new astro turf and fun obstacles in each hole, this place is a new family favorite! There are two different 18 hole courses. I bought a Groupon but it ended up being cheaper without it. I took my 6 year old and 3 year old and children 3 and under were free so I only paid for my 6 year old. It was $7 for the two of the to play unlimited golf! The adjoining creamy whip was reasonably priced and delicious too! They also have a bungee activity and arcade which we didn't do.

First Tuesday of the month from 5-8:30 they have free putt putt. Put on your mosquito repellent. The bugs are ridiculous! I got 10+ mosquito bites during the hour we were there. The event is supposed to last until 8:30p.m. Bit the lights were shut off at 8 along with the bubble blower. The kids get to see Elsa and her sister too. Be prepared for the whole soundtrack of Frozen which I loved and sand along to just to annoy my kids lol. We had a good time. There are a bunch of interesting holes. The cranny who has a bunch of items too, including cheesecake on a stick, yummy.

Love coming to this place for ice cream and put put and bringing the family and dog! Owners are super nice! The courses and obstacles have been completely re done and they are great. Prices are very reasonable and they are open all the way through October which I love to go because it's cooler out. I highly recommend this place.
My favorite local ice cream. Their specialties are always good and fresh. Plus they have putt-putt, and other fun activities.

Updating this to one star.  This place is a disaster for mini golf. I would bulldoze the place and start over.  Absolute trash to pay $6 for this place.  I wouldn't have fun playing for free if that tells you anything.  The course is so mistreated that I wouldn't spend money for the ice cream.  Instead I went to Graeters next door.  My reviews are all positive on yelp so this is the truth.  Save your money and drive somewhere else for fun

The mini golf courses are in pretty rough shape. I'm not a hugely competitive guy but I do like my putting greens to at least have turf that isn't rippled and torn and has been replaced in the last 20 years.

It's fine for little kids I suppose since they probably don't care. I will say, it ways nice to have a frozen chocolate covered banana during the 95 degree heat wave while we were there. 

All in all a little attention to some maintenance of any kind would be nice.

This is pretty well kept up and the holes aren't too cheesy or kid-oriented. Adults can have fun here, even without the kids. We played two rounds and that was enough for our attention span. Had some ice cream afterwards as it was pretty humid. Ice cream is run of the mill, which isn't bad but the prices are much more reasonable than Graeter's which is located right by. I like the location and parking is easy but I never would have known it was in this location as it is tucked away off Glenway, kind of next to Westwood Bowl.

The sign says "General Custer's Last Ice Cream Stand".  The only way the name could be improved is if it was General Custard's.  And then there's the arcade: General's Quarters  Delightful puns gracing a delightful place which is a west side fixture.  Despite being next to the venerable Western Bowl, it shines in its own right.  Every little Western Hills kid plays putt putt then gets a big ice cream cone to celebrate.

If you're a putt putt junkie, you can get all-you-can-play for only $8.50 to polish your skills on the fake greens, which are always an adventure, what with wear spots, little tears, and the ever present leaves and twigs from the little ones who get bored and start piddling with the landscaping.

Even if you don't play ad infinidum, a quick round of 18 will only cost you $6.50.  Plus, if that provokes a need for more miniature golf (perhaps you want to play the Sitting Bull course after finishing the Crazy Horse), they'll usually let you upgrade to the unlimited plan by just paying the extra two bucks.

I don't have kids, so I can't say this is necessarily a great place for a birthday party, but I can say that I've seen many a group of youngsters having an absolute blast running around the courses.  But maybe they were just wired from too much ice cream.

Wow ! What a great place to come visit with the kids. The owners have gone out of their way to maintain and make a great environment for the people visiting this location. I am impressed with all the improvements made and the amount of activities available for the kids to do while there. The owners should be applauded for their dedication in keeping this icon alive and well. If you haven't been here, it's worth stopping just to get a delicious ice cream cone. Thanks !

Went here Sunday with my boyfriend and his 11 year old...had a great time!  The course is cute..there are actually 2 - 18 hole courses here.  It's nothing fancy but it's not a run down place....we all had fun and the ice cream tasted great on a hot day!  I hadn't been here since I was young but had a Groupon and decided to go on over....was a great deal for an afternoon of mini golf.  Give it a try before they close for the season if you have time.

The place is on the way up. They have new turf which makes the golf MUCH nicer. Still looks like the place could use a good scrubbing, paint and vaccum. Prices are good $7 for adult and $5 for kids on sunday afternoon. Bathroom needs attention, get rid of all the little.kids riding toys (why are they here????) and clean up all the planting beds and it would be a nice place for dates. I wish them the best.

In the past, the courses have just been okay. They were a bit run down to be honest. Now? They have brand new turf! It's really decent looking now and a nice place to play some mini golf. The ice cream is okay - mostly soft serve, so it's your typical creamy whip deal.
This place is great!  So much fun!  Ice cream is delish & the hole sculptures make for great pictures!  Staff is very friendly!  There are 36 holes available at a very reasonable $8.

Been going to General Custer's since I was a kid.  Used it as a hangout as a teenager and now as adults.  We went there recently with our daughter and it's just run down.  The course on the left (closest to the street) has the most attractions on it, but NONE of them work.  The course to the right  (far away from the street) has no attractions.  It's basically just concrete obstacles to putt around, no fun stuff for kids.

It needs a HUGE makeover.  The courses are bumpy and the greens are lumpy so your ball doesn't roll right.  The fun attractions on the courses don't even work anymore.  The circus seal has an electric cord hanging over the top of it.   The lion attraction has a big whole in it, the water is dirty in the "stream" and the elephant fountain near the bridge doesn't work.   Not that I'd want it to work b/c I wouldn't want to get sprayed with the water there!  I've been to much cleaner attractions.  There is a huge pool area that is suppose to be used for a water "boat" type ride that I've never seen working.  It just sits there with dirty water in it all season.  Mosquito heaven. 

I'd love to see the courses fixed up and working like the ones in Gatlinburg!  I would hate to see a Westside attraction go under for no up keep.

The putt course has had some work done to it but it still not in the best conditions... But if you want a good ice cream! They have a ton of flavors and the staff is always very friendly. The prices are very reasonable. The biggest attraction is the fact they have the blue blueberry ice cream! And it is amazing with the twist..

Back in 1977, I played Little League baseball sponsored by Northside Tavern.  General Custer's also sponsored their own Little League team.  We used to SMASH this team on a regularly basis, and THEN go to Custer's Ice Cream stand to celebrate, because coach was obnoxious like that.  LOL.  This place looks EXACTLY the same as it did back then.  They don't appear to have done a damn thing to revamp the place.  We played 18 holes of Putt-Putt and I felt like I was in a time capsule.  The young cat attending the place was very nice though...so nice that he let some of his buddies in for free.  I didn't want to go, but DMuse already purchased a Groupon and being the Queen of Frugal, there was no damn way she was gonna waste it.  She didn't read the reviews before she purchased it...stuff happens.  We didn't have Ice Cream there though.  We went to Orange Leaf on Glenway instead.  Orange Leaf is the bomb.
Course is old and in poor condition, rotted wood, bumpy greens, run down looking place.

This is my favorite Dairy Queen location in Cincinnati because of the old style, park-and-walk-up-to-the-window factor. It's what you might call vintage. The woman inside is tiny and old (but sweet and competent) which adds to the experience IMO.

This location doesn't have a grill so you can't get the full DQ menu, but it's perfect for a cone or a blizzard.

The best part of this DQ is a very convenient walk up window or drive thru option. It is on par with other DQ stops- a little nostalgia for the way back whens, a touch of "this must be your first job, kiddo," and a healthy dose of yaaaaas that tastes just like I remember! The service is solid, if young, but they are training them well at this location. It is a popular spot for sure and they manage to churn out the orders at a pretty quick pace. During the pandemic times, I have seen all of the employees wearing masks. It gets a little dicey when you are ordering at the walk up window-the general public is less inclined to follow the "Stand Here" circles and masks seem to be few and far between. So even though it is faster, you may want to wait in the drive thru line to avoid the gaggle of possibly diseased teenagers who are more unconsciously thoughtless than purposefully invasive. Still, it is more sweet than salty and worth the occasional trip. And if you find the non peak hours, do let me know.
It's a quaint little ice cream parlor where a bunch of high school kids work. I mean, come on, it's exactly what it's supposed to be. Staff is friendly, and it's ice cream! Yummy!

When you drive up to this one, it almost feels like you're in the past. It has a very old americana feel to it, with the older style seating areas and signs. It's not in the most secluded area, it's right on the main road.

I got the M&M blizzard. (Remember you get a free small blizzard if you download the app). The blizzard was as good as usual. I got a chance to taste the smores one and I have to say, I liked that one way more. All in all, not a bad spot for a cold refreshing treat on a warm day.

Yeah so here's the story, I'm allergic to dairy products, and this establishment offends me. I believe it to be incredibly inconsiderate of this location to run a business where I am excluded from the product exclusively because they want to threaten to make me sick from eating their ice cream cakes. I did indeed have a stomach ache after eating a blizzard there though so I guess you win queen of dairy. I would think being a part of the royal society and all the Dairy Queen would be a little bit more concerned for her citizens, but maybe we are just peasants in her eyes. If you want to be treated like a dairy eating peasant this is the place for you, otherwise, if you have a sense of pride, you will just freeze milk at home, pour some chocolate sauce on it, and eat up like a man.

This is not the most special dairy queen in the city, but they do do some inventive things. Like just at the end of the season, these past two weeks, they had the only sale on everything. Everything was 50% off to sell the rest of the ice cream that they had since this is a dairy queen without an outside. They also have a drive thru which comes in handy when it's a little more chilly out in the unpredictable Cincinnati weather.
We really enjoy our cones at this location. The girls are always friendly and polite. The service is great.

Never had anything here I didn't like! The soft served ice cream is delicious. My mother and I went last night and I got a vanilla kiddie cone. It was the perfect size. I love how convenient it is to my house, that I can walk down there when it's nice out. The service is always great. One thing that is pretty slow though is the drive thru. I go up to the window now. One suggestion would be to make the parking lot bigger because cars can't drive past the people in the drive thru line, which causes a traffic jam and cars ending up on the busy Springfield Pike. Will definitely be back!

I think I frequent this DQ more than any other.

I absolutely love the little old lady who runs this place.  She is sweet and wonderful like a Dairy Queen treat.

I'm pretty sure the lines in the parking lot are not parallel, which makes things interesting when this place is busy, which doesn't seem to be very often.  Outdoor seating is available but leaves a lot to be desired.

We love to visit this Dairy Queen! It is our favorite. It's the oldest DQ in Cincinnati and one of the only ones with original signage (so cute!). The service was speedy and the ice cream was perfect. My favorite is the Heath bar blizzard.
Nice warm day, not really busy but still incredibly slow.  Confusing menu, and charged $1.75 extra four a scoop of ice cream in an arctic rush.  C' on!

Okay, this is the slowest dairy queen I've ever seen. Maybe I haven't been around enough but I always wondered why there was a long line, then I stopped there and now I know. 

They have ice cream and they serve hot dogs. The food is normal dairy queen fare at a reduced rate of speed.

I love Dairy Queen ice cream.  I used to work at one growing up and just always enjoy eating a blizzard.  However this one could use a little work.  It is the classic old school Dairy Queen with only the walk up windows, no inside seating or drive thru.  It just takes you back to a simpler time.  The problem with this one is the staff.  Each time i have went there has only been one person working and they have been really slow.  Also both times one item from our order has been messed up.  My wife likes her blizzard made with chocolate ice cream and orders it that way.  When they made it both times they put chocolate ice cream on the bottom and the candy but then put regular ice cream on top and blends it so it is only made with half chocolate.  But since it is the store just by my house i will probably go back to get my ice cream fix.

I have to admit that Cincinnati is not exactly a culinary paradise in general, at least for our tastes.

But that's OK because the city (along with Covington, KY) was enjoyable over all, and because after every subpar meal we would pop into one of the many United Dairy Farmers.

I simply can't believe ice cream this delicious is available all over the place, even in convenience stores and gas stations!

BTW, the quality was just as high in every one we visited, I simply picked this location to review because in an interesting neighborhood that's very pleasant to stroll around in.

I think nothing has changed at this location since it was built in the 1980's and that's kind of great: there are brass fixtures, pink neon lights, a section that sells paperback romance novels ... it's quirky but charming. Most of all, I love the café. I walk through Eden Park from Walnut Hills and having a $1.5 coffee here, at the summit of Mt. Adams, is a rewarding goal. UDF's coffee and ice cream is affordable and their café is a very underrated area to relax, sit and enjoy.

Good location! After walking up the hill from Walnut Hills to get to this location in Mount Adams, the coffee is a delicious reward. The cafe is nice to hang out and enjoy the coffee, with the "Reading Center" available with paperback novels if you so choose (although the chairs are not so comfortable).
Are you still hand scooping ice cream? You need to stop all hand to hand service asap!

I really love this UDF. It's my favorite location. It's the nicest UDF in existence, I'm pretty sure. 

I only go to this UDF when I'm doing my laundry because it's around the corner from where I do it. The people who work here are always super friendly and nice. 

This UDF has the norms, like their amazing ice cream and candy. Sodas and water. But they also have a "Reading" area full of books. 

They have a big selection of wine and craft beer. Great selection of both. The craft beer selection is always what has me in amazement. They have all the local beers like Rhineguiest, Madtree, and Braxton. But they also have other rarer craft beer like Fat Head and Tank 7, Belle's. One that you wouldn't find in most convenient stores or gas stations. 

They also have a bakery/sandwich area. The sandwiches actually look pretty awesome. Every time I'm in here I see people getting these sandwiches. I have yet to get one myself. 

If you'rein Mount Adams and need some amazing ice cream or some craft beer for take out, I would defiantly stop by in here.

Went there around 8 PM and they acted as if they were closing soon. We got a malt and a strawberry milk shake. The malt was okay but had a lot of frozen pieces. The strawberry milkshake tasted like so much dish soap we could not even drink it.

Not the friendliest staff present. I'd say this is the only location with a reading selection. Good ice cream. It's quite quaint and adorable in design nestled with natural design of original building. Where my friends and I sat originally, ants were present. When we moved still had issues with pest. I went to the restroom when there and honestly it's tinier than even an airplane bathroom. I couldn't even open the door entirely but thankfully I'm small enough to squeeze through the opening I was able to make.

I was initially a big fan of this place as it's the only grocery store up in Mt Adams. We come here every few days to pick up wine, or other random things we forgot at Kroger's. 

We went there tonight to pick up wine for my birthday. I waited in the car while my husband  ran in he came out shortly after because he realized he left his wallet at home. So I went in to pay for it and the clerk refused to sell it to me unless I showed her both our IDs. Mind you we are both in our 30s and we have visited this store many times. I then said I would go back to the shelf and pick up a different bottle of wine and she refused to sell me any alcohol unless we could show his ID. Not only was she unreasonable she went about this in a very nasty unpleasant manner. 

Whoever owns/manages this store you should train your staff to have better manners. You have lost two customers who live a block away and would have given you a lot of business. I will never go to this store again

This is our go-to stop for ice cream after eating dinner on Mt Adams. The ice cream is surprisingly good...my recommendation is to seek out the United Dairy Farmers ice cream. On each tag it is clearly labeled with either UDF or Homemade brand. If you're at the UDF, I figure you might as well patronize their brand.  It also seems to be a bit better than the Homemade brand.

Don't be put off by the fact that their ice cream looks and seems to scoop rock solid...it's actually much creamier and better than it looks in the display.  On a recent visit my husband and I both got hooked on Carmel Cone Crunch, which is a must try if you like carmel.

If you find yourself suddenly in need of a magazine, milk, or dental floss, it's a good stop as well.  But do yourself a favor...try the ice cream.

Solid place, nice to find a local ice cream joint.  They have the standard flavors and a few that are a little more creative and a few that are quite different; I had to try the "paintball" flavor...when I asked the flavor neither of the employees could really answer my question about what it tasted like.  I had to get it (along with the s'mores flavor)...it was sort of a non-specific candy flavor.  Not bad but probably not one I would order again.  The s'more was much better.

I was a little disappointed that they did not let me do samples...I would have preferred to try the paintball but order something different.

I love this UDF! Admittedly, it's right around the corner from where I live. Which is dangerous for me because I now want a mint cookies and cream milkshake pretty much every night. They have good hours; open until 1am every night! I foresee a lot of late night snack runs while studying...
The staff there has always been super nice to me, even when I can't decide what kind of ice cream I want! Best UDF in Cinci!

I really like the ice cream here it's so creamy and smooth! And I love that they have so many flavors and for so cheap! This is also a great location to grab a scoop and take stroll through Mount Adams.

There are UDFs all over the city of Cincinnati, but this location is by far my favorite. Perhaps it is because it is in the most posh neighborhood in Cincinnati!

UDF is probably one of the only places where you can get a tank of gas, get some cigarettes and beer, and maybe an ice cream cone if you're in the mood! It truly is a novelty. However, this location doesn't have any gas pumps so you'll have to settle for the other fun activities.

I enjoy this location more than others for many reasons. The first is their patio is so enjoyable to sit and eat ice cream. It's in such a pretty location and is well shaded by near-by trees. The inside of the store is very well laid out. They have a great magazine selection here. I've also seen more fresh fruits and lunch options at this location than any other!

If you haven't been to a UDF yet, it's an experience that can't be missed!
This is the only ice cream spot I know of in Mt. Adams. The employees here are always nice.

The ice cream made by the Homemade Brand is delish!  We got the mint 'n chip and it was so good I had to go back the next night for more.  

I haven't been this inspired by ice cream in a while!  eat it!!

The other reviewers are correct, this is a unique UDF. Quaint simply because of its location, the only issue is parking. If you live or work in the area, it has to be perfect!

The first thing you see when you walk in are bistro tables and chairs, as well as the ice cream counter. Wander further in and there are the usual convenience store items, plus a small wine selection! How smart of the United Dairy Farmers to make this a mini-grocery plus wine store! I also noticed, as Alexandra mentioned in her review, the wide selection of magazines.

Possibly the best UDF in the history of Carl Lindner's fine corporation.  Not only has it saved my cooking on several emergent occasions (Out of eggs!?!?  I need how much milk?!?!?), it is staffed by perhaps the greatest convenience store clerk not in a Kevin Smith movie.

Around our apartment we call him the cool UDF guy.  He works weekday afternoons and some weekend evenings, he is absurdly nice, he remembers you after only a couple of visits, and once he knows you he could probably list off your recent purchases better than your receipts would illustrate.  He could be a waiter at a fine dining establishment or a counselor, but instead we get to chat with him when dashing for that sour cream.  In case ice cream doesn't make you smile, talking to him will.  Completely worth a drive from across town.

review only for health code violation: i did not eat here.
on march 15, 2013 at 9:45 pm when not closing until 1 am the manager on duty closed both public restrooms. clearly they have public restrooms as required but neither were open for customers for the last 3 hours and 15 minutes of business. clearly an issue in the cincinnati area of limited restrooms at various businesses. i hope the department of health sees this post and clearly policies need to be adapted or enforced unless the city and the area is happy with people urinating and having bowel movements in alleys and and bushes i guess the powers that be consider a small price to pay to keep the homeless out of businesses and public restrooms according to the current state of restrooms in the city and the area.
not a review on food but i would recommend graeter's over udf, anytime.

I've been working a temp job in the Mt. Adams area and twice now I've walked to this UDF. Once was for lunch. I got a sandwich with ham and swiss cheese served cold. The lady gave me lots of ham and lots of cheese, which I appreciated. There's are some tables inside and more outside that can be used. The next day I found myself in this UDF again, this time for ice cream. Delicious stuff. I went with the cotton candy flavor and was not disappointed.

My favorite thing about visiting Ohio is getting Togo to Graeter's for some ice cream! The absolute best part is the pretzel cone!! The combination of salty and sweet is so good! They also have a lot of great ice cream flavors my favorite is the buckeye flavor which is chocolate and peanut butter yum! I also had a good mocha flavored ice cream as well. My dads favorite is the bourbon peacan. They really do have a flavor for everyone! 

I will definitely be back next time I'm in the area.

Ice cream is everything one expects from Graeter's. Rich and creamy with true flavors. Chunks and chips are usually substantial in size, and amount. The scoops that we received were all on the larger size for Graeter's. 

Service with a smile. Customer service at the Colerain location is friendly, attentive and welcoming. 

Seating is located both indoors and out. There is also a drive up window. This location is on the older side. Graeter's seems to be updating some of it's other locations. This one could benefit from some rehabilitation. 

This seems to be a popular location. There was a steady stream of customers during our entire visit.

I am incredibly disappointed that Graeters no longer carries ANY variety of low glycemic ice cream! I always had a choice, and have gone to Graeters (my old favorite) for decades. I was told today they simply didnt sell enough...I guess the almighty dollar is more important to Graeters that customer service! Angry. Disappointed  FORMER customer.

I just had to stop and write a review this morning after the great service I received from Becca at Graeter's on Colerain. It was a busy morning for them but she did a great job attending to every customer, and everyone went away smiling. Graeter's is my number one stop for cheese crowns!!  An awesome Danish filled with cheese and iced as well. There's no breakfast like a cheese Crown breakfast! Be sure to try them!
Website and window says 11pm and closed at 10:30. Very annoying. Follow your website times
We love the hometown ice cream and taste! We LOVE the chocolate chunks and the variety of flavors. We each have our favorites but we like to try new flavors each time. Great for the family!

Graeter's is always a great choice. One thing I noticed with this location was although they were super busy and short staffed for the rush, they managed to fill orders in a timely fashion and everyone was friendly.
Great sodas and great service! I would recommend to anyone. I will be back next week. Who are we kidding, I will be back sooner.
Excellent ice cream, my husband and I loved this place.  Very clean place and The staff was professional and friendly.  The salted Carmel ice cream is sooooo good.
Super friendly  guy that waited on me. Ice cream was freezer burnt but the guy was cool about fixing me a new sundae
Greater's is expensive, which is the only reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5. The ice cream is amazing!  And the service is usually great.  Haven't tried too much else except ice cream.

Couldn't tell you about the service because I didn't receive any! Actually, I guess that does tell you! Waited in the drive thru for ten minutes and no one ever came. I could see them inside laughing and hanging out, but no one was paying attention. Super disappointed!

We love Graeter's but the last couple of visits at this location were sub par from other locations. I had the strawberry shortcake and barely any strawberry topping on it. All three of our sundaes seemed a little skimpy. We should have gone to the Finneytown location like we usually do or went to UDF and pocketed the extra $7. Our visit definitely falls short of what we love about Graeter's. I don't mind paying the $22 for the four sundaes when the quality is there but you fell short this time. Hopefully you can get it together soon.

Gotta love Graeter's, especially when it involves more than just ice cream.  They've got pastries, donuts, etc.  and enough seating for they typical crowd.  Always the great, Graeter's ice cream, of course.  I personally love either a half vanilla/half chocolate malt or a cup of one (or both) of the cookie dough or toffee chip ice cream.
staff is very friendly, ice cream is amazing! lots of great flavors. love anything with chocolate chips in it. I don't know how, but their chips stay soft. it's so good!

I've been coming here since it opened which is awhile ago and I didn't have a driver's license.  Definitely a highlight of the summer season and a good place to come out for dessert at a great price.

My only critique is that they could be less stingy with the napkins and do a better job of keeping the place clean.

Just a local ice cream shop... I wouldn't say that there was anything special or extraordinary about them. They were a little bit pricey for the serving size, and they have an up-charge if you use a credit card or debit card, so I would suggest bringing cash. The area was clean, but there was noticeable lack of seating. 

Overall the ice cream was good enough and it did not melt too fast.

There isn't much to say except that they have blue raspberry soft serve. Not just any mind you. It tastes identical to the blue smurf/ huckleberry dairy cones from Hanna-Barbera land at Kings Island. Be sure to bring cash because it's $.50 more if you use a credit card.

I would say this place is average. Nothing special. It wasn't the best service but it wasn't the worst. There was a .50 cents upcharge for using a card but it's not too bad. There's only 3 parking spots so it's not really convenient. The ice cream was good but nothing special. A small ice cream is 2.35$ which is fine. I'd probably go there again,

I grew up getting ice cream from here. There's a certain nostalgia that has kept me coming back in my adulthood - that's where anything positive ends. The pricing is way too high for what you get - Not to mention the $0.50 upcharge for any credit purchase, regardless of overall spent.
