I have walked away from this place upset every time I've attempted to buy ice cream here in the past two years. The oreo flurry I ordered was basically a large cup of soft serve with a few crumbs sprinkled on top. Whenever attempting to order a Sundae or cone go-to, we've been massively shorted on ice cream. Last night the waffle cone I ordered contained about half the ice cream I would expect, as the girls barely filled the cone since I asked for it "flipped" to easily take in the car. When they also forgot the jimmies, I mentioned it was told "That's  $0.75 extra." I said forget it and they hastily handed me a large cup full of jimmies (Which spilled all over my seat on the way home - that was fun to clean up.) 

Save your money, go to McDonald's for soft serve or a flurry - it tastes the same as what they're selling. Or better yet - take that $8 to the grocery and buy enough ice cream for days.

Terrible service. I ordered a flurry and I was told sorry the flurry tops are already cleaned... so I couldn't have what I ordered. Funny thing the girl was just on her cell phone when I got there and I guess didn't feel like working anymore.
My favorite ice cream shop. I don't get it very much because I live on the east side, but whenever I visit family in the summertime, I have to stop on the way home.

Some people say that all of these places are the same and I have to disagree. I stopped by yesterday with my niece and was not impressed. I feel like my local creamy whip is much, much better. However, service was fast and friendly, but I will stick with my tried and true creamy whip!

It is expensive for a neighborhood ice cream joint. The flurries are good, but no better than anywhere else. Our kids enjoyed it. There is very limited seating for patrons to sit and enjoy their frozen treats.

Overpriced. Then they charge extra if you use a credit card, no matter how much you spend. No sign to warn you about that. Twice as much as McDonald's for the same soft serve junk. No actual icecream. Won't be back.

The young lady that was my server was awesome!!!! Seriously; if l could ever pick a waitress it wouud be her!!!!! Her name began with an S  and l dont know if she wants to be.... her and her employees were great!!!!!!
The young ladies that worked tonight went out of thier way to make me and mine happy! The store was closing; yet they made exactly what we wanted!!!! GREAT SERVICE AND ICE CREAM!!!

I have been coming to sweets and eats since I was a child. I love everything about it, EXCEPT my most recent encounter. I got a flurry because they're the best. The last time I got one, I noticed the reese cups were lagging a bit. I paid $5.00 for a large so I figured the candy would be compensated for the price as well, but I decided this time I would get extra candy. I almost fell over when she told me extra candy would be A DOLLAR! A dollar? I could buy a candy bar for that price and do it myself... I guess I will have to...I am just sad the prices have raised so much.

P.S. the dollar for extra candy was no where near worth the price, I couldnt even tell...

This is one of my favorite ice cream locations. They offer a great variety of favors in the soft serve, my favorite is the orange and vanilla soft serve. They have sundaes and malted and milk shakes. Lots of different coatings including sprinkles and hard shell chocolate.

I was craving a root beer float pretty bad. So my friend and I decided to walk up to sweet n eats. We got the root beer float and a shaved ice. My complaint is that my root beer float was like 80% ice cream and 20% root beer and I wasn't satisfied. Service wasn't bad. But wasn't awesome.

Some of the best creamy whip in the Cincinnati area. I love their soft serve and frozen yogurt, but there are many other sweet things to choose from if that's not your cup of tea. A word to the wise... Sweet N Eats, to my knowledge, is the only other place in the Cincinnati area aside from Kings Island to serve the blue soft serve. Smurf it up.

This checks most things off the list, so it's worth the drive up to East Price Hill:

* Friendly, patient staff with great recommendations
* Neighborhood spot with great views of downtown
* Unique, refreshing flavors mixed with ice cream classics (turtle sundae)
* Appropriate sizes for kids and adults alike

We enjoyed their patio seating next to the building, and the kids loved the classic vanilla and chocolate. They have homemade whip cream and peanut butter dipped cones.

I had to try the lavender milkshake. I asked what it tasted like. She said "lavender." Now I know - and that fun summer flavor does not disappoint. It felt lighter and refreshing than the candy bar creations you typically find. Try lavender!

Next time we are going to try the Bold Face Cone, but they sold out of the gold leaves for the cone the night before.

Sweet little ice cream shop in the incline district of price hill. They have many options and great customer service at their walk-up window! They also have lots of outdoor seating for those who want to stay and enjoy their sweet treats! The lady taking our order let us know they even have new sugar free popsicles their selling for those who can't have / don't eat sugar- so there is something for everyone!! Make sure to stop by after grabbing a coffee at bloc or food at the incline house - it really hits the spot!

Great ice cream shop! They have really unique flavors - my favorite in particular is the cardamom flavor mixed with vanilla. The ice cream is very creamy - they told us it's cause of the high percent of fat in the dairy which is why it tastes so much better than your normal soft serve ice cream. They give cups, cones and even can do dips with the cones! They have a really cute seating area right outdoor to the window that you place orders. It's really nice with lights and greenery - awesome place for some cute pictures too.
Best ice cream that I have had in a very long time. It is super creamy and there are tons of different flavors to choose from. They have a great outdoor seating area with corn hole too!

My friends and I went and all got flurries. The ice cream itself is very thick and creamy, best in cincinnati by far. The only issue was the flurries were not fully mixed, the toppings and flavor were at the bottom. We had a large group so I understand. Maybe try a cup with toppings. Still, amazing ice cream and super unique flavors.

I was very impressed with all of the ice cream options at this fairly new ice cream joint! 

What I ordered: I got a small lavender cone which was pretty and the flavor was light and sweet. My boyfriend got a small chai cone. His was also good!

They boast a lot of unique flavors and they have many seasonal ice creams. (We got a taste of the peach ice cream, which we also really enjoyed.)

There is plenty of outdoor seating. I wish there was someplace to sit inside because our ice cream melted so quickly!
Great ice cream!! Creamy, very flavorful, and I LOVE the corn hole boards outside. Great opportunity for a small business, and they just have outdone themselves.

Let me open with this: I got purple/lavender soft serve with rainbow sprinkles served from a building with turret... It was like a dairy delight from a fairy tale fit for a prince(ss)! *drops voice down an octave* Joking aside, Bold Face is easily my new favorite ice cream bar. They have vegan and gluten-free homemade popsicles (pomegranate, strawberry lemonade today) and a variety of soft serve mix-ins. Notable are cardamom, pistachio and lavender flavors. They have a specialty shake/malt with bourbon too! (it's flavoring and non-alcoholic). 

Not only do they have very reasonable prices ($1 kids servings) and hipster offerings, the location is really unique. It's in the same building as BLOC so you can also feed your coffee addiction in one trip. The building has some cool architectural character (it's the old Mason Lodge) and while you cannot go inside there's a patio with outdoor seating. Caveat: there's only one shaded area and the seating is covered in mirror-like metal which will remind you of burning your legs on playground equipment as a child. 

Urban exploration idea: come to Price Hill, check out Bold Face and BLOC and swing over for a panoramic view of Cincinnati from Olden View Park! Your Instagram followers will thank you...
The customer service is really good. The ice cream tasted good. We also enjoyed the hang-out spot!

Meant to edit, not update the last review 
Is there any way for Yelp to fix this? I don't want to delete the review but it's pretty silly to leave up the same review twice.

Nice little walk up ice cream shop. Typical soft serve with a short menu of flavors and toppings. I found the cardamom on the flavor menu interesting. The shakes are thick and creamy served in a decent size foam cup. Their outdoor seating area has plenty of tables and a small gazebo for shade seekers. 

The line was long, which I didn't mind. However, the line also took a very long time move. It took 20 minutes to get to the window before we could even place our oder. Otherwise a great experience.

Where was this place when I lived on the west side? I had the pleasure of devouring a Bourbon Pecan Shake and recommend it wholeheartedly. There was actually about a 1/4 cup of pecans at the bottom of the cup when I finished. Wow! I was tempted to try the $14! cone with gold flakes but decided the BPS was the right choice. 

Pros: friendly service, high quality, great outdoor seating area, nearby free parking

Cons: long lines during busy peak times (no surprise)... that's about it
This place is awesome. We had lavender ice cream AMAZING, And the customer service was awesome too

A very interesting unique concept! You order through a window and they have two flavors of soft serve vanilla and chocolate and then you can do a twist or add flavors to them and/or toppings! I would have given them a five star but we had to wait a little longer for our order as their vanilla machine was acting up. It's located right down the street from the Incline Public House so we enjoyed an excellent meal there and then we went to The Bold Face Dairy Bar for tasty dessert! They have a very large outdoor area to eat in with lots of picnic table seating. We tried the vanilla soft serve ice cream with the pistachio flavor, bourbon barrel stout flavor and the lavender flavor and they were all delicious! The lavender was amazing and it was our overall family favorite! The bourbon barrel stout in my opinion needed more of a stronger flavoring as I really could not identify that flavor and I enjoy bourbon barrel stout beer. The pistachio was a delicious choice also!

Since you can't try any of the flavors I asked the employee their favorite flavor and went with chai. It is literally just chai powder mixed into ice cream on the spot. It was gritty and unappealing. 
All of the seating is in the sun without any umbrellas.

I stumbled upon Bold Face Dairy Bar accidentally after I ate at the Public Incline House. I was walking down the street to my car and I noticed a small window -- I saw ice cream and could not resist on a 94 degree day.  I ordered a small Reeses Peanut Butter Cup Flurrie and was not disappointed. It was basically like a McDonald's McFlurry but SOOOOOO much better. The ice cream was absolutely fresh, creamy, and delicious and the peanut butter cups only made it that much better. I am so glad I found this adorable spot! I do wish they had more signage around though so that more people would know it is there. I had no idea I was missing out on this local ice cream joint!

My wife and I dropped by tonight and while we loved the ice cream and options, the service is what really steals the show. The young man working the window had amazing customer service skills and you can tell it will take him far. 

It's so fun to have a place to drop by where you know there is outdoor seating, a tasty treat, good customer service and a view of the city not too far away!
Great ice and great costumer service! Highly recommend! Love that they are a part of the price hill community!!

Really can't recommend this place enough. The ice cream quality is unbelievable. I've never had a frozen treat that creamy and delicious. I got the lavender flavor added to my soft serve and it was SO good. 
The staff is wonderful. They're helpful, quick, and kind. And gave great recommendations. 
It was raining while I was there, so I didn't get to try the seating area, but it looked just delightful. We went inside Bloc to eat. 
A word of caution if you get something with sea salt in it - the flavor is great, but ask for it "light" since it will sink to the bottom and you'll have some brackish melted ice cream at the end.
Amazing ice cream even better service! I've been at least once a week since I found this place! The ice cream flavors are unique. My 8 year olds favorite is the Lavender. Love coming here!

Delicious, unusual soft serve flavors you aren't going to find at your average ice cream place. From Lavender to cardamom to blueberry and mint, you'll still find traditional flavors as well as mix-ins to make your own flurrie. I'm partial to the mint, but everything I've had has been good. The flavors aren't overpowering or fake tasting. I believe they use all natural ingredients. The staff is always super friendly too!
This ice cream is GOOD a little pricy but good , nice assortment of flavors and toppings.
I'm not much of a creamy whip person but this place is pretty cool with such interesting and fun flavors and toppings will keep me coming back

Went here after dinner on our first night here in Cincinnati, and it definitely did not disappoint! Their ice cream is soft serve, vanilla, chocolate and swirl and they have a bunch of flavors you can add in to make it your own as well as toppings. I had the vanilla with chai tea flavoring, and it is some of the best ice cream I've had! The customer service was amazing as well! I can't recommend this place enough.

Great little dairy bar. I drove by it once and didn't see it. It is right behind the coffee shop. The ice cream is creamy and thick. The conglomeration crunch is almost every topping they have combined. It was delicious. The small was much bigger than I expected it to be. Definitely worth stopping by if you are in the area.

I go here almost everyday to get ice cream for my siblings and I and they customer service is fantastic. The employees are sweet and fast. It is also I'm the same building as BLOC so you can get a smoothie and/or coffee in the same trip. The best thing that I absolutely love about this place is that it is right down the street from my house and I can walk there. Highly recommend coming here.
The quality of the ingredients is incredible, the employees are kind and generous, and the ice cream is PHENOMENAL. I love how rich and creamy it is. Will definitely be going back ASAP.
Best kept little secret ice cream this side of the museum center. I love it. Looking forward to a long hot summer!

I'm always on the search for great homemade ice cream, and I think this is my new go-to spot in Cincinnati.

The staff is friendly and will make sure you taste a few flavors before making your decision. The Key Lime Pie was delicious, light, and refreshing. The Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip is what they're known for, and after trying it I can understand why. The flavor is spot on, and the chocolate pieces melt in your mouth! I also tried the Chunky Chunky Hippo. Although the name sounds funny, they did not mess around with this one. It was my favorite with vanilla ice cream, peanuts, caramel, and pieces of chocolate truffle. 

They also offer donuts, chocolates, candy, coffee, and ice cream pints to-go. You can even use them to cater an event! A fellow customer told me about an ice cream sundae bar they set up. They had tons of flavors delivered on ice with toppings on the side to build your own sundae. Not a bad idea!

Graeter's Ice Cream is essentially the best possible food you can put in your mouth. I've admired this treat from afar, snagging pints in my Chicago grocery stores when they're available. But upon my recent visit to Cincinnati, I wanted to stop in an actual Graeter's location to see the situation first-hand.

The flavors are top-notch. Basically anything with chocolate "chips" is a slam dunk winner. They're not chips so much as giant hunks of delicious chocolate icebergs, just waiting for you to discover them with your spoon.

So why only 4 stars? The physical condition of this location leaves much to be desired. Everything looks very, very run down and neglected. Even the ice cream was melty as soon as it came out of the freezer. (Might wanna check that temperature - I don't think it's being kept as cold as it should.) The bathrooms were also looking like they'd seen better days.

Again, this ice cream is perfection, but this particular location needs a serious revamp.

Never in my life had I had ice cream as good as this folks. Seriously. I was recommended and insisted upon by a friend to try out Graeter's while I was in Cincinnati. I should have sampled, but I saw the mint chocolate chip and dove right in. Fun fact - it was also low on the GI scale so I guess that is cool? But either way it was delicious, creamy, and they "chips" were incredible. That is definitely what they are known for and it did not disappoint. One of the managers of the store insisted that I try the peanut butter one so she handed me a sample and it was phenomenal as well, but I was there for any of the ones with the chocolate chip option.

It was worth all the calories and work outs and steps I had to take to walk off it's delicious, creamy, perfect goodness.

Have you tried the new Cheese Crown flavor? Amazing! 

What a great service at this location! Lovely Gentleman was kind enough to let me in, even though I was 2 minutes after official closing. He was not rushed at all and offered a sample of the new flavor (delicious!), checked my Sweet Rewards number (I forgot the card) and made it possible for me to start the weekend with 2 pints of the most delicious treat ever: Cheese Crown and Black Raspberry Gelato! 

This location is also offering a range of baked goodies, wow! 

What a pleasure!

I had Graeter's Ice Cream in Kentucky for the first time in May. I haven't been able to stop thinking about it since. No other ice cream will ever live up to Graeter's! You can't get Graeter's ice cream in California unless you place an order online and pay $80 for 6 pints. They're based out of Ohio.

I couldn't live without Graeter's any longer so I buckled and placed an order for 6 pints. I placed my order around 2pm on 10/20 and I received it at 11am on 10/22! It came packed in a small Styrofoam cooler and dry ice. It's been sitting on my desk all day and the ice cream is still rock hard and freezing cold. I ordered the following flavors: 
-Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip 
-Caramel 
-Pumpkin Pie 
-Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip 
-Mint Chocolate Chip 
-Cookie Dough Chocolate Chip 
Did I mention their chocolate chips are more like sizable shaved chunks not measly little chips? 

I'm probably going to look like I'm carrying an organ for a transplant when I walk to my car after work today : o

A fantastic shop with plenty of great ice creams, cookies, cakes and sweets. 
Be aware that their open time is only until 6pm.
Might be the best ice cream I've ever had. The staff were all super nice even though the cashier was new, she was still friendly. Very tasty, would recommend stopping in.

Just ate here, the older gentleman
 Who helped us was extremely friendly and helpful, offered us multiple samples. Phenomenal ice cream- can't go wrong w one of the chip flavors!

If it's ice cream you want in Cincinnati, make it Graeter's.  It is absolutely wonderful.

The Mt. Auburn location is especially dear to me because I remember visiting when I was a kid and we'd be down that way visiting my aunt.  Not much has changed either, except that they don't do the bulk of the manufacturing at this location anymore.

Graeter's ice cream isn't your cheap run of the mill ice cream.  They make small batches with quality ingredients so you know you're getting the good stuff.  It's a bit pricier than if you were to go pick up a pint of the Kroger brand stuff, but once you taste it you'll know why.  Black raspberry chip is my favorite, of course, and I highly recommend it.

Graeters also has an assortment of other sweet treats, like cake, cookies, and candy.  Equally delicious.

We stopped by the Graeter's on Reading Road after going to the Krohn Conservatory to see the beautiful Christmas display. The older gentleman who waited on us was wonderful! He went out of his way with all four kids to let them taste the flavors and patiently filled the orders. The Krohn was wonderful, but the grandkids mainly remember Graeter's flavors! LOL

Yum Greater's!  If you have not tried Greater's it's a must try in Cincinnati.  The ice cream is super creamy and if there happen to be chocolate chunks in your ice cream be on the lookout for HUGE chunks.  Their ice cream cakes and pastries are a true treat as well.  

Service at the Clifton location is especially great- especially when Dushi is in- she is always very friendly and helpful.  I wish there was a walk up window for warmer weather when I am walking the dogs!

The guy at the front (who was a Manager) was SUPER awkward. When we told him it was our first time and we hadn't ever had this before--he said "uh I don't know. I mean they're all good. I mean if you like a flavor just try that". Not "HEY! Here's our best flavor, or if you like (this this and this) that one would be for you! I asked him was his favorite was and he said "vanilla". It was then I figured out he wasn't a good salesman and I would have to find out for myself. The ice cream itself was DELICIOUS. I got the Buckeye, chocolate peanut butter ice cream with peanut butter cookie dough and HUGE chocolate chunks. My partner had the black raspberry chocolate. Again, I wish I could rate this higher, but it's about the whole experience. Wish that guy could've made this an all around experience, but go for the ice cream and really try what you want too!

My boss received 6 pints of Graeter's ice cream as a gift and left it in the office freezer "for anyone to eat." Needless to say, I've been downing bowls of this stuff all week. The Black Raspberry is probably one of the most delicious ice cream flavors I've ever eaten in my entire life. Thumbs up also go to the Mint Chocolate Chip and Cookie Dough. They use giant chunks of dark chocolate in all of these flavors, and the chocolate is at a perfect melt-in-your-mouth texture that blends magnificently into the creamy, but not heavy, ice cream base. 

I always thought that my trip to the Ben & Jerry's factory was going to be the most important ice cream-related event of my life, but I am starting to reconsider. It might be worth a trip to Cincinnati just to eat this ice cream on its home turf. Until then, I am probably going to start having it shipped to my apartment in Chicago - thank goodness they have an online store!

My first trip to an actual Graeter's store was last weekend at this particular location (same place as their manufacturing plant) when I visited Cincinnati.  Previously I had only tasted Graeter's ice cream by ordering online.  I must say, I didn't think it was possible but their ice cream tasted even better at the store.  Mmmmmm.. deliciously soft chocolate chips mixed into the creamiest ice cream ever.... My personal favorite is the double chocolate chip.  Oh, and their "Buckeye" chocolates are pretty good too.

This review is going to need a disclaimer... Ever since I knew how to spell my last name, my father has worked for companies specifically known for ice cream. Ice cream in the freezer was constant. Growing up with a constant supply of hard pack ice cream has made me develop a genuine fondness for soft serve in its infinite forms. 

But practically none of that has to do with Graeter's. Read everyone else's reviews... they're all completely valid. In fact, I'm embarrassed that I'm actually putting this review up here. Frankly, I find Graeter's way too rich for me. (Well, that and the first sundae I had years ago just wasn't all I thought it was cracked up to be.) Every flavor is handmade in small batches using the french pot method (which makes it VERY rich), and the chocolate chips are to die for. That's because they aren't chips. They actually throw some melted chocolate into the batch while it's churning and call it a day. :o) Out of all of the flavors, the black raspberry chip is definitely the best. 

Believe it or not, their CAKES (not ice cream cakes, regular cakes) are to die for. I don't know if they sell them at locations other than this one, but you should definitely pick one up next time someone has a birthday. 

Graeter's, you'll earn another star back if you just get some peanut butter topping for sundaes. That would be divine.

Sure, you've had dozens of pints already (and that's just in the past month), but have you ever seen that frozen goodness being made?  Do you even know where that happens?  No, not some fantastical Wonka-esque palace, but right on Reading road, in a typical warehouse whose exterior plainness shrouds the magic that happens inside.  Sometime as a child, I took a tour here and was permanently awed by the glory that is ice cream.  I probably even screamed for it.  As a result, I now make my own.

Anyway, the tours are no longer available, and I feel like part of my personal history has now been revised by the Ministry of Information.

I saw a multitude of baked goods, candies, pies, and ice creams upon entering Graeter's. I came for Graeter's signature chip ice cream flavors, most notably their Black Raspberry Chip ice cream. But before all that, I sampled a couple of other flavors.

Their Pumpkin ice cream is a seasonal fall flavor, using real pumpkin pie filling. I can see myself enjoying this one even when it's chilly or rainy outside. The Chocolate Chip ice cream consists of premium vanilla ice cream with dark chocolate chip chunks. A very nice ratio of chocolate chips to ice cream. A classic combination that showcases why Graeter's chip flavors are their signature items.

Bring on the Black Raspberry Chip ice cream! It's officially Graeter's signature flavor and all-time bestseller. I got it in a sugar cone for $2.50. Loved this one. Just a creamy, fresh, ideal consistency -- not too hard and not too soft. Black raspberries from Oregon (yes, Oregon!) are triple-washed and incorporated in with dark chocolate chips. The chocolate chip chunks provide a wonderful texture contrast, and the chocolate is a lovely complement to the fruity raspberry ice cream.

The ice cream started melting several minutes after I tried taking pictures. So yes, it did get a little messy, but hey, it was still fantastic stuff!

I also like that Graeter's ice cream can be found nationwide! It's in my local Fred Meyer store...win! if you haven't had Graeter's before, be sure to try that Black Raspberry Chip ice cream!

(Big thanks to the people at Ohio State University for telling me to go here!)

The Graeter Ice Cream Creator!

Man this stuff is good!  And why?  Chocolate chips that are just that, chips!  I'm not sure when it became cool to put chocolate dust in ice cream like every other place on the planet.  You can barely taste the stuff.  Oh yes I'm pointing at you Ben and Jerry.  Not sure how you got to be so popular.  Apparently you've never done battle with the Graeter Ice Cream Creator!  Rest assred when mint chocolate chips but heads, you are left eating your chocolate double fudge vomit surprise.

When I was younger in boy scouts we went to the Graeter's head ice cream place.  And I saw it.  I saw one of the chocolate bars that they chunk up.  It was the size of a tire.

And I must gloat.  My friends you haven't lived until you've eaten Graeter's ice cream with your feet in the surf of the Pacific Ocean!

Five stars!  Place kick arse!

Sheer bliss.

Best ice cream ever made. Try the Black Raspberry Chip and the Double Chocolate Chip. And the Peanut Butter Chip. And the Chocolate Chip.

Basically, if it has the word "chip" in it, you can't go wrong.

This is my favorite store out of all the chains. I truly love the service and the staff  at this location. I stop every morning for donuts for work.  Go early because typically by lunch, most of the donuts are gone.
Blackberry chip is very good.  It's also Oprah's favorite flavor.

Damn fine place. Damn fine. It's got some old school stuff, with really nice prices. Sodas made soda water, hand pumped syrups, and their awesome ice cream, phosphates (sodas without ice cream), floats and malts, and a great selection of confections and pastries. It's also got some new school stuff like frozen lemonade smoothies, pretzel cones, and buckeyes...these things are totally new to me anyway. My wife and I got a chocolate soda, a scoop of the daily special ice cream, and a delicious glass of fresh lemonade. All of it was awesome, and under $10. We also got a box of pastries and cookies to take back to Columbus. We'll be working on those tonight.

Graeter's is a must try. There is a lot of good ice cream in Cincinnati, but this is definitely my favorite. I drove past this location for years before ever visiting. The hours here are not great, but the staff is. My Father-in-law visited to load up for there trip back down south and they went out of there way to help load the car. Then again, he was buying a lot of ice cream. But Graeter's isn't just about ice cream, they have a very good bakery and candy as well. Do yourself a favor, check it all out, it's the only responsible thing to do.
On a cross country cycling trip this was easily in the top 5 best ice creams. And we ate a LOT of ice cream.

WOW! I'm an ice cream lover and this did not disappoint. Thanks to the reviewer who mentioned that the flurries are generous with candies -- big chunks all the way from top to bottom. I went with Oreo & Reese's peanut butter cups. So. Good. 

Dairy free ice cream available. 

Drive through or walk up. 

They do accept credit cards, and they have a few picnic tables to sit and eat.
Great ice cream! So many sundae and milkshake options and they have dairy free options which is awesome!

I was very excited to take my family for ice cream to a local place. The experience was unpleasant to say the least. The person who seemed to be the owner was not helpful, displayed a bad attitude and lacked any interest in helping us with our order. It was our first time and we felt unwelcome and ultimately what we order was not all that great. It's definitely unfortunately to have places with service like this ,open to the public running so poorly.

I wasn't going to write a review about my bad experience but after seeing someone in the reviews say they got discriminated against, I'm DEFINITELY not going to be back now. My experience was minor compared to that, but still ridiculous. 
My partner and I are vegan and they have dairy free soft serve, so I wanted to take him to try it. We pull up to the window to order, I ask about the flavors. They only had vanilla and orange (weird but ok). So I ask if we can do a vanilla and Oreo flurry, girl says no for some reason and I ask what we can do. She says a shake or cup with toppings. I say two shakes, one large, one small, and she says they "cant do large for dairy free, because it uses too much product". I'm getting frustrated at this point but I say medium is fine. She goes to put in the order and comes back to tell me they can't do shakes. I say "what CAN you do" and she says ice cream in a cup with toppings. Fine, sure. We pay and it was my mistake I forgot to ask about the ingredients, my partner has a soy allergy but I was told multiple times in the past it was almond milk ice cream. I ask again if it was almond milk ice cream to be sure, girl says yes. I ask if it contains soy just to be safe and she comes back to tell me it's SILK. Silk like soy milk. I asked for clarification because I know silk does make almond milk, but all they kept saying was "it's silk" and wouldn't give me an ingredient list. We had to get a refund and we went through it all for nothing. I should have asked in the beginning and that's my bad, but vegans should know before they go you're probably gonna jump through hoops to figure out what you can order if you don't want it plain. 

Tl;dr 
Don't support them, the owner discriminated against a gay person. But if you do: 
Vegans, keep it simple or you're going to jump through hoops to get your order.
People with allergies, ask to see ingredients right off the bat.

Have been twice and enjoyed it before! Third time was not the charm. They are closing at 9:30 (not posted anywhere online!) right now and had the window closed on us while still in drive thru line at 9:30.

I ordered a cone with sprinkles and they charged me extra and I didn't get sprinkles even after I asked for them after then my mom ordered a red cream soda and they charged her for a float when she actually asked for just the drink and then when she asked for just the drink they said they couldn't give it to her because they looked back at the order but they got the order wrong

4 stars for the menu options, the service and the convenience. -1 star for only serving soft serve. I HATE soft serve but I really wanted to treat the fam to something other than an ice cream chain and we came here. We did enjoy the outdoor seating and it was warm so it was really comfy and my son was able to run around and burn off his sugar rush. This place actually has a drive thru which I thought was hilarious but cool. It seems to be an independent ice cream parlor thing. Not my favorite of the independents but still refreshing and the sign in front always has a clever joke or something to catch your attention. There are so many menu option that you could have a different item everyday of the summer if you wanted! Mind blowing!

Not so humbly submitted,
King Michael C.

Excellent service tonight from the young man working at the walk up window.  There were 5 us, he took our order correctly, and very efficient.  Ice cream is good, and a good price.  They also have a drive thru.

This was my third visit here and my only successful one. The first time the flavor machine was down, second I drove up to the window and they were closed but instead of telling me that they just stood at the drive thru window. This time I actually got my ice cream and it's quite good if not a little thick. Their times on google were wrong, stated they closed at 10 but their sign says 9, thankfully they didn't turn us away. I like the cookie dough flurry I got but I'm still a little skeptical on the service. I mostly only go here if I don't want to travel to putz.

In what has appeared to be a vain attempt at getting the conehead badge, I visited the Cone Zone (formerly called Tummy Treats), and I certainly enjoyed my yogurt. The menu includes such awesome things as a Fried Ice Cream Sundae ($3.75), Hawaiian Ice ($1.50-2), and cheese coneys!? ($1.50). Great prices and fast service make this a nice thing to have in the area.  I am sure the students leave the school across the street and head directly to this place. 

I do not know if the Mayor of Cheviot (Sam Keller cheviot.org/officials.sh…) owns or is even involved with this business or (Keller's Cheviot Cafe yelp.com/biz/cheviot-caf… ), but both are great places to spend your time and money.

Satisfy your sweet tooth and stop by the Cone Zone. The outdoor area is a nice place too, but not until it warms up a bit.

I have never in my almost 25 years of life been discriminated against for being gay. This 'family friendly' so called establishment has a shared parking lot with a tattoo shop myself and my girlfriend were visiting. While in the parking lot me and my girlfriend were over arms length apart, shared a simple kiss and the owner of Cone Zone came out and told us we had to leave because they were family friendly and apparently we didn't fit the mold of her perception of this. I am completely baffled in awe and will never give Cone Zone my business.

The Cone Zone is a cool place on a hot day. The place is great. They have a walk up window, drive thru and inside parlor with a bathroom. The place is very clean and friendly with picnic tables out back. You get TONS of ice cream for your money. We will be back!!

Alright. I'm about to be real right now. I mean no disrespect to the owners or it's employees but come on!! After a horrendous experience last year, I'd figure I'd give it one more shot. Once again... I'm sorry that I did. 

Value: you defiantly get a lot for your money. I will give it that.  

Everything else:  last year, my wife and I wanted a nice summer treat so we decided to try this place out. we frequently go to zip dip. I order a flurry and my wife a slush puppy (or something similar). A flurry is similar to a DQ blizzard. I order a snickers flurry. I get handed a melting mess. I HAVE NO IDEA WHY THEY'RE OBSESSED WITH OVER FLOWING THE CUP. She hands me a cup with ice cream and snickers three inches above the rim.  She hands me the melting mess and it's dripping on me. I hand it back to the girl and ask her to get a different one that's not a melted mess. She then gives me my wife's slushy and upon first sip, she starts coughing. She asked me to try it and I do. It was straight up disgusting. Literally like if she made a drink with 80% syrup and 20% slush. It tastes like cherry cough syrup. I ask her to remake it as well. She hands me the new flurry and it's still a melted mess. Their ice cream melts fast.  Even though I've already paid for it, I drive off and decided screw it. I'll take the $8.00 loss. I don't even get the slushy back and I throw that discussing melted mess out the window and drive off. 

Fast forward to today. I order something called the snowball. Basically, I figured it would be a slushy with ice cream. that's the description. once again... I have no idea why they are so freaking obsessed with overdoing it. they hand me a 16 ounce cup that has a gigantic snowcone over top melting ice cream. The syrup from the snow cone has already begun melting along with the ice cream. it is dripping all over me. It got all over my shirt. The Cherry Syrup Also Got All Over my Shorts. And to Make Matters Even Better... The young Lady Doesn't Even Hand me a Napkin When She Gives me The Item. Needless to Say I Will Never go There Again.

To sum it up: don't use the drive-through. don't buy the ice cream. go down the road to zip dip and buy it there instead. Stop overflowing your cups. Do try to cram 20 oz in a 16 oz cup. FOR THR LOVE OF GOD, get a different yogurt or  ice cream mixture or adjust your machines so it doesn't melt w/in two seconds of handing it to someone. Also, GIVE OUT NAPKINS.

Omg. Maybe it was the fact that soft serve tastes AMAZING right now, but I had a pretzel M&M flurry here after lunch and I literally cannot wait to go back. This is definitely a place that I would drive way out of my way to get some delicious soft serve. This place has a drive-thru (always a bonus) and the choice of yogurt or soft-serve ice cream. I thought the yogurt was some of the best I've ever had, and my mouth is literally watering just thinking about it now.
Best soft serve in town! Great owners! Very tolerant owners who accept diverse lifestyles and views. Try an Oreo flurry or a swirl cone with rainbow sprinkles.
So freaking good. We were visiting from Maine and our family LOVES Cone Zone so we got dessert here several times. Deeeeelicious! Try the salted caramel with pretzels and brownie bites -- incredible!

It's an ice cream stand... The place is run by kids. I don't have high expectations of service but was annoyed that they charged 50 cents for a cup of water and it was a super small cup. Other than that, it is OK. Personally I like General Custer's Golf and Gulp a lot better but I have been here a few times because it was close.

Love it here - owner is awesome and I love that they have unique flavors and combinations! I can get my blue raspberry slush puppy float here too. Love that there's a drive thru. My only wish is that they had raspberry as a sundae topping.

I've been here several times and like the selection BUT. They have screwed up my order on two different occasions. One was a pineapple shake--how do you screw that up?  By not putting pineapple in it!  The other time J ordered a slush puppy float and got a snow cone instead. WTH?!  I give it three stars for the selection and prices. The service evidently isn't that great bc they managed to screw up my order twice. I'd recommend it but make sure you get what you order.

Our inaugural family visit to the Cone Zone in Cheviot was with mixed reviews.

Overall, we were pretty pleased with the selection and our ice cream. I got a medium chocolate/vanilla twist, my husband got a small Oreo "flurry" made with vanilla frozen yogurt, and the kids got a kid-sized orange/vanilla twist and vanilla cone with chocolate dip top, respectively. Both the ice cream and the yogurt were very, very thick, and I would describe the ice cream as being custard-like. While tasty, my husband and I both agreed that there was something about everything that seemed a bit artificial. It made my stomach queasy afterwards, which is what also happens when I try ice cream from buffet restaurants. Perhaps they use mixes?

They do have a lot of popular ice cream options, plus some unique things like fried ice cream topping and chocolate covered cheesecake on a stick. I really liked that they offered most things with the option of using frozen yogurt (floats, shakes, etc.). That's nice if you are looking for a lighter, healthier option.

Our order came to just over $8, which was pretty reasonable, and although we had cash on us for once, I was pleasantly surprised to see that they are one of the few creamy whips that take credit credits. It's definitely family-run spot with kids helping out, and the location looks really clean and well done.

My main complaint was how long it took us to get served. They have a walk-up window and a drive-thru for convenience. We opted for the drive-thru, but regretted it immediately. There was no one waiting at the walk-up window and we were only the 3rd car in the drive-thru, but it took us around 20 minutes to get our order. They seemed to have plenty of staff and it was a cooler day, so I can't imagine what it'd be like on a busy hot summer night. 

We'll probably go back, but will definitely try parking and using the walk-up window next time.

There's nothing quite as satisfying as taking a nice healthy walk around the neighborhood and finishing it off with a huge ice cream cone. Sometimes you need a creamy whip that is within walking distance (ok, lots of times).

Cone Zone has changed hands a few times over the best 6 or 7 years. The latest owners seem to really enjoy the place and are working hard to make it a neighborhood destination. The biggest new addition is the inside dining area. No longer will rain ruin your creamy whip plans! It has 5 tables and a little bar area and you can place your order inside as well. Very nice!

The ice cream is good, and the serving sizes are larger than the other creamy whips in the area. Good value for your money. The only bad item I have tried is the strawberry shake. Their strawberry shake uses syrup instead of real strawberries. That's a big no-no for me. 

They also serve coneys and burgers that are good, too. Their chili is more "real" chili than "cincinnati-style" chili, which was a bit of a surprise (but in a good way).

They also have parking in the rear of the building and an outside seating area, so everything you need! Go check it out!

There are a tremendous amount of choices on the Westside for soft serve. This is my favorite.  I love that they have a kiddie cone for when I just want a little bite of ice cream.  My son loves the chocolate chip cookie dough flurry. The drive thru has been great for when I want a cone on the go.  I prefer their soft serve because it is creamier vs. Icier. If that makes any sense. Definitely my go to when I am in the mood for icecream.

I go here simply because this is my son's favorite ice cream spot.Nice location....recently remodel and plenty of parking space.I have tried a few things on the menu but I am not impressed.But as long as my son happy with his ice cream and sprinkles.

I've stopped here a few times they have good prices and decent ice cream but I was taking a picture of the cone zone sign above the menu and an employee came out and questioned me why I was taking the picture and asked to see it... I simply showed him it was a snapchat to a friend saying I was excited for ice cream on this hot day. It was enough to offend me and make this my last visit also I did not get an apology...

I do not like the flavour ribbon garbage they use to make their flavours. It tastes really fake and the soft serve ice cream tastes pretty generic. This place would be much better if they would use team flavours or syrups.

I love a good creamy whip!  My loyalties lie with another one... but that may be changing!  Three of us braved the 30 degree weather to walk (yes, walk!) to Cone Zone tonight.  And it was totally worth the frozen fingers and toes.

I am a huge fan of a Reese Cup flurry/blizzard.  It is one of the few things I cannot resist, despite the calories.  I have very definite opinions about what makes a good one... It must have chunks of the cups, not just tiny pieces.  I absolutely HATE when the last quarter of my flurry is ice cream only.  Cone Zone is winning on all accounts.  

Too cold?  They have a drive through window!  Once it warms up... there are plenty of picnic tables.  

I have the feeling that Cone Zone is going to get way too much of my business this summer.....
The best half cookie dough x half brownie flurry in the city!  Cookie dough that actually has flavor and brownies that are real (well at least the delicious ones from a box).

I love Chill. My first experience must have been last summer when we ended up talking to one of the owners about her icy creations with homemade simple syrup sugars and amazing flavor combinations as an alternative to artificially colored garbage. I was sold. 

This past weekend they were at the butterfly show and I feel in love all over again. Now that I've been reminded of my crush, I've pursued their refreshing, tasty, glorious icy treats twice this weekend. Yep, once a day. If I could continue to pull that off, I might, but sadly this will be relegated to my weekend treat. When it's warm out it almost trumps ice cream in its clean flavors and tricks you into having some more water. Tasty, tasty water!

I've had the berry, fruit of the islands, strawberry, and lemonade flavors- among some others I can't recall right now- and loved them all equally. The ice is freshly crushed and flavors then poured over. Yum! To add to this you can have it topped with watermelon and mint. All in all, it's a perfect treat. The price is reasonable, $3.50 for a medium, which could certainly be shared. That's your prerogative; I don't often share. 

The owners are friendly and helpful, even remembering my order from the day before...way to be on top of it! Thank you to Chill for having such a fresh treat available for the upcoming summer months. If you haven't tried what they have to offer, definitely check them out. (They're outside of Krause's and Skirtz and Johnson's in case you think you've missed them).

It was a sweltering day in Cincinnati and I was perusing the farmers market.  Needless to say, I was sweating, becoming ornery, and in the need of refreshment.  I thank the good Lord above I ran into Chill.  The couple in charge was too cute and so sweet!  They gave samples galore and were very informative on how they produce their syrups; all natural, and delicious!  I opted for the fruit of the islands syrup with mint and it was exactly what I needed!  I wish I could have packed them up and flown them home with me to Orlando!  We need you out here!

This Place was delicious; this is far from your traditional snow cone, with all natural fruit flavors with no artificial ingredients. It was great, I had mango with strawberry mix incredible!! Every time I go to the Findlay Market I make sure to stop by get some shaved ice!!! This stuff is great on those hot Cincinnati days

Love this place located off Harrison Avenue near Race in Cincinnati, Ohio.  One of my favorite summer soft serve ice cream spots.   

4050 Drew Avenue

Lots of variety and friendly service with good prices.
My favorite ice cream place!  Their flurry's are so good and the service is quick. The long lines don't bother me because they are able to speed through the lines.

Zip Dip is another good ice cream stand. It has much of the very same offerings the others do. This one is in a pleasant location. It has a nice seating area. The parking lot is crappy. 

I had a cotton candy slushie. It's a flavor not many dairy bars have. This is about $2 for a medium. A lot of ice cream flavors are here. There are more than 50 flavors, with many of them common and some odd ones. It has a nice seating area. There's a few tables and a porch swing. 

I recommend this for anyone who likes these small ice cream places. It's better than going to a worldwide chain. The service always is cheerful but not excessive.

A small walk-up stand with two order windows.  Zip Dip has been a favorite of Westsiders for generations. A Westside institution really. After passing this stand on numberous occasions, we finally decided to give this stand a try.

Topping and mix-in selection is plentiful at Zip Dip. Candy, cookies, sprinkles, nuts, dips and sauces are all available.  Several flavors of Whirlybird granola are also now available.  There are far more options in that department then flavors of soft serve. Chocolate and vanilla are standard, with two revolving specialty flavors. I prefer my soft serve without toppings. As such, a small flavor selection is a drawback for me. That being said, the chocolate soft serve is rich, creamy and smooth. One of the better chocolate soft serves I have tried. A strong chocolate flavor. 

Bench seating is available on either side of the building. Tables and a swing are available on the other side of the parking lot. Some of the tables are shaded. At busy times, it can be hard to find parking.
Delicious ice cream at a great price. They had vanilla and orange when I went.
The ice cream is okay, but a little dry and tasteless. Service and staff is also decent. Prices are way above average, so that's a plus!

It's not a place you want to come to when they are busy. the parking here is horrible and people will illegally park at the inner section (which is very dangerous since it's hard to see around that corner) far as the ice cream goes? it's just average.. nothing stand out about it at all.

Meh. I know it's a west side staple and I have family who are out of town who LOVE this place and make trips to eat it but I feel like the ice cream is super generic and the last time we went there they messed my order up and were extremely rude about it. Also the parking situation is awful, but honestly they can't do much about that. Anyhow, there are better options!

Just reopened after the winter!  Their soft serve is so of the best around. You can't go wrong, but I tend to go for the classic vanilla cone. Creamy, generous serving. The best thing to make your day. 

Not many people there right now but I could see how parking may become an issue in the busy summer months. 

Prices can't be beat either.

Another West Side institution, Zip Dip has been a favorite of our family for years, after a baseball game on a Saturday afternoon the place to be to cool down was Zip Dip, anytime we wanted ice cream we pleaded with mom and dad to take us to Zip Dip. 

The menu items have remained the same, and I love it. I loved getting a cherry dipped cone or a soft serve in a mini baseball helmet with jimmies. 

Anytime I travel over to the West Side now, a must stop is Zip Dip.

Always a good time! Good price, delicious ice cream, fun experience. Wish the location was a little better. I don't love that's it really close to a busy road, but not a lot you can do about that! The staff is usually a high school kid, but they've always been attentive and gotten our order correct. I love their blizzards!! Writing this review is making me want to go right now! 
Definitely a family friendly place and fun!
This is probably my favorite ice cream place in town. My family and I always go here during the summer. Great place to go to just have a cone and chill out.

Love Zip Dip! Definitely a west side staple. 

Their soft serve is the best. Price is right, their portions are generous as well. All different kinds of combinations you can create, even off the menu which is fun! 

Staff is nice and friendly. You can even get a rewards card towards different treats. 

It's a popular place, so the only downside is parking, though you can always find a spot on the street if not in their parking lot. 

If you're craving soft serve its the place to be!

First visit, ordered a hot dog, bread was stale and hard. I understand it's an ice cream place, but serving a hard bun is a reflection of service. Second visit, ordered the brownie sundae. Brownie was also hard,  I don't know if they microwaved it too long or it was old to begin with. The sundae was also sloppy-made. Third visit, ordered an ice cream orange slush mix, horrible. That was my fault, I was expecting it to taste like Sonic's cream slush; they don't use the same ingredients apparently.  Haven't been back since.

Fun little ice cream stand with a really nice outdoor sitting area - off to the side with newer picnic tables and a "porch" swing.

They have a great variety and everything I've gotten has had great flavor - better than some other creamy whips I've tried.  They also always have two flavors of low fat / non-fat yogurt that my friends love (I like the full fat stuff!)

The staff is always friendly and the service is fast

Perfect for a good old fashion soft serve. Had a chocolate dipped chocolate come and it was perfection. Exactly what I was craving. We will be back when we are wanting soft serve. Also their picnic area is very nice. Always clean and well kept.

Even though I'm the biggest fan of real ice cream, I still enjoy the creamy whip occasionally. Zip Dip is a west side staple - open seasonally and packed with nostalgia in every bite. There's plenty of seating outside, prices are awesome and it's a fun way to get a cool treat (plus, they have awesome frozen yogurt flavors). My usual order at Zip Dip? Vanilla (or if I like the frozen yog flavor, I'll get that) With raspberry sauce and chocolate sprinkles. Hey, I love sprinkles! I love seeing small, family owned businesses thrive and Zip Dip is proving that we all crave recreating childhood memories through ice cream.

After a long fun day at Miami Whitewater Forest I was craving a small snack and some Ice Cream. Google pulled this up, the reviews looked good, so we set out to find it. I ordered a mixed Ice Cream Cone (Chocolate and Vanilla) with a Cheeseburger. My mom who was with me and visiting from San Diego got a Chocolate Shake. The Ice Cream was delicious! I wasn't expecting much from my Hamburger just because it is an Ice Cream place but even that was down right yummy! I've actually been craving it now for a few days. So I can't wait to make another visit to the park and stop by here on the way home. They also have a little stamp rewards system too where so many visits gets you something half off I think or free. I totally suggest stopping and checking this place out.

Zip Dip never disappoints!! Choc/Vanilla twist with crunch coat is my childhood favorite, and still my go-to as an adult. We occasionally meet friends at other classic creamy whips around town, but nothing competes with the flavor and overall quality of Zip Dip!

Zip Dip is great! My preference for frozen yogurt/ice cream on the west side. I know there are a lot of places like this around Cincinnati and when it's hot and humid in the summer, this is my only answer to combat the impending misery (I am bad at summer weather here). Zip Dip and the pool, I guess, are my saving graces. Reasons to willingly go outside ;) 

There are teens that work here, but they are surprisingly good a managing lines and looking like they care. It's a good crew and really friendly to interact with. They use pen and paper to take orders (drawing boxes around them when complete) and hand calculations for transactions. A nice throwback to a time when cash registers and debit cards weren't required. On that note: cash only, be prepared. 

The area around Zip Dip includes tables, a swing, and angled retaining walls to rest your legs while you enjoy your sweet treats. 

My favorite order is the peanut butter frozen yogurt, a sundae with peanut butter sauce, or any cone combination that might sound interesting or tasty on a given day.

A real treasure, an step back in time, give Zip Dip a try!

It's easy to pass by this tiny West Side establishment, but its pastel colors and neon border will grab your eye. Soon enough, you'll be pulling a U-turn into their parking lot.

Zip Dip dishes out over 50 different kinds of soft serve, from your traditional flavors to the more eccentric. If you know me, I always opt for the eccentric. At Zip Dip, this would be the crème brûlée soft serve. Then I got really adventurous and went with a crème brûlée milkshake. It was incredible! I highly recommend giving it a try, if you're bored with the classic flavors.

I can also recommend the regular chocolate shake, which is just the right combination of cream and liquidy to be a thirst quencher.

Zip Dip's "small" shake starts at 16 oz., which is more than enough milkshake for me. Wearing your elastic pants? They serve milkshakes in 44oz cups. That's almost three pounds of beverage!

Zip Dip has been a West Side legacy since 1950. Stop by and become part of its history today!

Price per person: $3.00

I liked Zip Dip, but I didn't necessarily love it. 

A lot of creamy whips tend to have very similar menu items and tastes, and Zip Dip resides somewhere in the middle, as there wasn't one specific thing about the experience that stood out. I got there, ordered my standard chocolate/vanilla zebra cone with chocolate sprinkles, and was on my way. 

I liked Zip Dip, and I'd absolutely have it again if I am to be in the neighborhood (which isn't often), but I wouldn't say it really has that joie de vivre that really sets it apart.

Maybe it's nostalgia, maybe this is the greatest place on earth. Hard to say but I've been coming here almost as long as I can remember. The friendly faces, the cheap ice cream, the warm weather and a bench makes for a great evening and date night. This is a local place but everyone is friendly here. Definitely stop by here and meet some people.

I can't say for 100% sure but about 40 minutes after I got home from eating a small dip top cone, I know I had some level of food poisoning.  It's the only thing I had eaten and as soon as i got it all out, I felt better.  It tasted fine but you never know when you will get bacteria I guess, especially from milk products.

Zip Dip is your classic ice cream stand with the best kind of ice cream in my opinion, soft serve!  I really enjoy stopping here around 7 to 8 pm on spring / late summer night and having a cone while swinging away and watching the traffic go by on Harrison Ave.  Locally owned and they do a great job.

I teach within walking distance of Zip Dip.... Each year there is a countdown in our office for when Zip Dip opens!  That really is the first sign of spring!

This is my favorite of all the creamy whip's in town!  Go there if its been a particularly bad day at work, or its a Friday, or its sunny..... really any excuse....

Their blizzards are the best!  Ask for an extra scoop of candy if you really want to kick it up a notch!  I also like their low-cal soft serve options, flavors change regularly and are always posted on a sign out front.  Add some fruit and don't feel too bad about the calories!

Parking is always at a premium in their lot!  I recommend parking on the side road itself.  There is always plenty of seating especially since they added a whole mess of picnic tables a couple of years ago.  There will ALWAYS be a line, but it moves fast.

Definitely try to get your butt here as soon as you see the flowers popping out of the ground!

Had this lovely westside gem on Saturday afternoon. I've had zip dip on several occasions and with the cooler temps, I love going even more because it's much less crowded. I can't vouch for their food choices (they do seem reasonably priced) but their ice cream yum. My boyfriend tried the butterfinger flurry and I had the vanilla yogurt with rainbow jimmies. Flurry was excellent it was just enough candy mix and ice cream. The yogurt isn't my favorite only because I prefer real ice cream lol. As a "healthier" option though it's suitable. The portions are huge. It looks pricey but when you get it you realize why. My boyfriend mentioned prices when we first got thee (he had never been) and then we're driving home and he said "oh geez this is soooo much. I didn't realize how much they would give me." Definitely a great weather it's hot or cold out.

I've been getting cones here since I was a wee lass, and trust me, that was many MANY years ago. Since then, I've tried soft serve all over the city, but this is always in the top 2.

Unlike the other shop in my top 2, Putz', ZipDip features a machine packed with Orange Sherbet and Vanilla Ice Cream EVERY DAY. So on those hot hot summer days a creamsicle cone is never far away.

The mix on the ice cream is always spot on, and the sundae toppings are excellent. I've only ordered the yogurt a few times, but it was pretty good for yogurt, and changes regularly.  

If you have your furry friends with you, ask for a puppy sundae: a swirl of vanilla softserve topped with a milk bone.

Ah, the Zip Dip Creamy Whip. Fun to say, right?

This place has a ton of character. Great neon signage, a laid back West Side crowd, and a big selection of frozen goodies. The stars of the show are their weekly rotating flavors of ice cream and frozen yogurt, as well as my favorite, the malts. The chocolate malts that I've had from Zip Dip are the best I've had in the city. Extra malty and rich.

Overall, the ice cream here is good, but the portions are the smallest of any creamy whip on our summer quest. That's a bit discouraging, sine they are towards the high end of the creamy whip price range. As well, parking and seating is extremely tight here. On a busy night, parking down a residential street and taking your treats to go is a must.

4 months in the States and I thought I started to fit in. Think again. I just stood there, staring at all the different types of icecream and none of them made sense to me. Blizzard, malt...? Say what? My fellow Yelpers tried to explain to me but most of it got lost in translation. I even think I heard that there is an icecream combined with coke? Errrm, right.

I decided to go for a small chocolate icecream that has marshmallow in it too (sorry, forgot the name :s). It was nice.

I was overwhelmed by the different choices and thought it was great to discover this American icecream roadshop.

The ice itself however... hmmm, how to explain? I guess I'm used to fresh, Italian ice, with bits and pieces in there. Not the soft ice I got. 

So, 4 stars for the concept, but probably need to try out a few more flavors before I really get something that I adore!

Pure Americana. Neon lights, simple eats and a smorgasbord of various ice cream treats.

I got a simple soft-serve chocolate waffle cone. Just about perfect for the end of a hot summer day. Others seemed pleased with their treats also.

The portions were huge. I was eating after a heavy dinner and just wanted a taste of something sweet. That order I mentioned above seemed like the smallest and least expensive thing on the menu. I thought I'd get a cute little cone. Nope. This was a large in my book. For $3. Great deal but more than I was looking for. Sure, I could have only eaten half but, come on, no way that was going to happen. I ate it right down to the point of the cone.

Putz's will always be my one and only creamy whip. But when I can't stand to make the trek down Montana Ave, I grab my ice cream fix from Zip Dip.

I particularly like the variety of mix-in items for Blizzards (cyclones, flurries, whatever they call them). My favorite is Crunch Bars (I've never seen them anywhere else).

I like their logo and the fact that they sell merchandise. Why doesn't Putz's do that?

I also like their rewards program. You get a punch card and every time you make a purchase you get one punch. There are different reward levels corresponding to how many punches you have. I like that I get rewarded for every purchase.

This place has the nostalgia that Dairy Queen could only wish to have. 

My first time here I ordered the milk chocolate shake. I was not disappointed, it was exactly what I was craving. Seems like a great place to go to if you are sitting around on a week night with a hankering for some ice cream. I will definitely be going back to sample some more of their menu.

Best ice cream on the West Side that isn't Graeters! The flurries (think blizzards) are better than DQs, and everything else is top notch. Cheap, quick, and always tasty. 

Also still do the frequent purchase card mentioned below, which is great when you're there fairly often!

My husband and I are slowly making our way to all the creamy whips in the Cincinnati area. Most recently we stopped by Don's and it was great!

This is a larger creamy whip compared to many others. It's in the Reading area. There is a good amount of parking and lots of picnic tables.

I had a Reese's Whipper (their Blizzard, Flurry, etc.). It was delicious! The soft serve had a superb, creamy consistency (not at all icy), and there was a great Reese's to ice cream ratio.

My husband had his typical twist cone in rainbow sprinkles. Another winner for sure.

Next time we're in Reading on a hot day we'll be stopping by Don's for sure!

Don's is the best ice cream place in Reading. It sure looks like it judging by the line. This place was hopping that night. It has ice cream, cold drinks, and hot food. The outdoor seating area is bigger and better than many others. 

I had a watermelon slushie. It's about $2 for a medium. This is pretty large though. It seems to attract large crowds. The seating area is big enough to handle them. It also has many tables with umbrellas on the patio. This is a luxury which isn't seen at most other local ice cream places. 

It has a small parking lot but there's plenty of room on the nearby streets. It has prices better than national chains. This is still cash only.

The ice cream here was so creamy and delicious. I ordered the small swirl sundae with whipped cream, nuts and hot fudge and I could not stop eating it. I'd have to say one of the better ice creams I had and there were several tables to sit at. Definitely recommend checking them out.
Busy. It's just ice cream. Not Putz's but still I very small town feel ice cream station. I would go again. I wouldn't rush back.

We were looking for something sweet and cooling on a warm day and found Don's on the Yelp app. 

I ordered the zebra with sprinkles and opted to have it served in a cup so it wouldn't melt on my hands. I'm not sure if the person who pulled the ice cream had a heavy hand or if their serving sizes are just plentiful, but my cup was overflowing and I still ended getting ice cream on my hands. 

They offer a decent selection on their menu with plenty of outdoor seating and off street parking.

What do you do on a perfect summer's day, when there's just enough breeze to make the heat tolerable and you just want to stare up at the pure cobalt sky, feeling the sun on your skin? Have a mini picnic with the best treat, ice cream. At Don's Creamy Whip, generations of kids (including my husband) have been getting their sweet tooth tamed with soft serve, sundaes, slushies, ice cream cookie sandwiches, dip tops and more. Don's even serves up hot food most days, including hot dogs and hamburgers.

My husband got his life-long usual dish (going all the way back to post baseball and football game treat time in his childhood). His beloved is always vanilla softserve with rainbow sprinkles. Of course he gave it thumbs up. I had zebra softserve with a chocolate diptop. The ice cream was amazing, but I've had better diptops. I am, however, looking forward to trying other items, a pretzel cone, watermelon slushie, and a cookie sandwich.

Slice of Americana! Perfect little creamy whip stop in Reading. There is a decent amount of outdoor seating but we did have to share a table with strangers, not a problem. 

Extensive menu that I didn't really have a chance to peruse so I had a zebra (chocolate and vanilla) dipped in cherry topping. It was huge and it was only a medium size. Parking is ample and off street. 

My only tips are to eat your ice cream quickly as it will melt all over your hands and the red dip on your hands looks like you are bleeding. Eww!

Total nostalgia alert! This creamy ship is right outside of vonderhaars aka the best caterer in the city. They have all the typical soft serve goodies that your heart could desire.

My favorite is always vanilla soft serve with peanut butter topping. Simple and classic.

Look out though! There sizes are no joke. The Small size here is what a usual medium is at other places. And if you order a Large, you had better have someone there to help you finish it!

Came here a few weeks ago after dinner for a cherry dip top. Drove right past the place, but then circled back around and glad that I did.  The prices were very reasonable as my cherry dip top was 2.25 and very good. The girls working were nice. Don's creamy whip is a 15 min drive for me, but I would and will make it again. 

They only accept cash.

Great ice cream! Affordable and fun, I bring the kids after practice every week. A good place with good snacks and sweets, no nonsense and no yuppie scum spilling cocktails on my work boots. Jeffrey loves the reds hat cup cone combo. I always get a small low fat malt. Tastes like the real deal! Thanks!
Delicious ice cream and snow cones.  Great price and friendly staff. Truly a hidden gem. Lots of choices. Going tomorrow. Can't wait.

Perfect stop for an ice cream ! We stopped here on a rainy evening;) I had a zebra small cone which was an absolute delight. And my husband had a plain vanilla cup!! What was more exciting was the color changing spoon ! I couldn't get enough of it

I like to visit dairy bars all over the city while I travel for work. Stopped at Dons today for the first time. The ice cream is good, but not the best I've had. The small cup with sprinkles is $3.45. I think that is a bit high for the quality and quantity of the ice cream.
Got a cup of twist ice cream.  Not as creamy as some.  We also got a yoghurt cone which they warned us was already melting.  Not a great first experience here.

A small local gem that will fulfill anyone's Cream Whip craving! They have a large variety of toppings, dips, and flavors. My personal favorite is a chocolate cone dipped in cherry! Not only are there many of sweets to eat, there are also a variety of snacks for those without a sweet tooth. It's a great place to go with family and friends!

Everything on the menu is amazing! My personal favorite is the Reese Cup whippers. The glaciers are great and anything with sprinkles is a hit! The size of the cones are accurate. The workers are always very friendly and on top of everything.

Love getting a zebra dunked in cherry coating. Used to be the group hang out after our swim meets (in which we kicked ass!...Go Eagles...4 time winners back-to-back!).

Usually if I have to do errands or return something to the library, or are in Reading for some reason, during the summer and spring only (due to the fact they're closed in the fall and winter), i have to stop at this place!

My friend took me to this little place and it's a bit different than your typical creamy whip, at least from my personal experience. I am a fan of the dipped cones, and Don's doesn't disappoint with their variety of dip flavors! Bubble gum? Blueberry, Cherry, Chocolate?? YES PLEASE!! I wonder if I can have my cone dipped in all of the flavors at once?? Hmmm.... 

Any who I'm getting off on a tangent, and fueling my own delirious dipping fantasy and this review should also be for YOU the reader... so uh yeah. Let me get back on track. They serve a delicious soft serve, and even have some of the yummiest French fries I've had in awhile. The prices are good, and they have a few tables so you can enjoy your treat on the spot. 

They only take cash, and if you order a dip cone or sprinkly cone, it WILL drip everywhere, most likely causing an ant Apocalypse from the river it forms below your table. You may want to get a bowl to put said weapon of ant mass destruction in. The bowl comes with a spoon, but it'll cost ya .50. It's a bit hidden, so plug it into your GPS, and go find it if you're craving some dairy deliciousness.

A little hard to find at first.  Thought it was actually on Reading Rd, but just a bit off Reading on a side street slightly hidden.  Glad we found it!  Nice new seating tables, some with umbrellas.

Very good soft serve and high quality toppings.  I had a zebra (chocolate/banana) yogurt strawberry sundae and it was very good (like a banana split which was what i wad going for) and the prices were reasonable.

Worth the 15 min drive IMHO.  Will visit again!

Apparently a known Evendale hotspot for cold treats.  My roommates family lives up here, and they treated to a round of frozen snacks.  The specialty seems to be soft-serve (which tastes very good for soft-serve) that is inverted and dipped in chocolate or peanut butter sauce to encase it in a hardened shell of candied delight.  

I also had a strawberry malt.  They were extremely generous with the malt powder, which was a bit grainy (perhaps not fully Creamy Whipped?) but it had real strawberry chunks, which can be a rarity these days in the ice cream joint industry.  

No frills, quick and tasty soft-serve based ice creamery.  And locally owned.
Great soft serve ice cream! This is an old school ice cream shop that is great for hot summer afternoons.

Everything delicious 

Despite being delivered the funnel cake was hot - enough for two people for sure.  The Reese's cups on top cut the sweetness of the powder red sugar very nicely 

Ice cream is homemade and reminded me of pistachio ice cream - very good

Found this place by chance after driving down to get some Jamaican food at Island Frydays.

While waiting for my food, I decided to stroll in here and give it a shot.  I'll tell you right now, I'm not sure why this place only has an average rating because the cookies and cupcakes I had here were some of the best I've had.  I even have the signed and sealed approval of my wife and 3 children.

Service was friendly and helpful, they even loaded me up with a fresh batch of chocolate chip cookies right out of the oven.  If I were going to have one thing from here again, it would be the s'mores cookie.  They bake a graham cracker within the cookie dough along with the chocolate and marshmallow.  They recommended heating the cookie in the microwave for 15 seconds and that is exactly what I did.  Amazing!

Highly recommended!

Willy Wonka's Ice Cream Factory. This place is so much fun. Roll any of the tons of ice cream flavors. Hit the cereal bar. Drool over the churros & cookies & brownies. Mix up dozens of toppings. Make a special trip to The Sweet Place!

Run! Don't walk, run and try this place! It's brand new, but I foresee with good advertising it will be packed soon. There are regular offerings like cupcakes, cookies and cake (even a pound cake!), but also non-traditional fare like cookie shot glasses which they'll fill with milk there or let you carry out. If they team up with Conscious Kitchen next door, which has a full bar, I could see a fantastic specialty dessert in their future.

However, the reason I say run is the Thai rolled ice cream that is made on site. I had never experienced this delicacy firsthand, but it is incredible! You get to add mix-ins to several base flavors and each creation is customized for you. It takes about 5 minutes to make, but watching the process is as fun as eating the final result. I can't wait to go try more flavor combos. 

This is a welcome addition to the Short Vine area, make it a summer favorite!

Ordered 2 cupcakes, peach cobbler and a pint of ice cream.  The desserts are good (not great) but they are way overpriced for what they give you!  The cupcakes are regular sized and the peach cobbler was gone in 5 bites. I realize we are in a pandemic but I don't feel like I got a good value for my money.  Hope the shop makes it.

I ordered from Uber eats. They forgot one item (sweet potato pie) , the rest of orders ( red velvet cupcakes and chocolate cake in jar) were just below average in taste. The mint ice cream was OK... bright green. Overall bland and one of the item was forgotten...

The chocolate ice cream is frozen chocolate milk made with cheap chocolate syrup.  There is only one station for them to make the Thai style "rolled ice cream" which causes there to be quite a long wait.
The ice cream was not rolled very well, which defeats the whole purpose of why I went here in the first place.

This place is the cutest! Love the retro decor and their desserts are photo worthy pretty, SO delicious and freshly made in house. I got the cutest cake pops as gifts for friends and 2 of their cupcakes for myself, the cream cheese icing is bomb. Brandi was so friendly and helpful and I love that this shop is a woman and black owned small business in Cincinnati. Also so nice that their hours are late so I can come after work or dessert after dinner- you don't get that everywhere. Will definitely be back!!

WORST customer service I've ever dealt with. The part owner made a rolled ice cream for me. This is located near my apartment so I've been before and she has started to know who I am. I ordered almond vanilla and took it to go. When I got back home I ate it and it tasted like cherry cough syrup. I called the store to let her know in case someone else ordered it. She started getting very aggressive telling me "it's not cherry I know what I made" and being extremely rude. I offered to bring it back so she could tell for herself to which she kept telling me I don't need to taste it it's not cherry. I told her it's not what I asked for and asked if she'd remake it if I came in. She told me she'll talk to her partner and call me back. This is 4 hours before they closed and I never received a call. Horrible person, horrible service.

I would give 0 stars if I could. Here is the "sweet potato pie" I ordered for $4.00 called the place and told them what was going on and denied anything was wrong. Horrible customer service that was 0 help and they would not to anything to rectify the situation.
