So I just placed an order tonight.  They sent me the wrong cake and then told me to call Uber (like it's their fault).  Second, the cake looks like someone ate some of it.  I don't know about you but I don't eat after ppl.  Third, I called the store and the manager (Brandy) is no help.... pretty much she got tired of talking to me and hung up on me (who hangs up on a customer when you are the one that made the mistake)....So I called back and Barry answered said "we are so busy, but I'm taking the time to talk to you."  The place has the worst customer service of all time I swear...  Please, enjoy that $10 dollars because this place will never get another dime from me!!!!
Terrible service with mediocre treats. Walmart premodern cookies taste the same for less money and none of the attitude. Don't waste your money here.

Cute little shop! I went in the evening and they still had a pretty good selection. The gentleman helping me was very knowledgeable, he knew every product and what was in it. The cupcake was bigger than I expected, and they give you a good amount of frosting but not an overwhelming amount. I also got a slice of chocolate cake. Both were super yummy! If you're in the area you should stop by.

If you haven't had The Sweet Place you HAVE to go! The cupcakes and cakes are so moist and flavorful. The red velvet is perfect. The churros and funnel cakes are to die for. I love that you can get so many flavors of almond milk because I'm lactose intolerant and so many people don't have dairy alternatives! So grateful   I love that you can get cereal or Oreos with it too, such a perfect snack' I get this all the time late night, using doordash or postmates, that's the best part!! The lady who owns it is so nice too, I want to spend all my money here.

Tonight I really wanted gummy bears or candy of some sort and I put in my special instructions that I wanted gummy bears with my pie and she gave me a bunch  I love this place

One of the Unique things about this place is that it is locally operated by a UC student and his family! The goodies are unique and they deliver late night bites. Love the cupcakes and the rolled ice cream is so unique lots of flavors to choose as well as toppings. Bravo! for entrepreneurialism.
Pretty tasty and really affordable! The cake in the vanilla cupcake I had was a little dry, but super light and the delicious icing made up for it! Glad there's a sweets spot on short vine.

Such a cool concept and really friendly service! Ice cream was delicious. It was fun watching it get made; it made eating ice cream a whole different experience. The woman behind the counter was great to talk to and you could tell she was a really hard worker. Would definitely recommend.

The manager I spoke to about a late night grub hub problem really came through. They fallowed up and really saved everyones night. Me and my fiancé were working 1000 miles apart tonight. It was his birthday and the week had been terrible. I suggest Uber eats if you want to order from them. Try the cookies. I heard they're killer!

I don't know what's going on with these negative reviews, but I've been here multiple times and the customer service is always great.

I've tried most menu items at this point. The cupcakes are great but should probably be made 50 cents cheaper. The cookies are spectacular and a much better value than Insomnia Cookies. 

The ice cream is amazing. Right now there are some hiccups; their are only two employees working and they work 16 hour days. Only one ice cream rolling station so the wait can be a bit... BUT: there are big plans for this business. 

A bigger menu, a bigger staff, more ice cream stations, just give this place a chance so it can get to that point. Don't listen to the negative reviews. This place is so spectacular but if you visit you do have to have a bit of patience. The ice cream is so so good and well worth any wait you might have!
Great service and the owner was very hospitable! We had a group of students, and all of us were really pleased with what we ordered. Highlights were the rolled ice cream and funnel cakes!
Yum yum cake was delicious. Employees are super friendly

Saw this place next to my hotel and wanted to check it out.  The rolled ice cream was great and the service was pretty good.  The only thing was that I had to wait for the rolled ice cream machine to turn on for a little bit.
My first ever experience at Freddy's was impressive. The food was delicious, the staff was fantastic, the music was great, and the custard was perfect.
I visited the this location and was so excited to see such fast and friendly service plus they gave my dog a "pup cup" I will definitely recommend and be back soon!!!

The Yelping Baby Boomer loves a good Freddy's Burger, Frys and Custard Ice Cream. The burgers are fresh, hot and crisp and because of the simple menu, there is never much wait time. You will also prefer the dense custard ice cream to normal ice cream every time. The restaurant is always very clean and the service is excellent.

Shout out from San Diego.  Love everything here, the burgers, fries and especially the seasoning.  The fries are perfect thin cut, lightly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  The pattys pressed and fully carmelized are unique and exceptional.  Though I'd recomend a bit less seasoning for my taste, Freddy's is one of my favorite quick stops.  Definitely get their seasoning shakers.

I went to Freddy's four times in three days... I kid you not.

I can't find a bad thing about this place. Granted my experience to the menu at this point is limited, but everything I did experience was great.

The staff was super friendly, helpful, and at times goofy. The food was always hot, fresh, and delicious. The custard... oh my goodness the custard is so creamy and cold.

I want to go back asap.

The burgers are salty, crispy and tasty, also pretty pricy. On a recent drive-through visit, though, I received an order of onion rings which were burned beyond edibility in grease that must have been a couple days old. The fries with that order came in a half-filled cup and seemed like they'd been sitting around for hours. I didn't have time to park and take the items back inside, so I tried phoning the store. Over the course of two hours, no one answered the phone. Freddy's is apparently unconcerned with customer satisfaction. There are a lot of other places to buy a fast food burger.

I was craving Steak & Shake, but currently all the Cincinnati-area S&S are closed for renovations. My mom suggested getting food from her nearby Freddy's, which she said was similar to S&S.

While there aren't as many choices (the tons of milkshake flavors or customized hamburger toppings,) I actually liked the cheeseburger and onion rings better at Freddy's than those at S&S. The portions were larger too. The burgers are the same thin, crispy patties, and the onion rings are nice and crispy too.

They also have the same shoestring fries, and crispy and grilled chicken, veggie burgers, hot dogs, a kids' menu (that has a grilled cheese, if you ever want a grilled cheese!) and milkshakes, malts, and vanilla and chocolate custard treats, with a lot of options for add-ins. And, wow, is the custard delicious.

Honestly, I can't say that there's anything really special about this place, but somehow the simplicity of it has captivated me. When I think of a place close by with good, affordable food, Freddy's stands out - even though I've probably only been there like twice!

Their frozen custard is good, and I usually start eating this before my actual entree arrives.  They have a Veggie Burger, which really isn't anything special, but it gets the job done. For me, the real star of the show is the Freddy's Sauce, which I thoroughly saturate all my fries in.  My biggest complaint is that they need bigger cups for dipping sauces.  :) I use many lol. 

In closing, I don't know that I can really articulate why I like Freddy's so much, but for some reason, I just do. There must be something in the sauce. ;)

Yall Idk if I just came on a good night or what. But this spot is soooo good. It's like Steak and Shake on steroids. 

Food: I ordered the California Burger I believe (I ate it so fast). It had their special sauce with two patties, I added bacon, onion and fries on the side.  THE FREAKING FRIES WITH THEIR FRY SAUCE OMGOSSSSHHH!!!!! THAT STUFF WAS SO FREAKING GOOD. It was hot, it was fresh, it was delicious. It was like the food teleported into my stomach. The burger was so hot and fresh. It tasted homemade. 
I also order the vanila custard with pecan and caramel on top. 
YALL I DON'T KNOW IF I WAS STARVING OR SOMETHING BUT IT WAS SOOO GOOD. 

Price: The price for everything I got was about 10 dollars. And the custard they didn't charge me extra for the pecan and caramel which was cool. Great price range

I went through the drive through around 9 pm and it was fast. My mouth is watering just thinking about going there again. I pray this type of service is an everyday thing. But you know how that goes. 

But with this place around I do not see me going to any fast food place for burgers but here.

I have visited this location twice. Both times the service was good, food was great fast food quality. If you are looking for healthy options, they do offer lettuce wraps versus a bun. I was impressed today as the shift manager came around to ask how our visit was. Nice touch!

We placed an order at 9:47 and waited in line to pay  until 10:17... The excuse we received was that they were "making everything fresh" I've never been to a burger joint that takes 20+ minutes to make a cheese burger... Food is no where near worth the wait nor the price you have to pay for it. Last time visitors

This is a good place to go when you are jonesing for an old school burger and fries. I love their hot dogs too. The restaurant was needing a little extra care. The floors were a little greasy and several tables needed to be cleared away.

Everything about this place seemed cool till we tasted the burgers!! Can you say LOTS OF SALT!  Not sure if there burger seasoning guy just got excited or what but man that was one salty burger.   Fries good.  Hot dog good.  Burger and fried pickles  not good.   The burger reminds me of steak and shake but not as good and super salty.

I've been here a few times now and the appeal has already worn off.

They serve burgers and fries just like Steak n Shake. You order at a counter then wait to pick it up at a second counter. So there's no table side service - which is the only noticeable difference from Steak n Shake.

The food is about as good as you would expect it to be. They give you a mountain of fries (not sure if that's good or bad).

I find it to be overpriced for what it is but I can look past that. However, what I can't look past is their menu. I find it very hard to read since it's 50% desserts and 45% combos. Most of their sandwiches/burgers are not listed separately so you have to guess how much they will cost.

Then if you check your receipt, you'll notice that they charge extra for cheese. There is no mention of this on the menu and every picture shows a cheese. 

If you want to charge extra for cheese then just put that on the menu or train the staff to tell you that it's extra.

During this specific visit (Sunday around noon), the wait for food was really long. And they were not busy so it didn't make much sense.

Overall, I don't see myself eating here very often.

First time eating here. I was told it was a little pricey but figured that came with a reason so decided to give it a shot. Ordered a regular combo and drink, then a small milkshake. Fries are shoestring if you're into those. The small milkshake was $3.xx and was slightly larger than a kids frosty from Wendy's. (Total was around $11) The burger was extremely salty, torn apart and so thin you could see through it in parts and it was burnt. The bun was good, though. I imagine I had a bad experience that (hopefully) isn't regular there..but I likely won't be back anytime soon. The small shake was really good,by the way!

I went here last night for dinner and got the original double with cheese, fries, and some fry sauce. I also got a nutter butter ice cream sandwich. I really 
enjoyed my burger and fries. I am a picky eater so I was very pleased when my plain cheeseburger came out correctly. I love how the fries are small and skinny, but wasn't the biggest fan of the fry sauce. I have a huge sweet tooth, and the nutter butter ice cream sandwich did not disappoint; only 99 cents with my combo! The overall cleanliness of the place was pretty clean, although there were a few dirty tables. I really liked how the booths had pictures of Freddy and what he was doing. That was pretty cool. I will definitely be back!

It's like Freddy's is the cousin of Steak n' Shake. The food is tasty, the custard is divine, and the kitschy 50's diner vibe decor is a nice touch. One huge bonus: they have a veggie burger that ranks pretty high on the taste-o-meter and you can substitute it onto any of the specialty burgers. 

The fries are the skinny ones, so you can trick (lie to) yourself into thinking you aren't eating as many as you are despite the shovel method you use. Plus, chances are you are slathering them up with the amazing mystery sauce (I think it is ketchup, sriracha, mayo, and a touch of cocaine-but no one's talking) as plow through a pile of crispy fried awesome. On my latest visit, I got the veggie burger with the jalapenos, cheese, and bbq sauce- YUM! 

Then there's the custard. The PBC and B sundae was...ahh....maze....ing. Real banana bits, real peanut butter cup crumbles, and that custard that is neither too sweet nor too rich. It is the baby bear of sundaes: just right. Go, even if it is just for the custard. 

Pro tip: The mystery sauce is for the fries. NOT the sundae. Don't be a rookie.

I'm losing faith / desire in Freddy's.
Placed drive-thru order for triple Cali burger, + bacon & O-rings.
Only 2 cars ahead of me.  Parking lot 4/5 EMPTY.
The 1st car @ window took 10 minutes!!  Only one drink / meal was bought.
The car directly in front of me took about 3.5 minutes at the window.
My food came in just under 3 minutes.

So EASILY:16 minutes wait, on a nearly EMPTY restaurant. 
The "theory" behind Freddy's unique technique of pounding thin & tenderizing the beef patties, is so THEY "cook quicker", right??

My TRIPLE burger had LESS "crispy like bacon BEEF" on it, than a Wendy's Double burger.
Paid almost $8 for that burger, it was light as air!! 
Nice THICK full slice of ONION, but the onion slice was actually THICKER than all 3 beef patties TOGETHER.
$.80 cents for maybe 1 strip of bacon that was broken into 2 pieces, so it FIT on the bun,
Pound of bacon is like $4-5 dollars in the store, there's like 12 or 15 strips in there.

Food quality was OK, little bit of the burps last night, but I had to warm up some soup to get "full" after this burger left me hungry.

I don't know what's happening behind the counter, maybe the staff are scrounging the food-portions, for themselves???
The "value" for the price is in the gutter.  The wait-times are tortuous!
And the uniqueness of the skinny French fries is offset by the extra grease and half of them falling all over.
You  should OFFER regular thickness fries. 
NOT sure if I'll be back

Chowin down at the Winton Road "Freddie's" with my wife and Dad.  Great place, quick service (with a smile) and excellent Steakburgers.  I highly recommend the patty-melt and my wife agrees that the chili is awesome   We really like the onion rings. Decent price!

And don't forget to save room for frozen custard (awesome sundaes BTW).

Recommended highly

Not happy at all!  A total waste of my hard earn money.  Burgers are thin a dry and I got the double.  The pickles are a lot thicker. I was so hoping that this burger was going to be tasty.  Taste like I was eating hamburgers chips on a bun.  Yes, it was that crunchy.  Looks like I'll be sticking with Steak and Shakes.  If I hadn't gotten my sandwich to go, I would have sure return its.   But it's not worth the drive to return it.  

I was so surprised because this places is always so crowded, I'm assuming it's because of the ice cream.
It was pretty decent. Our vegetarian guests liked the veggie burger. We ALL loved the cheese curds.

Decent chain steak burger food. The steak burgers are nice and thin. The shoestring fries are really crispy. The vanilla custard was sweet and creamy, yet thick. The parking lot was filled to capacity with cars and is rather compact, as they have been open less than a week. The customer service met expectations. There was a long line to order food, but the line moved quickly. The only draw back is that there is no waiter or waitress type of service. You order at the counter and are given a receipt with a number. Once your number is called, you take your own food to the table.
I did as the business suggested and posted a survey/complaint on the company's website and have not gotten any kind of response. Extremely disappointing and speaks on why the restaurant is failing.

I don't understand how the management of this restaurant could not anticipate a crowd on a Friday night!  Although no-one was in line when we got here we still waited 5 minutes to place our order & much longer to receive it. I felt bad for the guy working behind the counter. He looked overwhelmed & stressed out. 
Once I got my burger it was good, but missing half the toppings I ordered. By this time the line was so long I just couldn't face getting back in line. 
All the food was good especially the frozen custard but so frustrating!  I'm not sure it's worth the hassle.

I like Freddy's. But I would be shocked if I ever got through the drive Thur with the item I ordered.  Out of a dozen times I think once I got what I ordered.  Unless I unwrap the sandwich holding up the drive Thur I would check my order before leaving.  No mustard means no mustard

Sad to say that my two follow up visits haven't been too successful. Lots of problems getting the order right. Both times were at the drive thru, both times I was told someone is being trained. Today's visit ended with me asking for a refund and I left with no dinner. What I witnessed was the trainer not watching the trainee at all and when I questioned my order the trainer couldn't help me. It was a common sense issue to me.They handed me a bag that clearly didn't have $10.48 worth of food in it. And when I asked what was in the bag they didn't know.
I'm out!
The ice cream could  be bought at McDonald's for cheaper.  I tired the  funnel cake ice cream. The funnel cake was doughy if you like that. Personally I prefer the crunchy texture.

I've been here a few times and the drive thru is always so slow. Not them taking the order but actually receiving the food. I was the only car in the drive thru line and waited 5 mins at the window to receive my food. He gave me my concrete as soon as I paid but my order, which was a single steakburger California style with fries. He asked if I wanted sauce when I paid and I asked for fry sauce which he said he'll go and get but by the time I got my food he had forgot to give me the sauce so I requested it again. He did not advise why I waited and I watched him and someone else through the window serve different people on inside of the restaurant. Once he gave me my food he did apologize for the wait. The food there is okay, nothing spectacular. It was a $2 upcharge for a mini peanut butter crunch (snickers) concrete instead of a drink. 
My favorite thing there is actually their grilled chicken sandwich and I add Freddy sauce to it but sometimes they overcook the chicken and it ruins the whole meal which is why I don't go here as much as I would like to since I don't want to pay for overcooked food and I always get it to go so I don't find out until I'm at home that it is overcooked.

Slowest. Drive-thru. Ever.

A previous reviewer indicated the same thing which was responded to by "we make everything fresh". Panera does too and they are much faster in the drive-thru. I have waited 10 minutes for custard only. You have an efficiency problem, not a cooking method excuse. 

Second star only because the custard is awesome.
Chicago dogs and delicious sundaes.  PBC and B was particularly delicious.  Love the 50's style shake shack.  Restaurant is clean and new.

The thinnest dryest burger I have ever had....  Thoroughly unenjoyable, Steak n'Shake is miles better and that's not that great.  Also annoying ate two separate lines for food and custard, so if you order a shake, you might get it alot earlier than your food, which happened to me... Oh and a custard joint that has only vanilla and chocolate?!?  My regular chocolate shake was acceptable, but nothing to be overjoyed about. 

The fries are those mini ones, which to me are totally annoying.  You do however get alot of them... But they certainly are not 5 Guys fries...  It cost me $10.15 for the original "double" burger - which is still thinner than most singles anywhere else - fries and a regular shake. 

This place won't be on Guy Fieri's hitlist, and frankly - I hate to say it - McDonald's is tastier.... And cheaper.

Hey, it's not Michelin Star dining, but it's very good fast food. The patty melt is excellent and their onion rings are a cut above many I've experienced. The Chicago Dog is also very good, though maybe not quite as outstanding as the best I've had in Chicagoland. The frozen custard is above reproach. It is rich, thick and silky with excellent flavor. The Turtle Sundae is totally worth the calorie hit.  The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is that the service can be a little uneven. It seems like they have a lot of turnover there because I never see the same person behind the counter twice.  As a result,  they seem to always be training new folks which hurts consistency a bit, but that's a minor rub.

first stop on the burger passport for me. have driven by this location dozens of times. never wanted to stop because friends who have eaten there said it's just another steak and shake. I must admit it is pretty close. but what better way to goad me into your establishment but offer me a burger for $5. I ordered the jalapeño pepper jack 
steakburger. The burger had just the right amount of heat although I am not a fan of onion rings on a burger so those were immediately picked off.

Better than Steak and Shake.  I went through drive through only, so I'm just judging the food quality.  Service at the window was efficient and friendly.  The burger was just about perfect, grilled with a crust, but juicy.
I tried the fried pickles, good, but not the best I've had.

Freddy's is like Steak and Shake but with food that is not as good and service that is better.  They tout their Freddy's Sauce which is basically thousand island dressing.  Their prices are a bit steep for what you are getting.  Would I go back?  Out of everybody I polled, we all agreed next time we would rather go to the Taco Bell across the street.

Food is good good service and the food was amazing the only problem was the wait witch took 20 minutes in the drive threw window but besides that I definitely recommend this resturant and there frozen custard is amazing

Service was great. Food was good and was definitely fresh and cooked to order. My only disappointment was the packaging for carry out . Containers were covered in grease and I had a grease soaked bag before I could make it home.

OMG...... stopped by Freddy's for a concrete and saw a sign for Pumpkin Pie Concrete. This was the best pumpkin ice cream I have ever had. I would rate this a 10 plus... if you like pumpkin this is a must have....

This place is awesome. The burgers are good. Hot dogs are excellent. Chili and fries outstanding. The custard was probably the best i ever had. Workers are nice and service rocks the only thing wrong is it is always busy but come on its awesome lol  I will be back!!!!

When this place doesn't mess up your order it's pretty great, which is about 1/5 visits. Sometimes the people at the drive thru window forget they're at work or something, the girl stared at me for five minutes before I told her I had money for her food. Good food when they're on point. Seems like nobody working there is over 15 either.

Enjoyed the burgers, hot dogs and fries.  The custard was rich and creamy.  But they were awfully stingy on the toppings and mix-ins in our sundaes and concretes.  We could hardly find the cookie dough in the concretes or the sauce on the sundae, even at the bottom.  Hoping this was just part of them being crazy busy at 6pm on a Sunday.

The burger had a weird taste. I can't put my finger on it. The fries were ok. The burger left a weird after taste in my mouth. Colorful restaurant, but they will shut down in less than 2 years.  I would not go back for a free meal.

First time going through this drive-through I left with two car still in front of me after waiting for 21 minutes. The second time I went to the drive-through waited 13 minutes before actually getting my food. I had someone bring me a Freddys once and the only reason it's getting a second star is because their fried pickles were pretty good. Wish they would be more efficient with their drive-through time. If you have nothing better to do and want to hang out in a drive-through for forever come here.

Totally reminds me of Steak and Shake. Personally I think the burgers are better though. The service is definitely better. I've been craving it since I've had it and definitely want to go back soon! Glad they are building one in Colerain also. However, if you go to steak and shake for the shakes then keep doing that.

First visit. Not going back. Drive thru way toooo slow for such a short line. Got to window and apparently interupted some good laughs amongst the team. Eventually mumbled something that sounded like the total. Staff apparently skipped their language arts classes in elementary school. And ... screwed up the order. What a great first visit.

This place is just average. We waited over 15 minutes for our food. They said the heat also wasn't on and it was 40 degrees out so that made the whole experience less than pleasant. When the food finally came I ordered pickle chips and I received an extremely small portion considering the amount of fries they give out and the price. The aisle way to get your food, drinks, etc. was extremely tight and backed up. Overall, it is a very overpriced average fast food chain.

Great spot for some quick soft serve and good place to watch the neighborhood go by. Lots of picnic tables, benches, and grass to enjoy your ice cream. Some in the shade, some not.

They don't only have soft serve... there's flurries, sundaes, and a bunch of other frozen goodies. But I opted for the flavor of the week soft serve which was orange. The large cone was only $3 and it was plenty. I was tempted to get the pint of blueberry soft serve for $3.75 and am kicking myself for not!

Reasonable prices, good ice cream, great location for the community in Walnut Hills. 

Check their Facebook page for their flavor of the week. Their speciality is the green man twist which is vanilla/chocolate ice cream on a cone with green sprinkles, chocolate top and edible eyes and mouth. The ice cream is nice and thick. Portion sizes go well with the reasonable prices. Great customer service. 
Green man twist is closed on Tuesdays.

Green Man Twist is nice little stop for soft serve ice cream in Walnut Hills neighborhood, right of McMillan - you can't miss the trailer its bright green & blue, but if you're driving too fast, could pass it right up, just turn on the side street, park and walk up to the trailer. 
They have your standard vanilla, chocolate, twist plus a special flavor which changes, it was strawberry during my visit. I'm a sucker for just good old chocolate, so that was my selection a small chocolate twist in a cake cone.
Others in line before me ordered sundaes, soft serve in cup and an icee.
The team was very friendly & took care of several orders in minutes.
Stop by the next time you're in the area for a delicious ice cold treat!

The only thing I can say about green man twist is that we LOVE it! Thanks for bringing affordable and delicious summer treats to the neighborhood and helping to turn green man park into our go to place when we want to relax and enjoy some ice cream!

Looking for some ice cream on a hot day, we headed over to Green Man Twist.  It is a cute food truck in a small park.  We ordered 4 items.  Two of them had the wrong topping, and one had a very long hair in the ice cream.  The fourth item was fine.  Everything was fixed and taken care of, but the ice cream was ultimately not too great.  We will look for a different spot the next time we are in the area.

This is the family and I second summer enjoying this ice cream truck (well it's more than an ice cream truck). I'm in the Walnut Hills area and it's not a lot of areas to get ice cream (besides UDF). The customer service is great, the ice cream and other treats are delicious and I'm a customer forever!

I love everything about Green Man Twist!

The location is perfect, the staff is friendly, and the ice cream is so yummy! It's so nice to see a place like this in Walnut Hills and I am loving the park-like setting they have created. Can't wait to return!
Great ice cream! The Key Lime Pie Sundae was amazing! It's a great ice cream place and a great business!

This place was awesome. Great price, and the chocolate sprinkles are actually CHOCOLATEY, and not just sugary! The ice cream is delicious and thicker than the usual creamy whip. They also had a blueberry (King's Island?) flavor too that they let me try, however I went with the traditional chocolate + vanialla twist and it was amazing. 

It's located in a cute, newly renovated park right across from Fireside Pizza. Go grab some dinner over there, and stop at Green Man for dessert!

Green Man Twist is such a fun idea! It's so nice to bring people to this park and share in some walnut hill's history. We were brought here by the Give Back Cincinnati scavenger hunt, and while we didn't need to get an ice cream, we couldn't resist. 

I got a twist cone, but I like their other options, including a cone with green sprinkles and a little face, the green man cone. They are also hosting photography they'll put on facebook for you, with fun props,  and a coloring table for kids. I look forward to coming back to check it out more.
Awesome. Highly recommend cookie dough flurries. Oreo is also always a good choice. Classic soft serve in a cute little Walnut Hills park. What isn't perfect about this?
Amazing ice cream and great people!   A bastion from the old neighborhood that will serve the new neighborhood as well!

I don't have incredibly high expectations with soft serve places but this one is insanely good. They use really high quality soft serve, they always have rotating flavors and specials and the staff are AMAZING. Love GMT, and am excited that's it's finally summer!

What's not to love about soft serve ice cream? Green Man Twist serves some of the best I've ever had, and the staff are so friendly and welcoming. They feature a rotating flavor of the month as well as some snacks and hot dogs too. They're also located in a park, so there's plenty of space to hang out and enjoy your treats. Local ice cream shops are in short supply - and this one is doing Walnut Hills proud!
I love Green Man Twist! Such a friendly and welcoming place to bring friends and meet new ones in a great community feel. The ice cream is delicious and definitely worth checking out!
Had pizza at Fireside with family and noticed this soft serve across the street. This little place serves up a heap of deliciousness! Highly recommend.

Delicious reasonably priced soft serve! The vanilla soft serve was amazing ! The staff was super friendly and the owner was working hard to keep the area clean and free of trash. The menu includes all of the basics and also some fun new options including the green man cone. We will definitely be coming back.

It's such a cute little spot for some soft serve ice cream! Their prices are reasonable priced. A nice little date spot for a couple or for a smaller family. The seating is a little limited but that's okay considering the atmosphere that they have. Good music and good ice cream, can't beat that!

LOVE THIS PLACE!! Green Man Twist is intentional about bringing the community together through their friendly staff and delicious soft serve treats. 

The soft serve is thick, creamy and seriously addictive! The prices are very reasonable and they even offer a $1 cone. I've been several to new now and my go-to is the strawberry-cookies n cream milkshake. Try it!
The perfect ending to my favorite pizza in the city! Fireside doesn't do dessert so this is amazeballs

Green Man Twist is my go-to for soft serve ice cream! I love the owners and what they are doing to build into the neighborhood of Walnut Hills, plus the treats are super delicious! Go to Fireside Pizza across the street and do dessert at Green Man Twist for the perfect date night. Highly recommend.

May have just found another jewel in Norwood's crown, to rest alongside Shake It Records!

I hadn't been to Norwood much during the last several months (once for Record Store Day a while back & maybe another place to grab a couple slices of pizza), but today felt disgustingly hot & I had a goal after leaving the Kenwood Towne Centre to not only sample some of the food items here, but to bring back a quart of delicious Dole Whip.  If I can't be at Disneyland, I might as well eat like I'm there...

Anyway, it opens at noon on Saturdays, & arriving at 11:30, I parked in their lot behind the ice cream stand. When they opened, I took a glance at the menu & ordered a steak burger, chips, & a Pepsi & it came to a very reasonable $5.  

The woman who took my order was very friendly, provided a lot of information, & offered me extra napkins, probably assuming (correctly) that I'm a bit of a slob.  Very much appreciated.

The steak burger was very good, surprisingly so.  

After finishing it & the rest of my lunch at one of the pair of picnic tables that are available in addition to a handful of benches, I went back for dessert.  I saw that they had black cherry (a favorite flavor of mine), so I asked for a cone of that only to be informed that the black cherry is actually a sort of flavor "blast" that's added to their vanilla soft serve.  What sorcery is this?  They also have blueberry cones that are straight up blue, but I'll save that for when I visit King's Island.

It too was excellent, though I have to learn to eat before driving. Or at least peal the paper off the cone before driving, because doing so while driving is dangerous & difficult.  

As for the Dole Whip? I was hoping for pineapple, the old standby, as I'd planned to make a Dole Whip Float to celebrate my upcoming birthday, but they only had lemon or lime. I guess I'll pay attention to their social media & hope that pineapple, or maybe even raspberry, makes an appearance later this summer.

Good stuff!
Cash only! Great local spot- great ice cream and snacks available- if you buy something you can get a little ice cream cone for your dog!

Sometimes we walk here to get ice cream. I was surprised that they have vegan/gluten free options. I usually get pineapple Dole Whip in a cup. The mango is really good, too. My boyfriend loves the blueberry ice cream(not vegan or gf) and always regrets it if he gets something else. People are pretty good about social distancing and wearing masks here, too. Dogs are welcome, too.

After walking a few trails at Ault Park, we were looking for a cool snack and the Creamy Whip hit the spot. The staff member was wearing a mask (thank you!) and was very friendly. My husband and son both got a blueberry vanilla swirl, and they were very yummy and well priced. 

There was no wait and the parking lot was convenient, just make sure you bring cash. We had to go to an ATM around the corner because we usually our credit cards.

No frills soft serve spot in Norwood. They take cash only and they have a lot of options. I expected only a few flavors but it was almost like going to The Cheesecake Factory and flipping through their menu-- many combinations of flavors! You can turn it into a sundae with the different toppings, types of cones (bowl, waffle, sugar). 

There is parking behind with about half dozen spots and some picnic tables and benches outside to sit if you want to eat there. Service is friendly and there are dairy free options if you're interested. They even serve the Dole Fruit Whips that I love when visiting Hawaii... except here you don't need to take an 8 hour flight! 

They're open late and the service is friendly! I enjoyed this a lot more than the self serve froyo shops that are around/used to be around.

Summertime haven.  I love visiting the Norwood Creamy Whip after a night at the pool.  Their blueberry soft serve is as good as Kings Island, and definitely brings childhood back.  I just wish they had a longer season!

Norwood's biggest hidden gem! I love local creamy whips but this one is my favorite. They have food, ice cream AND the ice cream that ice cream trucks sell.  The soft serve is very creamy and delicious!

Free cone for your pup :)

Parking is limited.
BRING CASH- no cards.

Norwood has a good ice cream place. It's located in the middle of downtown. This ice cream place like so many others is cash only. It also has a regular food menu. The parking is tough in summer. 

I had the bubblegum slushie. It's about $2 for a medium. This is actually pretty large, a good value. It's just crushed ice and syrup, but it's good on a hot day. Just know that it's cash only. It seems most of these independent ice cream places are. That's the only bad thing about here. 

I would say this is one of the cheapest places to get food in Norwood. It's still best to avoid the greasy fried items and stick to the ice cream. The tables in front offer a good view.

We went there tonight. It's all boarded up! No icecream for us. 

Too bad. We were really wanting ice cream.

Came here on Memorial Day for an end of the day treat - this was my first Creamy Whip Experience as I am not originally from the area and I was SUPER excited as I am not a fan of hard serve ice ream - and wow was this soft serve great! 

Even though all the seating outside was taken when we arrived, there was no line to order which was great. Once we did order we got our ice cream SO FAST - we hadn't even finished paying by the time they came out! Amazing service. 
NOTE: All reviews all correct - this is CASH ONLY. 

I ordered a small chocolate/vanilla twist with chocolate sprinkles on a cake cone and my boyfriend a small blueberry/vanilla twist on a cake cone. The smalls were decent sizes - I originally asked the difference between small and medium and note - the medium comes on a larger cake cone and is also taller than a small - so a somewhat significant difference in height/width. 

In total it was $5.75 for the two cones. 
Both were delicious and we ate them extremely fast - actually leaving us for wanting more! 

Ratings on the Morgan Scale:
Overall Experience: 9/10
Food Price: 8/10
Food Experience: 9/10

The Norwood creamy whip is a summer favorite. They only have teenagers working their which is nice for the kids in the area looking for summer jobs. The ice cream is good and so is the food. They have also added more seating which is nicer than sitting in your car. Very nice place to grab a summer treat.

Cash only. Many choices. Friendly staff. Ample and sturdy seating (though most is exposed to the elements - sun, rain, etc). Not a ton of parking but enough. Solid creamy whip experience. 

They recently posted new menus so the faded pics of your favs from the 80s have been updated... it's up to you to decide if this is a good thing or not!

My FAVORITE addition has been the blueberry ice cream. YUM. Now I don't have to pay King's Island admission to get some

NORWOOD STAPLE. Hands down, the best ice creamery in Norwood, Ohio! Specializing in soft-serve, Norwood Delite Creamy Whip is a small, roadside ice cream mom & pop shop that reminds you of the go-to hangout after classes or work. The soft serve is creamy and the perfect quality of sweetness for your classic flavors of chocolate and vanilla (with some promotional/seasonal flavors here and there). They have a lot to offer besides soft serve such as sundaes, traditional ice cream and popsicle selections, and even non-sweet items like burgers and fries. All of which are super cheap and what'd you expect from this kind of establishment but with the added benefit of exceptional quality. I'd come here everyday but the thing is I'm not a big soft-serve guy nor would it be in my best interest health-wise. However, it's the perfect spot to hangout and eat some delicious cold serve.

My husband and I wanted to try a creamy whip we hadn't been to yet and found this place via the handy Yelp app. 

Your standard walk up window creamy whip with tables to sit at outside around back. They take cash only and do not offer an ATM. There is a gas station near by that has one if needed.

I ordered the strawberry shortcake and it was huge! It had plenty of good vanilla soft serve over an angle food cake round with plenty strawberry topping and whipped cream. It could have fed two, but I only shared a couple of bites with my husband.

This is a great neighborhood stop on a warm day.
Softest soft serve there is. Magical place that is absolutely out go to ice cream spot. Super friendly staff. Heads up, it is cash only though.

Creamy whip is a term I never heard growing up. To me it was just soft serve ice cream. Whatever you call it, it's the stuff of childhood, completely unnatural and processed, but so, so satisfying. When you get a hankering for a cone or a sundae, nothing else will do.

We picked a dark and stormy night to get ours, but it still hit the spot. A peanut butter dipped cone for her, a waffle cone cup for me, and even though we had to eat it fast before the rain hit, we left happy.

This week I was in the area and made my first visit to the Norwood Delite Creamy Whip and it didn't disappoint. The ice cream was a thick soft serve which was pretty good and a really reasonable price($2.75 w/ sprinkles). They also offered lots of ice cream treats you would find on a neighborhood ice cream truck. Good experience and a reminder they only take cash ("straight cash homie"- Randy Moss). I would visit again if in the area.
Doesn't look great from the outside, sort of hidden on a busy street, but the soft-serve was great, and the service was friendly, and price was fair!

They do not accept cards, cash only.

The parking lot is very cramped.

The people working seemed friendly.

Didn't actually get any ice cream, because we didn't have cash on us. There are many easy ways to accept cards like Square, even if there is a surcharge for using cards, at least find a way to accept them lol

Extremely glad I ran across this one day and finally saw that it is open for the season! I've only been once so far, but I plan to go so many more times. I got a Vanilla cone with an orange burst and it was perfection. They have so many options-sundaes, cones, dips, popsicles, milkshakes and malts! As well as snack foods like hot dogs and chips. It is cash only so have some on you and there were two windows to help with speeding up the ordering process. You have to go!

What a hidden gem!! Norwood Delite creamy has a delicious vanilla soft serve and a bunch of other unique flavors to choose from. From what I've tried so far their blueberry and butterscotch are delicious. Parking is kind of limited, especially during peak hours. The prices are fair for what you get. For a large waffle cone with soft serve vanilla and sprinkles I spent $3.75. FYI this creamery is CASH ONLY!! Overall, this is such a great find. I wish it wasn't a seasonal ice cream shop because I would go all year round if I could. Your pup will love this place too... they give you a free doggie cone with any purchase!!

There are tons of these style ice cream stands back in Michigan where I grew up. During the 3.5 years I was greatly disappointed at the lack of any summer ice cream stand. You can imagine the excitement I had the day I came across this place! Everything is reasonably priced and so yummy! The only catch is making sure you bring cash!

This is a cute quaint little shop in Norwood. Went on a weeknight and they were busy, but very friendly and efficient. 

I came here craving a creamy chocolate soft serve cone. However the chocolate ice cream tasted more like a fudgecicle and was icey rather than creamy in consistency. 
So not my personal taste so I doubt I'll be back. 

This place is very reasonably priced with large portions. I don't remember what size I ordered but it was just over $2. 

Loved the vintage feel of this place but the flavor of the ice cream just wasn't what I prefer.

This place is so good! They have lots of options for topping your delicious soft serve, but also different ice cream bars and I think even snow cones. The medium sized cone seemed to be just the right size and is less than $3. They have a decent amount of outdoor seating and there's always cute dogs around. It's hard not to stop here every time I drive by.
The krunch kote on zebra &&& their blue ice cream is amazing!!! Tastes just like kings island!

We are always trying new adventures of places we have never been ! So we decided to go try it. We both got the Dream Cone it was $4.00  and looked Scrumptious it was like art work! 

However the Chocolate Ice cream had a really weird taste, I don't really know how to describe it but I would say it had sorta  a cherry flavor to it!

I travel all over Cincinnati for my job. I love the spring and summer because it means the wonderful neighborhood dairy bars are open. Norwood Delite is one of my favorites. The vanilla ice cream is very creamy and has a great flavor. They get bonus points for having my favorite topping, crunch coat. Alway friendly service and reasonable prices.

Nothing special at all, besides that it has a cool location. Ice cream basic don't know what all the fuss about. My girls chocolate covered vanilla ice cream fell apart and was nothing out of the ordinary

I love a good creamy whip! I was on the hunt for some good soft ice cream in my new hood, and discovered that this was our closest one. We stopped by on our way home from dinner a few weeks ago.

This is a CASH ONLY establishment, so we had to walk to the nearest UDF and get some cash out of an ATM. Kind of an inconvenience in this day in age, especially when we waited in line and then had to return to the back of the line once we got our cash. It wasn't super busy on this Thursday night, so we did it.

I like my ice cream simple, so I ordered a small chocolate cone. I was expecting a creamy chocolate that comes out a light brown color. I got something that was more along the consistency of a fudge pop. It was dark brown and kind of an icy consistency. Definitely not what I was expecting and was a major disappointment for me.

My husband ordered a large vanilla cone with sprinkles. They were out of sprinkles, so the employee there talked him into a sort of cereal type sprinkle dip. I'm not sure what it was called. He said it was good but a little different. He was also a little disappointed in the consistency of his ice cream - more icy than creamy.

With "Creamy Whip" in the title we were just expecting a different kind of ice cream. We might be a little picky, but we probably won't be back. Just not what we had in mind and not our favorite kind of soft-serve.

Perfect summer ice cream spot! My only complaint is that their season isn't longer- they close in Sept 1 :(. It's exactly what you'd expect of a whippy dip. I also grew up with Tucker's in Mason and never realized how lucky we were! There are towns without whippy dips?... Whaaaaat! They make the perfect twist dipped in chocolate and they have doggie cones so my whole house enjoys stopping by. 

They are CASH ONLY!

This ice cream shop has been there since I was a little kid and I am happy it is still around.  There is a decent variety of things to try out and it can be hard deciding what to get but I usually always end up getting the cyclone.  Definitely a place to check out if you are in the area.

Such a wonderful creamy whip! It's very small and there's not a whole lot of parking, but plenty of street parking nearby. They have quite a large menu so it was impossible for me to decide. I asked the guy working what the most popular item was. It was a delicious brownie sundae with a brownie that was made in house. Sooo yummy and they give you a ton of ice cream in your bowl! This is a lovely neighborhood spot and I'd love to come back.

If you've never had a red dip ice cream cone, are you really even living? Every summer I search the tri-state for the best red dip cones, and this place never disappoints. Centrally located in Norwood with a nice private parking area, not to mention an always delicious, always creamy, ice cream delight. Just a heads up, this is shop is cash only, but the prices are fair, and you really can't put a price on a childhood favorite.
We love this place! They have a great variety and the prices are very reasonable! We get sad when they close for the winter!

This is a really neat little place. We wanted to get ice cream at a new spot and this is an excellent soft serve ice cream spot.  I ended up getting a small vanilla ice cream cone and the serving is more than generous.  I can't imagine the size of the medium and large cones.  Also out of nowhere I decided to get sprinkles which the don't skimp on dishing them out to cover the cone.  All and all this is a great alternative to Graeters and other bigger Cincy options and very descent pricing.
Nice no-nonsense soft serve ice cream parlor. What they do differently is that they have these flavor mix ins for the soft serve such as green apple. It is basically soft serve swirled with a flavor.

Your typical home-town creamy whip: tacky, cheap, tasty, and nothing spectacular... but on those hot summer days, nothing can beat it!  Don't expect the best ice cream of your life, but if you're looking for a classic twist cone with sprinkles, look no farther.  Their cones (vanilla, chocolate, blueberry, or twist) start at $2.50 for a small, and portions are generous. Toppings are a little extra, but it's hard to pass up their "crunch coat" which is a mysterious mixture of sprinkles, cone pieces, and other stuff. My favorite is a Glacier, which comes with a huge swirl of ice cream, covered in a slushy.  Other selections include sundaes, blizzards, milkshakes, and a few food items.
Biggest complaint? They close too early in the year!  They open in early April, when it is often still frosty at times in Cincinnati, but close around Labor Day, leaving several more 75+ degree September/October days in Norwood without a Creamy Whip.

This place is adorable and everything you need for your sweet tooth craving. I want to say they only take cash, but I vaguely remember one time I thought I may not have had cash where they told me to just bring some back when I get it. I found it the cash and tipped them extra for saying such a sweet thing. Please support this business.

One of the many ice cream stands around town. Nothing special. The teenager working the entire place, sun damaged handwritten signs, picnic tables outside (actually a lot of seating is outside), and cheap ways to spruce up a soft serve (dips, toppings, or making it a shake). Yet, I do love these places 'cause it takes me back to simpler times; when a single ice cream cone can brighten up your day.

Taking a star away because no outside fountain (to wash hands, etc.), lack of dips/toppings (yes, there are more at others), and they were out of ice cream sandwiches :'(

This is by far one of the best places I've been to in Cincinnati. Not just for ice cream or desserts, but overall. I got a turtle sundae and a pretzel with cheese. Given the low prices, I expected pretty average or small portions. However the sundae was huge - I couldn't even finish it on my own. And the pretzel was pretty sizeable too, filling me up nicely before dinner. I'd definitely recommend this place!
Great, friendly service and delicious ice cream. We had a very nice person behind the window and the other customers were very pleasant. We will definitely go back soon.

Man, I wish we had one of these in Newport. This place takes me back to my childhood. I was hanging out with a friend who lives down the street and just happened to mention that I would kill for a chocolate, vanilla twist in a cup cone. Little did I know that my wish would be granted in less than 10 minutes.

If you didn't know it was there, you might pass the building a hundred time before you even realized what it was. But there is no way you can't appreciate a little place like this.They have everything you'd expect an old school ice cream joint to have--all those ridiculous cartoon character popsicles that turn your kid's lips unnatural colors, ice cream sandwiches, and then anything you can possible make with soft serve. I got a little greedy and bought the large soft serve in a cone. I wanted to barf later because no one needs that much ice cream, but I enjoyed every second I spent snarfing it down. 

Apparently the joint literally gets boarded up in the winter (because it's all outdoor seating and who really wants ice cream in the winter anyway?), but this is definitely a place to hit up in the summer.

I love this place! It's so close to my house, which is perfect for a evening walk with my pup! It's very old school, takes me back to simple time. The staff is always friendly and always offer a pup ice cream for Hank :) 
You can never go wrong with soft serve ice cream! They also offer a ton of novelty ice cream treats as well. 
Perfect for summer nights!

Great little neighborhood soft serve ice cream shop in Norwood and nothing like an ice cold soft serve chocolate dipped cone on a summer night.
Portions are generous as the previous review indicated, medium dipped cone is $2.50 and just hits the spot.

Love this place! I grew up in Mason with Tucker's Whippy Dip right down the street my entire life, so having a creamy whip so close to where I live is great in the summer! Everyone here is always friendly, the ice cream and other items are inexpensive, and they even have little doggie cones for free when my dog comes with me (I like to walk here with him). This place is definitely a favorite.

This instantly transported me back to my childhood.  I haven't had a soft serve cone dipped in chocolate since I was like 10, and I am so glad this place is close to my house.  The GF and I stopped in on a Saturday afternoon to get a little ice cream before we went home.  We have been driving by it for months now, always talking about wanting to stop some time.  We finally did, and it was amazing.  We both ordered soft serve, one with the chocolate dip, and the other just sprinkles.  They were amazing, and for $2.50 each, you cant beat it.  Is the ice cream as good as Graeter's? Hell no, but its way cheaper, still delicious, and brings back great memories. I will definitely be back.

Love the chocolate soft serve. A small size is a good portion and they only accept cash. $2.50 for good chocolate soft serve is a deal. I have come back many times. Sometimes there isn't enough parking, but there are normally enough places to sit down and enjoy your soft serve. It's very creamy and delicious, perfect for a summer evening.

Great local ice cream shop.  All the ice cream is soft serve with toppings you got when you were a kid.  Lots of sprinkles, chocolate dip, etc.  The ice cream is good and its a fun nostalgic thing to do with the kids.  Plus, it's very inexpensive.  Makes for a great destination on warm summer afternoons/evenings.  It is cash-only.

I have to start by saying desserts are my absolute favorite food and ice cream even being at the top of my dessert favorites. That being said, Creamy Whip is one of the best soft serve ice creams I have ever had. Great prices for huge servings of great ice cream. Wide menu offering ice cream and food. Cash only

My go to! I live just a couple of minutes from this little joint. It has all the original offerings an old school ice cream shop should have. I always stick with a chocolate shake which is as good if not better than UDF (whose flagship is in Norwood, stiff competition, but they hold their own). They have a walk up window, the line can get long sometimes in the summer but it's fun and I've never waited longer than 5 minutes. Parking is limited so if you live nearby it makes for a nice little walk.

Who doesn't love some good old fashioned soft serve ice cream?! This place is great! Small, family owned, and very simple location. They only accept cash wich isn't a big deal, you just need to make sure to have some on you before you go. They have plenty of seating and are quick to open up another line if they see it is needed! My favorite summer treat spot!
Great little neighborhood soft serve spot.  They have all the summer favorites, and some food.  Note that they are cash only!  There are picnic tables to sit on and enjoy the hot weather too.
So excited to find this place! Perfect summer stop on a hot day to get your ice cream fix!

This place takes me back to being a kid after basketball games with my dad. It's a small, walk-up window. It's quite cheap, they give you a ton of soft serve, and it's good soft serve at that! It's only open during the warmer months, though. They have solid variety of flavors and mix-ins.
Cash only. Love this place. Reminds me of my favorite place back in my hometown. Friendly staff.
Love this place! I grew up in the neighborhood and have been eating ice cream from here for years. I love soft serve! This place is cash only, so be prepared!

Four stars only because we narrowly missed Gwen Steffani and Blake Shelton here on our last visit! No really - it's probably the best soft serve in the city, save maybe the one in Mt. Washington.  I wish it was truly frozen custard, not soft serve, but that's just because I'm from Cleveland!  Reasonably priced.  I think they only take cash.
This place is awesome! Neighborhood ice cream shop that has the best Cyclones! Cash only, family owned and run!
Fantastic soft serve. Friendly staff. Dog friendly. Wish they took credit/debit cards.

First it is run by a bunch of teen girls who don't seem to know what they are doing.  Husband asked for a strawberry and banana cyclone. They had no clue how to make one abdominal offered him a Reese cup one.  Thethen I found a long blonde hair in mine.  Ewwwwwww

I've been coming here since I was a little girl and nothing about the place has changed. It has so much charm! It's also very cheap but only accepts cash. They will also give you puppy comes for your dogs with any purchase. The staff is also always very polite and friendly.

Being new to Cincinnati, I'd never heard of a creamy whip before. After exploring some of the more known offerings like Putz's, I was excited to discover there was one so close to our Oakley home.

With parking in the rear (which can fill up and has had a huge puddle on our first two visits), it shouldn't be a problem to make a stop. They have a variety of creamy whip flavors. Their current special flavor is blueberry. My favorite though is the swirl with a cherry dip. The portions are extremely generous - I'm sure the large must be huge because my usual order of medium always shocks me with its size.

I would recommend a stop if you are in the area and want a summer sweet. Be warned though, this is a cash only spot.

I'm from Louisville and had heard of Insomnia Cookies (now I get it, available until 3a). During a day trip to this area I spotted the shop on our way back to the car and had to experience the cookies. 

After stepping inside my friend and I had to go back out. The shop is currently allowing only 2 customers inside at once. It only took an extra minute and then we were back in to order.

My friend opted for a peanut butter cookie while I got the combo with two cookies and a beverage (water or milk). The snickerdoodle and MM chip were both delicious. Both cookies super warm like being right out of the oven. Deluxe cookies are also available for an up charge as well as birthday cookies. 

The shop isn't taking cash due to Covid; however, they keep a tip container out front and cash is welcome there. Cookies had to be paid by credit card. You also have to take your order and go - no standing at the high tops to eat your cookies. My friend laughed he was worn out by all the rules! It was a lot compared to the other stops along Calhoun, Ohio and McMillian. 

Would be excited to stop by again or for Louisville to get a location. We need more options, especially late night options.

Outstanding customer service one day. I had a pickup order that was supposed to be ready for me, but despite miscommunication to the employees about the order, they accommodated so incredibly well with a friendly face. They gave me all my delicious cookies, cookie butter, and ice cream, and even threw in a bonus cookie for my trouble.

And the cookies were incredibly hot and fresh, much better than some previous experiences I've had. Definitely recommend the deluxe cookies!

My first time was actually at another location a block away from Syracuse University. Little did I know, University of Cincinnati had Insomnia cookies near campus. Personally, I am not too big on sweets. Insomnia Cookies are open till 3 in the morning and set up shop for delivery later in the day. I got the half dozen assortment in a box (six pack). On a warmer day, I'd have to get a scoop of ice cream.

I was so excited to try these vegan cookies and ordered them for delivery. They were still warm when we got them but they were all CRUNCHY!! I've never had crunchy insomnia cookies before; I always expect them to be soft. I'm not sure if they were hard because they were vegan or if they were just overbaked. 

Here is my ranking of the vegan flavors:
1. chocolate chip
2. double chocolate chip
3. birthday cake

Insomnia Cookies was an all right sounding idea to me.  
However, I've never had one until someone in the office ordered them for us.  I can honestly say it was one of the best cookies I've eaten in a LONG time.

The cookies arrived in a purple and gray pizza box, which was very warm.  Inside the box were a variety of cookies:
Classic with M&Ms, Chocolate Chunk, Double Chocolate Chunk, White Chocolate and Peanut Butter...each in its own small bag.

I chose my favorite out of the bunch--Peanut Butter.  The taste was terrific, to say the least!  Each soft, melty bite was the equivalent to floating down a lazy river in an inner tube.  Enjoyable to the very last bite!  

If you have a sweet spot for warm, soft cookies, I would highly recommend Insomnia Cookies.  You won't be disappointed!

I order insomnia about once or twice a month. I have a sweet tooth that just can't be contained. Typically they have a special during each day of the week and you can order just about anything you'd like or sample any of their menu items. My favorite promotion is their bogo which is by one get one free cookie pack. 

There are two locations in Cincinnati one in downtown and one in Clifton right on Calhoun. Every time I order typically I get the cookies delivered because it's late at night and I don't want to violate the current curfew by running to get cookies--and mainly because they deliver until 3 am every night. 

My favorites from their menu are the chocolate chunk, triple chocolate, snickerdoodle, s'mores and white chocolate macadamia. All their other items are pretty delicious as well. The price per cookie is $1.75 and runs higher if you get their deluxe cookies $3.25. I personally had one delivered to me on a special day and it just brightens your day & it's also really delicious. Other menu items include milk and ice cream cookies and brownies. Though, I typically just get cookies from their menu. 

Overall their cookies are very delicious. I highly recommend if you're looking for a midnight snack or just craving sweets. Pro-tip order ahead for the items because they tend to have busy wait times especially on weekends. Also take advantage of their daily promos listened on their website or through email.

This place is always good for a late night treat, but lately they've been slacking. The last 2 times I ordered, I've had an issue. Tonight some of my mini cookies were so hard they were crunchy. I like the convenience, but the quality is lacking so I probably will no longer order from here.
Cookies are so good and perfect for late night cravings. Employees are great and very attentive!

I suppose they don't need $60 worth of business, our son is a surgical nurse and can't come down to the lobby to pick up cookies, so I wanted to see how they do this when they deliver to hospitals, called the number several times and after waiting 8 minutes no one ever answered, crappy way to run a business.

Insomnia cookies is a must when you are craving a sweet treat. They are served fresh and warm, which makes them irresistible when purchasing. 

They are conveniently located on the University of Cincinnati's campus alongside a lot of other great food options. When you enter, you will be able to see what the product looks like and can choose the quantity wanted. 

The reasoning for the 4/5 stars was due to the price (costly) and the flavor if not eaten immediately. My recommendation would be to eat them when you buy as they aren't the best when you let them sit for a few hours. Enjoy!
Yummy yummy. Melt in your mouth type of cookies. What are you waiting for. Go get some cookies!

You want dessert and there's nothing open??? You're in luck my friend, this place has got you covered. Located in the heart of Clifton Heights, it's easy to find along the business section. Service was fast and easy. My only disappointment is that I wish the cookies tasted more homemade, but when the calling comes for dessert this place was perfect!!! Thank you to the workers at this location for serving us late and still had great attitudes which was nice to see even if your doing fast food service! My favorite ice cream was Moon Tracks because it has mini Reeses peanut butter cups in it!Mmmm!!!  So yummy!!!
Delicious, second time visiting my family enjoy the cookies I think I paid 22 bucks for 13 cookies though. So worth it to me

I would recommend ordering delivery instead of actually going to the store. The workers were quiet, gave me attitude, and didn't make eye contact. All very non-welcoming signs. Cookie was good though.

Just found out about them, went to their website and saw they had a Friday special of BOGO 6 pack of cookies. Ordered a dozen (6 free) as a treat to surprise my co-workers with warm fresh cookies on a Friday afternoon. Ordered at 3:15 p.m. and website said delivery at approximately 4:00 p.m. Email confirmation supplied a tracking number/link as well.  All the way up until 5:15 p.m. the tracking just said "baking" (next options were "out for delivery" and "you're the next stop"). No answer at the store when I tried to contact.  As I was leaving at 5:15 p.m. my cell phone rang and the delivery person was in my building lobby with my not-very-warm cookies.  

They just need to manage expectations.  Don't tell me warm cookies are coming if you can't deliver them when they are ready.  Give realistic delivery timelines on your website when an order is placed. And use your tracking software as it was intended or disconnect it.  

But the cookies were good - my family enjoyed them instead of my co-workers!  Not sure I would pay full price unless I could count on the service.

Went to this cookie shop last night. We ordered 2 cookie-wiches (cookies and cream cookies with cookie dough ice cream). The cookies were really good, the ice cream was ok. Also was sad to learn the BOGO was only for online ordering. But, good enough cookies I might be back

Oh my word!  So good! My husband and I were in Correyville for a romantic weekend and we had heard about these wonderful cookies.  We order a dozen to be delivered to us at our hotel.  In 15 minutes we got a call from the delivery person informing us that he is at our door. These cookies were as good as homemade!  I recommend these to anyone in the area!  I'm depressed that we can't get them here at home!

Yay! I am sure whoever thought of this place is rich. I went by just to check it out and of course I bought something. First there was a nice selection. What I wanted the chocolate with smores wasn't in the budget because I wanted to ice cream sandwich. I did get the cookiewich with chocolate chip.
It was very tasty. The cookies tasted warm even with the ice cream. I sat and just enjoyed it. I noticed that they deliver as well which is cool for those in that service area. 
I would definitely check it out again as an after dinner spot to get me a dessert. The staff was nice and helpful and service fast.
We got a cookie cake and it was AMAZING! We had it delivered and the employee was kind and wished my friend a happy birthday.

The cookies are excellent.  Double chocolate mint cookies are FABULOUS! They have ooey gooey brownies. The prices are about $4-$10  for a dessert.  The parking is terrible! You have to pay to park.  The meter maids are right there waiting to ticket.  The are seats inside,  but only two double seats.  They're great for people watching.  PAY YOUR METERS!

Please do not have them deliver your cookies. I placed an order at 12:37pm Wednesday, they said the order would be delivered in minutes. I called them at 1:25pm to check on the whereabouts of my order. The order finally arrived at 2:05pm. The driver dropped it off. I ordered 12 cookies and 2 of the cookies cost $5.90, when I checked one of those $5.90 cookies was missing. I called and thought they would deliver the cookie. I literally spent 8 minutes talking to there call center in Pennsylvania about the missing cookie that was not delivered. They insited that it was in the box. So disappointing. I was ready to take all the cookies back and request for a full refund. Then they decided they will just refund the missing $5.90 cookie. DO NOT GET COOKIES DELIVERED FROM INSOMNIA!!!  The cookies were good.

Wow, where do I even begin? My daughter was admitted to the NICU and PICU in the past two months at the local children's hospital. We saw so many people carry Insomnia cookie boxes that we asked a nurse about them and they excitedly told us how awesome they are so we ordered them late at night as a treat for my husband and I. It's true, they really are awesome! The cookies came warm and we ordered cold milks and they delivered at Children's Hospital and when you are feeling at your worst dealing with health issues the comfort of those cookies and milk is unbelievable. It was something we looked forward to as a nightly routine. Now that my little girl is home we don't have a Insomnia cookies around us so it makes us a little sad but when at children's and you need something comforting order insomnia cookies!

I love the concept. The cookies are kept in a warmer. Walking in and being able to bite into a warm cookie is pretty awesome. 

It is the warmer is what keeps me from giving Insomnia Cookies another star. Most of the cookies we had remained soft on the inside. Unfortunately, the cookies had been in the warmers for too long. The sides were crisp, and dried out. They had the consistency of croutons. The two coming together just did not mix. For the price, the cookie shouldn't be dried out the way it was. Also, since the cookies were warm they melted the ice cream of the ice cream sandwiches too quickly. The first bite caused the majority of the ice cream to fall out. We all were eating our ice cream with a spoon. A solution to both problems may be to remove the cookies from the warmer before they dry out. The cooled/ room temperature cookies could be used for ice cream sandwiches. 

Flavors of the cookies were decent. A fun part of the ice cream sandwiches is that not only do you get to pick the ice cream, and the cookies, but you may also pick different cookies for the top and the bottom.
Stopped in fir a snack...there are 4 stools. One employee was on her break and just sat there taking up one table alone,  while we stood next to her trying to balance our plates.

I would give zero stars if I could. It took over two hours to get them delivered. Ice cream was completely melted, cookies were undercooked. I understand if delivery was delayed, but why not keep the ice cream in a freezer?

When I was younger and lived in Columbus I appreciated Insomnia Cookies more than I do now, for some reason. However, when I saw they were opening one at UC I still got pretty excited.

The idea alone of a late night cookie delivery place is amazing. For it to actual exist is another level of amazing. 

They have pretty delicious cookies. I always love the m&m and mint chocolate chip cookies the most. They also have milk, and ice cream for extra snacking. 

You don't have to have your snacks delivered from here. They have a store front that you can go into and pick your cookies out yourself and take them home. 

I guess my only issue with Insomnia Cookies is the prices. Everything is a little pricey for just cookies, or just ice cream. 

Go to place for a late night snack, though. For sure.
Has the worst customer service and the worst delivery service ever. Although expected delivery time is always 25 mins, it's always two hours plus before the cookies arrive.

At first I was a little skeptical. However I gave it a try. Ordering online through there app they were offering three free Chocolate Chunk Cookies with any delivery order so of course I went with the 6 pack, the more economical deal. The delivery was fast and efficient. The cookies arrived nice and warm and came right on time. I did enjoy my experience.

Literally was in town for a work meeting & drove 20 miles to get some cookies as I was first introduced to them when In St Louis... So headed out and when I got there was talking to the Mgr telling him how I just heard of them and Im in Boston & we dont have them.. 

To which he said, YES WE DO!!!! Mind Blown and then I Yelped super fast & SURE ENOUGH we do... What a dunce I am.. 

So got some great cookies and now the knowledge that they are here in town...

(4) ~ very good overall cookies & service

** Double Chocolate Chunk = (4) very good...my fav:)
***S'mores = Next time...they were out:(

Ordered cookies last night at 9:45 pm and received them at 12:30am. I called customer service after a hour and they couldn't get a hold of the Calhoun store either, they gave me a coupon tho. I just assumed they weren't coming after let alone 2 hours. I was very annoyed because I just wanted to go to bed by the time they came, and when they did come, the cookies were cold. Do not order delivery from here.

Thank God I am not a UC student. This place would be responsible for way more than a freshman 15. They deliver to your dorm!!!! Oh snap. Game over. The nice worker explained the cookie options which include, among others, a large or a smaller cookie along with ice cream accompaniment. Geesh. Before my sugar levels peaked, I ordered one small and one large and my taste buds sang Beethoven's Ode to Joy as I gobbled up the the warm chocolate chip cookie. The large was brought home for my lady. ;)

Go check this place out, they're open 3pm-3am. Great late night treat.

What a total disappointment. We went to the location while on vacation looking for a late night sweet tooth fix. This encounter quickly turned into a total disaster. We waited for over 5 min thinking the person infront of us order was being made. While waiting the couple said, they had been waiting for over 10 min... When we asked the manager rudely shouted we making cookies and other people have been waiting as well. At this point we decided to leave. Never again

Throughout college I was always jealous of my friends who had insomnia cookies on their campus. While pulling all-nighters I'd always get snaps from them showcasing their cookie a la modes or cookiewiches. I always thought this was a wonderful concept and a cookie lovers dream. Nothing would beat having a cookie delivered to me while studying--who ever thought of this idea was a genius.  

I always wanted to try this place and I unexpectedly saw it on the UC campus. I was so excited!! I had just eaten dinner and still decided to run to this place.. I HAD TO TRY IT.

As soon as I walked in, the aroma of cookies was overbearing (in a good way) to the point that I could only focus on the cookies in front of me (they strategically have their cookies showcased right at the entrance). I honestly wanted to try all of them!

Their menu was straightforward. I appreciate that they have multiple options such as the cookie a la mode option for those that don't want the whole sandwich and may be watching calorie intake. 

I ordered the double chocolate mint cookie and cookie dough ice cream. The cookie was served to me warm and was good quality (definitely a 4). However, I was very disappointed in the ice cream. It wasn't rich nor creamy...it was a bit bland and watered down (it was about a 2). This was a new batch of ice cream--so it's either that they have not chosen to invest in  quality ice cream or my ice cream preference differs from their typical clientele.I would not order the ice cream again. I have a sweet tooth and I did not finish it. I only ate the cookie. 

The cookie experience was well worth my run and I appreciated the service. The server was friendly and took the time to open a fresh new cookie dough batch of ice cream for me. 

I will definitely be back to try another cookie! Cookies are my weakness. :D #Iamthecincycookiemonster

This place is kind of overrated. The fact that they stay open until 2am baffles me. Are there that many cookie lovers out trolling the streets at 2am for cookies? For the quality of the cookies it's a bit expensive and the size does not justify the price. The brownies and ice cream options put a little twist on the concept but still very underwhelming. Maybe it's because a co-worker was so excited and hyped the place up and I was let down based on what I expected by her description? I most likely will not be going back to Insomnia. Seems like more of a gimmick than anything else.

Not so humbly submitted,
Michael C.

Stopped here on our way home last night. We got 6 cookies & a pint of ice cream. The price seemed really expensive to me.  
On the plus side, The cookies were still warm by the time we got home. The ice cream was really, really soft however. 
The chocolate chip cookies were large & basically satisfying. The melted chips made them seem home made & that was my favorite part!
The chocolate ice cream was ok so I recommend skipping it & going straight for the cookies

Overall we felt this place was just meh. I'm all for hole-in-the-wall joints, but this one felt like the owner thought about putting effort into decor and ambiance and then took a nap instead.
