The girl that helped us was nice, but she neither used gloves, nor washed her hands and as someone that has worked a lot of food service jobs, that's pretty gross and violates health code. Not to mention that her butt crack was clearly visible as she turned around to the cookie rack in the back. There was just nothing about this place that made me want to eat the food. After all of that buildup, my husband found a long, dark hair in his ice cream sandwich

Insomnia is cool. I tried two different cookies, which honestly seem over priced, but I wanted to give them a try. The cookies we decent, don't get me wrong, but I think I'd listened to too much hype about them lol. I can definitely see myself stopping in again if the opportunity presents itself, but I can't see making a special trip.

My boyfriend tried the brownies a la mode and hasn't shut up about it since. So late the other night he was hit with a craving and we decided to order in. 

Let me start by saying I'm not sure if the people that answer the phone are located in the same city that you are ordering in, I'm also not sure if these people have a basic elementary school education, but both times we've called the ordering process has been a mess. I always hang up with fingers crossed that the right thing gets delivered to my house after my ridiculous 35-40 minute wait. 

Which brings me to another point: 35-40 minutes for cookies? I've never even waited that long for pizza to be delivered. 

The cookies themselves are not much to write home about. The first time we ordered mine weren't even warm and my boyfriend's brownie looked like it wasn't warmed at all and was cold. I've made better tasting cookies myself and with the wait time and overpricing, I could have gone to Kroger and got a pack of break and bakes. But I understand a student living in a dorm might not have that option but you can get a better cookie from Potbelly or Panera for that matter. 

Bottom line: don't waste your money.

Tasty sweets here but watch your wallet!

Open generally from 3pm until really late, this place clearly caters to the pressed for time, sweets craving college student. Walk in and you are filled with the smell of fresh cookies baking. Can't go? Just get them delivered to your dorm, apartment or office. I have taken these to meetings and class presentations, and they are always a hit. Whenever they are giving them away free on UC's campus, people flock for them. My particular favorites are double chocolate chunk and the current seasonal option, cranberry orange oatmeal (which has a good amount of orange flavoring making it taste light and citrusy).

It is a niche market establishment though. They know their cookies are good and in high demand at certain times so the mark up is HUGE (see thr other reviews). I would love to see some "happy hour" esque deals for people to come in during slower times. That would definitely bring me in more often. I am subscribed to their email list though so I get notifications when they have ice cream sandwich or bulk buy deals going on. 

Next time: I'll be trying their ice cream sandwich. They look good.

I wish I can give no stars for starters I was waiting in line for like 10 mins remind you the first person In line ( only a couple was there eating that's it ) And I still had to wait like 10 mins in order to get my order taken . Also it's only one person working ( which wasn't her fault) When I finally ordered I got a snicker doodle cookie and a brownie with ice cream . She said it will take 2 mins for my brownie to warm . I said that's fine even though I already been waiting a while. So I'll say 6 mins go pass the place is packed almost out the door now. Oh gosh she FINALLY go and check on my brownie an all of a sudden she says it fell on the floor at this point I'm like can I have my money back an she try to make it right by giving me a extra free cookie ( in which I didn't enjoy) . I'll say overall  it took me 20 mins or so just for a brownie an small dip of ice cream with a cookie . Tbh I don't see the hype with this place I actually got sleepy waiting ...I may try it again but probably not you better off shopping at a cookie stand in the mall
Fabulous! Never disappointed, and makes a great treat after movies in the park, at Washington Park, during the warmer months.

I think this place does cookies really well. Mine are always made to order because it doesn't take long; so they are always fresh and hot. This particular birthday cookie...well it was kind of thick and not quite done. We ended up sticking it in the oven at home and all was well. I do think they are a bit pricey.

It's impossible to get ahold of by phone, be it for ordering or customer service. But the cookies are always great and delivery is super fast.

I ordered online with a coupon code to get 2 free cookies and for some reason, it didn't show up on the order even though I had the coupon applied as well as the items. I tried reaching them by phone both on the customer service line and ordering line. Couldn't reach anyone and gave up after 10 minutes on each. It's not a busy night- my order was delivered before I could reach anyone on the phone. So, the delivery was fast, but so fast that I couldn't fix the order at all. I only ordered to use the coupon.

Pros:
-Good cookies
-FAST Delivery

Cons: 
-Good luck reaching them by phone. Just do it online.
-Checkout didn't put in my coupon, which is the reason I ordered
-Delivery can be $6+ even if you live very near it (on campus)... go by foot, if you can, even though I think their whole thing is delivery.
-Delivery drivers will never come to your door. Once they couldn't seem to find the Calhoun dorms last year, despite it being down the street. Sometimes you have to go outside to go get it, but that seems like a common issue with delivery here.
Ordered my cookies at 12:15 AM, didn't deliver until 3AM. Was asleep by then and never got my $20+ worth of cookies. Never ordering from here again.

I have had Insomnia Cookies a few times when I'm working night shift and I think they seem really awesome because of the novelty- cookies delivered to the workplace in the wee hours of the night really do cheer people up on a bad night. 

I went to their location in Clifton for dessert a few days ago and ordered a chocolate chip cookie. It was warm and melty, but tasted pretty much like the kind of cookies you can "make and break". Service also left something to be desired- super slow even though there were three people working there. 

Will probably leave it for late night ordering!

Awful. You can buy better quality cookies at Kroger for a much cheaper price. Service is lackadaisical as well so this place is the epitome of terrible.

Complete rip-off. Overpriced food that lacks quality, I could taste the artificial ingredients the second my teeth touched the surface of the cookie. 

Don't see how these positive reviews are implemented, the cookies are garbage

I like there cookies but evertime I come here for a good cookie I have one of the worst customer service experiences ever today I waited 15 minutes before I was looked at!!
And when I tried to order he told me there will be a 15 to 10 minute wait for the deluxe cookies which I really wanted I was the only one in the store so if it was not busy either way it will be my last time coming here due to the fact that it's horrible customer service !!
Funny note One of the employees was doing nothing but playing Pokémon don't get me wrong I love the game but work is work

Second review 
Why do I keep going back after very awful service I came in and a lady was sitting on a chair drawing or writing or doing something and she told me I'll be with you in one moment and she took 10 minutes while I was waiting on the front counter I encourage the owner or the company to look at the camera if you don't believe me what a horrible service wow !! I felt so disrespected but now I know for sure to never come back and tell all my friends about this crazy experience

Absolute Sh*t service. Every single time we order delivery it takes over an hour. Every. Single. Time. If I could write a review and give 0 stars I would. 

Yea the cookies are good but when I decided to order cookies I expect them to be here in a reasonable time. Not an hour and a half later. 

Oh yeah I live down the block. I could walk there faster than they could deliver it here.

I love the concept of insomnia cookies. It's a fantastic resource to treat a friend or significant other from afar, other than flowers or something boring. During a stressful week my sister was able to call in an order and have it surprise delivered to my door, without my knowing. who's week wouldn't instantly be made better by a surprise delivery of freshly baked, warm cookies? (Oh and you can have a pint of ice cream sent too?!). Granted it is a bit pricey, but so are flowers and you can't eat those!
It took over 1.5 hrs to get my cookies. Really disappointed with the delivery and the service.

Okay, just no. 

The price is ridiculous for the quality of product! I get so much more enjoyment out of buying a roll of cookie dough at the grocery store and eating it for much more bang for my buck. 

I order the cookie ala mode (around $4.50~). For my cookie being freshly baked it was hard as a hockey puck. My vanilla ice cream, surprisingly stayed frozen for the delivery trip...but didn't taste like much. 

2 stars for the good delivery and nifty online ordering. 

-3 for price, and horrible food quality

It's a good think I'm no longer a student at UC, I would order these all the time. And wow, I can't believe there exists a cookie ordering service that delivers until 3 am!!

There wasn't much information on the website about this place, and I wasn't even sure if walk-ins were welcome or if it was delivery only, but now I know. Walk-ins are definitely welcome!

It's a small little shop with a whole lot to offer.  Even ice cream.  I ordered one of their deluxe cookies with ice cream, and was really satisfied!! The cookie was warm and gooey, and oh so good!! The ice cream was good, but I wouldn't say there's anything extremely special about it - worth the try, but I may just order cookies when I visit from now on.

They have two tiers of the cookies, I'm can't remember the names so let's go with standard and deluxe for the sake of describing them. The standard includes your average cookie, like snicker doodles for a lower cost. Then you have the Deluxe, which is what I went for. I had a reese's cup type cookie that was amazing, but there are other options like s'mores.

I plan to visit this place more when I'm in the area!
My go to for late nice munchies, the cookies are gooey yet crispy. Get some ice cream for ultimate satisfaction

My early experiences with Insomnia Cookies was good.  They delivered on time to the hospital and the cookies were fresh, hot and good.

Today I placed a birthday order at around noon.  The system somehow deleted the order when I went to check out online and I had to re-enter everything.  I noticed on my confirmation that I had not changed the default from pick up to delivery.  

I called the call center.  They told me to put a new order in with comments to delete the old order; it seems like it would have been easier for them to modify the old order but ok.  I put a new timed order in for 3PM (with a 20% tip).  The driver arrived with the cookies at 3:15 without the milk.  He did have one container in his car and offered to go get another but we did not want the cookies to get cold so we just went without.  Today's service was disappointing.  The cookies are expensive.  If the service was up to par the price would be worth it, today it was not and this will likely be our last order.

I'm furious! I spent over 30 minutes online trying to place an order for my son's birthday. The ordering site is terrible and the site would not complete the order after several attempts. I finally called customer service to order and that took 20 minutes (person helping me was very pleasant and trying to be helpful!). We finally got the order placed, including 6 free cookies due to problems with the first time I ordered last Dec. and she assured me everything went through. I received my confirmation email for delivery last night to my son and a group of friends. He just called me tonight to ask if I had forgotten to place the order because nothing ever arrived and he never received a call or any notice. I did not receive a call or email saying there was any problem. So now I get to waste even more time trying to get back the money they took without delivering anything or following up at all! Never Again Insomnia Cookie! I should have "listened" to all the other bad reviews they've gotten!

Absolutely horrible service. I ordered using the coupon code they gave me from the last time they messed it up, and again. Never ceases to amaze me, I ordered 2 s mores, 2 snickerdoodles, and 4 chocolate chunk, and what came in the box? 1 burnt s more, 1 burnt snickerdoodle, and 1 burnt chocolate chunk. I've ordered from them 3 times, and each time they mess it up worse. And you wouldn't think that the times I order are busy times, the second time I ordered was 3 in the afternoon, and they showed up 45 minutes past what I scheduled for the delivery time, again with burnt cookies and low quality service. Needless to say I will never be ordering from here ever again. Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice  shame on me. Fool me 3 times? what the hell are you doing? This place is the definition of idiocy in its purest form.
Update. Called customer service. Asked for refund. Didn't give it to me. Not a coupon or even an apology to make up for their lack of ability. They instead decided to resend the cookies. And send them 2 and a half hours after I called and was asleep as I get up at 6 am everyday. Showed up at 12:45. And still got my order wrong! I didn't get two of the cookies I paid for. Safe to say. Never ordering from here ever again.

LOVE IT! Warm hot cookies ready for you, alllllllll da time!!! My favorite is the white chocolate macadamia! All their cookies are really sweet so if you don't have a sweet tooth... then why are you at a cookie joint?! I am so happy one finally opened here in Cincinnati... they also deliver!!!!
I can only say I wish I lived closer to Clifton and Insomnia Cookies so that I could partake in a 2:30 am delivery of warm cookies and cold milk.

This place has bomb ass cookies and if you're served by D'asia, you're winning. Soft, warm, delicious. Perfect for a cold day or honestly any day. Tell D'asia we sent you and give her extra tips $$$!!!

All cookies are served warm. 
You pay $1.35 for 1 or $14 for 12 which is a bit pricey for an average size cookie. 
They also have ice cream for a sweet treat.
The cookies look delicious but aside from being warm and looking delicious they're just an "ok" cookie. I tried the double chocolate chip and it wasn't sweet nor salty, it would be a totally bland cookie if it didn't have chocolate chunks. 
Love the idea though!
This place is amazing. Highly highly recommend this place. What's great is they deliver till 2 am and  the cookies are amazing!!

On-demand food delivery services like Eat24 and GrubHub have finally begun to tap the Cincinnati market, but if you're hungry late at night, all of their listed businesses are closed.  Plus, there aren't really any options to cure a sweet tooth.

Insomnia bills itself as "late-night bakery concept" and is attempting to fill this gap with rapid expansion across college campuses throughout the Midwest and East Coast.

Finding myself in Clifton on a chilly November afternoon, I stopped in on a whim.  Since I wasn't "dinner hungry" yet, I couldn't help but to feel the stars align between the warm cookie crisper oven in front of me and my own imminent hunger.

You order a cookie and it emerges from the warmer with that fresh-from-the-oven feel.  That simple.  Awesome.

I had the peanut butter chocolate chip, which is a deluxe cookie ($2.75 vs. $1.35 for a normal cookie).  No regrets.

Also, they offer delivery service, but sadly only within Clifton and not yet into nearby Over-the-Rhine.  I pray the cookie gods soon allow a little expansion here.

It's a great concept, but I'm just not a huge fan. The cookies are good, but honestly, I just can't get behind the prices. I would much rather use my effort to drive to the grocery for a cheap pack of cookie dough or cookies instead of paying for delivery and having to tip. I do enjoy them when they're catered and/or otherwise given to me for free, but I really can't think of a time I've wanted a cookie so much that I would pay for a half dozen to be delivered to me. But maybe I'm just too broke.
I like the cookies! Of course like the other reviews I haven't really encountered it so I'll leave it at 5 stars for now. Love the concept!

I'm currently in line. There's 3 people doing nothing behind the counter. Honestly? I'm bored. I want some cookies? Like...? Shit service also water is $2,25??? Hello? Is this 2006? Truly exceptional.

Chocolate chunk and the deluxe triple chocolate chunk cookies are the best! Everytime I come to visit my family- n- law in Cincinnati, its a must! The many times I've eaten the cookies; they were  straight out of the oven and soooo delicious! I seriously can eat a dozen cookies with a glass of milk. Love Insomnia cookies!

Where can you get warm, decadent mouth-watering cookies at 2am? Want 'em delivered, too? Mmm. Insomnia Cookies. It's literally a 5-10 minute walk from UC. Its hours are ridiculously convenient. And the s'mores cookie is DIVINE. Get the s'mores. Thank me later.

Very rude female working nights.  Out of every other cookie people ordered and it took 10 mins to get our money refunded...and then she threw our money on the counter because she had the misunderstood what was happening.   Serious attitude problem, no product, and poor customer service.  How in the world are they in business

I love the cookies from here.  I go to the store whenever possible, but the delivery is a mess.  I live a 5 minute walk away from the store.  I ordered cookies to be delivered for my roommates and the delivery took over 3 hours to get to them.  I called the store to ask what the status was of the delivery.  They apologized and emailed me a coupon that only applies to delivery orders.  I went to use the coupon that didn't expire for another two months and the code didn't work.  I called the store and told him it wasn't working.  He said even though it hadn't expired it wasn't going to work and gave me a new code.  The new code didn't work either and he told me there was nothing he could do. Still ordered the cookies.  Delivery driver took extremely long and would not get out of the car to deliver the cookies to my house. I really do like the product, but getting it has been such a mess.

Cookies + delivery what a great idea!!! I had never heard of Insomnia cookies, but I wish this would have been on campus when I was a student. It's such a clever concept, granted they do charge a premium, around $1.50 a cookie. They have several varieties, although nothing out of the ordinary. We had to wait for our order, but they were fresh and warm.  The cookies are fresh and warm which is pretty much perfect. They also serve ice cream with all the add ins and milk. It's the perfect combo! Great place for a quick snack. Although, it seems a little pricy to me, given the flavors aren't anything special and it's like a buck and a half for one cookie. That being said, the cookies are quite tasty!

Well, while it sounds cools that they "deliver" cookies to you, I think their cookies are rip-offs. Did I pay $1.45 for a McDonald or Subway quality of cookie!? There are really nothing special about their cookies. I even suspect that those cookies are made from regular (cheap) cookies mix. I will never come back.

The ice cream with double chocolate chip cookie was good. But they are a bit rather expensive. The price for one cookie is at least $1 if it's the usual type. But if you add in extras it could be $3. I got the milk and two cookies deal for $5. I wish it was open before 3 pm. It would be great with lunch.
Cookies what more can i say! They are always hot and delicious. Its also great that they deliver!

I recently discovered this place thanks to a co worker.  I wanted to have a good laugh one night and ordered a cookie cake, and put in the comments box (as they request) what I wanted written on the cake. It showed up with nothing on it.  When I called the customer service center, they could care less.  Apparently doing as they instructed wasn't acceptable, you have to specifically tell them to write on a cookie cake. (WTF?) Still, though, quick delivery, cookies are always hot..and hey, they are right next to a college campus..ideal location.

Delivery took 3 hours longer than it said it would originally take. Then after I tried to call and ask about it no one would answer for about 11 minutes. Very poor customer service. I'm very disappointed.

Go somewhere else. Go to the grocery store and bake them from scratch. It'll be faster than having them delivered! After 45 minutes, I tried calling to see what was going on and find out how much longer. The customer service rep was apologetic but told me after I questioned her a couple times about when I was going to actually get the cookies that it would be another half hour. I mean, could've AT LEAST offered a coupon since I just spent $19 (YES, $19!) on cookies that the company can't even deliver in a timely manner... And to top it all off, the cookies weren't even warm!? Nobody there did anything to fix the situation or acknowledge it. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THEM.

Who doesn't love Graeter's ice cream? We moved to California seven years ago and this was our first time back.

We had dinner in OTR and had to pick up a few pints for the next night's dinner. We also got chip wheelies for a quick fix. 

The place is small and was crowded. However, since most everyone was ordering their fix at the counter and what we were buying was all 'pre-made', we were able to get in, pay and eat out very quickly. 

Graeter's ice cream is the best; I don't care where the store is. This particular store was an easy walk after dinner, so super convenient.

A little smaller than other Graeters locations I've been to and a little more expensive, but this location serves up all my favorite flavors with friendly and quick service. The 1870 tower is truly amazing with the perfect mix of deep chocolate flavor in the bundt cake, crispy pecans, creamy black raspberry chip ice cream, and some hot fudge to tie it all together. I also love cheese crown with the most amazing crispy and flavorful cheesecake bits. Caramelized chocolate truffle and black cherry chocolate chip are two other flavors which are truly amazing.

Overall, definitely worth a visit if you're in the area for some amazing ice cream.

As an out of town visitor, everyone recommended trying Graeter's and I can see why! There were so many flavor options that sounded amazing, but I ended up trying the Perfect Indulgence cookies & cream as well as the black cherry chocolate chip. Both of these are vegan, but they taste exactly like the dairy version. The toppings were huge (basically full sized Oreos & chocolate chunks) and the ice cream was so creamy and flavorful. I will definitely be back to try more flavors!

Graeters has great ice cream- this location is not great because parking is a pain in the butt. We ended up paying $7 for parking which was more than the ice cream. My chocolate milkshake was OK- honestly for $5 I should have gotten something else because it was just not super flavorful.

This is the most frequented Graeter's I go to when I visit Cincinnati. Black raspberry chocolate chip ice cream is a staple of the town and is a must/have flavor if you visit Graeters for the first time. The staff during my last visit was extremely kind and demonstrated utmost customer service. The cake in the 1870 tower was fresh and the ice cream was the perfect temperature. This is a true gourmet experience.

Graeter's made me believe in chocolate chip ice cream again. I've always found the chocolate chips in my ice cream to be rock-hard and stubborn pieces of chocolate that refuse to melt at the same pace as the rest of the dessert, so I was doubtful when I heard black raspberry chocolate chip was the best selling flavor. I confess I've been wrong all along, because Graeter's showed me that the impossible is possible, and chocolate chips can be delicious in ice cream.
The way Graeter's chocolate melts in your mouth is magical. Fruity flavors can taste artificial sometimes, but this black raspberry was very natural and not overly sweet, pairing well with the chocolate. Coming from the West Coast, my expectations for ice cream are sky high, but Graeter's exceeded expectations in every w

This is the local institution of ice cream. Their specialty seems to be the chocolate chips that various flavors are imbused with, and I happen to be a mint chip guy, so this started out well.

And the chips in my mint chip were indeed impressively rich, varied in size and texture as if they been passed through a wood chipper or something. It was an excellent flavor. The caramel flavor I sampled was also solid. I wasn't wildly impressed with their cones and just got it in a cup. They had some sorbets but none of the dairy-free creams that seem to be sweeping the country. This location had some bar seating, and was quite a good area, being near the streetcar and a tour company across the street.

Great central location, makes for a great pit stop after dinner or between shopping. Only slight down side is that there's limited seating. The staff is always so welcoming and know the menu very well

This was my first experience with Graeters Ice Cream. I've always heard wonderful things about the ice cream. I purchased a scoop of coffee ice cream in a pretzel cone. If you like salty and sweet this is definitely the way to go. My combo was a little weird but I wanted to try the pretzel cone. My ice cream was good but I guess I was expecting it to be spectacular. I felt for the price of $4+ it should have been a little better. My most favorite ice cream is from The Chocolate Moose - Vegan Coffee and still is. 

This seems to be a very busy spot. There were only three people ahead of us on a Saturday around 4 pm. The experience was fun and the staff was pleasant but not overfriendly or talkative. I like that you can sit and people watch. Lots of fun restaurants within walking distance.
Some of the best ice-cream I ever tasted!! Salted Carmel oh my! Black cherry with chocolate chip YUM! Chocolate yummy! Ask for their bittersweet sauce to top it off too!!

(4.5) ~ Very Good Overall Food & Service!

MENU:
** Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip = (4.75) Great!!:)
** Cold Brew Coffee w. Cream = (4) very good

I was not impressed with the ice-cream here. 

First of all, you can't see the ice-cream at the counter. Which in my opinion, is one of the joys of being in an ice-cream shop; is to see the variety of ice-creams displayed right in front of your eyes. Theirs is like hidden behind the counter or something. 

Graeter's is apparently a must if you're in Ohio, but the ice cream is subpar. It's a grainy ice cream rather than creamy and smooth. It lacks flavor. For example, the salted caramel with chocolate chips, neither tasted like caramel nor salt. It was a straight sweet ice-cream with chocolate chips. In a blind taste test, I might have guessed it was vanilla. What they did well and are known for are the chocolate chips. Rather than being rock solid, they were soft and melted in your mouth. 

The thing about Graeter's is that it has a history and a place in Ohio's heart. It has that vintage charm. But in comparison to other must visit ice-cream places, it comes in last place.

Graeter's Ice Cream is always one of my favorites while in Cincinnati. At any location including this one the staff is usually always nice and friendly. The location of this one is on Vine St. in Over-the-Rhine which is a popular area. Therefore, it was a little crowded but the line moved pretty fast. 

I love the creaminess of their ice cream as well as the taste. My husband and I always order either Cookies & Cream scoops in a cup or a milkshake. Both are always delicious. The Cookies & Cream ice cream has a nice and creamy vanilla base with chunks of Oreo Cookie mixed throughout. Amazing! Sometimes you get the big chucks (half an Oreo) and I love those. I've tried maybe one or two other flavors but I always come back to Cookies & Cream. This flavor is also my husband's favorite so that's why we order it the majority of the time. I like it as well but we usually always share sweets anywhere we go so this is the one flavor we can agree on. Occasionally I will get Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough because that was my favorite flavor growing up, and I still like it as an adult. My husband doesn't like it so usually when I get this flavor we don't share but it's not often. 

Overall, Graeter's has some good ice cream and is my go to spot when I want a sweet cold treat. While we always get Cookies & Cream they do have other good flavors. Give them a try and I'm positive you won't be disappointed.

Fun Graeter's location in OTR. It has the feel of an old time corner ice cream shop. 

Located in Vine Street where all the action is, this particular Graeter's made me feel like I was walking back in time, in a good way. On a recent steamy Sunday afternoon I headed in with a friend for a cone and to cool off! 

A few samples later, I had decided on my old summertime favorite of peach. If you haven't had this one yet, I highly recommend that you get a scoop or two of Graeter's peach while it lasts -- it's one that many people anticipate all year long. 

The cool shop was just the pick me up that I needed on the hot afternoon. A few minutes later I was cooled off, refreshed, and ready to take on the rest of my weekend.

Our neighborhood Graeters- We Love You and can't get enough of you! Sometimes we start to draft away from your champion and go with Mint Chocolate Chip, Chocolate Coconut Almond Chip or that teaser of a Buckeye Blitz. But we always land back with the irreplaceable Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip and crown it with a chocolate adorned waffle cone to make up for lost time.

OMGosh, so good!! I had salted caramel chocolate chip in a dip cone! My husband had a triple scoop, double choc, black raspberry and strawberries and cream. My sone had the 1870 tower with black raspberry and strawberry cream! Yummmmm

Graeters is a must-have when visiting Cincinnati, OH.  When you're there, you gotta try anything chocolate chip [ESPECIALLY THE BLACK RASPBERRY CHIP.  you're welcome.] because they don't believe in tiny chocolate chips or flakes; they believe in ginormous nuggets of chocolate in their chocolate chip ice creams.  Again, you're welcome.  

Like any good ice cream shop, you can sample any and all flavors before you make your choice.  While you can't go wrong with any flavor, black raspberry chip is the way to go though imo.  They also serve shakes, ice cream pints (to enjoy there or at home), and coffee; so it's your one-stop-shop for after lunch/dinner.

Grater's is always a winner! If you've never had it before, you need to know that Graeter's is known for their enormous chocolate chips. So be sure to order a flavor that comes with those. Their most famous flavor is Black Raspberry Chip. Even if you're not usually a fruity ice cream fan, I would at least recommend that you sample it. Because they'll let you sample as much as you want!

Now, this location might be a little busier than others. They don't have their own parking lot, so you'll have to find a meter or go to a garage. And this place is sometimes understaffed. I just went this past Saturday around 3p. There was a group of six of us and a few other people in and out and only one guy there to scoop and run the register. I don't know how he did it, but he got it done!

If you plan on becoming a regular, get a rewards card! Once you've spent $100, you get $5 free! Also, you get a free sundae on your birthday!!

Ice cream was delicious. The pretzel cone was disgusting. However, it's really hard so the ice cream didn't melt through it. I would never order a pretzel cone from here again. Customer service was different. I didn't like that before I ordered, while looking at the menu, I was asked to pay. I had never been to a Graeters before. I didn't know what I wanted or which flavors of ice cream they sell. Feelings rushed I asked to taste the cotton candy. I ordered the cotton candy and was trying to decide on a cone when the sales associate suggested pretzel. After receiving the cone, while I was looking for napkins, again I was asked to pay. It was like they thought I was going to steal the ice cream. I'm clean cut and couldn't understand why she were acting the way she was. Though the ice cream was good, I would never return to this establishment or any establishment with this name.

This is a Cincinnati gem!  (A local tipped me off to try this ice cream shop.). I first sampled the peach ice cream.  Then opted for my favorite flavor:  mint chocolate chip.  It was divine with HUGE chunks of real milk chocolate.  My server was so sweet and friendly.  (See photo.). A definite like!

Perfect spot for a rainy day! I was visiting the city not long ago and decided to walk into Graeters. I received a warm greeting and I was also given several suggestions along with a sample or two. Service was lovely, I ended up going with my favorite which is cookies & cream along with salted caramel. Ice cream was delicious and the atmosphere is perfect.

Such a professional and friendly staff at this location. There was a small line, but it moved quickly. Inside, the decor reminds me of a modern old fashioned ice cream shop. Based on many Yelp reviews, I ordered the black cherry chocolate ice cream in a sprinkled chocolate dipped waffle cone. It was amazing, filled with lots of bug chocolate chunks. Glad I only ordered one scoop. It was huge. I'm glad I made time to check out Graeters while in Cincy. You should, too. There are multiple locations in the greater Cincinnati area. The scoop in cone cost roughly $5. Parking is limited - street parking.

In all rivalries, there's a good guy and a bad guy, with one's loyalty usually falling where their butt fell first. 
Michigan vs Ohio State.......Biggie vs Tupac........Donald Trump vs Orange Paint. You get the idea. 
And then there's Graeters vs UDF, with Graeters' name implicitly implying superiority......the gaul and balls on that burgundy-cursive ice cream shop. 

My heart has always cuddled with the underdog, but with too many locals and talk show hosts singing Graeters' praises, I decided to decide it once and for all - Graeters or UDF?  

So one fateful Monday in a hot AF* August (*As Fireball), a friend and I skipped lunch and dinner to save space for frozen justice.  Back-to-back we went, OTR Graeters to Mt Adams UDF, scoring for taste, sample size, and in the words of no English teacher, funnity. 

1) Graeters' samples were like refugee camp rations, while UDF fit a whole bowl on the bowl of a sample spoon. #TigOl'Samples
(*UDF did say that they cap sample-asks at 5.  Brave be the sugar soldier who asks for more than 5, while impatient infants breathe down their neck.)
2) In Graeters' defense, they're exclusively ice cream, while UDF has expanded into related markets like gasoline.  But Graeters hasn't instilled nearly enough fun around a product that literally sells itself.  Most of the swag for sale there belong in a golf pro shop (with the one exception being Beanboozled, which if you haven't played, is definitely funnity). 
3) Also, an ice cream shop's staff makes all the difference - and Graeters' scoopers tend to be middle-aged men, when really who you want serving you is an assistant baton twirler.  And UDF HAD THAT, in Savannah, Jay Jay, and Alicia, who dubbed herself the Shake Queen. 
They truly made our UDF experience extraordinary and playful, which every ice cream experience should be.  After all, ice cream is the culinary manifestation of playtime.
In fact, when I couldn't find a pint of Mint Cookies n Cream, Jay Jay suited up in an astronaut's beekeeper suit, grabbed some from the back, and filled it into a Chinese takeout carton.  #TradeWars4What 
Meanwhile, Graeters' idea of playfulness was suggesting Cookies n Cream with a scoop of Watermelon. That's like your Mom making you wear a tuxedo on the first day of kindergarten, but trying to fun it up with a tie-dye pocket square. #projecting  
4) I will say that my heart always sidelined with UDF's Cookies n Cream. It was my Sun and my Moon. But Graeters' pint-style rendition did sincerely impress. It's just a shame that Graeters' name is written on the carton like it's a baseball jersey. It's the one thing holding Graeters back from hitting the flavor out of the park. 

Also, the UDF girls did let us in on a little secret - that UDF private-label manufactures some of Graeters' flavors for Graeters.  That's like Chuck E Cheese secretly making some pies for LaRosas. Now I don't know if it's true, but let this review ring the Alexander Bell to begin a game of Telephone. 

What I do know as truth is that Graeters' tradition has unwavered through time. In some ways, that's good, that they're not falling prey to new-age ice cream flavors like Sriracha Nutella.  But UDF is still Undoubtedly Da Funnest. 

And after that all-ice-cream diet, I'm overfed and undernourished. Drop me at the ER

Pretty good ice cream but since I don't eat a ton of ice cream I don't know what bad ice cream tastes like. They don't have the wild crazy flavors, which I don't think is necessary anyways. You can get 3 low sugar options.

The inside is a blend of ice cream shop and cafe. They also sell coffee FYI.

The store manager David is super friendly and helpful. Get your Holtman's donuts across the street afterwards.
Black raspberry chocolate chip is bomb! The chocolate chips are vary in big and small but they are soft in texture. Highly recommend

One of the men working was polite and friendly, asked us where we were from and welcomed us into the shop. Makes me want to go back and see if he is working because his hospitality was a 10/10:) 

Ice cream is also a 10/10 definitely get this ice cream while in Ohio!

What all this hype about Grater's? Well, if you're at this location, it's in the middle of the square then you're probably in a real long line of a rather small shop. Anyways, stay there, just wait, it's worth it. Greater's was started in Cincinnati, and it's now like nationwide, so it's real good and you're getting it from the source! It's hand dipped, rich ice cream. If you get a flavor chocolate chucks, like mint chocolate chip, or the famous Black-raspberry chip, there are HUGE chunks of chocolate. Just wait, you'll get one. Mmmmm. This location also has baked goods like donuts. In Columbus we dont have this, so I've never had any, but they're good. Just give it a try, you'll love it.

This is an update and correction about Grarter's Chunky Chunky Hippo ice cream that I recently had for the first time. I have been asked about this new flavor by several people who are interested in trying it so I want to be accurate about it.                                             The ice cream is toffee flavored. The milk chocolate caramel cups are described as truffles. I could not make that distinction when I had it. There were so few of them and they are very small compared to the chocolate chunks in their other ice cream flavors.                           As for the peanuts they are salted and taste good but there are way too many of them in this ice cream. The texture is too chunky with peanuts and there is not enough of the competing toffee ice cream and chocolate caramel flavor. I can't recommend this new creation in honor of Cincinnati's Fiona the hippo for chocolate lovers. Until next time be kind to each other.#cincyyelp

Good dessert spot in the OTR area and conveniently located by a bunch of restaurants. 

The lemon sorbet was pretty good but the black cherry chocolate chip was amazing!

Friendly service from staff.

I love their ice cream- the signature flavors are rich and the limited edition flavors are great as well.

They also have an assortment of baked goods and candies that are homemade as well and just as delicious as the ice cream.

This location is pretty spacious but always busy, though service is prompt.
Came in town recently on business and stopped in to get buckeyes to take home- $6.95 for 8 of them- not a bad deal!

Amazing ice cream!!! There wasn't a line so we were able stroll right on in and order. I got a single scoop of the S'mores ice cream which was one of the featured flavors this month. If I had the room, I would have gotten it on a sugar cone but I was so stuffed from dinner. The ice cream is very flavorful and creamy. It tasted just like a s'more!

What's not to love about Graeter's? We usually frequent the Ft. Thomas location but today we were in OTR and it was a perfect day for ice cream.

First off, the gentleman working was so welcoming and nice! He gets several gold stars for giving excellent customer service. That alone made our visit outstanding.

Today I tried the black raspberry gelato for the first time. You get the same great taste of their signature flavor but a bit less indulgent but very creamy and light.  Right now they have a seasonal flavor of orange cream which my husband raves about. It's the closest thing to an ice cream flavor he misses from his hometown in Chile.

I'm so glad Graeter's is in OTR because there's no other ice cream shop around!

Hubby and I stopped by to commence our date night. 

Graeters ice cream is delicious and the flavors did not disappoint tonight.  

What was disappointing tonight - the service.  We entered the ice cream shop to several unoccupied dirty tables and three employees very occupied by their cell phones.  We proceeded to order and the male employee was pleasant but the two females were clearly annoyed by our interruption of their evening.  They didn't smile or use any pleasantries during our interaction.  They prepared my husband's sundae in a to-go bowl without inquiring if we'd be dining in.  The male employee prepared my sundae in a cute little dine in bowl.  

We thoroughly enjoyed our desserts.  But they would have been even better if they were accompanied by a pleasant staff.  

Will find another location to fill my Graeters fix.

Yep, upon a visit to this chain in their flagship hometown, we learned the new locations in Illinois are a good and accurate reflection of the original.  This particular store is in a great location in the middle of all the trendy restaurants in the historic OTR district, and it's hard not to just stop in here for dessert or whatever.

I scream, You scream, we All scream for Graeters Ice Cream!!  This particular location is conveniently located in the heart of the Over The Rhine dining/drinking hot spots. They have some of the best ice cream you'll ever taste.This location doesn't have quite the selection of pastries or candy you'll find at other stores but that's ok.  It's all about the ice cream, and more specifically Cotton Candy Ice Cream.  Soooo good!!

This is a nice Graeters. What it has going for it is location, because it's right on Vine in the middle of OTR. It's clean and new. The ice cream is delicious as always (my favorite is still black raspberry chip!). The service here is not as friendly as other less busy locations, but I understand that that's because this spot is really popular. Overall, a convenient stop for after dinner dessert. Open until 10pm most nights, 11pm Friday and Saturday.

Always a delight. This is Roger's first time to graders. He ordered the black raspberry chocolate chip and he really enjoyed it. Coming from Texas he compared at the bluebell ice cream and said " it is not an artificial tasting at the bluebell ice cream". I ordered the same thing as he did however I've had the mango in the past and really enjoyed it as well. I have take other students here in the past who have really enjoyed it when they were on their away rotations from other medical schools around the nation.

I love their ice cream! Tried it last time when I went to Cincinnati with my friends. Totally falls in love with it! I really wants to go back to have more. Was surprise for the amount they gave ($4 for two flavor, huge amount) My friend told me they sell their ice cream online, I checked the website. The price is totally great compare to the price and amount we have in New York. I didn't order online cuz I didn't found the my favorite flavor online (blueberry). I also like the cheesecake flavor. I'm not a cheese/cheese cake fan at all, i was super surprise of the taste of their cheesecake flavor ice cream. Wow

Very yummy!!! I got the peppermint ice cream which was creamy but had delicious chunks of perfectly sugary peppermint every 7 bites or so. I also got a scoop of their pumpkin ice cream which was delightfully simple, not to sweet, but not bland either. The pumpkin made the peppermint not so overpowering (although it wasn't as is) and they complimented each other well. They also had a wall of sweets both for children and adults, and the entire place looked very welcoming.
I had the Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip ice cream for breakfast.....need I say more.
Great ice cream, would have given five stars if the staff was friendlier but overall I'm glad we checked this place out.
Our stop for PreOTR dinner ! Nice staff! Normally super busy! Black raspberry and chocolate chip is my go to regardless of location!

What a great place to come hang out when you're crazy and waiting an obscene number of hours just to have dinner at an OTR restaurant and you've run out of stores to duck into and all the bars are just as crowded and it's too cold to just be outside waiting and waiting just to eat a decent meal. 

When the bestie and I had been up and down Vine Street (in the cold) trying to ride out a 2 hour wait for The Eagle, we finally decided to go into Graeter's for coffee. Never realized this place had such good coffee! The staff didn't have much to say about us taking up a table for almost 45 minutes and we were in the perfect spot when The Eagle finally calls. 

No need to get into the other stuff. Everyone knows Graeter's is amazing!

The newest edition to Vine street has been a long time coming. Finally an ice cream shop, and...it's GRAETERS! 

The layout of the shop is very standard. Bright and airy with floor to ceiling windows up front. They are know for their black raspberry chip and their infamous sundaes. But the geniuses that be have called upon the gods to introduce the pretzel cone. Yes you heard me correct. A salty delicious pretzel cone that houses your deliciously sweet treat. Seeing as I am not a huge fan of chocolate or sweets I love the addition of the salty cone. I would suggest getting the peanut butter or chocolate as it really brings out the flavor. Seems crazy I know but the pretzel cone may just be the next big thing. 

Stop by on a nice day, a date night or whenever you're craving everyone's favorite Cincinnati treat!

Great local ice cream shop! They also have really good boxed chocolates. They are decently priced and have bottled and glass soda! The worker "Sarah" was so sweet and did a great friendly job. It's also in a really good location.

What a great location in OTR! 
Friendly staff!

I heard there were 2 things to eat while in Cincinnati -- Graeters Ice cream was one of them.  We decided to give it a try nit and was not impressed.  The staff was rude and rushing you, I told them I wanted something chocolatey, but just not plain chocolate, they said the buckeye was a popular flavor, so I decided to try it.  The buckeye (chocolate and peanut butter ice cream) was okay, not anything to rave about, in fact, breyer's chocolate and peanut butter ice cream is much better.
The ice cream was good. Apparently, they are known for their chocolate chips in the ice cream... They were ok. The three rating is partially due to the staff that seemed bored with his job.

Sweet serendipity! My Mariano's in Chicago just started distributing Graeter's ice cream in Chicago so when we planned a long weekend to Cincinnati and saw they had a store front, it was a must visit destination! 

The gentleman helping us was so sweet and friendly, and we were able to taste several flavors, but obviously I was dead set on something with chocolate chips in it! Over the course of the weekend I tried Strawberry chip, Mint chip and Buckeye chip - what other ice cream  basically puts bars of chocolate in their ice cream?! Plus the ice cream itself was luxurious!! 

Great experience from start to finish!

Yes! Brilliant! Although Graeter's isn't the niche boutique startup ice cream shop we were all expecting for OTR, let's not forget that it's a hometown favorite!

This signifies a huge change for OTR in general. Now that mainstream restaurants and shops are taking notice of the success and banking in, we are sure to see even more positive growth in the neighborhood. 

This Graeter's was a much needed addition. Now I'm waiting for LaRosa's to follow suit with an OTR franchise!

While Graters is not my most favorite ice cream place, they have great service at this location. I ordered a "something drinkable that tastes like turtle" and the guy totally delivered!!!! I wish I had asked him what was in it because that is my new favorite milk shake. I will definitely come back to this place the next time I am craving a shake. 
I also love the fun flavors .

Can anyone say anything negative about Graeter's? Located conveniently in the heart of OTR, this location is close enough to grab a treat after dinner or as a pit stop as you're barhopping the area. I love the roomy, comfortable feel inside and availability of seating. My favorite flavor is the Toffee Chip, but I'm no Graeter's expert; I'm sure there are plenty of other flavors that are outstanding as well, but Toffee Chip has never let me down. Always worth a visit in Cincinnati!

Every time I'm in Cincinnati I have to stop at Graeter's at least once! This time it was a visit to the Vine St. location when we walked around Fountain Square. Super clean location, conveniently located, and friendly staff! I got the watermelon sorbet (waaayyy too sweet for me) and the cotton candy ice cream (one of the most delicious things to ever touch my tongue). Yum!

We stopped here after Lumenaria.  They seemed a bit understaffed that night, but we were happy to wait.  We were even able to snag a table.  This Graeter's seems more like ye olde ice cream shoppe than the typical store.  Loved the higher ceilings and spaciousness that is often lacking in their standard store.  Of course I had to get the mocha chip, my favorite, with whipped cream (cannot have ice cream without whipped cream!).  Yum!  Happy to have this option for dessert in OTR!

Always a treat I HAVE to get when I'm in Cincinnati. The salted caramel and cookies cream are very good, but my favorite is the black raspberry chocolate chip! I recently read it was chosen as a top 5 ice cream flavor nationally. I love the chocolate chunks in them, and the purple color looks so cool!

They have a damn good strawberry ice-cream and they're open relatively late. This gets a "1 michelin star" from me- if you're in the neighborhood you should pop in for a scoop. If you're not in the neighborhood I'm pretty sure you'll survive without having it.

Who doesn't love Graeter's? It's a great location on Vine, perfect for wandering over after (or before) a meal in OTR.  Of course the most popular flavor is black raspberry chip, which is delicious as always. There's limited seating inside.   I also like Toffee Chip, Mocha Chip, and pretty much anything else.  I think more access to Graeter's is always a good thing.

You know OTR is in the full-on throes of gentrification when Graeter's opens up a scoop shop there. After dinner at Arnold's the other day and with a super singed tongue from a very hot cup of tea that morning, I wanted a cold dessert. Enter the Graeter's on Vine Street.

I'm not sure if this has happened at the other Graeter's, but there are some really distinctive branding and ingredient changes to Graeter's that were very apparent at the OTR location. The menu had a much different appearance than the menus I grew up with. Fiance got mint chocolate chip, which I distinctively remember having that minty green color of my childhood visits to Graeter's. Today, it is a normal cream colored ice cream -- though it still tastes very minty! 

Wish they had had the little self-serve water fountain many other locations have. Props to the employees who gave me a Flavor of the Month magnet (though confusingly, they were offering some flavors that the magnet said are only available in autumn) and got me signed up with one of the rewards calls. What's really funny is that a few nights later, we were at the Esquire, and one of the employees said "Hey, weren't you at Graeter's the other night?" Now that's an attentive employee! Glad to see this newest addition to Vine Street, and I hope it does well.

WOW
This is the best ice cream I've ever had. This beats jenis splendid ice cream. The flavor is incredible, huge portions, a very thick consistency, and the chips were no joke. I was only in cinci for two days and before I left I had to get some for the road. Graeters lives up to the hype.

Graeters has always been clean, offered great customer service and the icecream is consistent. 
However, I'm withholding a 5th star because they just don't blow me away. 
I don't feel like they're doing anything new here. 
That's not to say I don't frequent this establishment for it's aforementioned benefits, but I just wish they'd offer something new or a twist on an old classic.

This ice cream and candy is as good as it gets. I always go with the local favorite which is black raspberry chocolate chip. This ice cream is salty as it is sweet. I always get two scoops in a chocolate dipped waffle cone followed with a side of an "afternoon nap"! We also like their signature milk chocolate candy bars which also serve as a great holiday gift!

This was my first time experiencing Graeter's.  Apparently this is a Cincinnati staple and all the locals recommended that I check it out.  It's located in Over-The-Rhine, so don't expect to find parking close by.  I'm personally not a big ice cream person (I prefer frozen yogurt), but this was pretty good.  I got the chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream in a cone and it was great.  I got to taste quite a number of their other flavors, and there were only a few that I didn't care for.  It's definitely a nice place to stop by for dessert if you're eating in OTR or hanging out at Washington Park.

Brought some out-of-town friends in here this past Saturday, and they did not disappoint! The fella working there was very friendly and accommodating. I ordered a pumpkin ice cream malt with a shot of espresso, whipped cream, and cherry on top. It was phenomenal! The guy said he'd never made that particular combination before, but it was perfect! 

The store was clean. I found I didn't need to talk the ice cream up because our friends were impressed enough with the service and the cleanliness and decor that they didn't need any convincing! I'm so glad this is part of the revitalization that's happening in OTR!

Such a dangerous location to tempt me with ice cream after cholesterol busting meals at Pontiac or Eagle. I never try the desserts at the places near here because I know that I can get some awesome scoops of ice cream at this location, literally just next door. It has all or most of the flavors at any other location. Service is good and there's always a place to sit inside or outside
We were told to try it and we were so happy we did. The ice cream is made in the very same fashion it used to be made back in 1870s. I can only picture how it was like back in the day. Loved it!

I can't tell the difference between good ice cream and really good ice cream. It was just ice cream to me. I tried the signature black raspberry chocolate chip. It was aight. I obviously liked it because it was ice cream, but I feel like the flavor tasted a little fake to me? Is a black raspberry just a blackberry?! I do like that they try to use locally sourced dairy!

After attending the Yelp Summer Bucket List Segway tour at the Garage in OTR my husband and I decided to take a walk down Vine and check out all of the local venues! It was our first time in OTR so it was definitely a treat. As soon as we saw a Graeter's I knew that was our next place to hit! I ordered a cup of the Caramel Gelato and it was just as good as I had expected it to be! The staff was very pleasant and shop was decent size for the location.

I came to visit ohio from ny and my friend tells us about this place. I got the chocolate chip cookie dough and it was amazing ! I must say the customer service is phenomenal. The woman came to give us water and let is try samples after we made our purchase. If I ever come back .... It will be here. Thank you for the wonderful ice cream and customer service.

Terrible customer service. I stood there for 3 minutes, briefly stepped away to see if there was a restroom I was planning on using after I ordered, came back and was told I lost my place in line because I stepped away for what was literally 10 seconds. Really?! Also the guy working the counter was a jerk about it. Lost a potential customer. Would not recommend.

I'm not a huge ice cream fan but I do prefer the fancy stuff. After eating and drinking way too much at the bars/restaurants down the street, my friend said I have to have Graater's if visiting Cincinnati. I just had a single scoop of the signature chip flavor and by golly it was pretty damn good. All the other flavors looked tempting as well but this one was awesome. I'm a believer and I'll try when I'm back in town. It was also cool that a restaurant we went to the next night had Graeter's on their menu. Good stuff.

My wife introduced me to Graeter's when we first started dating 7 years ago. I was promised "the best ice cream you'll ever have." As with most expectations, I went in skeptical, but boy was I surprised! Her statement was 100% correct. Graeter's is the smoothest, creamiest, most flavorful ice cream I've ever had. I regularly come back time and again. The black raspberry chip is my consistent favorite, but I've recently been branching out to the Black Cherry Chip. The seasonal flavors are always great, and they provide a good excuse to return regularly (as if you needed that). I should qualify my statement on best ice cream: My wife is certainly the aficionado in the family when it comes to ice cream, and she sees a plethora of criteria and seems to be impressed with subtle distinctions. While I respect that, I'm pretty basic when it comes to what I like: It has to have amazing constantly and incredible flavor. If those two things are there, I'm happy. Unfortunately, SO MUCH ice cream fails one or both of these criteria. Graeter's not only satisfies both of these; it exceeds them. If you are feeling like doing some ready, look up the French Pot method they have used since the mid 19th century to make the ice cream; it's fascinating. Graeter's will always be my local go-to when it comes to dessert. I also have a friend out of town who pays $$$ to have it shipped across the country for his parties, so you know it must be good. Trust me, go here.

Excellent ice cream and people watching in the OTR. Glad we saved room for dessert. I enjoy Graeters, I don't recall ever having it as a teen in the Cincy area. Whenever I'm in the area now I stop in for some of the best ice cream I can recall. Good thing it's available locally, but I try to limit my intake... for obvious, waistband expanding reasons!
Awesome ice cream and the staff was so nice and generous! I came in with my 4 year old and they hooked her up. Above and beyond. The facility is also very clean.
Delish!  Went after Reds game. Place was packed and it was late, but staff was still very attentive and the ice cream was great. Toffee chocolate chip was tonight's pick. Yum!

If you are a fan of ice cream, this is the place for you. The only reason I didn't stop in two or three times a day was due to a general concern for my health. The bourbon pecan chocolate chip was wonderful. I would say add more bourbon flavor!! If Graeters ever opens a store in Michigan, I will send you lots of business and sing all of your ice cream praises!

I love the seasonal ice cream selection!! Summer bonus flavors (yum). My friend got a scoop of coconut chocolate chip and was super impressed. Usually we go to Aglamesis, but we might have to come here more often!! Not super generous with portion sizes though.

Graeter's is a Cincinnati institution.  Their french pot ice cream is delicious and made with care.  Their flavors are simple but delicious.  The service is always delightful and never in a rush.  This is the best and most unique ice cream in Cincinnati.

I have had a couple good experiences. Tonight I had the worse strawberry shake ever. All milk and no flavor. Employees may need training to make consistent high quality product. Make sure to taste your product before leaving.

We stopped by Graeter's on Friday night after a late lunch and planned to really indulge. We are so glad we did! With a family of four, we had the opportunity to try many items. The two-scoop black raspberry "chip" in a waffle cone was awesome. The chips are more like boulders - they are huge. We also had a scoop of coconut chip and cookie dough chip - both awesome. The simple vanilla was also thick and packed with flavor. One note - this is some flavorful stuff, and we could see it being overwhelming if you come straight after a meal. Come with room in your belly and enjoy it all. If you are a fan of black raspberry chip, this is really a signature item.

I had the worst service from a guy named Semion at the Graeter's located in OTR. He rang our order up wrong and when I asked for the correction he got annoyed and huffy about it. Then he handed me my receipt and told me I had over 100 Graeter's points so I was eligible for a free item up to $12.95. (He said it could only be redeemed that day) I asked if it could be ice cream but he said merchandise only. So I asked him to show me the t-shirts they sell and in a very annoyed voice said, "We don't have any of them up here, I'd have to go ALL the way to the basement to get one." So I asked if he could get one before my family and I left and said, probably not."  So here I have this REWARD coupon valid only that day for being a very regular customer and he refused to show me the item I wanted. Lastly, I saw a few of the t-shirts displayed on a window sill, grabbed my size and took it back to the register to claim my rewards item. He then tells me I can only get the t-shirt if I make a purchase to which I responded, I just bought 5 cups of ice-cream. Not to mention, NO WHERE was it stated that I could only get my reward with a second purchase. So the nice lady next to me told him to use her ice cream cone on my rewards card so it would count for another purchase and he got mad about that and the tried to over charge her for her cone. I was FINALLY given the shirt and he wouldn't let me keep my receipt for the free item even though he'd already scanned the bar code, so I took a photo of it for proof that no where stated I had to make another purchase to receive my free item. Bottom line, his attitude was terrible, he acted like I was bothering him when I asked to see the t-shirts in the first place, then acted annoyed the he had to make a correction after over charging me on my first transaction, and then was refusing to give me the free item is earned by spending more than $100 at Graeter's.  I will only return there if I don't mind being treated poorly simply for asking for the attendant to serve me/the customer, don't mind being told "no" when asking to see some merchandise, don't care if I'm over charged, and lastly, being lied to in order to get more money/another transaction.  Sorry Graeter's, you'll always be my favorite ice creamery but today's visit left a poor taste in my mouth!!ml

This is one of my favorite Graeter's locations. Usually if I'm here, I've just seen a movie at The Esquire. There is nothing better than watching a good Indy film at The Esquire then getting some ice cream at Graeter's (bonus points if It's nice enough to walk around the neighborhood with said ice cream).

The staff here is always super friendly too.  Graeter's currently (during social distancing) offers pickup OR DELIVERY (I repeat, you can get Graeter's delivery). All the flavors are good, but I'm definitely a sucker for the Buckeye Blitz and the Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip (because duh). Even writing about it has me pondering when I can get some Graeter's ASAP.

Graeter's ice cream is a big deal in Ohio and I can see why. It was some of the richest, thickest ice creams I've ever had. I ordered the black raspberry chocolate chip and the buckeye blitz chocolate chip. The black raspberry flavor went real well with the chocolate chunks, and the peanut butter cookie dough of the buckeye blitz was nice and chewy. The other reviewers are not wrong when they mentioned large chocolate chip chunks in the ice cream. It gave a nice crunch and had just the right amount of bitterness to take the smooth, sweet ice cream to another level. I wish they had these outside of the mid-west, but for now, I'll always seek out Graeters when I'm there.

Delicious! The staff cannot seem to wait to help you. My kids said those are the friendliest people ever. My family loved that they knew everything about any item you asked about and they kept asking if you would like to try anything which my kids loved but did only have one sample bite a piece thank goodness. I had the buckeye blitz and it was yummy. Staff said it was one of their more popular flavors and I could see why. Lovely family outing to have a treat and the staff made it even more of a treat!
This older location was like stepping in a familiar old town shop. Very friendly service and delicious ice cream. Had to try Oprah's favorite flavor...Which was delicious!

Gem! Awesome ice cream! Had a Sunday tasted freaking amazing!! The chocolate chips are no chips, they are more like huge fudge chunks! The staff is super friendly and you can sample flavors before deciding. Plus some locations also carry bakery goods. The quality is all Graeter's. Translated, that means graet! 100% recommend!

As others have mentioned, the ice cream is great. However, I am writing a review about their ice cream CAKE. 

I bought the chocolate fantasy cake for someone's birthday, and it was pure ecstasy. They only have one size for their cakes. It serves 12 people for $35. I was originally worried that the cake was too big because I only planned on serving 2 people but NOPE --  I am 100% positive that I can finish this entire cake ON MY OWN within a few days. The chocolate fantasy cake was the perfect balance of cake, ice cream, chocolate whipped cream, and fudge on top. The fudge oozes down as you slice into the cake. PURE ECSTASY. I wish Graeter's can serve slices of ice cream cake as well so I can resist buying entire cakes for myself.

Graeters is AMAZING! This cute lil place is my go-to stop for all Icecream cravings.

Must try flavors:
Black chocolate raspberry
Cookies and cream
Anything with chocolate chips (esp Mocha)
Buckeye
Vienna coffee

Their sundaes are splendid too! I love the 1870 Tower.

My favorite ice cream, chocolate chip, at my favorite, Graeters

And, Mom had her free birthday sundae! She's 91 and LOVES Graeter's. She had a wonderfully delicious chocolate chip and coconut sundae with hot fudge topping. She smiled ear to ear

A visit to Cincinnati is not complete without going to Graeter's Ice Cream! You can't go wrong with whatever you order. I've had everything from milkshakes, sundaes, and single scoops and have yet to be disappointed. My personal favorite is the Buckeye Blitz. Graeter's also  recently made a "Boldly Bearcat" bicentennial flavor for the University of Cincinnati Bicentennial celebration this year and we ALL wish it was sold in stores.

Graeters is a Cincinnati classic - and this location doesn't disappoint! It's near UC and can get a little crowded at night, but overall it's one of my favorite locations in the Cincinnati area. 

If you haven't tried it, the black raspberry chocolate chip is the way to go. However, they have a variety of delicious flavors! Trust me, Graeters won't disappoint.

Just as you associate Garrett's with Chicago, Graeters is a well known Cincinnati tradition...but for ice cream of course. 

I was a regular at this place and now this has become a must stop for me every time I visit Queen City. 

I would always get mango sorbet and dark chocolate truffle in waffle cone. While this combo disgusted my friends, I think the richness of dark chocolate perfectly complimented and was cut by the tart and sweet mango sorbet. 

This recent visit was a bit disappointing since they did not have the dark choc flavor. Went with a different approach and tried the raspberry sorbet and bourbon pecan. Sorbet was a bit too sweet in my opinion but flavorful. Bourbon pecan was a delight, could actually taste the subtle sweet notes of bourbon!

They come up with interesting limited and seasonal flavors as well- right now the whole pumpkin jazz is in full swing. 

Servers are incredibly sweet and efficient, hardly have to wait in line considering it's popularity. 

Have sundaes, pints, some baked good and candies too. 

- As lovely as this neighborhood is, parking is annoying.  Street gets super busy in evening. Try street- couple blocks in.

This place has fast service, very friendly staff and delicious sundaes, shakes, and sorbets. I highly recommend their watermelon Sorber or their signature chocolate cherry ice cream. Located right down on Ludlow Avenue it's centrally located in a nice buzzing district of Cincinnati. There's a few small seats inside to sit at as well as a little bakery in the place to get cookies and other small treats.

We are huge fans of Graeter's and have been to many of their locations.  We went to the Clifton one last night.  It's smaller than most I've been to, but is very charming and I actually prefer the size.  They have everything that all the other ones do yet the people serving up the sweet concoctions were very nice and friendly.  The flavor of their ice-cream is a notch above any other ice-cream I've ever tried.

Graeter's ice cream is a Cincinnati staple! Try a few flavors before picking out what you're going to have. Sign up for their app for deals and rewards. They even offer you a free sundae on your birthday. The black raspberry chip is one you should try. They also have other seasonal flavors like peach, blueberry pie and chocolate coconut almond chocolate chip.

Seriously, the best ice cream I've ever had. I am genuinely hooked and wish there was a Graeters close to home. The black raspberry was at the perfect temperature giving it a ready to melt texture. Flavor was bold, sweet with a good tang. What shocked me the most was the huge hunks of dark chocolate in all interesting shapes, ready take over the bite. Exquisite. The line was long at this location, but moved fast. Friendly servers were happy to give samples of flavors.

I recently downloaded the new Graeter's ice cream app after getting an invite from my daughter. Because of the invite a free sugar cone was added to my account. I had 14 days to use it. With the time running out I came here on a week night. It was Valentine's Day but it was not busy upon arriving. My interaction with the college age employee was very pleasant. He gave me a taste of the new seasonal cherry chocolate chip which I decided to get. However during our conversation the female manager on duty abruptly and sharply spoke up to make it clear that it was a kid's sugar cone that was free. If I wanted a cup not a cone it would be a small size. I felt bad for the employee. Upon requesting a topping of chocolate sprinkles she again abruptly cut in to point out that a topping makes it a sundae. So it wouldn't be free stating that the register does not allow it to be rung up that way. I felt disrespected and knew that a topping would cost me extra but did not get the opportunity to say it. I switched to the bittersweet chocolate sauce & it tasted great. However I left feeling disrespected and sad for the employee. Until next time be kind to each other. #graetersicecream #yelpcincy

You can't go wrong with Graeter's. It's just one of those facts of life. Some of the best ice cream you will ever have. I think my favorite thing to get is two scoops of  Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip on a Dark Chocolate dipped Waffle Cone. True perfection. 

If it's someone's birthday and you love them, you should come here and get them any ice cream cake. They are AMAZEBALLS. 

This location also has the Graeter's Bakery in it which not all locations do. They have lots of yummy pasteries. 

This location is in the cool "Clifton Gaslight District". So it's always fun to go grab some ice cream and walk around the stores or the neighborhood. However, because of it's location this is one of the busiest locations to go too. If it's a weekend night, just attempt to go to a different one because this place will be packed.

Went to Graeter's during a visit to Ohio because you're just supposed to. 

I had the butter pecan and raspberry sorbet in a waffle cone. 

While the service was great, I found the ice cream to be too sweet and rich for my liking and left me quite dehydrated and unable to finish the whole cone. I felt it was a little pricey coming out to $10 for the two cones we ordered but got to add it to the Ohio must-have experience checklist

Service was excellent, that was the first thing that I noticed. Very willing to let you try any samples you want, but let's be honest, you're just going to end up getting black raspberry chip anyway. Went there with the coupon book from donating to the fund for children's cancer research. They had some difficulty with it, just be aware it may add a couple of minutes to your order that you weren't expecting. However, the manager handled it well.

I need to follow up on a previous review I did last week about having an  ice cream gift shipped.  It may have taken more than a week but the Grater's team made good with a bad order.  My gift was resent and friends received the shipment with 24 hrs frozen solid.  This was the first introduction of the ice cream to our friends and they absolutely loved it.  They were impressed that they made good on their promise to deliver frozen.  Thank you Grater's I will for sure order long distance again!

How can you be from Cincinnati and not like Graeters, unless you're lactose and tolerant? I am kind of bias, but this ice cream is the bomb diggity. 

The high butter fat content of the ice cream makes it smooth, rich, creamy and down right delicious. 

My favorites are peanut butter chip, choc chip cookie dough and key lime. Graeters is great!

This is my favorite Graeter's location. It's always clean, it's close to campus, and the staff is always friendly! As always, all the treats are good, but their ice cream is the best! No matter what other ice cream places I try, no matter where, Graeter's always remains my favorite.

Black Raspberry Chip.

Literally nothing else to say about this place.

Graeter's definitely has the best ice cream I've ever tasted.

The Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip is amazing. 

So is the Black Cherry Chocolate chip.

Mmmmm.

This particular evening at this particular location, I opted for a bowl of Black Cherry. A "traditional" bowl costs a little under $4 and gets you a large scoop of delicious ice cream. I thought it was a bit pricy at first, but after devouring it, soooo worth it.

The only thing I don't like about their ice cream are the giant chocolate chips inside. I'm not a huge fan of chocolate and having to crunch giant chips is a bit annoying. Fortunately, there was only one monster-sized chocolate chip in the cup so I didn't waste too much.

As for this location, I wanted to linger a bit more but my husband was eager to get our ice cream and head out the door to the plaza across the street. I didn't really get to explore but I did spot a little bakery area with cookies, homemade candies, treats, and gifts in additon to the ice cream counter. A few vintage-y tables are available for a place to sit down. Overall, pretty cute place.

Can't wait to get my hands on some more Graeters again!

Undoubtedly, this is the best icecream I've so far had in the States. They have simple, straightforward flavor options unlike most of the other places. Oh! They even have a pretzel cone! 
Being my first time, I tried their Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip, also their bestselling flavor. It was heavenly! Not too sweet, just perfect. Wish they had branches across the country!

The customer service at this location was great. The two ladies working were so nice to me and my family. I went in after craving a shake and ordered a vanilla shake. My wife got the eggnog shake. We argued over whose was better. Naturally, we agreed to disagree but I'm almost certain mine was better! We were reminded that I had a birthday and I was given a free sundae which I thought was the coolest thing ever. I gave it to my 4 year old and he devoured it. Wasn't planning on giving him sugar that late but plans change right? We were three of five people in the joint and its set up really well for people watching so we sat for a while and watched....until my kid realized they sold candy! Something about eating ice cream on a cold night really warms me up (literally)! I've been here a few times and they are consistently good. What they lack in flavor options they make up for in every other areas.

Not so humbly submitted,
Michael C.

I come here all the time and never have any problems, today the girl taking my order moaned and sighed when I said it (a sugar cone with coconut and black raspberry) and she went "Those are the hardest ones to scoop." She then proceeded to make me change my order to put it in a bowl and on top of that, she gave me cookies and cream. Weird. I like this place but this was just especially awkward and a bit rude.

I get a rush of childhood nostalgia whenever I eat a spoonful of black raspberry chocolate chip ice cream. It's such a Greater's classic. And it never disappoints. I shared a bowl with my family and it was a perfect way to end an evening.

YUM!! Big night for me - first time having chili at Skyline and now my first time at Graeter's. A kids cup of black raspberry chocolate chip ice cream is the perfect dessert for my Cincinnati night! And I was able to pick up some dark chocolate gifts!
