You can't go wrong with Graeters ice cream when i lived in Columbus i went all the time i ordered the s'mores ice cream on a waffle cone but they surprise was the blackberry mint ice cream I was told this is there number one seller I see now why I normally don't go for this type of flavor but very tasty well played graeters a nice surprise to my blue collar sensibilities!

Yesterday, I went to Graeter's with my mom and gramma so I could get my birthday sundae - something I look forward to all year long! If you're part of their rewards program, you get a free sundae the week of your birthday! I now live in St. Louis, but I made the trip to Cincinnati for a week of celebrations and you bet Graeter's had to be included! I miss having them nearby! Their ice cream is delicious and the chocolate chips are more like chocolate chunks (I've found some the size of my palm). So it's not surprising that my favorite flavors all have chocolate chips - Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip, Coconut Chocolate Chip, Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip, Black Cherry Chocolate Chip, Toffee Chocolate Chip, Mocha Chocolate Chip. That's what awesome about Graeter's - it's not a place where I get stuck getting the same flavor every time. There are so many great ones that I can switch it up every time! They also have some fantastic seasonal flavors - currently they have the cinnamon (which is one of my favorites because it takes like a snickerdoodle cookie) and pumpkin!

There are Graeter's all over the city. So no matter what part of town you're in, you can always find one near by. Thank goodness!

What a disappointment. I absolutely love Graeter's ice cream but every time I come in this location I am so turned off by what I believe is the manager that I actually don't want the ice cream anymore. I'm not sure who the woman with the short hair and the black polo shirt is but the way she treats the employees is embarrassing and degrading. Also, there is an employee named Bingo that is not far behind her. No matter how friendly you two are to the customers if you treat your colleagues like garbage it shows. I normally don't think it's appropriate to call people out like this but I'm fed up with what I see every time I'm there. Please don't take this lightly. I saw both of you speak down to a young man working tonight 9/27/19 in a way that made me sick. He looked like he was on the verge of tears. No one deserves to be treated that way. And let me reiterate this is not an isolated incident. For the sake of your employees I hope someone sees this.

So I know this is basically blasphemy here in Cincinnati, and I'm going get doused in hatorade for saying it, but I think Graeter's is just what the 3 yelp star rating says: A-OK. It's not the best I've ever had (by a long shot), but it's ice cream that tastes like what your grandma would have made for you on a hot summer day (if my grandma could make ice cream...). It's rich and creamy, which is what you want in ice cream. My only qualm is that the fruit flavors taste so artificial. Is it so awful slash difficult to have strawberry that actually tastes like strawberries? 

The best part about Graeter's is the chocolate chip part. Haha, they should just call it _(insert flavor here)__ Ginormous Block of Chocolate. Doesn't quite have the same ring to it though. But unearthing the whole block is probably my favorite Graeter's pasttime. I think I need new hobbies. 

Do I like anything there? Actually, there are a couple of flavors that I look for when I'm at Mejier, shopping the ice cream aisle which I will buy if they're on sale. Cookies n' Cream, Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough, and Buckeye Blitz. They're always winners in my book.
Love Graeter's. Period.  This location is always busy and open late on Saturdays. Parking is a bit tricky; look for a lot down the street.

Review mostly for this branch with a little dollop about the ice cream. 

I'm not sure what it is about this branch but I never enjoy it. I went here recently with a friend. It was a Friday, early evening, and the place was nearly empty. (One other party of 2 was there.) My friend didn't know what she wanted so she took extra time checking out the menu and trying 2 flavors. The staff member helping us was not friendly and seemed almost annoyed. She never offered suggestions and just stared at us. 

I ended up getting the low gylcemic mint chocolate chip. My biggest complaint about Graeter's in general is it's too heavy and sugary. This option was a great choice for me! Tasted great and light. Thankfully I don't have a nut allergy because somehow mine ended up with a chunk of walnut(?) right in the middle. The staff must not have really cleaned up the scoop well enough I guess. 

Also the place had a serious mildew smell. I could hardly stand by the counter and could even smell it while sitting inside. I would have gone out if it wasn't raining at the time. The sponge that they use to smack off the water from the scoops did not look good. It just did not seem sanitary. 

I would have given a 1 star if not for the ice cream. I'll keep to generally avoiding this branch in the future.

Of all the Graeter's locations, this is one of my favorites.  I have been coming to this location since I was a child, and in recent years I have brought the kids I babysit on a frequent basis.  All of the staff is always friendly and willing to let you sample flavors or give suggestions. According to the 13 year old I babysit "I like the window seats, so you can watch all the people going by!" I wholy agree that this aspect gives charm to the location.  On this past visit I tried the carmelized chocolate which is a summer of 2017 bonus flavor.  It had a unique texture with the occasional bit of caramel in it.  I will definitely be returning soon to have it again before it disappears!

On a recent road trip from TX to NY I looked for local favorites along the way and Graeter's came up pretty frequently. After trying the ice cream here I can see why. It's great. It's made in very small batches (about 2 gallons at a time) and it's creamy and delicious.
The lady behind the counter was also fantastic. She was charming and polite. Although I didn't even notice, she had accidently switched the second scoop on my cone with another flavor. When she realized it she came out and apologized and brought a scoop of the flavor I'd originally ordered in a cup.
If you go, try the Black Raspberry Chip. It's insanely good.

Nice cute shop. Tried sampling several of their ice creams. I picked the "Buckeye" which has dark chocolate ice Team with chunky chocolate chips with mini peanut butter balls. 

Chocolate ice cream and chunky chips were good and satisfying.  The peanut butter part isn't. It was like eating an ice cube. 

I saw the bakery part and haven't tasted it. Saw bags of different kinds of cookies for sale. All seemed hard and dry. Perhaps that's that store type. Who knows. :-)

I came back to Cinti while visiting here for a couple of weeks. The chocolate chip and the raspberry chip were still amazing and it was great to see you have not changed the quality since I was little. Yummy.

I'm from out of town, and my Cinncy friends wanted to ensure I try their local ice cream. We went to this location after dinner.

Prompt service, lots of interesting flavors. Overall, this is a fantastic ice cream - thick and creamy. Lots of seating and the restaurant was clean. 

I had the peanut butter & chocolate, double chocolate, and cookies and cream ice creams. I liked the cookies and cream the most, but probably because it was the least sweet. 

YUM
Love their ice cream and try and stop by every time we visit Cincinnati. My favorite is their black raspberry chocolate chip. It is heaven!

While I agree I'm not big on ice creams, u was quite underwhelmed with the prof Co to taste. Maybe all the hype took to me and I carried over unrealistic expectations. For now it's meh for me. Will probably revisit in the summer.
A Cincinnati classic! If you're in the area, you must go to Graeter's! Amazing ice cream and a very cute inside area to enjoy your sweet treat!

While we were visiting from out of town, our friends said we had to have Graeter's ice cream because it is one of the best.  It really is.  I did a bowl of the mint chocolate chip.  It was delicious and had a perfect creamy texture with the right amount of big chocolate chips (more like chunks). 

I definitely want to come back and try their black raspberry chocolate chip.  It was just featured on Food Network as one of the top ice creams in the country.

What a wonderful ice cream parlor! I have always been a big fan of the ice cream at graeters, but this location is one of the best places to enjoy it. Located in the beautiful gas light district on Ludlow, grab your cone, sundae or pastry and take a walk around the beautiful neighborhood, or make your way across the street to by he Clifton plaza where on Friday and Saturdays you are likely to find live music playing. Parking is located on the street, or in the business district lot,located on Howell behind Clifton plaza. You can also take the new Cindy red bike and park it in Howell as well and walk up the steps!

Overall this graeters will not disappoint.

I would give it a five star rating - however - i will wait for the Blueberry pie ice cream that they make in August.  :(

Had the Peach and it is pretty good.  Lots of chunks of fresh peaches incorporated.

Oprah, you got it right! This place blew it out of the park with its ice cream. I got the blackberry chocolate chip ice cream. The large chocolate chunks didn't bother me at all as it had to other Yelpers. I found the chunks not to be hard, but very soft. It's sad that this place is only found in Cincinnati, but I will definitely be making an order from this place in the near future!

Favorite Childhood spot and Graeters location. Cannot beat the quality and taste of graeter's ice cream. Anything on the menu is great but my favorite flavors include mocha and/or mint chocolate chip. The chocolate chips are the size of a quarter which is crazy. Recently they introduced coconut chocolate chip which is so good and the coconut is not overwhelming. If you're undecided definitely ask to try the flavor and make sure you're a rewards member! Definitely a landmark if your visiting Cincinnati.

When I eat out with my family,  we will usually go to this Graeter's afterwards.  It's always a good time sitting on the stools overlooking all of Ludlow's hipsters walking the streets or just watching people inside drip ice cream all over themselves.  

The ice cream is really good.  I usually get the black raspberry but the last two times I tried the new salted caramel and the peanut butter.  The salted caramel was very good but the peanut butter was amazing.  As usual, it came with huge chunks of goodness in the ice cream which is usually the site of disaster for me.  I always try and dig the pieces out and in turn I'll drip ice cream on myself.  I know its going to happen, but my inner child doesn't listen.  Oh well, that's what a washing machine is for.

Check Graeter's out if you're in the area, you won't be disappointed.

Graeters is, of course, a Cincinnati institution. I love their ice cream though I must admit I usually stick with simple flavors. Coffee being my go to flavor. Other people go on about the huge chunks of chocolate but to me it just seems lazy. Chop those chunks up for us dammit- you think I got all that time for chewing? 
The bakery has some nice items as well. I love the toffee cookies and the white glazed doughnut are very good, though I'm not in love with the name- Glazed Happiness. Seriously, don't make me asked for Glazed Happiness. 
The cheese crowns are a must on a Sunday with coffee. 
This is a location I can walk to so its where I usually go. The folks working there are always nice. 
I am not in love with the interior so I usually just order and leave. For some reason it feels like a place where they'd hose down prisoners before taking them to their cell. The lighting is harsh and just not pleasant. 
Aside from my picky gripes, I stop in quite often and recommend you do the same.

This place should be Cincinnati's famous food! Absolutely delicious, creamy, sweet tasting ice cream. I found this ice cream to be very delicious. I enjoyed a double waffle cone of salted caramel with chocolate chip ice cream which was absolutely amazing. All the cones were beautifully crafted and the ice cream had the perfect balance of sweetness. This place was fantastic and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone looking for some good ice cream in the greater Cincinnati area. My goodness!

Black Raspberry Chip.

I mean, I like Graeter's, but there's basically no other flavors at this place.  Black Raspberry Chip is better than many ice creams, but I've had better ice cream at other places.  Sorry Cincy!

I love the water fountain at this location, reminds me of the dentist.
It's Graeter's, you can't go wrong. I like the proximity of this location to a bunch of cool things in the area. The seasonal blueberry pie is scrumptious!

Excellent location, friendly staff (especially Kamal), and ice cream is super rich and creamy. A bit pricy, but get the double in a cup for a hefty portion (and you an get a to-go lid if needed). Or, get a mini cone for just the right amount of ice cream!!!

My sister suggested I visit here while visiting her. Great call!! My wife and I shared their bourbon sunday thinking it would be a great local tasted of Southwest Ohio and were not disappointed. The staff was extremely friendly and treated this outsider like a local regular. 

The sundae was great with the taste of bourbon mixed with the deep flavorful chocolate sauce and vanilla ice cream that was soft and tasted like it just came out of the mixing bowl. 

On a side note, with the donuts being sold there too, I am surprised no one came up with a dish that would be something like a donut shortcake ice cream sundae contraption.

I recommend Graeters to all who can hear this one!
The ice cream here is great, the price is kinda high but ITS SO GOOOOOD. Also the staff is really nice. I go here a lot and I'm always very pleased with the service.

I LOVE this charming ice cream spot--I wish we had one back home. The employees are very friendly and eager to help and it's no wonder this place stays busy until closing time. For my first experience, I had the Toffee Chocolate Chip--so delicious! I inhaled the whole cup. Can't wait to go back!

I have a saying: Ice cream is the only thing I take seriously.

Graeter's is some pretty good ice cream, and the best chain ice cream I've had. Their vanilla is solid, hot fudge sauce good and serving sizes generous. What I found most interesting was their whipped cream, which appears to be made by whipping air in manually as you would if you made it at home rather than charging a tank with nitrous oxide.

Be advised what they call 'chocolate chip' is really more like 'chocolate ribbon'. Their chip flavors have chewy ribbons of chocolate in them, rather than chunks or (my ideal) flakes. For the uninitiated, chocolate chip ice cream is made by pouring molten chocolate in the cold ice cream as it is being spun in the machine. The hardness, consistency and size of the chips are adjusted by the temperatures of the ice cream and chocolate being poured in. Personally, I like tiny, crisp flakes of chocolate. Graeter's is fine, just different.

I've been back a couple times. It's worth the trip when visiting Cincinnati.

My wife introduced me to Graeter's when we first started dating 7 years ago. I was promised "the best ice cream you'll ever have." As with most expectations, I went in skeptical, but boy was I surprised! Her statement was 100% correct. Graeter's is the smoothest, creamiest, most flavorful ice cream I've ever had. I regularly come back time and again. The black raspberry chip is my consistent favorite, but I've recently been branching out to the Black Cherry Chip. The seasonal flavors are always great, and they provide a good excuse to return regularly (as if you needed that). I should qualify my statement on best ice cream: My wife is certainly the aficionado in the family when it comes to ice cream, and she sees a plethora of criteria and seems to be impressed with subtle distinctions. While I respect that, I'm pretty basic when it comes to what I like: It has to have amazing constantly and incredible flavor. If those two things are there, I'm happy. Unfortunately, SO MUCH ice cream fails one or both of these criteria. Graeter's not only satisfies both of these; it exceeds them. If you are feeling like doing some ready, look up the French Pot method they have used since the mid 19th century to make the ice cream; it's fascinating. Graeter's will always be my local go-to when it comes to dessert. I also have a friend out of town who pays $$$ to have it shipped across the country for his parties, so you know it must be good. Trust me, go here.

Late night ice cream cravings? This one is right next to the UC campus and is also conveniently located near my place. Whenever I get my ice cream cravings or one of my GFs gets it we will do random trips here. It's in a cute neighborhood too, Gaslight District. My favorite flavor so far is the the Buckeye. So good!

I don't know why but I feel like this is my favorite location. There is just something nostalgic about going on a date to the Esquire and then getting a scoop of ice cream after. 

Like many others have said Graeter's is the Cincinnati ice cream. It's been around forever. I am not a huge fan of chocolate and almost every ice cream here has gigantic hunks of real chocolate in it. So if you are a chocolate lover this is your heaven. The ice cream flavors themselves are pretty classic. I usually just go for cookies and cream, but everyone seems to swoon over Black Raspberry Chip. If you haven't had it before I would suggest getting a taste. 

They also offer tons of home made chocolate candies, gifts, and bakery items. The tables and chairs take you back to a simpler time. Everything about this location screams 50's ice cream parlor and I love it. A great date night spot for sure!

I live in California and my parents live in Chicago - so you how, you might ask, did I end up with 6 pints of Graeter's in my Bay Area freezer?

My mother decided to have them OVERNIGHT ME 6 PINTS OF GRAETER'S as a surprise -- the chip selection (black raspberry, strawberry, mocha, peanut butter, vanilla, chocolate chocolate chip)  -- it's all glorious and well worth the extra hours I'll have to put in at the gym to continue to fit into my clothing as a result of indulging in all this lusciousness.

A wonderful gift for your favorite ice cream fanatic, fat ass, or some delightful combination of both ;)
Chocolate chocolate chip.  Huge chunks of Valrhona rich dar chocolate in slightly spiced chocolate ice cream made with real cream.

This in my opinion, is the world's BEST ice cream.  I think I first had Graeters in 1984 while visiting a friend that was going to UC.  Ever since then, a trip to Graeters is a requirement when going to Cincy.  

There ice cream is divine.  Even my sister, who has a milk intolerence, on our last trip to Cincy, had some ice cream.  She thought the suffering would be worth it.

My favorite is the Turtle Sundae with Mocha Chip ice cream.  HUGE chunks of chocolate.  And you MUST have the fresh whipped cream.   Also the bittersweet chocolate with raspberry sundae is divine.

I've heard Oprah talk about Graeters on her show.  Even she loves it.  I think you can have it shipped.  But to me, part of the charm, is going to Clifton, walking around shopping and ending up at Graeters!

IF you have never been to Greaters, GO!!! Whats stopping you?!  If its Oprahs favorite thing, you at least have to see what all the fuss is about!

This is my favorite location for Graters!!  The store is on the corner of Ludlow and Telford, and is also on the 17 and 19 bus stop!  When you walk inside, there is an entire retail/bakery section where you can get fresh baked goods, chocolates and even some souvenirs to send to others who are missing out.  I especially love the eat in at the several tables they have set up, which always have flowers or something in the center just to jazz it up.  I also love how much detail the servers put into making somethign as simple as a sundae.  No joke, last night I ordered a sundae with raspberry toppings, whipped-cream, nutts and a cherry and this man looked like he was painting a Picaso.  Even the people behind us said how it looked jsut like the picture on the wall (which by the way, if you have not seen, they have giant framed photos of their ice cream all over which is awesome and kind of over the top/hilarious all in one).  

Check it out, especially at this location!  There is always a line which tells me people keep coming back for more!

We were visiting from out of town and our friend said we absolutely had to try Graeter's.  Apparently everyone else had the same idea.. it was after 9pm and the line was to the door.  We didn't have to wait more than 10 minutes though, but the line grew and wrapped around the store behind us. 
Our friend was right though- the ice cream was delicious! I shared a with my husband- we got a double cup with toffee chip and peanut butter chip.  I preferred the toffee chip to the peanut butter. 
-1 star for the service and the odd taste of the gelato I tried.  I asked if I could sample the hazelnut gelato and frankly I thought it was nasty.  It had a very weird aftertaste.  I asked if I could try the peanut butter chip and got such a nasty look that I hesitated to try a different one.  We guessed with the toffee (didn't sample it), and I ended up loving it more than the peanut butter.  Our one cup with 2 scoops ended up being just over $4 (a little pricey but it was good).  It really was delicious- I was only going to have a couple bites but ended up eating half of the cup we shared.

So I suppose it's a tradition to come here whenever you're here in Cincinnati, so it's no surprise that I would make my way here. This is my first time here in town and I had no clue what/where to go.  Upon asking a local waitress, she was adamant that I must try 2 places in town, Skyline's Chili and Graeter's Ice Cream.

I tried the Black Raspberry Chip and Black Cherry Chip.  It did not disappoint.  The flavor/texture is unique.  It was pretty good.  However the chocolate chips were huge chunks and I think due to the ice cream making processes, sometimes it'll break it up into small pieces, which I like better.  So that's the only issue with it, but I sure there are other people that may favor it more.  Just my preference... 

Just saw Graeter's ice cream at the grocery store! And just couldn't help myself from purchasing some.
Omg! Love, love, love this place... Super close to my house... Staff are friendly.... Price is reasonable... They have a bakery and candy shop at this place too!!! Must go!

It's Graeter's. It's good. Very good. My wife likes peach ice cream and I have to admit that Graeter's makes an improvement on God's fruit. Black raspberry chip? Yeah. That's what taste buds were made for. 

But, and it took me a long time to put my finger on this objection, I always feel as if - for an ice cream parlor - Graeter's lack warmth. 

They never seem comfortable. It's almost as if I'm walking into a formal setting. Maybe because many are a bit too dark. Maybe it's because there isn't the lights and neon of a walk up ice cream place.

That doesn't take away from the treats. They're great.
Ice cream! What else can i say. Very good and tasty. Always busy at this location. I have always thought that the price is quite high for 2 scoops.

There are so many good ice cream options, and they have a bakery as well with free samples (at least in the afternoon).  We were only in Cincinnati for 24 hours, but we went to Graeters after both dinner and lunch.  We had the banana chocolate chip, the peach, and the Buckeye Blitz as the mini-scoops one time, and the other time we had passion fruit guava sorbet.  It would be best done as an afternoon snack instead of after a meal, but if you aren't there long enough to do that, this is a definite stop however you can get it in!
Friendly staff and great ice cream as always! Parking can be somewhat difficult depending on the time of day though.
Since moving to Cincinnati, no other ice cream can compare. Family friendly atmosphere and great service make this ice cream to die for!

I had an inordinate amount of Graeter's Ice Cream during my time in Cincinnati.  I enjoy ice cream.  I can't really say that the ice cream was as great as everyone hyped it up to be.  

The flavors I tasted were black rasberry chip, vanilla with bean (I don't know why they just don't call it vanilla bean), peanut butter chip.  They were all good.  But, the flavor I especially enjoyed was blueberry pie (only being served for a limited time).

The location is really nice...a great place to walk around afterward with restaurants and other shops to check out.

This Clifton location is your typical Graeter's.  I do like the fact that the windows are lined with stools so you can watch the streets for traffic and people that are interesting.  I keep hoping that Graeter's will stop serving sundaes in those shallow plastic bowls with a flimsy plastic spoon.

I had been to the downtown location previously and didn't like the store. I will ALWAYS love the icecream but my opinion is that you shouldn't neglect your stores just because your product is amazing.

So this store was a lot better than the downtown location. I still think they could make the stores better but at least this one was clean, with friendly staff and a lot of products to choose from!

My favorite Graeter's store so far in Cincy!
Black raspberry chip, mocha chip are among our favorites. Best ice cream we've been to and Ludlow location is our favorite. The service is excellent.

Graeter's Ice Cream is always something I enjoy having whenever I come to visit Cincinnati! The Raspberry Chip is a must! Next time I will have to get the mocha chip. The service was good, nothing to complain about.

If you are visiting Ohio, or live there, this is a great place to go!  They have good selections and tasty treats.  

Side Note:  They also have dog treats that were a huge hit with my friends dog.  Random, I know, but try them out.  Not you, but your dog.  ;)

If you don't enjoy this place, if you don't think this is the best ice cream, you're smoking crack!

I used to live just around the corner from this ice cream store and I credit it for the 20 pounds I gained while living there. 

But seriously... it's a great location with the greatest ice cream in the world. Bottom Line.

Yea, I'm going there; Greater's is Great ice cream!

I have had several different flavors and I have really enjoyed every one. Holiday Peppermint, Cookies and Cream, sherbets...

Their ice creams are super creamy and chokc full of huge pieces of treats (like cookies). If you're into that kind of thing, I wholly recommend it.

The staff there is mighty pleasant and I always have great service there. 

I look forward to eating all the ice creams! Plus the Clifton area is full of Indian restaurants so eat something spicy and then cool off!
Rich, creamy, home-made ice cream. In addition to ice cream I really appreciated being served by kind, patient (I have kids who take their time) and communicative servers.

This is by far my favorite ice cream in the world. If I hadn't moved to Cincinnati, my life would be a shambles without having ever discovered Graeter's!

What you find at one Graeter's location, you can find at all the others: delicious ice cream. What sets this shop apart from the others I've been to in the Cincinnati metro area is the shop itself.

The staff is very friendly. The storefront just LOOKS appealing to the eye. When you walk in, you see not only the ice cream area, but the delicious-looking confections area with so many sweets on display that you will get a sugar high just walking past it!

If you are ever on Ludlow and need some dessert after your dinner at Ambar, Habanero, or Skyline, walk down the block and get some Graeter's!

I will forever love Graeter's since going to college at UC (University of Cincinnati) up the street from the Ludlow location. The area is great for window shopping, so this location is always busy. Graeter's is just one of those Cincinnati things, almost as notorious as Skyline Chili. As I'm writing this I'm contemplating having some shipped to me in California.

My favorite flavor is Black Raspberry Chip but actually you can't go wrong if you get any of their flavors with chocolate chips because they aren't the chocolate chips you're expecting- they're more like chewy slabs of chocolate that kind of melt in your mouth.

Graeter's ice cream is always a nice place to go after dinner.

Pros:
1) Location- Ludlow is a nice street to walk around while eating your ice cream
2) The ice cream - Most people love the black raspberry chip ice cream but I prefer the brownie sundae, especially if you ask them to warm the brownie first.
3) The staff is really friendly and the atmosphere is very welcoming.

Cons:
1) Sometimes the lines can be huge, really not that big of a deal but it can get annoying

Overall I would definitely recommend this place if you are hanging out in Clifton.

Graeters Oprah-endorsed ice cream is a must-try for anyone visiting the city and a mainstay for the locals. This shop off of Ludlow serves as a great spot for people watching, picking up your bakery or confectionery needs, and grabbing a cone before one of the outdoor concerts in the park. I highly recommend the 1870 tower for yourself or to share. If you're a newbie, they sell mini scoops so you can try several flavors. I usually get the kids size - it's so rich and buttery that I don't usually want anything more than that!

My favorite ice cream.  You simply must try a variety that includes chocolate chips, because when they say "chocolate chip", they often mean "piece of chocolate often equivalent to the size of a Hershey's Kiss, only with much better quality chocolate."  Black Raspberry Chip is my favorite, but they've got several varieties on the menu.

According to the guy behind the counter, Graeter's is why Oprah's diets all fail...she gets it shipped to her house!

The best ice cream in the world is here.  I believe it is the only place left in the country that does French pot-style handmade ice cream.  The result is the creamiest thing you've ever had.  I have no idea how anything other than black raspberry chip tastes because I didn't need to branch out after I tasted their signature flavor.  The huge chunks of chocolate are sooooo good and unlike any other ice cream you will find.

I'm sure I'll have some shipped to New England at some point, but I'm afraid it'll spoil me for other ice cream that I don't have to ship across the country.  If you're in the city, you must have some Graeter's.

Graeter's is a Cincinnati staple-  and if it's good enough for Oprah to mail-order, I was happy to check it out. I tried the raspberry chip which is their classic flavor. It was sweet and creamy and quite good. This place is known for their excessively large chocolate chips. I took home a $5 pint to my fiance as a little surprise.Just be prepared to bring your own cooler as theirs aren't exactly inexpensive ($10 for a Styrofoam cooler seemed a tad excessive to me).

I feel a little guilty pooping on the local favorites (mostly chili), but here's a spot I felt was decent.

Its not special, and its not "super premium" ice cream by most national standards.  High overrun, and the texture is a little weird, I suspect I am also pickier about non-natural coagulants than your average joe, but hey I love my ice cream.

Good effort at flavor variety.  The chocolate "chips" are a bit overwhelming, as they can become really REALLY big chunks because of the process, but some people probably love it for exactly that reason.

For a few bucks, its worth the adventure, and I recommend anyone try it once for the genuine Cincinnati/Midwest experience.

Its good in comparison to the local peers, but I don't see any big city folk banging down the doors to bring Graeter's to their local stores.  And as far as regional ice creams go, Blue Bell in Texas is always going to be the winner in my heart.

I tried their blueberry pie ice cream, and that was decent. A little too sweet for my taste though, and I think they definitely could've done more with the mixed-in pie crust -- it was honestly a little bland. A graham cracker or a heavy shortbread crust would've been perfect.

The malt ball (I kept thinking this was "moth ball" when everyone was talking about it, hoho!) ice cream that I sampled was pretty durned good though.  I'll probably get this the next time I'm at Graeter's.

The Good: THE BEST ICECREAM IN THE WORLD. Seriously I have yet to have one that tops the almost all variety's of Graeters (and I've had a lot of ice cream around the us/world). My absolute favorite is the mint chip. I'm saddened at the fact they took out the green food coloring because that was the only "unnatural" part of a brand that is going 100% natural. People eat with their eyes, this is almost as devastating to me as Pepsi Clear was back in the 90's.

The Bad: It's all the way in Cincinnati, I can have it shipped that's a hell of an expensive way to keep myself fat. This place is also bad because I get very greedy and don't like to share my Graeter's.

The Ugly: I eat this stuff by the pint other than the sheer amount of saturated fats and calories I intake I grew to be lactose intolerant a year or so ago. I power through it, lactase doesn't seem to help (and I've had 3 of them before a binge).

Another note about Graeters where I am extremely upset is they got rid of the classic yellow cake with vanilla ice cream. This was topped with fudge and aside from their mint chip my favorite dessert hands down. If I were to be on death row for my last meal I would request Graeter's for my dessert.

On a plus note I hear they'll be distributing Graeter's across all Krogers. Sadly they don't have on in Chicago, but I'm proud that my hometown Icecream is expanding their operation and going national (I just hope this doesn't compromise quality).

I bought a vanilla chocolate ice cream cake recently and it was smelling real bad.. I believe they sold me an expired product or the cake that was not fresh!!!

Update 11/14: Someone from Greater's contacted me and offered to refund or provide me with a fresh cake. It was nice for them to contact me and offer it. I declined the offer though!!

Black raspberry chip is the mist try selection here and is what made Oprah proclaim it to be the best ice cream she had tried a few years back.

They have fantastic seasonal selections that are always worth a taste and their bakery and confections are delicious. I will often stop in for Saturday morning donuts between ice cream trips.

This little part of town is very nice as well and there are plenty of dinner choices on the street so that you can make this a dessert stop afterwards. Of course this place is worthy of a trip all its own!

They sell pints in the Kroger owned grocery stores around the country if you are lucky enough to have once nearby.

I guess if you're in Cincy, you gotta come to this institution right?  That's exactly what I did for a late night snack and it does not disappoint at all.  I went ahead and got the order of three mini cones which is exactly what it sounds like, three double mini scoops on separate cones.  Make sure you get some flavors with their oversized chocolate chips in them as I quickly found out that's what they're known for.  Oh yeah, their mint chocolate chip is white instead of green...I don't know why, but that seemed like something worth noting.
The best ice cream you'll ever have. I wish they wouldn't have closed the Newport, KY location.

I love everything they sell! The staff are friendly and they always go above and beyond by accepting late orders, and putting things to the side if you call ahead. The next time you go in for an ice cream cone you MUST try the pretzel cone w/ Chocolate Coconut Almond Chip ice cream...delicious!

I never really liked hard ice cream until Graeter's changed my taste for it! Often craving the Black Raspberry Chip and Peanut Butter Chip Signature flavours, I wish I could find the buckets of ice cream in Canadian superstores. Well I guess I'll have to move to America to get my Graeter's ;)

The other great ice cream of Ohio, (come to Chicago!) the chocolate ribbon is wonderfully integrated into the ice cream and the flavors just melt in your mouth. This place is worth a drive to Ohio just for an ice cream tour

As a tourist and first timer visiting Cincy anyone will tell you that a trip to Graeter's is a must. 

People in Ohio love their ice cream and they want you to try Graeters and UDF and decide which one is right for you.

I went with the black raspberry ice cream with chocolate chip chunks. The ice cream is great, I love anything fresh and locally made.

Their are Graeters throughout the city and you need to try one before you leave. They have a long list of flavors and everything is very good!

I've never understood why people were overly fond of Graeter's.  It's a nice place for ice cream, but I always found to to be pricey.  I don't think the ice cream is that fantastic, but that's just me.

I was in a local Publix supermarket in south Florida and saw a few pints of Graeter 's ice cream on the shelf.  They had a very small allotment of shelf space but they weren't shy about the price  ($5.39 per pint). I briefly remember reading about this chain and I equated the high price with quality.  As soon as I picked up the pint I knew it had a high butterfat content based on the weight.  I chose plain old vanilla with chocolate chips.  All I can say is that it is average in taste in the super premium ice cream category.  I actually think Haagen Daz tastes better.  For those folks who think Blue Bell is better, you must have a taste bud deficit. Blue Bell should be called ice milk because it has so much less butterfat than the premium brands.  When you weigh a pint of BB to Graeter's it is not even close.  You actually think that half the pint is missing from BB.  Bottom line, you will really like the taste of Graeter's but it is by no means worth the ultra premium price of $5.39 a pint.  I will stick with Haagen Daz when their sale price is $2.50 each (yes I know it's 14 ounces now). Still half the price of Graeter's and much better taste.

I haven't been to this location since I was at UC... let me tell ya, that was a while ago.  But, I remember having so much fun there.  The ice cream is to die for, that's a given.  I've had it shipped to me in California and have eaten it with family in Columbus.  However, the Ludlow location is what makes it the best.  Near campus, this place looks like an old soda shop.  Going here for a cone on a hot summer night after catching a flick at the Esquire is the quintessential way to enjoy your time at UC.  I highly recommend Graeter's.  Its my favorite dessert ever.

So...I am a huge fan of ice cream.  I buy it all the time and try any new place that I see...So for a place that is hidden in the Nati...I...I...I just cant explain how smooth and silky the Ice cream was.  The black raspberry chip...Come on!!!!!! Seriously...this has to be one of the best desserts you can find.  The pastrys and other desserts are ok but if you go for those without getting ice cream...you need some help =)  So go and make sure you try really any location since it will be one of the best ice cream places you will ever try.

Graeters is the best ice ceam ever!! Ludlow location is my favorite, grew up in Clifton so a little biased but nice old school feel.  I swear they have changed their recipe eventhough I was told it has not.  Does not stick to the roof of your mouth as much any more.  Black Raspberry chip with chocolate sprinkles is the way to go!  We always get some when we go back home for a visit, YUMMY!

Excellent ice cream! I've had their mango and raspberry ice creams, which were non-dairy and had an amazing flavor. My favorite from them is cookies and cream ice cream, which was heavenly. The Oreo pieces are actually large enough to see and are just so tasty. Definitely a classic ice cream shop to go to when visiting Cincinnati!

I LOVE Graeter's! It has to be my favorite ice cream! I actually love it so much that I made it a point to come to this particular Graeter's location because it is their oldest standing location (Est 1922!). Such a Cincinnati staple!

I had been near this Graeter's last summer when I was in town for the Hyde Park Blast, which takes place right in Hyde Park Square. I never made it that night, but I always wanted to go back (I live in Columbus, so not the quickest drive to get here!). I ended up going with my family after a trip at the Cincinnati Zoo this summer.

This Graeter's is smaller than every other Graeter's I've been to-- but the scoops and delicious flavors are all the same! I got the new birthday cake flavor with some chocolate in a waffle cone. Always such a treat. 

I also love how you can tell right away that this is a vintage Graeter's. The signage up front makes you feel like it hasn't been touched since the 1930's (it may even be the original 1920's signage!). I love all things vintage so to be able to go to this Graeter's was a special field trip for me. 

Keep serving up those delicious flavors, Graeter's! You make Cincinnati proud! I hope to get back to this location again one day!

I'm always a fan of local ice cream shops. I was super excited to try Graeters and I wasn't disappointed. The sugar cone was standard and the birthday cake ice cream was one of the best I've had. Also, my sister went with me and ordered a scoop of the black cherry chocolate chip. Unfortunately, the Grater's employee showed us that it was too soft so my sister had to order another flavor instead. That was a little disappointing but at least the employee informed us of the issue. Anyhow, Graeters is rightfully a Cincinnati staple!!

As a Cincinnati native, I really enjoy everything Graeters has to offer - pastries, cookies, candies, ice cream, etc. If you are visiting for the first time, black raspberry chip ice cream is a must try!! 

This location is in Hyde Park Square, so it's perfect for grabbing a cone or cup of ice cream and sitting in the grassy area of the square.

Parking can sometimes be a challenge at this location. But the great ice cream and good service is the same I've found at the other locations. 

Our most recent visit was around 4p on Memorial Day. It wasn't very crowded - I think due to the impending rain. Both my husband and son got a double shop in a cone. My dad and I got a double scoop in a dish. 

Every month they always have at least one seasonal flavor. But it's this part of the summer where they offer bonus flavors! My son enjoyed the Orange Cream. My dad and I had the Strawberry Chocolate Chip and Chocolate Malted Pretzle - so good!!

Went in on a hot day for some ice cream! Ended up getting a two scoop waffle cone of the seasonal peach and Oregon strawberry. I also asked for whipped cream to be added on top. It was delicious! My only complaint is that the cashier was very slow in checking me out, so unfortunately my ice cream was melting by the time I was able to get to a table.
No wonder why everyone rants about this place. The waffle cone? Amazing. The ice cream? Best ice cream ever. Can I come back already?

This Graeters like most is pretty good. My husband and I stopped in while in Hyde Park, after our lunch at E+O kitchen. This location is cute and has fun little items inside like cookies, ice cream cakes, ice cream pints, and etc. I also like this location as it's nice to be able to stop by after or while walking around Hyde Park. 

I got one scoop of Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough. This was my favorite ice cream flavor growing up, so I wanted a scoop of my old classic. It was really good. The only thing I didn't like was the huge chucks of chocolate in it. They were definitely bigger than the dough and chocolate chip size. It was some what over powering. More like it was chocolate chip ice cream rather than chocolate chip cookie dough. I would be chewing and get huge chunks of chocolate pieces. I like chocolate but sheesh. It wasn't what I was use to. 

Overall, Graeter's has good ice cream and I enjoy their ice cream from any of their locations.

I love Graeters but this location is very small. I prefer the mocha chip and double chocolate chip. Candy is excellent. I love the ice cream cakes. Premium pricing. Place is usually packed. Parking is challenging at this location.

Graeter's has the best ice cream in town! You can see them everywhere! If you choose to go to the one in Hyde Park, you gotta walk because finding a parking space is hard - it is worth it though! Try the black raspberry chocolate chip! It's the best!

Very tasty ice cream spot in the heart of High Park neighborhood. Vast array of flavors in offer and you can sample as many as you like until you find the right pick. Loved the coconut one I had, it even had little shreds of coconut in it.

Delicious old school ice cream! The service was really friendly even when I asked to try about ten different flavors. 

My favorite was the buckeye- chocolate ice cream with peanut butter balls and chocolate chips. Luckily more places don't have this or I would be in trouble.

This Graeter's is always popping but they usually have a pretty great handle on the crowd. They have a nice staff that seems to have a good process in place for busy nights.

They have a great assortment of candy and sweet treats. I'm assuming all locations have the option to buy pints, but they have that here as well.

I like that they have different events going on throughout the month. I want to come back for dogs night out!  

The only thing I wish is that they had a restroom.

Tip: their water fountain is like liquid gold.

Who doesn't love Greaters!? I mean come on...Black Raspberry Chip anyone? Kind of the biggest deal in ice cream here in Cincy. But while black raspberry chip is pretty much amazeballs... it's not the only epic flavor available here. 

May I introduce coconut chip and the buckeye flavors. OMG. If you love coconut and chocolate you must meet and become acquainted with this delightful flavor. Moreover, it's kind of mandatory that you at least try the buckeye flavors in the buckeye state. And you won't be dissapointed.

This location is central in Hyde Park and the interior is very large considering. They also offer coffee and cakes and well as bakery items. I mean donuts at an ice cream place? Could they be any more tempting? You can also purchase pints in the freezer on your way out.

It is always fun to go to Graeters. This location has a medium size customer area with a good amount of seating. The service is friendly and the ice cream is the best. I really like the newer Cheese Crown flavor. The seasonal Cherry Chocolate Chip is so good. All the ice cream is so very creamy and tasty. Choose your favorites. I prefer the chocolate flavors like peanut butter chocolate chip.

THIS ICE CREAM WAS AMAZING!!! I got the double chocolate chip and it was soooooo delicious and creamy. This place is a MUST and I can't wait to go back!! Konnor was also very helpful and a great worker!

I am very familiar with Graeter's ice cream since I lived in Columbus for 17 years and family live in the Dayton/ Cincinnati area.  I placed and order on Thursday Dec 18, one day air ship and paid the fee of 29.95.  This order was not delivered until Dec 26 mid day.  I called the morning of Dec 26 stating my delivery hadn't taken place and wanted to know why.  The stated they would re-place the order that day and all I got was an email stating there was another order.  My original order was delivered mid day on the 26th and the ice cream all 6 pints were soft liquidy.  I have yet to hear anymore from Graeter's on this and I would NOT recommend any mail orders to this company.  Either they have a poor carrier in place and they cannot stand by the 24 hr guarantee.  I should have rated this with one start but since I've had Graeter's ice cream many times, the only thing that would get 5 stars would be the ice cream.  Get it yourself or go in person, otherwise don't buy long distance.

So I have never been to Cincinnati but I know of Graeters Ice Cream.  This is by far the best ice cream ever made.

I am in DC and every year I have a friend who orders tons of it and has an ice cream party at his house.  This is how I was introduced to this ice cream and now I look forward to ice cram parties every year.

America is a nation of immigrants. Even the Indians by land and the Vikings by sea! Cincinnati's two oldest hand crafted ice cream stores were started by immigrants. German immigrants started Graeter's in 1868, selling it at the Court Street Market. That would be about the same time my German relatives moved to Over the Rhine, and shopped at that same neighborhood market. 

This location is the oldest Graeter's in it's original location. 

My grandmother and her sisters were always Graeter's loyalists, this was their neighborhood store, and I'm sure they knew the family. Of course, my mother had to show her independence and support "the other" ice cream business in Oakley! 

Growing up, Graeter's ice cream was reserved for special occasions. Graeter's also makes Winter holiday tea cookie collections which are unique and excellent. 

Graeter's ice cream is stiff, dense and sweet. Their vanilla bean is my go-to ice cream and stands the test of generations. 

This store has a few taller bar type tables and overlooks the Square. The benches on the Square is a great place to enjoy your ice cream too!

The staff was great. Of course one of the best things about Graeter's are their many branches all over the city. And in December, keep an eye out for their cookie assortments. They are almost as good as the ones my German grandmother and her sisters made!

(Based on just 1 visit)

Ok.. SO much hype about this place I drove out here on my visit to Cincinnati! My first recommendation came from TSA in the Tampa International Airport ... the Cincinnati native couldn't resist telling me to make a stop... so that alone may have set my expectations to high... 

Either way- I love the area, the shop, and the wonderful service... did not LOVE the ice cream. It wasn't bad but it wasn't really special in anyway. I had the Brownie Sunday with Coffee & Vanilla ice cream (& ate all of it, so no its not bad)... but wouldn't be particularly interested in coming back or raving about it. 

Perhaps, as some other reviews state- there is no need for toppings? May need to come back for just a scoop of the coffee ice cream to truly appreciate the ice cream here! 

Definitely an old fashioned shop with refreshingly kind staff so I will give them another try! Its great to see the support in the community for this shop so 100% will be back!

This place is delicious and adorable! The service was speedy. Although the line went to the door, we only waited about 5 minutes or less to be served. The quality of the ice cream was delicious as always! It is a little on the pricier side though. (I got a strawberry milkshake with wild cherry syrup which makes it taste like black raspberry ice cream! So yummy! I like to do this instead of the black raspberry chocolate chip because the chocolate chips are too big for my liking) 

This particular shop's location makes it the perfect date spot! You can grab some ice cream and then go for a stroll around the square or sit on one of the many benches in the area. So adorable. I love it!

Wow this place is awesome! They have like a biz zillion different flavors of ice cream and even strawberry cheesecake and s'mores too. It's really good and the staff are all polite and courteous. The place can be a bit busy and the line is long but they also are doing Uber eats orders. Nice.

Awww, Graeter's is adorable and their ice cream is delicious.

I love the throwback feel and the prices are great--we got two single scoops and a small sundae and it was about $11. (I had the Buckeye; chocolate peanut-y goodness!)

Walked away smiling; what more could you ask for?

I am not a huge sweets person. Now don't get me wrong, I love them from time to time but I don't think I'm a good critic for them. If it's too sweet I possibly won't like it and this was on the brink of too sweet, too creamy. lol.  But it was good and I'm really glad I gave it a try.  I heard it was supposed to be like, the best in the country? 

I had a couple flavors, including the black raspberry chip. It was my favorite and absolutely amazing. The chips were actually big, solid chunks of goodness. I also had a scoop of the Buckeye Blitz. Yep, loved the Buckeyes.  I am so glad I got the black raspberry. It's by far my favorite ice cream combo ever! To make the experience even more amazing, my cone was a pretzel cone! Wow! Because Graeder's uses the French pot method, ice makers produce the ice cream in very small batches, by hand, daily!

Two totally amazing happenings due to this adventure? I found a cute area of town I'd love to explore further.  The homes were cute and the area surrounding the ice cream shop was like a park and I think it had wi-fi. There were lots of little shops. Another cool thing? They also have candy, including buckeye chocolates.  I was very happy to see them because I had originally bought some at Jungle Joe's to take home to my family but SOMEONE ate them! (blushing a little) First, the guy gave me a free sample of one to see if I approved and then I bought a box.  To be honest, the ones at Jungle Jims were way better in my opinion.  They were mushier. But the Graeter one's were fancy, nice thick chocolatey shell and clean peanut butter. Much better for gift giving as far as professional packaging and presentation go.

This is my neighborhood Graeters and it's my favorite location. Just off of Hyde Park Square, you could make a whole afternoon of getting ice cream here and then hanging out in the square, shopping, walking around, people watching. My favorite flavors are Black Raspberry Chip and Buckeye Blitz, and I always get the kids size because the small is a pretty big scoop.

Looks are deceiving! Found a hair in my single scoop cup of ice cream, and my daughters Milk shake tasted sour. Manager happily issued us replacements, but after leaving my other daughter found 2 large ice cubes in bottom of her single scoop of ice cream. I could no longer eat my ice cream, told both my daughters to immediately stop eating their ice cream worried we'd get sick. I contacted the manager and they offered to refund full amount. 

Will NOT return to Graeters, more importantly definitely not this location!

Also don't see why all the hype - ice cream isn't that great, have had much better tasting ice cream!

This is an awesome Graeters. I usually only come here after eating at a nearby restaurant, but it's nice to skip expensive desserts at a restaurant for delicious Graeters. I always love the turtle sundae. As others have said, this location tends to be busy. When it's nice outside, the inside isn't very crowded and the few outside benches are often full - but you could always walk around the square or sit in the park across the street.

This ice cream is delicious!  The black raspberry chocolate chip was listed as the fifth best ice cream from Food Network in 2015.  I've never had a flavor I haven't liked.  Some of my other favorites are: peanut butter chocolate chip and toffee chocolate chip.
This location is right in the middle of Hyde Park square.  You can buy a cone and then sit in the middle of the square and enjoy it.  You can also take home pints.  One for now, one for later!

Huge Graeter's fan.  My favorites are Black Raspberry Chip, Peanut Butter, Butter Pecan and Mint Chocolate Chip.  It's too hard to choose and recently I fell in love with their new line of Gelatos.  
I was in the Hyde Park Square location and wanted to get my free Birthday Sundae.  Every year I get the 1870 Tower (brownie on the bottom, black raspberry chip (or your choice of ice cream) with whipped cream, chocolate syrup drizzled all over and cherry on top).  Delish and mouthwatering.  The person waiting on me was a elderly woman and was really sweet.  She made my sundae and the serving looked quite large.  Not complaining at all!  
This location is fairly small, yet have a great selection of cookies, pastries and ice cream to go in the freezer section.  Very clean.  
Thanksgiving is coming up and my parents are looking forward to me bringing the butter bit rolls and cookies home (Georgia). 
If you have not signed up for the rewards program, please do!  It is worth it!  It's also free!

I don't love ice cream, but was satisfied for a little sweet craving. There was a long line and clearly a good business. 

I tried the cookie sundae and shared it with two people - we all had plenty. The chocolate is smooth and everything tastes fresh.

Stumbled here just before they closed when i was just driving around the city... 
Had a sample and could not resist to order a scoop of their speciality ice cream to go...

for sure i will go back for more..

We are in Cincinnati for the weekend and this was one of the top 3 places suggested by locals and tourist. Glad we came, easily some of the best ice cream we have had in a long time. Mass produced stuff you find at the store can not touch this. An absolute must if you are in town!

The lemon and raspberry sorbet combined is incredible! Also, there's an intimate pathway between Erie and Edwards RD, with a waterfall and numerous benches to sit and enjoy while you eat. Five stars every time.
Cutest Grareters location in Town. Came in at 10pm on a weekend. The place was filled with people still. Never too late for ice cream!

If you're from Cincinnati... you know Graeters. 

If you're not from Cincinnati... you need to visit a Graeters. 

There are plenty of locations throughout the region, this one being my favorite. Located on Hyde Park square, this old fashioned ice cream shop really makes you sit back, relax, and and enjoy your sweet treats. 

The employees have always been friendly, and helpful with navigating the menu options. 

Most people will tell you to go with the Black Raspberry Chip, but I prefer a double scoop of Peanut Butter in a waffle cone. :)

Not a lot of seating in the shop itself, so I recommend taking a stroll around the square, or finding a bench in the park across the street. 
. 
Some of their other locations have drive-thru windows, and parking lots to accommodate, but parking on the square can be difficult from time to time.   

If you're in a hurry and just want ice cream, this probably isn't the best location for you. 

On the other hand... if you have time on a warm day, this is your go-to!

I love Graeters. They have an excellent ice cream selection lots of choices and they are all really really delicious. They also have seasonal flavors and those are out of this world great. 
The atmosphere inside is really nice too. Very family friendly and just a nice old fashioned ice cream shop. The employees always seem to be on point. Even when it is crowded they keep the line moving and they are always smiling. 
Also a wonderful thing I just discovered is that they have packzi's. Being from Michigan Fat Tuesday can't be celebrated without them and I was thrilled to find out they have them and they are delicious. Maybe not as good as the Polish bakeries back home but pretty darn good.
If you are in Cincy and looking for a place to get ice cream this is definitely your spot, don't be intimidated by a long line, it will move fast!

It's Graeters, everyone knows about Graeters but this one is special: this one I swear has a sewer gas leak in one of its drain lines.  Every other time I go to this one, it smells like raw sewage inside.

***Graeter's is a longstanding ice cream brand out of Cincinnati; it has several locations throughout the city and is sold at some of Cincinnati's popular restaurants like Montgomery inn; it is more of an old fashioned ice cream parlor like Baskin-Robbins and Fosselman's than the newer artisan spots like Ohio-based Jeni's; Graeter's is a satisfying ice cream spot, but you will be able to find more interesting as well as more delicious ice cream flavors elsewhere***

Graeter's is one of Cincinnati's (as well as Ohio's) most well known ice cream brands.  Its popularity is due to its long history in Cincinnati (it has been around since the late 1800s), its availability at popular and longstanding Cincinnati restaurants like Montgomery Inn, and its signature and not found everywhere flavor black raspberry chip.  Graeter's has moved beyond Cincinnati.  They have other locations throughout Ohio and pints of a few of their flavors are now available at Ralphs locations in California.

Graeter's is an old fashioned ice cream parlor with mostly traditional hand scoped flavors and throwback sundaes and desserts like banana split.  They have gotten a little more modern with some seasonal and more interesting flavors though Graeter's is still a lot like places such as Fosselman's and Baskin-Robbins.

I tried three of their flavors.  I went with one of their seasonal flavors--strawberry chip.  It was good.  The strawberry ice cream had the right amount of sweetness and tartness.  The chocolate chips were also good, thick and rich.  They have a lot of other chocolate chip flavors.  Their black raspberry chip is popular, but I find the ice cream base on that flavor too tart.

I also had their Elena's blueberry pie.  This flavor was quite strong.  The blueberry flavor really came across--like very potent blueberry pie filling.  There were also crisp shortbread-like cookies in the ice cream (kind of like pie pastry).  I thought the flavor was pretty good and some would probably really like it.  I am not sure if I would get it again though.

I also had the caramel and this was average.  It did not have the complexity of the more contemporary salted caramel flavors.  It also did not have the richness or sweet flavor of a really good caramel.

The consistency of the ice cream was good but not great.  It was creamy and smooth and was not icy.  The ice cream though did lack the denseness and creaminess of the really good artisan ice cream now available at shops like Sweet Rose Creamery, Bi-Rite Creamery, Three Twins, Jeni's, and Carmela.

Prices were good.  Graeter's is more of a big scoop place so you do not get the variety of flavors in a smaller serving size like Carmela or some gelato shops; however, the portion sizes on scoops are very generous.

Service was okay--polite though not as friendly as other places I visited in the Cincinnati area.

Graeter's is worth trying at least once due its popularity and long history.  I find it just okay compared to the newer and more upscale gourmet ice cream shops (like Jeni's in Ohio), but with Graeter's many ice cream flavors, sundaes, toppings, and shakes, I think most will be able to find something they like here.

This Graeter's is located in the charming and quaint Hyde Park Square shopping district and you can find metered street parking and free street parking in the nearby residential area.

This is the quintessential Graeters location, in my opinion.  Friendly staff and a good amount of seating options between inside, outside & the square.  Can't be beat on a summer day!

If you've never been to Graeters, I always recommend the Black Raspberry Chip.  You can't go wrong though! Every flavor is awesome.
The Hyde Park location does not offer restroom access for paying customers which is really unfortunate and inconvenient.
All the flavors are good especially mocha chip and black raspberry! I love so many ice cream brands but this one is BY FAR my favorite! Highly recommend!!!

Recent visits to the Hyde Park location has been the best customer service I have personally experienced in a long time, along with a co-worker commenting on her latest visit as being the best customer service also, thank-you Rob S.    

Kenneth Meade

Three words: Black. Raspberry. Chip.   Greaters is my all time bae. The best ice cream on the Planet. Oprah said she loved it, but if you're from he Nati, we already knew the truth. Long long ago. Everything goes well with Graeters, birthday parties, graduations, after school breaks, Friday night high school hangouts, movie snacks and plain old just 'cause.  There's no occasion that can't be made better with a pint of Graeters. Thank god it's sold in grocery stores here in the Pacific Northwest!

Huge crowd and very long line. They manage the line decently well. Ice cream isn't anything special. Seems like this is the best Ice cream in the area. I got chocolate chip ice cream and one chocolate chip was like a block and when I bit into it my tooth felt like it broke. Staff seems very friendly.

This is one of the busier Graeters and while I like that it's open later in the summer (I think 10pm?), there is often a line out the door! The inside always has a kind of funky smell, too. I actually avoid this location and prefer the Mariemont location, especially since they remodeled and took out most of the bakery section. However, the employees at this location, often on the younger side, are always very friendly, efficient, and capable of steering people through the ordering and payment process in a direct yet inviting way.

delicious delicious ice cream! definitely try coconut chunk and blueberry chunk and honestly any other chunk ice cream! The chocolate chunks in these are INTENSELY big! I wish they had a store open in Toronto, Canada. 
Would love to come back and order some more ice cream!

Black. Raspberry. Chip. 

The best ice cream on the planet. 

Friendly, great location. A Cincinnati staple that must be visited!

I can honestly say that I'm obsessed with Greater's ice cream. So much so, that when I lived in Texas, my mom shipped me some on dry ice! (I am from Cincinnati, so I'm a bit biased.) Graeter's ice cream is creamy (not icy), sweet, and delicious! Their ingredients are basic-- whole milk, cream, sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, and milk from cows not treated with rBST. Their ice cream is not organic, but mostly free of chemicals and dyes. Warning-- you may leave with a coating of fat on the roof of your mouth! Oh, but it's so delicious! 
My favorite flavors are mocha (coffee) chip & black raspberry chip! My sister loves the blueberry pie flavor! But you can't go wrong with any of the flavors! They do have several flavors of the month, and they will let you taste as many as you'd like! The ones with chocolate chunks are the best! The chocolate melts in your mouth, and the chunks are huge! I love the sorbets, sodas, and sundaes too! Most of their toppings (caramel, hot fudge, whipped cream) are made by Graeter's. Although, I'm not a fan of the new gelatos; I think that they are too sweet (weird, I know!)
Most of the locations evoke an old-fashioned soda shop feel. This location is fun in the summer because you can grab your ice cream and sit in Hyde Park square to eat it! The store itself is small, but does have a good number of tables and chairs. They also sell homemade candy, cakes, cookies, and other baked goods. The icing on their birthday cakes is the very sugary, thick kind-- I love it because it's not whippy or chemical-tasting! 
If you're in Cincinnati, you HAVE to try Graeter's. Heck, they even sell it in most grocery stores across the country now! (Thank heaven or I'd go through withdrawls!)

We got a gift certificate to Graeters as a wedding present (hint: it was our favorite present). We ordered ice cream and ice cream sandwiches, and the price was right! 

Flavors We Ordered In the Order We Enjoyed them:
Caramel Truffle Gelato
Peppermint Stick
Mint Chocolate Chip
Buckeye
Cookie Dough
Dark Chocolate Mint Crunch Gelato

The caramel truffle gelato was INSANE. Hubby picked it out, wouldn't have been my first choice, but it was dark and delicious and decadent. All of the "chip" flavors are more like swirl - it's gentler and softer than a chocolate chip, and WAY more enjoyable. 

The one that didn't really do it for me was the dark chocolate mint - it just falls a little flatter than the rest of them, not very sweet (almost not sweet enough). I did like the cookie pieces in it, however. 

Peppermint Chocolate ice cream sandwiches were fantastic - would order again!

There are only 2 kinds of people in the world, those who haven't tried Graeter's, and those who love Graeter's.  

Graeter's brings the charm of an old-fashioned ice cream and candy shop to a bustling modern world.  You will be greeted with the aroma of freshly baking waffle cones when you walk in, and your taste buds will be in for a treat after that.  

Try their famous black raspberry chocolate chip or mint chocolate chip - you won't be disappointed!

Black raspberry chocolate chip is my new favorite ice cream flavor. The chocolate "chips" are actually huge dark chocolate chunks with a very smooth texture. You should definitely check this place out! It's very good if you like rich, creamy ice cream.

Really great ice cream and worth trying at least once. The raspberry chocolate chip ice cream with chocolate "chips" is delicious. The chocolate chips are more like huge chocolate chucks - a nice surprise. 

Friendly staff and good locations too. The prices are slightly on the expensive side - but nothing outrageous.
Rita's, Haagen, Baskin.....Bye!  Graeters chocolate malt was amazing!

Graeter's is the bomb .com and everyone knows this, but I love this location best.  Maybe it's just me, but this location makes me feel like I'm in an ice cream parlor from the 50's or something, which I love.  Every time I'm here the place is hoppin', couples on dates and kids with their parents after a soccer game.  Just hearkens back to a simpler time, I guess.  And if you don't want to be inside, a short stroll across the street will take you to the little park in Hyde Park Square where you can sit on a bench and enjoy your ice cream open air.  

Line is usually long, but it seems to always move quickly.  And the gentleman working there last time spontaneously broke into song between scoops, so there's that too. :)

Graeter's ice cream rules and the Hyde Park location makes it even better.

The ice cream here is so AWESOME!!  No need for toppings, they're all in the ice cream.  The staff is also so very friendly and genuine.   I'm not even an ice cream lover, but this place has changed all that.

Graeter's is a Cincinnati institution. 

Recently I found some Graeter's in my local QFC, in Bethany, and I about fell over in a faint of pure happiness. 

It's the stuff my childhood visits to Cincinnati were made of. 

Every family member has their own favorite ( my aunt Barb's is peanut butter chip, and my grandmother's - I never met her -- was coffee) and every family member used to fight for the last spoonful... so fun.

There was coconut chip on the shelf when I picked myself up from the faint, and it was good.Big chunks of chocolate, coconutty ice cream goodness. mmmmmmmmmm

It was fun to share it with my mom, who's been eating Graeter's all her life.

When I've gone to Cincinnati with my family we have gone to the shops in person, and I introduced my college roommate to them when she moved there with her family, and the ice cream shops are a nice place for a family outing.. I don't know why they think they need pastries and doughnuts, but it seems other people do, and that's fine. 

I will stick with the ice cream.

This is where my German genetics get their big hipped/hourglass propensities from, I think. How could you live near Graeter's and not partake?

Seriously just sat here eating ice cream and watched a lady walk in with a dog leash. She carried it to the counter and the let her around back and she washed and scrubbed it in their sink right in front of me. The main sink right next to the coffe and the register. Gross!   Only eat here if you like sharing your ice cream with dog slobber, poop, or whatever else gross thing that was on that leash or genitals area that dog has licked.

Best place in Cincinnati to get the best ice cream in the world. The Hyde Park Square store has an old fashioned look, seating indoors and out, and the option to go sit in the park or stroll around window shopping. I recommend double chocolate chip and mocha chip- creamy delicious ice cream with chunks of what must have been an enormous chocolate bar is the Graeter's way. It's a must have for locals and a must try for visitors!

We are so delighted to be back in the vicinity of our favorite bakery. Our daughter has been eating birthday cake from here since her first birthday. She is now done with grad school and demands one every year..we love seasonal flavors cherry chip, dinosaur crunch, and double choc chip

Hands down, the best ice cream in the Midwest. Maybe the country?

Always creamy, always memorable flavors.

Note to out-of-staters - they ship pints! You will never have to be without the addiction.

I loves graeters' ice cream. It's local and doesn't have any weird ingredients -real cream and sugar. I had the delicious chocolate ice cream. The service is always great. It's great they have some low calorie options like gelato and sorbet. I also saw a sign for low glycemic index flavors this time. When we have guests from outside town, we always take them to try graeters. Will sure be back here!

It's hard not to call Graeter's perfect.  Everything they do, they do well (if over the top in decadence: mammoth chocolate chips, inches of icing on cakes).  The pastries are fantastic, the ice cream is nationally famous thanks to Oprah, and the candies are delicious.  Since it's such an institution, we take it for granted.

Think about this: have you ever had anything bad there?  Has anyone?  (Except for an occasional grumpy scooper or the hypervigilent managers at the Finneytown location who close 15 minutes before the posted hour).  This has to be one of the most consistent businesses in the nation.

So go ahead and gripe that you can get better flavors elsewhere, criticize the excessive richness of the ice cream, or note that so-and-so bakes better danishes.  You're probably right.  But you'll still be spooning through that pint of black raspberry chip, won't you?

Also, now that it's summer, be sure to try their excellent orange chiffon cake.  It really does have too much icing, but if you scrape some (or all) off, you'll find the airiest, most delicately flavored (and, alas, now artificially colored) sponge cake.  I dare you not to eat half of one in one sitting.

I have never tried a Graeter's flavor I don't like. They are all robust, sweet, creamy and delicious.  The hardest part is deciding which flavor best suits my mood at the moment. My go to is the black raspberry chip. Any other black raspberry chips pale in comparison.  I also love the mint chocolate chip and appreciate that it is naturally colored and white with no artificial color. I also love the strawberry, a burst of fruity deliciousness so when I discovered June's flavor of the month is strawberry chocolate chip I was all over it. Amazing!  Really anything with chocolate chips is great here because they are hand shaved. It is not uncommon to find bar size chunks to chew through. Love, love!

There is so much hype around Graeter's-- another one of Cincinnati's institutions-- and this one sure does deliver!!  Anyone who visits Cincinnati really does need to stop by Graeter's to see what it's all about.  Smooth, creamy, delicious ice cream.  Who doesn't love the Black Raspberry Chip?  Another one of my favorites is the Blueberry Pie, with bits of crust in it.  Finally, I'm always a sucker for toffee, so Toffee Chip is another one of my faves.  In any case, stop by, grab a cone, go enjoy outside in the Square, and enjoy of the things Cincinnati deserves to be proud of.

Graeters tastes so much better than your average ice cream, and that's coming from someone who's tried alot of different brands of ice cream. They use the traditional french pot way of making it, which incorporates less air and gives it a much richer taste and thicker consistency that most ice cream makers don't use. It's more expensive than regular ice cream but you get what you pay for and the portion sizes are large. If you're visiting Cincinnati, please stop by this place, you won't regret it! I recommend the double chocolate chip, vanilla, and my personal favorite, the black raspberry chocolate chip! By the way, they also serve gelato and sorbet (I noticed they're now selling the ice cream at Whole Foods, and they used to at Safeway).

Does Graeter's Ice Cream qualify as an institution of greatness?  Very debatable.  From an outsider's perspective that is newer to the area, one can see the strong redeeming qualities of the ice cream itself, but I love it when a community absolutely embraces a Company like Graeter's, makes it their own, and then adds so much more to said Company's reputation of greatness.  If you speak bad about Graeter's around these parts, it could be fighting words, so tread lightly.  I love it.  

I unfortunately feel the need to go to far too many ice cream shops wherever I live, and Graeter's is no exception.  I think they do a fine job of making a quality product back at the "mother ship" (wherever that may be here locally), yet I think there is something, and I'm not sure what it is, missing at Graeter's that takes the quality to that "stratospheric level".  First, and most importantly, they don't pass the "WOW" test.  I've never tasted their product and said to myself "there is something so unique about this - something so good - that I can't get it elsewhere".   And before anyone says "well, what about the Black Raspberry?", let me stop you; yes, it can be found elsewhere.  Secondly, there is something of the "soft" variety that is missing that would make it great (for ME).  When I think of a true homemade ice cream place, I think of a friendly and knowledgeable staff (usually family of the proprietor or just a real "go-getter" employee, not a bunch of eager high school students), brown cartons that hold ice cream that can't be re-used and unique flavors that aren't just there to appease a large audiences from across the land and aren't artificially colored (i.e. like banana ice cream that looks more like the color of a highlighter).  This one may sound Hokie to you - I almost expect a flavor in the case that is like "why in the world would the owner carry this?" - something like a Rum Raisin -  when you look at it, it's clearly one of the owner's hobby and doesn't sell a lot, but he or she likes their guilty pleasure on display so they can justify eating it often by selling a cup from time-to-time.  So, I'm giving you a lot of qualities that would make a 5 star ice cream shop for me, which clearly Graeter's doesn't qualify for.
