What they do qualify with me is a very happy customer.  One that enjoys the convenience of their locations and appreciates the quality of their mass produced product.  My only gripes with their locations is that they do lack on friendly customer service, but I get that you are going to get that when you employ a lot of high school kids.  Some are either going to go that extra mile for management, and others aren't, and unfortunately at a place like Graeter's you can't really hide someone that has a less-than-stellar customer service - there are only so many tasks to be done.    

Try the 1870 Tower!  Also, we tried the new Less Indulgent ice cream they are offering (I believe it's new), and it's fantastic - worth the try for your in home freezer and it's less calories!

Mmmmm ice cream!

On a day trip to Cincinnati, we of course had to stop at Graeters. So tasty! They make their ice cream using the french pot process. 

I had the Black Raspberry Chip and the Coconut Chip. Both were excellent. Rich crunchy chocolate chips. Smooth ice cream. Whats not to like?

This particular location has a very old school vibe to it. They also sell baked goods here, I didn't have the opportunity to try them out. 

Lucky for most of you, you can pick up some flavors of Graeters in your local grocery store. And if I'm ever back in Cincy, I'll come back through!

First time here & I had their famous Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip Ice Cream.  It was soooo delicious.  Perfect on a hot & humid day.  The flavor was the perfect amount of sweetness & they put in huge chunks of chocolate chips.  I'm not even much of an ice cream person & I nearly finished the whole thing.  I also walked out with some chocolate chip cookies from them.  Highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to try any kind of Cincy specialty.

Graeter's ice cream is definitely delicious! My favorite flavors were the Mint Chocolate Chip and the Black Raspberry Chip. One of the key distinctions of their ice cream is their large 'chocolate' chips that are as crispy as wafers, just as chocolate-y and tasty as chocolate and just as rich as a brownie. The service is generally very friendly, and the Hyde Park area is super cute, which makes Graeter's all the more appealing on a hot sunny day.

I really miss their ice cream since I've moved from Cincinnati...

Truly the best in so many areas:
1. American chocolate
2. Cookies
3. Breakfast pastries
4. Cakes and pies
5. Ice cream

It is so good it should be criminal!

This place was so good!!! Not from here and this my first time trying it. I was told many times that I had to try this place. Anyone visiting Cincinnati must try this place. I was surprise that their raspberry chocolate ice cream was good, I just never thought that combination would be so amazing!

Amazing Ice Cream. Awesome Location in Hyde Park. The perfect spot to come. The lines can be very long, but moves quickly.

Only knock is that inside seating is sparse.

Delicious ice cream! Since I moved here everyone told me I had to try it! I sampled a few. The raspberry chip, which they're famous for was pretty good. I'm just not a fan of the fruit based ones. I ended up getting the buckeye, which was delicious but quite a bit of peanut butter. The servings are huge! I got a small cup and it was too much. The chocolate "chips" are pretty big pieces, which I was not a huge fan of that. However, I will definitely go back and bring my friends who visit me to try it! They also have seasonal flavors, which I want to try. The staff was very friendly and helpful!

Ok, So I feel compelled (a little voice of ignominy in my noggin...) I can't, with decent scruples, leave this ice cream joint review-less, especially after my review of that other ice cream joint in Oakley... 

Yes, Graeter's is brilliant..!!! The Black Raspberry Chip, the Mocha Chocolate Chip and the Toffee Chip are absolutely three of my favorite flavors of ice cream in Cincinnati... And, that's sayin' something considering how big an Ice Cream Town Cincy is...

And, this location is definitely my favorite... Beechmont is ok, so are Ludlow, Walnut, Kenwood, Wooster and The Florence store, but I just enjoy the staff and location in Hyde Park more... Nothing personal... Maybe it's because I like walking out to the Erie Ave sitting park after I receive my cone or cup... Just sayin'...

After tasting Graeter's, I have to ask why other small batch ice cream retailers even bother with any other method than the French Pot method. Hands down, Graeter's is the best ice cream in the country. 

Peanut butter chip is the best!

The chocolate chips are SUBLIME. Anything followed with Chip, do it. Mocha Chip, Coconut Chip, WHATEVER CHIP.

They could make Crap Chip, and I'm pretty sure it would be the best thing I've ever put in my mouth.

There are many Graeter's locations across the city of Cincinnati, but this is by far my favorite. This one is set in adorable Hyde Park Square near the beautiful fountain in the center. The inside features cute ice cream chairs and tables, a beautiful tile floor, and tall ceilings. There is just something about it that is much nicer than most other cookie cutter locations. On a nice day you can see people get their ice cream and then go sit by the fountain. I used to come to the square and get ice cream a lot after school.

Now the ice cream is not to be messed with! It is some of the best ice cream in the country in my opinion. When I was living in Boston, I actually had some shipped to me! The chocolate chunks are the best part. If you've never had the ice cream before, then start with a "chip" flavor. They have a special way of making the chocolate chunks so that they don't freeze in the ice cream and they melt in your mouth.

You can get Graeter's ice cream at any location in the city, but I recommend going to this one for the sheer experience!

The Graeter's in Hyde Park was my dessert location of choice after eating a burger at Arthur's around the corner. I had read the Yelp reviews and was pretty eager to dig into some lovely 'scream when I went in. I was sort of in-the-middle in terms of my opinion of this place.

On the one hand, Graeter's is really good. There's no denying it. I had coconut chip and my friend Randy had black raspberry chip (which was better than the coconut, I thought), they were both pretty good. It was pretty solid and old school and the chips in both were fudgy and so didn't suffer from the ailment of most chips in ice cream that can get crazy hard and flavorless and become annoying. 

On the other hand, it just wasn't particularly spectacular. It was sort of an experience that I would say is super locally, but on the national scale (which because I was driving from TX to CT when I ate there I was thinking of it on), it's not really up there with the best I've been to. 

Graeter's is really good, very solid. And if you grew up on it, or live in Cincy I'm sure it defines Ice Cream for the region. Pretty neat place!

Most classic American-heartland ice creams are very thick and creamy.  This is lighter-textured, and the mint chocolate (my favorite flavor) is white, not green, so you know it's authentic.  Heavenly, especially when gathered from their old-fashioned bathroom-tile-lined mother parlor here and eaten outside on a balmy early-June evening amid the benches and fountains of pleasant Hyde Park Square.

Stopped in for some afternoon dessert with Andy P. on our road trip from Dallas to Connecticut.

As Andy mentioned, I had the black raspberry chip and he had the coconut.  He preferred mine, yet I preferred his.  Both were really good, and the chocolate chips were big and fudgy, being tasty while a bit too bulky to go well with the ice cream.

From what we could see of the crowd, this seems to be a local favor of Cinci, and it's easy to see why.

Ambiance: 16/25 stars
Food: 21/25 stars
Service: 17/25 stars
Bathroom: didn't use it
Probability of going back: 20% (I don't live in Cincinnati!)
At first I was skeptical at how good Graeters could be, but it really lives up to its reputation... I can't believe how much I eat here now.  The toffee is my favorite.

I'm from out of town and normally going to Graeters is the highlight of my trips to Cincinnati. This time, however, the service was lacking. We came in as a party of four with two servers working the counter. One server proceeded to help us while the other stood there unwrapping gift wrap from products, looking at us but not coming over to help. My fiancé ordered a milkshake, to which our server made comments about how 'weird' it was. A family came in behind us as we ordered our second item, and the server unwrapping presents stopped and  pointedly announced that she was available to help the 'next separate order.'  Our order took forever as a result. Very unimpressed by the comments and the unhelpful staff.

Like I always say, ice cream is a dish best served cold.  And Graeter's has that going for them.  Four stars because my kids love this place so much, and because it's a Cincinnati institution that deserves the hype.

I'm a purist at heart, and I appreciate that they offer only a limited number of options.  I'd rather them offer a handful of superb varieties than a whole slew of mediocre ones.  

Having said that, though, the purist in me wishes they'd just stick with the ice cream.  All the chocolates, donuts, pastries, and candies seem like an unnecessary distraction.  

As for the Hyde Park location, it gets line-out-the-door busy at the times when you'd expect: after lunch and dinner hours and midday on fine-weather weekends.

The Graeter Ice Cream Creator!
 
Man this stuff is good!  And why?  Chocolate chips that are just that, chips!  I'm not sure when it became cool to put chocolate dust in ice cream like every other place on the planet.  You can barely taste the stuff.  Oh yes I'm pointing at you Ben and Jerry.  Not sure how you got to be so popular.  Apparently you've never done battle with the Graeter Ice Cream Creator!  Rest assred when mint chocolate chips but heads, you are left eating your chocolate double fudge vomit surprise.

When I was younger in boy scouts we went to the Graeter's head ice cream place.  And I saw it.  I saw one of the chocolate bars that they chunk up.  It was the size of a tire.

And I must gloat.  My friends you haven't lived until you've eaten Graeter's ice cream with your feet in the surf of the Pacific Ocean!

Five stars!  Place kick arse!

3.5*

Had the Black Raspberry Chip in waffle cone. yum yum 
creamy, tasty and the choc chips were humongous!

As far as ice cream in cincinnati is concerned, this is as good as it gets. When you walk into the Graeter's in Hyde Park it is like walking into the past. it has the distinct feel of an old time ice cream/soda parlor which makes the experience very eclectic and relaxing. 

 I have yet to come across an ice cream flavor I don't like at Graeter's. My personal favorites are the Black Rasberry Chip, Cookie Dough Chip, and Elena's Blueberry Pie. The Chocolate chunks in the ice creams are rich, delicious and huge and the ice cream itself is creamy and amazing. Along with all the great ice cream flavors they offer there are also plenty of sweets to satisfy any sugar craving.

If you are looking for ice cream in the area, plan a trip to a Graeter's location and be enlightened by some of the best you may ever taste.

This place was highly recommended my a friend while I was in town for a quick meeting. It was wind chill of about zero the other night but this place was across the street from my hotel and he said it was a must have.  I don't eat a lot of ice cream. Tend to stick to healthy stuff.  Had a few samples including their signature black raspberry chip. They all tasted good to the tiny sampler spoon.
I landed on a scoop of coconut chip. They convinced me to add another scoop for 50 cents so I could enjoy two flavors. $4 for two big scoops. Good deal. Easy decision. I added blueberry pie, which actually has pie crust blended in.
I enjoyed the coconut chip more.  This ice cream is dense, creamy and very good.  The best I have ever had. No. But no complaints! It was delicious and worth the calories. And no, I didn't finish it all demonstrating great willpower.
The staff was awesome. They were ultra friendly and brought me over some pamphlets since I told them it was my first trip to Graeter's. 
My friend here in Dallas (from Cincinnati) said it was available at the local supermarket, Central Market, in pints. Pints are never as good as hand dipped but if we need some ice cream in the future, good to know it is available locally.

If you're from Cincinnati then you already know that Graeter's has the best ice cream in the country. Oprah Winfrey has said that it's the best. I say it's the best. And I'm pretty sure if Jesus came down to earth, he would say it's the best too. 

Apparently they use a french pot process to make the actual ice cream. I don't know what's french about it but hats off to the fine folks of France for perfecting ice cream. After that, the word on the street is, they pour a layer of liquid dark chocolate over the finished product, let it cool, and then break it up into the ice cream resulting in massively delicious chunks of chocolate. And that is what makes Graeter's so money - the chocolate. Black Rasperry Chip is the most popular but I think any "chip" flavor is incredible.

If you've never been and you live in the area, you should drop what you're doing and beeline it to your nearest Graeter's. And if you're visiting Cincinnati sometime ever make sure this is a stop on your trip.

The only frozen thing that is close is East Coast Frozen Custard, and it's completely and totally different... and in fact, it's really not even the on the same level.  I kind of regret giving East Coast 5 stars in a fit of lactose induced delirium.  Not that it's not amazing, but it left me no room to indicate that Graeters is better.  Better than everything, actually.

The black raspberry chip is quite simply one of the most amazing flavors of any kind of food anywhere.  Amazingly, I haven't had any other flavors.  I'm not normally a "fruit ice cream" kind of guy.  Chocolate, Chocolate peanut butter cup, Chocolate blah blah blah.  Yet, this stuff is SO good that I instinctively shy away from trying anything else.  I'm not like this anywhere else.  I'm never the "always order the same thing" guy, but at Graeters, it happens.

I just know that if I order the black raspberry chip, I'm going to see God.  There might be a level better than that, but I'm not sure I can handle it.  I will have to live with that.

Put it this way... I've contemplated quitting my job, cashing in my 401k, filling a new chest freezer with Graeters, and seeing how far I could get before I burst open like the guy in Seven.  True story.

DELICIOUS! Had the buckeye sundae and my friend had the malt balls and butter pecan ice cream. Creamy ice cream and , huge chunks of melt in your mouth chocolate..I dont even like chocolate that much  but I will never say no to anything at G's. Definitely will be back.

Graeter's is awesome!! It was my first time visiting Cincinnati, and had heard that this place was a must-try so I knew that I had to go! Apparently they're famous for the Black Raspberry Chip so I tried that and it was soooooo good. I'm really sad they don't have one where I live...but that could also be a good thing because I would probably eat it several times a day. Delicious!
My boyfriend is a Xavier alum so my first visit to campus we saw a basketball game and had some Graeters.  I fell in love with campus, the ice cream and a little more in love with him.

Ice cream very good.  My only complaint is the Choc" Chips" as these are not chips  Instead these are globs of chocolate.  Large thick pieces of chocolate. Not exactly appealing.   I myself would much prefer small chips of chocolate.

Nice little old fashioned ice cream parlor/confectionary, painted tin ceiling, full of charm. And good ice cream. Great ice cream. I had Black Raspberry chip and peanut butter chip in a cup. Delicious. I think better than Oberweis (Gasp!) And you can find it at Sunset Foods!! 

Their candy is good too. We bought some turtles for my father-in-law and they were quite tasty. 

I didn't really care for the "chip" part of the ice cream...I know some people like the thick frozen ribbon of chocolate but I don't care for it. I like smaller chunks that are more evenly dispersed.  But that's my only complaint.

I do enjoy Graeter's (although not my favorite ice cream in Cincinnati) and this location is a pretty cute one. Since it's tucked into Hyde Park square, you can ear outside and walk around, which is nice. The inside is pretty small, so the tables are squished, and you end up wanting to go outside to eat.

Ice cream, like all other Graeter's is always good. Thick and delicious - it's very rich.

Something about eating at this Graeter's makes it feel more special than the others. Perhaps it's the location in Hyde Park Square or the illusion that there are more flavors on the well-organized menu. Perhaps it's because they often have free samples of baked goods at the counter. 

I order my usual: one scoop of mocha chip, one scoop of black raspberry chip. Apparently a new flavor was just invented: Cotton Candy. I sampled it. It was very creamy, sweet, and blue. My friends are big fans of the raspberry sorbet and mint chocolate chip, which by the way, is no longer green. Aw. I loved the bright green color of minty ice cream. At least we have a new blue color now. Mmmm. Blue.

If you're looking for a Graeter's with the old fashioned ice cream parlor atmosphere, look no further than Hyde Park.

Cost per person: $4.00

This is the kind of place you have to bring your family and friends when they come into town. The store is small in and in the summer time seating is at a premium but the square is right across the way and is a great place to take your treat on the go. There are also benches outside as well to sit at and people watch. 

You just cant go wrong with black raspberry chip, or any ice cream that has their signature chocolate chips in them. I try to stray and try different flavors but I never do, I always come back to the black raspberry chip. I am drawn to it like a moth to the flame. There is also an area that sells other treats such as buckeyes, candy's, donuts, cakes and seasonal items like chocolate eggs around Easter. 

This is probably my favorite Graeters location of the few that I have been to and most definitely worth your time if you are in the area. You will probably end up having some shipped to you after you start going through withdrawal.

Normally, I like to mix things up. However, when it comes to Graeter's, I will always order one of two things:

The Blueberry Pie ice cream
Raspberry Sorbet with Lemonade

Let's start with the Blueberry pie. Now, while the back story is a bit of a tear jerker (there was a little girl with an illness who designed this ice cream, it was only seasonal but since she died they keep it on the menu full-time donating the profits to research), the ice cream is so different than anything else. There are actually chunks of pie crusts in the ice cream. And they don't get soggy, they stay crunchy! And I don't normally like blueberries but the ones in this ice cream are delicious!

The raspberry sorbet with lemonade is perfect for summer. You can grab one of these and wander over to Hyde Park square and enjoy a nice summer day. 

I have also enjoyed any of the ice creams with chocolate chunks, but only when other people get them (I am not above mooching ice cream). As for the other things Graeter's offer, like chocolates, can't say I have ever had them or remember having them. But who needs chocolate when the ice cream is this good.

Everyone loves Graeter's ice cream. It's an axiom. I agree with others that trying the Blueberry Pie ice cream is a must. And The Boss smoothie will keep your lips glued to the straw as you inhale pulverized chocolate bits.

But don't forget their baked goods! Before Lent, they sell the best paczki in the city. Their cheese crowns have a surprise cinnamon filling (which I guess is no longer a surprise). If you're looking for an upscale bakery good, definitely consider Graeter's.

This Hyde Park location is great for those who live nearby, but parking is rather difficult. In nice weather, it's lovely to take your treat across the street to the square.

I'm not from Cincinnati, but obviously this is the local place to get ice cream. It's VERY rich and creamy. I like the black raspberry chocolate chunk (and they are HUNKS of chocolate). If you have issues with rich and creamy food, watch out. Otherwise, eat away!

So I pretty much love ice cream. It's just plain delicious. I've also worked at two different ice cream shops in the past back in my Indiana hometown, so I like to think that I know my ice cream. 

So when I first moved to Cincinnati and heard of the mystical Graeters that had the "best ice cream ever", I had to try it. Not going to lie- my first time, I wasn't convinced. Second time-ok, but nothing special. The only reason I kept going back was that my boyfriend thought it was pretty much the greatest thing in the entire world. He kept telling me, "But Steph, it's French pot! Do you know how much work it takes to make this kind of ice cream?!" So after many trips with him, it sort of started to grow on me. Then, the other night, I found myself craving it. What does this mean?!

So I guess I'm a convert. Graeters is well known for its chip flavors- black raspberry chip being on the most popular flavors. Personally, I'm more of a peanut butter chip gal. But, not matter what flavor you choose, you can delight in huge, delicious chocolate chips. Graeters also has a great selection of seasonal flavors- pumpkin, peppermint, mint cookies and cream. 

The Hyde Park location is my favorite. According to my boyfriend, they give the largest portions. While haven't weighed out the proportions, I think the location on the Square has a whole lot of charm. I also love how you can window shop at the boutiques while eating. There is always a good crowd and the staff is excellent. 

Graeters is a Cincinnati tradition, just like flying pigs and Skyline chili. You just absolutely have to try it if you are passing through town.

I'm not even an ice cream lover, but I do really like Graeter's. I like the Hyde park location the best and I think the milkshakes are really delish. It's a fun, family friendly environment in the Hyde park Square. If you are visiting from out of town, it is a must stop!

visited with the family during summer, so we had to get some ice cream! all the signature flavors looked delicious, but i chose buckeye blitz, and i was very happy with my choice! every bite was full of flavor. shop was very clean and organized, and employees were friendly and funny :)
I had the Chocolate Coconut Almond Chip ice cream. Excellent ice cream but almost too many different tastes at one time. Definitely worth a return the next time I'm in Cincy.

I LOVE GRAETERS ICE CREAM!!!  All the flavors are yummy, especially the chip flavors with the huge hunks of chocolate.  I especially like the Buckeye Blitz as well.  I also have "fond" memories of eating big bowls of mint chocolate chip every night right before the OH Bar exam.  Nothing like a bowl of creamy goodness to soothe the pain of studying.

I now live in Chicago, but whenever I'm back in Cincy, I gorge myself on Graeters.

Fantastic place!  Grab an ice cream then a bench in Hyde Park Square.

My daughter (and wife) ask for it by name.

Guess what?  I still LOVE Graeter's!  But apparently not everyone does, so DON'T come to Graeter's if...
you are allergic to ice cream,
you are allergic to big pieces of chocolate that taste delicious,
you are allergic to fun,
you hate fresh flavor,
you hate nice people.

So there you have it.  All others are welcome to enjoy Graeter's!  It is way better than Ben & Jerry's and all others I have tried (except gelato in Europe).  It's still great, it's still a Cincy favorite, it's still perfection.
Don't miss it!

Don't know how this ice cream can rate anything LESS than 5 stars. I am reviewing the Graeter's I use to go to in Hyde Park Square as a kid and yes the ladies there were intimidating - borderline rude even, BUT nothing will ever deter me from my love of this luscious creamy goodness. Even better now that I can mail order it and enjoy it in the comfort of my own home. There isn't a flavor I don't love - among the best, all the chip flavors, peach and coconut. Oh yes and the strawberry. Boy this stuff is good - puts the rest to shame!

The best ice cream you'll find in Cincinnati. Very rich in taste, theres very few flavors you can go wrong with. I highly suggest the Black Raspberry Chip, which is my favorite. If ice cream isn't your thing I suggest their sorbets and malts, both are just as flavorful. They have a great selection of seasonal flavors as well, they fit well with what the weather has you craving at that time. The stores themselves are often small and quaint, if you plan to stay in I'd suggest a sweater or something for people who get cold easily.

A Graeter's addiction seems to form for many in Cincinnati, this includes my family. For a time in grade school I would have a sundae every day after school. It made the days go by faster and always gave me something to look forward too. I also used to eat Graeter's coffee cake for breakfast (they're fantastic if you have a sweet tooth).
so many flavors!!!!!!!!!!!!!! and so yummy!

Toffee chip ice cream with really cold chocolate chips in it. Incredibly refreshing on a 100 degrfee day while visiting Cincinnati. Couldn't come visit and not get an ice cream. If you're in the area, just go. You'll be happy you did.

black. raspberry. chip.
my friend betsy, a cincinnati native, used to have this flavor shipped to her when she lived in NYC. now i know why. (betsy is so smart.)
while visiting her in cincy, we made a trip to this location and oh my god. SUCH good ice cream. it's not too heavy/fatty, like ben & jerry's - the consistency is like velvet. the chocolate "chips" are a freakout - not exactly chips - and i thought i was going to have to unhinge my jaw to get one of the chips in my mouth. what a treasure!
man i'm not even making sense in this review, but dang that stuff is good.

Awesome ice cream (I'm somewhat of an ice cream/custard aficionado)! I got the black raspberry chip and couldn't have been happier with my choice. It's so good, you gotta try it when you have a chance.

Yum, this ice cream is so good!  I brought 6 pints of ice cream home w/me to share w/my family and friends.  I couldn't believe the ice cream actually stayed frozen for 36 hours!  The black raspberry chip was so good - the flavor tasted so natural.  The coconut chip was amazing!  The mint chip was very refreshing and minty.  I've never had such flavorful ice cream that also tasted so natural.  I wish they had locations closer to Chicago!

This is the best ice cream ever.  I'm not a black raspberry fan, but tried it since it's their signature flavor.  It was sublime.  On another occasion had the banana chip.  It was good, but the black raspberry is the best.  I was disappointed that I wasn't in town in June to try the Strawberry Chip.  A colleague swears that this is their best flavor.

Best place to get ice cream ever.  You can eat in the cute ice cream parlor inside or you can take your ice cream across the street and watch kids play on the fountain.  They have tons of cakes and candy on display as well.   The one thing I don't like is they make you order as a group.  We are paying separately so why does this make since?  When we go with a group of 10 it makes for a long wait with the other guy just standing there.   My all time favorite is the banana chip.  It is seasonal and they don't advertise when it is out.  They won't sell it in a pint and I had to resort to getting 3 scoops in a big cup and storing it in a thermos in my freezer.  This makes me feel like a crazy ice cream lady but it is really good.   Egg Nog is also a delicious seasonal treat.  For everyday Blueberry Pie is my go to flavor.  You should really try it if you haven't already.
Visited here at the end of a 'first date' a year ago; went back this past Friday and proposed. Amazing customer service, amazing ice cream and an amazing part of my future. Highly recommended!

Growing up in Cincinnati, of course I was always a fan of Greaters (can you say black rasperry heaven??) Now, having recently discovered that their sorbet is vegan, I have been able to reconnect with this childhood favorite. It is so fun to have a spot to go out for dessert! Five stars for happiness!

I've been very fortunate.  I have a sister who craves and loves good food as much if not more than I do. Every single time that she travels, she makes a point of finding the most sought after best reveiwed restaurants and bakeries..and always brings something home to the rest of us.  Food is a much much better souvenoir than magnets and postcards!  When she found out that she would be traveling to Ohio, all of us received emails to quick pick a flavor of ice creeam that we would like from Graeters.  I had heard great things, but since it was ice cream, I was nervous of her having to travel with it, and also not expecting it to be that big of a deal.  Was I ever wrong.  This was hands down, probably the best frigging ice cream that I have ever tasted.  I had the Raspberry Chip, and the chips were huge and flavorful!  The raspberry ice cream was also extremely yummy and you could taste, I mean really taste how homemade it was, from the cream, the milk, it was a taste explosion!
I highly recommend stopping there if you are ever in Ohio!
It's Graeter's - nuff said. Coconut chip is my favorite but the peanut butter is shockingly good too!

best tasting icecream ever but very inconsistent with chocolate chips. my favorite is raspberry choc chip. sometime hardly any chocolate chips inside:(. but when they put them in its awesome. bottom line is each carton inconsistent.
Yummmmyyyyyyyy!! Raspberry Chip, I think is my fave. Just as good though was the peanut butter chunk. I wish I lived in town for such wonderful treats more often!!
One of the great America's finest confectionaries.  Fantastic ice creams, sundaes, shakes, and candies.  A must for any native Cincinnatian, or visitor.

I tried the peanut butter flavor ice cream with a cone and it was so good!  Totally could taste the sweet peanut butter.  Friendly service on top of that - $2.50 for it, a bit more than I thought but hey, its specialty ice cream part of a family business since 1870 :)

This was my designated Graeter's for the 12 weeks I was interning in Cincy. I can't tell you how many times we made after-dinner runs here! The flavors are all delicious! My favorites were the mint-chocolate chip, coffee, and coconut. Sometimes you can get a seat, but it does get packed during the busy hours. The service here was always so friendly, even if they're about to close. Love them! Will be back!
Besides Ice Cream Graeter's has the best cheese cup pastries!  Oh my goodness they are addictive!  Love my Kenwood Store Location!
Fantastic ice cream!!  I've been Graeter's  50+ times over the years and it is always a wonderful experience.
Highly recommend the black raspberry chip and blueberry pie
This ice cream is the real deal.  I even ordered it online (wasn't cheap).  It's better than Blue Bell ice cream.  Is it better than Amy's in Austin?  Nobody will ever know that answer.
I just tried my first smoothie and it was delicious! I got the Purple Power Blend and I loved it! I was debating on the ice cream or smoothie and I think I am now hooked on the smoothies.

The bleach blonde-tips hair girl with an overdone fake tan and bad attitude walked out looking like she just blew the other guy in the back. Stood in the store for 30 minutes before they even came out to us. She walked out chewing gum with her mouth open and a bandage on her arm falling off touching the food.  He sat on the actual FLOOR and watched her serve guest.  Asked three questions about the yogurt, she was so snide with each answer I literally thought I was on a prank show. Just stick to store bought icecream. Decided to leave because, well, wtf???

Yagoot is BY FAR my favorite frozen yogurt in the entire country! It isn't your typical sweet yogurt, it has a tart taste which makes it stand out. It is also only 120 calories for a small (about a third of the calories of a scoop of ice cream)!! Yagoot has a variety of toppings from fresh fruit to dark chocolate chips. Yagoot also has treats for your puppy!! 

Yagoot is a must have in Cincinnati and everyone needs to try it if in the area!

The frozen yogurt is amazing and way better than orange leaf/ menchies. Their customer service not so much, i love the taste of Yagoot but the way they treat customers makes me want to take my business else where. 
The first time we came the customers didn't care for us, not friendly or helpful really. Just recently (6/7/2021) my boyfriend and I walked into their store at 9:05. The sign on their door said "open" we took 2 steps inside and the dirty blonde head worker said we are closed and turned us down. Then turned down the 3 girls behind us. They were still serving one other customers. I understand that we came in 5 minutes after they "closed", but with the door being unlocked and the sign saying open, I feel as if they should've served us. We did drive 40 minutes in order to get Yagööt, but first had to make a stop at REI. I know that I have the ability to look up store hours, but when a restaurant says "Open", the doors are unlocked, and they are serving customers, you think you will also be served. It would be different if the door was locked, or if the sign at least said closed. 

Like I said great ice cream, but management really need to train workers on customer service. I feel as if this business will only stay open because they are different from other frozen yogurt places. They would make more revenue if their staff was friendly and put customers first, wanting their customers to came back.

Yagoot is still pretty good! I stopped in last weekend to get some froyo. The place is still neat, and can't complain about the service. 
I got a medium pistachio one with fresh raspberries and chocolate chips. It was really good! The froyo, in itself, is so creamy and tart. 
There's a lot of toppings to choose from, but chocolate chips is probably my go-to here. 
The pricepoint isn't the best- have to pay additionally for toppings, so almost $6 for a medium.

Yagööt was pretty good. I was in the Rookwood shopping area, running errands and happened to see Yagööt. I didn't eat lunch and wanted something semi healthy so I decided to give them a try. I had also never heard of them, so I was curious. I was happy I gave them a try. The inside is super welcoming and colorful. It puts you in a good, happy mood. 

I tried their Straw-Nana Smoothie. Yes, it's a strawberry-banana smoothie. I added amino acids to my smoothie. The base is milk and yogurt. I enjoyed the smoothie and thought it had a good taste. It tasted like what it was supposed to and nothing about it was overwhelming. It was well balanced.This was definitely a good, quick on-the-go snack. 

Overall, Yagööt has good smoothies or at least a good Strawberry-Banana smoothie. I would definitely come back for this smoothie if I was near one (they have more than this location) or in the Rookwood area.

I've been coming to Yagööt for years.  There's nothing else like it.  Once you've tried Yagööt, you'll never want to go to those other frozen yogurt places.  

The taste is a lot different from your classic frozen yogurt places. It's very tart, almost sour. The taste is amazing.  It's kind of like a frozen Greek yogurt.  The great thing is that it's kind of healthy too.  They put the toppings on for you, but don't worry they put just the right amount. 

I recommend getting a parfait or a smoothie.  If you get the cups, you end up paying the same amount as a parfait but you get less.  With a parfait, you can pick up to 4 yogurt flavors and 3 toppings.  The smoothie is yogurt blended up with a few toppings.  I really like the original yogurt with fruit blended up in a smoothie.  It tastes just as good as a parfait and you can still taste all the flavors.  

Some of my favorite toppings are yomance and the mini peanut butter cups.  Yomance is a mixture of dark chocolate crunchy ball things and pink yogurt chips.  

They also have a rewards program.  Give them your number so you can sign up. You get a free menu item after spending a certain amount.
Will not be back!  Why do they NOT hav dine-in when all other yagoots do??? Hellooooo. Dont waste your time go patronize the yagoot in mason

Yagoot is my absolute favorite frozen yogurt & I am so excited they're reopened after the pandemic. I know frozen yogurt is suppose to be tart and I love that about yagoot but for some reason today my smoothie tasted bad so I had to go back in and get a new one. I hate doing that, I've never had to do that (or any complaint for that matter) with yagoot but the guy was super nice and completely remade my smoothie (without one ingredient) and it tastes so much better! I'm sure that's not an employees favorite thing to do but he did it very gracefully and I am so so so thankful! Of course I can't wait to come back another day!
I love YAGOOT, especially during this pandemic. No better approach to staying healthy than starting with gut health. I'm grateful they reopened and happy health strategy to all fellow loyal customers

One word sums up this place. Yasss! 

I'm all for this frozen yogurt as it is tangy, tart and sweet all at the same time.

I'm used to pouring and sampling my own frozen yogurt as that is how it is done at other yogurt places around town. That's not how it's done here, which is fine. Just ask the employee for a sample and they will give you a sample in a mini cup. 

The prices here are on the steep side compared to other yogurt shops. They charge $1.00 per topping. Say what? Yea, it's true. 

If toppings is your thing, I would advise you to get the parfait as it comes with three toppings.
I really love this place. The frozen yogurt has a bit of a sour taste and it's not for everyone, but that's ok. More for me. Especially when they have their white peach. YUM! YUM! YUM!

Absolutely the best frozen yogurt money can buy! The staff is always friendly and welcoming, and the monthly flavors are always well-thought-out and taste amazing. A little pricey, but definitely worth the money. I would recommend this to anyone!

My ultimate favorite dessert place to go to. This is the best frozen yogurt spot I have ever been too. The yogurt is tart rather than tasting like it is filled with loads of sugar. They also offer to-go pints of all their flavors. Their flavors change every month which offers you a wide and fun variety. There are a bunch of toppings to choose from and you can get the yogurt in a cup or a smoothie. My favorite flavors include: Italian coca, white chocolate raspberry, and pistachio!

Thanks for barely putting in any in my dish... at least it was only $20 for 4 smalls D: 

It's really good yogurt but your portions where so stingy (ironically in a cup that says fill me up) that this will.be our last visit.
This frozen yogurt is the worst. It's so sour and overpriced. The worker was also very rude for no reason.

Came here for a cheat day sweet treat, and I was impressed! I got a small of the original with strawberries, cheesecake bites, and chocolate chips. It was perfect! The yogurt had the perfect amount of tang and subtle sweetness, and they were really generous with the toppings. The yogurt here is great because it's not overly sweetened like it can tend to be at a lot of other places, so it ends up being pretty refreshing. And because it's yogurt, I didn't feel horrible after eating it! Overall, great product here, and will definitely be back!

Yagoot is my favorite frozen yogurt place in the entire world! I visit Cincinnati about once every two months and I always make sure to stop by Yagoot before I head home out of state because a trip to Cincinnati wouldn't be complete without it!! I always get the original yogurt with nothing on it. It's perfectly refreshing and tart. I love Yagoot and will definitely be back soon!!

This is a warning for people that are looking for their frozen yogurt fix but have never been here. All of the yogurt flavors are extremely tart/tangy (like "original" froyo usually is). The cake batter yogurt had no cake batter flavor at all.  You also do not get to scoop your own toppings, and my cup was made while I was still ordering, so I ended up with toppings overflowing when I would have preferred less of some things and more of other things. It seems like you can only get 3 toppings, but I'm not sure.  It also seems very pricey (there are set prices, it's not by weight).
It seems a lot of people like this place but it wasn't for me. Objectively, the store was clean and the people were nice.

Yagööt is delicious ! This is definitely one of my favorites for frozen yogurt. The yogurt is tart as opposed to sweet giving it a very different taste than competitors. Healthy mix-ins (like fruit) are available then you have the normal mix-ins like chocolate, nuts, coconut, gummy bears & their original alligator granola ! Flavors differ monthly & flavors for each month are listed on their website. My favorite , by far , is blueberry lemon (July)!!

Yay! Hey kids, let's go over-pay and get treated like garbage. Sign me up!

The staff is always distant and rude, the product is decent but over priced for what it is.  

Management doesn't seem to care that employees behave less than what you would expect at a McDonald's.

FYI, Aglemisis is not far away and they like having customers.

Love the tart taste of this frozen yogurt. All of their flavor, from original, fruits (strawberry, blackberry, peach, mango, etc) to the nuts and cocoa are awesome! My favorite is the acai bowl! I can't find anywhere else that makes acai bowl as delicious as Yagoot

I love Yagoot! I wish I knew how to make the umlaut above the Os. I also wish it was a little less expensive, though. Still, I go for dessert whenever I'm at Rookwood getting Qdoba or going to Whole Foods.

My favorite flavors are Italian cocoa and coconut, but they are both seasonal, sadly. Otherwise, I usually just get plain with Oreos. They have various fruit and candy toppings similar to other yogurt places or Cold Stone. They usually have six flavors of yogurt with original (plain), strawberry, and original/strawberry swirl always three of the options.

The yogurt is a bit tart and not rich like ice cream. It's thick and creamy, though, so it satisfies the need for naughty things just enough without making you feel overindulged. 120 calories for a small plain. 150-190 calories for most of the flavors.

The decor is bright, colorful, and whimsical. I enjoy spaces that sort of wake up your brain from the white blahness of so many places.

Yagööt is a great place. Great sweet and tart yogurt. They have so many flavors, sizes, and toppings. There were so many different combinations and nice service. Me and my family always go there and eat together to have so quality family time with great yogurt. The only downside is I can't eat it everyday. Haha. I've tried many yogurt places in the past but none seem to be good besides this one. I really recommend this place to you!
Perfect remedy for a hot summer day! The blueberry lemon, black raspberry and pistachio flavors are a must. I really like that you can sample the different flavors first!

This is sooo good guys! I love their original and blackberry flavor! Amazing! However they don't have any special toppings... it's a little bit expensive but i have to say, it's worth it! 
It opens late. Yassss!
Best spot ever! I love the frozen yogurt and the employees! So nice to have when you're shopping or just stopping by for a delicious treat!

Yagoot is amazing. Hands down. As a health nut, it can be hard to find a sweet treat that won't leave me feeling bogged down. They have a few year-round flavors, but the seasonal ones are where it's at. Plus, they have a ton of toppings to choose all the way from Busken cookies to fresh fruit! If you haven't tried Yagoot, you need to make a trip ASAP!

Yogurt is yummy--perfect blend of sweet and tangy. The flavors swap out each month; we got the strawberry, mango, and blackberry. This is on the pricier side, but we got the 20oz parfait and it was plenty for two (and also more affordable when split).

By far the best froyo place in Cincinnati! The flavors are always amazing- very rich and fresh. The serving sizes are decent and there is a wide variety of toppings that are also always fresh.

Compared to many froyo places, the favor here is more tangy, so steer clear if your looking for typical soft serve taste. 

My favorite is the shake. They are a great deal- the size of maybe a medium (plus some) and 3 toppings whipped together. And adding protein powder makes it a meal. 

The inside is small and not meant to house groups but, there is plenty of benches/stone edging to sit on outside the store (they put pads out during the summer to make them comfy).

Simple, yet exactly what you need and what you look for in Froyo! The set up is like a Pinkberry, so it's NOT self serve. 
We will definitely frequent this place for frozen yogurt cravings! 

They have more than froyo soft serve though. They also have smoothies and push-pop choices! 

Parking is plenty, and when the weather is nice, there plenty of spaces to hang out outside with your cool treat!

Yagoot trumps Orange Leaf.

Yagoot is better than most other frozen yogurt I've had, actually.  It's not really sweet, like some other places can be, so it might take you by surprise at first.  Its tangy and some flavors can be a little tart, it's rich and dense and delicious!  I've had it plain, with fruit toppings, with Nilla wafers, and I recently had a Red Saylor, which is Yagoot's version of a red cream soda float.  Yummy!

Even though they only have 4 different flavors in rotation at any given time, it's still better than the 20 or so flavors you get at the self-serve places.

The Rookwood location is the only one I've been to, and it seems like the last few times I've been there Caleb was working, and he's a peach!  Speaking of peaches, the white peach flavor has proven to be one of my favorites, along with the caramelized pineapple and the classic strawberry.  The peach and pineapple are seasonal, so get 'em while the gettin' is good... or take home a pint.  They have a case there where you can get them to go.

Yagoot is the tingly-tart, frozen dessert that bound to be your new favorite obsession. It's owned locally by busken too so that's another bonus for me.  I haven't met a flavor I dislike. The best part is that they have two staples--original and strawberry--and the other flavors rotate seasonally.  A food for your mood!

So if you've never actually had yagoot I feel obligated to describe the experience to you.  Yagoot is not like your orange leave or DQ soft serve.  When they say it's frozen yogurt, it truly is frozen yogurt.  It's not overly sugary sweet and it's tart and creamy too--I find it to be best complimented by one of their many fruit toppings--chopped fresh daily!  I have so many favorite combos, most of which include the alligator crunch topping which is HEAVENLY.  It's a combo of nuts, coconut and brown sugar and goes so great on everything.  I love it on the seasonal pumpkin.  It's also amazing on the white peach during summer with strawberries.  My mouth is watering as we speak.

So, try it.  It's local, everything is made from scratch, and it's a taste so unique you have to try it to understand it.  Isn't it intriguing?  Go go go!
This is definitely the best Yagoot store in the city. The employees are always very nice and they always have good healthy yogurt in stock. It's nice to see clean toppings with very little mixing.
Great tasting. Decent selection. The staff was great. They made recommendations and told us their honest opinion on things.

This is my absolute favorite frozen yogurt!!!! I actually live in Cleveland and make a point to stop at the closest Yagööt location every time I'm passing through. It's just absolutely perfect. I've tried plenty of froyo in the past and am just not a big fan of how sweet most company's tend to be. I cannot say speak more fondly of this wonderful, tart frozen yogurt and I want to thank the owners for realizing the gap in the market place! My only ask is that you please bring a location to Cleveland - I'm putting too many miles on my car with all these trips to Cinci.

Yagoot, owned by Busken (didja know?), is still the most authentic frozen yogurt in town. While it's no Pinkberry, we can safely call it frozen yogurt instead of ice-cream disguised as froyo. I like sampling the monthly flavors (two each month--chai right now!), but in the end, I'm a fan of the original. I think you can tell a lot about the quality of the yogurt by the original.

If you find yourself making more frequent trips, definitely get a goot card to collect points and get a free cup. Worth the extra space in your wallet.

I had one of their Whirled Shakes with Blueberry Lemon frozen yogurt and red soda.  This was absolutely delicious. However, I was not able to enjoy it until I got home because I'm a bit of a germaphobe and all of the straws were open for customers to reach in and grab. This may seem silly, but this just strikes me as really unsanitary. The straws either need to be wrapped for customers to reach in and pick up, or you need to have them in a dispenser so that you are only able to touch your own straw.

Let me start by saying the location is clean, the staff is friendly, and the toppings are fresh. I personally just do not like the taste of the Yagoot yogurt. It is very tangy and less creamy compared to other local yogurt chains. Cost seems higher as well. I would recommend trying it out, but for me, I keep trying to like it and cant.

One word: Addicted! 

My fav yogurt (froyo) place in the U.S! 
Tops: Mango, White Peach, Coconut & Pistachio

It's soooo good.  It's frozen yogurt... but not that ice cream/fro-yo stuff.  It's literally frozen yogurt.  So yes, it's tangy.  Like yogurt.

They always have original (plain yogurt flavor) and strawberry, and they rotate 2 seasonal flavors monthly.  May 2014 is mango and caramelized pineapple.  I usually get a small for myself, or a medium to share with the beau.  We usually top with 2 fruits (they have blueberry, strawberry, raspberry, blackberry, pineapple, mango) + mochi.  But they also have the normal nuts, chocolates, peanut butter cups, gummy bears, sprinkles, etc that many people like.

This stuff is so good, I could have it daily and not get sick of it.  Yumm!

-----------------------------------
Explanation of my rating system -
5*: Epitome of something, the best I've had, would LOVE to go back
4*: Great food and happy to go back regularly, but not the best of the category
3*: Food is fine.  I may spontaneously decide to go there based on convenience.  But no need to go back either.
2*: If you insist, I guess I'll come along. I'll find something to eat. But I wouldn't have picked it.
1*: No plans to come back.  I'll try to talk companions out of going.

I've been to and loved at least a dozen froyo spots, but let me tell you why this one's the best!

Yagoot is real frozen yogurt. It's not ice cream they're passing off as yogurt. Each of them are a little tart the way you'd expect yogurt to be. And they still have a plethora of great toppings to choose from.

You aren't charged by the weight, but rather the size of the serving you choose.

Aaaand, it's not self-serve, so you never have to try not to trip over a dozen kids running around trying every flavor. But they'll still let you sample whatever you want!

I was surprised by how good Yagoot was compared to it's competitors. What a great, relatively healthy dessert. Love it!

We stopped in on a Thursday night around 8pm. There were only two workers at the counter - one doing all of the work and the other just hanging out at the cash register, thus, orders took longer. The yogurt and toppings we both ordered were great. However, as we were waiting for our yogurt....I started to look around and notice how DIRTY this place was. The floors, under the machines, the walls, the chairs and counters were disgusting. I'm not sure when this place had its last deep clean, if ever. This was the dirtiest store I've been into in a while and snapped pictures for proof...
The customer service kinda sucks. The employees are teenagers who barely make eye contact and are always chatting or on their phones. The yomance is why I keep coming back.

Love Yagoot!   I can't say there is anything else like it that I've enjoyed in any Yogurt shop.  It's definitely real Yogurt if you want real Yogurt, as opposed to Orange Leaf.

I don't load it down with the condiments.  Straight Yogurt..tart and sweet and very very smooth!

YUMMY!! Super creamy, rich and tart.... I don't know how else to describe it.  It's real frozen yogurt, not ice cream infused.

I personally like the coconut mango swirl topped with almonds...so good.  They rotate flavors monthly and by season so there is always something new to try.

If you like yogurt and frozen yogurt...this is a must try!

My best advice is give this place more than one try. The first time I went I was not ready for the tart flavor of the frozen yogurt. 

I've since learned the reason for the tartness--the yogurt is real and healthy and even the flavorings are natural and carefully selected.  I've been impressed at how fresh the fruit toppings are each time I go in. Though, My favorite topping, I have to confess, is the completely unhealthy busken crunch. It's a blend of nuts, coconut and brown sugar.  

The original flavor with a set of toppings is delicious. However my favorite flavor of yogurt is caramelized pineapple. So delicious, no toppings needed. 

Beware! The stuff is addicting. It quickly became a pregnancy craving for me. I almost can't believe I'm saying this but I prefer it to ice cream on a hot summer night, because it just tastes fresh.

It's a little pricey but worth the splurge. Every now and then they give away buy one get one free coupons and if you sign up to be a "ya groupie" they usually send an email with the monthly special or free taste test of a new flavor.

I don't typically go for Frozen Yogurt but I am addicted to their shakes. White peach with crunch, choc. chips, and granola is the real deal. Unlike most yogurt places, their Fro-yo is the highlight of the treat and not the toppings.
It could have be a 5 stars if not because of some rude employee. It always clean, fresh produces, most of the staff are friendly. And sometime they remember what i usually order.

Before the myriad of self serve yogurt places made it to Cincy, Yagoot was here.
I revisited them for the first time in years the other week, and was really pleasantly surprised. The yogurt is awesome quality, with really unique flavors, and I think that for what you get, the prices are awesome.

Mmm good Yagoot's frozen yogurt is nothing like any other frozen yogurt you've tasted, ice cold, thick and flavorful. Just what you need to cool down on a hot summer day. Good plain with no toppings while even better with a few strawberries & chocolate chips.
Stop by on your next Rookwood visit mmm good!
Amazing! I was shocked to find out that you can put fruit in your cup!! I've definitely been sleepin on this place

I love yagoot, almost as much as I love red mango. They have a good concept and amazing promotions. I love their Christmas in July promotion (pomegranate and italian cocoa, yummmm). 

But when I come here, I always get the strawberry froyo with the strawberry mochi & yomance. The yomance is like shaves of yogurt and crunch mix. Yum! Alligator crunch is good here too.

Service is always friendly, and whenever I comment on their instagram, they always reply. my boyfriends dad loves getting pints to bring back home!

The froyo here is pretty tart. Maybe get a froyo smoothie blend with your fave toppings? 

tl;dr solid toppings (yomance, strawberry mochi, alligator crunch), and tart froyo. Great customer service!

Yagööt is the best Cincinnati Yogurt shop.  It's real, live Yogurt (not some powder-mix)

I actually like getting their smoothie-type drink the most when I go here - they have interesting flavors suggested on the menu board, but, of course, you can choose whatever flavors you'd like.  

As far as per-oz. cost, getting a pint is the best deal.

Last visit I commented on the bathrooms and overall cleanliness of the store.  Honestly, they just chose a tough floor-color to keep looking clean.  I'm not sure if they'll really be able to get the stains off the neon-green and orange floors...but, until they swap the linoleum, it's going to have the appearance of "dirty."

The seating is family-friendly.  I did notice that on this visit the music was either off or turned down a lot...so it seemed a little eerie for a retail shop.

Overall, this is still our favorite yogurt.  We'll see you soon.
Always my favorite place to get a guilt free dessert! They've recently added a kid's smoothie size and it's perfect! Not too much and not too little.
I'm a huge fan. Great frozen treat with lots of fresh fruit. Man I want some right now. Hopefully they'll get a refrigerated drone to start delivery!!!!
Good yogurt for a pretty good price. A good smattering of flavors that is usually different every time I different. Combined with friendly staff, it's a must visit.

Cute establishment. Love the tart, yet sweet yogurt. There toppings are way better than other fro-yo places I've been recently. The workers are also much friendlier than most. I live that they have seasonal flavors!

If you like tangy this is the place for you.  I am giving it 3 stars because I prefer more traditional yogurt.  They had 4 flavors tonight (strawberry, vanilla, pomegranate, and chocolate (they called it something else).  They offer 3 sizes and will add in toppings for you - like 25 cents each for fresh fruit or nuts, coconut, cheesecake, chocolate, sprinkles etc.  The small is a good amount and you can choose 2 flavors split in the cup.  I prefer Orange Leaf for the taste but not the price.  

Restaurant is bright and has funky furniture.  Doesn't seat a lot of people but I expect people usually take it to go with the outdoor mall.  Nice desert after PF Changs.

There's only so much you can write about a froyo joint, but Yagoot has long time taken the spot as my favorite froyo place because I have always preferred real tart frozen yogurt and not the froyo that takes like soft-serve ice cream. Their froyo here is so refreshing and smooth, and their fruit here is always fresh.. not to mention their mochi which is also always on point. They have a bunch of other delicious toppings as well and also a great menu of other froyo-infused options. They rotate out two flavors of the month in addition to original and strawberry and I literally have never tried one I didn't like!

Yagoot, you are so goot to me and I love you.

For Cincinnati Yogurt this is as good as it gets. 

Get the parfait. It's the by far best deal. You can customize the flavors AND the toppings.

For those nervous to try yagoot, just ask for a sample of any of their flavors and they'll let you try whatever they have on hand. For some, the taste is too weird. The flavor is pretty tangy and almost sour, but I find it to be very refreshing! Honestly compared to Orange Leaf, Yagoot just has something better about it. Orange Leaf has more of an ice cream gritty texture, and yagoot is smooth and creamy. 

The atmosphere is great and the service is always quick. Even if there's a line, they usually get people through rather fast. I highly recommend it!

Triple yum yum yum. I thought I'd seen it all with yogurt, but Yagoot is in a league of its own.

My mom and I were on a day-long shopping excursion (had just spent 3 hours in ONE store, it's true ... sad, but true) and we were plumb tuckered from all that exertion. We'd missed lunch but didn't want to fill up before dinner so started brainstorming about quick stops, something that didn't come from a place with the double arches. 

Yagoot was across the street. She hadn't been but told me she thought the flavors were mostly tart. I've gone that route at a place near me in DC and never found it particularly satisfying, puckering my mouth at every bite and missing out on the smooth and creamy that always makes my frozen treat experience. I started doubting that this was really the right choice, but when we started rattling off our other options and where we'd have to drive to get them, Yagoot it was.

Thank goodness! Every flavor was divine, I couldn't make up my mind. She let us sample whatever we wanted and I didn't throw a lick of any sample in the trash, even when I knew I was getting my own little cup. Which, I must say, was inhaled nearly the second she put it in my hand.  I had nooooo trouble with the small. I elected plain topped with strawberries and raspberries, my mom went with pistachio with their signature sugared-nut topping.

As we were leaving I noticed that the "shake" seems to be the popular choice - there's always next time!

The yogurt was good and the topping selection was decent. But I prefer the yogurt places that you can self serve versus choose a number of toppings and the staff do it for you. The atmosphere and location were great though and quality of the yogurt was good.

mmmmmm yagoot! they have THE BEST frozen yogurt in town. My favorite is the mix-up yogurt smoothie treat they have where you can get yogurt + toppings and drink it from a straw. Pistachio yogurt + mochi + oreo cookies = INCREDIBLE. seriously, try it. You can thank me later!

Yagoot is a year round treat that I indulge in when I have a few minutes to pop over to Rookwood Commons. I first fell in love with this luscious treat one summer after spending all day at the pool. It's the perfect combination of refreshing and tart. I always recommend to my friends that they start out basic when trying Yagoot for the first time; which means small original plus fruit. I personally have tried a number of the seasonal flavors and continue to go back to the original flavor. Depending on my mood, I will switch up between blueberries, raspberries and strawberries. 

The staff is always patient and willing to let you sample different flavors. The shop has plenty of space to eat in or sit outside on benches. This stuff is addictive once you get your personal go to combination down. I try to limit myself to small since it's on the pricey side but alas sometimes I cave and go for a larger size. Enjoy!

Had a strawberry-kiwi smoothie with some other stuff thrown in.  Wow!  This was the best smoothie I've ever had.  Definitely worth the price.  The staff was very friendly and had some great recommendations.  Service was fast.  This is a great place to stop on any visit to Rookwood!

Yum! Not too much to say about this place other than GO! Yogurt is creamy and tangy. My favorite flavor are strawberry and original. Toppings are always super fresh, but I usually forgo because they freeze in the ice cream and mess up the texture!

Yagoot is one of my fav's.  

I have tried other yogurts but I love their originality.  No one has yogurt that taste like Yagoot.  Some love it. Some don't.  I love it.  I wish there were more Yagoots in Cincinnati.  Campus.  In the movie theatre. In the dentist office, great reward.  

No, but literally, try it.  You'll like it.  Usually, I see if people like Keylime pie first because it's tart. It's good though. Heaven.... in a cup.

I always order the Whirled Famous Shake which comes with 3 toppings and/or protein powder (the protein powder is just an extra $0.75). I recommend trying the combination that I love which is their original yogurt with Cheesecake Bites, chocolate chips, and the Crunch or Nilla Wafers. Everyone that I've introduced it to has loved it!!
Although I have left Cincy for about two years, I cannot forget this frozen yogurt! The best ever!

Yagoot is pretty good, but I don't like their choices as much as Fave in Hyde Park Square (or course, Fave is now "closed for the season," so...). It is a fun and novel place to grab some frozen yogurt, but I haven't found it to have staying power when there are so many other sweet tooth options around. Admittedly, I love sweets. If you're one of those people who find yourself saying, "Oh this dessert is too rich/sweet. I can't eat another bite!" -- and you actually mean it, then Yagoot is probably for you.

That said... Cap'n Crunch as a topping? Awesome.

Love this location. The Yagoot in Rookwood goes beyond basic with their selections of toppings and tangy yogurt flavors. During the summer, the White Peach flavor has a sweet and sour taste that speaks to the palate and in the winter you get unique flavors like Pomegranate, Pumpkin Spice and Italian Cocoa. What is unique about Yagoot is the fact that their toppings are prepared fresh on a daily basis. Therefore you don't have to worry about anything that might be borderline spoiled. They have a number of interesting combination toppings like Alligator Crunch (an unique take on cereal and coconut) and Chocolate Chips. The crew is very nice and very generous with the portions of toppings. It is a colorful setting and very family friendly. If you want a healthy treat and great outing in the Cincinnati area, come down to the Rookwood Yagoot!
Yagoot yogurt was good, I like the xtra toppings of fruits. The decor of the place was cool.

Do yourself a HUGE favor and make a trip to Yagoot already. This tangy, tart treat is unlike any of its neighboring frozen yogurt clones. Full of fruity flavor goodness and a creamy custard-like texture, you will be smitten after one bite. Seriously, that's not a joke. It's addicting. 

All of the flavors are delicious in their own right but like most things, they are not all created equal and Mango stands high above the rest.
I love going to this place after a good workout! Love all the flavors. It also looks like they brought back pistachio and Italian cocoa early for a special treat!

I cannot recommend this local frozen yogurt place enough. They have true frozen yogurt, not the powdered stuff that places like Orange Leaf have gotten used to using. It's real yogurt! Not only thay, it tastes delicious! They change up the flavors (4 at a time) every month, but keep original and strawberry year round. If you get a chance, get the Pomegranate before they change it! It's amazing

Not the hugest fan of sweet treats but I do have to say Yagoot surprised me! 

If you are like me and don't like sweets you might like this place. It is real yogurt so it is naturally tart. Like everyone else is saying, you really can't describe it. You just have to try it.

The restaurant itself is trendy and modern and feels like something out of the Jetsons.  You walk up to a bar of goodies and choose from about 4 different types of flavors to start. Then you get your "add ons" Each add on is an additional price. Some people go crazy and get fruity pebbles, chocolate chips, coconut, and everything in between! 

My boyfriend and I kept it simple. I had the peach yogurt with granola which tasted EXACTLY like a peach snapple. It was sooooo good. When he asked if we wanted a pint, I looked at Justin and said lets run!!! I'm already "one of them". You know, those scary people that are addicted. Now I know why! 

My boyfriend got the strawberry yogurt with kiwi. Yes, I said kiwi. As in freshly diced kiwi on his yogurt. Does it get any better than that? Or healthier? I don't think so. If you are in the mood for a cool treat but don't really like sweets this is the place to be. But be careful, you might get addicted...IN A GOOD WAY!

mmmm, Yagoot. At first, I wasn't so sure--I prefer ice cream, and this frozen yogurt is, well--tart. But then, I enjoy feeling like I'm doing something healthy, while not suffering for it. That's a feeling worth giving it a few more shots. And what do you know, it's like I developed a palate for it!

I will happily eat Yagoot in any season, but I think it shines the brightest in summer, when sometimes it's too hot for even an ice-cream-aholic like me to eat ice cream. It's can be too rich when it's really hot. But enter Yagoot! Now you don't have to deny yourself frozen concoctions! And with all that tingly-tartness, it really must be doing something healthy for me! Oh, I know it won't make me lose weight--I'm not THAT delusional--but it must be putting good bacteria in me or something. At any rate, it tastes really good and I like it!
I thought it was way too tangy and tart and overpriced. It tasted sour. I ended up throwing most of it away. Even my two year old daughter wouldn't take a second bite and she eats everything!

Though I was initially put off by Yagoot's tartness (think plain Greek yogurt, not your standard American "frozen yogurt"), I've come around and now love the flavor. There's a hint of sweetness without it being overpowering. Coconut with the "crunch" topping is my favorite, though I enjoy all of the fruit flavors (skip the chocolate, which just doesn't work as well). 

My main complaint is the price--$3.75 for a small cup and one topping is quite expensive. They also only have a few flavors to choose from each time. The inside of the store is bright and cheery, and the high school students who work there are fine.

How can I not have written a Yagoot review yet? Are you kidding me?

OK, this place is The Awesome. If, like me, your sweet tooth is somewhat limited, or you prefer your sweets to be not too awful for you, then head to Yagoot. Now. That's an order!

The yogurt here is not sweet; it's sort of tangy, rather than saccharine. As such, it provides the perfect base for the many fruit, nut, and sweet toppings. Generally, Yagoot keeps 2-3 flavors of Yagoot in stock: original, chocolate, and something seasonal (coffee, pumpkin, pistachio, banana). My favorite is the original, plain yogurt flavor. My favorite toppings are raspberries, blackberries, and a crunchy mix called "Alligator crunch". The small is plenty big enough, especially with all those toppings. But no matter what you like, Yagoot has it. 

In addition to excellent yogurt, Yagoot has a sweet gift card deal. If you buy a $25 gift card, you get a small carrying bag for lunches (or pints of Yagoot!), AND a super-soft Yagoo t-shirt. So, once you've been and fallen in love, buy gift cards for all your friends. You won't regret it.

Cute, nicely decorated store, attentive staff and it looks like care has been put into the product. 

My kids and wife love it. However, I have a sweet tooth. A major sweet tooth. I like my ice creamy desserts to be overpowering sweet. Rocky Road? Yes, please. This was more of a palate cleanser. It wasn't bad. It just wasn't what I want in a dessert. I didn't appreciate the tartness. Although, I do think my tummy felt better after getting some live cultures into it.

I do like that the menu isn't jammed packed. This helps especially if the kids are indecisive that day. No 37 flavors to overwhelm you. I take that as another indication of care put into the product.

My only complaint or bleg would be for a smaller small. We all ordered a small and each was too big for us.

Best frozen yogurt and super fresh toppings.  I love the shakes the best. Tart and tangy, but still sweet! If you're sensitive to tartness get a shake or strawberry yogurt. While you can't get all their flavors served anytime of year, they always have pints of their other flavors and now push-ups. White chocolate raspberry and mango are my favorites!

I stopped into Yagoot after having my first taste of the Five Guys down the way.

The company is owned by Busken's, a local bakery, which I think is pretty cool. 

I ordered a plain (is it vanilla?) yogurt with oreo pieces mixed in. The yogurt has this incredibly fresh tasting yogurt tanginess and bitterness to it which you rarely find in american style yogurts these days. Just means that it's made really well and with good ingredients. Greek yogurt has a similar flavor. 

Next time I'll get fruit in the yogurt, as the sweet-tanginess really lends itself to fruit pairings over chocolate or decadent pairings. But it was still really good.

Omigosh, how have I not reviewed Yagoot yet?! I ADORE this stuff. I even use "goot" as a verb in my daily vocabulary. (Ex. "Who wants to goot today?") Yeah, I'm pretty much addicted. My coworkers and I drive over to Rookwood to goot after lunch pretty much once a week, enjoying our dessert on the stone benches outside.

I love the simplicity -- 3 sizes, 3 flavors (1 of which rotates monthly) and then lots of toppings -- and the fun, fresh interior. I usually get plain (which is a little tart, not sweet) swirled with the fruity flavor of the month, plus chocolate chips. The smalls are surprisingly filling; mediums usually last me a couple days (I store them in the freezer at work). For just $3 or $4, I think this is a great value.

Interesting note: the plain flavor is very reminiscent of these yogurt drinks that me and my Chinese friends used to drink as kids. So Asians, you may be more familiar and accustomed to the flavor.

Yagoot is a fantastic place to get some of the best dessert in town. When thinking of going out for ice cream, you should not discount this place. Even though it is yogurt, it is probably the best alternative to going to Graeter's or Aglamesis. Don't get me wrong, I am a big fan of both of the other places (especially the latter), but I find Yagoot's yogurt offerings so much more refreshing and healthier for you. Add to that  the fresh pieces of mango, kiwi, raspberries or a whole host of other fruits or candy pieces if you prefer that and it takes the yogurt over the top.
I took my nieces here last week and they absolutely loved it. I have gone with my family, my girlfriend and my friends. I have never once heard anyone said they don't like what they have gotten here. 

It is relatively inexpensive and the young people working behind the counter are always friendly, helpful and prompt. Any long lines move very quickly.

The only down side to Yagoot is that I can't eat it every day. Long story short, Try it!!! You won't be disappointed.

The froyo craze sure has taken over - I'll be the founder of TCBY is somewhere crying about now.

Yagoot is leading the charge in the Cincinnati area. Like most froyo places is somewhat rips off the Pinkberry design document - very new-agey with lots of bright colors and plastics. They do it in a way that looks quite expensive, though, particularly the floor.

Unlike many places (and as I'm more used to), Yagoot is not self-serve. You pick size, flavor and number of toppings, Also, unlike many places you have a choice of 4 flavors. So it's a bit more traditional, if a bit more limiting.

So how's the yogurt? Fantastic. I somewhat prefer Orange Leaf, if only because I prefer the creamy and sweet, but the quality of yogurt here is much better. It's true yogurt, with that true yogurt tang. My friends absolutely adore it for that tang. I've had each of the current flavors - the plain is quite good, the coconut is amazing, the strawberry is probably the best strawberry froyo I've had, and the peach tastes like peach but isn't very good to my tastebuds.

The toppings are very high quality, too. Go for the alligator crunch. Yagoot is owned by Buskin (they should consider going with a wider franchisee model, then selling out! If you need anyone that does corporate franchise strategy, find me, haha!), and gets this topping right from the bakery. Other toppings are all high quality and the fruit is very fresh.

Then there are the mixed items on the menu. One is a warm Buskin muffin with yogurt. Don't let the picture lie to you - the muffin is a bit small and you get an enormous amount of yogurt, not just enough to top the muffin. In fact, part of the muffin is buried in yogurt. But man, it's delicious. The Acai berry crunch mix is a bit too trendy, but get it with coconut yogurt, topped with banana and granola, and it's one of my favorite desserts in the area. The slushies made with soda are the only disappointment to me - the red cream soda was kind of gross (it's a bargain brand and just not a good mix.) I'd love to see Yagoot instead use Boylan's Creamy Red Birch - my guess is this would be mind-blowing.

Yagoot is a winner. It's hard for an ice cream / froyo place not to be, but Yagoot is pretty much the top of the heap in the area. Beautifully designed stores with majorly fresh ingredients. I'd probably choose Orange Leaf over it 6 out of 10 times, but I do so feeling guilty - this is a higher quality place. They just need a red velvet flavor and Orange Leaf would be out of my head!

Um... WOW! I'm actually considering dropping my Starbucks habit for Yagoot. MAN that stuff is good! 1st time had the plain with strawberries and almonds, 2nd just strawberries. The small is MORE than enough too... they're very generous. The first time we visited was a weekday afternoon, so the staff was really warm and helpful. On the second visit, the woman in front of me was raving up a storm about the fact that the "Free Samples" advertised on their signs around Rookwood were, in fact, samples... and not the cup of fruitfully adorned yogurt on the sign. ("False advertising!") Moron. I was speechless. 

Anyhow, I can't wait to go back and try the coffee yogurt. I had a sample on my last visit and it was as fantastic as I expected. I also noticed that you can buy pints of their yogurt for home consumption. Yum, yum. 

I am so thankful we've finally got something other than hard pack ice cream in Cincinnati. It's about time!

Even thinking about what to say in this review is making me want to get some.  Right now.  Their description of "tingly-tart" is perfect.  If you are not a fan of yogurt, this place probably isn't for you.  It is the most on par frozen yogurt I think I have ever had.  Regular (plain) yogurt is always available, and it seems like strawberry is now as well.  There is always a third rotating flavor, which so far has included mango, coffee, pumpkin, and pomegranate.  I tried the pomegranate last week- delicious!  

I can't say I've tried all the items on the menu, but I have had the saylor- regular yogurt with red cream soda.  Yum!  The shakes have been my new favorite obsession.  My top-pick:  strawberry with blueberries and protein powder.  And as always, you can choose yogurt with multiple toppings that include all kinds of fruit, candy, and granola.  

Also, if you check out their website, you can sign up to be a "yagroopie".  They sometimes will send out free coupons for a free small with one topping!  Yum!

I was pleasantly surprised with their fro yo! They have some standard flavors, but also change it up each month. I tried one of the specials for the month- white peach. It was delicious! It wasn't tart, and it also wasn't too sweet. It was the perfect mix.
