I visited BBC after I found out where they were located hoping to try out some of their new ice cream mixes.  I ended up with vanilla and bourbon ice cream.  There was a LOT of bourbon in the ice cream.  It was tasty, but the downside is that I couldn't leave the store with the ice cream. Be prepared to spend a bit of time inside the store.  Overall the ice cream was okay, it was definitely an experience you should at least try once as part of the OTR experience.

Name a better ice cream place......I'll wait..... 

My husband and I always come here when we're in town. We even missed our flight because we had to stop by. Cincinnati doesn't have much to offer so I'd be lying if I said I didn't come all the way here just for this place and another restaurant. 

These guys are always pleasant and so nice and remember us (and even our orders!) even though we're only in town a few times a year. The only downside is that I have to travel all the way to Ohio to get it. 

The staff and the shop deserve all the stars.

This place is so cool, literally. Love the concept of the science experiment-esq ice cream parlor that has something for the booze enthusiast to the coffee enthusiast, to the non alcoholic kids choices. 

From the start my favorite has been The Bonfire... which is strange because I HATE Fireball, but to me it just gives this ice cream a smokey flavor as opposed to the cinnamon. All the joy of s'mores and fire in a cup! My second favorite is the hard apple pie, tastes just like it! The buzzed bull flavor is OK. Honestly I've never tried making my own concoction (which is available to do). The consistency and amount of mix-ins you receive are perfect. Sure its a little pricey, but you have to remember there is shots in your ice cream! I have tried the yogurt base, but prefer the ice cream base. Don't forget, you must eat here if your ice cream/coffee has alcohol in it, but don't worry, its a really nice space to hang out in a for a little bit! Its also pet friendly! Summer or winter this is the perfect boozy treat! 

PS if you get their app, you can order ahead to have it ready when you arrive, and also take advantage of their rewards points program!

If you're looking for an ice cream fix late at night, skip the local chain and head to Buzzed Bull Creamery. The staff was friendly and explained how everything works: basically you can choose from the pre-made menu (which we did, selecting their Tiger Stripes), or build your own. Everything can be made in either an ice cream cup or shake form, and you can add various liquors for a buzz. We opted for the shake, and the nitro ice cream was smooth and creamy, the toppings and mix-ins perfectly matched, and the portion size average. 

They also offer abundant seating, though we took ours to go, and just recently released a new app to allow customers to order ahead of time and also to earn loyalty points. Overall, a great place to go at the end of a date OTR.

OMG! I've been wanting to try this place out and it is sooo good! I got the cherry cordial shake with chocolate vodka and it was amazing. It had chunks of cherry, which is my favorite, and chocolate ice cream. Made it hard to drink through the straw but I just used a spoon to eat it. The worker recommended different liquors that would go well with my milkshake and I appreciated the help since I didn't like what it was originally paired with.
I'll definitely be coming back.

So this is a little disappointing to have to write this review after attending the Yelp event that was held here. After the event I was super excited to come home and tell my husband about it. I wanted him to try it and said "babe we need to go one night on a family outing after dinner." Well that night was last night, and after talking it up it was an embarrassment for my husband to try. I'm the foodie of the two and do well with picking restaurants. After this he looked at me and said "babe you fell short with this one, and how are they open?" "This is it good at all". I just dropped my head with this face :/ and said "well it was good when I came to the Yelp event." There was no wait so that was perfect. 

It starts with either an ice cream base or a frozen yogurt base followed by add-ins and most importantly for some the booze. They use Kitchen-Aid mixers and liquid nitrogen to whip up the creamy dessert. Their bases produce nice and creamy treats, it was cool just to watch. 
However, these creamy treats have no flavor. In my opinion this is the true test. You can have something bland and cover it up with alcohol but when it's stripped down how does it really taste? They failed here! 

Since we were with our 10 month old daughter who we shared the ice cream with we did not get alcohol added. I also prefer the non-buzzed version. I have tasted their ice cream with the alcohol and I honestly didn't care for it. I'm a traditional gal and the alcohol infused flavors tasted just like alcohol with mix-ins. In my opinion it takes away from the "traditional" flavor of ice cream because all you taste is alcohol. It's an interesting concept but just not for me. 

We ordered a small plain Vanilla with Oreos mixed in. Thank goodness we only ordered a small. I would have been pissed to order a bigger size and it wasn't good. We picked the ice cream base instead of yogurt. I raved about this base because during the Yelp event they let us taste it before being frozen and it was awesome. Well when it's frozen with just vanilla it's not so hot! They do everything from scratch and add the "flavors" as they go, even Vanilla. Ok, I'm fine with this and all for it if it's good! This "ice cream", flavorless cream, or whatever you will tasted awful! It was bland, not sweet enough and the vanilla tasted cheap. It's like the flavor of the base and vanilla never mixed well and tasted separate. What I tasted was the bland base finished with a cheap tasting vanilla. Totally off! I come from a southern family who makes their own ice cream so I know what homemade ice cream (with the vanilla being added before freezing) should taste like. This is definitely not it. The Oreos didn't even mix well. It was like cream and then Oreos. It was so weird. I have never tasted an ice cream where the Oreos didn't even mix well. 

Overall, I wanted this place to do well but I think the hocus-pocus of it being made with liquid nitrogen looks cooler then the product taste. The main thing going for them is the product has a good creaminess. It lacks tremendously in flavor and sweetness. They want to grow it and start franchising but if they don't make some changes they will be in trouble. There are too many other good ice cream places around for them to be lacking. They will definitely fall short to the competition. If nothing else you definitely need a strong base as everyone will not get alcohol in their base. Honestly now I realize the alcohol infused ice cream flavors, are only hot because of the alcohol. The mix-ins don't quite "mix-in" either. It's basically cream with mix-ins but it doesn't taste cohesively blended. It's like chocolate chips folded into cream and each individual part has its own separate flavor, but the flavors don't play nice together. Like oil and water! When I chew my ice cream it should all taste cohesive not like cold bland creaminess with a chocolate chip just kind of out there. Needless to say, we won't be back.

One of my favorite ice cream places of all time! I've never seen nitrogen alcoholic ice cream before and it is delicious. My favorite flavor is the pumpkin and I had it mixed with captain Morgan which was great. Buzzed Bull is such a unique and fun concept! They're a family run business and everyone who works there is beyond friendly. I come here every time I'm in town! Wish we had one in LA.

We checked this out after a late night dinner just to see what the real 'buzz' is all about. Pretty pricey for a scoop of ice cream with your choice of some alcohol mixed with it $8+ place has a cool, chill vibe to it. It was okay.

Alcoholic ice cream. Do I have your Attention? Such an awesome concept and it is done right! Although I did not get any boozey ice cream, I was able to create my own minty and brownie creamy frozen yogurt creation! Creamy and delicious! Love this place and love watching them make the orders as they get them!

@Eating.Drinking:

ICE CREAM MIXED WITH ALCOHOL? Look no further!  -- Based in OTR, Cincinnati are the incredible pioneers that are @buzzedbullcreamery! These guys are delivering on their promises to remove the 'one-ice-cream-fits-all' mold, make ice cream to suit anyone & everyone, and make ice-cream cool again!
*
Their innovative process is all down to science, and that of liquid nitrogen! This process produces a fully customized, hand-crafted frozen dessert and it doesn't stop at only ice cream either, with the healthier option of frozen yogurt, sorbets and the superb nitro milkshakes. Buzzed Bull truly offer something for everyone. The fun doesn't stop there either with the option to add up to 20 mix-ins, and over 30 flavors available to choose from!
*
The beauty of #BuzzedBullCreamery is that you witness science in front of your very eyes and this makes the experience like no other. Due to using Liquid Nitrogen it allows for the instantaneous freeze of the ingredients which creates a smoother, creamier...and much cooler dessert! 
*
The process is simple making your life even easier:
#1 - Buzzed or Non Buzzed
#2 - Pick your flavor
#3 - Pick a size
#4 - Pick your base
#5 - Pick a mix-in
#6 - Upgrade your buzz by adding a shot of alcohol to your ice cream!!
*
Another great feature is the ability to choose a flight which allows the sampling of 4 Buzzed flavors, perfect to taste your way around the menu, and see what you like best for next time. One of the most enjoyable things is witnessing children see their creation come to life. There is a real buzz & excitement in the air here!
*
Next time you're looking to enjoy science, #IceCream & #alcohol rolled into the perfect possible bundle, get down to Buzzed Bull Creamery. Their staff are friendly & masters of their craft will guide you in choosing the best flavor for you!
*
buzzedbullcreamery.com
*
Over-the-Rhine:
1408 Main Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202

Now, as a totally disclaimer, I am not a huge ice cream fan from the start. However, my wife and I have twice been let down. 

My wife loves ice cream and I am a bourbon lover, so this seemed like the best compromise for the end of a date night. I got a chocolate and bourbon ice-cream and I simply didn't love it. It was so flash-frozen that the chocolate sweetness didn't come through and the bourbon flavor was minimal. It's a shame cause I really wanted to concept to work!

I also think that this could have been forgiven if were not for the price. This place is expensive and makes Graeters seem like inexpensive ice cream. I guess you are paying for that bourbon you can barely taste. 

It's a novelty for sure. It's fun to watch it get made and say you've had alcoholic ice cream. It's just not a place we'll be giving a third try. 

The only thing I'd recommend there, are the drinks. They've found a way to make add liquor to desert, in liquid form. And wow, is it good. It is just no exactly what Buzzed Bull Creamery should be know for, though.
So so so good! Its a little pricey but definitely worth it. They have buzzed options that are also really good. The Red Leg and Banana Split are great.

wow, excellent ice cream (super cooled with nitrogen gas) and the kick of adding booze is really fun. might not seem like a natural pairing but definitely works. I had the Buzzed Bull which included coffee ice cream and bourbon and it was excellent. I thought the liquor flavor would be hidden but it was definitely there. love this place

Was super excited to try Buzzed Bull Creamery, and really wished I could say I liked it better than I did! Though I love love love ice cream and love bourbon, the two just didn't come together to amplify each others' greatness. Alcohol lowers the freezing point of other things, so in order to get the ice cream with alcohol to freeze, they have to use liquid nitrogen to freeze it. This unfortunately makes it less flavorful. And it's not like you actually get an effect from the alcohol in the ice cream. Ultimately, a fun novelty, but you're better off getting ice cream and a drink and enjoying side by side!

I was super excited to finally visit buzzed bull! I really enjoyed my experience. There was a really long line since it was a weekend night, but the wait wasn't bad considering. The ice cream I got was really good, which was the tiger stripes. It wasn't too overwhelming like I thought it might be. I would definitely like to return to try a milkshake next time.

Was delightedly misguided in discovering you can make your own alcoholic ice cream treat. I made a mistake (and got a rightfully judgy look from the cashier) when I went with fireball, coffee and banana. It was okay, but I tasted some of my friend's standard menu item which was much better. The location is a bit "off the beaten path" (next to the Woodward theatre) but it is the perfect summer treat. I really have no idea how this place will survive the winter but hopefully there are more creative menu items to come.

The concept of alcohol and ice cream with custom flavors, liquor, and add ins is genius. There are an infinite amount of combinations here with lots of unique options. 

The space is welcoming and set up well but the boards/instructions could be more clear. It was taking people between 5-8 minutes to place their order and understand the process (1/2 of the issue was with untrained staff at the iPad register but I assume that is just a growing pain of being new).

I think I went wrong by ordering the pre-made flight. I was attracted to the option to taste four unique combinations but they tasted icy, not creamy like the custom flavor options that were made fresh. Also found it odd he flight flavors were posted in areas not visible while waiting in line. 

My husband got the Tiger Stripes and that was way better and fresher than my flight. Highly recommend choosing a specialty or making your own.

Hmmm...I may be in the minority here, but I just didn't think the ice cream tasted very good. This place feels more gimmicky to me than something that I would actually go to regularly. That being said, it was fun, so I still think you should check it out at least once. 

On the recommendation of the guy working there I got the buzzed bull ($8 for small; coffee, bourbon, caramel, nuts, whipped cream).  I should add that they weren't exactly forthcoming with recommendations, which would help because the menu is super confusing...I had to ask 2-3 people for what is their most popular item. The value seems really good to me since I would pay $9-12 for a cocktail in OTR, and this had toppings and stuff mixed in it. I like that they make it with the liquid nitrogen right in front of you...It's a pretty fun show! I also like that the liquor can be customized, from well drinks to top shelf liquor. I just went with Jim Beam because that's the base liquor.

My ice cream was ok. Frankly I didn't taste coffee or caramel, just peanuts and Jim Beam. I thought it was way too alcoholic tasting, and I basically just didn't like it. My friend ordered strawberry daquiri base with gin and blueberries and she really liked hers, so maybe my flavor was a bad choice or the person making mine didn't balance it very well. 

There was no wait when we went in, but when we left there was a short line. You have to enjoy your alcoholic ice cream inside. Overall, I don't know if I'll be back, but I enjoyed it for the experience.

Came here after dinner on a Thursday night. First off the staff was very friendly and explained everything well. I got the chocolate ice cream with Oreos and reeses. Really good. My friend got the Tiger Stripes with rum. He loved it. Really recommend this place. Ice cream is awesome and they serve it in a unique

A delicious time and wonderful experience. This is probably my 3rd or 4th time going. I always get the 'Death By Chocolate' with the chocolate vodka blended in. It Always comes out pretty delicious and the staff were very kind as well. It's always a great experience and I will be back.

A few things:

A: Alcohol or wine infused ice cream is not a new concept. This idea has been around for years. Go east to New York to experience the real deal.

B: If you're coming here to enjoy "ice cream" spare yourself and just go to Graeters. It's truly booze-infused here and if you're going for ice cream you will definitely be disappointed. 

C: Now, if you like booze-infused, try the Buzzed Bull, nice flavor and my husband enjoyed it. I blended rum with coconut ice cream and added sliced almonds. It was smooth with a nice hint of almond and I enjoyed it.

So with that being said, I enjoy wine infused ice cream more than booze. However, Buzzed Bull is perfectly fine for something different. Keep an open mind and try it.

I think the Buzzed Bull Creamery is an interesting and new concept that I haven't seen before in Cincinnati. As an Engineer, liquid nitrogen Ice Cream isn't anything absurd or crazy, it's in the standard playbook for any kids science day event. 

The creamery here makes it more "adult" by adding in liquor into base if you want it buzzed or you can get it non buzzed. You also have the option of ordering from a preset menu or you can build your own like a blizzard. 

Overall, the ice cream was just decent. The flavors were not there for me. I think the showmanship is great because you see your ice cream made in front of you. But if you want good ice cream, go to Graters and pour a shot of liquor on top of that.

I wanted to like the Buzzed Bull. I really, really did. In fact, I hoped it would be so good that I would have to visit every trip to Cincinnati. I mean how could alcoholic ice cream treats not be amazing? However the Buzzed Bull ended up being "just alright".  

I ordered the strawberry Daquiri flavor which included shots of triple Sec and rum. I could have sworn my ice cream had an ABV of 0% because I couldn't taste (or feel) any of the advertised ingredients. It ended up being just kind of okay but also kind of bland strawberry ice cream. I couldn't even finish the stuff because it was so bland. My friend ordered the Buzzed Bull classic Bourbon ice cream and - while slightly better and definitely alcoholic- it still wasn't anything to write home about. 

End of the story - I may be back; I may not. I certainly won't seek it out though.

*update* my husband and I have been back a few times since this review- both times we have to wait over 30 minutes for our order to be ready, and there was no one in line ahead of us. Also the staff was very uninterested in moving quickly, and both times it was on a Friday night and there were only two people working. So delicious? yes! Worth the 30 minute wait? not for us. 

Sooo yum!! Great summer evening treat. Ice cream made from scratch with the option for adult beverage mix ins??? Amazing! Great building, great staff, delicious ice cream. Love the concept- glad it's in Cincy.

Came back here a second time on a Sunday evening. There were about 6-8 people ahead of us in line and we ended up waiting 30 minutes just to order! After ordering, it was another 15 minutes before our orders were ready. My husband and I shared the buzzed Red Leg (strawberry ice cream, vodka, red bull, and graham pieces) and weren't impressed. The ice cream tasted a little freezer burnt almost - more 'ice' than 'cream. Our friends got the Bonfire with Khalua (which they also got the first time we came here) and, once again, that was creamy and good and made me regret not ordering it for myself. I would still like to come back here, but right now the concoctions are not worth the 45 minute wait :(

Outstanding taste must order the White Russian with nuts and whip cream
Watch them make your ice cream right before your eyes! Flavors are delicious must try death by chocolate next time!

Just recently had this as a dessert with a group of friends. Ice cream is mediocre and taste like any other ice cream you get from the grocery store. I had the tiger stripes, girlfriend had the red leg, friends got cherry cordial and vanilla ice cream with oreos inside. My girlfriend found an end of a paper straw wrapper inside of her ice cream and when informed about it, the workers did not say sorry or offer any type of refund or even offer to make a different ice cream for her to enjoy. Not that enjoyable.

Ok, I can get down with this place!

Finally got to try Buzzed Bull after seeing all the hype, and I'm pretty happy with my first couple times there. The only reason I'm not giving five stars is because of how long the wait is even when it's not busy. I guess it's just a long process, but twice when I've been in I've seen them have to remake someone's so I think it's just maybe growing pains. Also, it's definitely pretty pricey, but I do understand alcohol increases the cost.

The ice cream I got was cake batter, peanut butter, vanilla vodka and sprinkles - one of the flavors they have listed on their premade flights (which also sounded great, and convenient that they are premade!). I really liked mine, and didn't think the vodka was too overpowering. Most people I was with liked theirs, except my friend who got brownies in his said it didn't taste like brownies, but more like cubes of sugar.

I went back and got cake batter, brownies, sprinkles and no alcohol, and I thought it was still pretty good. I'll be back!

Love it! Can't really say much more than that. I got the Buzzed Bull with Makers instead of Jim (Hate Jim outside of the Double Oak) and it was fantastic! I wasn't buzzed at all but it was a delightful treat. My wife got something girly. She loved it. Oh. It was Death by Chocolate. She loved it. It taste very good too. 

The staff were great. It's almost a show watching them make the ice cream. That liquid nitrogen looks cool. How they handle it without any protection is beyond me. I'll definitely be going back though. Especially this summer when it's going to be so hot. Highly recommend

Fun concept, good place to take visitors, sometimes not the most friendly of employees. I've been to Buzzed Bull 3-4 times now, and I really do enjoy it. It's on the pricier side, but it's basically dessert + a drink, so the prices make more sense when you take that into account. And the servings are HUGE - go smaller than you think. I really like the monthly flight option, but the downside is that then you don't get to watch the liquid nitrogen (which is half the fun!). The Bonfire flavor is to die for. I've never strayed into the create your own flavor because Bonfire is so good. The only real negative of this place is that the employees always seem somewhat annoyed. I'm sure that they get sick of everyone taking videos of the liquid nitrogen - but that's sort of to be expected at a liquid nitrogen alcoholic ice cream shop. 
TLDR: One of my defaults to take out of town visitors, great taste, fun idea and vibe, but don't expect amazing customer service.

Ice cream with alcohol...so delicious. Stopped in on a Sunday afternoon. Only 2 people working to the line/wait was pretty long. It was also national ice cream day...so not sure if the crowd was normal or not. The wait gave us plenty of time to check out the extensive menu...sooo many choices. I got butter pecan with Bourbon and my husband got cake batter with Vodka. Very tasty.

Big plus, they allow dogs! Unfortunately, I was disappointed with the ice cream. The technique was supposed to make the ice cream creamier. I really didn't think so. My mix ins were a little skimpy. I was wishing for Graeter's but my friend chose Buzzed and since I just ate a whole big serving, I couldn't very well walk the few blocks to Graeter's but I was yearning for it. The appeal to this place is incorporating the liquor and the technique. I just wish the texture was as promised and the flavors better. Sorry!

First off, the concept of this place is awesome. Who doesn't want ice cream with liquor mixed in? And the presentation of how the ice cream is made, complete with plumes of liquid nitrogen vapor, makes for a pretty cool experience. The location itself is very nice and the staff very friendly as well.

The ice cream itself, though, is a total mixed bag. My first time here I ordered the Bonfire (a s'mores-like specialty). While I didn't think it tasted like a s'more exactly, I did find it delicious. The Fireball pairs well with the sugary base, with the cinnamon hit *almost* like the taste of a campfire. The marshmallow syrup itself though is completely lost in the mix, and I would probably substitute it for
vanilla next time.

The Tiger Stripes is another story. I normally think of stripes as referring to two different flavors but this one just tasted like I was eating a bowl of chilled peanut butter out of the jar, and the drizzle of pure peanut butter on top only emphasized that. I love peanut butter sundaes but I would never get this one again. It needs to be balanced with other flavored to justify $7.59.

We also tried a straight non-buzzed strawberry ice cream for my kid. This was by far the most disappointing one. It was a faint pink and had the ever so slightest taste of strawberry.  But mostly it just tasted like cold sweetened whipping cream. When I mentioned it to the staff they were not surprised. Apparently it was made by blending in three strawberries and nothing else. The did happily remake it though by making a cake batter ice cream with strawberry syrup and strawberries mixed in. It was great after the remake but the original was so bad that I'm baffled why they would knowingly serve it!

So will I come back? Probably, but I'll be careful on what I order. Hopefully the menu gets revamped soon so the consistency of flavor can be improved.

So so good! Not only is the ice cream delicious but this was such a neat experience. They make the ice cream right in front of you using nitrogen. You can get your ice cream buzzed or not buzzed. I highly recommend the buzzed version for those over the age of 21. But the non buzzed versions are delicious as well. I highly recommend the specialties tiger stripes and the bonfire.

OMG!

This is an AMAZING place. 

Idea, execution, ambiance and product, all superb.

They have you pick your ingredients, toppings fillers and alcohol.  Flash freeze it in a blender and out comes alcoholic ice cream made just for you.  All the ingredients are excellent and you can upgrade your alcohol to top shelf as you please.   I had bourbon coffee and pecans delicious. My husband had the Buzzed Bull.  Both were delicious.  I have no doubt that I'd like to put 2 shots in a concoction but we were driving.  

The process of making each cup is fascinating so even though there was quite a wait.. there was a lot to see watching the assembly line process of flash freezing each person's unique concoction.  

I think they're going to be doing very well for quite some time as every single person who took a first bite while I was there said "Oh Wow, that's amazing" or some variation along those lines....

Props to the geniuses who made this dream a reality. We will definitely be back!

Lost my buzz while waiting. I was excited to try a boozy ice cream place for the first time but the experience was disappointing. Not even exaggerating it took OVER 20 MINUTES to get my ice cream as the worker took her time acting in no hurry whatsoever. There was only one worker making ice cream on a hot Sunday afternoon, this is unacceptable and they should warn customers about the wait before ordering because I would have walked out. Not to add that the worker struggled to explain their concept to me and acted like I wasn't understanding how they made the ice cream....The ice cream was okay, barely tasting the booze. I won't be back with many other great ice cream options in town that take no more than 5 minutes to serve you.

Pretty neat new ice cream place! My friends and I was so curious about nitro alcohol infused ice cream so had to check this out. 
There was about a 15 minute wait because two people in front of me took that long to decide on something. It can get a bit confusing to figure out how to order, essentially pick an ice cream flavor, one free mix in and if you want it with or without alcohol. I got the strawberry daiquiri ice cream with pineapple mixed in. Watching the process was exciting, with all the steam and such puffing around! The ice cream was creamy and flavorful, a nice summer treat. Someone actually took my order at the end of the line, so they had to make me a new one. 
I'd suggest ordering one of the specialities, such as Death by Chocolate or Tiger Stripes (my friends really like those). It can be expensive, but remember you are paying for booze. Also you have to eat the ice cream inside if it contains alcohol.

It is a cool concept and delicious, but the process is slow so expect a wait.  We came on a Thursday evening and it was about 1/2 from the time we walked in to when we got our shakes.  I am not sure if it is the process, or there may have been a couple of new employees that got a little overwhelmed.

We will be back as I now know the process and hoping that it was just newer employees that made the time longer.

Super helpful and nice staff. Gimmicky but fun process. 

SUPER SUPER SLOW.  Don't try to make substitutions to menu. Items will get confused and lost. Their pos system may not allow for easy changes. Just build your own if you want anything different 

A regular is more than enough for two people and a Small is almost too much for one. 

Prices are great. I'd give it another go.

Such a great concept and at a great location! Buzzed Bull is a unique place to get coffee, ice cream, or milkshakes. You can order either of the three either "buzzed" or "non-buzzed". Buzzed is with alcohol and non-buzzed is without. I ordered the "Death by Chocolate" specialty coffee. It didn't come out super hot which meant I could drink it immediately, huge plus. Also, it wasn't super sweet and didn't taste like I was drinking fudge.

I enjoyed the experience. Definitely will be back. It was packed and there was a line but it was worth it. I ordered the nutella but nonbuzzed. It was good as tasty. Had whip cream added as well.  You cant take the ice cream out but there is enough seating for everyone. Staff was nice.

Have you ever had ALCOHOLIC ice cream?

No?

Well you should - and the perfect (possibly ONLY) place to start is The Buzzed Bull Creamery. 

Stopped by on a dessert date one Saturday evening to check out this cool new place that just opened. We were in the mood for something sweet, different, and dare I say...erm....DARING. Buzzed Bull definitely lived up to those expectations.

I noticed two things when I walked in: (1) How clean the place looked and (2) how it looked like one part bar and two parts ice cream parlor. Liquor bottles are shelved behind the counter where you order and see your sweet treats come to fruition. There is a decent amount of seating in the place and it looks both inviting and distinctly adult at the same time. I will offer one qualm: The spot where people order their liquor-infused ice cream creations is not all that clear. It's near the back of the place with only a tiny "order here" sign indicating where to go. It was partially for this reason we were a little confused when walking in; however, we needed some time to look at the menu anyway so no biggie.

We weren't too sure what to order. Yes, I've enjoyed my fair share of alcoholic drinks. Yes, I have delighted myself with the finest of iced creams. But mixing the two....what's one to do?

My date ordered a Kalúah and coffee infused chocolate ice cream and I ordered a rum infused strawberry ice cream - both suggestions by the staff. The chocolate was rich and out of this world! The rum/strawberry, while nice, left me wanting a bit more sweetness; however, you can definitely taste the alcohol and ice cream working together. It's something I'll definitely be back for!

As a bonus, you get to watch the creation of your ice cream. The power of mixing kitchenware and liquid nitrogen finally unite in front of your very eyes! It's an eerie experience, watching metal bowls act almost as cauldrons to make your flavor come to life. 

I wanted to have some fun writing this review because I think Buzzed Bull is a really neat place.  
Put simply, the staff is friendly and the alcoholic ice cream is a wickedly delicious evening treat. I hope to return soon!

Super fun stop, open late night- fast service and fair prices! Cool create your own options, alcoholic or non alcoholic and fun mixtures tons of options for everyone! I had the campfire shake with fireball and LOVED it! The liquors not an overpowering flavor and really was a great mixture! If you sign up for the app you get a free incentive and also free treat for your birthday!

I was excited to try this place! Ice cream and alcohol--seems like a good combo. The ice cream was homemade and I do think their base product seemed good but my experience was ruined by waiting legitimately over 30 minutes for a small ice cream and milkshake. Come on. If I had known that, I would have never made a purchase. (Probably why they don't let it be known because they'd lose so much business). Who has that much time to just sit (and sit) and wait for ice cream? Not me. No one was in a hurry, it was obvious many customers were getting frustrated over their outrageous and unknown wait times, but the workers didn't seem to care or even address it. Separately, the nitrogen seems cool and all but it was too much for the flavor it added and was used too much (about 15-20 nitrogen blasts per order). And I couldn't taste a hint of alcohol that you pay double the price for. 
Basically I won't be going here again.

Buzzed Bull is such a fun concept! We loved speaking with the owner, Shane, about how his dream for Buzzed Bull came to be. The line moved quickly and the place was well set up and decorated with awesome photos of Cincinnati on the walls.

The ice cream I chose (cake batter with Loopy Three Olives Vodka and brownie bits) was just okay. This was mainly my fault for my choice of liquor as the other people I came with had MUCH better concoctions! I would recommend not doing a liquor that is too flavored because it will really infiltrate your ice cream.

We were also a bit confused about the menu, but it was easy to understand once it was explained to us.
Delicious and definitely worth the very reasonable price! Lots of choices, not just ice cream but coffee and drinks as well!

I was really looking forward to trying this place. The concept is awesome and it's a lot of fun figuring out the menu and ordering. Sadly, this place is not made for people with allergies whatsoever. My friend who has a nut allergy asked what she was able to order and the man as the register said he wouldn't get a single thing because the dishes were not washed that well. I totally understand him telling her not to get anything but after he said the dishes were not washed that well I am a bit cautions (what does that mean?!). Hopefully this spot can accommodate but allergies in the future since it is so common, but also maybe wash their dishes better? 

My buzz cream was delicious on the other hand. There were a large group of us and we ordered about every type on the preset menu. I'm interested to come back to try to customize it a bit. 

Tip: don't go here while day drinking or before a night out. Your stomach will hate you.

This place is great! So glad they put something like this in OTR. I ordered a small with banana flavored ice cream, vanilla pinnacle and walnut pieces. It was delicious (although I wish I added chocolate chips) and you could hardly taste the alcohol. It was about $7 which isn't bad considering you get a whole shot of liquor plus ice cream. Double shots were about $12. 
I highly suggest dazzling up your ice cream because the flavoring can be kind of bland (I tried my boyfriend's strawberry ice cream as well) but the ice cream itself is very creamy and delicious. It's all made in house so I give them props for that. Add some crunch or flavor if you are creating your own and make sure you know what will mix well! If you're not the best at customizing, I suggest ordering from the specialty menu.

My girlfriend and I went here tonight for dessert after visiting another restaurant downtown. I found this place through this app and my girlfriend of course loved the idea of "buzzed" ice cream. Parking is on the street or in one of the nearby lots. It's a cute little small shop and when you walk in it's very Urban/Industrial feel, which I really loved a lot. The menu is quite extensive, lots of goodies to choose from and different ways for them to be made. You can also get coffee as well. The ice cream as stated in other reviews is made with liquid nitrogen. The production line has clear see through glass, so you can see your ice cream being made. It's actually super cool because you see the nitrogen rolling out of the blender. It honestly looked like a science experiment. I got the White Russian and my girlfriend got the Dreamsicle. Both were amazing and we shared ours to get the best of both worlds. I can already foresee many trips here during the summer. Prices aren't bad in my opinion, especially if you're getting booze in your ice cream. I love helping small businesses out too, so I have no problem paying a little bit more for quality. Keep up the awesome vibes! :)

Eh. So my first experience with nitrogen ice cream was in NoCal so my standards are high. But, I tried the butter pecan without the buzz and I was overall disappointed in the flavor. I was so surprised at how underwhelming the flavor was. It seems as if the ingredients are not all natural and there is some syrup or sweetener that just doesn't fit. I will say their focus must be the buzzed ice cream which may have improved the flavor. I'll try another spot next time I'm visiting cincy.

I wanted to like this place, but was so disappointed. My husband and I each ordered different flavors of ice cream with no booze added, but what we got wasn't ice cream--it was basically frozen cream with no sugar and minimal flavor. The presentation also leaves a lot to be desired. There was also a pretty big discrepancy between how insipid my ice cream was vs. my husband's, which suggests that there's some inconsistency in how it's prepared. 

I'm usually a big fan of innovative approaches to ice cream, but this was really disappointing.

Been there four times- finally writing the review. One of the best ice cream. Super smooth and not too sweet. I like the following combo: Nutella ice, banana, and brownie or Brownie batter ice cream, banana, graham cracker, and brownie.
Staff very friendly and helpful.  Ice cream is good, Next time I'm trying fireball and vanilla ice cream. Great experience for the kids, they loved the smoke coming from nitro.

I have been dying to try this because you doesn't love alcohol and ice cream! I was very curious how this would taste, so I shared a flight of ice creams. We had a chocolate with rum, coconut with rum, strawberry with tequila, and mint with bourbon. They were all delicious! My favorite was the mint and coconut. I highly suggest doing a flight so you get a variety of different flavors and drinks. I will definitely be back to try a new flight next month!

Don't "bull"-ieve the hype. 

I'm fortunate that this review is written in text, because I can't feel my tongue or any part of my mouth.

I'm not sure where to begin here...so I'll just start off with how overpriced the menu is. This is highway robbery masked as "gourmet" ice cream. My gut says the idea is there, but the execution is not. Upon arrival, you pick a flavor, mix-in, and decide if you want it with booze or not. Seems pretty straightforward, or so I thought. 

My partner and I went this evening, and for two adults (we both ordered the honey bourbon flavor--I ordered a small, him a large) it was $30. 

FOR. ICE. CREAM. 

When the cashier said it would be a $9.50 up charge for my ice cream if I got "top shelf" whiskey (on top of the base price of $6+ cup) I felt paralyzed. Never in my life have I felt so robbed before eating ice cream. Normally this choice of dessert evokes pleasant feelings such as happiness, joy, sometimes bliss. Today, I just felt angry, confused, and in pain. 

If the asinine prices weren't enough to drive you out, maybe the debilitating injuries will. There should be a "Danger! Wait 15 minutes to eat your ice cream." sign by the pick-up window.

Buzzed Bull, you should have your employees warn customers about how cold liquid nitrogen is and how cryogenic fluid *probably* shouldn't be consumed. Just a thought. One bite and it felt like my mouth was on fire. My partner threw his large cup of ice cream away after suffering through half. That's how unbearable eating this ice cream was.

But hey, if you like your tongue and the roof of your mouth feeling fleshy and raw while eating overpriced, bland ice cream doused with liquor, then this is the place for you.

As for me? I'll pass and never return.

Got a buzzed shake. I really enjoyed it! The service could be a little faster but it is Tuesday and it was surprisingly busy. There was a good amount of alcohol in my shake. A little pricey, but it's not unreasonable for OTR. 

Would definitely recommend it!

The concept of this place: A+

The execution of this place: D+

I really did love the idea and the look of this place! It looks very modern and scientific and you can tell that the staff knows what they're doing. My beef is with the product itself. 

If you didn't know, Buzzed Bull Creamery makes their ice cream to order - they combine your preferred flavor combination, topping choice, and your favorite spirit together into a custom-made ice cream of its own in 10 minutes or less. The process is impressive and it is quite the experience watching the employees craft their work together. 

Thus it's not the employees that ultimately soured my opinion; the ice cream itself leaves a lot to be desired. It's airy and the texture is somewhat chalky. The taste is almost what you would expect from an alcoholic ice cream however it's lacking what the branding suggests it would have - creaminess. 

I know a lot of it's flaws ride in the process - you can only do so much with made-to-order alcoholic ice cream. But I believe if Buzzed Bull was to strip away some of the showiness and focus on having a truly great product to offer, I could see them becoming a future staple of the city.

This is such a cool idea! My boyfriend and I got mint ice cream with brownies and 1 shot of bourbon. The bourbon definitely overpowered the mint flavor so I would probably get a different liquor next time. The smallest size was still a lot of ice cream to split. The workers were very nice and helpful. I can't wait to try more flavor combos!

TLDR: Come here ready for a cocktail and not ice cream-it will help you have a good experience.  "Flavors" on the board means ice cream flavors.  Pick a flavor, pick a booze, pick a mix-in (one comes with your price).

So for the novelty and being the first to d'nati with the concept: 5 stars
Space: solid art work on the walls, inviting space: 4 stars
The actual ice cream treat: 4 stars (mine was a 5, s/o's was a 3)
But...the ordering experience...ugh that's going to drop this to a three star review.  The board isn't clear and, while friendly, the staff weren't terribly helpful.  When I was struggling to choose a mix in, her response was, "well, you don't have to get one." instead of offering "x might be good with that"  With a treat that has appeal to folks who may not typically drink liquor, and a new concept in town, we need a little help here.

As others have mentioned, the ordering board needs some work.  Here's how to think about it:  Step 1: Pick your ice cream flavor. 
Step 2: Choose your booze.  
Step 3: Mix something in.  
Pro tips: (some booze/ice cream suggestions; or flavor combos to make popular drinks)  Specialties: (the current list)

There's also a flight option of four pre-selected flavors, but the flavors aren't on the board.  They ARE listed next to the door when you walk in.  So, while standing in line, if trying to contemplate this option, it's hard to give it any weight.

My pb/choc+bourbon ice cream was pretty solid.  The s/o's Red Leg (special) lacked flavor all together. 

(PS there's soup on the menu???  that's sooooo confusing to me)

It's a tasty treat with a creamy soft-serve like texture that was a good treat for me.  But, be prepared to pay for a cocktail and not a bowl of ice cream.

I wish this review was about the actual product, but unfortunately I never got to try it. Twice now I have waited in line for 10+ minutes with not a single person ahead of me even having the chance to place an order. Throngs of people behind me sat waiting for their orders, and four mixers churned away for what felt like forever, trying to deliver ice cream to the dozens of people waiting.

If you own a business that is clearly on to something, invest in the labor and the additional equipment to meet that demand. We left. Not worth waiting. l can stir some tequila into ice cream on my own.

Update: I returned and was able to finally try the product. It still took about 15 minutes to order and get our ice cream, and it was ok but nothing spectacular. Just not worth the wait and the hype, I suppose.

This place was such a disappointment. I think the hype really set me up for the disappointment I experienced. First off- the ice cream tasted more like butter than it did ice cream. I took my toddler (who loves ice cream) and he turned his face up and only ate the mix-ins (gummy worms). Before you ask, I got the non-buzzed for the kiddo. For myself, I got a flight which sounded cool when I read the menu but was pretty disappointing. They all tasted exactly the same. I had a rum based, tequila, bourbon and one that wasn't really memorable. They all tasted like butter with a hint of alcohol infused. One listed ingredients as mint, alcohol and chocolate chips and it turned out to be chocolate sprinkles! Not the same in my book. All in all the $20 bucks I spent here could have been better spent somewhere else because I wanted ice cream and this was not ice cream. The service was good and there was a cool visual seeing them use nitrogen to freeze the alcohol but aside from that I can't recommend this place.
After eating 12 ounces of ice cream, I walked out as sober as when I walked in proving that milk really does help you reverse the effects of alcohol. They have a great gimmick to sell ice cream but I'm not sure it's enough for me.

Not so humbly submitted,
Michael C.

Actually stopped by Buzzed Bull for the first time out of ice cream necessity! It is the only ice cream place open past 10pm on the weekdays that we could find in OTR.

I am a bigger fan of frozen yogurt than ice cream so I was glad to see they had frozen yogurt as a option. I figured (like most IC places) they would have a few yogurt flavors and a ton of ice cream flavors but this was not the case at all! They make each flavor when you order it from an ice cream or a yogurt base so all their flavors are available in both IC or yogurt :D The frozen yogurt was super creamy and the mint flavor was really strong and natural and exceptionally delicious.

It's a somewhat gourmet ice cream experience considering you choose your base, flavor, mix-ins, and alcohol if you want it buzzed or not. I wasn't in the mood for a buzz so I went with a regular mint chocolate chip small for about $5. We also got a large Dreamsicle which tasted amazing. But somehow that order rang in at about $20 which is pretty steep for an ice cream outing even considering the triple sec in the Dreamsicle.

Fun experience, definitely will return.

We came to Buzzed Bull on their opening day and enjoyed exploring the menu and trying a few different flavors of alcoholic ice cream. The concept is so cool (alcohol-infused ice cream frozen right before your eyes with liquid nitrogen), but the ordering process is a little confusing. Everyone in front of me and behind me in line had questions when it was their turn to order, so there was an extended wait time. I chose a White Russian with Reese's as a mix-in. Loved the flavor and consistency of the ice cream--on par with places like Cold Stone, plus there's alcohol! I'll definitely be back to Buzzed Bull, and hopefully their ordering process will be streamlined by the next time I'm in.

okay, so after reading about this place... i COULD NOT get here fast enough. i enviously watched a live stream on fb of the local news checking it out on their opening day. i mean. i've been obsessed with this concept since i initially learned of it. 

i've also never had liquid nitrogen ice cream--so i have nothing else to compare this to. but it was awesome. 

i ordered a medium "death by chocolate" with a double shot (lol) of vodka. came to $12.83.

it was good. maybe *too* much alcohol in it, but that's my own fault for ordering a double. 

but THEN. thennnnnnnnn. i tried my friend's. he got the bonfire. h'oh my god. DELICIOUS. perfect. the addition of crumbly graham crackers was perfect. we swapped and i devoured his. 

it's a pretty simple interior. it's cool to watch the process--tons of smoke billowing out of huge mixers. definitely worth a stop in. next time i think i'll try a non-buzzed one.
very good!! had to finish my alcoholic ice cream inside but it was good!!! really really goid though!!!

Amazing product concept and loved the fact that it is made right in front of you while you wait! It was strange to not be able to take the ice cream and just walk down the street with it since it's alcoholic, so an outdoor space would be nice.

Tiger Stripes was a great flavor convo! I highly recommend trying this place if you drink and like ice cream.
honestly this place was very good. i got an advanced chocolate milkshake and it tasted like heaven. i would highly recommend.

Disclaimer: I'm a teetotaler. (I don't drink alcohol)

The build-your-own-ice-cream-with-nitrogen concept is neat! I believe (?) it's a first for Cincinnati. I'm all for interesting entrepreneurial pursuits so I agreed to go with friends.  

I got a non-buzzed Nutella with cookie dough. It looked like ice cream. It smelled like ice cream. It didn't TASTE like ice cream. For some reason, its' taste favored that of a mild cough syrup. I only finished it because of the higher than average price for ice cream. 

Things to consider: This place might not be suitable  for sober consumers. Go to Graeter's instead.

Nice concept but the execution was just ok. Nothing special. My friends was overwhelmed by the liquor taste. My coffee creation was not any better than coffee ice cream you can find in the grocery. Overall, not worth the money or time to find parking.
Amazing concept! Great selection! Can literally customize anything and it's delicious if you like booze and ice cream!! Can also make non-boozy stuff

As a teetotaler I initially thought Buzzed Bull would have nothing to offer, but even their signage notes that you can get non-alcoholic ice cream. Our family of 5 shared 2 smalls, which was sufficient: a cake batter with Oreo and a mint with chocolate sauce (mixed in, not on top).

It's not cheap, but I'm not sure it's more than, say, Cold Stone Creamery -- and I'd say it's better. Lots of flavors and mix-ins, so lots of options.

We weren't asked if we wanted ice cream or yogurt; I assume we had ice cream, but perhaps they should ask if a customer doesn't specify (yes, I could have asked myself).

I was surprised how long the making took. It wasn't a problem, I just didn't realize that it's iterative: mix, add some nitrogen, mix, add more nitrogen, etc. The employee running mixers seemed to keep a close eye on several at once, to achieve the desired texture.

And the texture was very good, very smooth, creamy and thick. A few bites were more solidly frozen than most; some might dislike this slight unevenness, but I thought it emphasized the made-to-order nature of the item.

We didn't get whipped cream, which costs extra. But I was surprised to see another customer's order topped with... canned whipped topping. I figure if you're charging for it, it should be real.

Perhaps the ice cream is a bit too sweet -- I prefer less-sweet desserts. But that could be a matter of flavor and mix-in -- or maybe I should have asked about the yogurt...

I wanted to like the idea of booze in ice cream... but it just didn't taste very good.  It had, of course, the boozy aftertaste that to me was very strange.  I would like to give it another try, although I tried the sampler / 'flight', and only cared for the peppermint, I think because it hid the aftertaste better of the alcohol.

If you can't decide between dessert and a cocktail, come to Buzzed Bull Creamery and have it all. That is not to say Buzzed Bull is only for adults, "nonbuzzed" flavors are available too. Bring the kids in for something different from the norm.  My children loved watching the ice cream being made. While their ice cream wasn't buzzed, their minds were buzzing with questions about liquid nitrogen. Not sure how long it the offer is running, but they are running a "happy hour" special. All buzzed orders were buy one get one half off. Alcohol flavor has been strong in all of the buzzed concoctions I have tried. I have tried four different buzzed flavors.  Personally, I find mixins with a higher fat contents to have a noticeable feel of oil on the tounge. The feeling is similar to how a frozen Reese's Peanut Butter Cup feels. With there already being so many reviews, I'm not sure what else to add.

Good, but a bit more expensive than I'd have liked. I got a small nutella w 1 mix in and it was $4.49 (sans booze). It was a generous serving, but for that price, I'd probably have rather gone to Graeters. It also took awhile for the ice cream to be made - to be fair, I understand its a process that involves them temping down the cream right then and there but if that place had been slammed the wait would have been RIDICULOUS. I do know folks who've gone and waited 40 minutes for their ice cream there - that for me is a bit much. The ice cream itself was creamy and tasty and they have a good base product. My friend got a sampler/"flight" of a couple different boozy ones and though they were creative, I personally didn't care for them vs the regular "virgin" options. 

 The atmosphere is great there and they did a great job on it, but going into an ice cream shop and not being able to try a sample of any flavors b/c they're made fresh isn't ideal for me. I'd suggest the owners maybe consider having a small cooler where you can try stuff - otherwise, how will you know what kind of flavor combo to get?
AMAZING! Such a fun environment and the ice cream is incredible. My favorite is the Bonfire! The staff is super helpful and very friendly as well. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Whoever thought of combining ice cream and alcohol is genius. The entire store is beautiful. I loved how you got to actually see them make your order and you got to see all of the combinations you can make on their handwritten chalkboard. Death by chocolate is my go to.

Two of my favorite things: ice cream and alcohol. Also science. This place was so cool and I can't wait to go back. The line was super long when my friends and I arrived, but that just gave us more time to look at the menu. I really liked how they had suggestions for flavor combinations. The process of how they created the boozy ice cream treat was so cool and reminded me of an episode of Bill Nye. They mix everything together and then blast the concoction with LIQUID NITROGEN. That is so insane! I think everyone should try this place at least once. Science rules!

My go-to ice cream place in OTR. The ice cream is made to order using liquid nitrogen and is so, so creamy! Personally, I think the non-alcoholic options are the way to go, but if you haven't been, you must at least try the pre-made flights - 4 samples of different alcoholic flavors!

Good Ice cream with a big price tag!

The Environment 
We stopped in here after the Labor Day fireworks downtown. We took the street car up to OTR and stopped at Buzzed Bull. We found very quickly that we were in a bad part of town as this was just barely in OTR. The restaurant inside was very cute and had plenty of seating. 

The Food
The ice cream was very good and I liked that you could customize your own if you wanted. I ordered a medium Death By Chocolate with 1 shot. You couldn't taste the vodka (upside) and the ice cream was very creamy. The only problem I had was that I ordered too much (go with the small). 

The Value 
The medium was over $10. I understand that it has a shot of vodka but even then it should not be over $10. 

I doubt that I will be back to spend another Alexander Hamilton on ice cream.
Gem of a find one night in OTR!  Will definitely be back.  Staff was great for our group of first timers.

Meh. I've experienced better is right. I've tried both Buzzed and Non-Buzzed and both options are very meh. Maybe I'm spoiled by all of the great ice cream places in Cincinnati, but the creams here are very underwhelming. Weak flavors, no noticeable change in flavor when you add "buzz juice" (liquor) - which is probably due to the tiny splash they put in - and a very boring trendy presentation. This place is for people who either don't know much about ice cream, don't like ice cream, don't care about ice cream, don't like/care about/want to enjoy shakes or anything I guess. I would 1 star it but the service was quick. Definitely a hype spot, clearly sucking up to local wanna be foodies! Sorry! Real foodies only here! My wife hates this place and I do too.

Bull cream more like Bull $#!%

This ice cream is so good. It's about the experience, too though. They infuse flavored cream with your choice alcohol and you can mix in whatever else you like. They also have pre-made recipes that are excellent - can't go wrong with the Apple Pie flavor with apple moonshine.

Better than expected. We had the strawberry daiquiri with gummy worms mixed in, and the buzzed bull with an extra shot. Fair warning putting an extra shot in the small container makes the alcohol very apparent (which we didn't mind). Both were amazing and we luckily got there before the line. They did only have one person working the liquid nitrogen, so I could definitely see a line building quickly.

The staff is okay- nothing to write home about. It is a slow process, but that's nothing they can fix. The ice cream was really good!! I'm not a huge ice cream fan, but I was impressed. The booze might have helped.

One of our new favorite places! Ice cream and liquor, it's a no brainer. Tiger stripes was delicious. Choco, spiced rum, peanut butter cups, and peanut butter sauce to top it off. Love that it's in OTR along with some of our other favorites.

Ok, so I had to go to work in the next hour after my first visit here, couldn't have the liquor. But I did have the coconut pineapple ice cream. It was so freakin good! The ice cream was smooth and creamy with a very prominent coconut flavor. The pineapples were fresh tasting and they didn't skimp on them!! The staff was very friendly and helpful, they know exactly how to handcraft this treat! 
The whole process and concept is genius! They make the ice cream right up in front so you get to see the magic in action! I'm definitely coming back, can't wait to try the complete flight!!

Love the concept, but the presentation needs work (the ending ice cream look)... Been to other ice cream spots like this in other cities, but while mine was being made there seemed to be no care for presentation or excitement, maybe people hyped it up too much.  Overall, I guess what matters is the taste and it was good. I guess I wanted it to be as exciting as Milk Bar's (NYC) alcohol cerial milk shake, but of well!

Good service. Good concept. Honestly though. Just my personal opinion, and if I ever return. Get it without the ice cream and walk down to Liberty's and get a drink on the side. Ice Cream is perfect. And nothing outside of Ice Cream is perfect. Don't mess with it.
Great quality ice cream. Super cool concept. I could see this being a nationwide franchise once they get systems in place. I enjoyed my Nutella ice cream!!

All in all a very underwhelming experience. I don't know if it was just the flavors I ordered (Lemon Cake buzzed with gin) but the ice cream was not in any way enjoyable to eat. The atmosphere is kind of cool with the liquid nitrogen processes, hence the extra star, but I just couldn't finish what I ordered. I would go back to try again, just to see, but it's too expensive of an ice cream run to validate a second trip.

Sweet place! Ice cream is tasty and the buzzed flavors have alcohol in them. They have ice cream flights, which is what I tried. really enjoyed the strawberry margarita flavor and the birthday cake. Staff is friendly, but a little slow but I know once they get the process down they'll do great!!
This place has some amazingly yummy ice cream- so creamy and dense! Made right in front of you and seriously some of the best ice cream I've had! Definitely a must try!!

Wait time was over an hour but we worth it. Some of the best priced "drinks" in OTR and all delicious. Will definitely be recommending this to my friends. We tried the campfire and the Fireball goes perfectly with Camilla ice cream.

What can I say! The coolness of this ice creamery is insane! An alcoholic ice cream treat sounds as amazing as it truly is...You walk in and see a huge menu to the right overhead...you choose your size, flavors, alcohol or non-alcohol in your treat and any added extras such as candy or fruit which comes with one free per size! You can choose from many different brands of liquors to put in your treat as well..well brands and top shelf. You can put as many flavors as you want in your treat as well. I chose the coffee, honey Bourbon flavors with banana. I got a shot and a half of their house Bourbon, a shot of coffee and the bananas mixed in. It then went into a Kitchenaid pro mixer with a stainless steel bowl and a faucet of ice covered liquid nitrogen over the bowl. The concoction is then mixed on high for about 5 minutes and shots of nitrogen are pulsed into the mixture to freeze it. You can also watch while all of this is happening..which is a plus! Your number is then called and you get to enjoy this amazingly flavorful treat. I definitely was buzzed leaving the creamery and happy as a clam too knowing I have such a cool and deliciously fun place in my city! Can't wait to go back!
Amazing. Probably THE best ice cream place I've ever been to. The price is more than reasonable and the ice cream is even better.

This was my first time at this place and it was a terrible experience. I came here with my mother on Mother's Day and was greeted by an hour and fifteen minute wait, unenthusiastic, irritated and slow staff, as well as offered no help when trying to navigate the menu. The guy at the front with the red hair was condescending and appeared to be irritated by my questions. He literally rolled his eyes after being asked to change my ice cream from unbuzzed to buzzed after realizing Kahlua was available. This was my first time being here and I am skeptical to return after the service alone. I understand that the place was busy but customer service should always be first. The hour and fifteen minute wait would've been easier to deal with if I had been greeted with a smile and apology for my wait.

Overall, this is a pretty cool concept. I'll break up this review by pros and cons. 

PROS: 
*Great location - on Main Street so it's pretty close to everything in OTR. Perfect for a nightcap. 
*Friendly staff - the staff were friendly and willing to help give suggestions. 
*Great Ice Cream & cool experience 

CONS: 
*The line is a little tricky to navigate. When you first walk in, there is a mesh of people waiting in line to order and people that have already ordered, so it's a bit confusing. I would suggest they tell customers to have a seat and designate a staff member to either call out order numbers or deliver to tables that have designated numbers on them. This would make for a better customer experience. 
*Price - I found that for a small chocolate by death with 1 shot of vodka it was a little over $8. That's just a little too pricey for me and seems a little off. 
*Seating - there wasn't enough room to find a place to sit. Yet again, this stems back to the issue of customers standing right where seating should be when they are waiting in line to order. 

Conclusion:
Go try it at least once. It's a pretty cool experience but I'm not sure that the price makes it worth it.

Absolutely delicious ice cream. The staff was wildly helpful since it was my first time and helped walk me through the menu and explain everything to me. HIGHLY recommend :) 
I ended up getting the apple pie and added Carmel sauce and pecans.
I suggest the flight!

Cool space and neat to watch. The two guys running it are really friendly, however I got a non buzzed coffee ice cream and asked for caramel to be mixed in with whip cream on top and after watching them make it for 5-10 mins I was super disappointed at how bland the taste was. It literally tasted like they froze some milk and gave it to me. Ice cream is my favorite snack in the universe and I can honestly say this was the first time I was this disappointed in my ice cream. 

With that being said I've had their lattes with and without ice cream mixed in and those are the bomb. Sad that the actual ice cream experience was so underwhelming.

This was SUCH a great concept - however, a little on the pricy side. The venue was neat, service was great, and the variety of options allows you to really get creative with your mix. However, the pricing compared to the sizes they had was a little $$$ - I'm glad we went, but I don't know how often I'd go back.

This was our first time visiting Buzzed Bull and we LOVED it. The staff was great and answered all of our questions. We ordered the Tiger's Stripes-Buzzed and it did not disappoint. The rum inside it had a delicious aftertaste, and the peanut butter chunks were the right amount (plentiful). We highly recommend visiting this place if you're in Cincinnati and want some delicious dessert--with alcohol or not!

My new favorite "Cincinnati" ice cream, any flavor you can imagine. And in case you didn't see... ALCOHOLIC ICE CREAM. Soo good, the liquid nitrogen makes it come out very cold, but it is super flavorful with a texture between soft serve and scoop ice cream. Our favorite part is you can bring your pup! No puppy flavors though, that would be the cherry on top.

Go here for the experience more than the ice cream itself. I don't mind paying more for something unusual (like alcoholic ice cream made right in front of me), but I DO mind paying premium prices for clearly sub-par ingredients - i.e. whipped topping instead of real whipped cream, chocolate flavor instead of quality chocolate. You can taste the difference, and Graeters is five minutes away.

The fam and I have been excited about Buzzed Bull Creamery since we read about it in the newspaper--apparently everyone and their mother read the same article because the place was packed.  The concept is super innovative, trendy and perfect for being in the heart of OTR on Main Street--liquid nitro ice cream creations prepared fresh to order.  You have the option to infuse any toppings or liquors you want into your ice cream, hence the "buzzed" part of the business name.

We went as a fun mothers day outing and the line was to the door.  The line didn't move incredibly quickly, but it also didn't move slow enough to deter us from waiting--it probably took us 15 minutes to get up to the register.  The staff was very friendly and made us feel like it would be worth the wait--especially since you can see them working their magic with the liquid nitro behind the counter.  

When it was finally time to order, the cashier was friendly and knowledgeable and explained to us how the ordering worked.  One confusing question she clarified for my mom I'll share on here because a lot of people might want to know.  My mom inquired if the "frozen yogurt base" option was lower in calories than the traditional.  The cashier clarified that the frozen yogurt base wasn't a lighter option, but a true, full fat yogurt option.  They essentially take their traditional, sweet cream base, and infuse it with yogurt to give it that yogurty tang.

Moving on... here's how you order:  Pick your base, pick your toppings, pick your alcohol (if you are 21 and up!).  OR do what I did if hand selecting all the options overwhelms you and pick a pre-created menu option.  

I got one that had fireball, vanilla, graham cracker, and chocolate chips for a s'mores like experience.  I thought the ice cream was very creamy and not overly sweet which is a plus for me, but something to note if you are used to a sugar bomb in your mouth.  I thought there were enough toppings to provide enough topping to ice cream ratio.  Here are my two minor complaints:  1) The alcohol and 2) the price.  The alcohol added a really great flavor but after 3-4 bites, it felt like I was taking a shot of fireball and I could feel that slight burn from the liquor in the back of my throat.  For me, the "buzzed" novelty wore off after those few bites and I had wished I just ordered it without the alcohol.  The price was another sticky point for me as for the three of us, the bill was 27 dollars.  That is a lot for the quantity of food you get.  However, if you look at the price including the experience of watching them hand prepare each order, it can be justified a little.  However, when I think summer and new ice cream place, I want it to be something affordable that I can return to all season long and this didn't meet that mark.  Definitely a fun special occasion or perhaps date night type of place. 

Overall, I was impressed with the space, the staff and the trendy concept.  While the price bothered me a bit, I still would return here if there was something I wanted to celebrate with friends or family.
The ice cream was good! A little over priced even for the non-alcoholic selection. Probably won't go out of my way to come here, but if you're in the area definitely stop by.

Buzzed Bull is absolutely awesome! I went on their 2nd day being open and had a wonderful experience and even better ice cream. You can either build your own or go with their tried and tested flavor combos (which I'd highly recommend). I had the Tiger Stripes, a peanut butter and chocolate combo, and it was unreal. If it's your first time going, I'd recommend the small as it's a generous portion and pretty rich.  Lastly, I have to mention how awesome the team there is. I live nearby and was able to casually meet Shane & Colten a few weeks back as Buzzed Bull was still being put together... seeing them in action now and how great an experience they make this for customers put a huge smile on my face. The kind personalities there make this a business that you want to support, not to mention the awesome ice cream. Welcome to OTR, Buzzed Bull and I know you'll be a staple here!
Super, duper good. Concept to product is flawless. Don't mind paying $10 for a medium bowl of this fantastic boozy frozen treat. Customer service is great. This is a MUST EAT!

I love this place and it will probably be my go to for ice cream all summer 17 lol. I haven't tried all the specialties but the hard apple and the jager bomb are both delicious. I tried to get one that had brownie pieces and chocolate vodka and ice cream in it but they were out of brownies  I will be back soon to Get it. I tried the ice cream flight and it seems like a good buy because you get to try four ice creams at once but I would pass on getting that one the first time. You are really doing a disservice to yourself if you don't get one of the speciality made ones. Be prepared to stand in line it does get crowded but service is pretty fast.  This place is awesome alcohol and ice cream how could you ever go wrong.
Delicious! Nice staff and very clean. Got the latte with three olives vanilla and their ice cream as cream and it was soooo good. Would absolutely recommend!

We stopped in Sunday after hearing about Buzzed Bull Creamery.  They offer made to order ice cream that features liquor infused or mixed in.  They have ice cream and frozen yogurt, they have fruits and candy's to mix in (sort of like other ice cream joints), but you pick your flavor and have the option to mix in featured liquors like bourbon, rum, vodka, etc.  Its unique.  The wait was long, the place was full and they can only make so fast.  So we waited about 45 minutes after order for a dish of ice cream.  Not ideal, but come expecting the wait if its a busy day.

Innovative idea executed well. This is a fun place to go. I had chocolate with brownies and whiskey the first time I went and vodka with strawberries the second. Both were delicious and unique. Looking forward to going back and trying more.

Its ok. The staff didn't seem particularly friendly. Their cashier seems new and does not handle people well. Also stares at customers while they eat. Felt very uncomfortable while there. Chocolate is good. I felt like the ice cream that i got buzzed at 0 taste. The guys making the ice cream need to actually care about what they are doing. Other patrons noticed the lack of care here.

Visited this place on a Friday after lunch. Awesome selection and concept offering a unique frozen treat experience. Prices were as expected for a unique hand made alcoholic ice cream. I will definitely be back.
Great place to go after dinner for dessert! My favorite one I have had so far is the White Russian.

Went back and didn't get chocolate chips but tried alcohol infused ice cream instead! My boyfriend had the bonfire and I had the White Russian. Fireball personally gives me heartburn, but I tasted it in the bonfire and it tasted surprisingly good. The White Russian was also delicious!

Best ice cream in the world! Takes a while to craft but well worth it. My fav, banana with chocolate chunks! Whoa-uh! Iove!
I've never had the the adult version ice creams...I love this one just the way it is. Wish they were in NKY so I didn't have to make a special trip.

Although the concept is great, the execution of alcoholic ice cream options was very disappointing. After waiting 45 minutes, we finally received our order. We felt that it was a waste of time and money. You might as well make your own milkshake with alcohol in it. It would be much cheaper and more timely. I would not recommend.
Love the concept! I had the campfire one with graham cracker. It was great! Heads up, eat before this. If you're stomach is empty you can get a little more than buzzed
Yum. I had the bonfire and it was delicious. Looking forward to trying the death by chocolate ice cream next.

I wasn't impressed! I like the whole idea behind it and watching them make it was pretty neat but the taste was bland. I got the Red Leg. My bf got the smores one though and that was was pretty good. I wouldn't recommend the red leg but def give the smores a try!

I had the Buzzed Bull which has Bourbon in it. Very tasty. My daughter got the Death by Chocolate which has Vodka and it was even better. The service was very good and staff was very friendly. Very long lines, but it moved well. Only down side is it is a little pricey. Definitely recommend.

This is a very well-run ice cream shop. I happened to meet the owner my second time in (during my sister's bachelorette party when we had a large group) and they were very polite and even offered to give us their table (they seemed to be with family) so that we would have enough space to seat everyone. 

Along those lines, the staff was incredibly kind and very efficient with our large group, whether we ordered the pre-made flights or custom orders. Everything came out in a timely manner and was absolutely delicious. 

This is a great product and I am amazed by how well they are able to pair ice cream with spirits. Nothing is overpowering, and the pre-made flights are so well balanced in terms of flavor and alcohol type/content. 

I will definitely be back many times!

Pretty exterior and interior design. Ice cream was good. I got cake batter ice cream with rainbow sprinkles, and one shot of vanilla vodka. It's a lot stronger than I thought but I didn't get a buz but it's good!!

You can go to my blog and read my write up about Buzzed.. heymichelle-help.com. The staff is awesome and then ice cream experience takes it to another level.. Pick your flavor add your favorite alcohol and you get buzzed cream ice cream! I got the Redlegs and loved it. Really .. ice cream and shots you can't go wrong. Just be prepared because you can't take the ice cream outside if it has alcohol. This is genius.

I was super excited to try this place because who doesn't love boozy ice cream! We went on a Sat night and it was packed. The wait was pretty long to order but it came out very fast after that. They seem to have a good system down even though they only have limited production capacity. Prices were very reasonable especially for the boozy ones. Our group tried 3. The Namesake Buzzed Bull, a make your own boozy with rum and a non alcoholic make your own. The non-alcoholic was simple but tasty but both the alcohol ones had a very overwhelming taste of alcohol. I like the taste of alcohol in my drinks but this was so strong I couldn't get any of the other flavors. I like scotch and bourbon straight up so I am not afraid of strong alcohol but if I am getting it in something I want it to be balanced.  Maybe you need to upgrade to the higher quality liquor but the standard just did not taste good. I would like to give it another shot. Perhaps someone mismeasured or something.
We went there for my birthday. The staff was not overly attentive or personalable of their opinion. However it's still fun concept and a must try at least once!

I'm having a hard time believing that folks are giving this place 4-5 stars.  I'll give two for the concept...alcohol, heavy cream, and liquid nitrogen.  But that's about as far as I will go.  I've been to numerous liquid nitrogen ice cream shops and this is by far the worst.  The texture of the ice cream....can't even call it ice cream.  Anyone else remember the days of freezing the blue case of cool whip?   Remember the dense smooth texture?  Yes this is exactly how this taste and feels like.  Way cheaper too....The flavors were not there....and cannot recommend this to anyone.
It is very cool to watch the ice cream being made in front of you. We went in on the second day and ended up waiting an hour. The taste was different and unique. Good if you really like alcohol.
While the experience is very alluring the product is lackluster. Most of the flavors I have tried (whiskey sour and honey bourbon) seem like a step down from other creameries.
