Woohooo!  Us lucky tourists stumbled into Buzzed Bull on its fourth day in business.  Stumbled out, too, but for a different reason.  The menu is overwhelmingly wonderful -- the combinations seem endless.  We couldn't decide and went with the flight.  Wow.  Got up to re-order more and was so buzzed I ended up forgoing the second helping.  Yum.

I must say that I have a particular fondness for ice cream and perhaps have it a time or two more than I should on any given week, especially if I am traveling for business.

But hey, who doesn't love ice cream? I mean, we all know the chant if "I scream, you scream, we all scream for...", well that popular chant does not end with brussels sprouts. No, it goes "I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream." 

This place has dome truly amazing ice cream. Do yourself a favor, if you find yourself down here, go check out this place and you will be screaming for ice cream and that is definitely a good thing.

Yes, yes, yes... this place is delicious!! 
The smores ice-cream was UNREAL! It was absolutely perfect! Chocolate and marshmallow pieces, and divine flavored ice cream. The cone was fresh, sweet, and also super yummy. 

Why not 5 stars then? The cotton candy scoop wasn't all that exciting for me. It was just blue sweet icecream, not much of the cotton candy flavor. 

If I'm in the area again though, I'll definately stop here!

Great ice cream shop in downtown Cincinnati. Masks were not required in the store. The staff were extremely nice and funny as well. Definitely service with a smile! 
There was an awesome selection of ice cream including sundaes, frozen drinks, milkshakes, malts, and more. Truth be told I didn't get a picture of the menu because I had one thing and one thing only on my mind, ice cream. 
I had the cookie monster sunday. Holy cow was it amazing. Cookie dough chip and cookies and cream ice cream. That was topped with hot fudge, whipped cream, and chocolate sprinkles. What Sunday isn't complete without the cherry on top. The ice cream was absolutely delicious and cold. Again I was too focused on my ice cream to get a picture but trust me it looked as amazing as it tasted. I highly recommend if you are looking to cure that sweet tooth with some delicious ice cream.

Awesome location... Right in the middle of downtown Cincinatti, near the ice skating rink, this Graeters turned out to be the best choice for a late night sweet bite. While Graeters ice cream is always great, specifically the maple cinnamon crunch flavor (My favorite), the service by the 3 woman inside was superb. I went on a Wednesday night 12/30/20 and each of the woman inside went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure that my wife and I had everything we needed. While we went to this shop close to the end of what I am sure was a busy day, these woman acted as if we were their first customers of the day. While I wish I remembered their names, I put the date on this review so to ensure that the managers at this location know just how lucky they are to have an incredible staff. 

Their is seating available inside but it is limited, thankfully, very few people were staying to eat their ice cream inside so my wife and I were able to sit down and enjoy our ice cream. The shop was clean, and the ice cream was frozen.

As a last comment on the ice cream, I am consistently blown away by their Sorbet, I tried the raspberry sorbet tonight and it was superb! All in all this was a most definitely good experience, and I hope customers to come are able to be greeted by the best in customer service at Graeters Downtown Cincinatti.

--Pre-Covid Review--
Came by on a rainy day in the winter so the shop was pretty empty. There's a few tables around the large ice cream shop if you wanted to stay inside or you can take a walk in the park area right outdoors. Since it was a slow day the workers were all talking among themselves and it was a bit difficult to get their attention.

I had to try the famous Buckeye Ice Cream (Peanut Butter Cookie Dough w/ Dark Chocolate Chips). As far as texture goes, Graeters definitely has that classic ice cream shop creamy, velvety, and dense texture down. I found the texture a bit on the soft side though. As for the ice cream itself, it was tasty but just a bit too sweet and heavy for me. I love similar flavors but I just need the amount of sweetener turned down a notch. The chocolate chunks were nice and the whole thing tastes sort of like a Reese's Peanut Butter Cup crossed with a brownie. Really really indulgent flavor. I could only finish about half the small scoop.

Overall, Graeters is a solid ice cream shop that's more on the traditional sweet side. It's a fun place but not my preference when it comes to ice cream.

"I'm your ice cream man, baby, stop me when I'm passin' by
See now all my flavors are guaranteed to satisfy"
(Van Halen)

Graeter's Ice Cream Fun Facts

1) Their ice cream made its debut via push-carts on the streets of Cincinnati in 1870.

2) It was, and still is, crafted in a French Pot process that yields just 2  1/2 gallons at a time

3) French Pot ice cream is more dense and creamy than regular ice cream. It has a high butterfat content and isn't light or airy.

4) They are famous for their "Signature Chip Flavors" with 14 chip flavors

5) The chips are poured as a liquid and then frozen into the ice cream, The process creates a variety of soft uniquely shaped chips.  

6) They have 50 locations across Ohio, Kentucky, Pennsylvania and Indiana.

7) Besides ice cream, they sell candy, desserts and all sorts of baked goodies.

8) My dish of Toffee Chocolate Chip was one of the best ice creams I've had in a very long time. 

9) Graeter's was an awesome place to visit, full of history, tradition, a great atmosphere, a lot  of flavors, and outrageously good ice cream.

When it comes to peanut butter chocolate chip there is no better ice cream flavor.

Being from the Cleveland area and living in Columbus everyone from the Cincinnati area always mentions that Graeters is the ice cream to try. I was traveling for work and decided to check out the hype. 

I walked in and instantly locked my eyes in on the peanut butter chocolate chip. I wasn't in the mood for much ice cream so I went with only (1) scoop. When I got to the register I was surprised to see that it was almost $5. For the quantity I don't think it was worth the price. The ice cream was good but I wouldn't put it above the Cleveland favorite (Mitchell's) or the Columbus favorite (Jeni's).

I would still recommend going to Graeters over any other ice cream shop if you're in the Cincinnati area.

Hello non Cincinnatians traveling here for business, this review is mostly targeted for you! This location is something locals know is great, and as a visitor this is your perfect opportunity to try very high quality ice cream at a reasonable price! On nice evenings, enjoy your choice outside on Fountain Square. If its winter? Youre still going to want to try this!

This location on Fountain Square must make a killing and for sure gain some loyal new customers that have traveled into town for business. It is ALWAYS busy, but the staff take that in stride. There is plenty of people to help, let you sample the flavors, and get your final choice out to you quickly. The bakery case and seating area looked a bit like a tornado had gone through on this particular Tuesday evening, but in all fairness it was an hour before closing. 

I would say the Graeters token flavor is Black Raspberry chocolate chip, which has high quality dark chocolate chips in it. Having whatever flavor on a waffle cone is a must! They have many limited time flavors which are also always good. Most recently I tried the Honeycomb... honey ice cream with a generous amount of crispy honeycomb in it. I didnt expect it to be as amazing as it was! MUST. GET. MORE.  If you want some yummy baked goods they have those too, but come early in the day to get the best selection.

All the hype I read about Graeter's ice cream is True! So true that we went 2 days in a row on day 1 and 2 in Cincy. 

Friendly service and delicious creamy yumminess! Black raspberry with chocolate chips in a waffle cone, chocolate almond coconut, and buckeye chocolate were all delicious!

Take a look at the seasonal menu inside the store to see what seasonal flavors are available for the month.  I'm sure everything is good here!

This place is amazing. The ice cream is delicious. So many flavors. Creamy with big chunks of yumminess. I loved every flavor I tried and I went 3x in 3 says while visiting Cincinnati. 

The perfect pre and post race Flying Pig treat!

IN 1 LINE: The best ice-cream you'll ever have (trust me, I'm an ice-cream lover)!

This downtown parlor has a great location right in the heart of Cincinnati. 

FLAVORS: My favorite flavor is the Black Raspberry Chip. The chocolate chunks are made by crushing large chocolate blocks, so you can be surprised by very big bites of rich dark chocolate! My sister's favorite flavor is the Mocha Chip!

SEATING: There are high-top tables and chairs offering much room for seating. 

SOUVENIRS: There are also fun gifts including mugs, hats, t-shirts, playing cards are teddy bears.

Graeter's Ice Cream in fountain square is a must go to spot if you're exploring the area and want some authentic Cincinnati flavor! I tried the Peach Boulevard drink for the first time and it was AMAZING! A mix of their peach ice cream, carbonation, and whip cream. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. Not a lot of indoor seating but with the whole entire Fountain Square right outside the door you'll have plenty of options and a great city view to enjoy. Great selection of ice cream, shakes, and even pastries; none of it will disappoint!
YUM!!!  Very creamy and so tasty!  Great flavor options too!  Friendly staff, what more can you ask for.  Thank you!  Stay safe!
The customer service at this Graeter's is outstanding. The young man who served us was friendly and we loved the apple pastry!

Visiting the city for the first time I noticed this city staple.  I am not an "ice cream " person but when you make great ICE CREAM,  I am willing to convert.  The flavor was fresh and bold and had me contemplating buying a second...

Graeters Ice Cream is truly delicious ice cream, on par with the best. Creamy. Intense flavor. Rich. A treat. Could feel my heart slow down :)

I had the Double-chocolate Chip. Look forward to trying others. Even in winter, there was a steady stream of ice cream fans like me coming in for a fix.

Located in the located downtown in the fountain square/Fifth Third Center

$5 for single scoop in a deluxe chocolate cone.

PS Don't tell anyone:  Came back twice in two days while in town.

Ahh Graeters, easily the best part of the Cincinnati region.

This Graeters in particular is my favorite solely for the location and service. In terms of location, it is located in the heart of downtown Cincinnati, adjacent to Fountain Square. My friends and I always find us grabbing a dish of ice cream here and heading out to watch one of the weekend concerts. As for service, I have never waited in line more than 3 minutes here. Even when the line wraps around the store, they pump customers in and out quickly. There are also a few tables inside along with a water station which makes it the perfect place to rest. 

I've also found that this particular Graeters gives much larger portions than other locations. One scoop here is almost double the amount anywhere else.

If you're ever in the Fountain Square area, stop on into this Graeters. You won't be disappointed!

TLDR: the best ice cream I have ever had.
____

Strolling through downtown I noticed they had a Graeters location nearby and stopped in for a little snack.

The line was pretty long. Business folks on lunch break. Tourists like myself. Teenagers on summer break. But the line moved super quick. 

I went with the Black raspberry. Wowzers. This ice cream is super dense. Super creamy and super delicious. 

Chunks of chocolate come mixed in. My tour guide CincyCindy told me how they make the ice cream - putting a layer of chocolate on top then cracking it into various sized chunks. That means one chunk might be more like a speck and the other one a monstrous Nugget. Amazing. 

It's not a strong raspberry flavor, but the color of it is bonkers. Looked great for this food Pics haha. 

It's a bit messy to eat on a cone. One scoop is huge.  Walked around downtown as I devoured the cone. It's right in the park so sitting down by the fountain with a cone and maybe your sweet darling isn't a bad way to spend an afternoon stroll.

@Eating.Drinking: 

Winners of the "Best Sweet" at the 2014 Food Network South Beach Wine and Food Festival, and founded and headquartered in #Cincinnati, OH, @Graeters offers a huge variety of the tastiest, and most desirable ice cream there is. *
With endless choices of ice cream and catering for absolutely everyone, Graeters offer their; Seasonal Selections, Classic Selections, Signature Chips, Low Glycemic and Sorbet. And it doesn't stop there!!! They even offer a range of fantastic baked goods, toys, candies and other kinds of souvenirs in over 50 retail stores.
* 
Even @Oprah agrees when she said that Graeters was, "absolutely the best ice cream I've ever tasted," in June 2002.
*
Ever since 1870, #Graeters have used their famous French Pot Process. This involved developing a hand-made, metal bowl that sat inside a wooden bowl filled with ice & salt. This pot would then be filled with a mixture of cream, sugar and eggs and then attached to a motor and spun, forcing the mixture to the sides of the bowl where it would freeze, being scraped off by paddle until it came together. This requires the ice cream to be made in smaller batches of 2.5 gallons a time ensuring quality, care and passion in every single scoop of ice cream that is served and hand-packed. This care for what they do, and they HUGE chocolate chips is what sets them apart from the rest of the chasing pack.
*
Whether it's the Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip or their very first flavors of Vanilla or Chocolate, or a variety of their many, many other flavors, Graeters is THE number one stop for all of your ice cream wants and needs.

This has got to be the most successful Graeters location there is, every time I go there is a line, although thankfully it does go pretty quickly. My family and I love Graeter's Ice Cream, my mom boldly states "it is my favorite ice cream In The Whole World!" Graters is always a good idea, whether your from out of town looking for a local gem, or a local looking for a sweet treat. I tried the caramel espresso chiller for the first time and I was not disappointed! Although it's difficult to pass up the traditional, delicious cone. My favorite is buckeye blitz, perfect blend of peanut butter and chocolatey goodness!

After attending a Yelp event on The Banks with my daughter and granddaughter we decided to walk up to the Fountain Square Graeter's for some ice cream. We still had some time left on our parking meters and it was a very pleasant Tuesday evening. We were waited on by a very enthusiastic student aged employee who gave us a sample taste of several ice cream flavors before we ordered using a coupon I had from an Ensemble Theatre Cincinnati ticket for a buy one get one free cone. We both had an extra scoop of ice cream in a cup with the cone on top. As usual the ice cream was very creamy and delicious especially after it started to melt. We sat down by the fountain to enjoy our treat and take a few pictures. I haven't spent much time at Fountain Square and at this Graeter's store recently but I have always received good friendly service here. Until next time be kind to each other. #graetersicecream #yelpcincy @yelpcincy #icecream #familyfun

Great Cincinnati icecream establishment!!! These guys kept busy and kept their line moving!!! I got a chocolate peanut butter shake, which was fantastic. 

So this place blew my mind for one reason. It'll sound stupid, but it's a BIG pet peeve of mine. When I order chocolate icecream "anything", I HAVE IT when a place serves "vanilla-with-chocolate-sauce" icecream rather than CHOCOLATE ice cream. 

These guys ASKED which way I preferred, one or the other!!! It sounds like a minute, first world problem, but I was VERY HAPPY when I was asked what one of the two I would like.

These guys know what they're doing!!! And I'm coming back next time I'm in Cincinnati!!!

I don't eat ice cream often but when I do, Graeter's Ice Cream is the one.  This ice cream is a Cincinnati staple.  They are best know for the smooth and delectable chocolate chips.  Cookie dough is my favorite.  There is no skimping on the cookie dough here!

Over the weekend I took my young nephew to the Fountain Square Grater's.  He ordered a vanilla ice cream with sprinkles and a cone.  The gentleman that took our order and asked my nephew if he wanted to put his own sprinkles on his ice cream.  With an offer like that, my nephew didn't refuse!

The gentleman took him behind the counter where my nephew watched the ice cream be scooped out.  Then the SPRINKLES!  He told my nephew he could put as many sprinkles on as he wanted.  His eyes lit up!  Three heaping spoonfuls in, my nephew was ready to dig in and eat the fruits of his labor.

Thank you to the wonder staff at Graeter's for making my nephews day!  He loved the ice cream and has asked when he can go back and help serve ice cream :)

We're fans. We understand why transplants sing the praises of Graeters, even while in Blue Bell country. Graaters is better. Creamier. Big chunks of chocolate. Interesting flavor combos. No green food coloring in the mint chocolate chip ice cream. It's good. So very good. Good enough we went back a second time - in the rain! On my second trip I tried a pretzel cone because I'd never heard of it before. It was thicker than a normal cone with large salt crystals. I think it would be a good match for a dark chocolate ice cream - it wasn't the best with the sweetness of mint chocolate chip. From our experiences, be prepared for long lines!

The go to place for ice cream in Cincinnati (there's also one in Indy).  The flavor to get is Black Raspberry Chocolate Chunk, although there are probably 50 flavors of ice cream and sorbets to choose from.  In addition, there are sundaes, shakes, malts, and other frozen drinks and a pretty extensive bakery.  Come on a Friday during the Summer and enjoy the concert series right outside the shop at Fountain Square (or ice skating in the Winter).

(4) ~ very good overall food & service

MENU:
** Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip ice cream = (4.25) Very good & The Chocolate Chips are the size of small chocolate bars;)lol
** Coffee(medium) = (4) very good
* S'mores ice cream = (3.75) Good

A great homemade style ice cream.
Unique flavors made with fresh fruit or berries are a specialty.
Absolutely my favorite ice cream shop. Today it was chocolate chip and some mores! The staff are anxious to offer generous samples. A perfectly beautiful day to be downtown cincinnati

What a great spot downtown. This is my go to in the spring/summer/fall.
The atmosphere is great, the ice cream is the best, and I always leave with a smile. Every downtown needs an ice cream parlor!

Ice cream is my weakness. It's a dessert I always have room for. I meannnnnn....it just slides down so easy! When it comes to ice cream in Ohio, Graeters sets the bar high. With locations all over Cincinnati, we went to the location right at Fountain Square in downtown.

They had a good number of flavors to pick from so I was faced with a hard choice. However once I saw Buckeye ice on the menu, it was a no-brainer. I was in the Buckeye state and it had to be done! Their Buckeye ice cream was creamy, not too rich chocolate with big ol' round chunks of peanut butter to satisfy my sweet tooth. Loved it and could have eaten a gallon easily if someone had placed it in front of me.

The 'traditional' aka small bowls ran us $4 each which isn't bad at all for such quality and taste. 

They had some basic tables for us basic bitches to get our grub on and stare out the big windows and interesting happenings on the square.

Aside from just the ice cream, this location is full of bagged candies, fun chocolates, nuts and seasonal items. I ended up buying a few boxes of chocolates with a great Cincinnati photo on them to take to friends & family as gifts.

This is a great ice cream parlor.  It is right in the middle of downtown and the amount of flavors is incredible.  The ice cream is made fresh and the price is very reasonable.  If you are there, make sure you leave room for ice cream after your meal.

Totally forgot to take a picture or check in.
It was just a few minutes before closing and we'd walked up from Bunbury festival and wanted a late night sweet. This Graeters was just across the road from our hotel.

Also, Graeters is my best friend. We fit together nicely. I absolutely love love love their black raspberry chocolate chip and putting it in a waffle cone just makes me Winnie the Pooh dance with excitement.

My hubby grabbed the salted caramel in a pretzel cone. We'd never seen those cones before but I was too intune with my waffle cone to remember to ask for a bite. It was gone in about the same amount of time as mine. For my non sweet loving husband, maybe it's that Graeters ice cream speaks to your soul, or it was just hot and the welcome chill from the ice cream was needed, he sure put it away quickly!

I was super excited that it was about $1 cheaper to buy the same thing at this store as the ones I usually go to in Lexington, Ky. Worth it!!!

The staff were very nice and I think I inhaled the ice cream in less than two minutes- it was hot, had to eat it before it melted, right? Sorry no picture of the gloriousness that is black raspberry chocolate chip!!

Overrated is the word that came to my mind as I finished my ice-cream here. No, it wasn't pathetic at all. But there wasn't a much wow factor either. However, given a choice, I would go for Cold Stone which is few miles away in Newport. It may have a less diverse menu from Graeters but very good quality ice-cream. 

Ice Cream:
In terms of menu, there are some good innovative items on the list and you can definitely try that.  We went for Apple Cinnamon Sundae and Affogato. Affogato was actually nice with more of a rum flavor than espresso in an ice cream. Or perhaps it was Bourbon Pecan that was doing the talking. I liked the concept and the end product was good. However, Apple Cinnamon Sundae was more towards "okay" than amazing. None of the above are on their regular menu, so I may have tried a little too much. However, having had a taste of their ice creams from Kroger store, I am more certain about Cold Stone than Graeters. The lady serving us wasn't even aware that Apple Cinnamon Sundae is on their menu. She read through the ingredients on the board behind her and made it.

Ambiance:
The place was very crowded and remains crowded pretty much all the time because of the legacy. There is much more besides just ice-cream if you want to purchase. They made a good use of napkin holder by placing information about their history and their process of ice cream making over it. The place is a little cramped with a decent seating capacity. But if it is a warm day, you may as well take your ice cream out and enjoy it sitting at Fountain Square itself. 

Staff:
The staff was good, overall. While the lady was clueless about Apple Cinnamon Sundae, the lady at the cash counter quickly jumped in and helped us out to explain to the server what do we want. That was very good. There was a huge crowd but the turnaround time was pretty quick, so not much of a wait there. 

Overall, it's a good place and worth try. But not so amazing as people here make it sound.

(Clifton) Usually a favorite, but... Went in yesterday on a neighborhood walk to get 2 cones. There were no other customers and 3 men working in the shop. The guy who behaved as if he was the manager gave us the smallest stingiest possible dips I've seen from Graeter's all for $7.50.

A local classic, Graeters delivers your needed ice cream fix if you're willing to wait in long lines. The first time we came yesterday we got the black raspberry chip and mint chocolate cookie in a chocolate waffle cone, and tonight we got the brownie sundae. Serving sizes are average, not necessarily generous, and flavors are your average ice cream shop's offerings. 

I was surprised by the large chocolate chunks in the ice cream; these aren't little flakes of chocolate but rather dime-sized hunks. Today we were served by the manager, and he was attentive to details and eager to serve, but the young cashier seemed bored and disinterested.

I came here with some friends, and as out-of-towners, we were excited to try this ice cream shop that all the locals were raving about! Just upon entering, I was cheered up by all the cute displays and the friendly service. I was also able to try a lot of different flavors before making my final decision. I ultimately got the Pistachio ice cream (3.75 for a single scoop), which was super creamy, with exciting chunks of pistachio in every bite. I got some chocolate for the trip home. Next time in the area, will definitely come by and try more flavors!

I feel like this is a place any Cincinnati native would recommend.
I'm not a HUGE ice cream fan which I know is about to turn many heads...yes I don't know what's wrong with me, but I'd still reco this place to anyone. I'm all for trying places that have reviewers claiming it's the best in the world.

I wanted to try the raspberry chip that everyone raves about but they had run out (whaaaaat).. so I settled for half hazelnut and half vanilla bean to explore the hype. It is in fact thick, creamy and fresh...but as a person who's not the biggest ice cream supporter, all my stars are really for the friendly customer service. Allowed to sample as many flavors as wanted, gave generous servings, and were really prompt. Go for the food come back for the great service!

Sea Salt and caramel!! Wow, is this the best ice cream EVER??!! Thanks for delivering to Disney Burbank, then on to Torrance, CA! We also enjoyed the vanilla bean, wow though!! It's not even Friday and we're lovin' this Thursday treat!

Great ice cream at reasonable prices!

I tried this dessert place for the first time during a business trip and I loved the ice cream there. It is located at the Fountain Square at downtown Cincinnati  next to many restaurants and Macy's department store. 

The dessert place has wide selection of chocolates, candies, shakes, donuts, cakes, ice cream, gelatos and sorbet. I got the two scoops in a cup ice cream and it costs $4.5. The ice cream tasted yummy and there are lots of flavors available.

Great finishing after dinner.

Delicious! Great service! Went with a group of about ten people, everyone loved their choices.  Apparently the coconut chocolate chip is amazing by a few accounts, but I had a salted caramel malt, which was very yummy!
We had this brand from whole foods and it was amazing. We got 2 flavors, black cherry and black raspberry, which is their most famous flavor. Highly recommend Graeter's and this location is great.

The place is small, but quick and friendly. After visiting Smale Riverfront Park this was a nice treat for my son to cool off and enjoy. The organic strawberry ice cream was delicious, my 3 year old was nice enough to share a bite. They had a big menu and tons of items I'd like to try.

I was staying in the area, at the 21C hotel and my husband had late night craving for some ice cream. Thanks to Yelp, we found this place a short walk from the hotel. I think all of the late night partiers had the same craving. It was a good place to people watch that night.

The ice cream is always excellent at Graeters. I'm glad they made their way back to Lexington, where the FroJo is the craze. 

They also had a seasonal selection of gourmet candy. What's not to love about this place?

Is it the cheapest ice cream? No. Two scoops is about $5. Is it delicious? Absolutely. While it may not be practical to come here all the time it is a nice treat. 

I've had the black raspberry chip, and mango and watermelon sorbets. The sorbets are light sweet and refreshing. The black raspberry was creamy and fruity and had nice big chunks of chocolate *drool*

If you're in Ohio this place is a must try and it's s chain as well so they're not hard to find. Think of it has the Ben and Jerry of Ohio.

The ice cream is delicious. It is creamy and thick, and melts in your mouth in a unique way that you have to discover for yourself to make sense. 

The counter staff was extremely helpful, and let me be my indecisive self while I got samples of a few different flavors until I found the one for me.

Their famous black raspberry chocolate chip is actually FABULOUS!  
The mint chocolate chip wasn't the best I've tasted - I prefer more mint.
3 words: Maple Cinnamon Crunch. I ordered that and the salted caramel chocolate chip. Salted caramel was good and had huge chunks of chocolate, but the maple cinnamon crunch was the star.

I had he good fortune to be staying at a hotel around the block from this Graeter's. I've had Graeter's before and usually get the traditional chocolate chip but this time I noticed some more "chip" flavors. Sine I think the chips are so special, I asked our server (Heavana) for a sample. She said it was her favorite flavor and it is now MY favorite flavor. My buddy ordered a chocolate dipped waffle cone and I ordered a traditional sugar cone. Soooo freakin' good and what I look forward to when I'm visiting Cincy.   My only negative comment was the smell when you first walked in. I'm not sure if it was because it was the end of the night but it didn't smell great/appetizing. The service was excellent and the ice cream was creamy, flavorful and tremendously satisfying.

A very busy location, but the line moves fast without compromising service. I recently visited this location to try the seasonal Honeycomb flavor. That ice cream mixed with a pretzel cone was pure heaven on a hot day. I will be coming back again and again, that's for sure!

Some of the best ice cream in the world.
Background: Graeter's uses the french pot method to make their ice cream. It is more labor intensive. The side affect if additives to ice cream (chocolate chips) keep their flavor longer. I believe this is a better process.
I arrived just before closing and the staff was still alert and attentive to serve me. I want to try all the flavors but always focus in on the signature menu.
Even if you do not eat ice cream often, you should try the Graeters just for the experience of a local Cincinnati flavor.

One scoop please. 

Add a second scoop for 50 cents? 

Absolutely. Cookie dough + salted caramel chocolate chip. The chocolate chunks are as big as they've always been.
Lived up to expectations with plenty of ice cream choices. Now as a good Texan I am not allowed to say it is better then Blue Bell, but .... I will be happy to do a blindfolded taste test,

Super pleasant staff serving you ample servings of scrumptious mouth watering ice cream. I went for the imposingly COOKIE MONSTER which proves to be crazy good value for money compared to regular scoops and absolutely delightful to eat. And yes it has a cherry on top. Life is but a dream.

If you find yourself in downtown Cincinnati you must try their ice cream. They have an eclectic taste and variety of ice cream and sorbet. I had to try their pumpkin Sunday and I even came back to have a taste of their limited stout pretzel. Both were equally delicious and good.

They have various items for sale as well in their sort of gift shop filled with chocolate and other delectable items.

As far as seating there isn't much so as popular as this place is be prepared to take your ice cream on the go.

They always have free samples and you can taste the ice cream is on the menu. Also get a second scoop for only $.50,more -- that's a great deal.

If you're looking for a creamy delicious chocolate malt...look no further...This place uses traditional French pots to craft their ice cream ...whatever that means, boy can you taste the incomparable flavor and richness.  This is indulgence at the most.

I tried the salted caramel ice cream. it is as delicious as it can ever get but it is pretty high-priced. I compared it to Trader Joe's Salted Caramel Swirl gelato and there is hardly any difference in the taste and texture. And you get double the quantity with Trader Joe's for a dollar cheaper. I do like to buy Graeter's brands from Whole Foods when they are on sale though as they are very good and worth the cheaper price.

Went on a quick trip to Cincinnati and couldn't leave without trying the infamous Graeters! It definitely didn't disappoint. Such a large variety of flavors to choose from and at such a good price! My double was $4.50. I had the pumpkin and blueberry pie... pure happiness! The pumpkin was so thick and flavorful, and I loved the real pie crust pieces in the blueberry pie. If the blueberry pie wasn't partially melted when it was scooped for me, my experience would have been absolutely perfect! I'd love to try the mini pies and other sweet options Graeters has if I'm ever back in town.

We visited locations in Centerville and downtown Cincinnati.  They are very consistent.  The ice cream is very good.  Half there flavors have chocolate chips.  I had dark chocolate brownie, smores, and cinnamon maple crunch.  I liked the smores a bit less because it had pieces of marshmallows in it.  That's more me than the ice cream.  They got the graham cracker flavor right.
Single scoop of vanilla bean (~$4) was delicious! I see why this is is everywhere and a local favorite. Definitely very creamy and rich with very flavorful vanilla. Definitely would get this again!

This location needs help, walked in at 9:30 a.m. needing 4 dozen donuts (I'm from out of state) and they did not even have enough of a variety for 2 dozen, asked if they had more donuts and was told they don't make them on site with no more help.

Please don't waste your time or money on this location.

Really good and creamy ice cream! They weren't very busy on a chilly January day, but we still enjoyed our ice cream. They have a lot of flavors to offer, as well as hot chocolate and coffee. 

I tried the cookie ice cream, which wasn't too rich for my taste. Apparently the black raspberry is the signature flavor, which I'll have to try next time I'm in Ohio!

I was pretty disappointed that I ordered a regular scoop and received way less ice cream than my friend who ordered a kids scoop, and it was 1/3 more of the cost! Overall pretty good, but there portioning was just unfair for 5$ ice cream.

I had to wait in a pretty long line to be served.  Once I tasted my ice cream it was obvious why the place is so popular.  Even though the ice cream was very busy we were still served with kind personal attention.  The mocha flavors that I ordered were very distinct.  The flavor selection was broad.  They offer many toppings and different cones to go along with your ice cream.   The serving area appeared very sanitary.  The price was a little above average but so was the ice cream.  There isn't much more to say about this place.  They exceeded my expectations and delivered up some really delightful ice cream.

Hands down, this is the best ice cream you'll ever have. This location is perfect for grabbing a cone after dinner and enjoying it on the square. I'm always surprised by how large their single scoops are and they have several types of cones to choose from. They also have a great variety of pastries, coffee cakes, candy & cookies.
Don't come here in the evening - the customer service is terrible. It's super slow, even when no one is in line. While the ice cream is good, won't come to this location again.

I'm not sure how it's possible that I haven't reviewed Graeters yet.  I head to Cincinnati every summer to visit with family and Graeters is a MUST.  I try to visit as many new places as possible each time I go, but if I had to choose between going somewhere new and going to Graeters, the choice would be simple. 

It always takes me a long time to order because there's just so much to choose from.  Last time I was there, I told them I was visiting from Canada and everyone started making suggestions of things I had to try.  

The staff are always really friendly and helpful, and the ice cream is so creamy and delicious... I just can't stay away.

Can't wait to be back!
wait for it! The line was long but moved very quickly.  The salted caramel was super delicious with the pecan danish.  The danish was sweet & fluffy. The chocolate chip was creamy & well worth it.

Delicious!   I was introduced to Graeters from a friend from Cincinnati.  I live out of the area and luckily, my store carries the brand.  While visiting for a convention, I had to stop by the store.  Best ice cream ever!

I wrote a rather negative review of Graeter's, and I would like to retract some of my declarations.
Their chocolate chip ice cream sandwiches may be the best ice cream sandwich in the world.  I do apologize for my negativity and I do love Graeter's ice cream.  It's just the proclamations I hear in Cincinnati and Louisville about everything being the best or the biggest drive me nuts!  I grew up in NYC, which often demands the best, but rarely do folks declare things the "absolutely finest in the world." People along the Ohio River are quite insular and often have the need to smack folks in the face with why they don't need to experience anything different because what they have is the greatest. I find this attitude so limiting and I took on their opinions of Graeter's ice cream.  That is my fault and I apologize.

I'm just realizing that I've never written a review for this place!! Probably because I've been coming here for years and it just seems like a given - like, doesn't everyone know that when you're in Cincinnati, Graeter's is the place to get your ice cream?

This is the closest location to my home, so this is the one I frequently go to. But I also love this location because there are benches outside and tables across the street that are perfect for the summer. 

Two important reasons why Graeter's is one of the best in the country:

1. Their chocolate chips can be as big as your palm! Also, have you noticed how a lot of chocolate chips taste waxy and hard? Not these! They have a nice chew to them and a super rich flavor.

2. All of their flavors are awesome. Usually, I find a favorite flavor at each ice cream shop and I stick to that one and never try anything else because I know that it won't satisfy me the way my favorite does. But at Graeter's, I get a new combo every time! Basically any flavor with their ginormous chocolate chips are a win, but I also like to consider the seasonal flavor as well!

Anyone who loves ice cream, Graeters will be able to satisfy your cravings and then some. For those who love creamy rich delcious flavor, you will love what Graeters has to bring to the table. I recommend the cookie dough flavor, but honestly I don't think you can go wrong here. The list itself has a ton of flavors to chose from and should have something for everyone. The only downside of this place will be the wait time and the long line. Prices and the portion sizes are average but overall worth the expense.

Graeter's has caught a lot of hype and media attention, which is what drew me to this place, especially when visiting from out of town. The location seems prime and the service was adequate. But I never felt the over-the-top service others commented on here nor did I feel that the milkshake was something unreal. Dare I say it, but I've had a better milkshake. 

The ice cream itself is very rich, a testament to their small batch, French pot process. The key distinction from other ice cream places is the quantity and quality of added ingredients. I went for the toffee chocolate chip ice cream- the toffee was rich and generous in portion. Similarly the milk chocolate chips weren't the usual hard over-frozen crunch bits but soft, melt in your mouth type. That won me over. But the milkshake was a slightly overpriced, too thin mix. It seemed like they skimped on the ice cream and added far too much milk, making it rather disappointing. 

For a random ice cream place, I would go back, mainly for the ice cream than milkshake, but I didn't feel it stacked up to it's inflated reputation.
We have had a lot of ice cream in our lives. This ice cream was the best we have ever had.  It was so fresh and flavorful! My son has a peanut allergy and they accommodated it very well.

Graeters is awesome at all times, which goes without saying.  But the service at this location, the few times I've been in it, has always been extra friendly and attentive.  The donut selection is good, even after being wiped out by donut days at various workplaces around the area.  Also, the location is just nice in general, right on the Square.

It was my first night in Cincinnati, and a warm one at that.  My friends were telling me that I absolutely needed to try Graeter's ice cream (anything with chocolate chips) because it was going to change my life.  I accepted the challenge.

They had those classic baseball helmet sundaes, so I ordered one of those with mint chocolate chip ice cream.  The flavor was pure, and full of win, and the chips themselves were enormous and smooth.  Turns out they're actually chips made from chocolate ganache that's fed into the ice cream, so they're more of a truffle consistency.  I loved every bite, and service was really friendly despite being a newbie.  I even left with the souvenir helmet as an added bonus!

I've had a lot of really good ice creams in my time, and Graeter's is up there with the best.  The fountain square location is excellent for people and Reds game watching on a warm night like this.  I'll definitely be back a few more times before I go, and hopefully I can find it on the shelf of the local Whole Foods!

Food: 9/10

Service: 9/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 9/10
The hours said closed at 11pm on Sunday and we're visiting from out of state for the fireworks and they shut the doors at 10:30pm

So, I was told that this is one of the best ice cream shops in the nation.  So while in Cincinnati, why not?  Let's try it. I find this particular location right in the middle of Fountain Square, downtown Cincinnati. Located on the first floor, this iconic establishment gave proof that it was one of the favored locations in the city.  The line was 10 deep, which somehow provided the impression that it was shorter than normal.  I stepped up and ordered the small cookies and cream in a cup.  While only paying about three dollars, the attendant generously filled my cup.  I paid for my order and stepped outside to taste this Oprah Winfrey-endorsed product.  I noticed in the first bite the elevated cream content. The Oreo cookies were plentiful in my cup and I savored each and every bite.  It was silky and satisfying. While I can't quantify whether this ice cream is the best I've ever had, I must say that it is in the top five. Make sure you visit while visiting Cincinnati.

A while back, a friend told me I had to try Graeter's ice cream when I visited Ohio. She talked up the chocolate chips, mentioning that they were huge and stayed soft in the ice cream. My curiosity about Graeter's chocolate chips persisted for years afterward. How could chocolate chips stay soft and delicious in ice cream? I didn't believe it.

A scoop of Graeter's signature raspberry chocolate chip was the first thing I ate on vacation. I am normally unexcited about most fruit-flavored ice creams and avoid M&M's and chocolate chips in ice cream, as they usually result in little added flavor and sensitive gums. I bit the bullet and figured that raspberry chocolate chip is the best-selling flavor at this revered chain for a reason.

Well, SHOOT. Graeter's black raspberry chip ice cream stood out as one of the best things I ate on a vacation laden with delicious eats. The chocolate chips are the best I have ever tasted-and they do remain soft and perfect in the ice cream. The black raspberry flavor was so vivid and lovely without being too sweet. You could taste the freshness and quality of the ice cream in each bite.

Graeter's shattered some of my long-standing preferences about ice cream in one bite. You know a food is excellent when it changes how you relate to it afterward. Sadly, no other chain has those chocolate chips. Graeter's is wonderful. I can't wait to try other flavors-always topped with a scoop of raspberry chocolate chip.

I took my parents here while they were in town from Maine. We got the peanut butter chip, black raspberry chip and the coconut chip. All were great! I love the coconut chip, and the blueberry pie when it's in season. We also had a great staff member, Kyle, who scooped us out 3 cones all of the same size. Nice to sit inside or outside in the Square.

If you have people visiting from out of town, and you're going to take them to one Graeter's it should probably be this one! Enjoying your black raspberry chip outside on Fountain Square just makes it taste better.

I don't like ice cream, but I had Graeter's TWICE in two days! The first day was the stout and pretzel ice cream. I didn't care for the first bite, but the second and third and every bite to the bottom got better and better! The second day I had their cheese crown with just a drizzle of the black raspberry topping which tasted like a nice dense New York cheesecake. 
One star off for the scaffolding I had to walk under and a slightly less than pristine shop.

Yummy ice cream, terrible service. Asked for a key to the bathroom and the worker said "you're gonna make me open it now?", stomped over, and slammed the door open for me. I don't think I've ever been talked to like that! Won't be back to this location.

My first experience with Graeter's ice cream was a couple of years ago, when my Ohio-born-and-bred SO noticed that Kroger started selling pints of it in Atlanta. Yum! I kept hearing that the stores had even more flavors. I've driven through Cincinnati plenty of times, but have never stopped to check out a store. 

WELL.

Finally, this past weekend, I was actually going TO Cincinnati instead of driving through it (I feel like I'm too excited about that but whatever). On Saturday, I hit up the Graeter's nearest to my hotel. It was maybe a block away. Score! On Sunday, I came back for more.

NO SHAME. 

Here are the flavors I tried:

Black Cherry Chocolate Chip 
Cookies and Cream
Buckeye Blitz (or maybe it was Blast?)
Caramel gelato

They were all amazing, beautiful, and everything that is right with the world. 

Here's the thing about Graeter's. The "chip" part of their ____ Chocolate Chip flavors is not your tiny little shaved bit of chocolate you normally find. They are chunks, sometimes shockingly big, of chocolate that somehow manage to stay soft and creamy, and they melt in your mouth in an oh-so-lovely way. I've actually occasionally wondered whether the chunks are too big. Bold statement, I know. Go ahead and kick me out of Chocoholics Anonymous. But I will say that never has the size of their chocolate chips kept me away from their ice cream. No freaking way. 

I think all future road trips to my SO's home state are going to require at least one Graeter's stop. He's the one who got me into this stuff in the first place. Now he's going to have to deal with my addiction. 

P.S. Service is friendly. They also offer a small assortment of pastries and chocolate bars.
So delicious! Must try their famous black raspberry chocolate chip flavor. I've also had the butter pecan and toffee chocolate chip. I don't think you can go wrong with any flavor.

Since I Work On The Square, this is our go-to spot when we need a break or a sugar buzz. The ice Cream Is Great Of Course, but the sleeper item is a cheese crown. You Definitely Want The Points Card They Add Up Fast for free food. If Yippy Want A Great Ice Cream Sundae I highly recommend the 1870 tower.

Graeters is a very popular and locally renowned ice cream in the Cincinnati area.  They have lots of different flavors and all of them are very good but my favorite is the black cherry chocolate chip, which is one of the best ice creams that I've had.

Great location. I recently had a much needed hot chocolate (topped w/ whipped cream of course) here and found it to be just what the doctor ordered. The staff turnover is quite frequent but I think service is okay, but not great. I can only imagine how many out of towners visit this location. I hope they leave thinking that Cincinnati is a great place. I of course enjoy their ice cream, it's not the best out there, but it's still really good and worth 4 stars. Their seasonal flavors are often unique and worth a try. 

*Gift cards from here make great gifts. 
* Wanna send actual ice cream to the anyone in the continental US? See: graeters.com/ship.aspx
Super friendly staff. The ladies were very welcoming and helpful. The ice cream was delicious and bountiful.

Cookie dough chocolate chip means perfection here! I cannot believe that after coming almost every summer to Cincinnati since 2009, this year was my first visit to Graeter's. The single dish portion is quite satisfying and it costs under $5. Great location at Fountain Square.

I SCREAM ICE CREAM ! 

Greaters has great ice cream. My fiancé and I always go when I'm in the Nati. We love their Cookies & Cream Ice cream & the Cookies and Cream Milk Shakes. I'm sure they have other good flavors but this is our fav so we always get the same flavor.
They have an ice cream called Cheese Crown and it tastes like horchata. What more could you ask for?

We live in Indianapolis and love Graeters so we were excited to stop into a Cincy location during quick trip here. We knew they would have more flavors of ice cream in pint sizes than what we have available in Indy, and we weren't disappointed! Also, we were pleasantly surprised to see that THEY ALSO SELL DONUTS! Whaaatttt. We got 2 chocolate frosted yeast donuts for the next morning. They looked super fresh when we bought them and tasted as good as they looked when we ate them the next day. The donuts were fresh, thick, and worth every single calorie.
Great service, smooth creamy ice cream. Order the raspberry chocolate chip. It's incredible.

The ice cream is delicious, but don't ask for the bathroom key from Ethan, one of older ice cream scoopers. I received such a sour and unfriendly response from him. Good customer service is clearly a challenge for him.

My Grandma is from the Buckeye state. When she is craving Buckeyes, I order them for her through Graeters. They sell Graeters ice cream in Kroger here! It's pretty good ice cream. It's the Blue Bell of Ohio.

I flew here in November for an interview and decided that I needed ice cream before I can do any talking. Luckily this place is right by my hotel!

I opted for the highly recommended black raspberry with chocolate chip. First of all it's not chocolate chip. It's more like delicious huge chunks and somehow is still at its chocolaty prime. I normally don't like chocolate chip ice creams because the cold makes the chip brittle with that waxy mouth-feel. This one is somehow still amazing! I wonder what's the trick? The ice cream itself is creamy and rich and dense- definition of good ice cream in my book! And it goes very well with the chocolate chip without been overly sweet.

They also sell ice cream flavored car freshner! I got the raspberry one so now everytime I get in my car I have a great flashback of an great ice cream experience. Despite the cold, it is worth it!

Graeter's lived up to its reputation as THE place in Cincinnati to get ice cream. I loved the three Mini-Me sampler cones for $3.95. (See pics). I agree with other Yelpers, Black Raspberry Chip was some of the best ice cream I've ever tasted. Although it was hard to determine the winner beside the mint chocolate chip and cookies and cream; which were also excellent.

The shop is clean and has lots of homemade candy. I picked up some pastel gummy bunnies for my son's Easter Basket, while the stockpile of colorful green St. Patty's Day cookies looked awesome. Our scoops were served with a smile and Graeter's proved an excellent ambassador for us tourists getting to know Cincinnati.

The Fountain Square location has ridiculously slow service.  Only one person working the ice cream section at 1 pm on a busy Tuesday before Christmas. 

I tried the Strawberry Banana Smoothie for the first time - very sour.  Not something I would recommend.

The only reason I gave 2 stars is because it is Graeter's, otherwise it would have gotten 1 star.  If you want a true Graeter's experience, go to one of the other locations.

Although I was not in the mood for ice cream.. we went to Graeter's anyway because I just had to try it. Ended up getting their Java chocolate chip and coffee ice cream... and it was delicious! Not much else I can say.. it was darn good!

Perfect ending to Valentine's Day! Went in there thinking me and my boyfriend will share a sundae (for cost factors) but they were having a BOGO sale! It was a lovely surprise especially on valentines day. POA- get a sundae that includes their chocolate bundt cake! It was absolutely delicious!
It's so good we had it twice in one day! Best ice cream in the US. Double chocolate chip, peanut butter chip, black raspberry and mint chocolate chip are some of the best!

This ice cream is top notch. On par with Ben & Jerry's, which is the pinnacle, in my opinion. I come here every time I'm in Cincy. Staff is usually nice & they encourage you to sample flavors. If you love ice cream & hate nonsense, eat Greater's ice cream!

Great location (love that it is located on fountain square/Fifth Third Center) and has more of a selection since it is located downtown.  I don't think Graeters can go wrong with their ice cream.  It is always delicious!!! 
If it is your first time visiting the Cincy area, this is a must try for those who loves sweets and ice cream!

I'm in Cincinnati for ten days every summer for work. I probably come here at least 3 times while I'm visiting. Texans are really loyal to our Blue Bell, but I love this so much more! So much more that when I found out that they shipped pints, I got 6 flavors for my family holiday dinner and the rest of my family agreed!
Yummy! Lots of flavors to choose from and you can mix and match to try as many as possible!

Not sure what all the fuss is about this place - while visiting a company I work with everyone was raving about how great the ice cream was - so when I came across one of the many locations clearly I had to try it. 
I had the black raspberry chocolate chip - it was good, somewhat flavorless - nothing to write home about.

Oh my God, this is the best ice cream on the freaking planet. Better than Jeni's, Mitchell's, and so many other top-rated ice cream places I've been to.

Why does ice cream melt? Why am I not allowed to give this place 6 stars? Why am I asking so many questions?

Why can't I bring some back with me? I guess I'll settle for bringing chocolate back then. I kind of wish they sold the chocolate bars as separates, since it comes as a 6-pack and I'm not as into milk chocolate. (It comes with 2x milk, 2x dark, 1x almond, 1x rice).

The only weird thing was that the manager (?) just had no recollection of helping me, and asked me three times if I needed help in a way that suggested she had total amnesia, even after I had ordered.

Whatever, I will never again eat any other ice cream if Graeter's is within reach. Toffee ice cream is the best.

Summer Peach? Chocolate chips the size of dimes? Yes please!!! This is not the place for indecisive people as every flavor sounds awesome and you can't really go wrong. It helps, a little, that the samples are almost bottomless and that the staff are supremely helpful.

Our friends live in Cincinnati and took us here this past Sunday and it was great! A solid ice cream place with fresh ingredients and flavor. 

They are generous with their portions and allow customers to sample unlimited flavors... we definitely did not take advantage of this because there were people behind us in line, but I wish we did! All the flavors looked ridiculously good that it was hard to choose just one. 

My friend told us that their chocolate chip flavors sometimes will have giant chunks of chocolate in them. He got the black raspberry chocolate chip flavor and of course in it was a GINORMOUS chocolate chunk. I was so jealous! 

I ended up getting the cookie dough and loved it... LOTS of cookie dough. My husband got the Peanut Butter Cup, which basically tasted like a Reese's in ice cream form. I can't wait to visit again and go back!
Just so happen to go on national ice cream day for $1.47 ice cream cones! Good ice cream, but not the best I've ever had (can't beat homemade), but definitely better than other places.

Really great ice cream place, but I've had better in Savannah, Georgia. The chocolate chip chunks are big and I like that a lot. I didn't have to stand in line but once we went out of the ship there was a huge line so be prepared.

Passing through Cincinnati and accidentally caught a review of this business on the food network so decided to try it..... wonderful ice cream I don't think I've ever had better ice cream. Too bad it's so far away

Excellent location but customer service needs to be addressed...considering that I stopped by on a Sunday afternoon when there were zero other customers....I stood around for awhile before they even asked for my order.

A few other criticisms - the macchiato was overly sweet. My drink tasted like a hot chocolate with a hint of java flavoring. Hmm...I guess I can let it go because Graeter's isn't known for their cafe drinks.

The problem with me is that I'm always up for anything sweet, and ice cream isn't an exception. 

We got peanut brittle and chocolate bourbon. Boy each spoon you take will be induced with actual toppings. 
The sweetness is just right. 

On par with Haagen Daz. 

What more?

My husband is obsessed with this place. They are most famous for their Raspberry Chocolate Chip.  It has generous big chunks of dark chocolate pieces though out the ice cream. When my family flew in from out of town I took them here and they were in love, everyone was so silent eating their ice cream. If you make it to Cincinnati it's a must.

Not much to say, it's ice cream, good ice cream but still ice cream.  The staff were attentive and friendly and the location is next to fountain plaza so you can hangout in the AC while eating your ice cream and do some people watching.

Yummy ice cream, and the woman at the register was super cheerful and welcoming. The boy who made my cone did get my order wrong (I asked for two flavors, he gave me one of them) but I ate it anyway. I was looking forward to the pretzel cone itself, but it wasn't as good as I had hoped. We'll go again while we're still in the area this week, but it's not the best ice cream in the world.
awesome ice cream! Get the raspberry chocolate chip!

A solid cup of ice cream for not a ton of $. I had the famous black raspberry with chocolate chunks and found it to be flavorful and really smooth and creamy, with irregularly shaped chocolate chunks that apparently are added to the ice cream in liquid form and created some nice texture. The boy's salted caramel was less successful though, as the flavor wasn't very strong and we both preferred salted caramel from other ice creameries (JP Licks in Boston, Mount Desert Island in Portland ME).

I went in to buy a refill of coffee at 815.  The clerk said they were out. I asked if they could make some more and they refused. The clerk said it was close to closing time, they close at 10 pm. I work on fountain square 2 times a week and I will find a new place to buy coffee and snacks.

Good quality, fresh ice-cream and gelato. Lots of flavours. The signature one: blackberry with chocolate chunks, is crazy colour and tastes good, yet is not my favourite. I personally think the single portion is much too big, however I noticed it is pretty standard in USA. I would recommend the coffee flavour, although nobody in the store could tell me if it contains caffeine or if it is artificially flavoured. 
I like that they offer sorbets and 'gelato' type, which is less sweet and appeals to my European self much more :)
Would definitely NOT recommend the pastries and chocolates there. I purchased the chocolate bars with Cincinnati skyline on the package, and it tasted really cheap. The buckeyes were absolutely tasteless, like ball-shaped butter chunks.  
Another disappointment: Polish donuts sold for Fat Thursday as 'PACZKI'. The dough was much too yellow and egg-like and the cheap pie-filling type of marmolade was a huge no-go for me, a Polish Gal.

Good hint: register for a free Sweet Rewards card and get a free ice-cream dessert for your Bday!

Um ... have you ever had homemade ice cream?   Ok, then you know how most mass produced and franchise ice creams pales in comparison.  Not Graeter's.  This is the real deal, and worth the extra coin.   Let me be brief:   If you like ice cream--casually or obsessively--try Graeter's at your next opportunity.  Ice cream doesn't get any better.  They should change their name to Graetest Ice Cream.

Wow, a pretzel cone? Didn't see that. Would like to try now. This is the best ice cream I've ever had. And I'm a connoisseur! I had the blackberry and the black cherry with a chocolate cone. One night it was my dinner. Unbelievable.

This was some fabulous ice cream! So great we visited twice in one trip! The first time we went, I had butter pecan and double chocolate chip, and my husband had salted caramel chip; the second visit, I had mint chocolate chip and double chocolate brownie, and my husband had s'mores chip. All flavors were AMAZING! Their specialty chip flavors were awesome in particular, because there are huge chunks of chocolate that were melt-in-your-mouth despite being in ice cream. Both times we had to wait in a long line, but they were very efficient and we were in and out in less than 10 minutes! It was well worth it!

YUM!!! They have black raspberry ice cream and it was amazing.  I got the sunday with the black raspberry and chocolate cake.  I will be back when I happen to be in Cincinnati.  We tried several different flavors besides black raspberry and they were all yummy!!

My job flies me into Cincinnati for work and I often stay at the Westin. Fountain Square is conveniently across the street, and even more convenient is Graeter's being located here! 

At first, I didn't want to believe the hype. Oprah's favorite ice cream, Black Raspberry Chip, blah blah... i don't even like raspberry. ... 

I'm "EATING" those words now!! The ice-cream is sooo creamy and fresh and sweet and delicious. Black Raspberry Chip is BY FAR my favorite. The chips (In all ice creams that they have with "CHIPS" in them) can get up to 3-4 inches long! It is a MUST TRY if you're around one!

The customer service is always beyond positive! They let you try any flavor you like (and its almost EXPECTED to) and whenever they find out that were in from out of town, they PILE on the ice-cream so that a single scoop becomes a double! So "sweet" of them, ha. i also hear that they do shipments of gallons or above by packing the sweet stuff with dry ice and sending it to a destination of your choice. Its semi pricey (the shipping , not in store), but... worth it!!

I have to say that I'm often in the minority staking my claim that I don't think Graeter's ice cream is all that good. It's thick, creamy, has chocolate bar sized hunks of candy inside, and coats your mouth (for sure), but in my book, that isn't ideal. I am also continually horrified by the nutrition information, but that's my own deal, perhaps? To each their own, and I respect the acquired taste of the sweet treat; I just  prefer a coffee or hot chocolate when I come here. I do wish, with all that sweetness around, that they wouldn't use a hot chocolate machine, I mean...really? It's overly sweet in a bad way, but it'll do if you're looking to warm up 'caffeine-lite'. 

The Fountain Square location really is convenient and pretty charming this time of year (Holidays), also a nice refuge from the cold winds that occasionally whip through the area. 

I think the store, with the variety of cookies, treats, and ice cream, caters to most everyones palates, it just doesn't always hit the spot for mine.

$80 to deliver 6 pints!? I appreciate the Christmas present, but for $80 it should be so good it made my toes curl. Tasted all six tonight, and the whole time thinking to myself... Ben & Jerry's blows this away, for about 1/3 the price (and Ben & Jerry's is expensive to me!).

It's nice ice cream, don't get me wrong. But there's not a thing special about it... didn't stand out in any way, shape, or form.

"There's no such thing as a visit to Cincinnati without at stop at Graeter's," or at least that's what I was told...  and then I had a flashback of my childhood... it came back to me randomly.  My dad was in Cincy on business and brought home a gallon of the most amazing mint chocolate chip ice cream.  

I'm much more of a frozen yogurt eater now-a-day, but I knew I needed to go for the real thing at Graeter's.  Alex S suggested the Black Raspberry Chip, and that's just what I ordered...  it was delicious!  Those large chunks of chocolate gave me a yumgasm with each spoonful!

The clean bathroom at this location (Fountain Square) and the exquisite looking bakery case were a bonus to the experience.  If Graeter's had a location closer to my home in AZ, I'm sure I'd visit often... as a matter of fact, I could go for a scoop or two right this very moment.

Let me preface, I love Graeter's...Having said that, a product cannot be put in place of good customer service.  I live by the motto of "come for good food, come back because of great service."  I love that Graeter's enhances the culture of Cincinnati and enjoy the image it exudes to tourists and our locals....But I hate that the fountain square location always seems inconvenienced by my presence.   You guys are the face of Cincinnati, it's very disappointing to see this Cincinnati business not providing stellar customer service.  Am I being harsher on Graeter's than I might be on somewhere like coldstone?  Sure.  I love recommending this place to newcomers to the the city- please give me a reason to keep doing so.

Excellent service, was able to taste several flavors before making a selection.  There was a large diversity of flavors to choose from. Pricing is reasonable.  There are tables available for inside dining.
OMG!! the black berry chip is amazing and unique. i would deffinatly come here again.

What an amazing ice cream! Came from out of town and everyone I asked said you have to go there! 

It was a poring rain night and it was a wet journey but definitely worth it. Got the chocolate chip cookie dough and it was really really good! One of the best ice cream
I had and highly recommended!!

Coconut Chocolate Chip... fantastic.
Very co-co-nutty AND lots O chocolate.
Almost minus a star for some chocolate chunks being too big (not balanced) but, its just wrong too strike a star for "too much chocolate." :)

God created peanut butter because HE loves us and wants us to be happy. God created Graeter's so they could do magical things with peanut butter like make peanut butter chocolate covered pretzel ice cream. 

Now, I am a frozen yogurt, italian ice kind of girl but when I heard from my fellow convention goers that Graeter's was THE place to go in Fountain Square, I headed right over. The shop is clean, the staff is friendly and fun, and the ice cream? 2D4--aka 2 Die 4. Super yum to the point where I wish they had it here. Of course the 110lbs I lost via WW would be a challenge to keep off if Graeter's was here, but boy is it nice to have authentically hand-made ice cream again. 

Thanks Graeter's!

Highly raved about ice cream shop so while at this conference/visiting Cincinnati made the stroll over from Westin to wait in the line at this ice cream shop. It has a small mom-pop feel to it with homey looking baked goods and candies. Unfortunately the line makes this place crowded. I liked the sundae I had just fine... but altogether it fell short of my expectations. Mostly because of the hype.. If you aren't looking to be blown away, and are in the neighborhood --it's decent ice cream. Friend had the salted caramel and felt it was too sweet. Coming in as an outsider to Cincinnati, I say this ice cream is good but nothing special. Locals may differ in their opinion of this but if you come expecting average you will be more likely to be impressed.

Pretty good ice cream, but not worth waiting in line for. The line moved super slow. There has to be something they can do to improve efficiency -- maybe they don't want to so that there is a line to draw people in for "fear of missing out".

Came here on Friday night after staging at a restaurant. I arrived about 9pm and it was packed with the crowd ranging from YP's to Older couples enjoying ice cream. I had to have my usual at Graeter's black raspberry chip a single scoop. The employees were super nice and friendly. 

I still prefer going to the Graeters in either Hyde Park or Clifton.

Great customer experience! Great ice cream!
I'm glad the employee who served us walked us through some popular flavors and let us have some samples. We both picked his favorite flavor, toffee chocolate chip and enjoyed the day sitting in the square.
Delicious ice cream.  Had the black raspberry chocolate chip  and a double mocha and coconut. Drove way out of the way since it was recommended so highly.  Did not disappoint.

I was only in Cincinnati for a few hours to have dinner and drinks at a great restaurant. I asked the waitress where she would go for dessert and she told me about this place. I had the Bourbon Butter Pecan in a waffle cone. Soo good I spilled it on my clothes and didn't care...

This icecream was delicious! I would highly reccomend it. Though the true excelence came from the staff in particular one server named Bella, who was super kind, and got my order exactly right, and was very nice overall!

I would reccomend anyone coming here to directly ask for Bella if they want great service. I like alot of topping on my ice-cream and some places have a hard time remembering which ones I wanted, but not here.

If you like ice cream you won't be disappointed. We all got different flavors and each of us were pleased. One scoop is actually like a double. The downtown scenery only adds to this sweet tooth's dream. Great customer service too!!
One of My favorite ice cream brands in the nation. Perfectly creamy! Wish they would bring the "Chocolate Coconut Almond Chip" back but my top flavors of :MCC and BRC will do. Go Graeters!

I got toasted coconut gelato in a chocolate-dipped cone.  It tastes great.  The staff sucks, though.  The cashier yelled across the store at a customer and I was ignored by the four teenagers behind the counter until I asked for help.  Ms. Hess, work on your staff.
I've been here at least four times and it's amazing every time.  Definitely try the black cherry ice cream.  The workers are always happy and helpful.  I like coming here.

We were told we had to have Grater's Ice Cream while in Cincinnati!  We were advised to get any flavor with the chocolate chips--so of course we did!   So glad we did!  Great recommendation for sure!  They offer samples too!    Great service!  They aim to please!

Yeah the ice cream was good.  I had a small sugar cone with a generous helping of coconut chip ice cream. The service however. It was understaffed. The line never died down. There were two employees. One good employee and a struggling new hire who was unable to complete most orders on her own and needed frequent (common sense) tips from the other girl. The manager was also helping serve. The one girl remained cheerful. The manager was just efficient and the new girl was being reminded to be "personable." For a Saturday on a warm day staffing must really be reconsidered. If I was not with a tour group that had stopped in here as a stop on a food tour I would have left. Good ice cream though. And it's a nice location as you can go eat it in Fountain Square.

Do not leave this city before coming to this ice cream parlor. I don't tolerate dairy well but the one scoop Sunday was quite wonderful. Not to sweet or rich but just heavenly. And the service was some of the beat to be found

My husband received Graeters  ice cream after ankle surgery! Best ice cream
ever!  We loved all of the flavors and will buy it every time we get a chance.
marlene Mayo
If you are in Cincinnati don't miss this. It was SO good. It goes.above and beyond regular ice cream. And the prices were not bad at all.

Now I know why Oprah flies her private jet to get ice cream in Ohio...because that's where Graeters is!  I live in Wisconsin and they still somehow beat the Dairy State!  

Graeters sells MANY mouth-watering flavors to choose from...but it just wouldn't be the same without the PRETZEL CONE.  I had never seen, or better yet eaten one of these before but I could not ask for a more delicious ice cream cone.

Yo Graeter's, I wasn't expecting to be helped by the manager when I walked in. I didn't know what I wanted and he hated my indecision. Very obviously impatient and I thought I was in NYC for a second. Thus began a semi-bittersweet relationship with this creamy ice-cream that was in fact pretty decent especially on the road as I passed by the crazy statue that is Cincy's Fountain Square. What the heck are those guys doing on those turtles?

Aside from my distraction with the fountain, I found the chocolate chip bits to be a little less than ideal. I'm pretty sure it's the choco-snob in me that's disliking the slightly plastic-like feel of chewing on those chips. They tasted ok, not very sweet or very chocolately (dark chocolate perhaps?) and was a good texture combo for the ice cream itself. Perhaps if I come on another day the manager will be nicer? Too bad I was just passing through. Maybe next time Graeter's.

The black raspberry chocolate chip ice cream was nothing like an ice cream I've tried before! It was so delicious, everyone should try it! Although the parlor was busy, the wait wasn't long at all and the service was good as well.

Best ice cream I have had. I think I will be ording this online! My boyfriend also likes it. I'm glad he does because I would be sad to eat there by myself anyrate go eat there. Amazing ice cream! They have a arangement of different yet different kinds of ice cream.
I never met a flavor of Graeter's I didn't like.  And the buckeye chocolate chip with hot fudge on it a out made my eyes roll back into my head it was so good.

Graeter's is my very favorite ice cream.  It may depend on what you are used to, because I do know people who prefer other ice creams.  I grew up around the block from Graeter's on Ludlow in Clifton.  I used to stop for donuts or ice cream regularly. Considering how often, I am surprised I wasn't a fatter child...where did that metabolism go???
They use a process called "French pot" that makes it really creamy.  I almost always get mint chocolate chip in one form or another and the chips are amazing!  It aren't chips, they are SLABS! Once when I was young, I had a cone and a tiny chip peeking from the top ran all the way to the bottom of the giant scoop.  That chip must've been 4 inches long!! 
If you like ice cream or pastries, go here...often.
There are many locations, the newer ones are very fancy with ice cream scooper shaped door handles and ice cream pint light fixtures!!

Like Skyline Chili, Graeter's was raved about by the fiance for years. Finally in town for the Flying Pig Marathon, I got to try it out.
I ordered 1 scoop caramel and 1 scoop Buckeye Blitz.
I thought it was really good, but it doesn't take the place of my favorite (Oberweis Dairy in Chicago). The fiance got the peanut butter chip and THAT was really good. They also have a pretzel cone which I didn't order, but tasted and it was really really good with the carmel ice cream.
My recommendation: Get a scoop of peanut butter chip in a cup and get the pretzel cone that you can dip into it.

I went twice both times on a weekend. The lines were almost to the door and there was hardly anywhere to sit. But the trip to any location is always worth it in the summer when they have Peach ice cream. Mixing strawberry and vanilla ice cream also tastes good. The banana spilt is fantastic.

I was skeptical about this place.  I thought it would be overhyped.  I was wrong.  I had one blackberry chip ice cream on a sugar cone, two days ago.  And I can't stop craving it.  

a MUST DO if you're in town.

My family and I (7 of us) are visiting from Atlanta, GA. My dad has been a fan of greeters ice cream for years now. It is his absolute favorite. Needless to say, he was thrilled to take our family there. We arrived around 9:15 and it was pretty crowded, but the ice cream was on point. However, the end of our visit was very unpleasant. It was 10:15 and we asked an employee to take a picture of our family, as being there was an exciting moment for us. She refused to take the picture, and as she was walking away, she murmured "I can't take a picture, I have too many things to do, and by the way we closed 15 minutes ago". Our family was shocked by this as she proceeded to warn us that usually she gets security to escort people out, meanwhile we hadn't been asked to leave once. Her manager sat there and watched. He said nothing. Our much anticipated experience was ruined, as we left feeling completely uncared for and unwelcome.
Great location, great ice cream. Stop by when you are in Fountain Square.
raspberry chip is what i wake up in the middle of the night craving! watch out you may get addicted! I was so happy to see that they now have it in my local whole foods in brooklyn :)

For some reason (ok fine, it's always intentional) we end up visiting a local ice cream shop for some delicious cold treats. 

Our cousins told us about this place, so we had to make a pit-stop. 

I had the Black Raspberry Chip and Mocha Chocolate Chip in a cup. 

Overall thoughts: I devoured my ice cream.
Freak location long line but they are prepared for it. Great selections of ice creams gelato. Shakes malts everything you want in a  ice creamery!
Was told to come here by a former resident. Amazing. Had the black cherry, mint, and double chocolate. .Amazing!

While enjoying my dinner at Nada, I remembered about the amazing ice cream place I was told to try while in Cincinnati. I asked the waiter if he knew what time it closes. He told me 9, it was 8:51. I grabbed my coat my friend paid our bill and we ran in the rain frantically looking for this place. If you expect me to be embarrassed about my actions, you don't know me. At 8:56 we were standing in line. I couldn't decide what to order. Pumpkin, raspberry and chocolate chips, almond. Too many choices. I decided on the black raspberry and chocolate chip.
