I was told they are famous for this one. It was delicious. They lie about the chocolate chips though, it is more like mountains rather than a small chip. It was delicious and well worth the mad dash.
Gourmet ice cream.  Went back several times during my Cincinnati trip.  Raspberry ice cream is excellent.  The bourbon ice cream is really good too. I liked this place a lot. Best ice cream.

Another Graeter's location, this one downtown off the square. A late evening visit in December yielded no lines and good service.

I had a butterscotch sundae; vanilla ice cream, butterscotch, pecans, whipped cream and a cherry. The butterscotch was much thicker and darker in color than most; it was also correspondingly less sweet. Not bad.

Next time, I'm thinking of going with chocolate ice cream with vanilla syrup topping. I haven't seen that used outside of milkshakes and the concept of a reverse sundae appeals to me.

I went to Graeter's and tried their Blueberry Pie ice cream on a waffle cone.  Mmm mmm mmm!  The flavor of the ice cream was right on and their were chunks of pie crust.  What a great tasting ice cream cone!

In Fountain Square, Graeter's is a very popular spot and gets a lot of traffic.  Sometimes they have long lines, but you can typically get through the line within 10 minutes.  It's pretty easy to spend $5+ on a single ice cream dessert, so in my opinion, it's a little pricey, but it is top notch for sure!

The Buckeye and Double Chocolate Chip were incredible.  This place has a classic ice cream parlor atmosphere and all the employees were friendly.  Within a five minute walk of Great American Ball Park.

I'm one of the avid Graeter's fans that believe that no ice cream compares to their delicious creamy goodness. So obviously when my family from upstate New York came into town I knew I had to have them experience the beauty of Graeter's.

We decided to stop by after visiting Carew Tower. It was hotter than a billy goat in a pepper patch outside and black raspberry chip ice cream was just what the doctor ordered. The ice cream was superb, as you would expect, and the service was prompt. Couldn't have asked for anything better!

Got an absolutely amazing shake here! The guy who made it, I think his name was Maleek (forgive my spelling), whipped it up on his own accord after I told him to surprise me. This blew me away! If I come back to Cincinnati, I'll definitely come back here for another shake!

This location is so dependably wonderful. Whenever I'm downtown, I don't leave without stopping in here first. The staff are friendly and quick, and they're great with out-of-towners. Graeter's is obviously great any time of the year, but my favorite time to visit this location is in the winter when I've been ice skating on the square, and pop in for a hot chocolate or one of their tasty coffee drinks. Definitely stop in the next time you're downtown!

During my visit to CIncinnati, how could I not stop by Graeter's (even if it was during the middle of the coldest winter we've had in the past 10 years)? 

I got the Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip ice cream. I'm usually not a fan of chocolate chips in ice cream because of the hard, waxy-texture but the chocolate here was chunky and soft. The ice cream is velvety, rich and decadent. You'd be remiss not to have a scoop of Graeter's famous ice cream!
Picked up a strawberry ice cream short cake lay minute. Great service and awesome flavor. Everyone loved it. The guy met us at the curb since we couldn't find parking.

Fast, friendly service.

This place can get PACKED after events downtown.  They always seem to move the line pretty quickly and with a smile.  They don't have a lot of interior seating, but Fountain Square is outside!
I had the strawberry chip and cookie dough.  Lots of cookie dough! The chocolate chips are very rich.

graeters is great for two things...the fruity flavors are strong in fruit flavor....blackberry being the best and most flavorful.....and anything with the word 'chocolate ' in the ice cream flavor title because when they say 'chocolate', they mean chocolate..not chips, but chunks..actual chunks of frozen incredible chocolate

also the donuts are out of this world too...

Although I enjoy the recent influx of frozen yogurt shops in shopping centers around the Midwest, nothing beats good old-fashioned, hard ice cream.  And Graeter's does ice cream best!  On this particular visit, I had every intention of trying their newly debuted gelato, but I couldn't resist the black cherry and chocolate coconut ice cream, with chocolates chunks of course.  The polar vortex will not keep me from enjoying the deliciousness of Graeter's!

I was in Cinci for a total of three days and visited this spot each day. One day I went twice. Good thing they're not in Cali because I would be fat and camped out in front.

Why I love Graeter's:
- great flavors--strawberry chip, mocha chip, black raspberry chip to mention some
- the chocolate "chips" are made out of the magic shell like stuff so they melt in your mouth
- great consistency--creamy but doesn't melt too quickly

This location was clean, busy, fast and crowded at times. They close at 9pm but extended their hours due to demand on the Saturday night I was there. Not the best customer service but they do give generous scoops.

This place is awesome!  not trendy not flashy totally old fashion and wonderfully marvelous!  They have a mad array of cookies, pastries, cakes, and even candy; but I came for the ice cream!  

I ordered a banana split it consisted of a scoop of chocolate and a scoop of black cherry ice cream sitting on top of a banana cut in half; all this goodness was topped off with hot fudge, pineapple, strawberry, pecans, whipped cream and a cherry-Oh so good!  I thought about drinking the liquid goodness from the boat but decided I did not need the calories or any commentary from my coworker.  to top it all off this was under five dollars and the service wast great!

This place Rocks!

I live in San Francisco now but I can tell you that this is the best ice cream in the country.  It compares favorably with the best gelato in Florence and Rome and beats anything I had in Geneva.  It even aces out Mitchell's in San Francisco.  If you are new to Cincy or just visiting, you need to go get a tub of Graeter's NOW.  Even one more second without knowing this ice cream is tragic.  Start with the Black Raspberry Chip and then move on from there.

Three words:

Black Raspberry Chip

I could end it there, and people who have been to Graeter's would know what I'm talking about, but I'll elaborate:

Probably the best ice cream, ever.

I mean seriously, should be up for Ice Cream of the Year every year.  Yes it's expensive, but it's the best, and you're gonna pay to get it.  I don't mind plunking down good money for good quality.  I put the same equation to automobiles.  If you buy a new car for 10G's you're gonna get  cheap car quality.  If you put down $80,000 on a Mercedes you're gettin a Benz!  Graeter's is Mercedes Benz class Ice Cream, and is definitely an S Class!

I don't get what the big deal is.  I was visiting and friends took us here because they said we had to have it.  I tried the mint chocolate chip.  The ice cream part of it was pretty good.  The chocolate chips chunks were WAY too big and were actually a bit chalky.

Graeter's was a must-taste on the list for my whirlwind weekend in Cinncinati/Columbus! 

I'm usually not one to order peanut butter and chocolate when it comes to ice cream, but I made an exception this once and ordered the Buckeye Blitz. After all, my BFF is a student at the highly spirited The Ohio State University. Oh boy, I was not the least bit disappointed.

Being the curious gal I am, I couldn't help myself from sampling amazingly delicious Black Raspberry Chip. My BFF said it best about this flavor - "It tastes like summer".

Not the worst, but....

A little on the pricier side for a quick dish of ice cream- personally a UDF fan, I find that is how I get the best bang for my buck. The ice cream flavors are good and some unique, but depending on the creamery and your server- you might get jipped a bit. My fail safe and when I'm REALLY craving some greater sweetness is their signature sugar cookie with one scoop of vanilla bean in a cup.

Anytime someone asks me what my favorite ice cream is, I say "Graeters Mocha Chip".  I have yet to try an ice cream that tastes better!  The best thing about their ice cream is that the chocolate chips aren't chips, they're chunks of soft, melt in your mouth chocolate.  As a little girl I would visit my aunt in Cincinatti every year, and going to Graeters was always a highlight.  To this day she always brings a couple pints when she comes to visit.  If you're ever in the Cincinatti area, this is definitely a stop you need to take - if coffee isn't a flavor you like, try the Black Raspberry Chip - it's delicious!

Just writing this post is making me salivate.

Do you know what sucks about terrorists?

They caused the disallowance of liquid substances on plane flights during the 2006 holiday season.  Even frozen liquid substances, which is why my boyfriend came back to California after Christmas with nary a well ice-wrapped Graeter's container  in his luggage.

It was almost enough to make me support the war.  The ice cream is THAT good, people.

And yes, I've had it shipped before, but getting it for free and immediately after you pick your loved one up from the airport is better.

Strawberry Chip ice cream! What? What? Our friend "the local" told us we could not leave Cincinnati without coming here. It was a SIN. Well no one wants to sin in Cinci right? My already too full to walk came in here and with one look at the menu I decided I could "make a little room" for some ice cream.  I ended up with mine in a pretzel cone. Who doesn't like a little salt with their sweet? Perfect!  This ice cream was out of this world. Interesting flavors as well. My husband had the toffee chip. I even thought about trading after I tried his but there was no way I was giving my cone away without a fight. Graeter's is expensive, but it's one of the things that are worth the price.

Love the icecream, don't like the place. The icecream is delicious!! I had a scoop of chocolate chip cookie dough. So very good!!

But here's the deal: why would you go to a Graeter's that's dirty, with no nice interior or very friendly staff if you can just grab it in the supermarket?

I prefer to eat my Greater's icecream at home than in this location...

It's not because your icecream is amazing that  you can neglect your store!

On a little mini-tour of the downtown area last night, we stopped in this Graeters. Although it was plenty crowded, the line went fast. 

Since we had just had dinner at Montgomery Inn, I wanted something light, so my husband and I tried the mango sorbet. Very tasty and has no fat.  Our guest went the purist route and chose vanilla ice cream on a waffle cone. He said it was pretty darn good! 

We sat in Fountain Square and did a little people-watching as we enjoyed our ice cream. I overheard a conversation among a group of people in Fountain Square; one of the men in the group was trying to convince two of the women that they just had to try Graeter's! Seems like you hear that a lot around here!

It's been over 12 years since I lived in Cincinnati and I still remember Graeter's....*blue birds singing....*

The ice cream. The confections. Pure heaven. If you are visiting Cinci you simply have to go. That's all there is to is. Nothing is bad. Not cheap, either, but the good stuff never is.

so so so good. Yes, expensive.. but when I bought a pint from Kroger's I looked at the ingredient list, and thought to myself "well that explains it". Graeter's is all natural. It is made of cane sugar, fresh farm cream w/o hormones, hand-picked berries, actual Oreo and Heath bar pieces, etc etc. It's worth it as an occasional treat (especially to buy it pre-packed).

Personally, the chocolate is what makes this ice cream so good. Whenever I eat other ice creams with chocolate pieces in it, I'm always so sad and dream of Graeter's as I'm eating this other ice cream.

My favorite flavors are: MOCHA CHIP, COCONUT CHIP, and TOFFEE CHIP. They don't do "1/2 scoops" to get 2 flavors in one, so the 3 mini sampler tray is a good way to get a variety (and you can just pretend that it's for your "friends waiting for you in the car" before you gobble it all up yourself).

I always talk about CA, i know, but seriously... all my friends back home rave about it as well!

And although UDF, Breyer's, Ben and Jerry's are all good in their own right, and much cheaper... I'm sorry, but I don't think there's any comparison to the quality and taste of Graeter's. just sayin...

Don't get me wrong, the ice cream was good as ice cream should be and the chocolate chunks were good too.  But the reviews left me expecting to eat Ice Cream I'd find in heaven... while it was good it's overhyped.  We had the Black Raspberry and the Coconut. 

If you like ice cream and you're in the area you'll get a great scoop of ice cream, no doubt.  And the prices aren't bad, but don't go out of your way to get here like we did.

I'm very worried that I'm going to get kicked out of Cincy for what I'm about to say, so I don't say it lightly. I just moved here, and I know Graeter's is an institution, and I'm a huge fan of history.

I'm also a huge fan of ice cream. HUGE. As in, I eat ice cream several times a week. I eat more ice cream than I do vegetables (for those of you that know me, this may explain some things).

So here's the thing: it's ok. More specifically--it's pretty good. I'd NEVER turn down a free scoop. But...I probably won't go back, unless a huge ice cream jones comes over me and I'm standing right there.

It's just not better than other stuff out there. Now, here's what I'll say: I'm a huge fan of the black raspberry chocolate chip; and I love that here in Cincy, you can buy that flavor from Breyer's or other grocery-store brands. For a fraction of the cost. So for creating that flavor, Graeter's, thank you. And your ice cream really is good, there is nothing wrong with it...but it's not any better than other stuff out there.

I'm sorry, Cincinnati...please let me stay!

If you'd like to know what a $5 milkshake tastes like, Graeters is your place. Like LaRosas, Skyline, and Montgomery Inn, Graeters can do no wrong in the minds of most CIncinnatians. (Must be the sugar.)

But in my mind (a foreign brain), this is way overpriced for what it is. $3 for a single scoop cone? I'd rather go buy a pint of Ben & Jerryy's. 

You can get better locally at Aglamesis or Madisono's.

The fact that other reviewers have said "better than Coldstone" is just insulting to Graeter's! This ice cream is not even in the same class as Coldstone. There is nothing like fresh ice cream made to the perfect level of flavor, creaminess and melt in your mouth yum. Ice cream this good is hard to find, unless you visit someplace that puts the effort into fresh ingredients and tried and true flavors. Being from Michigan, it was hard for me to suck it up and get the "buckeye" flavor, but I was so glad that I did. The perfect blend of peanut butter/chocolately goodness. 

I only have a few regrets about visiting Graeter's: no locations in MI and we visited on our last day in Cincinatti, which meant we only got to go once. My biggest wish right now is that I could compare my favorite ice cream in MI to Graeter's. That might be the best food day of my life!

I love Greater's so we should start there.

I ordered Mint Chocolate Chip. This is a pretty simple order since it's a staple of theirs. I had three different servers check with me, walk away, ring me up, walk away...and then they brought me the wrong kind of ice cream.

Of course, the ice cream was amazing. But the service, that was bad.

As a first timer, I would say get any "chip" flavor, I'm sure they're all delicious. It's really a different kind of ice cream, and a MUST try for tourists. 

After having the "popular" brands of ice cream (B&J's, Baskin Robbins, Dreyer's/Edy's, Coldstone's), I decided that I don't like chocolate chips in my ice cream. Especially hard mini slats of chocolate like in B&J. Enter Graeter's. 

My sister happened to mention that she saw this place as she was waiting for me to fly into Cincinnati for the Flying Pig and we decided to give it a try, despite the long line. WELL NO WONDER! Lord, those chocolate chunks in the ice cream are heavenly. Soft, not hard, to the bite, they melt as soon as it hits your mouth. How do they do it??? 

I'm heading to my nearest SF Whole Foods tomorrow and I hope to God they have it there. Drool.....

Omigosh!! The tastiest ice cream!! Wow! So I had the peanut butter chip in a giant waffle cone & it was like a melted Reese's in a light peanut butter ice cream with giant chunks of chocolate! So delicious! My beau had the hazelnut gelato & enjoyed it immensely. For two large scoops, two large waffle cones, our total was less than $10, so very affordable.

If there is one thing I miss about living in cincinnati its Graeters.  AMAZING.  Black Raspberry Chip is the best.  Peach in the summer is absolutely perfect.  Double Chocolte chip...mmmmm.

The good news if you dont' live close is they will deliver it to you for like $200
Eating ice cream and cookies here was the highlight of my trip to Cincy.

Great location from the hotel.   The toffee chocolate is out of this world.   It had huge chunks of chocolate with every spoon.  You must try this place if you are staying in the downtown area.   It is an eyeshot with a lot of restaurants.   Morton's is right across the street.  The fountain square is supposed to have free wifi but I haven't tried it.  I went here two days in a row so I am a fan.

For me, Graeter's ice cream is all about the chocolate chips. Big, melt in your mouth, creamy chunks of chocolate, hiding in the ice cream. It's that simple, really. No other ice cream has the same type of chocolate chips- they are always either too thin or too hard and not melty at all. The ice cream is good, and of course the history makes it all the better. Definitely a staple Cincinnati food.

My favorite location is definitely Clifton, but the Fountain Square location is well-placed and much closer to where I live. Maybe it's been a while since I've been to another Graeter's, so I could be crazy, but can't you usually see the array of flavors in their tubs? They don't have that at the downtown Graeter's! I know that the flavor names are self-descriptive, but for some reason I like to see it before I eat it. Anyway, this is not a real complaint. Now, go eat something with chocolate chips!

was told this ice cream place was the bomb (and a Cinn staple) so I had super high expectations. The chocolate chip black raspberry was supposedly the most popular so I tried it out. I didnt mind the long line since I was in Fountain Square and there was a crowded Reggiefest going on anyway, however while the icecream was ok I couldnt find a difference between it and ice cream at a place like ben and jerry's. I'd get it again, but given between a choice of graeter's icecream and frozen yogurt, I'd probably go for the frozen yogurt
The world's best ice cream. This is a "must stop" when you visit in Cincy. The staff are very nice and the prices are reasonable. They have a wide variety of flavors.  Great treat for your kids.

Mmmmm...Graeter's. The boyfriend and I visited Cincinnati a while back, and this was probably one of the more memorable parts of the trip. 

The ice cream was delicious. The cookies and cream was out of this world. Sooo flavorful! The black raspberry chip is probably the best ice cream I've ever had in my LIFE. 

I took off one star because it's so expensive, but I guess that comes with the territory if you're talking about excellent ice cream.

I have been and always will be an ice cream fanatic. I'm the kind of cold-confection fan that I will eat ice cream in the dead of winter, with gloves on, in the snow... and I will enjoy every second of it!

Having only lived in Cincinnati for a short time, I am surprised to say that I can put to rest every other great ice cream experience -- Graeter's surpasses them all.

I love the chips. They are not chips in the way that other ice cream shops define chocolate chips. When they make their ice cream, they pour melted chocolate on top of the churned deliciousness and churn it again, breaking the partially-hardened chocolate into pieces. Some pieces are small, some are big, and some are so huge that you need to bite it once or twice to eat it!

My personal favorite is the Toffee Chip, though you can't go wrong here regardless of what you choose.

This specific location is right in Fountain Square, which is fantastic for tourists or for anyone who has just eaten at one of the many downtown restaurants and need dessert. It's not a bad location, the staff is nice, but there are many other Graeter's shops that I enjoy more; to name one: Ludlow Ave in Clifton.

Wherever Graeter's is served, I'll enjoy it!

Graeter's ice cream is one of my favorite treats.  This location ls not my favorite as in service and seating area space but it is convenient when in downtown Cincinnati and is right off Fountain Square.  If you join their rewards program (no cost), you get a sweet treat reward of ice cream sundae for your birthday!

I was in town for work and my boss and I had just finished up lunch when he remembered that Graeter's was supposed to be one of the best ice creams and thought we should go grab some!! Well when he realized this we had to get going to catch our flight so we of course get to the airport and our flight is delayed....I walked over to the information desk and asked if they had a Graeter's in the airport, she said No but did tell us where the closest one was....

Sooo we took a cab about 10-15 mins away had him wait for us ran in I got the Mint Chocolate Chip and my Boss got the Raspberry Chocolate Chip. His was better than mine but thats ok. It really comes down to the Chips that they use in the ice cream that is what makes it soooo good other than that though the ice cream itself is just ok.

Now after all said and done our Ice Cream Adventure cost us (my boss) about $60 was it worth it?? I dont think so! We did however make the lady sitting at the Information Desk happy when we brought a pint back for her!!

Graeter's did not meet my expectations which were based on all the comments I heard from fellow conventioneers. Since Oprah's had highly recommended it I expected it to be out-of-this-world but it was just OK.

It's GREATER's, what else do I need to say? Love it, love that they are on the square and they are open LATE!

Also a great place to stop by for some breakfast pastries. Mmmmm cinnamon squares!

OH MY GOD.

I'm an ice cream-aholic.  I'll admit it.  I freaking LOVE ice cream - if you know me, you know my story.

Anyway, our friend took us here after dinner and I wished I hadn't ate dinner so I could have eaten more ice cream. The chocolate-coconut - almond chip will make you loose your damn mind.  So good.

In addition to the incredible ice creams they have all types of candy, cookies etc.

Do not even walk by this place if your trying to keep to a diet.

My girlfriend had her first experience at Graeter's last week (shocking I know!) but she is from out of town so cut her some slack! I took her to the one in Fountain Square and it certainly did not disappoint! The woman helping us was handing her samples faster than she could eat them!! 

She ended up with a pretzel cone and cookies and cream ice cream and I went with the raspberry choc chip and a sugar cone (my fav!!). Both were amazing as always! This is a great location and the perfect end to any meal!! It was a nice night so we enjoyed the fountain being lit and sitting outside! Some of the perks of summer!! This is one of the few "chains" I will actually openly admit to liking!!

One of the few perks for living in Cincy is Graeter's ice cream! The black raspberry chip and strawberry chip are my favorite. They don't skimp on the chocolate chips which are SOO huge and creamy. I kinda wish they had milk chocolate chips since I'm not a fan of dark chocolate, but its still SOO good. Since their ice cream is rich, 1 scoop in a waffle cone is really enough for a small person like me, but I always feel like getting 2 scoops. Sometimes I feel a little sick from eating too much ice cream afterwards but I can't help it!

Anybody living in Cincinnati knows Graeter's Ice Cream.  A chain unique to the tri-state area, it truly does have some of the best ice cream you are ever going to taste.  You can find Graeter's locations all over the city (I've been to many of them) so I'll endeavor to keep this review particular to this location.

Honestly, not overly impressed with this location.  The quality of the food is what you would expect from Graeter's.  The ice cream is great (although I personally prefer the milkshakes).  The portions are well worth the price that you pay.  And if you're just dropping in for a quick non-ice cream snack or soft drink, it has that too.

I'll also admit that it's a great location.  Right on Fountain Square in the middle of downtown, it's very convenient.  Many times I've been at the square during a large, city-wide event, and have noticed this location staying open past its normal closing time.

My only issue with this specific location is the customer service.  Every time I've been in, the staff makes it very clear that you're a number and they want you in and out as fast as possible.  Even on the occasions when I've been here and the place wasn't even crowded, the staff has never been very engaging with the customers.  The way the staff treats customers reminds of the lyrics from that Brad Paisley song...."To the guy at the ice cream shop, you're just another dip."  That's how you feel at this particular Graeter's location.

While most Graeter's stores are a nice experience, this is not one of them.  You can get ice cream (maybe not as good) at other places downtown.  And you can find a much better Graeter's location elsewhere in the city.

Mahalo, and avoid.

Came here with my boyfriend since we've been told it is so great. We had a preview of some of Graeter's chocolate at a friend's wedding the night before which I thought was OK.

I ordered a scoop of the mint chocolate chip with a sugar cone and my boyfriend ordered a scoop of the peanut chocolate chip with a waffle cone.

The ice cream was good and a good thing to try if in the Cincy area (I'm not a huge fan of sweets so I guess I'm not the best person to review ice cream).

GRAETER'S is the bomb. This location is perfect - right on Fountain Square. It's perfect for a summer evening - grab some ice cream and watch music or the entertainment on the square. Good job, Cincinnati!
Ice cream was good. The server was awesome. She helped us put together flavor combinations and was very patient. Ice cream didn't wow me but it was good.

This is hands down the best ice cream I have ever had. I got black raspberry chip on my roommate's recommendation, which was perfect. The flavor is awesome and the chocolate is soft enough to melt in your mouth, even frozen in the ice cream. It's a little pricey, but worth it for the quality. 

Minus-one star is because the say that they can pack quarts to travel and stay cold for up to 24 hours in dry ice, and that didn't really work the best. I was headed to my boyfriend's house, which was about 7 hours away, and I brought him ice cream that I had them pack up at the store, which definitely melted at least a little bit because when we ate it after sticking it in his freezer for a couple days it was kind of icey. Still really good (coconut this time) flavor though. I think the guy didn't want to charge me for more dry ice than I really needed, which I appreciate, but I would rather he have erred on the safe side and spent a couple more dollars. Not a huge deal, and I still definitely would recommend Graeter's, just make sure to ask them to pack it extra-carefully if you want to travel with it.
It's good and creamy. I was told it has a high fat content but a scoop once in a while won't hurt. I will come back and try their sundae next time.

I first discovered Graeters ice cream when I came to Ohio about 10 years ago with my aunt who grew up in Ohio and went to Ohio State.  Graeters is one of the great regional ice cream chains that I have come across in my travels.  They have delicious ice cream and the staff at each of the different locations I have been to has always been friendly.  They never rush me to order while I stand there overwhelmed by the options and are always great about letting me sample.

I came to this location while I was in town for a work trip and jumped at the chance to have Graeters again.  I don't remember what I ordered I just remember loving it and the giant chunks (not chips) of chocolate. Delicious and should not be missed on your trip to Ohio.

Ice cream is my favorite.  Better than any other dessert, I love ice cream.  With that being said, this place does ice cream right.  I mean come on, can any establishment survive since 1870 without doing it right?  It's like my beloved Guinness - history speaks for itself.

I only had one flavor here, but I was sold.  It was the Elena's blueberry pie.  Delicious.  Hands down one of the best ice creams I have ever had.
Great location next to fountain square.  I've had the toffee and peanut butter flavors, both are excellent.  The ice cream is good, stop by if your in the area and looking for a treat.
The cookies and cream rocks!  Black berry chip is good don't get me wrong is good. But yelpers think it the best thing ever. Definitely try it but its not for everyone.

I was in Cincinnati for a conference just for the weekend and I went to Graeter's twice! Kevin helped me both nights and was incredibly friendly, made some great dining recommendations, and didn't even laugh at the fact that I showed up there two nights in a row. 

The ice cream is fan-freakin'-tastic and beats the fro-yo craze that seems to have taken over in the town I'm from. I had the mocha chip ice cream on a sugar cone. I proudly ate it while I walked back to my hotel. I felt like I was carrying/eating a trophy.

Ice Cream

Black Raspberry Chip, it may be my favorite ice cream and flavor
Great ice-cream. This was my first time here. Loved the black raspberry ice-cream. The staff was quite friendly. A great way to end the evening with friends.

I am not originally from Cincinnati, so this isn't a "homer" review. With that out of the way, I have to say that I find Graeters ice cream to be exceptional. If I'm not mistaken, it is the only creamery in the US to use the French Pot method:
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gr…

You'll find people comparing Graeters to UDF ice cream. If you aren't familiar with UDF, you might not understand how silly these folks sound. Allow me to put this in perspective. You can get chicken at Bobby Flay's restaurants, and you can get chicken at Yum Brands' restaurants. Imagine sitting next to someone at Bar Americain and hearing a pair of rubes at the table next to you complain about how they've got the same chicken at KFC. Same thing here.

I'm not sure that this Cincinnati tradition needs another five star review, but I don't visit without stopping there at least once.  This last time, in fact, I had them pack six pints in dry ice to bring back via plane as checked baggage.  Worth it and delicious.  Blueberry pie and chocolate chocolate chip are high recommends though I know locals prefer the raspberry chocolate chip.

One of the best ideas we did was to stop in on a cold night at a Graeters for a hot chocolate. And of course my fiance and I couldnt resist getting some ice cream too so we got the Black Raspberry Chip...yep, it's a must if you go! We love this place and always make a trip to one whenever we're in town.

We read that Graeter's was the place to go for ice cream in Cincinnati.  We were in the Fountain Square area and decided to give it a try.  My daughter order a black raspberry phosphate as she was not in the mood for ice cream.  My husband had a cookies & cream ice cream cone and I ordered a chocolate malt.  The malt was good & creamy, however, you could barely tell it was a malt vs. a shake.  My husband enjoyed his ice cream cone.  

The place was busy as it was Memorial Day weekend so we were unsure who was making the phosphate.  When my daughter received her phosphate she asked the girl if it was a phosphate and she said yes.  The manager was in the middle of ringing our sale and walked away.  I waited several minutes and finally asked someone if they could ring us out.  Really?  I could have walked away and saved $11 as the cashier looked a little put out that I asked her to do this.  When we got to the table it was discovered that the phosphate did have ice cream in it. When my husband took it back the girl who had made it asked someone how to make one.  When he came back about 5 minutes later it still wasn't right.  There was carbonation & fruit but little to no syrup.  

If I ever go back to Cincinnati, I would give them another chance but for now I would recommend that they train their employees properly before a busy weekend that had the Taste of Cincinnati at their doorstep.  Train these kids and the manager in good customer service, it speaks volumes.

To make it simple, Graeter's is THE best ice cream ever.  I live in San Francisco, have only visited Cincinnati, didn't believe, couldn't believe when I was told I had to have it, but they were right.  So right that I just had 12 pints shipped out for my friend's birthday (who loves Graeter's more than life, or at least a really lot lot) in January.  yummy.  I still have  a bit left in my freezer...oh the joy and sadness of there not being more...

I recently visited Graeter's while visiting with my boyfriends family.  I had read about Graeter's on yelp and I was surprised by all the rave reviews.  So I went there with restrained hope.  I tried black raspberry chip as suggested by so many yelp reviewers and at first I was kind of... wondering what it is that I was expecting.  It's just ice cream after all.  But something magical happened.  As I kept eating my super scoop of ice cream somehow it just got better and better until it was fucking amazing.  And when I was finished I needed more.  The texture of this ice cream is incredible.  It's rich and light and fluffy and creamy and just about every other positive description you can come up with.  It's magical and surely they must include blood of the first born unicorn or something in it because the deliciousness of Graeter's is inexplicable.  I'd have to say that if you are going to try Graeter's you have to try a flavor with chocolate chips in it.   They are amazing.  They are rich and dark but not so much so and huge.  They aren't really chips but large chunks of delicious soft chocolate.  We sat there trying to figure out how it is that chocolate sitting in a freezer could not be frozen solid but rather delicious and chewy.  "But if it's in a freezer, why is it not frozen?"  Graeter's defies reason, logic and nature.  

I can vouch for the raspberry chip, mocha chip, and coconut chip, mixed, or as we called it, mochacoconutchip.  For two ice cream dishes it was roughly 6-7 dollars, which I felt was entirely worth it.  Every time I go to cold stone it ends up running me 15 dollars, and Graeter's is approximately 800 percent better than any other ice cream I've ever had, so they could charge me 800 percent more than any other ice cream and  it would be a reasonable asking price.

The best ice cream in Cincinnati. It is a must for anyone visiting the area to stop into one of their many locations. I enjoy the strawberry chip, but it's only available in the summer. However, they have other great seasonal flavors including pumpkin in the fall and peppermint in the winter or you can't lose with Black Raspberry Chip.

When I moved to the Cincinnati 'burbs many years ago, a coworker told me I had to try Graeter's. I naively said "it's just ice cream! How good could it be?" Oh, sweet heaven, how misguided I was! I haven't lived in Ohio for years, but how I miss the Black Raspberry Chip! I need to bite the bullet and order some online. My pal Gretchen did that for me once, and it was one of the best gifts I ever received.

Great view of Fountain Square. Went to get something warm after watching my nephew ice skate. The attendant was awesome. I ordered coffee. But then realized coffee makes me feel like taking a hairy dump so I asked her if I could trade for Earl Grey tea. She didn't charge me! In L.A. I would've gotten the bum's rush.

This is the most amazing Ice Cream that I've ever tasted!  It is truly something that needs to expand to more places because I can't find a cooler big enough and enough dry ice to take back to Chicago all the Graeter's I want!  It is the best ice cream ever!

Great selection of ice cream flavors. Two scoops for $4 is a great value for the size of the scoops. I loved the black cherry. And I don't normally like chocolate ice cream but the chocolate coconut was soooo good. They do well on more traditional flavors too - butter pecan was great.

The ice cream has so much cream in it it can be "chewy".  I LOVE it that way.  Their ice cream isn't overly sweet either.  You can really taste the chocolate in the chocolate.  And who hasn't found a HUGH chocolate chip in the middle of their scoop?  Definitely super premium ice cream, and priced like it, but well worth it.

What other ice cream place does so much business that they have a drive through?  People are lined up even in the winter.

If this is your first time, I recommend trying one of the "chip" ice creams in a waffle cone. Graeter's chips are actually finger-sized chunks of chocolatey goodness. Great treat on a hot day, a cold day, or any day for that matter

I just learned that Graeter's is being distributed in my hometown (Ann Arbor, MI). The black raspberry chip is stellar! I tried it for the first time after finishing the Flying Pig Marathon, which made it that much sweeter.

During my visit in "the Nati", and after a huge dinner at Montgomery Inn, I stopped for some raspberry chip ice cream here at Graeters. Mmmm it sure was delicious. If only I could have taken some home on the plane. It's good to hear that I could possibly order it online now.

Oh how I miss me some Graeters. Graeters is one of the greatest things to come out of the "nasti." It truly is the BEST ice cream I've ever had. The black raspberry chip is unlike any ice cream I've ever had on the west coast. A MUST HAVE for anyone visiting Cincinnati :)
O how I love Graeter's!  It's creamy, delicious, sweet, sweet goodness.  What else can I say???  If you're in Cincy, be sure to give it a try :)

After you've lived in Cincinnati for a while. you may start to get these weird cravings for french churned ice cream. That's because Graeter's is arguably among the best ice cream you will ever eat. We always take out of towners here because it is pretty amazing. Due to price and sheer fat content, it's a special occasion treat only!

I am Texan born and raised, and Blue Bell is still the best bought ice cream....but Graters is the best I have ever had in a store! Period! It makes me wonder who had the dream from God with the instructions on how to make it?
Good, but it isn't the best. If you've never had it, do yourself a favor and get the black raspberry chip. Outside of that, eh. Go to the algamesis brothers.

Yum!  Talk about a delicious cone.  Graeter's is some of the best ice cream out there.  Even a simple vanilla cone is heavenly.  Go to a Graeter's ice cream shop while you are in Cincy.  You won't be disappointed.

best ice cream I've EVER HAD. Love the Turtle flavor. The chocolate chunks in the ice cream are soft and melt in your mouth. The butterscotch they make in the store --- sooooo mouth watering. I definitely miss this place.

I've never actually been to a Graeter's in my life (didn't find out about it until I moved away from Cincinnati to the west coast).  However, I have ordered a few pints via their website.  Yes it's a bit pricey ($50 for 6 pints or $80 for 12 pints), but man, is it worth every penny!  The chocolate chips are incredible.  I need to plan a trip to Cincy just to visit one of these ice cream shops in person.  Never had any ice cream better than Graeter's.

Graeter's ice cream is by far so much better than Cold Stones or any other ice cream out there. They don't have as much flavors as other places but the taste and quality of their ice cream is superb. This particular location is really cute - it's right smack in the middle of Fountain Square. They also have baked goods and chocolate that you can buy aside from ice cream. You must check this place out if you're visiting Cincinnati like I was.
Graeter's just might be the most overrated establishment in Cincinnati. The ice cream is ok, but UDF is like half the price.

This was my first experience with Graeters. I was staying at the Westin and came out to Fountain Square for a long phone call with my parents. There was a line of 30ppl the ENTIRE time I was on the phone. I couldn't understand why someone would wait half an hour for an ice cream cone, so I naturally stood in line for half an hour to find out after my phone call. It was delicious! The service here isn't as good as the one in Hyde Park, but there's always such a big crowd of people trying to get in and out. I'll safely say that when I'm at Fountain Square again I'll stop by.

MMMMMMmmmmmmmmm! Cherry chip, Black Raspberry Chip, Cookie Dough Chip.... I could go on FOREVER. Delectably creamy and dense ice cream. The chips are huge and delicious. I had my first chocolate soda at Graeter's. Amazing.

Let me start by saying that this place does indeed have fine ice cream.  The rest of this review (and my rating, which is mostly to lower the average which I think is way too high) may sound more negative than they should since it has fine stuff.

I tried three flavors: Black Raspberry Chip, Cookies and Cream, and some caramel thing I don't remember the name of.  First off, the ice cream was nice and creamy, if a bit to a lot too sweet in all three.  The black raspberry chip is NOT all it's cracked up to be on yelp.  It's fine, but it didn't really have an especially strong fruity flavor and the chocolate pieces were too big to be called chips (they're more of "chunks") and verge on too big to be easily edible, especially in a cone.  The cookies and cream was essentially standard, with a good amount of oreos to keep it chocolaty but still let you taste the cream base.  The caramel one was just ok, although my parents liked it.

This place certainly is no better than main stream ice cream places like Ben and Jerry's and Hagen Daz, and I actually prefer both of those.  It is, however, cheaper than they are.  The only other local ice cream I tried in Cincinatti was Putz's Creamy Whip, which seemed about comprable in terms of flavor, being too sweet, and reasonable pricing (Putz's is soft serve, but close enough).

If you want the local tradition, this place fits the bill, if you are looking for a decent price, same thing, if you are expecting "the best ice cream ever", you're going to be disappointed.

My parents started a tradition of taking me here for a Nectar Soda everytime I got an A on my grade school report card. The year they started doing that I went from C's and D's in 3rd grade to straight A's in 4th grade. Now I'm in medical school. THANKS FOR THE MOTIVATION GRAETER'S!!!

It was a freezing day in Cincinnati but I spotted Graeter's and count me in!!!  I was visiting from out of town but Graeter's has the reputation of the very best.  The raspberry chocolate chip but it can be described as chunk as opposed to chip.  Have a candy bar with your ice cream!  OKAY!!!!  I am somewhat thankful that I don't live in OH only because of my addictive personality to great food, drink and Graeter's ice cream.

I second that endorsement. As another Cincinnati transplant in SF, I agree that Graeters is the best thing about Cincinnati. Truly the best ice cream in the world - super creamy and smooth with huge dark chocolate chips. I'm a fan of the chocolate chip, mocha chip and toffee chip. If you don't live in Cincinnati, they'll ship it to you. It tides me over in between visits home :)

sampled the black raspberry chip (their signature flavor) and double chocolate chip, while both were tasty, the double chocolate chip won me over.  creamy ice cream and decadent chocolate chips.  good stuff.

Fountain Square location.  Extremely crowded.  Have stopped by the store four times in the past 10 days, all between 8-9pm.  Waiting lines have been out the door.  Still waiting to buy something since I am not will to stand in line for an extended period in order to have ice cream or a donut.

i am an ice cream fanatic, and when i'm jonesing for some good ice cream, this is where i go.

i go for small-batch, gelato, etc. frozen treats wherever i travel and graeter's is absolutely top notch.

it's not a funky flavor ice cream (there are some brands that get traffic purely because they have odd flavor combos), nope, graeter's is the real thing.

each graeter's shop has its own personality, and in the summertime, you'll find neighborhood people hanging outside, licking cones next to waiting babies in strollers and dogs on leashes.

clifton @ ludlow avenue: my favorite graeter's. in the university-near neighborhood, a 1/2 block from the esquire movie theater.

hyde park square: yes, hyde parkers are the kind of people who make sure to put on their ralph lauren "polo" shirts before heading out to walk the dog, but hyde park square has plenty of window shopping options (and more parking than clifton) for licking and strolling.

kenwood: this is a non-walking graeter's. you must bring your car and there's not much outside room. nonetheless, it's a close-by option if you're eating out in kenwood.

This is the textbook definition of your friendly neighborhood grocer. The selection is terrific, the produce is always fresh, and the staff is incredibly friendly. They have a great selection of raw nuts, seeds, and grains and if they don't have something you're looking for, you can ask and they can order it for when you're back. That is going above and beyond great customer service. I only wish I lived in Cincinnati longer and could support this wonderful place more.

Madison's is a place I've purchased produce from and for the longest didn't even know it. The store is so tiny and up until a few a months ago, I'd never actually made it inside, I always bought from the little tent they set up outside on the weekends. 

This might be one of my favorite places to buy produce. It's not always the prettiest but it is the tastiest and they have very fair pricing. I have managed to score a delicious watermelon here and they are always happy to cut it for me since I know I can never consume a whole one. The staff is so nice and helpful. 

Haven't had much else outside of produce from this store but the other reviews have definitely got this store on my radar for other needs!
the best produce in Cincinnati. you pay for the quality and serves. they also have the best mushroom selection in Cincinnati.

I've been to Findlay Market many a times and didn't know this place existed until my husband had to make a vegetable run one Sunday morning.  He wanted me to come see for my self how awesome this grocery store is.  
We went Sunday afternoon and it's located next near Pho Lang Tang (a couple of buildings down).  
It was quite busy and I thought alot of their produce would be sold out since we came late in the afternoon.  We got lucky. 
Here is what we scored for only $14.75!!!  
-9 apples for $6.00
-Bag of organic carrots for $2.99
-5 cucumbers at @$.75= $3.75
-2 bunches of celery for $2.00

All vegetables organic/no pesticides.  That is a deal!!! 
Staff is very friendly and very efficient checking you out at the register.  
Besides produce, they sell what any small convenient store carries- necessities like pasta, bread, olive oils, condiments, etc.  
Clean and well organized.  
I love this little store!!

Teeny tiny little mom and pop shop located at Findlay Market. Growing up my neighbors were farmers and I remember pickin' beans and snapping them with my neighbor on her front porch when I was probably about four years old. That is what this place reminds me of. Super local, farm fresh produce picked right out of the ground. 

Although, their groceries are the bomb, my favorite thing here has to be the Pink Grapefruit Sorbet from Madisono's. Holy mother of gawwwd! WOW! If you love that tart rich ripe flavor this is superb! Nada uses it to make margaritas, and I totally stole the idea. Get a pint of this stuff add some agave nectar, lime juice, tequila pour it in a salted/sugar rimmed glass and your friends with call you martha effing stuart. Trust.

Madison's is ALWAYS our first stop at Findlay Market! They cater to local farmers, which I love! As the seasons change, so does their local produce. They carry anything from pies, meats, jellies, herbs and it's all from local businesses also. And the staff is super friendly. Mr. Madison and Michael know our family well now, after shopping there over the last few years. The first thing they do is ask how our 4 girls are doing. Then they usually tell them to grab a juice or milk as a prize for being good helpers. You can't get that at a giant store! Madison's is definitely a hidden gem that will continue to receive my support for years to come. I highly recommend a visit. I love this shop!

Madison's is legit. If you live in the neighborhood, this is your best (and possibly only?) source of organic produce and pastured animal products. 

PROS:
-Organic produce (and non-organic)
-Pantry items (some organic as well)
-Pastured meats (limited, some frozen)
-Wonderful service (often the owner himself serves us)
-Wmall family owned and run

CONS:
I'm going to list things that some people would think of as cons, not all of them are truly negative.
-Tight quarters. I don't dislike this. They're making good use of the space and really carry more than you'd realize so it's worth asking if they have what you're looking for- chances are they do or can tell you who does at Findlay.
-Not a mega store (again, this isn't a bad thing, but I want expectations to be clear). You won't find each and every thing that you'll ever need here. But again, there is more than you think, so be sure and ask if you can't find something or just don't have a lot of time to search.

Last of all, I would highly recommend shopping here during the week when the rest of Findlay is moving along at a steady hum and not crowded like the weekends. If you want to get the perks of the weekend without the crowd, come on FRIDAY when everything is fully stocked for the weekend. Parking lot is free for the first hour M-F and that's always worked perfect for me!

My favorite grocer at Findlay market.  A lot of great, fresh products.  They carry a lot of products from the farmers' market vendors such as milk and meat:  I'll get those here if I can't make it to the market on Saturday.  Super friendly staff.

Went to Madison's today to pickup produce for a dinner party I am hosting on Saturday and it was just great, a few things were almost out of stock, but not items I needed.  Almost all the produce is from local farms which is great.  The older gentleman behind the counter is the owner and is so nice chatting about different things. 
  A must shop while at Findaly Market for your produce.

I routinely shop at Madison's to see what is fresh, local, and in season. They seem to stick to those criteria when selecting their fruit and vegetables, so in my effort to seek this out, they certainly make it easier for me. The local (like down the street in Findlay gardens) as well as more traveled items, are usually labeled. As I am not 100% committed to eating only local, I recognize the need to bring some things in. That said, I can't recall a time when I bought something that came to me any further than Mexico (usually my avocados), which is unique in a grocery store. 

Though I would definitely categorize this as a grocery store in its variety of food (fresh fruit, veg, packaged goods, sauces, stocks, dairy, cheese, eggs, etc.) sold, it doesn't have any of the overwhelming feeling of a "normal" store. An accurate description might be the EDGE of the grocery store, which is where I shop anyhow, so it works for me. Additionally, I trust that the products they carry are tried and true since they don't have room to stock many brands of one item.I also know that they are receptive to customer feedback and suggestions, which is nice to see when you need something that can be harder to find. Overall, the space is charming to me, but can get crowded. 

The owners and people who work at Madison's are, perhaps, the best part of the experience (which is hard to admit when fresh food is so important to me). Mr. and Mrs. Madison are about as adorable and helpful as they come. Though I certainly don't know them personally, they have never been anything but kind, entertaining, and friendly. If they were my grandparents, I assume I'd be pretty satisfied. The other folks working in the store, as well, are always available to answer questions (off the wall and otherwise) and point me in the right direction (for a small store, I am sometimes confounded by where I would find 'x'). 

The items I really like at Madison's include: gelato, MadPops, seasonal fresh fruits, stocks, Snowville Creamery milk/creamer, and Grateful Grahams. 

One last kudos to Madison's in their endeavor to sell fresh foods, which was pointed out to me, is that they are the only fruit/veg stand at Findlay that is also air conditioned. I had made a comment to the staff about previous experiences "shopping around" at the various stands, but seeming to come back to them because they had the least spoilage. They pointed out that this is likely an important difference in my experience; I'm sold. If something does go bad, as well, they are happy to replace it for you. Good customer service!

The entire experience at Madison's can be quick and easy- in and out- or you can take your time, browsing, chatting, and comparing notes. It's a bit of what I'd imagine "stores used to be like", and I'm happy to be a routine customer.

This is one place I visit nearly weekly (especially March-October).  They are dedicated to their customers and I feel like I'm always surprised/impressed by the variety of items offered in this small space.  Some of the highlights of my experiences:

-Location labeling/Local spending.  Most all of the produce is labeled with its origin which helps me feel better.  Sometimes, you just need an avocado, and while it may not have been grown local, at least I can feel good about my money staying local.

-Small (and large) quantities available.  It is here you can buy a single stalk of celery.  I LOVE this.  Sometimes, you just need a carrot or stalk of celery for a recipe and this is the place to get it (for fifteen cents).  I can seriously find almost any produce that I need here-though I haven't tried it, this also seems like a place that would order a large quantity for you if you had a need.  And you can always ask if you don't find what you need and Mr. Madison will let you know either where it is or why they don't have it.

-Dry goods.  Easily missed, behind the counter and back wall, they have a fairly expansive stock of dry grains, nuts, the like (even vanilla beans at Christmas).  The staff are happy to help you with whatever it may be-a quarter cup of quinoa or 4 pounds of oats.  This makes it super easy to try new things, or again, source a recipe.

-Staff/Proprietors.  The staff are always super helpful and attentive.  This place can get busy and crowded, and it could get easy to get frustrated as a staff person in that environment.  But, it my experience, they do what they can to help everyone quickly and direct new comers of the order of the line, or spend time getting your list of 43 bulk dry goods.

The only point that might annoy newcomers is that this place is a bit small, and on a Saturday morning (especially in winter) it can get crowded.  (PS the line starts in the back-see the sign hanging from the ceiling.) But, here's a tip-I've never tried it, but I do certainly have a bookmark from them that advertises that you can call in your order ahead of time during the week.  Some day, I imagine I might be organized enough to do this.  Also, during most of the summer, they have a tent outside with the larger quantities of seasonal produce which alleviates the crowd.

I actually worked here for a summer a few years ago, and can tell you from an unbiased, insider's perspective that this is some of the best produce you're going to get in the city. Bryan and Carolyn, while being a couple of the sweetest people ever, really value fresh, local, and organic produce. They make sure to stock up on fruits and veggies that are in season, so you're getting the best tasting and freshest product possible. They also make a point to support local growers and farms, and always have new and interesting products from local companies in store. I miss working here all the time, and wish I had a small market like Madison's to go to in LA. Make sure to pick up some gelato and check out the selection of fresh mushrooms as well!

Madisono's, Cincinnati's First Gelato Company, 110 West Elder Street, Cincinnati, Ohio

This is a review of their gelato only. Their gelato, unfortunately doesn't taste anything, and I stress the word "anything", like the authentic gelato from Italy. Their gelato tastes like normal ice cream. I couldn't tell the difference between ice cream and their gelato. It still tastes good though, which is why it earned 2 stars from me, but this is not gelato. Gelato has a creamier, more intense, dense flavor and is less airy. The intensity of the flavor comes from the fact of this lack of air vs. ice cream, which has a lot of air making it light and fluffy. 

The taste is great, but because it is not gelato, Madisono's Gelato only gets 2 stars from me.

Madison's has a bizarre assortment of specialties: gourmet cheeses, fresh mushrooms, gelato, organic milk and meat, local fruits/veggies.  I'm glad they've never tried to blend those.  As such, their store in Findlay Market could reasonably sustain you, though I prefer more variety than they offer.  Fortunately there are plenty of other vendors to fulfill my needs for cured meats and a panoply of vegetables.

Because it's a small volume stand, some of the produce can get a little old.  This is bad if you don't notice it but good when they do notice it; you can usually find some sort of special price for, say, browning bananas.  They do a nice job of getting seasonal specialties (meyer lemons, black truffles, rhubarb), so the selection is continually changing.

But let's be honest; the gelato freezer is the treasure here.  With magnificent flavors like lemon basil or lilikoi (a combination of passion fruit and coconut that sends me into delirium), Madison's iced treats should be your sweet lover this summer.  I recommend one of each, but here are a few specific suggestions:
For the breakup, the dark chocolate orange.
For after yard work, the pink grapefruit.
For casual snacking, the black cherry.
For elegance, the hazelnut.
I could go on.  For every time there is a proper gelato at Madison's.

Madison's is one of my favorite vendors in Findlay market. The great selection of fresh local produce is always priced right. The staff is friendly and very helpful and the misc. items are, a lot of times, just what you are looking for.

Not sure about Madison's just take a look in back at all the root vegetables and you will change your mind. 

I recommend Madison's as your first stop to find the produce you are looking for!

The first time I went into Madison's, it was a hot summer day and all that was left on my list was sundry fruits and vegetables.  Madison's is air conditioned; I chose then to purchase my fruits and vegetables inside.  I'm glad I did, because the store is packed full of way more than just air conditioning and broccoli.  

The second time I went into Madison's, it was because I needed tofu.  I wasn't sure where I'd be able to get it at the Market, but I had a feeling I'd be able to find it here.  I'm glad I had that feeling, because the store also carries seemingly random things like tofu.

This is pretty much the only place downtown to find a lot of the things you'll find here. I guess you could say that makes it....unique.  I like how they label where different things are from, what other store does that?

Local apples filled several shelves on my trip today, including Honeycrisp apples the size of a softball. I also purchased some local fresh milk for the same price as the non-local organic at kroger. Sweet!

Also, you'll find deals on produce you won't find anywhere else. Avocados for $1/each? Get out of town!

Some packaged goods are a little more expensive than at a big chain, but that's pretty much to be expected. 

There are bins of grains and nuts and such that you can buy by the pound.

They also have a special deal where on Wednesday and Fridays (there might be another day, too) if you spend $15 you get a free carton of eggs (or $1.50 off your order).  Also the people that work there are friendly. 

The gelato will rock your world. Try it. I dare you.

Looking for some additional food products that the other vendors at Findlay Market don't carry? It's probably at Madison's. This store has all of the staples like pasta, ketchup, tortilla chips, milk, OJ, and coffee beans that you won't find in the various produce, meat, bread, and restaurant stands at Findlay Market. A real bonus here is that they've also got a pretty good selection of fresh produce, fresh herbs, and mushrooms. If you go back by the registers there's also bulk beans and seeds as well as rice and coffee.

The store can get pretty hectic on the weekend, so if it looks like they're out of something, ask someone that works there. The staff is extremely friendly and they'll be happy to check to see if they've got something in the back.

Be sure to grab a basket from the floor by the front door on your way in. It's helpful when trying to navigate such a small space to not have both hands full.
The go to place for vegs in Findlay Market. Always Fresh and local if possible.  be sure to stop by during the week for the spend $15 get free Eggs special.

For the past year and a half, my husband and I have done almost all of our grocery shopping at Findlay Market. Madison's is often a necessary stop for us to pick up some grocery staples like milk and flour. They also carry a great deal of produce, both local and imported (for the things you can't find locally sourced.) I've always had good experience with the freshness of the produce and their groceries are competitively priced. Recently I bought some pecans for Thanksgiving and there was no comparison between these nuts and those from any big grocery store. It was totally worth the extra cost!

We go here almost weekly as our regular grocery stop.  If they don't carry it, ask them about it and they will most likely bring it in for you.  Great produce, super friendly staff, and a great location... you can't beat it.  The only downside that I could see is that it is a small store so you're constantly bumping into people if you shop on the weekends.  Also, there aren't any carts; you must use a basket or your own bags to corall your selections.  I don't have a problem with this but if you have any health issues or are confined to a wheelchair, this is a tough place to get to regularly.

We go to Madison's at least every couple of weeks, and the main reason is Snowville milk. I won't make this entire review about the milk, though if I did it would be full of flowery prose and possibly song. But I give Madison's mad props for carrying it. While I'm in there, I will frequently pick up other things, like fresh produce or feta cheese or what have you. I will say, because of its size (and the fact that Americans are now used to shopping in supermarkets, which have huge lanes for the huge carts and huge parking lots for your huge SUVs...sorry, I digress). But it's a small shop, and if you can possibly help it, don't go on a weekend when it's packed, because it IS difficult to get around in there, especially when loaded down with grocery bags. But they try to keep things local, which I love--and honestly, I love the idea of the small shop.
Pro tip: if you shop during the week and buy over a certain amount (like $15), you get a small discount!

It is a family owned business and it shows. The owner or his son Mike are there most of the days. Mike has a fund knowledge of seasonal local produce. He has a good relationship with vendors and keeps the store stock. For being such a small place the place is packed with most of the essentials a foodie needs.I had the pleasure of attending a potluck at their place and it was one of the most eclectic events that I have ever been in Cinci. Nice people sharing homemade food!

This location is super close to me and I love that it doesn't have a drive thru (as that'd be bad for my waist line). Every time I visit this location, the staff are super friendly. Every one has a smile on their face - even the customers!

When I visit, I typically always order a chocolate shake and it tastes delicious every time.

This is such a feel good place and feel good location! I will keep visiting!

Since I'm from Finneytown and love Graeters more than life itself, I only have been here hundreds of times.  The thing that makes this place 5 stars besides the ice cream is one of the best ice cream scoopers of all time, Kyle G!  He is the true MVP that had my husband and I drive from Clifton or Norwood to eat Graters specifically here.  He remembers my order exactly how I like it without saying a word (and he knows all of his regulars like that).  He provides the best customer service and makes us laugh every time we visit (used to be every Sunday before we moved to Texas).  But he's also the reason Graeters is our first stop when we land while we visit Cincinnati now! 

Thanks for always making my husband, Kyle C. the best milkshakes.  And thanks for always making my kiddie dark chocolate brownie sundae with the perfect whipped cream to chocolate jimmies to cherries ratio!

We will be back later this month and can't wait to visit this location!

This particular location has a lot of plus sides. Not only do they have free parking, but the inside of the store itself is designed for people to sit and eat their ice cream. There are a lot of take away Graeter's locations where limited to no seating is available. The largeness of this venue also lends itself to an expanded menu of bakery items such as breads and cakes, ample candies, and a freezer near the front for take home ice creams and cakes. 

All of this, plus the customer service is some of the best I have seen. My husband and I have been to this store dozens of times and each time we are greeted upon entry and the staff is not only friendly but knowledgeable. They take pride in the store and it really shows. Definitely worth a trip.

Plus, Black Raspberry Chip is always on the menu. Like....always.

Man o Man...the fudgy goodness of how the chocoltate chips melt in your mouth in the black raspberry is incredible. Honestly, I haven't had a Graeters flavor that I didn't like! I ususally wouldn't go to a chain, especially for ice cream but since this is regional I don't count it. lol. Just go here, it's certainly worth it! 

Let's not forget to mention, the customre service here was outstanding!

I grew up going to this ice cream shop, and it hasn't ever changed. I love it so much! This shop is never super crowded so plenty of space for everyone. Which is great because my whole extended family goes after church as it's right around the corner. I get toffee chip in a dipped waffle cone. The huge chunks of chocolate are always my favorite part of the ice cream. This shop is a classic that hopefully never dies!

Hello All,

Graeter's in Finneytown, Ohio is the best!!!!

The staff is always very friendly, fast, and organized!!!!

Specifically; Mollie, Kim, Rhys, Lloyd, and Samariah were great!!!!

Many thanks again,

Neil R. Sehgal
I probably get Black Raspberry Chip ice cream three times a week. They now know me when I come in. I feel zero shame.

The ice cream is amazing, however we had the rudest staff. I fully admit we came in 10 min before closing which isn't fun I'm sure but we tried to eat quickly and. It leave a mess. We left the dining room 15 min after closing so yes, frustrating I'm sure but we are still customers. First the manager loudly announces to us I'm locking the door so when you want to leave I will have to unlock it for you and she was obviously unhappy. When we left at 11:15 another employee tossed up his hands and said in a loud angry voice that he needed to unlock it for us. Then he proceeded to tell us "for future reference you shouldn't come in after 10:50 again." We were all stunned. I replied or never again to which he responded he was just kidding. Clearly he was not. Customer service seems to be a thing of the past here. They cleaned and broke down stuff while we ate our cones. It didn't bother us one bit. Our presence didn't prevent them from continuing their work but after spending $30 on ice cream they certainly made us feel unwelcome at this establishment in the future.

I'm from Cincinnati. Naturally I'm a big fan of Graeters. 

I recently returned to Cincinnati with my sister. We had to stop by for pastries and some of the new bourbon pecan chocolate chip. 

We ordered a lot and the service was top notch. The guy was helpful and took all the time with us we needed.

I'm from Finneytown. The Graeters on Winton is our go-to store. This store fully represents all that is good about Graeters. 

Living in California, I miss it. Please, at least send the amazing ice cream to the West coast.

One of Cincinnati's best Ice Cream spots.  Black Raspberry Chip is a winner.  Check out Strawberry Chip if in season.

Friendly staff at this location.  Never too busy.  Weird parking lot.

I cannot emphasize enough how great Kyle was at this particular location. I visited Graeter's with my mom, who is not from Cincinnati, to give her a taste of our local flavors.  Kyle helped us with baked goods and ice cream.  He let my mom taste several different flavors, a tea cake and some sorbet. Kyle then proceeded to create the most amazing banana split we've ever seen. He was patient, kind and attentive.  Kudos to this outstanding staff person. He's a gem.  And because of him we'll be back real soon.  I hope Graeter's appreciates him as much as we do. Thanks Kyle!

I like this Graeter's a lot. I like all Graeter's, but this is my usual. The ice cream is amazing, and the service is friendly and fast. It's pretty cheap too. I'd recommend this place anytime it's warm and you're with friends/family.

Norris Schloffen (not real name) is a representation of everything wrong with the ice cream industry. This employee, although young and hip, is a disgrace not only to this establishment, but also to himself. I mean honestly, how hard can it be to make a brownie sundae. Get out the bowl, slap a brownie in that bad boi, warm it up with a microwave, which has got to be the easiest to use heating device apart from setting things on the ground on a sunny day, drop some vaniller iced cream in that mothertrucker, drizzle those tasty toppings across that now melting vaniller iced cream, and shimmy it across that lil countertop to the eager customer. If he would have completed these tasks, I would have left him a tip. Mr. Schloffen is two bucks poorer cuz of this display of poor sundae assembly skills. Lemme tell ya what happened in this poor excuse for an ice cream parlor so you can get behind the boycott I am calling for. I order the brownie sundae, and as I wait (more than 40 seconds) he proceeds to NOT WARM UP THE BROWNIE. Now what the heck is that. Seriously, how am I expected to eat this brownie sundae with a flimsy plastic spoon when the brownie part is so hard I could use it to carve my name into a tree in a national forest. I proceeded to dig into the Sundae after it arrived to me, even though the preparation lacked precision, and displayed an utter lack of attention to detail. I pressed the plastic spoon into the broad side of this "sundae" and was greeted with a resistance like no other. I pushed and poked from every angle imaginable, watching as the plastic stretched, deforming my poor spoon. After a long struggle with this small cylindrical brownie, the spoon broke. A plastic spoon breaking trying to eat a sundae from Greater's. Utterly absurd. Anyways, I proceeded to disassemble the brownie with the knife in my multi-tool (courtesy of the Swiss army). After I had sufficiently saturated my knife with the secret sauce that is Greater's vaniller iced cream, I reluctantly shoved the device back into my pocket, prepared for an uncomfortable and sticky removal later on. I went up, asked a different employee (not Mr. Schloffen) for a spoon. They gave it too me. I thanked them. Sat down and finished that wretched bowl of "worm ridden filth" (courtesy of my brothers recommendation to quote Star Wars). Anyways back to the story, it sucked, Norris can't serve iced creme worth a rats pajamas, and if you ever pay a visit, do not get anything to dessert on, it will only serve to disappoint you.

While house hunting before we made the move to Cincinnati a few months ago, one of the housing representatives recommended that we try LaRosa's and Graeter's.  We made it to LaRosa's during that visit, but we weren't able to visit Graeter's until we'd already completed the move. Luckily, there is one a short drive away that we've been to a few times already. We were told that we had to try the Black Raspberry Chip, and we finally did just that last week.  Good stuff!  The raspberry flavor is refreshing, and the chocolate chunks are yummy, not hard chunks of chocolate like you too often find in ice cream like this.  

This location is clean and inviting with an enticing display of pastries.  The manager is friendly and personable and I have enjoyed every visit here.
Solid raspberry chocolate ice cream.  This Graeter's never fails and the staff is SUPER sweet!  Get it? Ice cream?
They are slow motion in reverse in here. Counter is nasty dirty looking. Im getting a chocolate soda. Cant wait

I love Graeters, and the Finneytown location is really just one of the best.

I went with a small-ish group from work one afternoon and we sat in the dining area.  They have a rather ample dining area here, but I wouldn't really recommend it for larger groups.  It fit us nicely though.

They always have samples of their sweets out, and this time it was chess pie.  I don't particularly like chess pie, but from what I hear, it was delish.  I ordered a scoop of chocolate ice cream and Dick, the clerk and store manager, asked me if I'd like to try it in a pretzel cone.  Yes, and ice cream cone made out of pretzel!  Excellent recommendation.  Chocolate ice cream is pretzel's new best friend.

If that wasn't enough, Dick came over to our table with a tray of some of their homemade chocolates and offered us all a sample.  With service like this, we might have to make afternoon trips to Graeter's a regular thing!

Good ice cream.  Good baked goods.  Friendly staff.  Never been disappointed.

Cheese Crowns are my favorite pastry there.  
All of their locations are always fun and delicious.

Not sure if this is the right location of Graeter's that I visited, but I don't think it matters because I am sure all of them are equally as awesome.

Bottom line, Graeter's serves up some of the richest, creamiest ice cream around. So if you are not a fan of rich and creamy, stay away. 

The BF is Cincinnati-born and bred, and he has been raving about Graeter's for years. I got to sample a bit when he brought back some pints for me to try, but nothing beats freshly scooped Graeter's in a sugar cone.

I was in Cincy for just a weekend and visited Graeter's twice in two days. The first time, I ordered a scoop of black cherry on a cone. The girl working there told me that they were introducing black cherry chip this month, and would I like to try that instead? OK! I guess they introduce temporary new flavors each month? 

The "chips" in the ice cream are really more like "nuggets." They include a generous amount of chocolate in the chip flavors, and in big pieces, too. The black cherry chip flavor was divine. It was chock-full of juicy black cherries and chunks of chocolate. MMMM!

My second visit, I got Elena's Blueberry Pie. Each Blueberry Pie sale benefits The Cure Starts Now Foundation. I've had Mayfield's blueberry pie ice cream, and it doesn't even compare. Graeter's version has fresh WHOLE blueberries and what appears to be sugar cookie pieces, though the website says they are pie crust pieces. 

Oh, I was also shocked at the low prices in the store. For example, a single scoop will cost you $2.75. That is significantly cheaper than ice cream places in Atlanta (*ahem* Paolo's with your $5 scoops and Kilwin's!) The BF said their prices have remained the same for years.

They sell cookies, candies and even bread in the store. I am not entirely sure if they have cake; I can't quite remember. On top of the ice cream selections, they have sundaes and milkshakes. 

I also sampled vanilla, mint chocolate chip, cookies & cream and mocha chocolate chip. I believe you might find pints of Graeter's at Kroger locations. All of them were incredibly good. I just wish they weren't so high in calories and fat! Half a cup is a whopping 300 calories. :(

We went in yesterday for a evening cone and shake. Immediately when we walked in we were greeted with pout faces and grins. Only one of the employees spoke. So we stood there waiting for someone to ask us our order after 5 minutes of staring at the employees I finally placed an order for a shake. I have never seen it take 10 minutes to make a shake, but I patiently waited. After the shake was done I was ready to place another order but the employee decided that he had better things to do and started off on another adventure. So after waiting another 3minutes he never came back. So we left the shake on the counter and drove over to the colerain location. Now that place deserves 5stars.
Cincinnati's finest ice cream! My favorite is the black raspberry chip 1870. Always clean store, plenty of parking and wonderful staff and service.  Any travel home has to include a stop at Graeters!

If you are for some reason forced to live, or travel through, the state of Ohio, please make sure you try Graeter's. It will 100% make up for any suffering you've had to endure during your stay (however long that might be).
