Since i've already embarrassed myself by creating the tagline "apparently i'm a fan of sugar and lard", I will take it one step further and admit that if I could, I would eat nothing but Graeter's Ice cream and pastries for the rest of my life (Although if I did this, it would be a short life as I would most likely die prematurely from a massive heart-attack)

Let me end this with saying that Graeter's, with it's massive chocolate-y chips and creamy goodness, is the best ice cream you will ever ever EVER eat in your life. It's a little on the pricey side for ice cream, but OH SO worth it. If I had enough money to have it regularly shipped out to California (do they do this?!?!?) I would in a second. Do not delay any longer, put "Road trip to eat Grater's Ice Cream" on your top ten things to do before you die list.

My top three recommendations (In order):

Raspberry Chip
Peanut Butter Chip
Mint Chip

Graeter's is delicious and worthy of a much better review, I'm doing this review, however, not on the ice cream, however, but of this location. Located in a strip mall I was first confused because the sign bore no resemblance to the Graeter's logo. When I pulled in though I saw the familiar scripted emblem proclaiming its 1870 origin. The shop was small, the staff was friendly, but the scoop sizes were much smaller than other Graeter's locations I've been to. Of course the ice cream is great, but hit up another location. My go to is Kenwood.

There really isn't much to add to the other reviews, other than this is simply the best ice cream ever created.  I enjoy the search to find an equal, but no close contenders yet.

As for favorite flavors, the Moore's go with Mint Chocolate Chip (I like to add a bit of hot fudge as well), Black Raspberry Chip, well, about any berry chip (Cherry, etc).

If you are going to have ice cream, go with the real stuff, and this is it.  Hit the gym later if you are feeling guity.

Graeter's is a must for anyone visiting Cincinnati. Sarah Jessica Parker once named Graeter's as her favorite ice cream, and nearly all Cincinnatians would agree with her expert celebrity opinion. 

If you even remotely like ice cream, you owe it to yourself to try Graeter's fantastic (still!) hand-churned ice cream, with giant chunks of semi-sweet chocolate and some of the best flavor combinations I've ever tasted. The Buckeye Blitz is my all-time favorite, basically tasting like a buckeye candy in ice cream form. Combine that with a Snyder's pretzel cone and I can't imagine a sweet tooth that wouldn't be satisfied. Seasonal flavors are offered all year round; the pumpkin ice cream is always a hit around town.

Graeter's is also host to an assortment of confections and baked goods if you're in need of either, but the main attraction here is no doubt the ice cream.

When and if you get into heaven, a cone or dish of Graeter's ice cream will be waiting.  Since it's heaven, you'll get to gorge on every flavor without agonizing over which one to select.  This gives me something to look forward to when I die, that is if heaven's out there and if God exists and decides I was a good boy in this life.  I'm not gonna hedge my bets if it means I get eternal scoops of caramel...peach...macaroon...etc etc etc... with no extra charge for a waffle cone.

Graeter's bakery is a'ight but will probably remain on earth in most people's minds.  One thing I gotta say though, it was a sweet surprise in more ways than one to find out that Graeter's has started turning out  "schnecken" for the holiday season.  Pastry traditionalists and hipsters alike went into mourning when Virginia Bakery in Clifton, which had ruled and owned the world of schnecken, called it quits.  With Graeter's, my personal count of their successors is up to three.  Schnecken are something that'll be offered beyond the pearly gates right along with Graeter's ice cream.  Essentially they're a small loaf of raisin bread, with a thick layer of glaze on top and on the sides, but that description so doesn't do them justice.  Schnecken are so effen good, to appease the cardiac spirits I wash slices of 'em down with cold skim milk and call it even heart-healthiness-wise.

Get  to a Graeter's whenever you're in Greater Cincinnati.  If you live in the area, you  should already know what I'm talkin' 'bout.
This Graeter's on Galbraith in Finneytown gives out *huge* dips IF you ask one of the local high school kids to do the dippin'. Nothing like a Graeter's ice cream cone on a hot Cincinnati day!

This is my hometown ice cream place!  Worth a trip, maybe from Atlanta!  Try the chip flavors.... some of the chocolate chips are big enough to surf on.  (Not kidding much.)  This is a family-owned old-time ice creamery, not to be missed.   If you are disappointed, it's you, not them!

Graeters is the best that Cincinnati has to offer although I am a big fan  Skyline as well. Characterized by the simplicity of the ice cream (I never get any toppings) the giant chocolate chips (I found one I couldn't fit into my mouth), and the tradition that has never died. Graeters is most definitely worth the price although 1 scoop is usually enough for me. If you are traveling from out of town this is one of the things that you'll come back to again and again. Thank god I live here.

First visit here; fun concept.  When we got there I thought the price was a little high but you get a good amount and like I said, it was a fun way to serve ice cream.  
It's a very small place and very hard to social distance.  They seemed a little understaff so the wait was a little long.  Mine had the wrong toppings but I didn't say anything since they were so busy and I'm sure it's hard for the cashier to hear me speaking through the mask.    Wrong toppings were made up for a fun taste.

I had some amazing vegan ice cream twice from simply rolled! Once was delivered to my house and once was in person in the shop. My experience with the actual food has been phenomenal both times, but I am docking a star because the mood at the shop when we went was just downright unpleasant. Both girls working didn't smile at all, or say hello when we walked in. We haven't gotten to go out very much recently, and I would like to enjoy my experience when I do!

i love this place! the ice cream is super good and there are tons of things u can add in to customize your ice cream! it's also a decent price for some fancy ice cream, but its worth the extra few bucks for something fun every once in a while. it does take a little longer to make your ice cream, just because of the prices of rolling it, but its honestly not that long of a wait. me boyfriend and i keep coming back to simply rolled because it's one of our favorites!!

Simply Rolled's concept of ice cream is both unique and delicious. The finished product is just about the only good thing about this business though. It's a shame as they could be capitalizing on a high demand, but instead Simply Rolled is far too understaffed to make this a quick enjoyable place to get some ice cream. 

My wife and I visited on a Friday night. We waited just under 30 minutes for our ice cream. You can call ahead to order, yet the two folks that I noticed come in for their call ahead orders were informed their ice cream wasn't ready and they would need to wait as well. Oh, and there were about 6 DoorDash orders that the workers would alternate preparing between the orders for the customers in the store. 

With only two people working, they were visibly stressed and overwhelmed. Preparing a single bowl takes about 6-7 minutes I'd guess. When a party of four walked in, I could see the dread in one of the worker's eyes as he glanced at the clock. I truly felt bad for them. They need help. Yes, it was a busy Friday night, but this is always the case anytime I visit. Even on weeknights. 

My wife received her order first and waited, and waited, and waited for mine to be ready so we could enjoy together. It somewhat ruined the experience. Not to mention the overall vibe of a bunch of people sitting around awkwardly also thinking "wow, this is taking forever."

If you're going to implement a business where each serving takes about 8-10 minutes per customer including payment, hire the appropriate amount of staff to facilitate that structure. I like the ice cream. I really do. But the wait and overall experience outweighs the tasty little rolls. Bolster your staffing to accommodate the clear demand.
Loved this place! They have vegan ice cream were you can add just about any topping! I will go back!

This is a great ice cream parlor.
They make it in front of you on a cold steel plate. Once you choose your liquid base and mix-ins, they chop it all together on a cold surface and it turns into thin layer of solid ice, that is next scraped into rolls of ice cream.
It takes a lot of time and labor, but you get a personalized dessert made-to-order on the spot. 
You can also choose toppings.
I am vanilla plain ice cream type of guy, but I like this once in a while.

What a fun way to serve ice cream!
The process of making a custom single serve from liquid base to frozen goodness is fascinating to watch.
It is a Korean concept, that utilizes chilling plates. Once the creamy base is poured over them, it gets mixed with optional goodies and then turns into a thin layer of ice cream, that can be scraped off into yummy tubes and topped with whatever you wish for.  
The customization options are endless, from different flavors of the base, through mix-ins, to toppings. They have some suggested options that are always good too.
Now, in October, they offer a seasonal pumpkin flare.
Once you choose what you want, you need to be very patient and wait in line, and the line is always there. The wait time is the only downside, but they always have 3 people on 3 freezing plates working non stop.
It is fairly laborious to prepare each portion, so even though it comes at $6.50 per cup, I always tip generously, as it is not the same as scooping some gelato from a container.
I like this location near Washington Park, you can grab the treat and stroll through the park while enjoying it.

$6.50 for a signature roll, or you can create-your-own cup with unlimited toppings. Place your order at the register and then watch your ice cream get rolled! 

PROS: It's a fun experience if you never had rolled ice cream before. 

Once the novelty of rolled ice cream has worn off, I still recommend this treat if you want to try out different combinations of flavors and toppings. 

CONS: Seating is limited, and service can be slow. Presentation of ice cream can sometimes be a bit sloppy.

I came to this place because it is the $50 gift card that I got from 3CDC when I bought one during covid (I did not get to choose where). I was not super hyped about rolled ice cream but I LOVE cookie dough so I was excited for that. The first time I stopped here I wanted a snack for an event in the park and decided to try a cup of the basic cookie dough with m&ms.  It was a mistake. I only had a few bites and ended up going somewhere else for food. The dough tasted average but was very dry and not enjoyable.  Next time I will try it with the ice cream but as one of the options advertised is edible cookie dough I was hoping I could enjoy it independently as I do at other places/home. Overall, I will go again because I don't want to waste my gift card but so far it seems like it looks better than it tastes.
I highly recommend that you update your hours. On your door and online I just drove 30mins to your store and it was closed at 9:10.

Walked into Simply Rolled Ice Cream from walking around downtown last night after dinner, & one of the three ladies working who was helping someone else - stopped in the middle of helping a customer & abruptly yelled to the front door "Do you guys have masks?" & I politely said we are all vaccinated - per the sign in the window it says, "Thank you for wearing a mask if you are not fully vaccinated," which we are fully vaccinated therefor we did not wear masks... She then yelled, mind you stopped in the middle of helping another customer & said "I need to see your vaccination card then," which I then looked at my younger brother & boyfriend & we all agreed that 1) Her tone 2) We didn't feel the need to have our integrity questioned when we followed the rules & lastly 3) it IS a HIPPA violation to ask a citizen to see their vaccination card or any medical documentation for that matter unless it is within a healthcare setting which I believe an ice cream shoppe is not. :) Will not be returning here - not because they wanted us to wear a mask, but the way they went about it. Please get a hold of your employees & talk to them about going about it in a respectful manner. Everyone is human & we were just trying to have a nice night walking the town & this completely ruined it. I will be calling the CDC & local PD to file a report of them asking for our medical documentation as that is not allowed & don't want other to feel victimized as we did. :-)

Simply Rolled is a can't-miss destination if you enjoy ice cream! I feel like I've been living a sheltered existing until now.

Recommended by a friend, we stopped in for a little dessert after dining nearby. Wow! Not only is the ice cream heavenly, it's also an experience. You can stand and watch the staff create your selection -- sort of like a Japanese restaurant where the entrees are prepared right at your table.

For my first visit, I ordered the Salty Caramel Pretzel. Yum! I enjoyed each and every bite. My husband chose the "create your own" path with a brownie batter base, peanut butter cups and hot fudge. I didn't try a bite but it sure looked delicious. When we go back, I'm dying to try to Strawberry Serenity.

So what are you waiting for? They're open until 10 pm Sunday through Thursday and until 11 on Friday and Saturday. Your ice cream utopia awaits. Bon appetit!

This place!! Such a cool way to have traditional treat. You get to choose from a tasty variety of ice cream flavors & the toppings and mix in selection is massive!! I created my own & I'm pretty sure this is what everything in heaven will taste like! If you're in the Cincinnati area, this is definitely a great place to try!!

What a gem! Right around the corner from Washington Park makes this the perfect afternoon stop if you have a sweet tooth.

I'm a fan of restaurants that offer a minimal feel or a limited/focused menu. You're here for one thing and one thing only...ice cream. On walking in, the staff was friendly and greeted us quickly. There are combos you can choose from or have the freedom to make up your own creation.

The place was clean and there was indoor seating so you didn't have to leave if you didn't want to. Looking forward to trying this place again.

I was cautiously optimistic about Simply Rolled Ice Cream. Part of me I was worried that this would just be a gimmick. The other part of me was excited to try rolled ice cream. While it might be a gimmick, it's a gimmick that has solid flavors behind it. Choose an ice cream base, and mix-ins. The liquid base and mix-ins are worked over a cooling plate until the liquid solidifies. The ice cream is then shaped into a rectangle. The roll-in of your choice is drizzled over the ice cream. From there, the concoction is rolled into the signature shape. Unlimited toppings may be added. 

I was really impressed with the flavor. Rather than one of their listed Creations I opted for the create your own option. I did matcha green tea base, with almonds and raspberries for mix-ins, lavender honey for the roll-in, and blueberries as a topping. The ice cream was rich and creamy. Having it rolled adds extra aeration; it really helps you taste the different flavors. The amount of matcha flavoring was just enough. Fresh raspberries added a bit of tartness. Allmonds added a bit of texture. To my delight, the lavender honey did not meld into the ice cream. It acted as little bursts of sweetness. Blueberries were the icing on the cake, so to speak.

Simply Rolled is a short walk from Washington Park. When the park gets too hot, walk over to Simply Rolled and enjoy a sweet treat.

Simply rolled was a great photo-op waiting to happen and there's plenty of great things to say about this place. My favorite part about Simply Rolled was how great the customer service was. It was a pretty quiet night when we arrived and the staff made sure to go out of their way and greet us with a warm welcome. be warned the even on a quiet night it still took a little bit for our water to come out. I think that's standard though and had nothing to do with the staff themselves they seem to be working diligently. I have no complaints about the service that was provided.

Unfortunately, the biggest downfall for me was the ice cream itself. The ice cream lacks the depth and creaminess that I like in my favorite ice creams. It almost tasted watery (maybe that's required to get it in these cute little rolls?). Don't get me wrong, it tasted good. However, if I'm going to splurge on ice cream then I want to make sure that the caloric intake is worth it. With that being said, I think I'd go elsewhere. I would definitely give them another shot, maybe I just ordered the wrong thing?
This is my daughters 2nd time and my first time....Great customer service, fast services and lots of choices to pick from!

VEGAN ICE CREAM YOU SCREAM ICE CREAM!! Associate who took our order was a bit stressed training associates and making orders, but the overall experience was wonderful.  Fun place to visit!! Come get a custom ice cream roll they are amazing.  

The boy ordered vegan chocolate, Oreo and peanut butter sauce 

And the spoon is a keeper it's heat activated

I visited simply Rolled otr over the weekend, for the first time. This shop has friendly accurate service and a delicious menu....one of the employees provided a suggestion because I was clueless everything sounded so good....I was very pleased!!! The shop was clean, and the staff was great, and last but not least the food was amazing..........will be returning to s.r.o.t.r..........definitely a refreshing treat

Yummy & fun rolled ice cream! My friends and I came here on a soft opening night around 8:30, and there was no line. However, by the time we left there was a line of 15 people. When we walked in, every employee greeted us with smiles! We each placed our orders and then the workers one by one called our names so we could watch them make our selections.

It was cool to watch the plain vanilla base magically transform before your eyes into rolls of ice cream filled with your toppings!!

There's only one size and you can choose a combo  are a few tables inside so you don't have to take your ice cream to go, which is nice.

We all were delighted with our combos, and I personally recommend the s'mores combo - they roll marshmallow fluff inside the ice cream and give you two toasted marshmallows on the side! I can't wait to go back and bring more friends!

I've only had rolled ice cream one other time and I have to say this place raised the bar. This place has multiple ice cream base flavors (including a vegan option!) and soooooooo many toppings! Best of all they give you preset options to choose from, but also allow you to create your own with anything your heart desires for the same price. Seriously, there's no limit to what you can top your choice with.

It's super busy and kind of small, but they do have 4 separate rolling stations so it moves at a reasonable pace. Definitely worth rolling on in (see what I did there )

Best part: taste. They nail it when it comes to actual taste. Kiddo and I shared an Oreo dish and it was so good. I know you come for the experience but their ice cream could look like a regular scoop and it would still be worth trying. 

2nd best part: experience. They call your name so you can come up and watch them make it, atleast I assume that's why they call your name. Super cool to see the bases freeze up and the ingredients chopped in. The rolling is cool but not as satisfying as Instagram makes it. 

Negative: it's 62 degrees inside the shop, understandably since it is an ice cream shop but it was seriously unbearable to eat inside. I was shivering. Unfortunately, they have no seating outside so you have to deal with the temp or walk and eat. Not so easy with a toddler. 

Other negative: the rolls really keep their ice cold temperature, I had a hard time eating the rolls. I found that I had to wait a few minutes for it to melt first. Not really a big deal but noteworthy, it's hard to just dig on in. 

If I was ever in OTR and wanted (pricey) ice cream, I'd come back, mostly because it really did taste delicious. It's a cool, clean place and the Thailand inspired rolling did not disappoint. 

Pro tip: order the root beer float and watch the root beer freeze instantly, it's super cool (and yummy).

My wife and made an impulse run for ice cream and had to check this place out.  It's been on our list for a while!

Simply Rolled is good but a tad pricey. It's among the many novelty ice cream shops around. It is different however, it reminded me of Cold Stone where you can mix your favorite toppings in fresh ice cream. 

I recommend starting with one of their pre-builts before getting into the build your own, but if you go down that path the options are endless. 

I got the banana-Nutella, but replaced the vanilla ice cream with chocolate. I also added strawberries. It was amazing. My wife really enjoyed the Thai Tea Rolls. There were more flavors I can't wait to give a try. 4-Stars only due to price. 

It's staying on the list for a good date night.
Service is painfully slow, ice cream is average. Manager of the store is working behind the counter without wearing a mask.

Cool, literally, location for some ice cream goodness. When our group walked in we certainly took a minute to figure out what we wanted from all the many choices. Choosing one of the pre-made menu items seemed too easy with all the great options so each of us concocted something different. I chose a matcha green tea ice cream with various fruits and even boba topping. The process of making these rolls was reminiscent to me of the Cold stone creamery back in the day only they roll this ice cream. It is mesmerizing to watch. I loved my creation and bonus, Color. Changing. Spoons!

This place is in a great location half a block away from Washington Park. The wide windows and white interior make it look fresh and spacious, despite the lack of sitting (there were only 3 tables when we went in). Because it is widely popular and in a good location, it can get hectic and the line can move slowly as the production of rolled ice cream takes some time. There are plenty of good preset options and it also allows you to make your own. I personally loved the matcha berry (option number 6) as it is very refreshing and sweet. The biggest downside would be that the flavor can feel watered down on some occasions. There were times I had a great creamy flavor and other times I felt I was eating ice with some topping on it. It is a great place nonetheless and a good addition to the neighborhood. I would encourage people to try it at least two or three times due to the flavor inconsistency though.

I typically stay away from "fad food" spots. You know, the "we saw this thing in another market and decided to do it in Cincinnati because it was poppin'" - but once the trend fades away, usally so does the business.. I only say that to give context. 

I've been seeing people talk about this rolled icecream trend for a while and have kept my distance. BUT after seeing some goodies that I trust post about this spot, I caved and decide to give it a try. After stopping by OTR Escape Room with the whole crew (And KILLING our mission), we all stopped by for a celebratory treat. This place is dope! 

It's a captivating experience to watch them make your individualized rolled icecream right before your eyes - and it's delicious! I suggest the #2, vanilla icecream with strawberries with graham crackers (or check out the seasonal treats the Red Velvet is niiiice). 

I believe that this trend is here to stay. 
And I'm rolling with it!

(3.75) ~ Good Overall ice Cream & Service

MENU:
* Pina Colada = (3.75) Creative, but I wanted more marshmallow...

So.... this place is cool. I mean way watching as the ice creame makers mix up your unique concoction is a really cool thing. And they're all pretty darn good at it. But there are some draw backs. 

Firstly, this is not the place to eat ice cream of you have food allergies, especially nut. They do clean their utensils after each use, and they scrape down the mixing surface, but not well enough that I'd be confident in saying there wouldn't be any cross contamination. My bowl had remnants of the ash coconut ice cream made for the gentleman before me. Also, I found that my ice cream melted really quickly. That may be neither here nor there, but it was a bit of a bummer.

I was excited to give rolled ice cream a try since is pretty new here in Cincinnati, plus I was pumped that they had a vegan option.
We went in and thank god it wasn't busy right at that moment because few minutes later there was a loonng line, so glad I didn't wait long.
When I got there the staff was welcoming, the guy that took my order was friendly so no complains there.  I must say that they don't tell you where to wait so you kinda just wait there among others, then they call your name and you don't know if you're supposed to get closer then or wait until is done to get closer, so I just stood near by. 
The ice cream itself is good, i ordered a vegan base with graham cookies and strawberries and it tasted like real ice cream, I did ask to be topped with blueberries and caramel but I guess they ignored that part of the order.  Nevertheless, the taste was good.
The actual place is pretty tiny you cant really sit and eat there because there so many people coming in and there's only 3 tables 2 chairs each.  So we decide to just walk to the park. 
I will give it another try and order one from there menu.

I've never tried rolled ice cream and was so excited to finally be able to try it! I'm not sure if was a bad day for them or they were feeling overwhelmed by the amount of customers, but my experience was not good. The service was poor and the ice cream appearance and taste was mediocre at best.

When I first entered there was about a line of 10 people and the front line seemed a little frazzled. Since it was my first time ever ordering at a rolled ice cream place, I wanted to ask the cashier some questions. She immediately dismissed them and was not friendly. Once I ordered I asked her where I should wait and she told me to stand in the back. This was incorrect as I should have waited at the front line area. 

When the party I was with and I heard my name called, I went to grab the order which appeared to be mine and immediately was told it wasn't for me. I then questioned "where is my order", because the person who took the order was in line after me. As a response, from I believe to be the manager, I received an eye roll, a shrug and a finger point. This is completely unacceptable service and is something that must be worked on. Remember you serve the customer, the customer doesn't serve you. 

Lastly for the price I'd expect a beautifully designed descent tasting creation. The rolls were off and messy, not even "instagram worthy". The ice cream was also overly dense with suppressed flavors. To be fair, I've only tried the Gone Bananas signature roll, so maybe the others are better. A larger serving per topping should be added for the price.

The only positives are they have a cool menu and offer a variety of different signature creations as well as the option to create your own. In theory this ice cream joint is a great idea, but executed unsuccessfully. By working on your service, more employee training, and giving larger topping servings, your rating will definitely improve. 

I'll revisit and write a review within a couple months to see if any modifications were made.

This is a really fun place!  I got s'mores (Complete with a flame toasted mallow) and husband got the buckeye madness.  The workers were super friendly and helpful and the ice cream was tasty.  It does take some time to prepare as they chop it up like crazy, then roll it right in front of you.  It is a little pricey, but you can see that it is a labor intensive process.  I do feel the s'mores needed some chocolate, but would probably try this place again.

Nothing like ice cream on a hot summer day! I came here with a friend after lunch. I've had rolled ice cream once before. The cool part of rolled ice cream is that you can customize your ice cream however you want because they have the different ice cream bases and 35+ toppings. I take forever to pick different flavors and toppings so I just chose the signature Matcha Berry. It's very fun to watch them make your ice cream rolls and it came out beautifully. 
I will need to come again to try out their other flavors like coconut ash and Thai tea. They also have a vegan vanilla base that is made with cashew milk and coconut cream.

Grabbed some ice cream on Thursday night at ~9, and the place was still lively (did not realize they just opened the previous weekend)! A friend and I split the Cookie dough boy signature bowl and it was enough to hit our sweet tooth. 
The ice cream itself was good, and the cookie dough that was mixed in was spot on. Love the color changing spoons! I do wish the base held up a bit more, because it melted quickly. It was refreshing. I would suggest trying one with a fruit base or a chocolate base for more flavor. 
The experience of watching them make the ice cream is fun and they have a whole line where you can watch. This can get congested since they do not direct you to a specific spot to wait and get your ice cream. Also, all the workers who roll differ in how they scoop-I would've liked to see a tighter ice cream roll, because I think they may have been rushing. 
Overall, it was good, and I want to come back to try and create my own bowl.
The cotton candy burrito is the only way to satisfy anyone with an insatiable sweet tooth!

The ice cream was great! But I will CERTAINLY not be returning. The instant I walked in, I was yelled at (YES, yelled at!!!) by the cashier because she thought I was ignoring the 10 person capacity sign, when I was really peaking my head in to see how many people are inside because the windows are tinted! 
Once enough people left for me and my group to walk in, the same cashier greeted me with a not-so-friendly stare that made it obvious that she didn't want me there. One of the people in my group didn't have a mask with him. Instead of being nice and asking him if he has a mask, she yelled "put on your mask!", and when he nicely explained that he didn't have a mask, she pointed to the door and glared at him. 
Throughout my 20+ minute wait for the ice cream (remember, we were 4 of about 8 customers in there at that point), we saw the same lady yelling at other visitors and also noticed how deliberately rude she was- she wouldn't say anything nice to anyone, not even giving a simple "you're welcome" to the cute little 5 year old sisters who watched her roll ice cream in amazement. I felt bad for the other girl working, she always had her head down and it could be assumed that the cashier treats her with the same disrespect that she treats her customers. 
It's amazing how one person can so badly harm a business by refusing to do the simple task of giving friendly service. And for that reason, I will not return and I will recommend that others steer clear of this place. I hope this review was helpful!

I had to check out the new craze, what is this 'rolled ice cream' I keep hearing about? It was pretty packed when I went but they work very quickly so the wait wasn't too long. The atmosphere was friendly and the decor makes the place welcoming. I got the Buckeye, you really can't go wrong with chocolate and peanut butter in my mind. It was quite yummy and very visually appealing also! I ended up walking across the road to Washington Park to eat it and I will say it melts very quickly, maybe more so the other ice cream? But 90 degree day will do that. The location is great being close to the park, I'm sure I'll be back when I need to treat myself to a simply delicious frozen treat.

Loved it- highly recommend. It's already kind of weird and different, so whatever you do, don't get shy once you walk in and order something tame. Be adventurous. Get the one where they actually chop up a piece of pumpkin pie, put it in the ice cream, then stick another piece of pumpkin pie on top (just in case you might have missed what this sundae-thing is all about.)
Be adventurous. Just go for it. 
I talked to some shop owners nearby who were actually scared to try this ice cream, as it is rolled up and not piled in a mound like the ice cream we've all had allllll our lives. 
Come on, now- that's old-people thinking. First, you'll refuse to try rolled ice cream. It's a slippery slope from there, people- next thing you know, you'll be wearing out a groove in your la-z boy, only watching shows you've seen before, for fear that if you watched something else (or! Heavens forbid! *actually dared turn off the tv and read a BOOK,*) something might surprise you, which would lead to bad things like elevated heart rate, smiling, or - gasp- maybe even getting off your tuffet and going for an actual walk OUTSIDE. 
dangerous stuff. 
Please help yourself avoid the slow and horrible slide into narrow-minded, cranky, and smelly (yes, smelly! Yes, you!) old age. Go try some of this here rolled ice cream.
Worker behind the counter not wearing a mask. Service is terrible. Would avoid at all costs.

This place was quick, and got exactly what I thought I was going to get. I enjoyed the experience, the rolled Ice cream was delicious, workers pleasant. I really don't have any complaints food wise.

I however thought for $6.50 thought the cups were small, and overall expensive. I enjoyed the experience, but I feel like this type of business isn't sustainable, like frozen yogurt shops. I MIGHT be back but i'm doubtful.

I first fell in love with a place like this in Chicago, so when I found out that there was going to be one in Cincinnati, I was excited.  I decided to make my own concoction involving lots of fruit, vanilla ice cream, lavender honey and fruity pebbles.  It was absolutely worth it!  The staff was great, and clearly enjoyed their job.  If you get a chance to visit and want some delicious ice cream, go here!

Ummm guys, UNLIMITED TOPPINGS!? If you haven't been here yet, you need to go. I'm pretty sure anyone who likes ice cream could make their dream flavor combo here with the amount of sauces, candy, nuts, pretzels, etc.  I'm also a sucker for dinner (yes, ice cream can be dinner, don't judge me) and a show.  If you've never been to a place like this before they pour the liquid cream onto a frozen plate, add any sauces or chopped items you want into the ice cream, mix it all up, and then flatten the delicious icy mixture. You can add sauces and they make the beautiful ice cream rolls and add any additional toppings or sauces on top of that too. I'll definitely be going back soon... even if winter is coming...
Absolutely delicious! My son had the cotton candy burrito and it was so yummy. The reason why I gave it 3 stars was because of the attitude of one of the employees....it was very pleasant at all

Worth checking out for sure! The staff is very friendly and helpful and explains how the ice cream is made on spot to order. The business is very clean and if I had kids I would take them here because they would be thrilled.

I've been waiting to find a place close to try rolled ice cream and it was worth the wait!  I loved it!

I made my own creation and the people that I was with tried some of their signature ice creams and we all loved it. The ice cream was much creamier than I thought it would be and was an all around good experience.

Top-notch ice cream, both in flavor and in presentation.

When they brought out a blow torch to toast the marshmallows on the s'mores ice cream, I know they meant business. If you're in the area, definitely stop in.

Service was absolutely terrible! Went there today, during a slow period and was completely overwhelmed by the employees attitude towards us. As we arrived no one told us where to place the order, greeted us, and then two of the three workers decided to go in the back visibly eating before eventually coming to help us after more customers arrived. HOW DO YOU RUN A SERVICE BUSINESS WITH EMPLOYEES THAT DISREGARD A CUSTOMER KNOWINGLY AND DELIBERATELY. 

I expect this place to go out of business soon. Good product/bad service.

I split the Oreo with my boyfriend after dinner - warning: it's A LOT of ice cream! One cup was enough for the both of us. It was good, but nothing special - very comparable to Cookies n cream flavor from other well known ice cream brands. It was entertaining to watch them prepare it though. If you're unfamiliar with how rolled ice cream works, you're not alone! I don't know if it's really clear to the public that there is a myriad of mixing and matching you can do with flavors and toppings at a place like Simply Rolled. This customization factor may account for the higher price.

Really unique concept as they make they ice cream in front of you! It's pricey but portions are huge so you can absolutely split. I loved the waffle taco option, reminded me of the chocotacos from when I was little bit of course much better. I was a bit underwhelmed by the customer service, for a cute place in OTR I just expected more but they are new so hopefully that will improve.

I wasn't a big fan of this place. Granted, I went early on in their tenure, but I'm fairly sure I either didn't get the right flavor I ordered, or it was very, very bland. At $6.50, it's more expensive than Buzzed Bull, which is my go-to place. Not likely to go again except with someone who hasn't tried it before

Update: went again and had the Oreo. Seems to be popular with the reviewer crowd. Increased to a 3 but I'm not coming regularly.

It was pretty good. But one of the workers was talking to his coworker like shit because he's new I guess? Maybe dude was having a bad day, but either way, it was just really unpleasant to have to listen to.

Excellent! Cool to watch them make it and it is delicious. Got a Matcha Berry with vanilla base and it was so good. Light and not too sweet. We also got a Caramel Pretzel and it was good too. It's a bit pricey at 6.50, but it's not something I will be getting that often. Big enough to share for many people. Didn't take long but I could see it being a long wait if they were busy.

We LOVE this place! Both times we have been, the service has been quick and impeccable. I was worried that the ice cream wouldn't be creamy considering the process, but I was wrong. It's so creamy and smooth, and watching them make it is so neat. The first time we went, I had the s'mores roll and my fiancé had the cotton candy burrito, which were both delicious. The CC burrito isn't for the faint of heart though. It's a lot and very sweet.  we went last night and I had the buckeye roll and he had the cookie dough roll. Also both amazing. I was obsessed with the buckeye roll. So many flavors, so smooth and just the right amount of chocolate and peanut butter. This place is a great addition to Cincinnati!

The taste is incredible. Had the Oreo and it was wonderful. The portion was satisfying without leaving you sorry you ate it afterward. The color changing spoons are a fun touch too.

Yes, $6.50 is a bit pricey for a cup of ice cream, but by the time everything is rolled up, it's probably a good 3-4 scoops. 

The only downside is that there are 3 tables in the place. We had to stand to eat.

Love everything about this place! The ice cream is so good and fresh - highly recommend anyone to stop by. The staff is so friendly and welcoming, if you don't know what to get just ask! The cookie dough boy is amazing and the pina colada is really fresh and light if you're looking for something different! Plus color changing spoons... how fun?!

Love the concept and novelty of it in Cincinnati. We went "pre-opening" days when they weren't officially announced open yet and the manager was very friendly and informative. It is fun to watch your ice cream get rolled up and the toppings selections are great. Personally, just didn't care much for the texture but it's a very personal preference. The taste was good. Smart addition right across from the park! Would def go back with my young nieces and rolled ice cream newbies.

Cool concept for ice cream. Fun to watch them make it. We got the chocolate chip cookie dough version, it was good, nothing out of this world. I would go back to try another flavor or maybe make my own. They have a lot of toppings and options to choose from. The caramel pretzel and sea salt flavor looked pretty good so that may be the next one I try.

These ice cream treats don't come cheap; 6.95 and up, but they are fantastic! We visited on Sunday afternoon, the place was busy, but service was quick. The selection is large, they have some popular choices, but also have endless choices to customize your treat. I tried the vegan vanilla ice cream as #1, the banana cream something. It was very good, a very special treat.

If I could give zero, I would. I don't like leaving bad reviews, but was treated very rudely for having a gluten allergy. Employees were not trained to understand allergies or treat a customer appropriately. We went at 6:30 on Sunday and there were 3 employees and one with a bandana (no name tags) said they would clean the surface before she started making my ice cream. She never cleaned it and when I inquired- she told me she couldn't clean it bc she had other customers. There were 2 other people and 3 different serving stations. I have never had someone refuse to clean equipment for a customer with an allergy. She was rude and unprofessional. Personally, I don't like leaving a bad review, but felt the need to alert those with allergies.

Service and atmosphere could've made this experience much better. The matcha berry ice cream was delicious; however, as a customer i long for the employees to be welcoming and excited about their product.

Loved the ice cream here! Pricey for ice cream (more than Graeter's), but it was delicious. A little too generous on the portions. I'll split a cup next time I go. First time there was great, will definitely be back!

Cool concept of having rolled ice cream, but very similar to Cold Stone. Pretty basic signature creations in my opinion. Portions are almost too much; reduce portions and lower the price! Staff was very friendly. Probably won't be back.
Watching the ice cream being made was pretty cool to watch, but the flavor I had was rather average. Worth it for the experience. I'd go back to try a different flavor.
Ice cream and atmosphere were great! Although, some of the employees were kind of rude when I came. Would definitely come back though!

I loved everything about this. The location. The options. Watching them roll the ice cream.  And I got the got bananas. It was perfection,  I wish I got a picture. But all I could think about was how yummy it was.
So good- ice cream isn't too sweet, ingredients are fresh and staff is super friendly

It was almost as much fun to watch the boy roll my ice cream as it was to eat it! I tried the s'mores and it was amazing! The toasted marshmallow was a great addition to the marshmallow cream, chocolate sauce and graham crackers mixed into it. Fantastic deal too. It looks like little rolls, but it was pretty filling.
This place is amazing!!!! The best rolled ice cream in town! Friendly staff and great service, will he recommending to others!!!!!!

Took my husband two granddaughters yesterday! The people were just adorable and the ice cream was absolutely delicious! So worth the trip! I think they all thought it might be the best ice cream ever!

Cute little place for ice cream and other sweets right in the heart of Oakley Square. You think ice cream in Cincinnati, you may think of the big G, but Aglamesis is also at the top of the list when it comes to original local ice cream offerings and has been for over 100 years. 

The ice cream is rich and creamy, and they also have refreshing Italian Ice if that is more your thing. The staff is very friendly and quick. This location is doing an excellent job of implementing covid precautions. Which currently I do not believe they are offering indoor seating, they usually do, but they do have tables and chairs set up outside for when it's nice out. 

Should you be in the mood for gourmet chocolate and/or other sweets, check the entire left side of the store and you'll be sure to find something. 

I'm a huge fan of Cream-n-cookies ice cream!

Recently tried Aglamesis ice cream for the first time to celebrate getting our Covid shot.  It looks more like the old-fashioned ice cream parlor than the other famous ice-cream plan in the our city.  Yes, I'm going to compare it to Graeter's in the sense that it doesn't have as many flavors.  However, I tried a pistachio flavor that was wonderful!  They had an amazing amount of different candies/sweets  offered.  Honestly, can't wait to try some of their other items when we are in the area.

Okay so... Aglamesis is BY FAR my favorite ice cream in the city! I've lived in Cincinnati my entire 20 years up until college, have tried every ice cream parlor in the city, and can confidently confirm that Aglamesis is THE BEST!

Aglamesis has been open for as long as I can remember and has the most classic, beautiful parlor interior. When you walk in, you automatically smell the chocolates, candy, and ice cream and feel right at home. The employees are all extremely friendly and will remember your family and your name! 

If you haven't been, theres plenty of things you must try... but you really have to try to BANANA ICE CREAM. I really don't even like bananas that much but their banana ice cream is heavenly. I normally get the banana milkshake that comes with two little butter cookies, which is adorable. My parents always split the two-step, which is like an ice cream sundae for two, and they always love it! My brother swears by the strawberry ice cream, you should try that as well!

The first thing you notice is that store is retro and adorable. However, it doesn't feel super inviting. We had our preschool aged son with us and it didn't feel like a place for him to look around comfortably- it's small and feels crowded inside.

The chocolate was really good but I'm not sure it's more premium than anything at Graeter's or maybe Esther Price. 

I'm glad we tried it but I'm not sure I'll need a return trip. Also, there's a large parking lot right before you approach the store. We didn't realize it and had to hunt for street parking, don't make our mistake!

Love everything about Aglamesis, the interior, the exterior, the divine strawberry chocolate chip ice cream and of course the chocolates. 
Talk about pretty in pink. Pink building, pink chairs, pink awning, pink everything. Great for dessert and cute insta photo ops. We're in town visiting and have already been twice.
Always delicious ice cream! If you'd like to step back in time stop inside and grab a scoop or two. We used to live right around the corner and this place quickly became a guilty pleasure of ours.
The ice cream is good. Service is good. Nothing that stands out and nothing that matches the hype or reputation.
Aglamesis is always delicious! I love their fruity ice cream flavors and recently I've loved the marshmallow topping!
The ice cream is nauseatingly sweet. I recommend the other ice cream place in Cincinnati.

I've been going here for almost 30 years! Always the best ice cream in Cincinnati. My main favorite is what used to be called a raspberry crush but I forget the new name for it. They will know what you're talking about. 

Fresh peach and raspberry ice cream (not just the sorbet)in the summer...butter pecan in the winter. There's always a main go to for every season.

It's literally like going back to the 1950s when you step into this place. Love ice cream parlors like that. You can tell they have been around for years. I always get the french vanilla with a waffle cone. Prices are fair and affordable. They have a lot where you can park at. Great place to take your kids during the summer.  Check them out

Try their pistachio and banana ice cream! Unconventional, but SO good. They also have great chocolates you can buy for gifts around holidays or just a treat for later. They've been around since 1908, so if you're into history in the Oakley area, it's worth a trip just for that!

I think I've only been here twice before, but I stopped in recently with a friend who's new to Cincinnati. I tried their mint chocolate chip ice cream and it was delicious! It had a strong mint flavor, but I really liked that! It's consistently wasn't super thick, but still creamy and it didn't melt right away even though it was a really hot day. Super quaint, and it appears that they are offering indoor seating right now.

TLDR: solid ice cream spot 

Cute lil ice cream and sweets store in a cute part of Cincinnati. In case you're worried about parking, there is a parking lot with FREE parking for customers of the surrounding shops. 

Overall, thought it was a good ice cream shop but nothing too special. Tried the coffee flavor ice cream but wasn't blown away. Its a pretty good place for classic ice cream flavors.

I used to frequent Aglamesis quite a bit when I lived in Cincinnati. Now when I visit, I try to stop by for a treat. My go to menu items are the Swiss Raspberry or the Raspberry Crush. if you're a fan of raspberry like I am, these won't disappoint.

The ice cream is great and the old school ice cream shoppe feel makes Aglamesis a full experience.

So here is my updated thesis
I do not have psycho-kinesis
But the best ice cream I know
Down in Cinci Ohio
Is the strawberry here at Aglamesis!

If Ronaldo was merged with Messi, you'd either have a really short Ronaldo, or A-Glam-Messi.

This is a really lovely ice cream shop with really good fresh strawberry ice cream. I enjoyed every slurp of it. The boy serving was really friendly and the girls serving was really flirtatious and had a crush on me. Unfortunately they didn't seem to get along and they were arguing and annoyed with each other. That's okay because the boy can be my bro and chill with me and the girl can be my date presuming that she is over 21 which I'm pretty sure she was. Fun times all around.

She helped me pick out the fresh strawberry ice cream flavour which was delicious, as was she.

While I was waiting for my ice-cream some guy was quoting The Wedding Singer so I called him on it and then we had a little chat. More good times all around.

Lots of cute people come to this particular cafe so watch out Cincinnati. You have been warned.

Excellent ice cream, I'll be back sometime to try a different flavour. Bear in mind this is old fashioned style ice cream with traditional flavours so don't expect stupid maple-bacon crap here. Otherwise I probably wouldn't like it as much. I'm all for quality products not fancy innovation for the sake of it unless it tastes amazing.

My alt review said:

Super cute ice cream place in Cincinnati with a legendary following and extremely attractive customers and really friendly teenybopper employees. I enjoyed my experience here thoroughly and I will probably bring Barbie back here for ice cream next time I'm in Cincinnati especially considering the city isn't absolutely packed with great ice cream places like for example Buffalo and Toronto.

Extremely friendly employees who deserve the tip that I gave them and while parking out front can be a little tricky it's worth coming here for people watching as well cuz it's in a very trendy neighborhood with lots of cool people and trendy people and Suburban people all mixed in together checking each other out.

An excellent addition to the lifestyle of Cincinnati and one which I recommend everybody check out when you're in town if you like ice cream.

I heard that they were pet friendly and decided to come in as my dog and I are walking distance. The service here lacked. The people were very rushed and seemed to be annoyed by any questions that were asked. 

I got butter pecan ice cream and got my dog the dog ice cream. My dog seemed to enjoy the ice cream (vanilla ice cream with dog biscuits). My ice cream though, I thought was nothing too special. I really wish they had more variety of flavors. 

I like the idea of having an option for your dog as Oakley is very dog friendly, but it was nothing too exciting that makes me want to come back consistently.

Absolutely love this place! I've been going here since my dad first took me when I was 10 years old. It is an authentic old-fashioned ice cream parlor that has been around since the 1920s. They have beautiful marble-topped tables and wire-backed chairs, and the place smells like chocolate! I always get the two-step hot fudge sundae, which comes with French vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, fresh whipped cream, and nuts. They also have delicious shakes and ice cream sodas. This is a great place to bring kids (big ones, too!) for a yummy dessert.

Great little ice cream and candy shop.  We ordered the Bourbon street, two step sundae, and Swiss raspberry.  Great ambiance and friendly staff.  Clean and has a large variety of flavors and treats.  My only complaint is that the prices are a bit high for the portions that you receive.

After passing by this spot a few times I finally decided to stop in on a hot afternoon. Like any other ice cream shop, I first went up to the counter and started looking at the flavor choices. I was then told that this was actually a full-service store, and so those dining in could sit at a table with a menu and have a server come ane take the orders. 

While the service was a nice touch, I actually felt apprehensive about it. First of all, it didn't allow me to look into the big cooler of ice cream choices to help me make a decision. Also, we were not aware of the 4 seasonal choices not listed on the menu until our server mentioned them (after we had already been looking at the menu for a while).

I went with the seasonal strawberry chip. While it was refeshing, it was a bit icy and not as creamy as I expected. Also, the scoop was pretty small for the price. 

If you're looking to splurge on an ice cream trip in Cincinnati, stick to Graeter's.
If you love premium dark chocolate candy, you have to go here. Ice cream is exceptional as well

If you are looking for an old school ice cream parlor and soda stand, then this is your place!  located in the heart of downtown Oakley, OH. It is a slice of nostalgia, right out of the 1950's era.  Not only do they have amazing ice cream, they have one of the largest selections of chocolate candies I have ever seen....I mean, so many to choose from and in all kinds of shapes, sizes & flavors.  I had the Butterscotch ice cream in a waffle cone and it was so good!  The place is old and not in the best shape, but that's what is cool about the place....it has so much character and charm. Skip the franchise/chain ice cream shops and head over to Aglamesis Bros ice cream!

Aglamesis has always been my favorite ice cream parlor. Yesterday was my first visit to this location. I've been to the Montgomery location many times. This location has the same cute decor and a welcoming, friendly  staff. My cousin and I visited yesterday after having lunch nearby. I ordered my favorite, Dutch Holland Chocolate and my cousin ordered chocolate ice cream with soda poured over. I've never tried that here before but tried hers and it was so good! I didn't buy any of their chocolates this time but they make the best NonPariels and Coconut Clusters.

The lady and I had ordered 6 different flavors. I personally had never had ice cream from here so wasn't sure what to expect. We ordered Pumpkin, Cinnamon, Strawberry, Mocha Chip, Cookies n Cream, and Coffee. Sampled all of them and they were all amazing; strawberry being a personal favorite of mine from Aglamesis Bros.

I love this place and their ice cream and the chocolates. It obviously has genuine retro charm and an awesome neighborhood feel. My great grandparents met here... stories like mine are not in short supply. 
I love the swiss red raspberry add hot fudge.
For something more classic, a nectar shake is perfect.
Visiting this place is a treat in more ways than one. You'll definitely feel pampered and you'll feel like you've taken a vacation, but instead of traversing miles you'll have traveled time.
Incredible ice cream in a place that's a blast from the past. Excellent candy too. Charming and wonderful!

This is one of the cutest spots that I have seen in the Cincinnati area. It has very retro vibes and it feels like stepping back a few decades when you walk in the store. The ice cream is delicious and I would definitely come back here again soon!

Fun old style ice cream parlor with both easy take out and some seating with table service.   We shared an Bourbon Sundae and it was good.   I guess they're looking out for our waistline as we thought it was a monster from the pictorial menu so we got one to share and although "three" scoops, it left us longing for more!  My hint would be "get your own!!"    Fun and tasty treat!

This ice cream parlor and chocolate shop is a staple in Cincinnati. The decor is still from time gone by which is so cozy. The ice cream is so good. My husband always get The Bourbon Street and I always dive right into the fruit salad. A big scoop of vanilla ice cream topped with various fruits, whipped cream and very finely grated nuts. So good any time of year.
Always delicious! Decadent chocolates and wide array of amazing ice cream selections.

How stinkin CUTE. I loved the happy, cheeky vibe of Algamesis Bros, and it smelled absolutely divine in there. Both of our cones were scrumptious, and I wish we'd picked out some chocolates to go!
It took us a little bit to figure out the menu, but after you untangle the setup it is really rather simple! Despite some order confusion with who was in line first, they were very willing to share advice and samples with us and ultimately I was so happy with the ice creams we picked out. I will be back for sure!

Aglamesis Bros is a pretty good ice cream spot. Their ice cream is decent but it is not as good as Graeter's. When I tasted it I was like meh ok it's good but I wasn't super wowed as I am with eating Graeter's. They also do not have a large selection of ice creams. I'm use to ice cream shops having 20+ options they have 17 flavors with a few Italian Ice flavors. Their flavors are also pretty basic (I.e. Vanilla, Chocolate, Strawberry, Strawberry Chocolate Chip, Mint Chocolate Chip, Banana Ice Cream, Banana Chocolate Chip, Etc.). This is not a big deal as I usually only order 2 flavors ever. I just wanted to state that to give people a heads up. They also are a chocolate candy shop. 

I tried one scoop of Cream-n-Cookies. It was pretty good. The ice cream had a nice texture and creaminess. I only had one little chunk of Oreo. I would have definitely liked more cookie chucks. It tasted like your standard cookies and cream. No big complaints but no real super brags either.

Overall, Aglamesis Bros isn't bad and has good ice cream. While I did enjoy their ice cream I probably will continue to go to Graeter's.

This is such a cool ice cream shop! My friend and family walked in tonight (5/31/17) at almost 10pm and the place was fairly busy! 

The girl behind the counter was nice and we asked for samples in which she gave to us with no hesitation at all. 

I got the Black Raspberry Crisp which was fantastic.... Perfect texture and melted in my mouth. 

Everyone else in my party ordered the peach flavored ones and all agreed that it was amazing. 

The shop itself is extremely pink and honestly just a perfect set-up for an ice cream parlor. It's so inviting and you can tell this establishment is well-liked by the locals. I didn't think so many people would be coming in during the week at such a late hour. 

This is my first time to Cincinnati and I have to say that this is one of the best tasting Ice creams I have ever had!

My favorite ice cream parlor anyway.   Even better than Zaharakos in Columbus, IN.   The ambiance isn't quite as good, but the ice cream itself is second to none.   You gotta try the peach.  They have old fashioned  sundaes that are super indulgent and super tasty.   Think metal bowls.   

Everything is pink and tiled, and it is still owned by the original family.  They also have really nice homemade candy.   This is a throwback to century old Greek ice cream parlors.  I hope it is around forever.

This place is so quaint and cute you have to check it out! The 1950s style vintage decor makes you feel like you're stepping back in time. And if you eat-in some of their ice cream dishes are served in glassware with real spoons, not plastic!  It's a great date night place and the ice cream rivals that other Cinci staple..

Ice cream is always good and up to today so was the service. The woman who took my order was awful. Nasty and rude. I brought friends who had never been there and they commented about how rudely they were treated. I am so disappointed. Then to top it off I'm told she's a manager. That's bad.

So glad I discovered this cute little gem today! I have an uncontrollable sweet tooth, so a visit to a good dessert spot like this one is enough to make my day! 

Walking in takes you back in time - it's like walking into an ice cream parlor from the 50's (or is it a blast even further into the past? Either way...you get the picture). The pink wallpaper and heart shaped chairs only add to the sugary cuteness of it all. 

You can ask to sample the many different flavors of ice cream. I couldn't come to one decision, so I ordered a scoop of French vanilla ice cream as well as a scoop of the champagne sorbet. Both were wonderful - the French vanilla was rich and creamy, and the sorbet was refreshing and tart.

Next time I come back, I'll probably go for the homemade chocolates, as I hear they are a real treat as well!

America is a nation of immigrants. Even the Indians by land and the Vikings by sea! Cincinnati's two oldest hand crafted ice cream stores were started by immigrants. Greek immigrants invented Cincinnati chili and the Aglamesis family created this ice cream, chocolate and candy store. 

My mother was an Aglamesis loyalist; she went to school with their family. It was a very special spot for us wide-eyed children to reward us for good behavior after adult events we did not necessarily relish. 

Aglamesis ice cream is a little different than "the other" ice cream business in town. Both are excellent, by the way! Both use the same high quality ingredients. Both have a rotating collection of flavors, including sorbets. 

Aglamesis ice cream has more air, so is less dense. That makes it easier to consume! 

Aglamesis is not as sweet as the other, it's a more adult ice cream to me.

Interestingly my mother's loyalty to Aglamesis overrode her mother's loyalty to "the other" ice cream business. They both were independent women! They both were always there for us. And as kids, we eagerly consumed both ice creams!

From Aglamesis I learned how to make chocolate chip flavors. After the ice cream is done with the dasher process, remove the dasher, then pour in melted chocolate, stirring it in with a long spoon. The chocolate will immediately flake into chips with the size determined by the speed you stir. Then put the ice cream away to freeze firm. 

I've always enjoyed their seasonal cranberry sorbet!

This original store hasn't changed since 1913. They have a huge selection of cordials, truffles and bonbons. The shop is a scent experience.

I had the mint chocolate chip - excellent - I have made this ice cream with creme de menthe liquor, which is difficult because alcohol is an antifreeze, freezing point depressant.

Next, the black raspberry chocolate chip - I think we call those blackberries out West! It has a great strong fruit flavor, tart and not too sweet - yum.

Finally, I had the champagne sorbet with a lemon flavor and pale pink color - also excellent!

This place is popular with families, for a date, or just to cool off. And for atmosphere, you can't beat their authenticity. 

The only improvement I would make is to add espresso!

No trip to Cincinnati would be complete without a trip to Aglamesis. Quaint ice cream store from the turn of the 1900 century, it's like taking a step back in time. You can get ice cream anywhere but you can only "time travel" at Aglamesis on Madison road.

What a delicious step back in time! This sweets parlor makes you feel like you're at an ice cream social in a town square in the 1940s. The staff is super courteous and the ice cream flavors and quality are delightful (we shared a sundae with a combo banana chip and raspberry chip). We also bought some chocolate truffles for my grandmother, which she confirmed tasted as scrumptious as they looked. Even my dog got spoiled afterward with a "pup cup" he devoured without coming up for air after we got home (a trip that single scoop made home fully intact 20 minutes later thanks to some kind of space-age paper bag).

Cinnamon ice cream was the best I've ever had. In fact, I'm dreaming about it now and ready to make the 30 minutes trek there to get some more, just writing this review. It's the brown speck cinnamon and not the red hot candy cinnamon for those cinnamon snobs out there. :) I love the history of the place, the location is trendy, and parking was a breeze. I'll be back because there is so much more I want to try.

Some of the employees are clearly mad and unhappy people. I went in happy, celebrating with my daughter. The lady, "Silver," was so mean, my 11 year old asked to leave and said she would rather not have ice cream and chocolate. 
If I wasn't so sad about the experience, I would be furious. I am telling myself that this lady is just a miserable person, and I hope she feels better.

It's really hard for me for some reason to review my favorite places. I guess I feel like, in words, I could never do these places justice to how amazing they are. 
Aglamesis Bros is one of those places. 

I fell in love with Aglamesis Bros before I even ate there. Two years before I even moved down to Cincinnati I was at a concert at the 21st Century Theater and when walking back to my car this little ice cream shop caught my eye with its gold lettering in the window and it's pastels inside the background. I never forgot about it. Then two years later when I moved down to Cincinnati, my boyfriend and I went on one of our first dates at Aglamesis Bros. When we walked in I was in "Awe", it made me think of "The Umbrellas Of Cherbourg", and that movie is what my heart and head look like inside. Haha. 

My top three favorite things to get at Aglamesis is. 1. Champagne Sorbet (Italian Ice), you will never have a better sorbet in your life. I also really enjoy getting one scoop of Champagne Sorbet, and one scoop of Raspberry Sorbet. They compliment each other and are amazing. 2. Sodas, Old school style soda's. My favorite thing to do suggest to my guess to try one out. They usually pick "Extra Sincere" and I love seeing their face when they bring out the giant goblet out to the table. Always funny. 3. Sundaes, Any of their sundaes, with crushed fruit topping is my favorite. The pineapple is really good, but my favorite is the Maraschino Cherry Chocolate Sundae.

They also have amazing homemade chocolates and candies. The Malt Balls are my favorite. If you ever want to just try a candy that you are unsure of, they will let you taste it too. 

During the holidays, you can always go in here and find plenty of candy goodies. Valentines Day, even though I don't celebrate it. I do love seeing the assortment of heart-shaped candy boxes you can pick out of, and you get to pick what candies you want them too. Easter is another holiday they go all out for. 

The service is also always top notch here. Everyone is always ridiculous nice and helpful. I also think it's amazing that my boyfriend lost my American Apparel hoodie, we couldn't find it for a year and then one day we were at Aglamesis and I was walking back to the bathroom, and low and behold on the wall hanging up on their coat rack was my hoodie that I've had for almost ten years. They kept my hoodie that I lost that whole time. 

I love LOVE, love Aglamesis Bros. They have perfected ice cream. They are my favorite ice cream place ever.

This place is SO cute. When you come in, you are immediately transported to the old days. You can order your ice cream to go or dine in, where someone takes your orders. If you do dine in, they serve you with a glass of water. 

About the ice cream: my favorite is the strawberry. I generally pair with with a different flavor each time (e.g., coconut, banana) to switch it up when I get the sundae. So good!

Love this place and always have.  But this trip was NOT good!  Stopped in with my mom and aunt,  their 1st time,  and the 3 girls working ruined the experience.  Horrible attitude,  no patience while my mom and aunt decided what they wanted.  And there was no one else in the place.  Will not be back.  Sorry Aglamesis.  Hire friendly people!  Even got an eye roll from one while my aunt was reading the menu.

Living in Cincinnati made me a dairy snob. My opinion of ice cream changed dramatically after years of college which was fueled by large doses of Graeter's. So, I know my frozen desserts. 

Aglamesis Bros is like time traveling back to the 1950s or 60s. A pink paradise of small, white tables and wacky wallpaper, the decor and the menu make all ages happy. I've visited with my friends and their kids, with my mom, and, most recently, on a girls' night out. Everyone left with smiles on their faces and money still in their pockets.

The marble counter, glass candy displays, and old fashioned recipes are a welcome flashback to a simpler time. You can get things like rum raisin ice cream, Mayfield brownies (which are like hunks of nutty fudge), and caramel apples all served up by friendly folks.

Prices are so low that our trio of ladies ate ourselves silly for less than $13. The berry ice was fruity and refreshing. The vanilla float was creamy and frothy. And my turtle sundae was rich and delicious. I love coming here and sharing this special pace with my friends, family, and the next generation of Cincinnati, ice cream connoisseurs.
My absolute favorite Mint Chocolate Chip in the world! We live out of state and have Aglamesis ship it to us on dry ice.

Cutest. Shop. Ever.  Pink wall paper and heart chairs?  Antique flower lamps?  Sign me up!  We went with a small group and everyone enjoyed their ice cream.  However, the ice cream itself left something to be desired. I assume that the recipe and method is part of their 100+ year old legacy, but ice cream has come a long way in the last 100 years.  Definitely still go, just expect your grandma's ice cream.

Love the table service! I felt old-school just walking into the shop. 

We were greeted upon arriving and given a menu. Since it was my first visit I chose the classic hot fudge sundae with strawberries on the side. You can't go wrong! The fudge is deliciously rich and the ice cream on par. We also took a few chocolate covered pretzels home for later which were great.

This is a great date spot and Cincy classic!

I love this kitschy 50's diner style ice cream shop tucked back in the Oakley strip.  What a gem.  No mater what time I go, it is always busy, but we are always served promptly, with a smile. All of the ice cream flavors are good, but the real stars are the sundaes, floats, and malts.  If you eat in the store, everything is served in metal bowls or glass cups.
I do wish I had tried the chocolates before I left Cincinnati.

I've been going to this location since I was a little kid (for over 35 years)! It's part nostalgia of course, why I'm such a fan, but the candy is phenomenal, the ice cream amazing, and the service and staff are outstanding. I think their ice cream is better than Graeter's and the decor is very classic with a 1950's feel. They also have some unique smoothie and soda concoctions. Give this place a try!

I'm not a big fan of ice cream (lactose girl) but they had the BEST Strawberry Sorbet ive ever had! Like so good I could have had two bowls instead of just my one scoop bowl. 

I also looooove the décor in this place. It takes you back to the old days (like 1940's) ice cream shops where someone actually takes your order when dining in. So cute! I haven't had any of the candies yet but its sure to be on my list for my next trip!

I am so glad I found this place.  I had the best sorbet ever and the place is just incredibly adorable, it really takes you back in time.  The service is also great, staff is friendly and nice.  
I highly recommend it, you won't regret it!

The champagne sorbet is worth the trip by far.  
The double chocolate chocolate chip is awesome too.  
This time warp if a place is worth checking out and having a special treat. My understanding is that this is the one and only location, and it's a very cool place worth visiting.
Been here twice and always a great experience.  Plenty of parking and the quality and optionof the food is exceptional.  Three choices of chocolate syrup alone.

What an absolute gem.

Not only is Aglameis Bros the most adorably decorated ice cream shop in the area, but the ice cream is amazing. Everything is very old fashioned, simple, and tasty. If you sit inside there will be a staff member to take your order and bring you ice cream and there is ample seating indoors. If you prefer to take it outside or to go you can order at the counter. Definitely stay! 

We both had a sundae and they were all sorts of amazing. The portions are just right and everything was sweet and delicious. The employees working were so kind and friendly, it made the entire experience so wonderful!

My bother was coming to town and I asked him if there was anything he wanted to do. He checked Yelp, and asked me if Cincinnati really has this many ice cream and butcher shops. I replied that they do. He said this was the ice cream place he wanted to try.

I had the banana chip on a waffle cone. My hubby got a sundae and since he doesn't like nuts, got them on the side and gave them to me. Banana chip ice cream with walnuts on top was great. If the banana flavor had been bumped up just a little it would have been perfect. My hubby thought the pineapple mint sauce was far better then the black raspberry chocolate chip ice cream.  He said "the ice cream and whipped cream made my mouth feel like I had been licking butter." The kids scoops of ice cream come with the option of chocolate or rainbow sprinkles. My brother said it was nice. 

A fun experience.  The decor was adorable. Think old fashioned ice cream parlor. To go orders may be ordered at the counter, or have a seat, and a waiter will bring out a menu.  They also have a wide array of chocolates and candies.  This would be perfect for a date or even a little girl's birthday (if they do that.) Coming here and Blue Manatee bookstore a few doors down would be a great outing for a young child.

You gotta' love any place that has pink champagne ice cream, seriously! It's a quaint old fashioned soda fountain with glass cases of hand-dipped chocolates. When they have it, the pistachio is rich and creamy and positively laden with pistachios --mmm.
There are phosphates and sundaes of all stripes. A stroll back to the Edwardian era for sure. Lovely.

We went on a weekend at the beginning of summer and they were swamped. We were able to get a table, but had to wait a very long time for someone to come to our table and a very long time to get our ice cream. However, it's a very cool place that makes you feel like you've stepped back in time and the ice cream was amazing! Would definitely go back but would not pick a weekend night to do so!

If you're in Cincinnati and looking for ice cream, there are two great local options that people mostly go to: Graeter's and Aglamesis. In my opinion, you can't go wrong with either, but I prefer Aglamesis. 

Aglamesis has a great ambiance that brings you right back to the pre-1950's soda shop and ice cream parlor. The pink decor, marble countertops, and old school lighting has a *wow* factor that basically transports you to Cincinnati in the early 1900's. This place is over 100 years old, so just for nostalgia reasons you really should check it out!

The ice cream sundaes are really good. I love their hot fudge, so any of the ones with hot fudge are great. But my favorite thing to order here is their champagne sorbet. Their sorbet has a much creamier, softer texture than any other sorbet I've ever had...It truly is one of a kind. Their milkshakes are just ok in my opinion. I absolutely love that they serve all of their dishes in cute silver cups that look like they've been in use for 50 years.

Service is good. If you're dining in, just grab one of the tables in the back and a waitress will come take your order! Prices are a little high, but fair. Love this place!
Ordered a butter pecan waffle cone and it was the best butter pecan I've had in Cincy. This ice cream has vaulted to the top of my list and their menu seems to have a lot of options.

I'm a huge Graeter's fan. Huge. And that's not going to change. But I couldn't not try another Cincinnati ice cream. I take ice cream very seriously and need to investigate all options.

I orderd the brownie a la mode. But instead of one boring scoop of vanilla ice cream, I ordered once scoop of Black Raspberry Chip and Strawberry Chip. I usually don't get brownie sundaes at ice cream shops because I take brownies just as seriously as I take ice cream. And at most ice cream places the brownies are an after thought. They hope you won't notice that their sub-par brownie is cakey and dry because they've put their delicious ice cream on top. Well, that is certainly not the case here. Their brownies are so amazing that they are sold on their own. The consistency of this brownie is similar to fudge - super dense and rich. In my book, that's perfect. So smothering it in ice cream takes my dessert experience to a whole new level.

Now, the ice cream. If ice cream doesn't have chocolate chips, I'm probably not interested. This would explain why I love Graeter's as much as I do. And obviously, no one could possibly out do their chocolate chips. All other chocolate chips are average or even unacceptable next to Graeter's. That being said, Aglamesis chocolate chips are strongly decent. Well done. Based on the three flavors I tasted, Aglamesis ice cream definitely isn't as creamy as Graeter's or as creamy as I prefer my ice cream to be. However, it wasn't at all icy - it was perfectly smooth. And it had great flavor. The Strawberry Chip was probably my favorite, but the Black Raspberry Chip was definitely yummy as well. But I can't say I was crazy about the Double Chocolate chip. It wasn't quite rich enough for my tastes and the lack creaminess just didn't do it for me.
