All in all, Aglamesis is awesome and I will definitely go back and I will definitely get the Brownie a la Mode again. Probably with Strawberry Chip!

In my opinion the best thing about the place is the ambiance, the look of a 1950's malt shop. Reminds me of old family photos with my parents on 1 of their earliest dates or my grandparents out with the family on a 'ice cream night' to celebrate a special occasion! The ice cream is always great no matter what flavor you try. The service is sometimes inconsistent depending on the how busy they are. I have recommended the place to multiple people who always report being happy with their visit. I will continue to be a customer.
Such a cute place to enjoy some yummy ice cream. I had the hot fudge raspberry ice cream sundae. I like how they use an old fashion serving cup. The ice cream was delicious.
Close to home.  Better than the other guy with a good product.  Location allows for other shopping, like grocery, pet supplies vis Pet People, Kroger and a locally owned wild bird shop.

What's not to like? It's an old-school ice cream parlor with delicious ice cream made locally. The setting is always charming for dates. It's a pink, well-lit, mirrored room with a classic soda fountain and chandelier. The homemade candy counter provides a vast selection of delicious candies. I love the honeycombs. The outdoor seating is pleasant during summer.

I prefer cookies and cream ice cream with a side of hot fudge (to prevent melting the ice cream). They have table service which is a little strange, but that's kind of a traditional Cincinnati thing (see Skyline). They use lovely silver dishes for serving ice cream. It makes the experience just a little better.

Their shakes tend to be too thin for my taste but your mileage may vary.

This place has been and will always be one of my favorites. The ice cream is delicious (dare I say it.. better than Graeters!), and the staff is always friendly. The old timey charm is what makes this place a staple in Cincinnati. 
If you don't want ice cream, go in for the assorted chocolates and candies! Always a crowd pleaser :D
I had the coffee flavored ice cream and the texture was certainly unique. Fluffy and light. However, it was a little bit on the sweeter side. Nice little ice cream parlor in Oakley.

Delicious! Isn't that what you were looking for? You have come to the right place. From the moment you walk in, you will smell the sugar high that is about to take place. 

They have left its interior design very close to when it first opened. You can take a seat at the bar, a table or outside. Note: outside you have to pay for your treats before treating yourself. 

I was surprised to see such an extensive menu to pick from but finally landed on the Raspberry Chocolate with Fudge with vanilla ice cream to cut the sweetness and it was divine. 

There are other chocolates and sweets to pick from so beware the temptation if you have a sweet tooth or you are bringing kiddos who will want to grab all the sugary treats! Priced reasonable and I highly recommend.

I ordered a waffle cone with banana ice cream and cookies and cream. It was good, better than most, but not better than Graeters. They serve ice cream out of real bowls and with real spoons! I like the set up of the interior, but when packed full of people, I could see this being an issue as there is not a lot of space. The ice cream flavors that I tasted and sampled were flavorful, but not savory.

My visit to Aglemesis Brothers turned out to be rather anticlimactic. On the plus side, I appreciated both the friendly service and the retro atmosphere. Unfortunately, I cared for neither the ice cream nor the candy. I purchased black raspberry chip ice cream and some dark and milk chocolate sea salt caramels. The ice cream was cloyingly sweet and had odd particles of ice crystals in it. The quality of the chocolate in the ice cream and covering the caramels was mediocre.  

For those who say it's impossible to compare this place with Graeter's, I could not disagree more. Graeter's ice cream is creamy, just sweet enough, and their chocolate is superb. I'll stick with Graeter's!
A must visit for Easter candy. While you're there try their original ice creams.......better than Greaters in my opinion.
Such a great Cincinnati business! So much more fun then Graeters boring locations. We love going there on a hot day!

You walk in the door and two things hit you: The sea of pastel pink swimming everywhere, (the floor tiles, chairs, painted door frames.) And the scent. As if somehow, you, yourself, have become enrobed in chocolate, the sweetness of it is so thick in the air. 

 The long row of intricate milk and dark, fruit and nut, malted, mint and tons more of individually displayed chocolates line one whole side of the quaint, old-fashioned-in-a-charming way ice cream and candy shop. The creamy, most-delicious-chocolate-you'll-ever-taste-I-swear is what my husband and I visit Aglamesis for. For birthdays, our anniversary, Christmas stocking gifts, a Tuesday in July when the craving hits... The chocolate is like none other I've ever tasted, maybe because it's so fresh. They also have so many unique flavors, like chocolate-covered pineapple, one of my favorites, and truffles with super silky interiors. There's even a selection of sugar free though I haven't tried those.

As a side note, I'm not really into the ice cream here. I fall onto the Graeter's side. I taste-tested their champagne flavor and it was fresh & different, but overall find their ice cream to have an odd ice crystal texture. The chocolates are so good, 5 stars it is!

Topped off our afternoon out with a stop here to have some wonderful ice cream.  Had two scoops of fresh made strawberry and was transported back to my childhood where ice cream was simple, full of flavor and not of preservatives.  It was one of the best scoops of ice cream I've ever had.  Then I purchased a handmade chocolate covered peanut butter egg.  I'm horsing that away for a late night treat this weekend.  This is a trip back to the 50's ice cream parlor.  Go, you won't be disappointed.

If I'm sad or had a bad day, this is where I go. Not just for the comfort of amazing ice cream, shakes, truffles and more, but for the kindness of the staff and the odd feeling of traveling back in time. Thanks for always cheering me up!

An old fashioned ice cream parlor with metal boats and glass bowls! The ice cream was delicate and delicious, the whipped cream and syrups freshly made. Gives a very European feel! 
Update: visited in again. Simply the best!
What a cute old fashion ice cream parlor! Delicious ice cream and wonderful atmosphere make it a great little date spot.
A family favorite for over 50 years. We cannot celebrate without a trip here! Their hot fudge is the best in town. The candy counter makes for great gifts!
Love, love, love their ice cream!!!   Still has the old fashion charming decor and their chocolates are sooooo scrumptious they melt in your mouth!!

Let me get this out of the way. I don't mean to brag at all but I've just achieved double Sparta level as this is my 600th review. ha ha Phew... I've got a long way to go, but I've enjoyed getting this far and hope you appreciate Yelp as much as I do. Okay, down to business. 

Step inside and you're transported back in time to a circa '50's ice cream parlor with a great atmosphere and even better selection of sweet stuff. I loved my experience and had difficulty deciding on what to treat myself to, sampling the seasonal Pumpkin Pie (pretty good) and then settling on a two dip cup of black cherry and cookies and cream. The ice cream was great and can safely assume that all the other flavors available are equally as yummy. 

The main worker was friendly and answered all the questions I had, peppering in a few stories about the store and some of the clientele. I might have to assemble a group of ice cream lovers and attack the 8 scoop French Quarter Bonanza. It is served in a massive pimp cup of a glass and would be epic to finish.
Best place in the city for ice cream, sundaes and candy. The have table service if you'd like to enjoy your dessert inside. The decor on the inside makes you feel like you're stepping back in time.

I visited here for the first time last night. I tried the black raspberry chocolate chip ice cream and it was absolutely delicious. I love ice cream, and this is definitely the best that I have had around Cincinnati since my move down. The staff were friendly and helpful as well. Next time I plan to try some of their chocolates. If you're in the area, check them out!

Came here because I was not impressed with the store bought container and I actually was unaware that it was a local creamery. I thought that the idea was really cute and comfortable. It is a full service ice cream parlor, which you don't come by often. Everyone was dressed to the part and I loved the Cincinnati love it showed. The sundaes were to die for. So many to offer they were just very pricey!! Double dollar sign for sure for ice cream $$. 

Aglamesis is very easy to spot out along the street with their inviting pink décor and outside, and inside matches. My boyfriend got a chocolate malt and is was nothing but malt. A little disappointed because we were really not able to taste the ice cream because it was so malty and milky. On the plus side, they do offer you a lot of ice cream. They fill up a cute glass and then give you all the extra that was left in the mixing cup. The sundae I got was amazing! I was a brownie with fudge and caramel and pecans and whipped cream! It was a lot of toppings but again, not much ice cream, but it really was delicious. Overall it was a really good experience. I just wish I would have been able to get a real good taste of the ice cream, because I've heard such agreat things, rather than all the addatives.

Growing up behind the Aglamesis Bros. ice cream shop in Montgomery (and frequently visiting), this place has always been my favorite Cincinnati ice cream place. Their traditional French ice cream is made even sweeter with their pink soda pop parlor decor, and it is hard to pick just one handmade flavor to enjoy while visiting! 

I stopped by the Oakley shop after eating in the area with my boyfriend. We ordered one scoop of their Chocolate Chip and Chocolate Almond ice cream, and they were both decadently rich and delicious! We got out ice cream to go, but if you stay in the shop, they will serve you at one of their tables.

Excellent. I ordered a vanilla malt and my fiancé ordered a scoop of cookies 'n creme with a waffle cone. I hadn't been here in years and it was delicious. The malt was perfectly blended and super delicious. My fiancé's ice cream was also really good. This is a great Cincy spot for out of town-ers and is close to Oakley square and several lunch/dinner spots.
If you're looking for something "healthy" they have a good selection of what they call fresh fruit ice which is sorbet ice cream. I haven't tried it but with how good everything else is I'm sure it's delicious.

In Cincy for the weekend and was taken to this delightful little old fashioned ice cream parlor.  Two people at the counter had ice cream sodas that looked delicious, but I opted for the mocha chip in a sugar cone.  The coffee flavor was wonderfully intense with large chunks of chocolate.  Although Italy's divine gelato is always Number 1 for me, I'm not there.  In Cincy, this is very good ice cream.

Thieir ice cream is amazing. My favorite is banana chip and the chocolate covered oreos are awesome ! The shop itself kinda makes you you feel like your a ice cream shop from back in time. The staff is always inviting. I recommend anyone with a sweet tooth visit here! I always bring my guest here when I have company in town.
First visit over the weekend with my family. Took some time but the ice cream was worth the wait. We will be back to try something different.

Always have a great experience here! Just grabbed some to-go milk shakes. Noticed that they servers had tablets and the old antique cash register was gone. Sad that they're leaving their old fashioned roots!! It changes the experience for us a little!
Amazing Ice Cream and Chocolates. The customer service is always friendly and I love the old time feel of the place.

Stopped by here for the first time tonight and did not disappoint! I loved the old school vibe & all of the pale pink decor. My boyfriend ordered a scoop of the champagne ice cream and I ordered a scoop of the cream & cookies w/ sprinkles. Quick & friendly service, tasty ice cream, and pretty good pricing! I saw a lot of people trying some old school sundaes which will definitely be on my list next when we come back!

I'm an Aglamesis fan, I moved to Oakley several years ago so I could be close to their amazing ice cream. Walking in the front door and the aroma of handmade chocolate is incredible for all chocoholics like me and Double Chocolate Chip ice cream with belgian chocolate is the best!
Even better is the sundae with hot fudge and raspberry sauce which you can enjoy with the double chocolate chip ice cream heaven on earth!
Best ice cream in the city. Have never tried any of the chocolates from here, but everything always look good.

Compared to most people, I am not that crazy about ice cream. *Jaw drop* My weakness is cookies. (And chocolate and froyo and pudding and macarons). But I must admit that Aglamesis is one-of-a-kind. 

First, the store itself is so old-school. You actually sit down to order dessert from a menu. Color scheme is pink. All they need is a few booths to make it feel like you're back in the 50s. Cute place for a date, as many have probably figured out.

Then, you get to indulge in the most decadent French-style ice creams you could possibly get in the Midwest without taking it straight from the cow's udder. I ordered the Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip just to see how it compares to Graeter's, and holy COW... everyone's right--the flavor is so intense. I also got a scoop of the Champagne Sorbet, which was just OK in my book (others love it, apparently). I tried my friend's seasonal Peach ice cream, and it felt like fireworks went off in my head... amazing, amazing flavor.

Confession. I have a sweet tooth.  I get lost in the menu when I come here.  "Can I have one of each please?" is what I'd like to order.

Aglamesis has some pretty awesome ice cream sundaes.  You can also get old school ice cream floats and malts here.  Plenty of cookies and candies to choose from too.  Decorated with marble and tiffany lamps, you get a sense of how things were "back in the day".  It adds a lot of charm to this parlor.  

Truly one of my favorite places in Cincy.

First time at Aglamesis. (Yes, I know. Shame shame.)

Here's the thing.... I like Graeter's better. I like the big creamy chocolate-y chips that are sometimes the size of mini candy bars. Don't get me wrong, Aglamesis ice cream is yummy. It's delicious. It's creamy and wonderful - but no gargantuan chips :( 

So that is why they only get four stars. And I know man-friend tells me Graeter's and Aglamesis can't be compared and that they are equally good in their own right, but I can't help it! I grew up on Graeter's and I'm a chip snob. There, I said it. But I can also appreciate that it's different than Graeter's and that maybe sometimes I am in the mood for ice cream with less chip.

It's a super cute atmosphere and I love the "old ice cream store / soda shop" set-up they have. They also have a TON of chocolate to sell, that looked mouth-wateringly amazing. I had some of the salted chocolate covered caramel (be still my heart) and actually, I think I am going to go back and buy some as Christmas gifts for out-of-town friends! 

I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream. And chocolate. And this place has both - so considering the fact that those are my two favorite desserts - and that they held up against such fierce (Graeter's) competition, I'll be back. Midwest sure does know what's up when it comes to ice cream. Glad to be back!

Two words. Dutch Chocolate.    Or maybe Swiss Sundae. Or maybe Hand-dipped chocolates!  You can't find a place as special as this anywhere else in the world!  I wish you could smell the air filled with fabulous aromas of the candies and ice creams made on site. A must visit for any one that appreciates chocolates made the sincere way!

I LOVE the cute old-fashioned ice cream parlor decor of this place! One step inside and you are immediately surrounded by the amazing smells and sights of all of their chocolate, candy, and ice cream. They also had shakes, brownies, sundaes, and smoothies. YUM. It's such a bright and happy place, it just makes you feel like you were 5 again. I wanted everything!

Unfortunately, my metabolism is no longer that of a 5 year old and I cannot consume everything I lay my eyes upon. So for this first visit, I decided to tone down my inner 5 year old and ordered my usual: strawberry ice cream. 

Since we ate in, they served our ice creams on chilled ice cream bowls. There were nice pieces of strawberries in my ice cream, which is always a plus. The ice cream itself was good but not the best I've had. It was not as creamy and smooth as other places that I have tried and was also slightly sweeter than what my taste buds normally enjoy, but that just might be me. Nonetheless, I consumed my ice cream w/in the first minute and subsequently ended up watching my friends enjoy their mocha chip and mint chocolate chip ice cream (no artificial green coloring = win). 

I would definitely be back to try out their sundaes if I'm ever in the area again.

Holy marshmallow fluff Batman this place is amazing.  Forget Iowa and field of dreams, this place is heaven. I love this place so much I have to restrain myself from coming to blows at the ignorance of people who have never been here. That's how passionate I am about Aglamesis. And you should be too.

OMG. SWOON. 

This place is so great. Ice cream lovers unite and visit this Cincinnati staple. I came here for a standard ice cream cone and got a Brownie A La Mode instead. Best decision I've made all day. Dense chocolate brownie, two dips of ice cream, whoop cream, chocolate syrup, caramel syrup, and pecans in a cute glass ice cream dish. The service was great and super friendly. Eating in? You walk in and have a seat, then they bring you a glass of water and take your order. To go? Order at the counter. 

This place is everything a ice cream parlor should be. I won't be going to UDF for ice cream again for a while.

As a native Cincinnatian, I am embarrassed to say that I'd never been to Agalamesis nor had any Aglamesis ice cream til this past month. When I finally decided to go and try it out, I could not get over how cute the store was. Walking into the store, it's as if you stepped into a time machine. It's cute, retro and very pink. You can order at the counter for your ice cream to go. Or, you can take a seat at little tables towards the back and the servers will take your order. If you want something a little different, I would suggest a the ice cream sundae with coffee syrup. It isn't overly sweet with the slightly bitter coffee flavor. However, these sundaes do NOT come with whipped cream and a cherry on top.

Nostalgia can be an interesting phenomenon.  As we get older, I suppose all of us tend to look back with some envy at our youth.  Adulthood, and all of the responsibilities that come with it, tend to make us long those simpler times.  It's a form of escapism, or at least a chance to set aside our worries for just a short amount of time.

Walking in to Aglamesis, you are instantly confronted with that feeling that you've stepped out of today and back in to yesterday.  Here though, it's different.  There's nothing fake about the decor.  What's before you isn't a modern recreation, trying to manufacture those feelings of nostalgia in order to push a product.  This is real.  Genuine.  This is how it actually was, and not how someone wants you to believe things were in a past that never existed.

I order my favorite, mint chocolate chip in a sugar cone, from the counter.  Sitting down at a table, I take a bite.  Suddenly, I'm seven years old again.  I'm no longer at an ice cream parlor in Cincinnati, but instead back in my home town, sitting in a booth at my local ice cream parlor, enjoying the same treat on a weekend afternoon.

To me, Aglamesis' ice cream tastes just like the treat I enjoyed many years go.   It leans more toward the "ice" part of the term than "cream."  While it would be too far to call it gelato, it does sit in near-opposition to the creaminess of Greaters.  Each style has it's merits, and which I prefer tends to run with my mood at the time.  However, there's something about Aglamesis that strikes me differently whenever I eat it.  

I'm a full-fledged adult now.  Married, children, and all the responsibilities that come with those events.  If given the opportunity, I wouldn't give all of that up to go back to being a kid again.  But every once in a while it's nice to take a few minutes, just long enough to eat a sugar cone with mint chocolate chip, and revert.  I can think of no place in Cincinnati that can do that, with genuine sincerity, like Aglamesis.

This place is too cute to pass up when in Cincinnati! I enjoyed my New Orleans Royal sundae and my husband had a double chocolate sundae that he said was also very good. Prices are also very reasonable.

Can't go wrong with their banana chocolate chip ice cream. It tastes like eating a fresh banana. My friend had the strawberry sundae which had amazing homemade strawberry whipped cream. The atmosphere is like a trip back to yesteryear at an old fashion soda fountain. Very friendly staff. Much better than graeters, by far!

A friend always gives me chocolate from here, so I was excited to finally visit. Everything is made in house, and the ice cream is fabulous! Some of the furnishings are a little tired, and the floor could use a serious cleaning (feels very slippery) but the history of the place and the experience makes it barely noticeable. 

Eat some ice cream and then buy some chocolates for later. Malted milk balls, chocolate covered raisins, and chocolate covered coffee beans are all delicious!

Adorably pink ice cream shop! This is such a throwback to the old school ice cream shops. They have a great selection of candies and chocolate confections also.  Lots of flavors to choose from, and its sold in some local Kroger stores! Try the cinnamon in the fall, YUM!!
Amazing staff, ice cream and candy!! This place has a classic ice cream parlor feel and is wonderful for the family!

Such a cute cozy ice cream place. Loved loved the interiors and the fact that they have not modernized the architecture. Just ate a ice-cream, wanted to satisfy the craving. But looking at the menu, will definitely visit multiple times !! Bonus - great hours!!!
great for ice-cream... great staff and more than 100 years old shop .... with wide variety of ice cream options.

I have not been here in a few years, but my grandfather used to take my grandma here when he was courting her back in the 1920's, and then he took his kids in the 1930's and 40's ( my mamma and her sisters) and then they took all of us cousins ( in the 60's until the present). . 

Now we take our kids.Four generations of Cincinnati descended German kiddos, we love this  Greek ice cream place and it's hard cookies, yummy chocolate confections, and it's frozen delicacies.

This is the stuff old fashioned ice cream parlor dreams are made of. 

My mamma used to get marshmallow sundaes here with vanilla ice cream, but I leaned towards hot fudge myself, even in my teeny tiny beginnings. 

The peach ice cream doesn't really Go with hot fudge, so I always talked some poor cousin into it so I could have a bite. 

Yum.

I have been coming to Aglemesis Bro's for years (aka since I first came to Cincy).  I am not a huge dessert person, but I love this place.  The store and the decor are on point.  It is old fashioned and comfortable.  It really reminds me of a scene out of an old 80s movie.

The ice cream is also pretty good.  I am no connoisseur but from what I get, its not as heavy as Graeters.  I would argue that this is a positive for me.  My favorite is the pistachio, but this is only seasonal.  Else the last time I went, I thought it was the best strawberry ice cream I had ever had.  It was nom nom delicious!

I give it 5 stars, because Its a go to spot for me to bring new people in from out of town.

Aglamesis Brothers is my favorite place in all of Oakley.  The ice cream is great, even better than Graeters as far as I am concerned, and the candies are underrated.  It is like several other reviewers have said, like stepping into piece of the distant past

If you do think Graeters is better, there is a Graeters about a half mile away in Hyde Park.  Get a dish of ice cream from both places, and try them side by side.  I am certain if you do so that Graeters will come in a close second.

My favorite item here is the hot fudge sundae with extra nuts and extra whipped cream, but I also like to take home some of the opera creams they make here

The large filled "eggs" they make for Easter are a family favorite

You generally wont be able to park in front, but there is a public parking lot on the same block

Let me start this review off with this simple fact, I LOVE ICE CREAM. Remember that kid when you were little that you would see chasing the ice cream truck across the neighborhood? That was me. But Aglamesis Bros is different, and takes ice cream to a whole new level. What I loved most about this place was the ice cream experience they offered. When you enter the parlor there's retro pictures and items, you feel like you are transported to the 60s, back when going to the ice cream parlor was THE Friday night activity.
There's a lot of discussion between which is better, Aglamesis Bros or Graeter's, but frankly they are just different. Graeter's is known for the delicious chunks of chocolate in their ice cream, while Aglamesis boasts rich and creamy ice cream. You really can't go wrong with either, but if you haven't tried one, you must.

Awesome old fashioned ice cream and chocolate parlor.  You can sit on old fashioned stools at the marble counter or at a few small tables and be served.

Ice cream is good but not as good as Graeters.  I had the mocha chip and mint chocolate ship sundae with banannas, hot fudge, walnuts and chocolate whipped cream that must have been put on the bottom since I didn't see it.   Didn't see any chocolate in the ice cream (like Graeters).  I have had their ice cream before and definitely saw chips. 

All the chocolates looks scrumptious!

Local legend! Old school ice cream with old school service and flair. Definitely worth a stop if you've never been, everything they do is delicious. But don't go looking for some wild and out there flavors, they keep things very traditional, everything on the menu has been tested and proven to be tasty!

Summary: If you've found Graeter's too be a little too thick, with chocolate chips that are too chunky, you've probably already discovered Aglamesis. This ends up a battle of texture and ambiance based on preferences - try both! Can't go wrong!

Aglamesis is styled like an old fashion ice cream parlor and has a lot of old fashioned ice cream parlor selections from Italian sodas to milkshakes. Truth be told, I find the decor cute, but it feels a little messy for my liking. The seating area is to the back of the restaurant which didn't feel as well lit, though it might just be how nice of a day it was outside.

In one word, the ice cream here is  - delicious. The ice cream served here is different than that at Graeter's. I'd classify both as premium ice cream, creamy in texture. I think Aglamesis is more creamy/less stiff than Graeter's. I find Aglamesis's ice cream to be sweeter than Graeter's and has more reasonable sized chocolate chips. As a result I prefer Graeter's, but end up at Aglamesis because the atmosphere is so special.

The waffle cones are made in house, which is delicious. I have not tried the Italian soda, but intend on one of these days. 

This is a historic shop with a very good ice cream product - try it!

Glad I made the trip down to Oakley while in town from Chicago. A lot of memories from this location and I remember my brother coming home with his pink shirt on with pints of delicious ice cream.

How cool that they are celebrating 100 years at this location this month. My brother worked here 40 years ago and the original location was in my folks hometown of Norwood.

I saw they carried their ice cream out at my first stop in town, Blue Ash Chili and now understand some of the local Kroger's carry some of their flavors too. 

It's such a treat to come in, sit down and have a glass of water brought over with a menu and a friendly hello. Of course I just had to have my childhood favorite, mint chip. I really love the subtle difference in taste here from Graeter's, which is now available in Chicago.

The trick is to always get it in a cup so you can let it soften up just enough to have the flavors pop. The other trick is no cheating and tasting it too early, as it's so dang good.

Cute little ice parlor that's been opened since 1908. They have a good variety of ice cream flavors such as pistachio, banana nut, strawberry chocolate chip, etc. They also have sorbet, Italian soda, variety of chocolates, truffles, and milkshakes. I will have to come back to try strawberry lemonade sorbet. We got the strawberry choc chip and pistachio on a waffle cone. You can see real strawberry chunks in the ice cream. It was quite good!

Such a nostalgic little ice cream parlor.  The black raspberry chocolate chip
Ice cream was wonderful I can't wait to come back!!!

This is my favorite ice cream parlor in Cincinnati.  The ice cream is really good and I have been enjoying it since I was a child. When I was younger, my favorite flavor was the Banana and I still love it but with age it has become harder to pick a favorite. Not long ago I tried the Butterscotch and it was amazing, though it was very sweet so be warned. My wife loves the Mocha Chip and I agree that it is one of their best flavors. I also really like the Dutch Chocolate. They also do seasonal flavors like Black Cherry or Red Raspberry and hard to find flavors like Rum Raisin.  I often pick up a couple pints and take them home but sometimes we stop in to enjoy a treat and sit inside. All the ice cream is made in small batches in the back. They also make their own chocolates and candies. They have a full case of chocolates and candies and you can purchase them one at a time or as a box of assorted ones.

One of the greatest things about Aglamesis is the experience. The outside of the building is light pink and as soon as you step inside it feels like you went back in time. Tiffany lamps, marble paneling, cute little tables and chairs, and employees in older styled uniforms. It may be the only ice cream parlor left like this in the world. If you eat inside they serve you ice cream in old fashioned stemmed metal dishes. This is a fantastic way to enjoy a banana split or a sundae. I highly recommend this to anyone that has never been. They also have great floats and even a good coffee frappe.

And with regard to the Cincinnati discussion of whether Aglamesis or Graeter's is better, I always choose Aglamesis! I personally think that Graeter's focuses too much on the chocolate chips and not enough on the ice cream. While Aglamesis offers some flavors with chocolate chips, I mostly prefer flavors without.

People who boast Graeter's as the best Cincy ice cream have never tried Aglamesis Bros before. Located in Oakley, this ice cream parlour has an old world feel while maintaining good service and prices. Everything is deliciously homemade. The only reason I'm giving it four stars is because although the building is historic, the inside seems like it wasn't taken care of as best it could have. It'd be good to see it restored with better care.
cute place for a dessert date. brownie sundae was delicious and the two scoops sundae looked incredible. friendly service. cute decor and plenty of different options to satisfy the sweet tooth

I love this spot- traditional soda fountain charm with exemplary options. My company used Aglamesis a few times to send out corporate gifts and they are SPEEDY and the wrapping is beautiful. But the little shop is fantastic as well. Their candy options cannot be beat, seriously the best chocolate covered pretzels ever and they are the bigger sized ones, too! And then there's the ice cream. Normal ice cream- fantastic. But also they have all these frozen ice sherbet things including CHAMPAGNE. I just love this little sweet spot.

Perfect cap to a date night.  The service is sweet when there isn't a busy line forming.  We got fruit smoothies (raspberry banana / pineapple banana) and per request a banana chocolate chip ice cream.  Haven't found a lot of options for smoothies but this place does a great job.  It was definitely a mouthful of sweet indulgences that I would like to come back to when I can.  Less sweet than Graeters and a cute place for a date night.  You have my attention.  I will definitely be coming back here again.

Came here the other night for dessert following dinner at Bakersfield, it was our first time having Aglamesis, and yes I have lived in Cincinnati my entire life. It was very good, since it was our first time, we ordered a scoop of vanilla, my brother a hot fudge sundae, and I ordered a basin sundae containing vanilla and chocolate ice cream with fudge sauce. 

I like how you order at the table and the employees bring the ice cream out, like at a normal restaurant, plus the ice cream is served in a silver dish. 

Very nice shop and employees with a lot of history, I will be in again, I however like another Cincinnati ice cream over this.

The ONLY Cincinnati ice cream to crack the top 5 list in Gourmet and other prestigious food magazines, Aglamesis ice cream is made the old-fashioned way and with only the best ingredients.  You don't get mass-produced ice cream here, because natural, pure ingredients do not fit with mass production.  But, you do get everything you want from ice cream: rich, creamy, appropriately intense flavors and, best of all, they take adding chocolate chips VERY seriously.  They also make to-die-for chocolates, which explains how they do chocolate in their ice cream so wonderfully.  Aglamesis is a Must-Stop for a real Cincinnati experience.
I got the brownie a la mode. It's normally perfection , however today they missed the mark.  The brownie wasn't fresh and thruway didn't warn the brownie up.

Very cute place, but the ice cream here is really poor. Tastes of a very low level of butter fat. The chocolates look good but I can't comment since I haven't tried them. Your local UDF has tastier ice cream treats.

I must admit I'm a born and bred Graeter's girl so it took me a bit to warm up to this place but I'm not sure why I ever resisted.  Some of the menu offers overlapping flavors but I've learned to appreciate each place for what they do best.  I'll stick with Graeter's for the Cookies and Cream but I could eat Aglamesis Black Raspberry Chip all day long.  
The charm and history of this place rocks.  They are generous with samples and service is always great.  Walking here is one of the best parts about living in Oakley!
Wow!! So good!  The ice cream is absolutely delicious and the interior, early 20th century, is absolutely gorgeous!

There's something about their ice cream that is so light and refreshing. It's not overwhelmingly sweet or heavy and they have all your classic flavors. I appreciate that they keep the classic old timey, polished ice cream parlor interior in each of their locations and it always makes me feel all warm and cozy when I step inside. My absolute favorite ice cream flavor here is the banana.. literally like eating a banana but 10x better!! They've also got other novelty ice cream parlor items as well as a chocolate/candy counter. If you haven't been here, stop by and you'll be in for a treat.. literally, a very yummy treat : )

The staff is phenomenal and the environment and history can't be beat.  They are currently celebrating 100 years in Oakley. We were seated and got water quickly. Their service was great and our bourbon sundae and mint chocolate shake were great. We'll be back soon.

This is a cool, throw-back type of place to the old Fountains that existed back in the day.  Even the attire worn by the servers are vintage.  They have a ton of things to choose from (cones to banana splits).  They also have an area where you can purchase some chocolates.  This place has a history, which makes it cool to visit for me.  The ice cream is just ice cream for me.  If I need a little nostalgia, then I will stop in again.  Otherwise, I will visit some other place for dessert.
Way better than Greaters. Must try the Banana Chocolate Chip and the pistachio ice cream! SO good!

Aglamesis ice cream parlor is ESSENTIAL for a visit to Cincinnati. Growing up, this was one of my favorite ice cream places in town. Yes Graeters is good, but Aglamesis should be getting as much hype!

What's not to love about an old-fashioned soda shop decorated parlor. There is only one location! The tiled floor and old lighting fixtures are gorgeous. The little wrought iron parlor chairs and tables really make it. You can also sit on the stools at the gorgeous marble counter.

They sell ice cream , sundaes, and milkshakes, but also have a candy counter with various chocolates and candy specialties. 

What are you waiting for!!!!!!!! GO!

This little gem was a highlight of my trip to Cinci. I've never been to an old fashioned ice cream spot like this. The service was superb! My pineapple pecan ice cream served in a beautiful metal bowl thingie was scrumptious! My husband had raspberry and chocolate combo, and we couldn't decide whose flavor was better. On the way out, we decided to buy a box of chocolates (great value btw), and the delicious journey continued at home in Chicago, where we would taste a couple pieces every day and remember our brief moment of bliss at Aglamesis Bro's.

This is the cutest ice cream shop you'll find yourself in Cincinnati. It has the feel of the 1950s and is family friendly. It feels like utopia. 

The ice cream is one of my favorites in Cincinnati. They have all the right flavors (banana too!). The ice cream is lighter then other Cincinnati favorites which is why I love it so much. The chips are plentiful and in every bite. I tend to get flavors other than vanilla or chocolate but when they were offering their free ice cream for the 100th anniversary I tried both. Both plain vanilla and chocolate were superb. I may order a plain chocolate scoop next time I'm there. It was that good!

The only thing I wish there could be more of is outdoor seating. We tend to stop by while walking our dog and it can be busy at times. The dog loves stopping for ice cream too because there are always other dogs around and a water bowl to quench his thirst.

Love the coffee frappe! Sincere nectar awesome! Root beer float a way way too sweet and syrupy and not enough fizz.  They are great at making sure you like what you ordered so be sure to try a few things out.
Great place.  Always buy chocolates and gift cards here for Christmas!

I have been looking forward to coming here for quite a long time but was mostly disappointed. Instead of the quaint vintage look the pictures show it mostly feels run down and a bit on the dirty side. We sat inside and the table had a bit of a mildew smell. The paint is peeling off the panels. It has a lot of promise with the original marble but the place needs some serious TLC. Absolutely loved the description of the sundaes. Very fun. The ice cream however was just OK for me. I am not a huge Greater's fan either so I won't compare them. The phosphate was a fun item but came out very sweet. The Butterbeer was the same. Our sundae was good. Nothing I will crave though. The chocolate were quite good. We might be back for more of those.

A beautiful local spot that offers a sweet treat for everyone. Step back in time to a french cafe for a couple of scoops of home made ice cream and chocolates. This store is like an old soda fountain and candy store mixed. The ice cream tastes super fresh and is served in a quaint little frosted metal dish. They have a very awkward bathroom but other than that this place is a must visit!!

Hands down best frozen treat / soda fountain / confection / ice cream / candy shop in Cincinnati.  I dare you to find a shop that tops Aglamesis.  We have been multiple times now and I'm fairly certain on at least two different occasions Jim Aglamesis waited on us himself!

From the cute outfits the friendly staff wears to the beautiful decor of their turn-of-the century shop, Aglamesis Bros does everything right.  

I love the fact that they have a counter but if you are eating in, grab a chair.  "We'll get you a menu and a glass of water."  The choices are plentiful and the service is lightning quick.

We've had the fruit ices on a hot day and been relaxed within moments without ever the fear of brain freeze or chunks of bland ice.  Smooth and flavorful throughout.

We've had rich delicious seasonal ice creams and had our tastebuds transported to heaven... so smooth you'd think you were eating frozen cream.... oh wait you are!!

I'm oh so tempted by the candy, but have yet to sample, but if it is anything like the frozen treats... I'd be smitten for sure!

Overall, skip the crowded Graeter's in hyde park and drive the 3 minutes or so to oakley square and get some true cincinnati flavor!

If you are the best in town at what you do, you get five stars. That's right Aglamesis Bros. is my favorite Cincinnati ice cream. I love the other heavy hitter in town, but Aglamesis' Swiss Raspberry Saundae is where it's at when I have a sweet tooth. The Oakley location's ole timey soda jerk type atmosphere is a welcomed blast back to a simpler time. If you need to change things up for your next ice cream outing, Algamesis might be the right spot.

This place could coast by on atmosphere alone. So adorable! I wish I had kids just so I could take them here.

We just ordered a plain vanilla cone, an excellent judge of any ice cream parlor's worth. It was tasty. This is definitely light, airy, American style ice cream. Not eggy, not dense. There were little vanilla flecks and a pleasantly milky flavor. I'm partial to creamier, eggier ice creams, but for what it was (an all American ice cream parlor!) it was spot on.

Also tried the cinnamon, which had a pronounced cinnamon flavor, but was a too bit grainy...

The girl behind the counter told me they'd been at that location since 1915 and in buisness for 101 years. Wow! They also make all their ice cream and chocolates on site. Didn't try the chocolates, but they were cute. 

Next time, I want a sundae or something just to enjoy the adorable, old school dishes...
Great ice cream, but if you go here make sure to sit down and get yourself one of their amazing sundaes! very cute and classic vibe.

Minus one star because this isn't NEAR the best ice cream in the area.  Just upfront, Graeter's is better.  And Bruster's is better (on the westside, I suggest you try it, a bloomington, IN fav).

But the ice cream is still really good.  And what you miss by not being "the best ice cream in the world," this location makes up for in adorable cutesiness and...well...location.

I don't end up in this part of Cincinnati often.  But when I do, I end up wandering around the whole area because of all the wonderful little shops.  There's only one way to end such a day (or take a midday break) and that is with ice cream.  They are ideally located across the strip of cute stores.  They are impossible to resist.

And it's just so...damn...cute.  It borders on kitsch with the level at which it remains unchanged from the "good old days."  And while I not so secretly want to hate it (pink pinstripes...ewwww), the nostalgia of the long gone days before I was even born just takes over my brain.  Because everyone wants to sit at a "soda fountain" and reminisce about their adolescence a la "It's a Wonderful Life."  It's just pink and white instead of black and white.

So, I won't drive out of my way to get ice cream here.  But I will make many excuses to go somewhere near this ice cream shop and then have to get ice cream before I leave the area.
This is the best ice cream in Cincinnati.  There is no contest.  I am not a huge Graeter's fan, so I was very happy to find that this place lives up to the recommendations.

I was lucky enough for my boss to take me here for a quick meeting a few weeks ago. Not only is it super cute, and has wonderfully friendly staff, but I really enjoyed my Mocha Frappe. You can tell just buy looking at and smelling their desserts that they are  very high quality. My Frappe was deliciously rich and creamy! Can't wait to go back and try a specialty sundae.

Let me start with the fact that I don't love ice cream. It's good, but I fancy myself more of a French fry person than one who, say, enjoys sweets. Therefore, if you want to keep reading this review, let's do it! Otherwise, if you don't trust my non-discerning opinion, feel free to check out (see also: you should keep reading if only for fun).

That said, it should be no surprise that I've not been to Aglamesis Brothers in my 27+ years of life. Just this past weekend, Date and I decided that needed to be changed.

Location: planted amid the hustle and bustle of Oakley Square, Aglamesis Brothers (it's written Bros., so I will continue to write and pronounce it as "Bros"), an ice cream confectionery boasting a pink facade, couldn't have earned a much better location for its shoppe (I feel like it deserves the English spelling, no?). With a number of restaurants surrounding it, Aglamesis lends its perfectly dessert-like hand in a convenient location for post-meal delicacies. If you're looking to check it out after a delicious meal in the Square, walking is perfectly doable. If not, a number of parking spots are available in lots and on the street as well. 

[Pre-Aglamesis Bros meal suggestions in the Square: Oakley Pub for a burger, Habit's Café for any of its extensive menu, Baba India, Boca for pricier fare and valet parking, Maribelle's for a burger or brunch, or even Skyline or Dewey's for more popular chain restaurants.]

Atmosphere: Sitting inside of this ice cream parlor, I felt like I was either auditioning for or had a small role in The Music Man. That's not necessarily a bad thing (I happen to really enjoy that movie); merely an observation. The interior decor is home-like and comfortable, if a little kitschy (read: way too much pink). It truly feels like a confectionery, complete with plenty of ice cream options, pastries, and candies (we got the 12-Flavor Gummy Bears which were delicious).

Food: In standard ice cream form, I opted for one dip French Vanilla and one dip Holland Dutch Chocolate on a sugar cone overturned into a bowl (if an ice cream place can't master the originals, what's the point?). I could have easily done without the French Vanilla, as it was nothing to blog home about. The chocolate was very good, though, even if it reminded me a ton of Graeter's. Date decided on Mocha Chip in a rainbow jimmy-dipped waffle cone. He seemed to enjoy it, despite the ice cream making its way through the cone opening at the bottom (this was his only vocal complaint--he's kind of quiet though, so what do I know?). Next time I go, I decided I will get Banana Chocolate Chip, mostly because I've never seen it elsewhere, and secondly because they were out last time I was there (probably a good thing--it wouldn't have been awesome to have to choose between my "regular" and that).

Overall Grade: C+ [out of a possible A+]  -- rounded up to a 4 for Yelp rating purposes.

I'm really glad I finally got to try this place. While I don't particularly love ice cream (especially of the scoop persuasion), it was good enough (read: above average) and I'm sure I'll be back in the future. If you like Graeter's, you must check this place out.

True european ice cream. The flavours are insanely great and pure. You can taste the pistachios or coconuts, not just the pistachio flavoring. And ice cream with the whipped chocolate cream is paradise to the palate. It's one of the best in the US and of course close to the ones I had in France and Italy.
I had a vanilla ice cream sundae with a fresh raspberry sauce and homemade whipped cream. Perfect proportions of everything. Such a memorable experience in a beautiful old fashioned ice cream parlor.
Worth going out of your way to visit. Like a little step back in time in one of the more enjoyable parts of Cincinnati.

I love their adorable little 1950s atmosphere so much. I love the display cases of unique sweets lining the walkway to the back, with the caramellows, chocolate crosses, and French chocolates being among my favorites. I love that they serve ice cream in lifted metal bowls, so that you only need concern yourself with bringing the spoon to the ice cream and then to your mouth.

The ice cream itself is icier and sweeter than Graeter's, and that's what I love about it too. The flavor also seems more intense. I got the mocha chip and was pleased by the completely pure taste of coffee, and the sizeable chunks of chocolate in every bite.

I was a first timer, and wow was I surprised when I arrived inside. They have so many different styles of chocolates and also they have some great ice cream flavors. I will come back for sure. It reminds me of an old fashioned ice cream parlor. Great service!

A timeless establishment that provides outstanding sweets and service. I would come here as a kid in the 80's riding my bike through Oakley with my cousin.  The quality is still amazing!  This is truly the BEST ice cream in Cincinnati.
Great place to take kids for an ice cream or treat. And their dark chocolate raisins, sea salt caramels and dark chocolate non pareils are amazing!!

Quite literally the best ice cream I have EVER tasted -- hands down! I miss this place so much. 
Might schedule a trip back just for this...
If you need a refreshing stop in the summer, this is the place! A scoop of banana chocolate chip and pineapple pecan ice cream in a waffle cone is unbeatable!
Friendly staff, delicious ice cream and candies, clean and cute. What more can you ask for from an ice cream shop?

I honestly have to say that I'd never been to Aglamesi's prior to last weekend, but at the suggestion of a couple friends, decided to indulge.  I love the interior - definitely has an Old Fashioned decor, complete with imported Italian Marble table tops.  Choose a table, and a hostess comes over with a complementary glass of water and menus.  There are not as many flavors as other places, so if that's your thing, you should probably go elsewhere.  I settled on a dip each of double chocolate chip and mint chocolate chip in a dish.  Of the two, the mint chocolate chip was the hands down favorite - very minty, which I loved!  The price wasn't too bad - about $4  , which is about what you pay for two scoops in a dish at Graeter's. 

The store has a huge candy selection, which thanks to generous friends, I was able to sample some.  I highly recommend the chocolate covered pretzel covered with peanut butter chips!

I had the seasonal peach flavor, which had the perfect amount of sweetness and fruity flavor. But the star of the show was the strawberry whipped cream-- so tasty.  It tasted a lot better than the chocolate whipped cream in my opinion.  Aglamesis is cute, old-fashioned, good place for a date or taking kids out of ice cream.  As for Aglamesis vs. Graeter's-- I'm not sure, I love both-- I just love ice cream. But the flavored whipped cream will keep me coming back for more.

Oh Aglamesis, how I miss you.  My husband and I loved stopping in for ice cream when we lived in Oakley - your ice cream was one of my favorite things in Cincinnati.  I was never a Graeter's kinda girl (I hope its safe to say that now that I don't live there anymore).   

I loved your super cool old school ice cream parlor - truly genuine and not contrived.  And your tasty, freshly-flavored ice cream.  Mint chocolate chip in a waffle cone (oh so very minty and delicious).  

Perhaps one day if I find myself in the Queen City I'll get to visit again.
This place is so cute! It has an old fashioned vibe to it which is extremely cute. The ice cream is soooo good.. I love the banana flavor ice cream! It's a unique flavor

Just wow...  I mean, what can I write that will convince you that this is awesome ice cream?  Just go... now...  I had chocolate chocolate chip with strawberries and whipped cream...  oh, if I had a bowl of it now!

GO NOW! (as Hannibal Lecter says)
This place is AMAZING! It makes me sad that a lot of people have never heard of this place. BEST ICE CREAM EVER! If you like malts, this place makes them the best. Hands down.
You can tell its age, but its old charm and good service make it fun. Ice cream is better than Graeter's and NO CHIPS! Great for a date and they actually have table service.

Everybody has a calling. Something that they are meant to do. For some people like Paul McCartney it's to make awesome music. For others like Mike Brown, it's to run a major league sports team into the ground. For the Aglamesis brothers, it's to produce decadent chocolate candies and extraordinary ice cream.

Not familiar with the Aglamesis Bro's shop in Oakley? Let me paint you a picture. Imagine if you will homemade ice cream served to you 1950s countertop style in a silver dish. And not just any ice cream. Creative and celestial flavors fit for a god like banana chocolate chip ice cream. And cinnamon ice cream. Imagine also that you can turn any one of their 20+ flavors of ice cream into a kickass sundae. And not just any ice cream sundae but sundaes that make UDF sundaes look like the ice cream bar at Golden Corral.

Ice cream not your thing? How about a 15 foot long case filled with blissful orgasmic chocolate candies. And not just any average candy. I'm talking about delectable chocolates that make Hershey and Dove chocolates taste like your grandmother's sugar free diabetes candy. Seriously, there is bourbon soaked cherry cordials, dark chocolate sea salt caramels, and award-winning chocolate covered creams.

With every day that passes my calling becomes more clear to me than ever. Meet one of the Aglamesis sisters and make her my wife. And then live out a long jubilant life filled with banana ice cream, bourbon soaked cherry cordials, and happiness.

"Ba-ba-ba-ba-ba-nana 

ba-ba-ba-ba-ba-nana 

banana-ah-ah (ba-ba-ba-ba-ba-nana) 

potato-na-ah-ah (ba-ba-ba-ba-ba-nana)

banana-ah-ah (ba-ba-ba-ba-ba-nana) 

togari noh pocato-li kani malo mani kano chi ka-baba, ba-ba-nana 

yoh plano boo la planonoh too ma bana-na la-ka moobi talamoo 

ba-na-na ba-ba (ba-ba-ba-ba-banana) POH-TAAA-TOH-OH-OH (ba-ba-ba-ba-banana) 

togari noh pocato li kani malo mani kano chi ka-ba-ba, ba-ba-nanaaaaah!"

- Despicable Me 2 Teaser Trailer.

Seriously. this song was made for the banana ice cream here. 

The minions would be so happy.

Wow, just wow!  If you have a sweet tooth, this is your place to die and go to heaven in.  The store is located in downtown Oakley on Madison Road.  The interior is a throwback to the old fashioned ice cream parlors plus a whole side of the store devoted to a large variety of chocolate and chocolate dipped goodness.  It was hot out today so I treated my team to hot fudge sundaes.  Large portions of homemade vanilla ice cream and a hot fudge to die for!!!  The accept major credit cards (including AMEX which gives them major points in my book) and cash.  They have so many flavors of ice cream that I will need to visit more often and try them all.

This place is a throwback to brilliant ice cream joints from days gone by... The recipe is so freakin' smooth and the flavors are amazing... I know most have an affinity for that Graet Ice Cream joint Cincy is most known for but, I love this place, it's authenticity and its tasty treats.  It definitely gives that other joint a run for it's money...

Y'know I once told a patron, at a previous job I held up the road, that I prefered Aglamesis taste and texture to that of the other joint (when they asked specifically for my favorite) and don't you know as I stood, with stars in my eyes, recollecting my last visit, that Richard "you know who", the president of that other joint, was standing right freakin' next to me... Smiling... 

He introduced himself, shook my hand and thanked me for my honesty when I explained that, "I calls 'em like I tastes 'em..." Just sayin'...

While the taste and quality may be the same as in years past, the presentation is pitiful. I suggested to my daughter to stop today to get a half pound of my wife's favorite expecting the famous pink box but got six pieces individually wrapped in plain old aluminum foil - no logo or name.   Not even close to what I expected and I won't get fooled again!

The reason I love Aglamesis is not because of their ice cream, but because of their "ices". The sorbets are the best in town and always fresh and flavorful. The champagne ice is one of my favorites and always a good pick me up that doesn't make me feel as terrible about myself as ice cream. It's like a fat free, frozen wine (not really alcoholic by the way) of happiness.

Not to say their ice cream isn't good - it really is. Their chocolate is nice, smooth, and dark. Their peppermint is my second favorite in town.

The store itself is too adorable to be true and very old fashioned. It's a great place to shoot some photos in the area because it is so well maintained and set up. Service is always good.

Definitely worth stopping by. For experience and atmosphere, this beats out any other ice cream parlor around.

It doesn't get any better than this!  Graeter's pales in comparison to Ag's.  Aglamesi's ice cream doesn't have that greasy taste to it nor the waxy texture to the chocolate chips.  All flavors are crazy tasty, but I love the mint chocolate chip - you can tell its made with real mint because its not a crazy radioactive artificial green color.  My dad also claims that their butterscotch ice cream is by far the best he's had in his whole life - and he's a connoisseur of butterscotch.  

Which brings us to the toppings - wow!  The butterscotch is amazing, but i love the option of marshmallow cream or whipped cream.  The whipped cream is great because they make it by hand, but also because they'll flavor is for you - chocolate whipped cream, mint whipped cream... the possibilities are endless!

The candy is by far the best in Cincy.  AND they offer a wide variety of sugar free candies for my diabetic friends - which is amazingly difficult to find in Cincy.  The easter eggs are my favorite - try the opera cream.

And to top it all off - the shop is just about the most uplifting and charming place, a throw back to the "old time" soda shops.  You can have wait service or buy it by the pint - either way its tasty!

This gem in Oakley is surprisingly unknown to even locals. I have a feeling people keep this secret to themselves should popularity somehow corrupt the purity of Aglamesis Bros'. 

On a recent visit I bought a bag of malted Easter eggs and am now too spoiled to ever crave store bought ones again. I love the sampler boxes because they prevent an indecisive gal like me from spending an hour gawking at the tantalizing display case.

If you're looking for a unique Mother's Day or Valentine's Day (or any day for that matter) gift, a little sweet treat from Agalmesis would be perfect. 

Another recommendation is that their lunch sandwiches are very tasty. I really enjoyed the chicken salad, but the turkey and cheese was good as well. Nothing fancy, just fresh bread and high quality ingredients. 

My only minor critique is that the lemonade is very tart. Almost too tart for my liking, though that may just be a matter of taste.
Best ice cream in Cincinnati, make that the country. It is truly divine, my family has been coming forever, no one does it better.

A little too rich for my tastes. I got the mint chocolate chip and the mint was so intense it tasted like toothpaste so I stole my boyfriends cookies and cream and it was fabulous. 

Very cute date spot. Awesome architecture. Love the family history so I will continue to support them.

Don't get me wrong, I love sitting in the Graeter's in Hyde Park square casually eating a scoop of mocha chip after school with some pals. However, nothing comes close to doing that same thing in Aglamesis.
 As said before, the atmosphere is what makes this place. Sitting back, chatting with girlfriends in the retro seating area drinking an old time seltzer soda is what truly sets this place apart. I could sit here all day simply reminiscing the stories and gossip that has been told around the tables whilst drinking a delicious mocha chip soda. 
 Yes, I said mocha chip soda. It's delicious - try it. My dear Maddy swears by the lime soda, but I wouldn't suggest it for the weak stomachs. It's a pretty intense concoction.
 Aglamesis is in a perfect area. There's nothing like a spring day in which you grab a bite at Habits, check out the toy and furniture stores surrounding Oakley (don't buy anything though; they're all overpriced) and ending your day drinking in old fashioned ice cream soda amongst friends in a shop that's never aged.

I loved the decor and want to have one of the counter lamps so bad! The staff is great and let me try plenty of samples before deciding on butter pecan and double chocolate. My son got chocolate chip which was also very good and my husband the strawberry with fresh strawberries, all was very very good and even though there are only your standard flavors to chose from those are made extreamly well!

What a cool atmosphere! I loved that throwback feel, but not in a time-warpy kind of way. It's situated in the charming little area of Oakley and its personality seems to fit perfectly. 

As for the ice-cream, it was excellent. I got the Pistachio and absolutely loved the balance it had with salty/sweet, creamy/crunchy. It was quite a good little bowl of ice cream. 

I want to go back and try some of their more intimidating items and other flavors, as I was pretty full from dinner yet. I think that may have stopped my review from being flawless but in no way would I hesitate for a return trip.

Aglamesis is a favorite of mine because I feel like I'm in a time machine.  It is beyond retro and very cute.  There seems to be a war between Aglamesis and some other cincy favorite and I would like to say that I vote for Aglamesis!

Their ice cream is delicious but I especially love their sorbets (also known as italian ice).  Their numerous flavors are unique and never disappointing.  I have gotten a different flavor each time I visit and I have loved them all.  Go visit, sit out on their patio and enjoy a frozen treat :)

Love it.  From the pink lotus lamps to the handwritten additions to the menu board.  I always buy gifts for co-workers there for the holidays, and my little one, husband and I treat ourselves to the variety of flavors to choose from the ice cream side.  The ice cream?  The best...pure, creamy and the flavors stand out, even when your tongue gets numb from the cold.  How could ANYONE turn down Butterscotch ice cream? Or Peppermint stick with a little dish of bittersweet chocolate on the side...ok.  Enough.  I'm wishing I was there again, even though I was just there on Monday!  

Their candies are excellent, their ice cream better, and the staff is so much more friendly than any area Graeter's I've ever been in.

Stepping though the front door of this ice cream parlor/candy shop is the closest thing you can get to time travel.  Upon entering and seeing the old-fashioned set up, you're almost forced to turn around and look out the windows to make sure you haven't taken a giant leap into the past.

I'll go ahead and get the obvious out of the way.  The ice cream....great.  The candy....great.  The staff....great.  The turn-of-last-century atmosphere....pretty cool.  The prices are a little higher than what you might see at a Baskin-Robins or Graeter's, but remember, you're not just paying for the ice cream. You're paying for the experience as well.

Some of the things I really appreciate about this place is that it's located smack-dab in the middle of the neighborhood (Oakley), it has a history spanning nearly 100 years, and it's still family owned.  In fact the last time I checked, the family that owns Algamesis Bros. are directly related to the same family that opened it so many years ago.

Algamesis Bros. is one of those hidden gems that every city has.  Lifelong residents can stumble upon this and think to themselves, "How have I never known that this was here?"  A great way to kill a bit of a summer afternoon.

Mahalo, and enjoy.

From the moment I walked in the door of Aglamesis Brothers I fell in love! The decor of the place is so charming, and my friend and I were surprised when we were told we could take a seat and a waitress brought us a menu! I've never been to an ice cream shop with a waitress. Our waitress was extremely nice and very helpful and quick.  
I got the strawberry ice cream and it was definitely the best I've ever had.  So smooth and a great fruity taste. My friend got the butterbeer, the drink from Harry Potter!  It was also delicious, though he found it slightly too sweet. 
We will certainly be returning to Aglamesis Bros sooner than later.  Best place in Cinci for sure.

I'm sure I'm not the first to say this but walking in was like taking a trip back in time.  I had chocolate chip.  The ice cream was fresh and flavorful.  It tasted like old fashioned ice cream. I personally prefer it to that "other Cincinnati Ice cream" company.

Went here again for the first time in years. Had a delicious "cara-marsh-pecan": vanilla ice cream with (surprise surprise) marshmallow creme, caramel, and pecans. Served in a silver bowl at a table with wire-frame old school chairs, it was like a trip back in time. Having only had vanilla ice cream, I can't really comment on the quality of the ice creams versus Graeters. But if you're looking for a fun place to sit down for a treat, this is a great spot.

You step into this Oakley shop and you step into the 20s (or at least the romanticized portrayals of it I see in movies).  Wireframe chairbacks, counter stools, marble-top tables, long glass display cases.  It makes me want to call the workers "soda jerks" (but jerks they are not).

Their flavors tend to be less sumptuous and decadent than Graeter's, but more fresh and vibrant.  The banana, for instance, is a perfect example.  It isn't overly creamy, but more fruity and banana-y.  Perfect for runners and monkeys.  The strawberry has lots of strawberries.  (Hint: those two make a great double-dip).

The real draw is the history and ambience.  It's a nostalgic escape to a century ago (2008 is their hundredth anniversary!), plus a hefty topping of good taste.

I forgot how much I loved ice cream until I popped over to this place. I loved seeing the photos of its history and to be honest, I felt like I went back in time while sitting there eating my ice cream. Great place to take a date or your family!

The BEST chocolate shake I've ever tasted, hands down. 
I really recommend everyone to go if they haven't gone. The place itself is adorable and they have a wide selection of chocolates as well as ice cream!

Ok.. I thought I'd reviewed this place the last time I went.. and it turns out I did not. I'm glad too because this time was SO much better than my first visit. I learned a very important thing about Aglamesis the other day..

It's not so much about their ice cream as it is the ATMOSPHERE. You see last time I went I got something to go. It was so unmemorable that I figured I wouldn't even return. I left thinking.. "What's the big deal about this place?!" If there were a status category for me it'd be sugartarian because everything I eat has to pretty much be consumed of sugar. So, as you can guess, I'm a bit picky with my sweets.. Ok, not really but sort of. 

This last time I walked in and that sweet ice cream parlor smell hit me in the face. It was like I transformed into Pepe' Le Pew and my body lifted in the air and swam mid air over to the counter. My friend saw this and told me to sit down before I swam into that beautiful Tiffany Lamp hanging from the ceiling. So I came back earth bound and we strutted over to a cute little table. 

Our Waitress was super nice and patient as I changed just about everything from my banana split concoction. As we sat there I was taken back into a simpler time, where people used to come and enjoy the ice cream and phosphates of yesteryear without so much as a care in the world while they did so. Fast Food didn't cross my mind, the pile of bills laying on a table at home were left there for a minute and the only thing I cared about was the conversation of a good friend and the smell of that beautiful ice cream parlor. 

Our server came over quickly with our treats, and they were in silver dishes! The kid inside took over and I began furiously shoving ice cream into my mouth hole. It was delicious and made just right. It was like an elaborate treat just for me brought out in this special dish. I was all smiles and even tilted the silver cup up to my mouth to drink every last drop of ice cream possible. 

I sat there starry eyed with a full tummy talking to my friend, and it hit me then that the atmosphere is exactly why this place is so great. Cold Stone is great for their flavors and what they offer, but they don't offer the personal touches and ,forget all your troubles, environment that this place does. I will go back, and enjoy a step back in time very soon. :)
The red raspberry chocolate chip is to die for. Graeter's, eat your heart out! Worth the drive from anywhere.
This place is delicious.  I'm only giving it 4 stars because it is really expensive and they need to come down on price.

New to town and went here with a lady for a after date snack and I thought it was delicious. I tried out some summer time flavor of pineapple and something else and I loved it. My only complaint is that I wish it was bigger. I ordered a large which was a little over $3 and I got a small scoop of ice cream in a metal bowl. GIVE ME MOAR!! IT'S DELICIOUS!!
Best ice cream in town!! Reminds me on Europe and it's great ice cream in Italy. Many flavors on available. Didn't try all the other stuff available there but looked great

If you love old fashoned Ice Cream and want a step back into the days of sitting down and being waited on at an Ice Cream parlor, look no further. I make it a point to tell anyone who visits to check this place out. The Ice Cream is rich, the staff friendly and the atomsphere right out of the 1900's. Great for a date or to take your parents or anyone. They also have a large assortment of candies and chocolates to take home or eat there if you so please. 

I am addicted to my Greaters, but when I want real old fashoned ice cream, Aglamesis is the place to go.

Where else can you get table service for ice cream? 

This place is a charming throwback to ice cream parlors of yesteryear with the round, marble-topped tables, pressed tin ceiling, and charming silver ice cream goblets. 

Try the seasonal flavors--especially peach during the summer--and you won't be disappointed. I can't recommend the mint chocolate chip ice cream though, usually my favorite, because of a strong, artificial mint taste. 

Pricing is comparable to Graeters, so a bit high, but at least here you feel like you got your money's worth with ambiance and wait service. It does bring up an interesting quandary though--to tip or not to to tip? It feels tacky to just leave change for a 20% tip on a $3 dish of ice cream, but felt worse not to leave anything at all (so I just left a dollar).

Note: while this is 1 of only 2 locations (the other one is in Montgomery Square), they also serve Aglamesis Brothers ice cream at Iris Book Cafe downtown on Main St.

If you want an adorable sundae in a charming atmosphere, go to Aglamesis Brother's. They have the best toppings of any Cincinnati ice cream parlor (although I prefer Graeter's ice cream flavors). 

Sit at a marble-topped table, while a waitress serves you water and takes your order. She returns with a beautiful sundae in a silver or glass bowl. You will feel special! You will want to bring your friends and family back for the experience!

I'm not a huge ice-cream fan, but my wife loves it, and this is her favorite. I'm a fan of the local, old-school ice-cream parlor vibe. It's very authentic. I get the chocolate milkshake a lot which is great.

Ice cream is one of my favorite things.  Ever.  I had been hearing about Aglamesis Bros. for quite a while, and finally went to go check it out today.  It literally is like stepping into a time warp.  It would make it complete if the servers wore hats.  The dishes the ice cream came in were so cool and traditional.  I haven't ever seen them used before!  

I got a nectar float, which was super tasty.  I was able to sample some of the raspberry chip and mocha chip ice cream.  They were also very good, but I do have to agree with my dining companion, Graeters has them beat with the chips.  They just don't melt in your mouth the same way.  

A little pricier, but totally worth it for the experience.  A trip here is a must!

I love Aglamesis Bros. With a passion. I do not go often enough (I've only been two or three times). It's way better than Graeter's in my opinion. The homemade ice cream screams quality, and the inside of the shop is so cute! I drool all over the displays with the chocolate truffles and treats while I wait for my ice cream cone (OK not really, but seriously. They look amazing.) The service is good, too, and the staff is helpful.

The prices for the ice cream are reasonable, but the homemade candy is more expensive - thus the drooling rather than devouring. If you want really good ice cream, go to Aglamesis Bros. And if you can spare some cash, buy me some chocolate truffles. Please?

Walking into Aglamesis in Oakley is like walking into a time warp. The place is done up in a pink and white color scheme that brought to mind the film version of The Music Man (sadly I did not see any straw hats) and the old-fashioned tables and chairs were excellent. Not to mention that they actually have table service, and serve your ice cream in metal bowls with little stems. Tres fancy. 

I wasn't super impressed with the straight-up chocolate chip ice cream, but my friend got butterscotch ice cream with hot fudge and it was amazing. I would definitely go back for that, or for some kind of sundae. 

Graeters will always probably be #1 in my heart but when I'm in Oakley (or Rookwood, even) with a craving for something sweet, I'm going to keep Aglamesis in mind.

Got a tip about this place from a waiter in Skyline chili.  This is a fabulous step back in time to the days when you went to malt shop, sat at the counter or was waited on at a table.  The owner is from Greece and his lovely european influenced ice cream is hand made on the premises.  Counters of marble imported from France and these cute little marble topped tables.

Well i am new to the neighborhood and everyone tells me to try this place so I did. 
I loved how the place looked. it is super cute on the inside. it is like stepping into a time warp. the staff is pretty good. the young girl messed up my order but gladly fixed it without an attitude which i appreciated. But i will say that overall i am a graeters fan. while eating the icrecream i thought to myself..."i'm glad i tried this but i'd rather be eating greaters. so try it and decide for yourself.

I've been wanting to come here for a long time. The shop is so cute! They have a marble counter and little cafe tables to sit at. I love the stained glass lamps. Everything just transports you back in time! You sit wherever you want and the waitress brings you a glass of water and the menu. I got the pecan sundae with coffee ice cream and mocha chocolate sauce. Soooooo goooooood. My husband got a scoop of chocolate and a scoop of banana, also very good. They also have a huge chocolates counter. All of which looked mouthwatering. Can't wait to go back!

My friend used to work here in high school and would steal buckeyes from the back and give me discounts on their chocolate raspberry hot fudge sundaes (yum!).

Sure Graeter's is great and yummy and their chocolate mocha chip is orgasmic, but Aglamesis has true flavor.  This place is over 100 years old and they still have all the old school tiling, soda fountains, and even make their candy in-house!  sit in their old chairs and tables, and a waiter/waitress will bring you water and hand you a menu.  Definitely a good dessert after going to Skyline across or Dewey's down the street.

I definitely recommend the chocolate raspberry hot fudge sundae.  The raspberry topping is so delicious.

After holidays their candy is on super sale, so if you want to try some of it without breaking the bank (because it is gourmet candy) roll in there and save some money while supporting a great Cincinnati establishment!
Great local place to stumble upon. Anything you could imagine is covered in chocolate. The milkshake was amazing!
I will never eat Graeter's again! Best ice cream ever. I get the Vanilla and Strawberry every time. SO good.

In the ever-controversial Cincinnati pantheon of ice cream, I've made the personal decision to shake things up, in terms of preference.  As far as I'm concerned, the rank is as follows:  1) Aglamesis, 2) Sweet Tooth, and 3) Graeter's.  While the third is undoubtedly very good ice cream, the butterfat content is way off the charts, leaving an indisputably "greasy" sensation behind.  Aglamesis has a far "purer" taste and sensory experience - the ice cream is finer, plain and simple.  Sweet Tooth lies perfectly between the two in quality - and I'm saddened to admit that I highly doubt most Cincinnatians are even aware of that little treasure of a shop, tucked away in Newport, KY.  Try it, and see what you're missing.

While a Graeter's location was nearby, my folks made sure I cut my ice cream teeth on Aglamesis.  This was at the Oakley location, back in the days of the Lunch Box diner, when the 20th Century Theatre was still awaiting a new purpose.  At that time (and until recently), you could order wonderful, simple deli sandwiches with your ice cream - complete with peppermint jelly beans, tucked alongside the potato chips.  This was incomplete without one of their exquisite chocolate malts, still (thank heavens!) served with a butter cookie over the straw.  Stainless malt containers abound - they give you the entire thing.

Their sundaes are creative and delicious - some simple, others wonderfully complex, but all beautiful.
