Finally, as to the quality of their ice creams... words can't quite capture this, but I'll try.  I have always been particularly fond of their ices and sherbets - their champagne ice is astonishing, and the fruit sherbets (strawberry, raspberry and pineapple especially) are balms for the soul, any time of the year.  Their cream-based offerings are simply perfect - I recall, very fondly, their seasonal pumpkin ice cream... banana is grand, too... my god, that chocolate... you get the idea.  However, my absolute favorite was a limited run (at the time), re-introduction of a popular 1940s flavor:  pineapple-pecan.  Oh, Lord, was that ever a surprise.

I ought to mention that they use home-made whipped cream - a sweet rarity in this day and age.  As well, don't pass by their candy counter, as they make impeccable chocolates.  Enjoy the environment, too - their soda counter dates back many decades, boasting marble, brass and stained glass fittings.  This place is a history buff's dream.

Now, if only they could bring back that INCREDIBLE 1940s wallpaper - I still have visions of pink, mint and silver carousels and trees...

We really know how to make ice cream in cincy :). Aglamesis Brothers makes an outstanding sundae but I did not know until today that they also make fantastic chocolates.  I sampled their salted chocolate covered caramel (fantastic) and a scrumptious turtle at the Chocolate Festival.  The had chocolates of all varieties.  Next time I enjoy a decadent sundae in wonderfully pink palour I will pick up salted chocolate covered caramels for later.

Great place to check out while on a date or after a big dinner.  The place is setup like an Old Fashioned Ice Cream parlor and it's filled with delicious looking chocolates and candies.  They serve the ice cream either in old school tin cups or in a waffle or sugar cone.  I would go back.

Welcome to the 1920-1950s... Old School Ice Cream Parlor at it's finest...

Quality: 5 stars, their chocolate and ice cream is first rate and might be better than Graeter's; makes for a great gift or surprise to anyone clueless or ignorant of this gem.

Service/Ambiance: 5 stars, even if you're a health nut, you can still appreciate it's charm and the service is very friendly and moderately attentive.

Value: 4 stars, it's not cheap but it's well worth your money to experience one of the few gems of Cincinnati.

Final Thought: Everyone must try this gem at least once, for nostalgia alone...

This place is as charming as it gets!  Pink marble and tiffany lighting as well as art deco sundae dishes really make having ice cream an EVENT!  This is our go-to place for any celebration and though the ice cream is available at our local Kroger, we are fond of choosing a pint right from the hand-packed case.  This is really, truly small-batch ice cream and the service is wonderful.  Our family loves the seasonal pineapple pecan which feels straight from the 1940's.  The menu is a full, old-fashioned soda fountain where one can still get a phosphate if you need it.  The little bistro tables are lovely and summer days eating either in the square or at the street-side tables is some of the good ol' fashioned fun we all like to have.  And...the chocolates aren't bad either!  Great place to pick up a hostess gift.  Besides, the area has a few charming shops to persue so it's easy to spend an afternoon in Oakley and end with a trip to Aglemisis.  You won't be sorry!

The ice cream is delicious for sure and there is a very wide variety of options to choose from! The service is sit-down service which is friendly and helpful, but adds a tip to your total cost, which is already pretty high for an ice cream shop. The old fashioned soda shoppe is very cute but it doesn't appear to be kept very clean (the floors were even sticky when I was in). 

Overall, I'd say it's worth the experience to stop by, but it won't be my go-to for ice cream!

My favorite ice cream parlor in town. Yes, Graeters is good. And, yes, everybody, including Oprah, loves the black raspberry chip. But I gotta say, Graeters is not what I'll miss when I leave Cincinnati. Aglamesis Brothers is. This is a true neighborhood ice cream parlor, one that hasn't been watered down by 50 other locations that look just like it, and the ice cream is delicious. Cinnamon, banana chocolate chip, and pistachio are all favorites.

YES. this place was so awesome. it feels like you've entered a different time & place when you enter - i kind of had a "back to the future" thing going on in my head the whole time - except i didn't run into my mom in her teenage years. too bad. anyways, the candy was awesome, i got a few things like fruit slices and red hearts. but the standout item is the pineapple sorbet - best i've ever had! perfectly flavored, not too too sweet, big chunks of pineapple. the service here was great and the prices are beyond reasonable. go there now!

My love for Aglamesis Bros borders obsession and infatuation.

I grew up in Cincinnati about 5 minutes from Aglamesis, and this is one of those old-fashioned ice cream parlors that is straight out of the movies. It was always so bright, cheery, well-lighted, and inviting. The parlor had this aromatic waft of sweets that captivated everybody inside.

My sister, my friend, and I would always sit up on the counter, order the Rainbow Sherbert combo, and blissfully indulge ourselves for that short amount of time while we watched the workers take dishes and plop them into the sink with the pretty blue-green water (ignorant, we were at the time, that this was simply dish soap), hoping that one day we too would be able to play with the special blue-green water.

I only have wonderful memories of my family sitting in the ice cream parlor enjoying banana splits and laughing with new customers that walked in. This is definitely one of those landmark institutions in Cincinnati. If you ever have the chance, I highly recommend you visiting.
Love the black raspberry choc chip, won't be disappointed.

Tried the chocolate mocha soda with vanilla ice cream and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. 

Like many have said, this place is a blast from the past, and while I can't handle a full serving of their sugary goodness, it's still a fun place with a lot of character.
Ice cream was outstanding!!  Has the same quaint feel as the soda fountain shoppes. And chocolates to die for!! :)
Cute little icecream parlor with little tables and chairs.Our server was friendly and the icecream was really good.I will return in the future.I got my eyes on the butter pecan.
Way better than Graters. Better decor/ atmosphere. Better tasting ice cream. I love the sundaes so yummy. Best ice cream parlor in Cincy.

Here is a Cincinnati SECRET....Aglamesis is WAY BETTER than Graeters! Just try it yourself. Graeter's  chocolates and candy is not even in the same league as Aglamesis and the ice cream is not as well. I will admit one thing.....Graeter's has bigger CHIPS in their chip flavors. But the flavors cannot compare. I challenge all you readers to buy THREE PINTS EACH...of Graeters and Aglamesis....of these flavors and compare yourself (I am writing this on October 28th, 2009 so I am giving you seasonal flavors, perhaps)... pumpkin, butter pecan (NOT a seasonal) and Egg Nog. Buy them, compare, and tell me if I am wrong!

As soon as you walk in, you can't help but notice two things: this place is PINK, and oh my god look at all those chocolates.  Where was I?  So anyways, once you've toured the chocolates, you can sit for table service.  I opted to snag a small table instead of sit at the bar as this visit was for dessert on a date.  We were the only ones in the place and received very nice service (even though when you do this in some places, you get snippy service because the waitstaff feels you're stopping them from doing nothing).  The menu has enough sundae options to please anyone, and if you don't like one, you can just ask for whatever you want.  The ice cream was delicious, the toppings were prime, and the banana (split) was the perfect amount of ripeness.  It even came with freshly mixed up chocolate whipped cream!  If you want the ice cream parlor experience, don't waste your time anywhere else.

Bottom Line: I'll definitely be back when the occasion calls for an ice cream treat.

After dinner tonight I was craving a nectar phosphate and being in Montgomery decided to try one here, rather than heading down the road to Graeters, where I usually would order this treat. Big mistake! The young gal behind the counter sure seemed to know what I ordered but upon it's arrival I was repulsed at how awful this concoction tasted. Maybe it was the look on my face but she offered to tweak the drink by pouring out some percentage of the drink and adding soda water to it. Still awful...at least she tried. She then told me the ratios are hard to get right. Hummm. I thought these drinks would be made by actually following a specific recipe. My daughter ordered a phosphate as well while my husband ordered a chocolate malt, delicious! We literally threw the phosphates into the outdoor trash can as they were inedible. Graeters for me next time!

I love the 60's icecream parlor feel. I appreciate all the unique flavors and toppings. It's also impossible to walk away without wanting atleast one of their side treats. The place is small, but adorable. It would be a cute date spot, or just a fun place to go with friends.

While family from New York was visiting, we packed the weekend full of activities. I was the only one who had been to Aglamesis Brothers before so we planned on heading to the Oakley store after a few games of laser tag. I knew the vintage ice cream parlor chairs, authentic soda fountain, and sodas on the menu would appeal to their interests. My family is a huge fan of Graeter's so it's hard to pull them away even one time from their favorites, but I promised them it was worth the deviation. All enjoyed the visit; some said "I still like Graeter's better" but acknowledged they enjoyed the option for seating at the counter and table service as a change of pace; Aglamesis is nice to mix things up, but there's no competing when it comes to ice cream flavor. Others said they'd prefer Aglamesis in the future because of the options for shakes and sundaes. But, all agreed it was nice to see some variety on the menu, especially the sodas and phosphates.

I had the red raspberry soda (soda, french vanilla ice cream, raspberry syrup) and loved it.
Hands down The BEST ice cream you will eat! The ambiance is cute; reminiscent of a 1950s style ice cream parlor. I love the mocha chip flavor the best! Totally beats Graters in my book!

After moving to Cincinnati this summer I thought I was a Graeter's girl. Although I do love Graeter's Aglamesis Bro's vanilla ice cream is FAR and above the best I've ever had anywhere. I love their old timey ice cream shop look as well. Try a caramel sundae with vanilla ice cream, simple but amazing.

Let me just start this review by saying I did not try the ice cream. My date and I wanted to try their chocolates instead. We got two chocolate dipped apricots, a turtle type of chocolate, and a piece of chcolate covered heath bar. They were all delicious, but nothing different from other candy shops I have been to. I will have to try their ice cream next time, but for now 4 stars for the chocolates.

I always wanted to time travel but stepping into Aglamesis Bros ice cream parlor will have to do.  The store hasn't changed since it opened in 1908 and upon entering it feels as if you have stepped back in time.  I'm like whoa what just happened? To the counter I go.. I have to have a caramel two step. Two scoops of vanilla ice cream, caramel, real whipped cream and pecan topping. It tastes like butter pecan on steroids.

I frequent (as in every other day) the Oakley location, and this is the cutest place you'll ever have an ice cream cone!  Once you step inside, you'll feel like you're in an old-fashioned ice cream parlor!  Though I always get the same thing (strawberry choc. chip, which is only a seasonal flavor at Graeter's), I can safely say that everyone will leave this  place happy.  It's a great experience and worth the drive if you live further away.

My happy childhood memories of Aglamesis might bias me a bit, but after many return trips as an adult, I can confirm that it really is as good as I remembered.  The ice cream is amazing, and I'm one of those who prefer it to Graeters for reasons I cannot really articulate, but what make Aglamesis stand out is the atmosphere of the Oakely location (I try to pretend the Montgomery location doesn't even exist) and the amazing candies and other non-ice cream treats.  The housemade chocolates are good enough to stand on their own next to other top notch chocolate shops, and I often send them as gifts.  The sugary fruit slices are also amazingly flavorful compared to fruit slice candies you can purchase elsewhere.  And, you can even order sandwiches for a light lunch!  I recommend the egg salad.

This store begs to be compared to Graeter's as the two ice-cream parlors not only live in very close geography to one another; but they draw crowds based on the same philosophy...homemade ice cream and candies in a old-fashioned "soda shoppe" atmosphere.  

While I give Graeter's the ice-cream edge for the one, the only Black Raspberry Chip (Aglamesis has it's own version, but you'll be disappointed), Aglamesis puts up a good fight with it's Strawberry Chocolate Chip flavor...it's like a chocolate covered strawberry in ice-cream form, yummy.  

Scoop sizes are significantly smaller than Graeter's and ice-cream, as mentioned in another review, is "lighter" in style...I suppose these are good points for some people, but I'm all about the huge scoop and the heavy cream, kids.  Aglamesis is cheaper, however, score one point for the store.  They are almost 100% of the time less crowded then the nearest Graeter's as well, so if you're in a hurry, it's a better bet.  

On the candy front, Graeter's and Aglamesis hold exactly the same quality (in my mind)...these two places are neck-in-neck, up until the price register, where Aglamesis kills Graeter's.  I was in there today and saw a dark chocolate assortment box that had at least thirty homemade candies in it for $25, you won't find the same at Graeter's or Godiva in the mall.

The first time I ever had table service for ice cream was last week at Aglamesis Brothers!  The service isn't speedy, but the old-fashioned decor makes you think you've traveled back in time so the speed didn't seem as important.  I had a simple cone that was quite tasty.  Aglamesis Brothers wins for Cincy's best ice cream shop atmosphere, but Graeters still wins for best ice cream.
Yummy!  The BEST peanut butter malts EVER!  Go there!  Try it!  It is good stuff!

My biggest problem with the place was that it wasn't kid friendly enough for my rambunctious 2 year old. They had a bunch of candy racks/displays that my son wouldn't stop touching. So instead of enjoying my ice cream, I spent the whole time cleaning up after my little guy. The small amount of ice cream that I did try was good, but I much rather go to Graeter's.

This place is fantastic.  I actually rank it above Graeter's.  They have excellent flavors, such as a banana chocolate chip and I think I even saw a champagne sorbet once.  Walking into the shop is like stepping into a movie set in the 1950s.  From the pastel sugary pink decour down to the heart shaped chairs and getting your milk shake with additional portion served in its metal mizing cup on the side, I adore the vibe here.  I would also highly recommend the root beer floats, which is something I usually wouldn't order at an ice cream shop.

Allthough I normally go to the Madison Road location, there is a second location up NE on Montgomery (9899 Montgomery Road).

I'm always impressed by a place that knows how to make a chocolate soda (with vanilla ice cream as it should be). Takes me back to some earlier times when my Pop would take me to one of the many ice cream parlors that abounded for a treat. Chocolate soda w/vanilla ice cream was one of my faves.

Nephew & Niece both ordered chocolate shakes, again made with vanilla ice cream & chocolate syrup. Nice & thick & delicious.

I much prefer Aglamesis to Graeter's.
Great local piece of Americana! They serve ice cream the way it should be done. It's a classic style that will hopefully be around for another 100 years.

What a great place on a warm summer night. The store has been around since the 1920s(?). Beautiful marble and a classic feel abound. the staff is super friendly and the facility has always been clean. The ice cream is wonderful. only a handful of flavors (maybe a dozen or so) but each is fresh and rich in flavor. my favorite is coffee. I get it as a sundae with their bittersweet chocolate sauce. Its so good it should be crime. I know that the "other" Cincinnati ice cream place gets all the publicity but this place has them beat hands down.

Aglamesis had been overshadowed, and maybe forgotten, but maybe that's part of the reason it's so special.  It has more charm and character than Graeter's which in part makes the ice cream taste even better!  Whenever I'm home this is the place to get ice cream.

I realize as a Cincinnati native that I'm supposed to be on Team Graeter's, but I will take Aglamesis Bro's over Graeter's any day of the week. And I'm even lactose intolerant, so there. It does have a very old fashioned feel to it, but that just adds to the charm of the place and really fits with the Oakley neighborhood. The ice cream tastes smoother and creamier than Graeter's, and the sundaes are positively divine. Try one of their chocolate dipped waffle cones for a real treat!

I'm born & raised in Cincinnati.  I'm an ice cream freak.  I've eaten ice cream all over the world.  I can say with conviction Mr. Aglamesis' makes the best ice cream and chocolates I've ever tasted.  Don't pass up his chocolate covered marshmallow and carmel at Easter.

my happy place.  get a sundae.  the best ones are the swiss raspberry or swiss strawberry.  the ice cream itself is fine but what you are really going for is the amazing rich fluffy delicious fresh whipped cream with the fruit folded right into it. holy hell.

After having been to a few different ice cream spots in the area (Graeter's, Schneider's, etc.), I'm pretty sure Aglamesis is my favorite. (Except maybe for creamy whips, but I'd put them in a different category anyway.) The item and flavor options are varied, but not overwhelming; ditto for the candy. The old-timey atmosphere is fun without being too cutesy. The location is different without being too suburban. The service is attentive but not invasive. Basically, Aglamesis is the Goldilocks of the Cincinnati ice cream scene - just right. Try the pink champagne shaved ice.
Totally great throwback that makes you feel like you own a flex capacitor. Great homemade treats and ice cream. Staff is always friendly and will recommend some great stuff.

name: Pendleton Parlor: Ice Cream & Cookie Dough

reviews.text:
Pendleton was sooooo cute. I got the cookie dough of the month (Nutella) and swirl soft serve and it was sooo delicious. 

This place is perfect for kids with bumble bee door greeter! 

Next time I'm trying the coffee

This place is amazing. All the ingredients from the ice cream to the edible cookie dough is rich and decadent. It's hard to finish my order every single time, but it's absolutely delicious. I'm a huge fan of Nutella anything so I ordered the Nutella ice cream with edible cookie dough. I was very happy with my order!

Love this place! Icecream is my favorite, and I love cookie dough, so combining them is the best :)
My boyfriend and I both got a small cup with icecream and cookie dough and it was so much to eat at 9:30 at night haha. But it was all delicious!!! Will definitely be back to try out more flavors!

I will have dreams about this place even after I leave Cincinnati. I am a huge edible cookie dough fan and this place has some of the best edible cookie I've ever had when paired with ice cream. I got the side by side and kept it simple with vanilla soft serve and chocolate chip cookie dough. The inside decor is very cute, like an old time ice cream parlor. Can't wait to try some more items off the menu!

An expansive menu of decadently chilly treats, kitschy decor & an attractive OTR location made for a fun stop at Pendleton Parlor on a recent hot summer day. Social distancing is in place, masks are required, & theirs no seating indoors allowed currently, but the friendly & attentive service & the many menu options make up for an inconvenience. 

I went with a s'mores sundae & got a mint chocolate chip malt for the road. Will definitely return when I'm back in the office regularly & can walk there instead of drive.

After having dinner down the street at Lucius Q, my friend strongly suggested that we come here for a bite of dessert. I've been meaning to check this place out for a while now and I'm glad it finally happened!

I'm not up for straight up scoops of cookie dough, but what my friend suggested, the flurry, sounded perfect for me! So I built my own! I wanted to try their seasonal Oreo cheesecake cookie batter, but apparently they were out. So my second choice was birthday cookies. The woman working there said she liked them slightly better than the regular sugar cookies because it was the same recipe but the birthday cookies had actual cake mix in it. Sounds Yum! Anyway, so I got a flurry with birthday cookies, Reese's cups and peanut butter sauce with swirl ice cream. It was delicious! I would happily return to make another of the exact same thing.

Just a heads up that the flurries only come in one size and it's decently large. It looked to be the perfect size to me. I would happily eat one on my own and not share. Not too small and not too big.

I ordered the brownie espresso ice cream and it was SO soft and amazing. There were giant chunks of brownie all throughout it which was obviously a nice surprise. I also got to try the "side by side" mint chocolate chip ice cream/cookie dough and I will definitely order that next time. The lady working was super friendly and patient while I was trying to make a decision and it's a super cool place to bring kiddos because they have a giant transformer inside!

Tried this place while waiting for my car hand wash nearby. I tried their cookie dough ice cream and loved it! Definitely something that I cannot usually get from grocery stores. The interior was clean and the staff was friendly.

Cookie dough + ice cream = sign me up!! Pendleton Parlor is a great addition to the Pendleton/OTR good scene. They specialize in their edible cookie dough ice cream creations! One of my favorites is the cake batter ice cream and sugar cookie dough. They are very generous with their serving sizes, but I can't complain about that! Pendleton Parlor is in the same family as the Old Milford Parlor and the Mt. Washington Creamy Whip, so they have some similar menu items but also are each unique!
Huge fan of the cookie dough and love how they have a new flavor each month along with the three other flavors. The coffee and ice cream are also very good!

Sitting here at home in quarantine and dreaming about my favorite ice cream parlor in Cincy. So, my roommate and I decided to order two flurries via Uber Eats. Saw that the cookie dough flavor of the month for March was peanut butter and I. Was. Sold. It did not disappoint! If you're a peanut butter lover, you'll fall even deeper after you get a peanut butter cookie dough flurry.

I've been here several times and if flurries aren't your style, try a side by side (scoop of cookie dough next to a pile of soft serve) or just a scoop of cookie dough. Can't go wrong!

Hopefully you can go in person sooner than later, as it's a super cute, fun shop in Pendleton that's fit for all ages!

Cute little parlor. Crazy interior, everything mixed with everything, Transformers' Bumblebee next to antique typewriter and cash machine haha it works, though.
They have raw cookie dough, ice cream and soft serve. I tried the caramel scooped ice cream ($4 per single)  and it was very creamy and good, with little caramel-filled chocolate squares.
The reason I need to take a star away is the smell inside the parlor. Very musty and repelling. I could  not wait to buy and leave.  Pretty sad, as they made so much effort for the interior design , but the old basement smell is so not appetizing.....

Well, I haven't had the opportunity to try the cookie dough BUT the ice cream was pretty Myeh. Cool setup and a good location, but the already limited menu was pretty much out of everything. My hands were tied and I ended up going with the swirl topped with Reese's peanut butter (Yuck!). This ended up just being a cold cup of peanut butter, not even Reese's cups! Not to mention the cashiers seemed to have no interest in walking us through our choices! This place needs a real change up or they won't last in prime time Old Milford. My smug friends who got the brownie sundaes seem to be a bit happier with the experience, but they should change the name from Parlor to Subpar!

I thought this would be a cute new ice cream parlor to try as an alternative to my usual Graeter's, but I will definitely not be returning again. 

I entered on a late Sunday afternoon with my mother, and no other customers were in the store. Therefore, the two young ladies working were paying no attention and were actually watching Netflix on their phone or tablet. They did not take notice of our presence until I spoke up, at which point they quickly tried to hide the video and act professional. I had never been so I had to ask about some of the menu options and try a few things, which they weren't great at doing. I asked to sample the cake batter cookie dough and she instead brought me the sugar cookie (but I chose not to make a fuss to be polite). 

Anyways, our desserts themselves weren't bad, certaintly nothing special though (whipped cream from a can instead of homemade like Graeter's). But while we were eating, I noticed the employees (once again with no customers to serve) sitting with their butts on the counter and feet up as well, right where the food gets prepared. Disgusting! That has to be a health code issue.

I scream, you scream, we all scream for COOKIE DOUGH! I'm happy there is a place you can eat cookie dough and not have to worry about your mom slapping your hand and saying "don't eat that, you'll get salmonella." I've tried the sugar cookie, chocolate chip, and chocolate chip brownie cookie dough with an equal enjoyment of all three. I loaded up on the chocolate chip to take home and it was a huge success with my wife! You can even get ice cream with your cookie dough and they do a variety of malts, shaved ice, and coffee shop related beverages. 

The staff was pleasant, accommodating, and cheerful. The parlor is smaller but has seating in and out side. The decor is fun and very much what I would expect to see in a ice cream parlor; a giant transformer in the corner, bright colored chairs, giant penny made of real pennies, and a random Elvis Presley clock with live action swinging hips. I look forward to coming back and taste test other items on the menu. Thank you for a great experience!

One of my favorite ice cream spots. I always get the side by side, which is one scoop ice cream one scoop cookie dough. Seriously phenomenal. So affordable too for what you get! If you have a sweet tooth, this place is perfect for you. It's across the street from a brewery so it's in a perfect area to stop at the brewery first then stop at Pendleton for dessert.

The Pendleton Parlor is a gem! Small with funky decor and a huge Transformers Bumblebee, the space is just as charming as the desserts. 

They have lots to choose from including soft serve ice cream and an espresso milkshake-like drink. 

But for me, the thing to get is their edible cookie dough. They even have a flight of 5 so you can try all of them. Come hungry because you'll want one of everything on the menu!

I love across the street from the Pendleton Parlor, and it's dangerous because I just want to go all the time. Ice cream and cookie dough together is an amazing combination. They have a new flavor of cookie dough every month (one month they had Bischoff cookie and it was magic) They also make awesome shakes.
Great customer service!! Two guys working are awesome! Wonderful soft serve as well! Need more locations!

This location is genius. When I saw it across the street before cracking into my beers I wasn't super interested in ice cream, but after a beer flight it suddenly seemed amazing. The premise is the combination of soft serve ice cream and cookie dough. That simple but that genius. I had vanilla ice cream side by side with sugar cookie dough and it was amazing. The space is a bit narrow but manages to look open. The decor is interesting and I'm not sure what it's going for but there are some interesting pieces, including an old breathalyzer like my grandpa used to build in his barn. What it was doing in an ice cream parlor, who can say, but it made me smile. Hope to check this place out again. Prices also seemed really reasonable.

Delicious ice cream!! I had the cookies n' cream. It was so so creamy! I loved it! Next time I will do the plain vanilla just to enjoy the creaminess. 

They allow dogs and will give them a treat!   

They are known for their Side by Side which is a scoop of cookie dough and another of ice cream. I tried the snickers cookie dough and was way too sweet for me, but give it a try! I am sure my sugar tolerance is on the low end of the spectrum.

Came in for the first time & absolutely loved it! I got vanilla soft serve with brownie cookie dough & my friend got the same thing. It was so so good! Also, the inside of the parlor is adorable. The girl who took our order was super friendly & helpful to us & gave us great recommendations. Definitely will be back!

I ABSOLUTELY LOVE COOKIE DOUGH AND SOFT SERVE. Whether it be McDonald's, DQ or gourmet soft serve I will eat it and love it. My standards aren't quite high, but to be honest I've never had a bad soft serve experience. 

The atmosphere and service is great--it gives you that old ice cream parlor feel (unfortunately, seating is limited). Their soft serve was creamy and delicious, it met my expectations. They offer either vanilla, chocolate or zebra; zebra is the best option in my opinion, because who doesn't love a chocolate vanilla blend?! I also enjoyed being able to eat my soft serve with my dog who enjoyed his cute little vanilla soft serve cup topped with a bone (you can opt for a whipped cream dog treat as well). YES DOGS CAN COME IN AND EAT WITH YOU!!! 

As for the cookie dough, it was quite interesting in a good way. It paired well with the soft serve and tasted like cookie dough, but the texture was a bit unexpected. The cookie dough had a light airy texture and was not dense or firm like your typical cookie dough bites. However, once you look past that unexpected surprise, the flavor is spot on.  It was salty, sweet and filled with LOTS of chocolate chips. They offer 3 signature cookie dough flavors: original, cake batter, and sugar cookie as well as one rotating flavor, which for March 2019 is SAMOAS!!! So far, I've tried the original and samoas, both tasted great.

Their most recommended item is the side by side, which comes with a large portion of ice cream (about 3/4) and cookie dough (1/4). When you pair the cookie dough with ice cream it is the absolute perfect combination. Since soft serve is light, having fluffy cookie dough compliments its texture well. Even though it's 5 dollars, the portion is HUGE and shareable between two people. They also offer cookie dough alone, cookie dough flights and a bunch of other items (coffee/espresso combinations, shakes, sundaes, endless toppings, some regular ice cream options and more).

I  plan on coming back with my dog in the future ( it's his new favorite place and has replaced his love for Starbucks puppuccinos)  My one recommendations or request would be to sell small, medium and large side by side options. Though I loved my treat, it was just too much--I couldn't finish it. Right now, the cup size is around a large!!

Get the side by side! The side by side it their soft serve ice cream and a scoop of their edible cookie dough.

We got the Oreo cookie dough and vanilla soft serve. The soft serve was very creamy! Almost reminded me of a custard. And their cookie dough was delicious. Having both was a nice balance.

Love this little spot! Their cookie doughs are amazing and I love their side by side option! My favorite flavor is the classic chocolate chip, but it's nice they have a rotating monthly dough, so there's always something new!

This place is a pretty cool dessert spot in Pendleton. We went for the cookie dough but they have a bunch of other dessert options.

Girlfriend and I both got side by sides but with different soft serve options. Paige got the Nutella with the chocolate chip cookie dough and she was raving about the Nutella ice cream. I went with the Reese's ice cream with the chocolate chip cookie dough. The cookie dough is awesome. The best part of making cookies is the dough but you're always told not to eat the dough. This place encourages it!

I am excited to come back at some point and try one of their other desserts!

Similarly to a lot of yelpers I thought the location of this place was the best thing about it. The decor and atmosphere is cute, they had the great British baking show playing on the TVs when we came in so bonus points for that! The staff is nice but not overly helpful and the menu seemed kind of limited. They only have like4 different cookie dough flavors and many of the ice cream flavors were blacked out when we arrived. Like another reviewer mentioned there are no prices listed so we had no idea what we were getting into. We settled on 2 side by sides ( cookie dough and ice cream) and that came to about $13 with a 15% tip. The actual flavors were okay but we could not finish the cookie dough it was weirdly too much and at the same time not enough flavor to make you want to keep eating. 

Portion consistency was also an issue here because I had one small scoop of ice cream in my order while my boyfriend had almost half his container filled with ice cream. Not sure what's going on there but we paid the same price for both so they should be even in the amount of product. Probably won't make a special trip to this place but I could see it being convenient for people who live in the neighborhood.

This little gem is my favorite place for dessert! The cookie dough taste straight out of a nestle cookie dough tub. Compared to some other cookie dough place I have been, this one takes the cake (or cookie dough)! My BF loved the coffee ice cream. I love the cookies and cream cookie dough with cookies and cream ice cream, add hot fudge for that added delight! Every time in near OTR I'm stopping by here, which is saying a lot because the dessert competition is fierce out there! Try it! You will not forget it!

Edible. Cookie. Dough. Let that sink in. After all of the years of salmonella warnings and hands being swatted away from bowls of yummy cookie dough, people everywhere can rejoice that Cincy finally has joined the edible cookie dough movement. 

Pendleton Parlor is such a cute little dessert addition to the area. They offer lots of sweet treats from shakes to sundaes with many toppings. My favorite however was the edible cookie dough. The chocolate chip and sugar with sprinkles were my favorites, but the cake batter was pretty good too. 

Service was fast and good, despite being slightly crowded on a rainy Sunday. Prices were definitely reasonable, take the kids.

Also, if you're a banana split fan, remember this place is BYOB (bring your own banana)!

So good! SO SO GOOD! I loved this cute lil place. The decor (so eccentric), the menu, the fact that they are dog friendly. 
I've always been a fan of soft serve and cookie dough separately. However, this joint combines the magic of these two and blows your mind. Not a fan of either? They have icecreams and sundaes. Don't like icecream too? Well, you hopeless lucky weirdo, there's milkshakes and coffee. This is as versatile as a place can be! 
A friend and I shared a cookie dough affogato. A layer of chocolate chip cookie dough, a swerve of vanilla soft serve and some coffee to top it off. PURE BRILLIANCE! 
I loved every bite of it. Perhaps it should have been a little less coffee, because it was too liquidy, I scooped every itty bitty chunk out of it happily! 
This place was a joyous find and I'll gladly come back.

Yum!!! I am a sucker for cookie dough; I will willingly eat it fresh from a plastic tube, raw egg and all. So I knew when Pendleton Parlor had a flight of edible cookie dough, I was on it! 

I think it's pretty close to actual cookie dough. The taste was great, salty and sweet just as you'd expect. The flight is a small sampling of each flavor. I LOVED the original cookie dough, brownie batter and sugar cookie. The cake flavor was just okay. 

Sizing was just right just an after dinner treat. I ate some, gave some to my mom and kiddo to try and still had a sample leftover for the next day! And it was just as yummy on day 2 from my fridge!

Hubby ordered the Java Whip and also really loved it. We've had it before from the Mt. Washington Creamy Whip (same family) so we knew it was a solid choice. 

Decor is so cute and kitschy! Loved the small steps up to order and the long bar to stay and eat. Not having any prices listed is a biiiiiig downfall. It seems very sneaky to not list your prices. Our cookie dough flight and Java Whip was $12- so I can only assume $8 and $4 but no clue really. 

Overall, I'll for sure be back, especially because they have the perfect spot in Pendleton surrounded by other great businesses.

Who doesn't like ice cream? Who doesn't like cookie dough? Who doesn't like both combined? If you said "yes" to any of these you're entitled to your opinion but you should also probably seek help (unless it's due to a medical circumstance than apologies for poor taste in humor). Anyways, Pendleton Parlor is my go-to for a sweet tooth if I can't decide between pigging out on ice cream and/or cookie dough. I love how I can say "and/or" because you can literally have either ice cream and edible cookie dough on their own OR have my personal favorite combination of the two. Regardless, there's plenty of options on either side, plus if you're not feeling either, they have speciality floats/coffees as well as shakes/malts. The shop itself reminds me of, surprise, a modern twist on an old school ice cream parlor. It's definitely a good spot to grab a scoop or two with your family or even a nice little sweet spot as part of a date. Seriously every time this place gets brought up among my friends I immediately crave it, so writing this for you all isn't helping.
The employees there were so friendly and helpful! Love the atmosphere and LOVE that I can bring my dog and they give her a treat! We love dog friendly businesses!
So I went in for ice cream and came out with a scoop of ice cream and cookie dough. My dessert was very delicious. I will be back!

My family and I moved to the Pendleton neighborhood a few years ago. We've watched several fun restaurant/bars move into the area over the past two years. One thing was missing- a fun dessert spot. That's been solved.

Pendleton Parlor brings fun + sweets together in this little corner year round ice cream shop (aka creamy whip). I have to admit, I was skeptical of an ice cream place opening in late fall in Cincinnati. Cincy chilly falls and winters and ice cream doesn't seem like a good combo.

But no matter, this place delivers, even in the cold. First of all, it's just a fun place and great location. Right across from Chx/3Points on Broadway street, the store is decorated with old, eclectic statues, toys and other items you might find in a museum of pop culture.

On to the ice cream- I ordered my classic chocolate and peanut butter Sunday with hot fudge. If an ice cream parlor can't do this right...we're done. Fortunately, they nailed it! They smashed the peanut butter into the chelate ice cream and smothered it with hot fudge, whip cream nuts and a cherry. Two YUMS wayyy up!

The soft serve concept is simple but can be done multiple different ways. The toppings and syrups create a ton of varieties and the nice staff is more than ready to accommodate.

My daughter ordered an affogato (an ice cream, dough drink concoction). Yes, she let me have a bite. It was a delicious mix of flavors! 

Surprisingly, there was a steady steam of customers coming through, even at the late hour. I can't imagine how packed this place will be once the winter thaw arrives. Another GREAT addition to the Pendleton food scene. We'll be regulars.

This is a great spot when they get it right but over the last year it has gotten more and more inconsistent with the quality of their custom ice cream / shakes. They also frequently close over an hour early, so be sure to plan accordingly!

Went here with some friends. Location is pretty sweet, right off the OTR bar strip really close to treehouse. In terms of the actual cookie dough, I got a small (forgot sizes?) scoop of cookie dough. Portion sizes were more than enough...I'd recommend sharing w/ a friend. However, the cookie dough itself was average at best, nothing too special but no real complaints.

Holy smokes! The cookie dough & ice cream (side by side) is phenomenal! Iced coffee is delicious as well. Drinks were a buck & they had a good variety of pop & water. I had the chocolate chip cookie dough & vanilla soft serve. Amazing- definitely a place you should check out!

Get the "side by side" here! It's your choice of cookie dough along with your choice of ice cream. The serving is definitely enough for two people. We tried the flavor of the month cookie dough which was Biscoff - delicious! The ice cream here is basically soft serve with the "flavor" mixed in. I think I come here for the cookie dough but it's a cute place to stop by for dessert !

Usually great ice cream, but they switched to pick up only and no ones answering the phone. Not worth attempting to go here if you can't actually place an order. There was a crowd of people standing outside trying to get a call to go through.

I wish them well, but their current approach is not working.

Wow - Finally a great "creamy whip" joint to go to downtown! This place fully lives up to nostalgia when it comes to getting a good ole creamy whip with some sprinkles. They pay homage to the old-fashioned, while providing some upgraded options as well. They will even let you sample some of their egg-less cookie dough to see if you want to kick it up a knotch... And dang, I could eat a bowl of that alone!

I would say the only downside is really the price in comparison to other creamy whip shops within the Cincinnati area. However, this is in a hot neighborhood, and thus a more expensive rent. I appreciate this place staying true to their roots in such a hipster area. It's a great place to treat yourself to something sweet!

As much as I wanted to like this little location and as much as other Yelpers loved it here, I must admit I was not impressed. This parlor is super cute on the inside and located in Pendleton right across the street from 3 Points Brewery. It's in a good location with a parking lot right next door, so it has easy access. The ambience and decor has the old school vibe with a modern twist. Like a back in the day ice cream parlor but in 2018. Super cute! I loved that. However. When it comes to the actual products it's nothing to brag about. They have soft serve, edible cookie dough, shakes and more. You can get tons of combinations. 

I ordered what the worker called a "side by side" aka cookie dough with soft serve. It's cookie dough in the bottom with soft serve on the top. I got the "bigger" size. I don't know the measurements as far as oz. However, it was 3/4 cookie dough and 1/4 soft serve. We ate the ice cream quicker than the cookie dough. Go figure! We got vanilla soft serve with chocolate chip cookie dough. The soft serve was good. Tastes like typical soft serve to me. It wasn't anything special or to write home about. My husband said it taste like McDonalds. I'm sure that's an insult but it is what it is. Honestly, in my opinion the cookie dough was NASTY. It was weird! It was super airy and fluffy, like whipped. It did not taste like normal cookie dough. You know firm but with a slight softness. I have had different brands of edible cookie dough and they are awesome, and taste just like non-edible cookie dough. This cookie dough just didn't do it for me. It tasted like we were eating cookie flavored fluff with crunch from the chocolate chips. The texture was off for sure. It tasted ok as long as you got a scoop of ice cream with it. It was not tasty by itself. Once we ate all the soft serve we tossed what dough was left. 

Overall, I wanted to like this place and was super excited. However, I just wasn't wowed at all! I doubt I'll be back.

This is exactly what everyone needs in their life! Everyone has been eating cookie dough ever since they were little, and this place has made it safe to eat and acceptable! The cookie dough is delish and even though it is made without eggs, it tastes exactly like the real thing! I got the cake batter which is essentially funfetti cookie dough. It was the so amazing and I wanted more! The best thing about this place is that it is dog friendly and even serves a doggie cup that my puppy thoroughly enjoyed! We will definitely be back!

I kidnapped my friend and we came here to try the cookie dough. They were offering cake batter, sugar cookie, and chocolate chip that day (I think they have other daily or seasonal offerings, but not sure). The nice lady at the counter let my friend and I try them before making a choice (I'm indecisive ). Pendleton Parlor did not disappoint. I wound up getting a side-by-side and my friend got a shake and scoop of sugar cookie to go. They've got a loyalty punch card, so I will surely have to return! 

Heads up- seating is limited, but if weather permits, there are seats outside. Or you could go for a stroll to the park down the street.

We really loved the small town feel you get when walking into Parlor! The specialize in ice cream and cookie dough options. I loved the chocolate chip cookie dough and my husband enjoyed both ice cream and cookie dough together. It was a great finish to our hot afternoon in Pendleton. If you're in the area definitely stop in!

I'm embarrassed to admit that I've been here more than a handful of times and summer has just begun. Pendleton Parlor is my favorite favorite place!! Let's start with the cute decor...so classic. The menu is huge, lots to choose from. I prefer the side by side - soft serve next to cookie dough. I have not had any of their actual ice cream cones, but next time I go...I'm making it a goal to try something new.

On a nice October day, my husband wanted to get ice cream. We decided to check out the newest addition to the Pendleton area. 

The parlor itself is a bright clean space, long and narrow with a giant transformer near the front door to greet you. At the time of our visit, it was before halloween and they also had a creepy stuffed life size "doll" sitting at a small table that we sat with while we ate our treats. 

Onto the ice cream.. My husband ordered a side-by-side, one cup filled with part cookie dough and part soft serve. I tried a chocolate malt with chunks of Reese's peanut butter cup. It had been years since I'd had a malt and it was delicious. I have no idea how the cookie dough was but my husband seemed to really enjoy it. 

The staff was friendly and helpful with answering questions. A nice treat and great addition to Pendleton.

I'm a cookie dough junkie, so naturally I was thrilled when I found out there was finally an edible cookie dough restaurant in the area after visiting some in other cities. We stopped here with a group of coworkers during lunch one day. I love the inside of the parlor, the decor is super neat and cute. I got the side by side with chocolate chip cookie dough and vanilla ice cream. I was surprised it was only $5 for a lot of food. Similar places charge a lot more. It was yummy! I'll be back soon to try more flavors.
This is Dairy Queen on steroids... we got a Reese flurry and cake batter flurry. 10/10 this place is seriously sooooo good! Trying just the cookie dough next time!

So excited there's finally a mom & pop Icecream shop near OTR! It's located in Pendleton across from Three Points Brewery. 

The parlor itself is adorable - modern feel with old school touches like stadium seats. They serve all soft serve, but they have lots of sundaes and milkshakes as well. The best part - they have edible cookie dough! Ans it's SO good. I got a cup of it plain and it was amazing. Also, when you order cookie dough ice cream you can pick your ice cream flavor and your cookie dough flavor (yes they have multiple) and they mix it for you right then and there. I've also been told they have dog treats as well. 

Would recommend!

Not sure if this is the ultimate complement or the ultimate insult: the chocolate shake tasted just like a Wendy's frosty. For a place that is almost shoving the trendiness down your throat, I'm assuming it'll be taken as the latter. 

They really get excited about having, "edible cookie dough"... but isn't all cookie dough edible? Sure it's somehow apparently microbiologically scrubbed and pathogen/salmonella free, but the forced trendiness on this marketing seems a bit cringe level. 

As so many small new businesses open in OTR (or in this case Pendleton) I suppose I am getting a little cynical. You can't just decorate with retro TVs & baseball stadium seats and give us $5 frosties and "edible food" to blow us away these days. The bar has been raised.

Alrighty suburbanites, going in you should know that you'll have to spend a couple bucks to park because you're in OTR.  Never fear, there's a well maintained private parking lot immediately next to Pendleton Parlor for $2/hour.

Immediately upon entering I recognized the decor as "wow eclectic."  It's a combination of half century time machine and modern pop culture like a ~8' tall Bumblebee from Transformers.  OK now for the reason why we came...cookie dough.  The service we received was solid including candid feedback about popular items.  The cookie dough flight (see photo) was suggested and we went with that because it allowed us to try half servings of four of their five cookie doughs.

Chocolate chip and brownie batter were our two favorite doughs followed by sugar cookie with sprinkles, then their seasonal strawberry shortcake.  While I savoring our doughs we enjoyed discussing the decor, interacting with Pendleton staff, and people watching.

So much better than expected! Edible cookie dough is hard to get right. Often, it's actually pretty unappetizing. Pendleton Parlor does it right! Both my husband and I were pleasantly surprised with the chocolate chip cookie dough. Coupled with soft serve ice cream, it was wonderful. The serving was HUGE!!!! We'll definitely share next time (which we almost never do). I'd love to try some of their other flavors. They also have malts, milkshakes, etc.

Parking lot is right next door. We'll be back!!

Not even a sweets person but this was SO GOOD! This parlor just opened a few weeks ago and it has been so crowded since. The staff was so nice and told us all about heir offerings of ice cream, cookie dough, coffees, and combinations. 

The three of us shared a large creamy whip + chocolate chip cookie dough and it was the perfect amount. The cookie dough is surprisingly soft and creamy and pairs perfectly with the soft serve. 

The parlor is very well put together with their decor and seating. Classic parlor feel mixed with modern tech. Everything about this place is great and inviting

Wonderful! We both got half ice cream and half batter. Mine was the brownie batter and pb chocolate ice cream and he had the same ice cream but the chocolate chip cookie dough. I also had an espresso drink which was amazing, I can't wait to go back.

First time I've had a scoop of cookie dough with ice cream and it was good but was a little too much for me. The first few bites were tasty but it got a little heavy by the end. The place is adorable inside though. Glad we tried it!

Recently visited the Pendleton Parlor on a Tuesday night - to sum up my experience: this is one of my new favorite places.

There were not many people there so service was fast - I decided to get the Side-by-Side which is cookie dough + soft serve ice cream. I played it safe and got the chocolate chip cookie dough and a twist for my soft serve which rang up at around $6.

The two together was DELICIOUS! The cookie dough definitely needed the ice cream with it to make it more moist - without I can see where some reviews say the cookie dough is dry. 

The only downfall to this place is the seating - there is literally only ONE table in the place and then some high top counters that you can sit at. Otherwise there are cool stadium seats, but they aren't really ideal for eating (no table) and are kind of in the walkway of the place and not really in an ideal location. 

I need to mention the decorations - the place is kind of eclectic but it fits really well together - there is the transformer, some flags/posters, small statues, etc. that at first you would not think work well together - but here they do!

Overall - definitely recommend visiting - just plan ahead for what you want to do regarding seating/eating!

Ratings on the Morgan Scale:
Overall Experience: 9/10
Food Price: 7/10
Drink Price: N/A

Visited Pendleton Parlor after leaving 3 Points brewery which is just across the walkway. The interior is unique with classic ice cream parlor décor with unique items such as a 10 layer, creation out of pennies. The menu is coffee/expresso heavy and I really wanted to order something like the affogato but it was just too late in the evening for me. Decided on ordering some cookie dough, which was simply that. If I was to visit again, I would order ice cream or at least a ice-cream cookie dough combination.

We found this place on accident wandering around Main Street and wanting something sweet. The cookie dough and ice cream where fabulously rich together! As soon as they let me sample, i knew i needed a whole cup of that magic. The delicious treat on top of the fabulous service and wonderful aesthetics, I will definitely be back!

This place is super cute! I'm a huge fan of all things cookie dough, so I was immediately game when my friend asked if I wanted to join her here.  The staff was friendly, answered all of our questions, and made recommendations.

We were there close to Halloween and we were digging the decorations at the time.  The parlour has an old school feel to it, and the vintage candy machine in the back was a nice touch.  On the flip side, the gigantic Bumblebee statue was new and yet equally cool.

Because I couldn't decide what I wanted, I opted for a peanut butter milkshake to enjoy there and cake batter cookie dough with sprinkles for later.  Both were very yummy and I will be back! The only thing that would improve this place for me would be to have a peanut butter cookie dough option! They wouldn't be able to keep me away if they ever add that to the menu!

Cute little dessert place my friends and I found on a Saturday night next to a brewery. I like that they are open late to accommodate the Saturday night crowd. They place was very unique, with lots of quirky decorations. They had an interesting Nitro Float on the menu, so I decided to give it a try. It wasn't bad - just ice cream with coffee mixed together. There were only 2 employees working, so the place was just a little messy, but other than that, pretty neat place to check out for ice cream.
I love it, I would have taken a pic but I ate it so fast. Customer service was great and they even let me try some new flavor they were making for the next day. Def my new go to place!

My experience at Pendleton has always been good. I've raved about the ice cream to friends and continuously go back. Everything was great until my recent experience. I went in to order my usual (side by side cookies n cream + chocolate chip cookie dough). When I entered, there was one person serving customers and two others talking to each other. One was talking about a bad experience she had with another customer. She mentioned the lady kept explaining the wrong thing which was so frustrating. First....it is so unprofessional to complain about customers in front of other customers (or at all). Second...if there's a line, it's best to stop the conversation and tend to the customers (just my opinion). Once they finished, the same one who was complaining about the previous customer asked what I'd like. She was very pleasant at first I must say. I told her my usual but I said "half n half of cookies n cream and chocolate chip cookie dough" instead of side by side. When she gave me a baby scoop (half of one scoop) I explained that this wasn't exactly the size I'm used to. She thought I meant a half scoop total. So we laughed about the mistake and she brought it back. This time she gave me a full scoop, but half of two different cookie doughs. I explained again that this wasn't what I ordered and mentioned one scoop of cookie dough, one scoop of ice cream. This time she gave me two full scoops of cookie dough and explained she thought I meant one scoop of cookie dough ice cream and one scoop of cheesecake Oreo cookie dough. Never said Oreo. Never said cheesecake. Their menu also clearly says cookies n cream under ice cream and nowhere else. She was visibly frustrated so I explained again. This time she brought me a scoop of cookies n cream ice cream and a scoop of cheesecake Oreo cookie dough. Sigh. Remember when I said I never said cheesecake? Never said Oreo? Yep, here it was again. She then says, you wanted cookies n cream ice cream and chocolate chip cookie dough right? I said yes, but this is cookies n cream and Oreo cheesecake cookie dough isn't it? She said yes it is...since I already put the chocolate chip cookie dough in the wrong order before you can just take them both. At this point I just said thanks and left. If you know I didn't order Oreo cheesecake cookie dough why would you put it in the cup again? Even though the order took a long time to make, I was most frustrated with knowing that as soon as I left, I'm sure she was going to complain about me too. However, based on my interaction with her, I can understand why the other customer also had a hard time communicating. I love this ice cream but these experiences are what make me go somewhere else.

Perhaps we ordered the wrong items?  But overall underwhelming experience.  Service was great.  They were super friendly and explained their extensive menu.  Vibe is hipster funky with interesting vintage machines scattered throughout.    

But sadly the soft serve was no better than McDonald's.  Lacking in flavor, it only served as a vector for the delicious treats we mixed in.  Save yourself some money, and just buy some candy bars at CVS.

I love this place. Have been numerous times and each time the staff have been friendly and helpful. My favorite thing to get is the side by side. The cookie dough of the month is always great to try. Right now my favorites have been Red Velvet and Cinnabon. My husband tries something different every time and have never had a bad item. We've taken several visitors from out of town and all have enjoyed it. Great place!

Such a fun place in a great location! The inside of this little parlor is so cute and decorated great. They have a lot of options, but when I went I had to try the cookie dough and ice cream. If you have a major sweet tooth this place is for you. I got a peanut butter ice cream with chocolate chip cookie dough and it was a little too sweet for me. Next time I go I think I'll do a simple vanilla ice cream with chocolate chip cookie dough and share with a friend because the portions are big!

THIS IS GLORIOUS. I am seriously in love and next time I have a girls night, this is where I want to go. I got a side by side with vanilla chocolate swirl soft serve over chocolate chip cookie dough. It was HUGE. I couldn't finish it :(

The soft serve is exactly what you would expect - creamy and delicious. The cookie dough is better than tollhouse, that's for sure! It is soft and has just the right amount of chocolate chips to dough. 

It's probably for the best that I live so far away!

Decided to go here after brunch at Boomtown. We were misinformed believing this was a venture of one the new spots like in the area like Q, Boom, or something else. But the two women present stated otherwise. This is the third location of this Milford creamery. They're known for their cookie dough. I love me some cookie dough but always get nervous whether or not this is the batch where I get salmonella. The choices are infinite on what you can get for flavors, sauces, servers, toppings, and more. What's also unique is that they serve an inkling of coffee infused ice cream. They're laying their ground toward Buzzed Bull for uniquely infused ice cream. With all the options the workers were helpful in what combos would work.  In the end I got the vanilla flurry soft serve with brownie cookie dough and nutella. It was a great mixture. Since my initial butter pecan choice had them confused if I was Benjamin Button for only old people like that...harsh. With the portion sizes I'd say the price is fair. You can't go wrong with sweets and ice cream. The Parlor is far from any mishaps. The inside was nicely designed and with an open feel to it. They had lots of old relics that reminds one of an ice cream parlor in the 50s with interesting relics they clearly got at an antique sale. For sure will be back.

I have tried reaching out multiple times to the owner, Nick Ganim, because I was told I would be receiving a refund for my doordash order. I have tried to reach out 4 different times over the past month, yet I have received no response. The customer service continues to disappoint.

Tried peanut butter top shelf ice cream with butterscotch topping and ice coffee. Ice cream was incredible! They allowed us to sample the cookie dough, which they make on site. Most popular Menu item is a scoop of ice cream plus a scoop of cookie dough.

I stopped here on the way home after an afternoon out in OTR. I had no idea what to get, so I asked the server for a recommendation and ended up with the Old School Side by Side, which had Swirl Soft Serve and Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough. I didn't love what I had this time around, but now that I'm looking over their menu, I definitely want to go back and try something different.
Delicious!! Cute decor and love the atmosphere.  Daughter gives it five stars! Generous portions as well.

First off, the setting is great. They have all kinds of cool machines to throw back to the 50s and 60s. The bathrooms were nice, though the soap dispenser wasn't working.

The ice cream is decent, I only say that because I'm pretty sure they made mine wrong. I got the soft serve with Nutella and it came out in a half filled cup that looked like a blob of ice cream. I was finished in 5 bites. The flavor was ok, but the presentation was terrible and lacked any care or creativity, the workers seemed to be too distracted to care.
The guy behind me almost had to force them to take his order because they were too preoccupied with daydreaming. (It wasn't busy). When he asked if they had Anything unique, they just used a lot of jargon and he basically looked dumbfounded at them because it was completely incomprehensible. 
This place could be great, just train or fire the current staff.

Remember back in elementary school learning to not eat raw cookie dough because of the raw eggs? Well my mom never stopped me and this place won't either. Go get you some cookie dough.

I visited on a Sunday mid-relay race and it was the best decision we made all day. My friend and I split a cup of half sugar cookie cookie dough with sprinkles and vanilla soft serve. She mentioned that she appreciated the fact that it wasn't super sweet, which I quickly agreed with. It's the perfect amount of sweetness and the flavors really balance each other out.

I definitely will be back. We had a hard time deciding on flavors and there is just too much to try out there. I ate the ice cream too quick to get a picture, but I'll add one next time I stop by :)

Pendleton Parlor is affordable and delicious. It's located 2 blocks from Ziegler Pool. We ordered a creamsicle milkshake and peanut buttercup sundae. They have a huge variety including nitro floats and Hawaiian shaven ice. I'll definitely be back after our next pool day. Prices are around $3-$5.

Very cool concept! The restaurant has a really down to earth relevant parlor vibe. 

Parking lot right next to the restaurant!

We walked in 30 min before closing, staff was very friendly! I got swirl soft serve side by side a scoop of cookie dough. SO MUCH COOKIE DOUGH. It was like a dream. 

Anyways, owners walked in- super friendly and seemed to have great rapport with their employees and even chatted with us! 

All in all- give this a try! Great price! Good service! Great concept- good execution! We will be back!

I got the cookie dough flurry w vanilla soft serve. It was very rich. I probably wouldn't order it again but it was nice to try it. I was hoping for chunks of the cookie dough and instead it was blended completely except for choc chips. 

I noticed that the cookie dough is room temperature which makes it a little different consistency with the ice cream. Maybe if it were colder it would be a little better paired w cold ice cream? 
 
I'll give them 4 stars bc I want to go back to try the smurf shake. And I loved the decor. Awesome antiques and the staff was very friendly.

I got ice cream and one scoop of cookie dough. The cookie dough is super fluffy and really good. The ice cream is just ok... it is soft serve plus whatever you want to mix in it. I also got a dog sundae which was soft serve vanilla and a dog treat, which I wasn't expecting. It's overpriced for what you get and the only good thing is the cookie dough.

Simple, reasonably-priced ice cream. The staff was very friendly and helpful when trying to decipher their slightly confusing menu. 

The decor inside is....well, interesting. Unfocused would be the best way to describe it. We'll be back!

My first time at the Pendleton Parlor was a quiet rainy day. I stopped in with my mom because her favorite treat is a cookie dough sundae. She ordered that with chocolate chip cookie dough and I ordered a side by side with vanilla ice cream and chocolate chip cookie dough. To say the least, we were both stunned. The edible cookie dough tastes just like regular cookie dough you'd buy from the grocery store! The ice cream was creamed and whipped to perfection. This place will for sure become one of our favorite stops!

Side note: We went to buy water bottles and the staff person was so kind as to just get us free cups of ice water. Very happy with our visit here!

It's very nice to actually have a soft serve shop in OTR. It was good Ice Cream- just a very odd menu. They list the menu in what I consider a funky way with no prices. No one offered us help- we had to speak up and ask for the menu to be explained. Which the worker half way explained.. For the price- I'd rather have graters. They also have no seating area. When we sat in the old stadium seats- I felt like we where eyeballing the staff, and felt like they didn't like us there, and they could talk among them self's comfortably with us sitting there. 

The soft serve was no better than McDonald's- and a large ice cream is not much larger than a McDonald's cone. 

Much rather go to a place where the prices are clear and we can seat comfortably. 

It seems like a lot of locals will give a business a 5 star- just because they are local. That's all I can figure with this location. I don't imagine this place being here for a long time- nor will I be back.

Great location, not a fan of the execution. The ice cream seems really good (had secondhand through milkshakes) but the cookie dough is waaaaaay too rich - I only finished it to justify the $5 or so it was. Also, the staff can be hit or miss in their helpfulness. 

Big minus points for basically no seating. Not a great spot to go to if you're trying to interact with companions.

Delicious and so cute inside! I told them it was our first time and the staff was very friendly and explained their menu. I ordered the chocolate chip cookie dough and a chocolate vanilla swirl soft serve. Everything tasted great but it's a lot to eat so I suggest maybe sharing. So good definitely try!

This place is amazing. We went just recently and we were blown away. When we went, the employees were so amiable and welcoming. Then we ordered. 
We got a small cup of cookie dough and cake batter and it was really great. I highly recommend the cake batter. It was probably our favorite. We asked them if it is the same as normal cookie dough with raw egg and they said that their eggs are pasteurized. Although it was very good, it's very filling. Our party of 4 could easily split two small cups of cookie dough. 

They also sell shakes and other cookie dough sundae-type desserts. We haven't tried them but are planning to come back in the future. 

The parlor itself is very old fashioned and it's really fun to look around. It's 70's themed and a pretty great atmosphere. I really have no complaints.

It's simple. This is the best ice-cream spot of all time. Need I say more? Okay. I normally go with the cake batter/vanilla soft serve. They've recently been trying out a rotation of new monthly flavors. Do not take this lightly. This Oreo cheesecake flurry changed my life. It made me a better person. Essentially, a single bite sent me up to heaven. I shook hands with Peter at the gate and gently floated back down for more. I would attach a pic but it never lasts long enough for me to even get my phone out.

Will not receive my business EVER again! I've been here plenty of times prior to my visit this evening and everything was great. Unfortunately, I just went in and saw some students from my school (the local neighborhood school) asking for water. At first the man told them no he couldn't fill their cup, but then decided to do so anyways. I was near the end of the line, as the students were leaving they saw me and told me which teachers they had next year. I then asked if they wanted any ice cream. When we went to order, I was asked if I was their parent or legal guardian because it's a liability for someone else to buy them ice cream. Excuse me? That's a first I've ever been asked that in order to buy ice cream. I stated that they attend the school I teach at and he said since I "know them he would let me buy it for them". At that point, I realized what was happening. 

After I made the purchase and we left, I decided to call and speak with the owner. The person I spoke to explained to me that the reason the person handled the situation is how their boss told them to. She went on the explain when the neighborhood kids come in and don't make a purchase they typically steal the tip jars. In which I responded saying "those exact kids that were in there with me?" And she said no just neighborhood kids. Which left me a little dumbfounded because that wasn't even what I was speaking to... but she unknowingly confirmed my suspicions. My guess is if the kids looked liked me, he would have never asked such a question. I called because I wanted to know why I was asked if I was their parent/guardian....I asked to speak to the owner and she gave me his phone number, which when I called went directly to voicemail--with a full inbox.  The entire situation has caused me to believe that this company needs to realize the neighborhood in which they operate in, and see people as people and maybe, just maybe, don't be racist. I don't think that's too much to ask.

This is the best place I've been to in a long time! My friend and I stumbled upon it and walked in. We were immediately blown away by the gorgeous, professional look that this establishment embodies, but also the warm staff that is more than helpful. Thank you! I will be coming often.

The Old Milford Parlor opened up a new location in OTR in the Pendleton area! They offer soft serve, a few limited hard scoop ice cream options, shakes/malts, sundaes, coffee, and best of all - EDIBLE COOKIE DOUGH!! Another plus is that they're open YEAR ROUND so even when you have that soft serve or cookie dough craving in the winter, they'll have your back :)

I had the butter pecan with hot fudge topping. The icecream itself was pretty good; and the hot fudge was great and it was not overly sweet and complemented the icecream. However the friend that I had gone out with was very excited to try the butterscotch flavor but was told that they do not have an actual butterscotch flavor instead they just mix in vanilla icecream+caramel topping. Their list of flavors was also quite commonplace that you could pretty much get in other icecream parlors. Their interiors was pretty chić and they had a vintage themed decor which I absolutely loved. They also have edible cookie dough which I did not have a chance to try this time; coming back for that soon !!

My girlfriend and I walked in, most of the seats were taken as other people were eating their desserts. He place is retro with a modern twist. We were served quickly and the price wasn't bad at all. Two solo scoops of cookie dough was $8. The taste was really good. I had the birthday cake which resembled cake batter, and she had the chocolate chip cookie dough. There's a parking lot right next to the building to get right in and out easily!
Wow perfect ice cream at a perfect location. Coffee bean ice cream is to die for ! Recommend this place to everyone. Friendly owner. Great employees. Awesome decor !

This place is the bees knees!  Not only do they have edible cookie dough (with delicious homemade ice cream), but the decor in there is so eclectic and home-y.  I always take friends/family from out of town here.  Likewise, the workers are always delightful.  In a super cute neighborhood too!
Cute little shop. Cake batter cookie dough was good but very sweet. I'd go with the chocolate chip cookie dough every time, so so so good!!

The ice cream, topping offerings, and cookie dough are amazing! Unfortunately the staff seems rather disorganized and poorly trained. I had a very frustrating experience with a young employee and ended up leaving with an incorrect to go order. This place would be a 10/10 if they had well trained efficient staff who knew how to better manage long lines.

Finally a new ice cream choice in the downtown area. And they are open until 11pm on Friday and Saturday, which is nice. I had the Java Whip, which was an excellent coffee flavored milkshake. They also serve edible cookie dough and a full coffee menu. Will definitely be back to sample some of their soft serve. Come for the ice cream and stay for the chill retro vibes!

Stumbled across this place on a casual Sunday in OTR. When I looked at the menu and saw that they had edible cookie dough, I had to indulge! When I discovered that I could get ice cream and cookie dough side by side, I was hooked! I got cookies and cream with chocolate chip cookie dough, and it was so amazing! Great ice cream, great cookie dough, great atmosphere! I can't wait to go back!
This a great little gem in the Pendleton/OTR area.....amazing Cookie Dough and great atmostphere.

This is a great little parlor tucked away in the heart of Cincinnati! The ice cream is the best I have ever had and the edible cookie dough is delicious! I enjoy getting the side by side with vanilla soft serve and the sugar cookie with sprinkles cookie dough! Highly recommend this ice cream parlor at anytime during the day!

When I go to get ice cream on a Sunday night at 9:45pm when the closing time is 10:00pm and there are 3 people working and all 3 of them ignore me and act as if it's an inconvenience that I'm there, it's a real bummer. Ice cream is a delicious exciting treat I look forward to on Sundays... and I always leave this place a little bummed. The flurries are fire though and they will keep me coming back, I am just always a little let down by the service.

They gave me free cookie dough. I walked in to ask if they could hang up *my* promotional poster, and *they* gave me free cookie dough. Customer service is always exceptional. I stop by very frequently.

Place is a little rink dink piece of heaven. The ice cream is like god put his little fingers in the mixer and the edible cookie dough tastes like that cold winter night when your mom would make homemade chocolate chip cookie dough with one ingredient we seem to be missing nowadays: love.

I really wanted to like this place...truly, but it just became harder and harder to look past these glaring issues. My wife and I are in Cincy for the weekend and love a good ice cream place, even better when you add in cookie dough; how can this get ruined you might ask...well I'll tell you. There are first off no prices listed anywhere, so until you get ready to pay do you know the damage you've inflicted on your bank account for what I would call mediocre ice cream at best. We ordered 2 side-by-sides (cookie dough and ice cream together in a cup) and it was $10.50. Then, because it was a hot night, I'd had a few, and needed a little pick-me-up I ordered an iced coffee. The total was now $14.50....excuse me what?! $4 for basic, black, only so-so iced coffee? Being from Chicago where prices are generally high, this is ridiculous. Next - customer service, or rather lack thereof. Again, I'm not a Cincy native so I don't know how your freaking menu works, so perhaps offer a brief explanation to make the ordering process easier and more efficient for the line of folks behind us. Instead a curt "I can take your order..." with all of the enthusiasm of a lifeless fish was all we were greeted with. And just a suggestion, chill your cookie dough. It's far more appealing, better textured, and less likely to melt your ice cream rapidly on an already hot night in a rather warm establishment, than the room temperature cookie dough squish I was served. Also, if you close at 11, don't start visibly and loudly closing up shop at 9:45...and also, if you've worked a 10 hour shift, I get it you could be a little frustrated, but don't complain about it in front of your customers. As for a blatant health code violation, at least where I'm from in Illinois and now in Kentucky, maybe don't your garbage out through the main dining room and front door while you've got at least 8 patrons in there. Y'all have a back door to the alleyway behind your building to your dumpster for a reason. Also, when you get back in from taking out the trash, wash your freaking hands before taking someone's order.
