Have staff that seem to give a shit about their jobs and aren't so preoccupied by trying to close early, playing inappropriate shows on Netflix (I don't personally care about shows rated TV-MA, but it's a family establishment  let's keep it that way), and being generally surly to paying customers who were looking to a nice end to their evening only to have it patently deflated by what I can only describe as truly abominable customer "service". For my money, I'd have gone to DQ and been happier. This definitely will NOT be a place I come back to next time in the area unless so major changes happen. Peace out Pendleton's, see ya never.
Amazing cookie dough and ice cream. Such an adorable place! Dog friendly which is a big plus.

HEALTH CODE VIOLATION CONCERN - I'll start by saying the store is darling and the ice cream was SO delicious. I love they make things from scratch and you can see how they work on all the goodies right there in the store. HOWEVER, I saw one of the workers stick her finger (without gloves) in the cookie dough she was making to test it, LICK her finger, and stick her hand again in the dough after adjusting some of the ingredients. Absolutely unacceptable, unsafe, unhygienic and just gross.  She should not be touching the dough without gloves and licking her hands while working with food. The owner should seriously talk to the employees about this serious issue to ensure the safety of the food they sell. As much as I loved the ice-cream, I will not be coming back due to food safety concerns.

Super cute place/decor. The soft serve ice cream only comes in vanilla, chocolate, or zebra. They have special flavors but they add toppings to the vanilla or chocolate ice cream to make it that way. So is it a natural home made flavor.. NOPE. The ice cream did not taste better than ikea's soft serve or McDonald's. Their gimmick is their cookie though. The cookie dough tasted like flour, and it was super salty. What a disappointment. You can't find a single price anywhere in the store so their employees are excellent at up-selling every single item and they give it to you super quick so when it's time to pay you can't say anything but give them all of your money !  I will not be back. I prefer to give my money to Schneider's in ky! That's true home made ice cream!

I had high hopes this would be a fun dessert /coffee spot, but my husband and I were disappointed. The cookie dough and ice cream were pretty good. The staff was friendly but they need to be properly trained. They had no idea how to work the nitro machine and also didn't know how to properly make a chai latte. They gave me the chai and it was cold. Sweet girls, but staff should know how to make items on the menu.

Edible cookie dough... need I say more? This is a cute corner place in the growing Pendleton neighborhood. The soft serve is amazing, as is the cookie dough. If you're questioning whether or not it's worth the rave, it is. Try it for yourself!

I was excited to go to Pendleton  because I have heard many great things about the restaurant but I was sad to say that it was not good. first off the cookie do was way too sweet and the dough was thick ad I could barely finish one scoop. the ice cream was okay but I was not thinking that it was going to be that great anyway. the staff is also a hit or miss with the staff, they were not helpful with the selection of the products.

Hands down my favorite ice cream/dessert place! Went for the first time on Friday, and I got a scoop of chocolate chip cookie dough with vanilla ice cream mixed with peanut butter cups. It was essentially like a peanut butter cup blizzard with chocolate chip cookie dough. Does it get any better than that? Needless to say, I will be back!

I'm obsessed with this place. So cute inside, they usually play episodes of the office or some other awesome show. The chocolate chip cookie dough and the cake batter are both aaaaamazing (and I'm a cookie dough fanatic so you can trust my opinion). The soft serve is creamy and delicious, not that icy nonsense some places have. I wish they had a small size option only because I don't have the self control not to eat the entire giant cup. I will be back over and over again
Nice place to cool off in Cincy w some tasty ice cream. Personally I had the chocolate malt shake which was delish!

For anyone living in this are of OTR and has a sweet tooth or addiction to chocolate, this is your go to place. While waiting on my order I looked around at all the vintage style accessories, some very unique and you don't see around a lot. The one that caught my attention was the old metal divers helmet. I don't know if that would be categorized as vintage but is definitely unusual and not seen often. The parlor is not a place to sit and enjoy your treat unless it is not at peak hours. The space is not large enough to have much in the way of seating. If you go at a time when they be fairly busy and folks are sitting there is little space in which to navigate when placing your order and waiting for it to be prepared. Yesterday, mid-afternoon would be considered peak time. All seating taken, we weren't planning on staying; however the line waiting to order was okay but once you order, pay and wait for it you should use common sense and take a place in a different line, if you will so as not to block those coming to the counter to order. If the couple who ordered following me would have taken their place BEHIND me and not stay planted in front of us waiting for our order there wouldn't have been the bottleneck at the counter. This is what I mean about common sense.  This in no way reflects on The Parlor. The choices of ice creams, sorbet, shakes/malts are plentiful. Different ways to have your indulgence such as cone, cone in a dish, etc. The prices are in line with other ice cream shops for the size and what you order. The young ladies working yesterday were on the move, steady pace to get everyone served with minimal wait. The Parlor is immaculate! Since chocolate is my primary addiction I ordered a chocolate malt. It was amazing! Took me mentally to my childhood. My grandmother, who lived on Madison Road, would walk us to Aglamesis for a treat. The Parlor will be on my list of places to revisit!

Very eclectic decor. They have the option to have ice cream along with the cookie dough (split) - which I highly recommend! I got the vanilla ice cream with classic chocolate chip cookie dough. The portion was enough for two people. Many times cookie dough tastes too rich to eat alone, but here, the ice cream really helped balance it out!
Great atmosphere, reasonable price, and delicious product... perfect setting to walk the streets and enjoy a nice afternoon

This place is awesome!! I love bringing friends here. Great place to hangout. My first experience I brought my bumble friend date and it was such a great experience with the staff! Thanks again for being awesome
Just go here. Don't think about it. JUST GO. Holy ish the edible cookie dough is unmatched by anything I've eaten before. AND the price point is nice.

Milk Jar is my favorite place to grab bubble tea in Cincinnati. The teas are rich and full of flavor. The tapioca pearls are always chewy and consistent. Parking is super convenient. 

I like to grab the oolong milk tea or the matcha strawberry latte. It's always a treat coming here.

If you're unsure of anything, the staff is always helpful and happy to answer questions.

After reading all of the rave reviews,  I decided to check for myself to see what all of the hype was about. Let me tell you, I am so glad that I did. I wanted my first go at Milk Jar to be something standard, so they recommended the Black Ceylon Tea. While waiting, I read that co-owner Jimmy Lin is from Fujian, which is considered the tea capital of China. He imports the tea straight from China, so you know what you're getting is top-quality. 

While I was here,I was also intrigued by the "milk cap" that was available as an add-on. I read elsewhere that the milk cap is a new trend that has been dubbed the Chinese cappuccino. On their menu, they describe their milk cap as a salty, soft foam - not unlike what you'd find at the frothy top layer of a cappuccino. However, I knew immediately upon taking my first taste that it was a little different than something you'd find at a run-of-the-mill cafe. The milk cap had a foam-like texture, but it also contained a thick enough consistency to be considered something chewable. The end result was something I could only describe as heavenly. The flavor was reminiscent of something sweet, but I couldn't quite put my finger on what it was. After a few more sips, I determined that it was similar to cheesecake. Their menu listed the milk cap as made up of cream cheese and pink salt, so the cheesecake comparison made sense. 

Other options on their extensive menu include items such as rolled ice cream and various sugary breakfast cereals. If you have a sweet tooth, I would definitely make a point to swing by a try Milk Jar for yourself!

Amazing boba place. Their selection is amazing. I got the caramel milk with taro with bubbles and milk cap and it was omg heavenly. Never had a cheesecake flavored milk foam on top of my boba before but I'm going to get that whenever possible. My kiddos had the fresh fruit strawberry and mango teas with lychee jelly and they were delicious. No reconstituted powder stuff here folks. The very basic stuff, like having a super chewy and fresh tasting bubbles up to the very fluffy optional stuff were done so well. I typically don't like to drink my calories, but I will make an exception for the Milk Jar (really anything from here) every time I can. Well done guys.

New cute little bubble tea place! We went to the other location i can't remember the address but they don't have a yelp page yet. They have so many different flavors i have never heard of i had no idea what to choose but i went with the mango jasmine tea figuring i'd get a little bit sweet but still a traditional tea flavor with bubbles. I liked the tea itself but the bubbles were not as soft in my opinion. *disclaimer* i am spoiled by NY/Queens bbtea places like xin fu tang and tiger sugar with superrr soft squishy bubbles. Otherwise it was good and i want to come and try different flavors. My friend got the oreo milkies which basically tasted like an oreo mcflurry to me which was yums. 

This location has the nicest staff and happy to answer any questions. The decor is so insta with their mint walls and they will be serving food there i heard. Will come back for more!

My new favorite milk tea place! I've been here 3 times now and I haven't gotten anything I haven't liked. They have unique flavors of milk tea and they have a custard pudding that they put inside the tea that is delicious! Custard in your milk tea sounds weird but it goes so great together! They have an option to make your drink "dirty" which just means they use brown sugar instead of caramel. I have tried the dirty mango, dirty taro, Thai milk tea, mango matcha latte, the caramel mango pudding, and the dirty egg milk tea. I keep buying 2 at a time because they are so good. You can also chose your sweetness level. Make sure you stir up the drink when you get it otherwise you will take a big gulp of all the sweet syrup and flavors at the bottom. I also think the teas look cool with the ombré effect of the milk on top with all the flavors at the bottom (insta worthy).

I highly recommend coming here for a snack or afternoon pick me up. I stop by whenever I'm in the area. They also have regular teas, and rolled ice cream that I am looking forward to trying next.

This has been on my list for a while of places to check out. I was sad that I didn't get to check out the interior, but immediately impressed with their covid protocol. 

Everything is contactless, even payment which made me feel very safe. 

I got a regular Mango Oolong tea and it was a little too sweet for me so I'll get less sugar next time! The lychee jellies were a good consistency and I could tell they used actual mangoes from the mango chunks in my tea. You do have to shake v well to get a uniform consistency, but it was very tasty.

I plan to come visit again when I'm craving boba!

I'm so glad to see that there are bubble tea shops around Cincinnati! Milk Jar seemed the most unique to the city with a very high rating, so I decided to stop by during my short trip. I went right when it opened in the morning on a weekday, so it was empty. The cashier was very helpful with the menu, and the drinks were made so fast!

I love how customizable every drink was on the menu, but it definitely made it harder for me to choose. I went with a mango oolong tea under recommendation and a dirty egg milk tea out of curiosity. To preface, both drinks were extremely sweet, and I'd order them again with less sugar.

The mango oolong tea was tasty, but it was like a sugar bomb with the lychee jelly. I had to drink lots of water in between. I enjoyed it though, and it tasted like fresh mangos. The dirty egg milk tea was basically a brown sugar milk tea with egg custard topping, hence "dirty egg." I really liked this tea, and I'm a huge fan of egg custard.

I can see why Milk Jar has such a high rating, and I could see that the menu was created with a lot of care. I'm excited to visit again when I'm back and maybe try some of the other desserts as well!

I have been to Milk Jar Cafe twice this past week, and both times have been amazing! They have some outdoor seating and are not seating indoors currently due to COVID (they have been following the guidelines great with masks and contactless payments). Just know that they don't accept card under $10 (but you can use venmo or cash). I got the oolong milk tea and Ceylon black milk tea, and both were great. Their only milk substitute is Almond milk, which is my favorite non-dairy milk (hello lactose intolerance). Their tapioca boba is bouncy with a nice brown sugar flavor, and their tea was great quality as well! Because the cups are very sturdy, they offer a discount when you bring back in your cup and lid to reuse. This is my go to boba place here in Cincinnati :)

This is a great boba place! My mom took me here and got me some boba one time and we went more after that. I've had a variety of boba there and there not to sweet(I'm not a huge sweet person so it's perfect for me). They have rolled ice cream which is delicious, it's also really fun to watch them make it. When I came here last they made some rolled ice cream for another customer and they put all the mixture on the spatula and threw it in the air! The atmosphere in there is also amazing such a cool place to hang out.
Covid safe and very tasty! Went in for the first time and the staff was so helpful and nice. Love the reusable cups!! Can't wait to come back

Perfect bubble tea.  Tapioca pearls that are cooked appropriately, not mushy or too hard.  There are varying degrees of sweetness that you can choose when you're ordering that even shows up on your receipt so you know they paid attention to it.  And they don't replace it with artificial sweetener so you don't have to worry about any aftertaste.  It's just pure sugar adjustment which should be an option for everything in this world to be honest.  The tea is good, the milk is good.  I wouldn't choose the less ice option unless it's cold outside.  The ice is the only thing that will properly chill your drink so if you ask for half or no ice, your drink will be running water - lukewarm temperature.  The strawberry matcha tea is wonderful with real fruit that provides a subtle hint that works great with the matcha tea and milk.  I think that strawberry popping bubbles in place of tapioca will make a drink sweeter because my fiancee got that with the same 50% sweetness and hers was way sweeter than mine.  Sturdy plastic cups too.  Make sure to recycle them!  Because they're definitely not going anywhere for a while.  The drinks are not as cheap as Houston prices, but that's asking for too much.

Their website is a bit of a mess but their Doordash is well laid out.  I would definitely come back.

Rolled ice cream and Boba tea have all the makings of a fad-ridden sugar binge, but Milk Jar has never impressed me all that much. Maybe I'm just not a fan of rolled ice cream, but it's quite expensive and weirdly flavorless. This sounds ridiculous, but the rolling process almost requires it to be *too* cold (á la Dippin Dots). In the end it's more about the presentation value than the taste... which is fun for the first picture and thereafter suffers from diminishing returns. 

Not sure why their Boba containers need to be made of ballistic-grade /un-recyclable plastic (my inner Captain Planet screams out at this injustice)... just seems a bit wasteful. MJ's a solid choice if already in the area but in general prefer "normal" ice cream.

I've been wanting to try Thai Rolled Ice Cream for a fair amount of time, and I finally made it happen by stopping in at Milk Jar Cafe. I chose Unicorn Poop (Fruity Pebbles, Caramel w/ Vanilla), which has a fun name. Unsurprisingly, it was super sweet. I also had the option to add additional toppings, but I decided to just try it on its own. We were able to watch my ice cream being made and delicately positioned in the serving bowl. Unfortunately, the server ran out of room and had to squash in the final ice cream roll, which ruined the aesthetic lol. 

My husband went with the Strawberry Matcha Latte, and he was pleased with this unique drink. 

Milk Jar has a really unique, fun menu, and I can't wait to try more items featured on it!

The dirty milk tea was sooo good! I definitely recommend it to someone who is trying milk tea for the first time. I don't know what to really get so I just asked the barista what was his favorite drink. Coming into Milk Jar was my best decision ever.

I LOVE this place. I had my ice cream delivered via Door Dash so I'm sure visit 
Ing the establishment would be better. We got two kinds of rolled ice cream (Nutella/banana and something similar to Cookies n Cream); both were delicious. I'm waiting for an excuse to go back there.

I love this place!

The drinks here are fabulous and they use real fruit! I absolutely love their flavors and toppings. Their prices are also reasonable, especially for the quality!

Staff is super nice and they take pride their work. This location is quite far from where I usually am, but it's worth the trip. I adore the decorations inside and the little details of the cafe.

I usually get a milk tea with pudding topping, but you can mix and customize your own drink! There are many choices and options to choose from! They also have rolled ice cream, with various toppings or you can pick a premade item.

There's plenty of parking in the plaza lot and plenty of tables inside and out, to enjoy your order. It's nice to order something refreshing and to sit outside to enjoy.

I recommend this place for casual dates, family outings, group hangouts, or for a sweet treat! Everything is good and you can try the same or different drinks, with various toppings.

Best bubble tea! Even better than places in the DC area where I'm from. 

Everything from the boba consistency to the crushed pieces of real fruit (mango or strawberry), to the tea flavor and the sturdy cups they use, are all perfect. And the milk cap is SO good. I also like that they don't use powder to flavor the tea. 

I'll say it's pricier than many bbtea places but the quality is quite good so it's well worth it to me. Note the $8 minimum for credit cards and they do not take AMEX or Discover. 

I'll definitely have to hit up this place more when I'm back in town!

Great place to get your boba fix! You can adjust the sweetness levels and customize your drink with add ins too. I've appreciated the outside table pickup during the pandemic. If you're doing some grocery shopping, stop by after!

First off, I want to say that the bubble tea and rolled ice cream is delicious. Pickup was also super easy and self explanatory. However, my tea cup had a leak in it. So, I went up to the door and knocked on the glass, hoping to get a new cup. The person making rolled ice cream looked at me for a few seconds, and then said something to the worker at the register. I waited for several minutes with no acknowledgement from them at all. 

Overall: great products, terrible service

Move over Aglamesis. There's a new ice cream in town and it is AMAZING!
This ice cream has a taste and texture like none I have ever had. It is thick and creamy. Now let's talk about the process. Ice cream base. Chose your own topping or choose a creation already developed. Either way you can't go wrong. The guys put your ingredients on this frozen table then chop it, mix it, smear it then roll it up into little tubes. 
My brother-in-law loves the Unicorn Poop. Which is ice cream base with caramel sauce and Fruity Pebbles. I have to agree. It's pretty darn good. Normally I'm pretty simple. I just go with ice cream base, bananas mixed in then topped with pineapple and cherries. However, after eating Unicorn Poop I have decided that on my next visit (which will be Thursday Feb. 20th) I'm gonna have to try the base with bananas, Honey Nut Cheerios and Honey. 
I think that sounds like a winner and I cannot wait!

Pretty tasty! My sister in-law and I were in the area were looking for something sweet. I've been in this shopping area before and would not have know that they served ice cream.

Walking in it was clean and looked like they were still painting the walls. By the counter there is a huge menu. Tons of choices for even the pickiest eaters, although there were few chocolate choices. I got a bit adventurous and got the Unicorn Poop.
Love love love this place! Dirty Mango is my jam! Super convenient to order ahead & pay with Venmo.

Best boba in town ! I love the jasmine mango with boba but you really can't go wrong. It does take a little while BUT they do a great with social distancing-- so as long as you plan ahead, it's totally worth the short wait.

Out of all the bubble tea places in Cincinnati, this is by far my favorite place.  After showing up just a couple of times, they start treating you like family. The owners Jimmy and Kevin really care for the quality and consistency of their teas also! 

The menu can be a little overwhelming, but feel free to ask any of the staff questions; they are always so helpful!

Milk Jar Cafe is my new favorite Cincinnati Boba Tea establishment! When I first moved back to the area, my roommates showed me this place; with a detailed menu, full of various teas (including a build your own / customizable section!) as well as rolled ice cream and fun cereal combinations, Milk Jar Cafe is an absolute must if you're in the Cincinnati area.

The last time I visited this location, the COVID-19 restrictions currently only allow for carry-out orders. The entire take-out procedure is simple, efficient, and relies somewhat on an honor system. Interested patrons can call ahead and place their orders; once your drinks and snacks have been prepared, an employee will set them on a table outside the shop, alongside information on how to pay through cash apps such as Venmo. 

My service here every time has been wonderful. The employees are friendly and helpful, the drinks are consistent and great in quality, and my items are always available within the window they're promised. I can't wait to dine in once things are safe again!

Such a fun  place!

I was in town and looking for bobba, my search led me to Milk Jar. The tea options and toppings are aplenty, so many it's a little overwhelming. The workers were very patient with me as I we played 20 questions.

While there, I had to try the ice cream. The presentation is lovely and the tasty is even more so. Again, there are many topping options, all good quality.

So if you deliver milk every day, use a MILK CAR
And if you serve adult milk drinks, you have a MILK BAR
Don't joke about Barbie's job, that's taking it too MILK FAR
And if you want Boba come and try the drinks at MILK JAR

I think back to my childhood, and thank you for your MILK, MA
Even though I walked in on your HJ, trying to MILK PA
I do so many money shots, I'm not a pornstar, I'm a MILK STAR
But if you want some Bubble Tea, try the drinks at MILK JAR

WHAT

I have lots of great things to say about Milk Jar. They're trying to do a lot of things at once like rolled ice cream and snow ice and whatever but I came here definitively for the fresh homemade bubble tea.

They have different options to others in Cinci, and it's quite an original menu. It's definitely advanced for the Cincinnati area. That makes three pretty good bubble tea shops they have in these parts, and this is the only one that is out in the suburbs, and probably the most authentic and imaginative.

The girl serving was a total angel and was flirting with me. The guys were really cool. I was teasing them for getting a different customer confused with another customer. They took it well. Good sports.

Speaking of Good Sports don't talk to Cincinnati natives about their sports teams.

Anyway I appreciate the innovative and authentic and fresh Bubble Tea menu. I also really really appreciate how they make their stuff. Everything is real and natural and fresh, for example the strawberry tea features a bunch of strawberries blended up and mixed on the spot, with some tea. You really don't see that a lot and they're doing it extremely well. Talk about the real deal. Guy Fieri can go f*** himself.

There's always a problem though - and in this case the problem is the tapioca. Listen, when you are charging a pretty hefty amount for your bubble tea - especially by Cincinnati standards - and when you are doing such a perfect job with everything else like the fresh fruit in the fruit teas and the wonderful tasting milk teas, then you really need to get the boba right. Its not the taste, because it's very sweet delicious honey boba and could even be some of the best I've had based on taste alone. But they real problem is the texture. It's nightmarish.

I don't know if it was a one-off and I really hope it was, but even if it was a one-off, that shouldn't happen. If your Boba is so hard that it's going to break my teeth and be spat right out the window onto Interstate 71 at 85mph unless you're a cop in which case I promise I was doing 55 officer, then you shouldn't be serving it.

Literally I had to try to avoid getting boba in my straw for both of my drinks - which were both excellent drinks.

When I did get boba in my straw, which happened several times, I had to avoid trying to chew it because it was hurting my teeth because it was so hard and tough and rubbery. And I never have that problem and I try dozens of boba places a week. Sure, squidgy boba gets old, soggy boba sucks, but hard boba that hurts teeth? That's the biggest no no of all.

The taste of it was nice but the consistency was awful and I have no idea what they did with it - perhaps left it laying around a long time or just didn't do it right. So down came the window at 85 I mean 55 miles an hour and my spitting talents were put to the most severe test as I fired four and five Boba at a time out of the window trying to make sure they didn't land in the car.

And they didn't, if Avis asks.

So if you were driving on I-71 north outside Cincinnati on that day and you found some hard pieces of tapioca on your tires after your drive then I apologize, if they hit your windshield, I apologize for the broken glass (they were that hard), but you should also call this shop and ask them to apologize as well because I'm not the one who made the Boba inedible.

Five stars for the drinks and service. One star for the tapiok. It was anything but OK.

So if you got drunk in a bar
And your beer addiction's gone too far
There's an alternate option
To getting your hops on
Come get some Boba at Milk Jar!

Move over local tea competitors, Milk Jar Cafe is killing the tastebuds right now with a sweet, creamy, and refreshing take on milk teas! 

I don't live in the area but I was taken here by my boyfriend and can we please get one in Louisville?? I have tried a handful of milk tea's all over the world and Milk Jar has brought me to life. The milk tea is creamy and refreshing at the same time... how is that possible?! 

I am not a boba girl myself because I am currently using Invisalign and didn't want to risk getting it stuck so I opted for the grass jelly and oh my, 100% recommend! 

If you are in the area and craving milk tea, fruit tea, or rolled ice cream this is the place visit. I will be coming back here!! 

Side note... I love that the have a heart stopper on every cap and the cups are hard and durable, great cups and great service. 

As a first timer here they were very patient and helpful, a hello and a smile and a goodbye with a wave! 

With some of the drinks (strawberry matcha) you have to stir until it's all one color a little of a workout but it stirs quickly.

Great selection, tasty ice cream, and good bubble tea. The idea of mixing Thai ice cream and cereal was a new one to me, but a delicious idea! Sort of a twist on Cold Stone.
Everything is *very* sweet -- for me, this is definitely a place for an occasional sweet treat, not a regular stop. The prices are maybe a teensy bit high -- my partner and I got two ice creams and two teas between us, and paid over $25.
The staff did not seem to be knowledgeable about dietary restrictions -- when my partner asked about gluten-free options, one worker said that nothing was gluten-free because they use heavy cream. (Maybe confused with fat free or sugar free?)
There is a bit of seating inside, but the space echoes and can get loud quickly.
It's a neat place, and probably does well in a wealthier trendy neighborhood like Hyde Park.

Coming from boba in California Milk Jar Cafe was a happy surprise. I honestly had no idea what to think about Ohio boba. They also had extremely safe handling procedures for COVID-19. You order through phone or one of the food delivery apps and pay through those or Venmo as well! Contactless process! I got the caramel pudding with milk and boba and it was so good! The boba was very fresh and chewy. My sister got the oolong milk tea with grass jelly which was great as well! The best thing was that they were not overly sweetened! I have to go again and try more flavors! I hope they add lychee jelly to their toppings soon!

Ugh I see myself spending so much money here. Bye bye overpriced, burnt Starbucks and hello creamy, fresh Milk Tea! I'm in love. 

Stopped in and needed a quick lesson on milk tea, milk cap and boba. The two working gave me some great info and I was super excited to try the milk tea. I ordered with milk cap, a delicious creamy, salty, sweet cap and chewy tapioca boba. The drink deserves 10 stars, it tasted amazing. 

The cups are reusable with 5% off if you reuse it. I love the cup concept with a place to drink straight from the cup to mix the cap + tea or a wide straw to drink up the boba. I loved this drink and was actually a little sad when it was gone. I could've drank two of these! 

Looking forward to bringing my kiddo for a cereal bowl or rolled ice cream. I'm not really sure why this place isn't heavily marketed, I never really heard of it before Yelp. It's now easily my top 2 fav stop for sweet treats!

I've been meaning to try to this place for awhile! I'm so glad I tried this place! I had the matcha strawberry and tasted some of the matcha latte! I loved the freshness of it! The tapioca was also nice & chewy! It's probably one of the most nicest bobas I've had in awhile!

Update: I tried the mango matcha latte and it was a bit too sweet for me so I wish I could adjust the sweetness of drinks here but the boba was still chewy and I still like coming here!

I've been here a few times and the first time I went was close to when they opened recently, so a review from me is long over due. The teas are amazing, and the options they offer are surprisingly extensive for a boba place that focuses on freshness and quality of its ingredients. These guys definitely know what good boba is, and having a conversation with the staff makes the experience more memorable. If you do go a couple of times, they will try to get to know you. As a Californian who is coming from the boba capital of the nation, Milk Jar is definitely one of the best places in the area for boba, and dare I say, might actually be able to compete with some places in the Bay Area.   

As for drinks I've tried, get one of the milk cap drinks, and their mango/strawberry matcha latte drinks can actually compare to Boba Guys from the West Coast. (For those of you who are also familiar with Boba Guys) In fact, I think I'm just gonna call Milk Jar the Boba Guys of Ohio!

This place is my new OBSESSION! I'm new to loving bubble tea, but whenever I want some this will be where I go! The employees are so helpful and nice. I got the Caramel Taro Tea and it was sooo good. Also loved how they had a Poke Bowl bar option too. I got a chicken one and it was delicious!! Definitely check out Milk Jar if you're in the area!!!

I'm bumping up my review by one star, because my recent experience was much better than my previous one. The matcha latte with a milk cap is a must try! 

The milk cap is a pseudo cheese and heavy cream foam that adds a delicious unique flavor and texture to each sip. 

If you want a milk cap, but want to reduce the amount of calories you're consuming you can ask them to make the matcha latte with almond milk and then add the milk cap on top or not have it all! They also allow you to control your sugar levels and toppings.

If you do go, I still do not recommend ordering the boba. Though they were better this time, they are still a bit too hard for my taste. 

Everything else is fresh and preservative free. It's nice to have a tea in town that is not made with a pre-packaged mixture. Definitely check them out and order a milk tea!

I love this place. It's a bit far from where I live but whenever I have time I would stop by and get me a matcha bubble tea drink. Always good. Their milk is delicious. Will always come back every time I'm around.

We were so excited about this place that we may have hyped it up WAY too much for ourselves.  Being from San Diego, we were on a mission to find boba and not only boba but good boba.  Based on the yelp reviews, we were stoked and excited to get some legit boba in Cincinnati.

But sadly, it just wasn't that great.  The drinks themselves were ok but the boba texture was just wrong.  The consistency was hard and not soft.  We were quite disappointed.  ::sad face::

The ice cream was good and the guys working there seemed SUPER excited to see a group of asian people walk in.  His greeting was so upbeat it was almost as if he knew us!  Super friendly store owners.

Boba could use some work.  Just doesn't compare to the boba here in San Diego!

This place is usually my favourite and I always go here for their  creamy layered boba drinks. However I had a bad experience this time. I sang praises about the place and took my friends . We were given extremely dilute orders and everyone was disappointed because it was not what we had drank before. When we asked for a change the girl was very cranky and gave us literally what tasted like whole milk with a bit of boba. 

Also, they should upgrade the proportions for large drinks. They give the same amount of boba for a large glass as they give for the small. 

I wish my experience could've been better after all this time that I have enjoyed it.

Milk Bar Café is a cute café and concept. I love milk teas so this is right up my alley. I also think that rolled ice cream is pretty cool. I happened to see that this was a new establishment on Yelp and had to try it. I am glad I did as my milk tea was great and the ice cream was good. My only compliant is that they are a little pricy. The rolled ice cream is one size and its $7.00. I thought this was a little high of what would equate to 1.5 or 2 scoops of ice cream from another ice cream parlor. The tea for the size I got was like $3.50 or $4.00. 

I got the Cookie Monster with a toasted marshmallow on the top to share with my husband and daughter. We choose the vanilla base. It was one Oreo crushed up into our ice cream. I personally prefer more and chunks but it was nice to experience the rolled ice cream. I guess I could have asked for more once rolled on top. They also didn't toast my marshmallow enough. It wasn't gooey. Ice cream with gooey marshmallow is everything.

I only took a few bites of ice cream and then ordered a Thai Milk Tea with Boba. It was delicious. I have no complaints about the tea. I would definitely come back for more. 

Overall, Milk Bar Café is good and we had a good experience.

I am now officially addicted to Milk Bar Cafe. If you're in Cincinnati and want a delicious treat or are looking to try something out of the ordinary (for the Midwest at least...) you have to stop by Milk Bar Cafe!

As someone born and raised in the Midwest, I'll be the first to admit that I'm not an expert in bubble tea. I would however consider myself an expert in seeking out delicious food and WOW did Milk Bar exceed my expectation. The shop itself is small, sleek, and clean. The menu is displayed on a huge chalk board wall, which is nice because you can read it and start deciding what you want while you're waiting in line. The staff is friendly and seemed happy to give guidance for those who weren't sure what they wanted. If I lived in the area, I could totally see myself stopping in with my laptop t grab some delicious bubble tea and get some work done. 

I had the strawberry matcha bubble tea with tapioca bubbles and it was INSANE! My mind was blown because, how can something be so flavorful and delicious?! Seriously. It was certainly sweet, but not overpowering so. The strawberry flavor was there, but it also let the matcha shine. And, even though I'm no tapioca bubble expert, they were the perfect texture for me because they didn't melt or get too gooey as I sipped on it throughout my long drive home (even though I had to exercise some serious self control not to slurp the entire thing down in a few minutes). If you're not sure what to get, I would absolutely recommend the strawberry match bubble tea. 

I'll definitely be stopping back in Milk Bar Cafe as soon as possible. You should too!

I LOVE this place, the drinks are always amazing. I usually get a Thai milk tea with boba and it's fantastic. Amazing flavors and pickup is easy. Call ahead and give them your name and then pay with venmo when you pick up. Super easy, really covid safe.

I was really wanting to eat ice cream and i found Milk Cafe on yelp, which was not that closed to the area but it seemed like a place that had to be visited so i convinced my boyfriend to go and check out.   
I have to say i really loved the place, first because as soon as you arrive all employees greet you and make you feel welcomed.  Furthermore, we told them it was out first time there so the cashier went through all the menu which was helpful unlike other places where you find yourself m super lost.

After debating what we wanted to order, i got Pick up Lime and he got the Cookie Moster, both were delicious, we were both satified with the quality of the ice cream, it had a lot of flavor in comparisson to other shops with the similar concepts.

Lastly, the place itself is small but spacious, the decoration is minimal but it has all that i needs there is enough space to seat talk and eat. 

I highly recomedn the place you really won't wan to miss it, i will definety be back to try the milk teas.

Delicious. Friendly service. Great boba tea and rolled ice cream. I would recommend to everyone. I got the banana and wafer rolled ice cream with the very mango tea with passion fruit boba. Prices are average.

Hands down one of the best Boba shops I have been too. Their drinks are legit and are not made from powder like many others. They also have a great selection. Highly recommend 10/10. While Covid is going on be sure to call in your order so you don't have to wait outside.

I love love love Thai milk tea with boba and this place has the best one I've had in Cincinnati! Along with the other teas I've had, I have yet to be disappointed. I also love how they use reusable cups, although with covid, I have a stockpile that I can't wait to use once the inside opens up again!
Was looking for ice cream within walking distance of a brewery. The walk was worth it. The captain cinnamon & camp fire delight were
I love milk jar, their staff, and their boba tea! The vibes are great so you could sit there for hours.
Super easy ordering and they place the orders outside the store on a table with clearly labeled names. Very delicious!

The staff and food/drinks here are both great. I've had the ice cream and a couple of boba teas on different visits and each item was A+ . i like their COVID protocols and how easy they make it to pay and pick up orders.

Love this place! It is evident that the owners care about their work and quality of their product. I've been here a few times, with family and friends, and everyone each time has enjoyed their drink or treat! I'm not a huge fan of tea in general, and I like how here there are so many flavor combos that I can find something to like. They also have a large variety of things to add into the drinks from boba to jelly. The rolled ice cream was nice and light, fun to add in lots of toppings and mix ins. Make sure to get a stamp card because this is a place you will want to keep visiting (so rack up those stamps!)

This place was so cute! My boyfriend and I are from KY but stopped by this place while we were in Cinci to grab some boba. They have a lot of options and I got something that I've never have before. They have unique drinks and I would love to try each one of them. The owner helped us with our drinks and he was very friendly. Would definitely recommend!

If this place was in OTR, it would be busy all day every day. As it is, it was empty when we walked in. The woman at the counter took the time to explain the entire menu to us, which was great. We were only there for tea, but they also have cereal bowls and rolled ice cream. We got a milk cap Thai tea with boba and a strawberry matcha tea with boba. 
I'd heard about milk caps before and they totally lived up to the hype- it's like a little touch of foamy cheesecake on top! They showed me how to drink it correctly, which I appreciated! I saw some complaints in the reviews about the boba texture being wrong, but ours was just right! Soft and a little chewy. The only reason I'm giving four stars instead of five is because the bathroom was really really filthy. The front of house was super clean and tidy so that was surprising, but it was honestly really gross in there. Still, we will definitely go back for the tea!

Yum yum yum!! I had no idea a rolled ice cream place even existed here let alone in Hyde Park!! They have so many amazing creamery flavors and teas but I opted for the mint rolled ice cream! It was really really tasty and a decent sized portion! I also loved the fact that I could watch them roll my ice cream which added to the experience! They have lots of toppings you can add to your ice cream, but I opted to just have the regular mind chocolate ice cream! 

So glad I found this place and will for sure be back to enjoy throughout the summer! And the guys working there were really nice and helped my friend and I with our decisions which is always appreciated!

Finally they have a punch card so eventually you can enjoy a treat for free!

Unfortunately I only took videos so I can't share them but trust me when I say it looks good and tastes good :)
Call to order ahead, it's all contactless . Boba is fresh and on the aldente side. Creative combos for drinks. So excited to find a legit bubble tea place.

This place is not overalls decorated. It's just the right amount of coolness. I ordered a Matcha Lattes with Fresh strawberries. It was a little sweet for my taste so next time I'll order milk tea. My husband ordered Jasmine Milk Tea with Milk Cap. He liked it a lot. I think what's cute is the reusable cups. Bring it back and you get 5 percent off each time.

Went to this place on a whim to satisfy our sweet tooth. My first experience with rolled ice cream and it was delicious! I had the Oreo coffee and topped it with chocolate chips, coconut flakes, whipped cream and a cherry.

Super friendly staff (the type that makes you want to come back!). Delicious drinks. My favorite are any of the boba milk teas (matcha,
Thai).

I've been here twice so far and I think it's an adequate addition to the Hyde park area serving all your bubble tea and rolled ice cream needs. My favorite order is the Thai tea with a milk cap which means you get a layer of creamy and cheesy froth on top of your tea. Cheese and tea may sound gross but think more like sweet cream cheese and it's delicious. You have to be sure to drink it at the right angle though so that all of the flavors meld together. The guys who work here are friendly and in my last visit they let me sample some of the more exotic flavors of boba and jelly that I was less familiar with. I don't go out of my way for milk bar but when I'm in the area and craving bubble tea I make the stop.

This is a fun way to try boba and/or a cheese drink. I HIGHLY recommend a cheese topped drink, that's the white "foam" looking drink. It's mildly salty and all kinds of creamy wonderfulness. It is a little pricey, but a fun alternative and definitely different for the area.

ATTENTION ALL CINCINNATIANS

This is what real milk tea tastes like! They freshly brew all their ingredients here and have no artificial flavoring/sweeteners. They have rolled ice cream, teas/boba, and a cereal bar. The business owner really cares about providing authentic, good quality products and I am so here for it!! Please visit their café! 

I ordered a mango matcha latte with a milk cap and IT IS GOOOOD. Their milk caps have cream cheese milk and pink salt, making the drink extra special. It's like drinking a cheesecake in a way.. SO YUMMM. JUST TRY IT. 

PS. They give reusable cups!! You will want to bring their cups back, trust me. I try to be as green as I can so I am loving that this business cares. Especially because the boba/drinks industry continues to be a huge contributing force in the plastic crisis. Love this shop! Will definitely come back often!!

It is time...to drop a review! It is my new boba spot. I have one other one, but it is a bit of a drive from us. Being from California...I know my boba lol Not only does this place do boba, but it also does rolled ice cream, cereal, and just added some type of pudding (still need to try).

I have enjoyed coming here not only for the treats, but also the customer service. They always greet you, take the time to speak with you, go over the menu...just gives you a mom and pop feel.

They have tons of options of everything: ice cream, toppings, boba, and tea flavors. Something that is new to me is the milk cap. My go-to drink is the strawberry/match tea combo with the milk cap. It is like a little piece of heaven has fallen onto your tea. The milk cap has a dense, rich cheesecake flavor.

I recently switched over to the jasmine tea with the jasmine milk cap and still super tasty. It adds a bit of sweetness without being overpowering.

One of the bummer's of this place is the pricey-ness of it. If you bring your reusable cups back they only give you 5% off your next drink. I appreciate the thoughtfulness, but still, you will typically walk out of this place for nothing less than $8 bucks a person.

For me...it is still worth it!! Quality items + tastiness = win for me! Milk Bar Cafe, you keep bringing me back!!

I am beyond ecstatic that this place exists. As a bay area transplant, I've been missing my milk tea pretty hard. I happened to wander in opening week and the staff was super nice and helpful, and best of all, of course, the quality of the drinks they produce IS ON POINT. So good. You can really taste the tea flavor. There aren't many options around Cincy but the ones I have tried just sort of taste like melted milkshakes. This place obviously pays attention to quality and is passionate about their craft. The tea is not too strong, not too sweet, and balances with the milk perfectly. The boba are the perfect texture, which is also a rare find even in areas with more milk tea shops. 
Trust me, as a San Jose native and someone who is so in love with boba milk tea that they resorted to making their own at home (harder than it sounds)... this place is an absolute gem. 
I nearly wept with happiness when I tasted their oolong milk tea with boba. 

The ice cream is also great. haha. 

The o n l y thing that I would want to see added to the menu are crystal boba. I loved getting those with fruity teas back home. 

I'm so endlessly impressed with these good good folks that I'm definitely gonna be a regular.

So excited to finally stop into Milkbar! The name itself totally draws me in.

I went in on a Wednesday night around 8pm. There were a couple families there together and us. Shortly after we got our order though the line grew to probably 12ish people.

The menu is huge! When an employee asked if we had been there before and we said no he happily came around to our side of the counter to walk us through the options.

The main choices on their menu are ice cream, milk, or cereal. Each are available with different mix-ins and (ice cream and cereal only) unlimited toppings.

The cereal mixes didn't really appeal to me, but I really wanted to try just about every ice cream and milk tea available. Like any good ice cream place, they have a variety of fruity, chocolatey, minty, caramel, etc options. I decided to hold off on the milk until next time and get an ice cream. I could decided between the campfire (s'mores style) or the mango madness so I had the cashier choose for me. Mango madness it was.

My freshly made, ROLLED ice cream was ready in just a few minutes. I asked for a vanilla wafers, strawberry, and just a few mango bobas to top it off.

This was my first experience with rolled ice cream and it was great! It was very fresh and creamy with the perfect amount of small mango bits worked in. I really liked the texture. It was light but still feel indulgent, like a real treat. I also am now a huge fan of mango popping bobas, as in the past I've been afraid to try it because I knew I didn't like traditional boba.

This place is definitely pricey at over $14 for my husband and I together. We don't get out much anymore though, so I was happy to treat myself this particular night. I imagine we'll be back to try a milk or the campfire ice cream soon!

Friendly staff eager to help customers, hilarious bathroom signage, re-usable cups, boba, milk caps, rolled ice cream, cereal bar and fresh, natural ingredients + much, much more.... Toto, I don't think we're in Ohio anymore .... but we ARE and I am SO HAPPY! Since moving out of the California Bay Area 6 years ago, I have been waiting (and hoping and wishing!) for more legit boba places to open up in Cincinnati (boba cha will always be my first Cincy boba love, but I'm not mad about more options!!) Milk Bar- I will be coming back and bringing recruits next time (which will hopefully be soon!) Thank you for the delicious treats and for helping Cincinnati earn more cool points!

Have your (cheese)cake and eat it too!

I stopped by Milk Bar on a rainy late afternoon. I needed pick-me-up and realized that this place just opened. 

Milk Bar is nestled on the less visited side of HP Plaza near Shaan's. It's bright and modern inside. A woman was painting on canvas at a table for what I think will be really cute wall decor. The staff was super enthusiastic when I walked in and excitedly told me about what all Milk Bar offers. There's not only boba drinks but rolled ice cream (with all the fix-in's your heart desires/that fits in the cup) and make-your-own cereal bowls. 

What I was after however was a refreshing drink - which is was how I was introduced to the milk cap tea....basically tea with a layer of milk thats salty but also sweet... 

Does it sound a little weird? 

Ya.

Is it delicious? 

Absolutely. 

What's it like? 

I had the Jasmine Tea Milk Cap with boba pearls. You could sip the tea with the long straw and get the deliciously floral tea. Or sip from the top and taste the milk cap which tastes like mild salted caramel cheesecake. It's a unique blend but you will not regret it. 

If you're not sold yet, they try to be green! Their cups are re-usable and are relatively sturdy!

I found a lil piece of home, Southern CA at its best!  Loose tea vs powders.  The owner served us, and was super welcoming! 

It's buried in a run down strip mall, hidden.   Go!!  Authentic Milk Tea.

Hands. Down. The. Best. Bubble. Tea. In. The. City. Though Milk Jar is on the pricier side, it couldn't be more worth it for the incredible flavor and experience you get with each of their teas. I have been following Milk Jar on Instagram for quite some time and finally made it over that way to try it out for myself. I got a Thai milk tea with boba and a milk cap. It was heavenly. Like emotionally good. I had never had a milk cap before, but heard it was similar to liquid cheesecake and was sold. There is a little hole on lid meant for sipping the milk cap through. To make matters even better, the staff was amazing-- walking me through the menu and giving me tips and tricks. I got a cute little reward card and learned that if you bring back your cup, you get 10% off your next tea! Sustainability AND savings! I also learned that they use no powders or artificial flavorings-- everything is fresh and real! I will definitely be a lifelong customer at Milk Jar.

A friend posted pics of some rolled ice cream sweetness on Instagram the other day and tagged this place. I wondered where it was, so I clicked in for more info, and was pretty psyched when I realized, woah, this is right down the strip mall from my favorite Indian restaurant, Shaan. 

I wouldn't normally review something after a first visit because I like to try multiple things and have a few experiences to write about. However, I have been thinking about the Strawberry milk tea with boba and a milk cap I ordered ever since I first visited the Milk Bar about five days ago. I wasn't even sure what a milk cap was until I tried it. So rich and decadent. It made me feel opulent AF, y'all. When paired with strawberry, it was like the perfect berries and cream boba tea. So psyched to go back! Especially because I have a powerful need to try the Unicorn Poop ice cream.

Bonus points for their all-gendered restroom. And as a side note, getting a lovely treat from Milk Bar is a super calming way to wind down after spending quite awhile in line at the Joann Fabrics across the parking lot.

This place was really good! The cashier was very nice about explaining the menu. I do wish they would sample milk teas or milk caps - I'm very unfamiliar with those items, and assuming a lot of visitors are too, and the girl helping us wasn't really able to explain them to us. With the price being $5+, I didn't want to try something without knowing at all what it was like, and I think sampling would be a big help here. 
My husband and I both got the rolled ice creams and they were really good and fresh. Made with fresh ingredients on the spot - they are speedy and efficient but you will have to wait a few minutes. But that's just the cost of getting something made fresh! We will definitely be back!

I've been craving for boba after moving to the area, but wasn't having high expectations to be honest. I was just looking for something close to chain brand level, but Milk Bar Cafe is awesome!

I had milk cap oolong tea w/ boba. I realized that I forgot to ask for less sweet after placing the order, but the drink turned out to be just right. The taste of tea was legit. The milk cap was probably the saltiest one I've ever had, but it went well with the tea. The boba are sticky and soft. I like that they have a mix of black and white boba - it doesn't affect the taste but just makes me happier by seeing them lol

The staff was helpful and friendly. He seems passionate about the business. In general I think the place is a must-try for good boba tea in Cincy.

So far so good! I'm thoroughly enjoying the Asian-inspired nomnoms popping up throughout the city! Milk Bar is definitely rolling with the rolled ice cream craze and bubble tea deliciousness! It reminded me of a place I visited in NYC with the cereal, ice cream dishes! 

During my first visit, my daughter got the Thai iced tea and I got the Jasmine green tea with mangos and passion fruit popping balls. Very refreshing and what I needed! There's sooo much more to try and try I will!! 

Come join me!

Omg a bubble tea place right in my neighborhood. Dreams do come true! I've only gotten to stop by once but they have almost everything that I would like in a boba tea shop. Definitely probably some of the best boba you'll find in cincy. The two guys running the show when I was there were super nice and welcoming. You could tell they were having fun  with what they were doing. I'm not super into Thai rolled ice cream but they also have that here along with cereal bowls. Both are customizable with toppings of your choice.

I went with the plain oolong milk tea because I have to judge their classic before I come back and get something else. The drinks come with a plastic cup that's reusable, and they encourage you to bring it back for a small discount on your next beverage. The boba was tasty. I'll definitely be back.

If you're in the mood to try something different, go for a milk cap tea. If you're not sure the best way to drink it, make sure you ask the guys to teach you. Enjoy!

I am glad to see more Asian drink options in Cincinnati. Compared to other bubble tea places in Cincinnati, I, for one, love that they have a parking lot, and 2, they have the milk cap tea! Its a must try! Milk cap teas are popular in China and I am glad to see they offer it. My recommendation would be to get the jasmine green tea milk cap - delicious!

This very cute little spot does Asian style milk tea, regular teas, breakfast cereal concoctions and rolled ice cream. All of these items are pretty hipster these days; rolled ice cream went from zero to everywhere in Cincinnati overnight it seems. That doesn't mean it's not good. In fact, it's darn good.

DLW and I stopped for a little pick-me-up on a Sunday evening, and found the place happily buzzing. The server at the counter patiently explained the ordering process to us, and several more times after we ordered. Our milk teas were freshly prepared, with good quality ingredients. I highly recommend the mango version.

I have a couple of concerns, though. Breakfast cereal isn't my thing, but I thought the offerings were pretty routine and overpriced. Nothing here is cheap, but you get what you pay for. I worry that opening a place like this in the fall is foolhardy, since summer would be the shank of the season. Still I recommend you get here and support this business.

Tried their Classic Ceylon boba tea. It was perfect!
Staff was very friendly and the place offers a nice ambiance.
Normally get my boba in California but thank heavens for good boba right here in my new home. Good clean place, nice staff. Definitely recommend.

Pretty good boba! Coming from Cali where boba is a normal corner drink shop Ive been on the hunt. I wish they offered alternative milk, like oat milk or coconut but so far I like teas. My kids like the rolled ice cream too!

Awesome!!
Great place to get Boba tea and specialty ice teas and ice cream rolls made to order!
Really nice people and a great menu.
Cups are reusable as well. Support the new local Cincinnati!
Never disappointing! Great, quick service. Everything always comes out fresh. They also taking great  COVID precautions!

Decided to branch out and try a new bubble tea place, and Milk Jar Cafe did not disappoint. Loved how friendly the staff was as it was my cousin and I's first time. They walked us through the menu and made sure we knew to ask if we had any questions. The interior was neat and cute. There were some outlets for studying and some seating. We ended up only getting bubble tea after a big dinner, but we'll be back for their ice cream and cereal bar.

I visited today and the owner was not nice or professional.  I do not visit places that talk bad about their competitors.  I've never seen a place blatantly spread false information to try to increase their own brand.  This isn't politics.  It is bubble tea.  Additionally, why would two plain oolong teas cost $8.70?!  Needless to say, I won't ever be back.  Thank u, next!
Got lots of variety that you can choose from! They have rolled ice cream, milk tea and cereal bowl! Definitely give this place a shot if you're stopping by Cincinnati!!
The best Milk Tea I've ever had. It was so good we went back the very next day! I would definitely recommend to anyone.
I'm sold! Great customer service and even better tasting ice cream. I'll definitely be back again!

We've been here 4-5 times now and love the freshness of the ice cream! The staff is always super friendly and the toppings are free. This is definitely a hidden gem as you have to try it to understand how good it is. 

Let's Date (strawberry and banana) will make you understand the taste of real banana ice cream, not the artificially flavored other stuff.

This is my new favorite place to treat yourself  they have authentic bubble teas that are delicious and a good value for its cost. I've been here three times in the past three weeks since I've discovered it and I'm so sad I didn't find it earlier! I'm moving and am sad I couldn't have enjoyed these longer. The rolled ice cream is also amazing. I like it for the same reasons that I like dip n dots. It's light and fun to eat with all the layers of air and creamy ice cream in each bite. I had the cookies with vanilla ice cream with pocky and chocolate syrup and it was delicious. I love how they offer unlimited toppings with your rolled ice cream. Also impressed with the skill it takes to make rolled ice cream, it looks exhausting. this place will have you never wanting any other kind of Bubble tea!! This place is a no frills, good quality, small business and I highly recommend trying it: Hope to one day see this grow into something that can be offered in a food truck setting because it's just that good.

The tea may be a bit pricey for the size, but it's delicious and the cups are reusable! The owners and staff are friendly and helpful. The ice cream toppings are unlimited! Unfortunately there are not any dairy-free ice cream options, but there are dairy-free tea options. I hope one day taro tea will be added to the menu!
Wide range of selection, from milk teas to rolled ice cream! I got the thai milk tea with boba! The cups are also so cute!!! If you reuse the cup you get 5% off. They also have stamp cards :)

I've lived in shanghai, LA and cinci, had bubble tea for 10+ years and this is my all time favorite bubble tea place. The owners jimmy and kevin are always nice and the drinks are just so consistent and always delicious. Can't recommend this place enough

This place is Soooooooo amazing OMG! From the friendly staff to the cute decor. I'm from New York visiting Cincinnati and wish we had this so bad! This was the best bubble tea I have ever tasted. I ordered the Thai iced tea with boba, it was perfect not too sweet at all and they give it to you in a reusable cup, so you can always bring it back and get 5% off the next time you go in. Too bad I'm not from here because I feel like I'll be there everyday. They also have other stuff on their menu different types of ice cream and cereal fixtures and of course different flavors of TEAS!!!
Absolutely love the variety. Satisfies all of your sweet cravings and has a large selection of Boba. A Boba Tea lovers dream!!

We walked up to Milk Jar Cafe on a Friday night. The rolled ice cream was delicious and the portion size was very large! I wasn't able to eat it all. It was great that you could order online. The. they bring out your order and set it on the table, so no contact! We felt very safe and will definitely go back!

Ummm, how did I not know about this place?  As a self-described ice cream fanatic, I was in the mood for a treat when I stumbled upon this place in Hyde Park Plaza tonight.  I got the Mint Oreo rolled ice cream and man was it yummy.  You can add additional toppings if you want at no charge, but I didn't want to complicate something already so perfect :).  I'll definitely be back soon.

Ordered 3 large bobas matcha & jasmine for a $20+ bill pretty expensive (the cups were skinny It didn't feel like a large cup). The bobas were very small in portion a teaspoon size maybe. I had milk cap on mine, very thin I could barely taste it plus the jasmine tea was overpowering and really fragrant. Will I be back? Not sure.. I will continue my quest for bubble teas.. ChaTime in Clifton is my preference and Kung Fu Tea.

Seriously a dream come true for an awesome bubble tea place to come to the Hyde Park/Oakley area. This place is legit! I've tried both the rolled ice cream (campfire dream, with chocolate, marshmallow, and graham crackers blended in- SO good) and several varieties of the bubble tea. I loooove the milk cap bubble tea here. It's basically a bonus layer of creamy goodness at the top of your tea. Slightly salty, slightly sweet, so delicious. The tea always tastes very fresh. The staff is very willing to help walk you through menu options (as there are several) if it's your first time in. It's a little pricey (regular size milk cap tea with boba runs you around $6) but I am sure that this is due to the high-quality ingredients. They have a rewards program so make sure to get a card if you go in. If you're a returning customer, take your reusable cup back for an eco friendly option.
Great bubble tea and rolled ice cream and always good times. Gotta get that unicorn poop!

Super friendly and fast. Very tasty rolled ice cream. My wife got the Monkey Business with Nutella and Banana and added caramel and graham cracker crumbs and I got the Unicorn poop that had fruity pebbles and caramel in vanilla rolled ice cream. Both were very good!

Have been here twice, and both times left extremely impressed.

Being from California, my wife and I are suckers for good boba. The first time we came here, that's what drew up in. However, this was the first time I've experienced a milk cap! I can't remember seeing it on previous menus, or maybe I just didn't know what it was to order.

I tried their strawberry/green tea combo with the milk cap....WOW! This thing is half tea/half dessert as the milk cap has a dense, rich cheesecake flavor. Blown away.

While we were waiting for our tea, I saw them rolling out the ice cream for someone else's order. It literally starts as a liquid and then freezes as they prepare it. The 2nd time we came, I knew I had to get this, so I went for the "Smores" (ice cream, with graham cracker, marshmallow, and chocolate syrup). Being a fatty, I of course added Cinnamon Toast Crunch, extra marshmallow, and M&Ms as toppers (unlimited toppings free with any ice cream). Not to sound redundant but....WOW! The ice cream was super creamy and flavorful, and the toppings gave just enough textural variety to keep it interesting from the first scoop until the last.

The only downside to this place is the price. No matter what you get, you're going to walk out for ~$8/pp. Pretty pricey for ice cream or boba, however you can see and taste the premium ingredients and process, so I am ok paying a premium price for the high quality product.

So happy that Milk Bar Cafe opened up, and I look forward to giving this place more than their fair share of my disposable income in the future!

Get to try this new bubble tea place today. The place is called Milk Bar. It serves rolled ice cream, cereal bow with 40+ unlimited toppings and esp bubble tea. The only place in Cincy you can find bubble tea with milk cap (foam made from cream cheese and added pink salt on top) I got their #1 selling items which are the uji strawberry matcha latte made with real strawberry and oolong milk tea with milk cap. They both were amazing. I have found my new/fave bubble tea spot and I will def come back. Come and check out this place

Best thing can possibly be open in Hyde park since smoothie king closed. It's great and fresh. 
I love watching them making ice cream. I found it entertaining watching them smash the fresh fruit into the ice cream and roll it up into the cup. With all -ALL the topping I want. 
I would come get some everyday if I could

I absolutely love milk tea. I've had it in Cincinnati to San Fran to London and etc. This is one of my favorite milk teas I've ever had. I tried the thai and also the mango matcha. Both were excellent, but I prefer the thai between the two. Definitely I must try if in the area.

This is my favorite boba shop hands down!! Awesome drinks, freshly brewed teas and they have ton of options for toppings!! Friendly staffs who will always remember your name and greet you with a smile! I drive 30-40 minutes each way to come here for their boba teas. If you're looking for the best boba tea in Cincinnati, this is your spot!! :)

FINALLY. Somewhere close to me with legit boba in Cincy! They make their teas using actual tea - not powder or syrup like other places. I love that you can adjust the sweetness level.

They also have milk caps/cheese tea. It's a thicker, whipped topping that's reminiscent of cheesecake. A bit salty in the same way cheesecake is. I'm never turning back - it's so flipping good.

I'll have to come back for their rolled ice cream and cereal bowls. Both come with unlimited toppings!

It's insanely good. I'm already planning my next visit back!
Really good milk teas. They have lots of flavors to try and it's definitely one of the best milk tea shops I've tried yet.

Great tea (and a bit too addictive) and very friendly staff. The ice cream is killer too! The only downside would be the price... but the flavor is worth it. Though their menu is designed for warmer days, it's pushing through winter like a charm. Big shout out to the owners! Edit: I'll give it 5 stars now since owners make sure they get quality products.

The best of the best!!! I think it's safe to say that I'm addicted to milk Jar. This place is literally my second home now, I can't go on a week without visiting Milk Jar at least once!! I felt in love with their milk teas since the first day. From the first sip you can tell that all ingredients are freshly brewed and made for each day. Everything is all natural. The menu is right on the best with many signature drinks that are very unique to their brand (definitely order their matcha drinks because those are top knots). The staff are very friendly and make me feel so welcomed every time I come. And the owner, oh gosh the customer services and the care he put in his shop is no doubt the reason why making Milk Jar one of the most well-known boba shop in the city even though they are only here for half a year. I have seen people driving all the way from Dayton just to try their tea.

This is a newer place that has amazing bubble tea. They also give you cups that are reusable for a fee different times. 
They also serve rolled ice cream, which I have yet to try, but it is so fun to watch them make.

i've heard that there are very few milk tea places and this cafe was recommended by my friends. 
the jasmine milk tea was solid. prices are a little high but they definitely can justify doing so. 
shop smelled like a big wall of dried squid/fish though; didn't really detract from the experience but i couldn't not say anything about it :)

Milk bar has an amazing options of drinks and roll ice cream! Their flavor options are innovative and their milk cap which is cream cheese on top of the bubble tea is something you should definitely try.

First time visit today - will not be my last. I had a strawberry 'milkie' which was very good. Freshly prepared and totally yummy. I'm looking forward to going back for the rolled ice cream. The place is a bit pricey though - $5 for a strawberry milkie. I don't see this as a regular stop but still recommend trying them out.
First time here. Menu was confusing but the staff were very helpful. Love the coffee base option. Cookie monster and camp fire were delicious. I love the rice crispy topping. Can't wait to come back

Let me start by saying that this place was so good that I had to buy two milk teas at the same time - both for myself. They have so many new flavors and variety on their menu that I will have to go back for at least two more. I usually get taro bubble tea and I was a little disappointed that they didn't have that. But it was for the best because that gave me a chance to try their delicious mango milkies and mango matcha with milk cap. Their staff was super nice, too and worked with me patiently while I took my sweet time to order. Definitely recommend this place!!!
Even my friend who has milk allergies could get the almond milk and enjoy !! LOVE THIS PLACE

This place is Aw e s o m e ! I can only talk about the drinks as I have yet to try the rolled ice cream... (I'm never in the mood for ice cream, I know..I'm a monster.) the milk cap drinks here are legit! My favorites are the Oolong milk cap , jasmine milk cap and Thai tea milk cap, honestly everything I've tried here was pretty good. (You can adjust sweetness as well! Bonus!) 

The service here is great, the guys are always so nice and helpful!!

Stopped by while in the area today to satisfy a boba craving and was pleasantly surprised. Moving to Cincinnati from Houston, TX I've developed lower expectations for food/drink in this city, but this place highly exceeded my expectations! I ordered a black ceylon milk tea and my roommate got the jasmine green milk tea. You could really taste how fresh the tea was in both drinks and they weren't too sweet at all. The boba was also soft and bouncy, and the cups are so cute. I'll have to come back to try the milk cap drinks and ice cream!

If you enjoy quality of ice cream with unlimited toppings meaning unlimited possibility off combination of flavors. This is the place for you.  New kids on the block.  Although, the two partners are only 5 days into their business, their attention to details already shows through the quality of their ice cream.  Only use fresh fruits.  They also carry variety of teas.  I didn't try them but they told me that they made them fresh daily.

Jimmy recommended (and made) the jasmine milk tea with milk cap for me.  Described as a cheesecake flavored bubble tea the recommendation did not disappoint -- tea with a creamy treat on top.  (I'll be back for cereal next time!).

Tried this place for the 1st time today and WOW, I was amazed! Great friendly staff and the strawberry Matcha tea I purchased tasted better than any I have ever had before. Will be coming back again soon!

Absolutely the best customer service! They are true artists.  We went tonight and had delicious rolled ice cream.  Large portions,  fun choices.  I absolutely love that they actually toast a full size marshmallow like campfire s'mores.  It was delicious on top of my coffee base cookie monster.  I would post a pic but I had to eat it immediately.

My tea was aesthetically pleasing obviously.... look at the picture! I dig the whole vibe of the place but more importantly the tea was tasty! I really liked the strawberry and mango boba balls i had in mine!

Milk Bar is AMAZING. I went almost everyday for like two weeks straight. I can't stop! Lol. The prices are a little high, but you get what you pay for and it's always great. I usually get the strawberry/mango matcha latte, which is great if you are new and don't know what to try! Their milk caps are so good, and you won't go wrong with anything you order! Give it a go!!
Also.. the employees are so kind and helpful.
A semi-hidden gem. They have something for everyone! I always want to try something different but I can't ever say no to the Thai iced tea milk cap. It's everything my life was missing!

Wow!!!! This place is awesome! I have had bubble/milk teas from all over the country (Boston, Houston, Seattle etc) and I have to say this place cranks out the BEST milk tea! They don't use powder and all the tea are brewed fresh everyday. 

I got the Jasmine milk cap and the fruit matcha latte milk cap and both were AMAZING! My husband loved them so much he took the cup apart after he finished and tried licking the remaining froth from the side of the cup lol...I will have to go back to get more. Check this place out folks, you won't be disappointed.

Absolutely the freshest boba milk tea place in Cincy. I've had many milk tea around the country. Milk Jar Cafe is using the real milk in the milktea versus powderpuff which makes a difference. Quality is the key

This place is exceptional!! Naturally brewed tea! The menu have a wide selection!!'The owner Jimmy is super helpful and nice!!!i told him I had passion fruit tea in another location and he said he makes that for him self and it's infused with jasmine tea! Omg! So refreshing and delightful! Hits the spot!! Love love this place!! Great interesting decor! A must for everyone to visit!!Big big plus for the friendly staff aka Kevin!!! Very helpful!!  They even have my favorite rolled ice cream!!!

If you're looking for quality rolled ice cream or bubble tea without the hustle and bustle, Milk Jar Cafe has your name on it. Located in a very convenient plaza with other food options and grocers, Milk Jar Cafe is the perfect spot for those with a rolled ice cream/bubble tea craving or want to try something different than traditional dessert options. There's a couple of tables and a few chairs outside for hot, summer day seating, and a pleasant  and adequately spacious interior that will suffice medium sized crowds. The one worker there was very polite and diligent in making sure I got what I wanted on my ice cream and was quick to prepare my girlfriend's bubble tea without error. Milk Jar Cafe was a very chill place to just take a breather in the middle of a busy day and took a big chunk of stress off my mind. If you like ice cream or bubble tea, enjoy seeing it made, or just have a sweet tooth, Milk Jar Cafe can definitely cater for you so give it a try (or multiple as they offer loyalty visit rewards as you order!)

This is my favorite bubble tea shop in Cincy! I crave their drinks all the time (like right now). It has a really cute atmosphere, rolled ice cream (with unlimited + really good toppings like marshmallows that they roast right in front of you), and bubble tea of course! My favorite rolled ice cream is the unicorn poop and my favorite drink is caramel taro with tapioca boba. So good. The only thing that I dislike about the place is the smell when you walk in...it might be from the chalk since there is are large boards on the wall full of chalk writing/drawing...but you get used to it and that won't stop me from coming back.
