Awesome ice cream and great atmosphere!! They gave me a card for a free item after I get 10 items, so I will definitely be back!! My mom and I got the Cookie Monster and the mint to be, both were fantastic and it was very fun to watch them be made!!

Excellent bubble tea. It was fun watching them make our rolled ice cream, but it was very difficult to eat and not very creamy. Get ice cream elsewhere -- get the ice instead!

Also, really disappointed by the lack of a child changing table on the restroom. At least the bathroom floor was clean :/
Great place. Huge menu, delicious ice cream and friendly customer service! Will definitely be back!
Mango Matcha milk tea with tapioca boba SO delicious and fresh. Definitely will be back!!! The people are so so nice and helped me pick out what to get!

Our first time here. Family is visiting in town and craving for bubble teas. They searched online and found this place. Glad they found it because I will be coming back here for their milk teas and rolled ice cream.  My kids loved it. Their cups are fancy since they actually print out the names of the order and put the labels on the cups.  What is more special is the drink itself. Very flavorful and you can actually see layers of the ingredients that they put in there.  I highly recommend this place if you like boba teas.

This has been my fourth time coming here, and I gotta say that this is the best bubble tea place I've been to. All of their milk tea options are fantastic, and next time I'm looking forward to trying out their fruit teas. I used to shy away from rolled ice cream because of a stomach ache I got eating rolled ice cream earlier, but the rolled ice cream here was amazing and had great presentation. Overall I would for sure recommend this place for everyone!
OMG, the best drinks EVER! We had Dirty Milk with Boba & Very Mango, the flavor is out of this world.  It is better than any thing I had in California!

Not to be dramatic but this is my favorite boba ever. So good I felt compelled to write a yelp review. I got black Ceylon tea with classic tapioca boba and its so so good. My sister got mango fruit with mango boba. I tried hers and it was just as good as mine. The employees were super friendly and helpful!

Best milk tea cafe I have ever had in states. They have the most in trend milk cap, which is so popular in China in recent years. I actually liked this cafe even better than some of the original ones in China. The ingredients are so fresh! I ordered the strawberry milk cap tea, they have real strawberry inside. The tea is not too sweet and I'm trying to cut down sugar in my diet, so it is perfect! Love it and will definitely be back again.

This place is one of my favorite milk tea stores and I go probably 2-3 times a week on average. Their quality is always very high in comparison to a lot of other milk tea places and their actual product is always super tasty! The owners are always really nice and I always see them take time to help customers who haven't been there before make sure they order something awesome! These guys have a great business and I recommend everyone go try them out!
Milk Cap Mango Matcha Latte with Boba was fantastic.  All natural ingredients, lovely aesthetics, and fun to-go mugs.  Staff were friendly and passionate.  Can't wait to go back!
Ordered a large Thai tea with boba, and was not disappointed at all! Loved the taste def want more

I love this place!!! Everything is made fresh and all natural. No powdered drinks. Their boba is amazing. They cook it just right where it's chewy, not too hard or soft.  The people that work there are super personable, funny, and friendly.  I love it here!! So happy I finally found a solid boba place in cincy.

Has a lot of options from a cereal bar, rolled ice cream, and bubble tea. Went for the bubble tea and it was pretty good. Customer service is what really pulled me in. I tend to wonder if they recycle since the cups they offer are practically reusable in quality. So nonetheless it's nice.

I had the money business and my wife had mango madness.  Both were absolutely delicious.  Guys working when we came in (I think one was owner) were super upbeat and happily explained everything.  Will definitely be coming back for more rolled ice cream!!!

The best bubble tea spot in Cincinnati! We ordered the matcha milk tea with grass jelly, and strawberry jasmine bubble! The "Let's Date" rolled ice cream is made with fresh strawberries and banana mix. I'm happy we finally have a cafe that uses all real fruits instead of powder!
Thai boba is rapidly becoming a favorite treat of mine. Why do boba taste like gummy bears? OMG.

This is where I love to get boba at. I was kinda nervous trying new boba place, but this place has blown my mind. Not only fresh - aka no milk powder - and delicious milk tea, the owner friendliness also makes me feel excited coming to this place. He knows me by name and we always have great conversations when I'm in the store. There is no doubt about the tea's quality. They are freshly brewed everyday. Their boba is handmade, fresh, chewy. They have the great amount of options and always come up with tasty new recipes. I highly recommended to try this place. It'll worth every single penny

I heard this place is great but I've yet to try it because we went in, looked at the menu and waited for at least 5 minutes to be helped (it was busy with only two employees so I understood).  However a family of 6 then came in and the employees immediately offered to take their order at the register which is when we realized we weren't in line (since neither of the employees who had seen us waiting even addressed us or told us that we weren't in line).  Thoroughly disappointing.  I'm sure I'll give it another try but I wasn't willing to be 7th in line since I had already been waiting a while.
Great quality drinks and ice cream, they know they're ingredients and menu very well. Best Thai tea and ice cream I've had in Cincinnati!

Super high quality tea!! I love the jasmine/green milk tea with boba and almond milk. I've tried the tai tea as well and it's so good! I could come here every day. The owner is so nice! I need to try their rolled ice cream soon.
I had the Monkey Business with banana, whipped cream, and coconut toppings. It was amazing! The only thing better was the customer service. Extremely friendly staff! I will definitely be back.

I am in love with this place! First time trying milk tea and first time trying rolled ice cream - it was amazing!! I am not a vanilla person so I was nervous about the vanilla base, but it far exceeded my expectations. I would legitimately go back today again and I'd be pretty pumped about it. 

This is the first yelp review I've ever done but this place deserves the love! It's somewhat hard to spot in Hyde park plaza...go find it!

This place does rolled ice cream better than anyone! Not to mention, the toppings and choices are all delicious. I got a Strawberry Milkie, which is essentially a strawberry milkshake, and that was delicious also. The folks who work here are so friendly and helpful, and the prices are very reasonable. Stop in and try a sweet treat for yourself!

I am 20 minutes away and will drive here about once a week because their ice cream and tea is so good! The staff is incredibly kind and personable. They recognized me after the first time I came and now know me by name! They really care and this is probably my favorite buisness in town. Ingredients are super fresh and everything is incredibly delicious! I reccomend it to everyone I meet who likes boba and take them there.
Hands down THE best boba tea I've ever had! I got the Ceylon Black Milk Tea Boba. The staff were super friendly and knowledgeable about the drinks! Will definitely be stopping in again!

Been here three times and each time, were fantastic! Love their milk tea cap and milkies! Their fruits are fresh and you can taste it in your drink! Can't wait to go back to try more items in their menu! I just read one of the reviews about their reusable cup! I'll definitely save mine next time I visit!
It's absolutely amazing!! The manager was so helpful and nice and the milk cap tea was soooo good!! Would 100% recommend!
Everything I've tried here is fantastic, great place for desert or any alternative to a Starbucks trip.

Lots of options to choose from, I don't think you can go wrong with any of them. So far I've gotten the Campfire Delight and the Mango Fruit Tea. The campfire was delicious and mango tea was very refreshing! One of the best boba places in Cincinnati!

This place is awesome, I got the Ceylon Black Milk Tea with boba and the Monkey Business rolled ice cream (banana + nutella). The boba is sweetened with honey and it's the softest boba I've ever had. Amazingz.

Best milk tea place in Cincy! We ordered oolong milk tea with popping boba, mocha ice cream, and hot mango uji mocha milk tea! All turned out great!  Very friendly staff members! Just ask them if you are #overwhelmed# by those too many delicious choices! Just hope they will come to the north side too!

The guys at milk bar are very cool. They made their own place and are looking for ways to improve it. They ask you to tell them what you think in a genuine way. They truly want the best product, and they want your help. I will keep visiting the milk bar. I hope they can become super successful because they are awesome guys. I'd recommend this place to anyone who love ice cream or cereal
This place is awesome!  So thankful for more interesting small businesses moving into the neighborhood. The staff are so kind and the milk tea is wonderful. Can't wait to try the ice cream!

I have tried many boba tea places in Cincinnati, and this is by far the most authentic and delicious we have!  The original boba recipe, Ceylon tea with tapioca pearls and dairy, is absolute perfection.  The tea flavor is dark and smoky as it would be served in the finest tea rooms around the world. The tapioca pearl texture was just as firm and chewy as it should be. As well as the classics, they have all the different combinations of flavors and textures that have developed from the original, so you can mix and match to your heart's content. My friend had the matcha boba tea and said it was perfect matcha; he also had the rolled ice cream, which is a work of art and the most fresh ice cream you could have with no additives, frozen and mixed from liquid right in front of you. Fascinating. It's sparkling clean and has wonderful, cheerful, patient service. They'll teach you about boba tea if this is new to you. Oh, and it's truly wonderful that you get a 5% discount for bringing your cleaned container back to be reused!! I was feeling so guilty about how much plastic you use in one serving of restaurant boba tea that I started making my own boba tea at home. It's pretty good, and way cheaper, but Milk Jar's is so much better and worth every penny.  It's the only place I'll go to from now on in Cincinnati, and I'll start doing my other shopping in that center just as an excuse to visit Milk Jar!
absolutely loved this place. employees were very helpful in describing everything and gave me a great suggestion. so many options too! would definitely recommend

I just love a dairy bar. My goal is to hit all of them in the area. I'm close. I got my ol standard, a chocolate dipped cone. I got the kiddie size. It was perfect. A cool addition to this place is edible cookie dough. Both the birthday cake and chocolate chip are delicious! It's nice to get that Kings Island blue ice cream fix there. I even had a sip of my husband's malt. I mean this place has been around forever; it's awesome. Get anything. You can't go wrong.

Love this place and the variety and quality. They have distancing and signs for masks, but several people were not wearing them and no one said anything which was disappointing. We chose the drive through for that reason. 

I just wish they would hire more people! The line is always so long and it takes forever to get through.

Good ice cream.  Pineapple and kings island blue soft serve.  Fast friendly service at walk up or drive through.   Was a great evening so we chose drive through and they took our order "chic-fil-a" style ahead of the window.  Great logistics and even better creamy whip libations.  A staple in the Colerain-White Oak-Monfort Heights community!!

Gold Top is another good dairy bar. It has similar offerings to the others. This one gets higher marks for things like good seating. It has a menu of cold favorites. They serve lots of hot food too. 

I had a cherry slushie. It's about $2 for a medium. This is much better than many other slushies. It's melty enough that it doesn't turn to ice right away. This is also refreshingly cold. My head hurt really bad. They have other popular items like their own version of the blizzard, as well as hot food like burgers and fries. 

I think it's one of the better dairy bars. It has a drive thru. This helps keep the lines better at the window.

A visit this past week taught me I need to splurge more often. This place has been around since I was a kid, yet I haven't visited here since then.
You'll not find a friendlier, happier crowd of people than those waiting in line at the creamy whip. I arrived close to closing time but since I was alone, several families/larger groups ahead of me allowed me to go ahead of them. 
I indulged on a chocolate/vanilla swirl waffle cone w/ rainbow sprinkles. The quality of ice cream is superb, portion sizes generous and service very friendly. I loved the soft serve texture of the ice cream. YUM!!!!!
I highly recommend visiting here when in the area this summer.

We found this treat last month.

It's a nice local soft serve ice cream shop.

They have the traditional soft serve, as well as flurries and sundae's in cups!

I tried the blue raspberry, it didn't have enough flavor so I stick with the swirl or sundae's.

What you'd expect from a local ice cream shop, nothing too fancy, but I hits the spot!
Fun little stop after a game for ice cream with the kids.  There is a drive through available and a few sandwich options.  Don't know much about those, the creamy whip is why we come!

Fast, friendly service. It's soft serve so you know what you're getting. My son and wife and her whole family love this place as if it's better than any other place that can pour things into a soft serve machine but I prefer graeters so what do I know.

4 stars for service and proximity to our residence
Soft serve ice cream sundaes, frozen lattes, cones, flurries, all sorts of delicious treats. They have a walk-up counter and a drive thru. Big yellow a-frame hidden on the west side.

Gold Top is definitely good.  It is precisely what you would like from a creamy whip:

- Ample seating
- Reasonable prices
- Good ice cream

Gold Top Dairy Bar is perfectly located between where I played softball and where I live, so I often came here after games to enjoy a treat.

We love GTDB! They have a great menu of ice cream items, and the prices are reasonable.  My favorite is the chipwich. Mmmmmmmmm. There is sometimes a wait because of its popularity, but the workers are friendly and efficient.

This is truly the evolution of ice cream. Their unique, housemade flavors still have that sense of classic ice cream shop nostalgia. You don't have to be the biggest ice cream fan in the world to stop by, but this spot is definitely fun for the adventurous. The unique menu is very fun: I had the banana honeycomb (and I should have gotten two scoops).

Anyway, I highly recommend making the effort to find this spot downtown and get a few scoops or a bakery item. Everything is uniquely handmade - and you can taste it!

Disclaimer - I am not a huge ice cream fan. 

Why? Oh fine, I'll tell ya - it's really cold sugar dairy with minimal fillings to make it interesting. 

But, I love Hello Honey. It stays less frozen and hard than most others. It's not soft serve but it isn't the frozen brick of things you get from the store or so thick that you feel terrible afterwards (looking at you Graeters). 

The brownies and cream have massive, large, brownie chunks that make Hello Honey the perfect dessert.

OMGoodness! How have missed reviewing my absolute favorite ice cream shop in the city! ? More than locally, this is my favorite ice cream shop PERIOD. 

At Hello Honey, everything is handmade, with love and you can taste it. 

My absolute fav flavors are banana, lavender, coconut and espresso. 

I will post pics the next time I am there, if I can remember before I devour my two scoops. Lol. 

Cheers!
Ice cream so good we walked 2 miles in 90 degrees of humid heat! Great quality and range of creative flavor combinations!
OMG this is my new find in cinci!! I had the banana honey milkshake and it was out of this world so good

The freshest all natural ice cream and desserts run by a husband and wife team! Desserts are classic American staples, like waffle cones and banana splits. They also have a few Thai-Asian flavors that are inspired by one of the owners who is from Thailand (Pandan, taro, matcha, and black sesame!) They also have ~4 vegan flavors!

The best dessert place I have been to in Cincinnati. It doesn't look like much from the outside, we weren't sure if they were open, but decided to park and walk over to see. The interior could be more inviting, maybe replace the metal chairs and add some plants or pillows but I liked the playful yellow décor and wall graphics. 

There are so many options to choose from, made-to-order waffle cones, small batch ice cream, cakes, cheesecake, their famous torched marshmallows, and sundaes (including one with a croissant bread budding). We got the cheesecake and two scoops of ice cream. The peanut butter midnight snack was memorable with a rich pb flavor and huge chunks of chocolate cookie bits. Everything was so fresh and flavorful. Highly recommend trying a few things. Will definitely come back to get a sundae!

I'm so glad I chose to go here for dessert! I was with my boyfriend visiting Cincinnati and we were trying to find a good icecream place despite the 30 degree weather. Anything to satisfy that sweet tooth am I right? Anyways, we both shared a 2 scoop cup with honey lavendar and blueberry cheesecake. Both very yummy flavors but I preferred the honey lavendar more. I also ordered a toasted marshmallow on top which was toasted despite the flame gun running out of power.

The place inside was cute with lights and plants giving a lively ambiance. Highly recommend this dessert place!

Hello Honey has the absolute best ice cream in Cincinnati (no debate in my eyes!) They have homemade, small batch ice cream that is just so creamy and delicious. The amount of flavors to choose from might make your head spin, but that's a good problem to me. I love going in and trying completely different things and mixing random flavors. Some of my favorites are what's pictured here- the Blueberry cheesecake and Brown Butter Caramel. They are both incredible! You can also try different samples if you can't decide on what to get at first.

My absolute favorite part about this place is the homemade waffle cone. They're made fresh to order so it's slightly warm when you get it. I've never had a better cone! I consider them to be a hidden gem because they're on the part of Vine Street that has been around for a long time so definitely go out and support them. You won't regret it!

I tried hello honey based on a TikTok video I saw.  I noticed that they had deliciously titled ice cream flavors and was excited to try them.  My nephew had the vegan cookies and cream, which was amazing and I had the Thai coconut, which was also amazing!  I can't wait to go again and try new flavors.  5stars

Hello Honey is a MUST GO TO in Cinci! They have fantastic homemade ice cream, great service, cute ice cream parlor and fresh waffle cones made to order. My boyfriend and I came here after work on Friday afternoon. 

My boyfriend ordered the chocolate chip mint ice cream which he thoroughly enjoyed! I ordered the he brownie and cream ice cream with a waffle cone and a toasted marshmallow on top. It was melt in our mouth delicious. The toasted marshmallow was an excellent touch and looked awesome! The waffle cone was warm when it was served and had melted chocolate chips in the bottom of the cone which was my favorite part. 

I highly recommend Hello Honey especially if you are an ice cream / waffle cone fanatic! You certainly will not be disappointed!

My nephews and I were looking for a good dessert shop to finish out the night.  We decided to give Hello Honey a try...and it was absolutely AMAZING, to say the least.

First thing we noticed about Hello Honey was how clean it was, from the doors to the sitting area.  The wonderful smells and warmth of the interior made us feel comfortable.  We were greeted by the friendly owners who answered our questions and made suggestions, because we were overwhelmed.
There were so many choices of ice cream, toppings and cakes...all made from SCRATCH! 

My older nephew ordered the Peanut Butter Sunday with peanut butter ice cream and freshly toasted marshmallow.  My younger nephew ordered the Brownie Time Sundae, with a piping hot brownie, Honey Vanilla ice cream, chocolate and caramel syrup.  I ordered what the owners suggested:  The Crispy Bread Pudding Sundae.  My sundae had a buttery toasted croissant made into a crispy pudding, topped with a scoop of Honey Vanilla Ice Cream.  We didn't just enjoy our dessert.
Our desserts took us to a blissful place of pure happiness. 
My nephews and I have chosen to make this our official "Dessert Place" when we visit Downtown again.

I can truly recommend this place as a "Must Visit" for anyone living in or visiting Cincinnati.  Hello Honey is well worth the trip and money.

Wow. This place was awesome. You could smell the homemade waffle cones right when you walk it. Lots of fun flavors to choose from (Banana Honey Comb, PB Midnight Snack, Blueberry cheesecake, Pistachio, Thai Iced Tea etc). Take some time to look at them all. Definitely get a toasted marshmallow on top if you can! Highly recommended giving this homemade ice cream shop a try!

Being overshadowed by Graeter's, and all the creamy whip places of Cincinnati, Hello Honey is the most low key and underrated place to get dessert in Cincinnati. They also to happen to make the best ice cream in Cincinnati.  

Hello Honey is hidden downtown where no one would ever look for such a gem. In the outskirts of the central business district. 

They make their own fresh ice cream and everything else they make that goes with the ice cream to compliment it, they make to order. 

I'm talking about fresh made waffle cones. A giant brownie that you have to wait 30ish minutes for that they bring straight out to you in the skillet it was cooked in. Mouth watering, melt in your mouth unreal goodness. 

Everything here is amazing and you literally couldn't go wrong if you tried. If you're going to stick with only ice cream, my favorites are "Brownie & Cream" and "Cookies & Pie". 

If you get the brownie make sure you get a scoop of ice cream to go on top of it. If you get a root beer float here, it is the most boujee but most amazing float you will ever have. Every piece of Cheesecake I've had here has been amazing. Also, If they have it when you're there, the Banana Fosters Is out of this world.

Lastly as far as things go food wise here, if anything is on the menu with a toasted marshmallow, Just do it. Don't question it. 

Hello Honey also usually has at least two vegan options of ice cream/sorbet and they are actually super yummy. 

Outside of all the amazing ice cream and baked goods at Hello Honey and the cute branding from the sketches on the menu board or the polka dot bowls for your ice cream, the woman and guy who run the place are always the nicest people on the planet and you can really tell they enjoy what they are doing and that they are passionate about it.

These are the reasons why every time my parents come down from Dayton they make us go here, and why it's also a rainy day hide away for me. 

If you've been living in Cincy and haven't gone here yet, you best prioritize it because you're going to be salty you've been missing out for so long.

I have only have only gotten To-go from here (Covid) but I don't know why I haven't been going here for years.   Actually I do: it always looks closed.  However, most the time it looks closed it isn't and it is definitely worth making sure because the icecream/desserts are delicious! I am so jealous of all the desert that they serve in store that I have seen pictures of. I mean what's a more fun treat than a dessert work of art (that actually tastes good). I feel like this may be my new go to special occasion place!

I was so exited to try this place. So many variety's of ice cream.  But guess what?  You can't sample any. 

How do you sell unique ice cream and not offer samples?  
Every other ice cream store offers samples. 

Don't waste your time!  Very disappointed and left!

I have been to this place twice and loved my experience both times. The place is nice and cozy albiet cold but what do you expect from a place that serves ice cream. I only come here for one thing and that is the S'mores Sundae as the s'mores is my truth no-boost top tier dessert and it's yummy every time. 

I didn't catch the owner's name. I think it's a husband and wife team that run it, but they are both very nice and explain everything on their unique menu. 

I can't wait to go back.

For quite some time I have lusted after the photographs of peoples yummy looking desserts from this location. It always seems they close fairly early in comparison to times i'd be downtown, but on the first night of Blink we came early enough for the parade to stop in. 

The inside of the shop isn't much to look at, its very simple, however the flavors certainly make up for this.  It was very busy and there was only one gentleman working, and boy was he working his butt off! I have never seen such hustle in an employee and the owners should be proud of this. He apologized that he was the only one there but the crowd was luckily being very understanding. 

The ice cream here is small batch and made with all natural ingredients (nothing artificial). The chalk board states the eggs are cage free and the dairy is hormone free! Their flavors rotate and are seasonal. If youd like to plan ahead they keep the current flavor list on their website. They are happy to provide you with samplings of the ice cream flavors before making your final decision. Their desserts beyond ice cream are all made on site. The store itself is filled with the aroma of freshly made waffle cones!

I sampled the honey lavender and the banana honeycomb. Both were fabulous so I opted for a scoop of each, with a waffle cone, and homemade marshmallow toasted atop. The second scoop didnt quite fit so it made its way into a side dish. I think in the future id opt for the waffle bowl instead. The waffle cone was the best ive ever had. Sadly I have to say, while the marshmallow was good, it didnt add to the ice cream what I thought it would, and might skip that in the future.

Let me start by saying 5 stars is not nearly enough for Hello Honey. We stumbled upon this wonderful shop in downtown Cincy and fell in love at first bite. When you walk in the door you immediately get hit by the smell of freshly made waffle cones (YOU MUST GET). We have tried so many of their flavors and you can't go wrong with anything you choose here. The portions are very reasonable for the price and quality of the ice cream you are getting. Unfortunately we don't live in Cincy anymore, but let me tell you we never had nor ever will have better ice cream than this.

RUN DO NOT WALK TO GET THIS AMAZING FROZEN DELICACY!!!!!!!!

Hello, honey indeed 

Absolutely rich desserts. Hello honey offers unique ice cream flavors, cakes, and baked goodies. I shared a honey lavender ice cream with a torched marshmallow and a chocolate pudding cake. They give out very generous scoops! One scoop was enough to share between two people. 

My options were definitely for the sweets lover. They may be too sweet for you if you normally don't indulge in sweets, but I'm sure Hello Honey has a flavor that would suit your tastes as well. 

The marshmallow was a nice touch, adding more gooey sweetness to your ice cream. I thought the pudding cake was going to be soft and lighter, but it was thick! It was delicious. 

Staff is very friendly. Definitely come here if you have a huge sweet tooth.

Love the ice cream. Flavors listed are what one tastes. Not too subtle, but not a punch in the face either. After sampling a couple flavors, I decided on the banana honeycomb and the peanut butter late night snack. Bits of honeycomb candy added a little crunch to the banana honeycomb. The peanut butter late night stnack has pieces of cookies in it. This added another textural component. The taste of the ice cream at self remind me of a peanut butter milkshake. Both were consumed in a made to order waffle cone bowl. Waffle cones and bowls are smaller at Hello Honey than most places. With the richness of the ice cream, the smaller portion is perfect. 

The toasted marshmallow was a let down. While it looked delicious, it was not melted on the inside. Essentially the marshmallow needed to be picked up and eaten as it's own entity. The spoon did not cut through it. 

Ice cream at Hello Honey is made with humanely sourced ingredients. Ingredients are also hormone free, as well as free of artificial dyes and flavors. All flavors are made right here in Cincinnati. In fact, ice creams (and baked goods,) are made right in the shop. Flavors rotate seasonally. Hello Honey will even cater for your next event.

Best Ice cream! I am so glad I live within walking distance of this great ice cream place. I got the banana honeycomb and the honey lavender with a torched marshmallow; both flavors were done well.

Banana honeycomb: the banana flavor is pretty strong and quite natural. The honeycomb was frozen so it added a little crisp to it, almost like sweetened cracker bits. I love the combination and was sad when I finished my scoop.

Honey lavender: both the honey and lavender flavors complement each other quite well. I've had "lavender" ice cream where there is no lavender flavor whatsoever, however hello honey did a great job in incorporating lavender in the ice cream. 

I can't wait to come back and try more flavors!!!
Wow wow yum! Probably the best ice cream we have ever had. You can tell they really use quality natural ingredients. Some unique flavors but also plenty of common favorites.  Highly recommend!!!

Great double chocolate and hazelnut ice creams served in a freshly made waffle cone. A good latte was served in a metal cup that became a bit hot. Each food or drink item was served on a small reusable wooden tray. I liked that the tasting spoons were metal and not single use.

Very small, craft made ice cream in-house, off of Vine near downtown. Small seating inside, free water, no bathrooms.

When you walk in you'll notice the chalkboard with the daily flavors. Since everything is made in-house the flavors change often. One of the things I was disappointed about was they don't offer the other treats anymore (if you look through the pictures on here you'll see what I mean) it's basically just ice cream and sundae type items, cones, etc. 

The ice cream was very good; thick, rich and creamy. The only issue for me is it comes out kind of soft so if you don't eat it fast enough the flavors will melt together. Overall, very delicious ice cream, if that's all you're expecting you'll be pleased.

Best way to describe this place is that it's pretty good! Comfortable bright place to eat desert. I was a little disappointed in my lava cake honesty, but my girlfriend had the brownie and it was fantastic 

Their house-made ice cream is awesome!!

Hello Honey is fun and cute! I had been wanting to try them for some time and finally got her chance. I have been twice now. I love that they offer different desserts with their ice cream but they constantly change. I like being able to experience something new. Their ice cream is pretty tasty! 

The first time I went I had the Cookies & Creme ice cream in a cone with a toasted marshmallow on top. This was a great combination. The ice cream was good. If I remember correctly they even put crushed up graham crackers as well as Oreos. It was a good small twist to the classic cookies and cream ice cream. The cherry on top was the toasted homemade marshmallow. It was so good. Who would have ever thought a marshmallow on top of ice cream would be do delicious? My daughter enjoyed eating the ice cream from the bottom of the cone. She bit the bottom and let the ice cream run down. Shrugs! The things 1 year olds do. Haha! 

The second time we went we got their S'more Ice Cream Dessert. It was the ice cream of your choice with graham crackers stuffed in the side of the cup and topped with chocolate. Of course we added the toasted marshmallow on top. This was very good and different as well. 

Overall, Hello Honey has some good ice cream and fun different desserts.

This is such a great spot!! They had tons of ice cream flavors and even had a few vegan options too. Unlike most vegan ice cream, their options were unique and so creamy!! The menu rotated out pretty frequently so I want to come back and see what other flavors they come up with!!

My friend and I walked past Hello Honey without even realizing it the first couple of times. But after a large lunch, we needed a walk to digest and just happened to find this hidden gem! Boy are we glad we did!

Hello Honey is very unassuming, with simple but cute decor that is picture worthy. They specialize in small batch homemade ice cream. All the flavors are unique and they have seasonal specials as well. 

Your best bet is walking here as there is limited street parking. There are plenty of parking garage if you want to drive and plant your vehicle there. 

The owner and staff are very friendly and will happily let you sample to your heart's content. Flavors very slightly daily and do sell out. I ended up with the lavender honey and espresso brittle and was not disappointed. Their ice cream is creamy and flavorful without being too sweet. I definitely recommend trying Hello Honey!

Really amazing ice cream with fresh ingredients!!! I got the banana honeycomb which is banana ice creams with caramel swirls and I love it. Also get the torched marshmallows, that are so worth it!!! Definitely coming back to try even more flavors

Holy moly is this place yummy. If you e never had a fresher bake waffle cone I suggest you stop whatever you're doing and head here now, it is so much better. I took my daughter and nieces for a birthday celebration and everyone was extremely pleased with the flavor of choice. I cannot wait to go back and try one of the other desserts they offer, especially with the house-made toasted marshmallow, talk about yum. 
The only negative is that it does take some time for the orders to come out, but seeing as it's all made fresh, it's understandable, and worth the wait. 
Side note, if you like chocolate the   Dark chocolate brow one ice cream is to die for.

I let out a fangirl shutter as the marshmallow that was destined to be placed upon my ice cream was torched right in front of my eyes. It's as though the man behind the counter knew the way to my heart as he asked "Would you also like a torched marshmallow on top?"

"You already know the answer to that question," I thought, but tried to play it cool. "Yeah, I guess soo..." I said as I stared off at the ice cream list (Hazelnut, Bourbon Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip, Blackberry Earl Grey, Salted Caramel, Charcoal Black Sesame, Brown Butter Caramel, Banana Honeycomb, Cookies & Pie, Honey Lavender, Dutch Chocolate, Honey Vanilla, Espresso Chocolate Chip, Brownie & Cream​, Mixed Berry Sorbet (Vegan), Thai Coconut Milk (Vegan)). The taste of the ice cream is delicious and the vibes inside Hello Honey are charming and inviting.

Some of the ice cream sundaes take longer to make than others, but be patient, I've never left disappointed (except maybe with my own restraint). I can't wait for more warm weather opportunities to enjoy some cold treats from Hello Honey.

Yummmm! Always get the toasted marshmallow!! I got lemon meringue ice cream so yes naturally the home made toasted marshmallow . My friend who was a manager at Jeni's approves. We are both ice cream snobs. Too bad no mint chocolate chip right now. They change flavors often!
My son, husband and I had dinner downtown then walked around and found this place. Really good ice cream and very nice place to sit and have your ice cream inside! Staff was great customer service!

Really delicious, fantastic flavors and toppings. I loved the vegan coconut and my daughters got cookie pie and brownie bites. Homemade waffle cones and marshmallows. The best ice cream place in Cincinnati!

If people claim graeters or UDF has the best ice cream in Cincinnati, it's just because they haven't been to Hello Honey yet. The flavors they come up with are seriously out of this world delicious, the marshmallows are a MUST, and the cakes and pies they offer are so creative and so delectable. There isn't a bad option on the menu. Do yourself a favor and stop in.

With all apologies to the 3-way, I would argue that ice cream is Cincinnati's TRUE culinary masterpiece.  Greater's, Aglamesis, Pendleton, Madisano's...even the local gas station (UDF) has ice cream that would rule in almost any other city.  And then there is Hello Honey.  Oh. My. God. The cream itself is amazing; smooth, sweet, perfect.  The flavors are creative, fun and mouth watering.  But that's also true of the other Cincinnati ice cream greats. What sets little ol' Hello Honey apart, what gives it a real case for best in town is the fresh made, warm cone.  It's worth waiting for, my friends. They make the cone fresh, it's still warm when they drop in a big old scoop of cold, creamy goodness...and magic is made.  It gets a little melty and that's how it should be.  You must get a scoop here!
I love this place! Great variety of flavors and the owners are so sweet!! I go during my work day, but can't wait to bring my kids for a special treat!

Any sweet tooths in the area better hustle and come here because Hello Honey's food is packed with flavor and goodness. The ambiance is super charming with the cafe-style aesthetic with charming illustrations on the walls and pleasant jazz music, which made it even cozier. The man behind the cash register was helpful, welcoming and kind.
My friend wanted to have ice cream, I wanted something warm, and this place had both. Even though I'm not a "ice cream in winter" person, I sampled the honey lavender and instantly changed my mind. We also ordered the bread pudding with banana honey comb and we're going to have dreams about it forever. The bread pudding was served hot on the skillet and it was moist in the inside, flaky and a bit salty on the top, which complimented awesomely with the sweet ice cream. There's caramel sauce on the bottom and every bite is bursting; we thought we weren't going to finish it and we ended up finishing the entire thing and wanting more.
If you had a bad day, come here with a friend and it'll cheer you right up. The greatest tragedy is that Hello Honey doesn't exist in Chicago and I'm going to be craving for it when I go back home.

This is a hidden gem! We popped in for dessert (and to eat our takeaway meal) from Fred & Gari's and were impressed with the handmade unique ice cream flavors and long list of options to enjoy it "a la mode." I've never seen a concept like this (Dutch baby, brownies, etc.) and it made it feel as much like a bakery as an ice cream shop. So many things to return to try!

Hands down best ice cream place ive ever been to. They hand made the waffle cone for my cookies and cream scoop and hand make the cookie for our warm cookie with ice cream on it. Very highly suggest coming here!!! Very good service too!! Support local business!!

Deeeee-licious! I found this place while scrolling on Instagram a year ago and it has been on my bucket list ever since. I finally got to try it this week, and was not at all disappointed. After sampling pistachio (yum), brown butter caramel (also yum), and honey lavender, I settled on the honey lavender. I've been on a lavender kick lately since it's so refreshing. The flavor was not as mild and subtle as you might think-- it was clearly honey lavender. They offer different gourmet toppings like scorched marshmallows or fudge, but I just got mine plain. They also offer other fun desserts. The prices are a little high, but it's a downtown shop where all of the ice cream is made from scratch, so the prices made sense. The shop has a great ambiance inside and even the name is cute and inviting. If I am ever downtown again with some time to kill, I'll definitely be stopping back in.

Actually had an amazingly patient man waiting on me. I had lots of questions! He even let me try the ice cream with little silver tasting spoons. Lots of good flavors that are special to this mom and pop store. I heard the cheesecakes are amazing. I ended up buying ice cream on a stick. I forgot what it was called but I've attached a pic. It was pistachio ice cream between two chocolate chip cookies then dipped in chocolate. Yum! Prices are actually good too. I would def recommend this ice cream stop.

What really made Hello Honey stand out in my opinion is there insistence on making the waffle cones/cups fresh for each order. It came so out so quick from the press to me that waffle was still warm and had a light crispy texture!  The ice cream is also fantastic, together they make a great pair.

I went in after the March and it was not a long line. There were three of us but I initially didn't see staff. Not sure if she was in the back and didn't realize we came in our not. One person finally came out. She was friendly and helpful. Offered the two in front of me as well as myself suggestions and the opportunity to taste them.

I ordered the two caramel ice creams (salted caramel and brown buttered caramel). I did sample both first. I got them in a waffle cup, which should not be mistaken for a bowl. It is a small cup and the ice cream is stacked. Overall it was good. They each had their own favor. I think I prefer the brown buttered caramel. The waffle cup was good also.

Staff was friendly just not very fast since it was one person working. But overall good customer service. The ice cream was different in a good way. It was made there and had unique favors to try. I will return to try more soon.

Very disappointing 
Kid working there was nice do nothing against him
The hot chocolate tasted like dark chocolate and was not mixed well -- my daughters threw most of it out 
Latte was sub par
Ice cream was okay
Just disappointed with the whole experience :-(
It was pretty good. The guy at the counter was really friendly! The ice cream I got was vegan - Thai Coconut Milk. I wish they had vegan toppings!

This was probably the best ice cream I've had in a long time!  so so good. The staff was lovely. I asked a question about every dessert on the menu and they answered it willingly and in detail. I ended up getting the brownie sundae. Such a treat. My brownie sundae had brownie and cream and the honey lavender ice cream. Both so flavorful and rich. 
Can't wait to come back!
This place is phenomenal. So many good flavors, good ingredients, amazing taste, fresh waffle cones are so good. Super friendly staff.

Cute ice cream shop located in the heart of downtown Cincinnati. Wide variety of fun ice cream flavors and toppings. (Highly recommend toasted marshmallow).

They not only offer ice cream but they also offer a wide variety of dessert options, each one smells and looks better than the next. 

I will be be definitely be returning!

Wow. Came here today fir the first time ever, such a DELICIOUS treat! Cannot believe I had not seen it before.

Ice cream are super creamy and every single one I tasted  was amazing. They do everything from the scratch, including the freshly baked waffel cones served warm.

Very good kind service.

I opted for banana with honey comb caramel-like crunchies. Truly amazing.

The marshmallow on top was perfection, torched nicely, extra crispy.

Will be coming back. Their cakes and cupcakes looked too good to be missed.

From the outside the storefront is not appealing. Upon entering I soon realized that the lighting is very dim. The dimness gave off a weird dreary feeling. Not upbeat or cheery that you would think an ice cream place would be. 

Nonetheless, they were out of the key lime flavor when I went. There is a multitude of flavor combinations that are exquisite. Unfortunately, the staff was adamant about the two sample rule. I have never been limited at an ice cream shop on samples. Especially when it's really hard to choose and the sample is literally a half of a teaspoon (NOT tablespoon). This was a complete turn off for me, therefore I have to deduct one star. 

I ended up choosing the brown butter caramel and turned it into a brownie sundae with the added bonus of a homemade toasted marshmallow. 
The ice cream is rich and very flavorful. The portion size was appropriate. The brownie was delicious. I just can't get jiggy with the two sample rule, especially since the ice cream isn't cheap. I paid 7 dollars for a brownie sundae + $1 extra for the homemade marshmallow.

(4) ~ very good overall food & service

MENU:
** S'mores Sundae = (4) very good. Got mine w. Cookies & Pie ice cream, and chocolate & caramel sauce.  Comes w. Graham Crackers; & a Toasted Marshmallow w. Whipped Cream;)
Needed a sweet treat after a long day and this HIT the spot. Asked them to give me their most popular flavor, so I have no clue what I ate, BUT it was FANNNtastic. Definitely recommend.

There's a true reason why this place has perfect stars. It's not just the food and the amazing variety and quality of ice cream it's  the service there personable real people that have passion for good quality ice cream and friendly service you have to try it if you're passing through Cincinnati. If I was the mayor during my trip here I would definitely get this placed the key to the city well done

So many unique flavors!! I love this place. Everything was so yummy and flavorful..had a hard time choosing. They rotate every month or so too.

I ended up getting a single scoop of banana honeycomb ice cream with a waffle cup. The waffle cups/cones are made fresh after you order it so it comes to u warm!!!  u can also add a toasted marshmallow to the top..they toast it right in front of you. Like a little creme brûlée. 

Awesome employees!
Loooooove this place so much! I tried the Pistachio honey icecream and It brought back happy memories! This is a luxury. If they were on DoorDash they'd be sold out lol. :))

Hands-down my best ice cream experience in Cincinnati so far. This little hole-in-the-wall is one of downtown's best kept secrets. Everything is made fresh in-store with natural ingredients and attention to detail. 

We got the brownie chunk ice cream sundae with caramel honey topping and toasted marshmallow in a waffle bowl. The ice cream was delicious with a fresh cream taste. But the stars of the show were the waffle bowl (light, crisp, hot off the griddle--everything you hope a waffle bowl will be) and the toasted marshmallow (fluffy and light, made fresh in store, and toasted with a torch right on the spot--it melts in your mouth and leaves the pleasant crunch of the toastedness on your tongue). 

The only thing keeping Hello Honey from five stars is their limited hours (they close at 7pm on weekdays) and their dingy interior. Honestly, the place is in disrepair and would make me want to turn around if not for the other yelp reviews. But push past first looks and you'll discover a gem of an ice cream experience just waiting for you.

Apparently I'm alone in not liking this ice cream. While I love, love, love their creativity in flavors I found their execution of the flavors to be lackluster for sure. I sampled a few-- the earl gray one, cookies and pie and lavender honey and Dutch chocolate. They all lacked serious flavor. It just tasted like a lightly flavored frown cream. The texture was really good though ‍ but if you're looking for a flavor punch then you're gonna be disappointed. Which if you're adventurous and seeking out fun flavors like they offer here, you are looking for flavor. 

We also tried a torched marshmallow on top and it was grainy. Even my 5 year old said he didn't like it. What 5 year old turns down a marshmallow?! Maybe I've spoiled him and his taste buds by introducing him to Jeni's Ice cream ‍ 

I really hope they continue to develop their recipes at Hello Honey because I would love to see a fun flavored ice cream place thrive!

Very...very good!  Not much else to say, if you like ice cream you like Hello Honey!  I tried the espresso and it was on point, by recommendation I also got the torched marshmallow...next time I will pass on that but the ice cream was amazing.  Glad I tried something new over the old local standby (wink, wink)

Interesting flavors and variety of ice cream accessories and baked goods. Compares favorably to the humdrum ice cream places in Cincinnati. The closest that I've found in Cincinnati to my favorite ice cream of all time, Salt & Straw.

Amazing homemade fresh waffle cones (they come out warm) Decent ice cream as well! Seemed a little extra that my cup of ice cream came on a wooden board but I guess they're going for the presentation here.

How have I not come here sooner?? I tend to avoid downtown locations because of parking and general driving.. but if you are in the area or just craving some ice cream, this is the place to go.

I appreciate an ice cream shop that offers unique flavors and most importantly, they make all of their ice creams and desserts from scratch.
Like many other reviews, I gotta say that the torched marshmallow is a MUST, seriously. I had the black sesame ice cream and the honey lavender and both were delicious and creamy. The espresso nut brittle was also great. The space itself is very cutesy and small and the owners were very friendly. 

I'm looking forward to coming back and trying other flavors!

If you are wanting THE ABSOLUTE BEST hot chocolate, this is the place! I have just discovered Hello Honey, and hands down the best I've ever had!! I walk past it on the way to work, so I stopped in and ordered the dark chocolate version (they offer milk chocolate as well) with their signature homemade marshmallow that they torch to get a roasted marshmallow smokiness and crunch. Amazing. Very thick and rich. They froth the milk and make it from scratch. No mixes here. It tastes like liquid fine chocolate.

And their specialty is unusual ice-cream flavors like lavender honey. But they also have cookies, brownies and cheesecake.

Because all is custom-made, items are priced a bit higher than some -- $4.95 + $1 for the marshmallow. But it's not crazy, and perfect for a special treat like when you are downtown at the Aronoff or Fountain Square (a block from either one). The staff are very accommodating as well. Try it! You won't be disappointed.

We got the s'more sundae with salted caramel chip and caramel hazelnut and it very well could be the best sundae I've ever had. The man that helped us at the counter was super nice and made the experience even better.

Seriously delicious creamy ice cream. 

Their silky rich taste is so worth the calories.

I tried banana and salted caramel, , both were amazing.
Good, and gets better the more you eat it. I would say it reminds me of cold stone...but this place is better.

Great ice cream. All of their flavors are sweetened with honey, of course. I tried the honey lavender it was great. I appreciate that it wasn't overly sweet. I also got a torched marshmallow, which are made in house. Absolutely delicious. 

I will need to try some of their custom desserts next time, like the crepe cake. I just wish the parking situation was better. It seems like a hostile location for a sweet little ice cream place, but they probably get a good amount of business from the Fountain Square area.

This is probably my favorite ice cream/hot chocolate/coffee stop in cincy, just a couple blocks from fountain square! Their ice cream is amazing and everything is baked to order. My favorite is the brownie time sundae-- it's soooooo good!! Everything tastes good because it's homemade and they have a great variety of flavors. During the winter the hot chocolate is super good too (pictured)!!! I would still get ice cream when it good, though (it's that good!). The workers are always super friendly and helpful. I'd definitely recommend for anyone in cincy!!!
Some of the best ice cream I've ever tried. Would highly recommend the mocha chip or cookies and pie.

Pretty disappointing. They have really cool extravagant deserts BUT only available on the weekend. Unfortunately we're from out of town and were there on a Wednesday. Had I known that I wouldn't have bothered to go. The ice cream had freezer burn on it, and the staff was mildly rude. They guy helping us was nice and helpful, but the other two (one was the owner I believe) seemed bothered that we were there. The seating area was cute. Bathroom was messy, considering they weren't busy, it doesn't seem appropriate. If you're going on a weekend it's probably worth it, but otherwise don't bother.

I absolutely love ice cream and Hello Honey did not disappoint. I started out by sampling the peanut butter brownie and espresso brittle flavors. Both were delicious. I decided to go with the espresso, and I normally always order peanut butter anywhere, and went with the s'mores sundae. The gentleman worker was friendly and played some great music. Would definitely return to try more homemade flavors as they seem to change, and try out some other sundaes!

Why, why, why do people open up artisan ice cream shops? Every time someone opens one up, it means I HAVE to try it. I mean, I suppose if I had self control I could stop myself, but it'd be a helluva lot easier if they just didn't keep popping up so I could spend my daily caloric intake on them.

Hello Honey is a quaint little ice cream shop in between 5th and 6th on Vine. I pass this place everyday on my way to work and one day, while feeling the need for ice cream, I FINALLY stopped in. And let me tell you, I WILL be back. 

I ordered a sundae with nutella sauce (F#%& YEAH NUTELLA), homemade whipped cream and a toasted marshmallow. Yes, I said toasted marshmallow. Ugh. The guy recommended the cookie and pie ice cream as the base and I was not disappointed. The ice cream is made by them, and with all the homemade ingredients on top I was not disappointed.

My only qualm is that most ice cream confections run $6-10. That's a little pricey, but I understand it to be because they make everything with the freshest ingredients and it's homemade. It won't be somewhere I frequent everyday, otherwise I'll be fat and poor, but it's definitely somewhere I will have no guiltiness in splurging on.

Hello Honey - A Cincinnati 4, Bay Area 3. There are so many things about Hello Honey that I want to love. Ice cream made in small batches on the premises. Seasonal flavors. Interesting flavor combinations aka a departure from the classic flavor profiles such as vanilla, strawberry, and chocolate and a veer toward the more modern flavors like strawberry balsamic and chocolate bourbon. Homemade salted caramel, made to order waffle cones and waffle cups, and homemade marshmallow torched in front of you. It's an amateur foodie ice cream lover's paradise. 

The service: it's great! They definitely give you time and space to peruse the menu which is always nice when you're visiting a place for the first time. And they're happy to suggest toppings! 

The ice cream: they have the fat content perfect - enough to placate your inner fattie with just a tad of guilt for consuming dessert before dinner. It's the perfect consistency - smooth and thick. The only qualms I have are with the flavor themselves: I found the two scoops (salted caramel and blackberry cheesecake) and my friend's two scoops (peanut butter and cookies and pie) were just very mild. Or too subtle. I personally prefer when ice cream flavors are more bold and robust and you actually taste the different components that make up that flavor. 

Hello Honey is a great addition to the Cincinnati ice cream scene. They've got the base for a great ice cream experience! I just hope/wish they don't water down the ice cream taste for the Cincinnati palate!

Absolutely amazing ice cream with a super cute and bright atmosphere! The work staff is amazing at helping out with suggestions and we had a wonderful time talking with other customers who are regulars because of how delicious their menu is.

Last week I had the day off and wanted to take advantage of the beautiful weather. I was craving a fresh scoop and ventured downtown to try hello honey. I ended up parking a few blocks away (parking is crazy during the week!!) but wasn't too bothered because of the gorgeous weather. The spot is incredibly adorable- fits about 15-20 people with plenty of seating space. At that hour (2 PM on a Tuesday afternoon), it wasn't too busy at all. There were so many interesting flavors to choose from - espresso nut brittle, honey vanilla, brown butter caramel, and a fresh strawberry sorbet. I ordered the espresso brittle with the toasted caramel (pictured here). I was so impressed with the quality of the ice cream and rich flavors. I could tell the marshmallow was made in house and it was toasted to perfection. As if this couldn't get better, I also got the waffle cone. The cone was warm, freshly made and perfectly paired with the coolness of the ice cream. This is one of the best ice cream desserts I've had in cincinnati, hands down. I'd love to come back and try out other flavors! I'm happy to give this place 5 stars, just wish it was a bit easier to access during the day, and the location had later hours.

Three days later and I am still dreaming about this ice cream!

My sisters, Mom, and I stopped by here on Saturday to satisfy a sweet tooth and are so happy we did. As there are several unique flavors, it took a long time for us all to pick out what we wanted. The staff were so patient with us making decisions and offered suggestions when we asked for it.

I ultimately decided to go with the milkshake of the day, which was a peanut butter milkshake and it was heavenly. My sisters and mom all tried it and love it. They all decided to go with the brown butter caramel ice cream, which I heard was equally amazing.

One of my sisters had decided to get a homemade toasted marshmallow on her ice cream and, to her dismay, it fell off and onto the floor within the first couple of bites. The employee who had clear, horn-rimed glasses was happy to prepare another for her for no charge. He was helpful and attentive to us throughout are time there. We were sad that we had forgotten to ask him what his name was. He was so nice.

I'm sad that I don't live in the Cincinnati area as this would be my go-to ice cream place!

This was really unexpected and amazing. Walking in I knew I'd made a good choice. It's worth a visit for the smells. Plan on taking time to order a fresh baked dessert. The special of the day was peach bread pudding ala mode and the sign said "please allow 15 min to bake to order." I didn't have time to wait. Ran in and got the brown butter Carmel ice cream with a toasted homemade marshmallow on top.  it went beyond expectations.

This is some of the best ice cream ever. The flavors are so good! They are unique and soft and delicious. I had honeycomb and it was the best thing ever. The people are nice and the portions are good. My one complaint is the building that it lives I. Is like a food market and down there hall I saw a huge rat. Gross!

This place is one of my absolute favorite ice cream places! I have only been a few times but it has never disappointed. You can tell the ice cream is homemade and there are so many great flavors to select from. This recent time we tried the Espresso Nut Brittle, Brownie and Cream and Salted Caramel, all topped with a toasted marshmallow of course! The marshmallow is really what makes this place the best, they torch it right in front of you, and even though it looks burnt, it is actually a beautiful sugary crisp addition to the ice cream. If you're in the downtown area you definitely have to go!

Some of the best ice cream I've had. Tried four flavors in two visits and loved them all. They make their waffle cones fresh to order, which takes a few minutes but I highly recommend. They come out warm and delicious.

This is the best ice cream we've had in Cincinnati. It's the closest we've come to Jeni's since we moved away from Columbus. When compared to Graeter's, this completely blows it away. 
I had Honey Vanilla and Earl Grey Blackberry. The herbiness of the two together was delicious. Unfortunately, I got the bottom of the barrel of the Honey Vanilla and it had a lot of ice chips in it, but the flavor was amazing. The milk fat ratio seemed to be a little high, based on the greasiness of the spoon and my lips after eating it. Regardless, it was still delicious and I ate every last drop. 
Can you tell I thought it was delicious? This will be our new high end small batch ice cream destination.

One of my new favorite ice cream shops in Ohio located right downtown by fountain square. The most unique and delicious flavors, and you can put any a freshly made waffle bowl or add a toasted marshmallow. Great place to bring visitors/kids and the staff are so friendly!
Always awesome and the best ice cream in the tri state. Also the couple who owns and works this nice place are so sweet and lovely. They provide excellent service. Everything on the menu rocks!

This place is great!  I love Hello Honey!  The ice cream flavors here remind me of Jeni's Splendid ice cream flavors from Columbus!

But that's not all they offer! They offer cakes, crepes, shakes, ice cream sandwiches and that's all I could remember off the top of my head.

I got their lavender honey ice cream and cookies and pie ice cream in a waffle cup.

My companion got their peanut butter and vanilla milkshake.  Truthfully, my ice cream waffle cup won out over deliciousness compared to the shake.  I mean even their waffle cup was delicious to eat on its own!  

Between the lavender honey and the cookies and pie, I liked the cookies and pie more.  The lavender honey is super lavenderish, if that's what you like.  Which I do, so it tasted delicious!  But when my companion tried it, he thought it was too lavenderish.  More for me!

I liked the cookies and pie more, because I love cookies and cream, but this is even better with PIE crust pieces in it!!

If you really like their ice cream, you even have the option to take home a pint, at around $7 a pint.

This store is small, and it got pretty packed by the time we finished eating.  It probably seats around twenty or so people...  or five big groups.

The guys working here are friendly and the store is super cute and clean!  I would recommend Hello Honey!

This place is pretty awesome. They have handmade waffel cones, good little Sundays, and a nice atmosphere.

Try it!

Hello Honey is delicious. Unique offerings, flavors, honey lavendar & brown butter caramel for example and toasted marshmallow topping yummmm. Just try it. I just happened to be passing by with my sister and brother in law. We all enjoyed!

You know I read the other reviews and thought to myself, better than Graeters? These people must like a different kind of ice cream ... but no, this is better!!! Well so they don't have the full chunks of luxurious chocolate pieces or full toffee chunks in their ice creams but they just have brownie pieces instead!! With more modern flavors too. This place is divine ... the waffle cones are amazing and come out hot. I don't even really particularly like waffle cones and I liked this one. Normally I'm one who is stingy on my calories. Like I will certainly eat fatty buttery high calorie foods but not junk. I don't do junk food. The pro of the taste must outweigh the high calorie con, i.e. Positive return on investment for my calories and this place exemplifies why I won't touch grocery store ice cream but I'd gobble this down in a second! Oh and the waffle cone too.

The toasted marshmallow seems interesting but I'm there for ice cream. My husband I shared the caramel and brownies and cream, 2 scoops on a waffle cone (ordered by my husband) and we both wanted to buy another one after we finished eating. The ice cream is literally the perfect consistency and the waffle cone crispy, sweet, and delightfully warm! We will certainly be back.
My kids scarfed down the brownie sundae in no time!  Super yummy & hope to go back again

No words can describe how much I love this place! The best ice cream ive ever had so far! The first time I tried their earl grey ice cream! Really good! 
The next time I tried the charcoal ice cream and banana honey toast! Everything is perfect! Please don't have it in a cup, try their waffle cone!!! No regret! (With a torched marshmallow on top, of course) 
This is handmade ice cream, the wife of the owner went to France to study how to make ice creams so that's why it's amazing!

This is hands down an amazing small batch ice cream/dessert place!! I got a single scoop of salty Carmel with a homemade torched marshmallow on top. My child got the strawberry sorbet which is awesome and my husband had a great chocolate and PB milkshake. If you live around Cincinnati you gotta try this place!!

Best ice cream in Cincinnati. Hands down. Graeters doesn't even come close to Hello Honey.

For starters, they make the waffle cone fresh with every order... it comes out soft and warm... absolutely PERFECT against the hard, cold ice cream.

Hello Honey has the best non-traditional flavors, as well! Honey lavender is my all-time favorite flavor, so naturally I always jump for it, BUT the Earl Grey Blackberry, Espresso Brittle & Brown Butter Caramel are also to die for. Menu is constantly rotating, so stop by often to see what's new!

What an adorable little ice cream store!!! I'm so happy that I stumbled across this gem!! My best friend and I were looking for desserts to eat after brunch and thanks to Yelp I was able to find this place. 

They make their own ice cream in creative flavors like lavender and honey or smoked butterscotch (which is what I got) but what makes this store different from the rest is they have option to top off your ice cream with ROASTED MARSHMALLOWS!! 

OH. EM. GEE! It's a $1 more but I must recommend you do it! It's literally heaven in a cup.

Seriously fabulous ice cream! If you LOVE ice cream, you will love this artisan shoppe.
The unique desserts and flavors reflect the craftsmanship.  Even the presentation is great, especially when topped with a marshmallow they toast in front of you. Plus, they were so nice!!

I happened to walk by this on my way to Cheapside and the name itself called to me! I had to find out what this was and go in! And of course, it has my favorite treat: ice cream!! 

After a delightful meal at Cheapside, I make it back here and nobody is in here, so I get the full attention of the owner and he lets me try everything! I was so impressed with the flavors, it was hard to choose, but I decided vanilla lavender and nothing but espresso and they were GOOD CHOICES. 

Waffle cones are made to order and they are decadent! It was incredible, I have never liked a waffle cone so much and I LOVE WAFFLE CONES. It has a thin, light airy crunch (unlike normal cones) and it crumbles easily, but not too easily that the ice cream melts into it and makes it soft. It was so perfect. But I made the poor choice of getting it in a cup and it was difficult to eat. Go with the cone because that's just normal and easier. 

I was also up sold with the toasted marshmallow and it was worth it. Expensive as hell - a dollar for a marshmallow (think, you can buy an entire bag for this much which has like 100 of them in there), but good. It added another element of sweetness and flavor with the brûlée crunch and smokey burntness (yes I'm good at making up words). Def try it. 

I'd love to go back if I come to cincy, so I'm glad I have friends here to visit! Oh hello, honey!

Wow! Just, wow!! I take ice cream very seriously, so believe me when I tell you, this place does ice right!

I visited for the first time today with my dad. They're awesome about letting you sample, which is good because I can be super indecisive. I tried the brownies and cream first and the brownies pieces were perfect. The Brownie  Time Sundae brownie uses the very same brownie, so I knew that was a win! Then it was just a matter or what ice cream to put on top of it. The Brown Butter Caramel was so sweet and full of flavor. But in the end, Peanut Butter Brittle won out. I'm really not a brittle fan, but the peanut butter ice cream was so rich and the brittle was such a sweet caramel that it totally surprised. I also decided top it with on of their toasted marshmallows because...why wouldn't I??? This sundae was perfection! The brownie was sweet, soft and moist. And this ice cream was some of the creamiest ice cream I have ever tasted! It wasn't icy in the least.

The only teeny, tiny, itsy, bitsy complaint I have is that their hot fudge hardens quickly. So if you don't eat it right away, you'll have some chocolate chunks stuck to your plate.

I will definitely be returning to Hello Honey!
Best dessert menu I've ever seen. A friend and I split 3 things because we couldn't decide. Both the cheesecake and ice cream were phenomenal !

I can't believe I didn't hear about this place until now!

I was drawn to this place by pictures of toasted marshmallows on Yelp Cincy's Instagram page and decided to give it a try. It seems I have been passing by for months and missing out! They have so many yummy desserts I want to try, and they have a ton of unique flavors as well.

I had the honey toast with blackberry cheesecake ice cream and a toasted marshmallow. It was fantastic! The honey toast was like a pound cake and it went very well with the ice cream and marshmallow. It tasted as delicious as it looked. 

My sister and I shared the dessert and they were nice enough to throw in an extra toasted marshmallow for us. Hello Honey makes me happy :)

I can't wait to go back and try their cakes and crepes!

During my weekend visit in Cincinnati, my friends and I frequented Hello Honey twice. We are a fan of their ice cream and desserts. The store is so cute and the owner is really friendly and personable. The owner keeps up with what's trending in the ice cream industry as I overheard her talking to a regular customer. There is several parking areas around Hello Honey. I think there was a parking deck next to it. 

Flavors do change and alter each week, They do have very interesting and smart concepts/concoctions to ice cream flavors that my friends loved. I tend to like more of the basic flavors like Vanilla and Chocolate. The flavors that I was able to try:
- Lavender Honey: interesting flavor and it definitely tastes like lavender. It was good and I think it's one of the popular flavors from the menu. 
- Vanilla Honey: this was my all-time favorite flavor. It was a twist to the traditional vanilla flavor. I ordered this both times I was at Hello Honey. 

Pricing is under $10 for each item. I think it's $5 for one scoop of ice cream and $6 for two scoops. Of course I went for the two scoops. The scoops are very generous so one scoop is more than enough. 

Overall, I wish there was a Hello Honey in Georgia. We really liked our experience at Hello Honey.
This is a must-visit ice cream spot. The unique flavors and additions (specifically the toasted marshmallow - order it on everything) are to die for and their matcha is some of the best I have had.
This is the best place to treat yourself. The souffle is even better than the one in Chilies. Everyone should try it.

After a late lunch at Bakersfield OTR, Hello Honey was an 8-minute walk down the street and we were happy to find them open for once.  It seems that we've always ended up driving by them while they're closed.   

And even though, it had started raining by the time we left to head back to the car, I am so glad we finally made it to Hello Honey! We were encouraged to sample as much as we liked - everything was so delicious, it was hard to make a decision. My husband ended up with Espresso Hazelnut and another delicious flavor - and I made him ask for it to be topped with a Toasted Marshmallow. OMG, this is THE perfect touch for any bowl of ice cream. You can watch them toast the homemade marshmallow using a mini-torch right before your eyes.  I had a Banana Toffee sundae with Maple Hazelnut Crunch ice cream. The only thing that would have made it more perfect was if I'd added a toasted marshmallow of my own. ;-)

Parking in the area is not very good - I swear, I would be there so much more if that wasn't an issue!

Hello Honey. The name says it all. The smell is intoxicating as soon as you enter into the door. It's so refreshing to find a place that is true to its roots. If I go to an ice cream shop, I want real, homemade Ice cream, if I go to a steak house, I want an authentic grilled steak. Hello Honey is just that. A true ice cream shop. They have a lot of unique, Rich, & delicious flavors. The ice cream flavors are luscious and definitely not your neighborhood strawberry or mint chip. 

Hello honey has a variety of other desserts, cake, warm & cold desserts, etc. they have a little something for everyone. Not doubt if you're looking for a delicious dessert or ice cream, Hello Honey is an amazing place to check out! My only downfall on the visit is that 1. The place can be busy so you don't really get the time or assistance needed regarding flavors, dessert options, etc. the rep working the counter was nice just seemed rushed so i didn't get the amount of time I felt was needed to review the options on the menu board. You only get two samples of ice cream as well. Kind of a bummer because they have so many unique flavors. 

The Parking is also horrible on this location. If you're lucky you'll get a Street Meter spot. Or you'll have to walk a little bit or settle for a parking garage spot. Overall a good experience! A must try!

Looking for warm, melt in your mouth cones, super tasty ice cream, unconventional flavors and awesome service "Hello Honey's" is the place to go! Love the espresso nut, mthly flavors coconut Thai and  mojito!!!

Oh man Hello Honey is absolutely amazing! You have to stop by and try their fresh baked waffle cone. They make it on the spot and serve it to you still warm! The ice cream flavors are all unique and delicious, too. My only complaint is that they close at 7pm so every time I am craving it after dinner they are closed. If they were open just a few hours later this would definitely be a regular post-dinner stop!

So delicious! Very friendly service. Good have better ambiance and more seating. I wish it was open in the evening. Maybe a better location? BUT it's still so so yummy! And you would be a fool not to get a torched marshmallow.
Got the chocolate chip cookie with the Brown Butter Caramel ice cream on top. So incredibly good!

My friends and I stopped here for a quick snack. I had the Dutch chocolate ice cream with a toasted marshmallow on top.  So good and delicious!  The ice cream is very creamy and full of flavor. This place has some awesome options for ice cream, pastries, trifle, and cakes. You should definitely stop by for a nice, cold treat and make sure you get the toasted marshmallow on top :)

Randomly stopped in for some ice cream and was blown away!! The gentleman that was working there was extremely kind and gave us a rundown of the menu. Generally I go for vegan ice cream, and there's nothing in Cincinnati that beats the Thai Coconut! The sit down area probably holds 15 people. Not huge. But this is seriously an amazing place for ice cream! I absolutely recommend. It's a little off the beaten path of downtown, but only a couple blocks from OTR and WELL worth the walk. Kind people are so appreciated too, they were so sweet and that alone made my night!

I visited Cincinnati this past weekend, and Hello Honey was definitely a highlight of the trip. It was a must on my Cincinnati To-Do List, and it definitely did not disappoint. I've tried a lot of ice-cream places, and I can confidently say Hello Honey is one of the top. I ordered a scoop of Espresso Nut Brittle with a toasted marshmallow on top. It costs an extra dollar to get the toasted marshmallow, but it's worth every penny. I also tried their Green Tea - Earl Gray White Chocolate and it was just as yummy (also super creamy!). They serve unique flavors and other types of desserts as well. Would highly recommend!!

This might be the number one hidden gem in Cincinnati. I've been wanting to try this place since it opened, and due to the hours it's hard for me to get there on time. 
I had the banana sundae which I ordered with brown butter caramel. I was surprised to see that the sundae wasn't as big as I anticipated, which I was happy about. So many places give such huge portions. The toffee pieces were super super good. 
My boyfriend ordered the nutella sundae but wanted matcha ice cream instead. It actually worked really really well together. The matcha ice cream is bomb. Sooo good. 
Service is super friendly and are more then willing to help and give you many samples. 
Can't wait for my next visit to taste more flavors.
Found this gem on Yelp. Two weeks after visiting my mom is telling people about how great the fresh made waffle cone and the ice cream.  Definitely a must do if in downtown Cincy!!

Heaven? Nirvana? Paradise? The promised land? There are no words to capture the beauty of this place. 
If you have ever liked anything made of dairy and even made eye contact with a cow, you should go to this place. 
This ice cream is made in small batches from organic milk and amazing flavours. The cones and waffle bowls are baked FRESH when you order and of course you absolutely must get the marshmallow (made in house) torched. Don't walk there, run!!! Because once a flavor is gone, it usually takes a while to come back around ( check the blackboard for current flavors). Feel free to say hi to me, I'm always there ... getting more ice cream.
The YUMMIEST ice cream I have ever had. And the waffle cone is delicious as well. The owner was so kind and generous.

The presentation was fun and unique. The practicability of earring it out of mug with short spoons was challenging. Ice cream was decent. We had the Nutella  Fever. There was a crunch to it might have been cone pieces was good!

Hello Honey is awesome!! I got banana brittle with a toasted marshmallow on top. It was absolutely delicious! Everything is homemade and very fresh. Very friendly staff and cute interior decor. My only complaint is their hours. I wish they were open a bit later! Overall, this place is a hidden gem!

The banana honey brittle was super good loved the melted brittle!!!
