Place surprisingly empty however. More people need to come here.

WELL HELLO HONEY!  Banana Pudding Sundae and Honey Toast.    Really creative and fun dishes made with homemade ice cream. It's a must try and try and try again. Hello Honey has an expansive selection of homemade ice cream, sundaes and cakes. The owners are gracious and offered up tastings and recommendations.

Great little place to fix your sweets craving. So many unique flavors of ice cream (honey lavender is amazing!) And for $1 extra you can get a toasted marshmallow on top! They also have different pastries if you don't want ice cream. The only thing I had trouble with is the parking. Since it's downtown you either have to get metered parking (which is very hard to find during bush days) or paid parking lots. However, if you can find parking, it's more than worth it!

I absolutely love this place and the ice cream was to die for. We got the lava cake with sea salt caramel ice cream with the toasted marshmallow on top. That marshmallow was out of this world. I cannot wait to go back. Go visit this place because it was dead when we were there and I don't want it  to close

No joke, the best ice cream in Cincinnati. Don't expect typical flavors, but instead, enjoy wonderful combinations such as brown butter caramel, cookies and pie, and honey lavender. 

The waffle cones are a must have. They actually make them to order in the back. They will also toast a homemade marshmallow with a butane torch directly on top of the ice cream. Yes, please!

Be warned if there is a crowd, it could take a few minutes, but WELL worth the wait!

Hello Honey serves up some pretty amazing ice cream, and offers a fairly unique offering of flavors that you won't find at other ice cream establishments.  I would say Hello Honey is the best ice cream shop I have visited in the downtown Cincinnati area (not Northern Kentucky, however).  When you go in, the kind staff is more than generous and helpful in regards to letting you sample whatever flavors you want in order to help you determine your selection.  Sometimes that sampling experience can get awkward (at other places) if you have rude staff that makes you feel as if you are free loading on Company product (as I'm sure some do), but the few times I have been in, the Hello Honey staff actually seems to promote the sampling.  

This is as good as it gets for ice cream in downtown Cincinnati!  I highly suggest you give it a whirl if you have a hankering for some sweets.

Have not seen our friend Pook and Brian the owners of Hello Honey. Was craving for the home made ice cream I ordered the Dutch chocolate....WoW!!! YummmmmY  blackberry ice-cream my wife ordered that was great. Great ambience and service. Will be back thank you Hello Honey.

I can't believe I'm just now reviewing this place! Over the past several years, I have been to this small ice cream shop, tucked away on Vine Street. The service is always superb; the shop is owned and run by a couple who are more than willing to let you sample any and all of the flavors. My ultimate favorite is the brown butter caramel. But there's always a variety of flavors for everyone's palette. The ice cream always tastes fresh and leaves me almost licking the bowl. You must try it at least once with the toasted marshmallow on top!

I don't even like ice cream that much, but I love Hello Honey on so many different levels.

FLAVORS.  Unlike ice cream shops that experiment with wacky flavors (sweet corn, anyone?), Hello Honey does a great job with flavors that most of us can enjoy e.g. cinnamon, Dutch chocolate, salted caramel, while throwing in a few cool ones that aren't completely out of the realm of flavor possibilities: brown sugar caramel, chardonnay, and Thai milk tea.  They switch up the flavors daily/weekly, so it's a constant surprise when you step into the shop.

DESSERTS.  They can torch a marshmallow to add on top of your ice cream--DO IT.  I've heard great things about their waffle cones, which they make fresh in-house.  It is difficult for me to leave without getting a slice of the green tea cake to-go.  Even though it's not the best I've ever had (have had some ridiculously good ones), it's an eye-catcher and deliciously light (or so I think).  They also offer lava cake and Honey Toast, which I've yet to try!  

SERVICE. The Asian lady behind the counter is SO sweet and will let you try as many flavors as you want. Small space, but plenty of tables and bar stools for you to sit and dig in.
The banana ice cream was incredible. I love how they make the waffle cones fresh for each customer. Can't wait to try another flavor!

What a delightful little ice cream shop in the business district of downtown Cincinnati!  Some friends and I walked in after a light lunch, and we were ready for anything on the menu. I was amazed by their choices that were listed on a big board above the tables. We had checked out the photos on yelp! beforehand and everyone wanted their dish topped with a toasted marshmallow. 

We were met by a smiling woman who was happy to help with any questions we had. I was overwhelmed by the flavors list, so I ordered the brownie sundae with a toasted marshmallow for $1 extra. This-made-my-day!!!  You know a place is awesome when they break out a blow torch. The treats came out quickly on a cute bamboo tray. The dishes were perfect and the ice cream was smooth and perfect over the hot brownie. The toasted marshmallow made me think I was right back at Girl Scout camp, but with plumbing and clean clothes. Amazing. 

The only thing that would have been better was the AC cranked up. But, it was a gorgeous day outside and we cooled off eating the amazing ice cream. 

I am so glad we tried this place. We will be back for more!

Hello, love of my life! This is hands down the best ice cream in Cincinnati and my favorite ice cream. Period. You can go simple with just a scoop of yummy ice cream like Brown Sugar Pecan or go cuh-razy and get your ice cream with a delicious cake topped with the most amazing marshmallow you've ever tasted. This place is game changing. You've never had anything like it, I promise. We've all had a roasted marshmallow and even a waffle cone, but not like this. The flavors, the textures; mind blowing! Thank God they sell the ice cream by the pint. This girl has got to have her Espresso Brittle and Honey Lavender fix!

Let me tell you about the best ice cream I have ever had.

It's called party in your mouth, and it's made with bourbon. I had the opportunity to try some of this "party in your mouth" when I went to Hello Honey this week and a customer recommended it to me. I got it with an eclair that was creamy and sweet, with a taste that danced on my tongue for a while and made it that much better. It was warmed up, too.

There's little I can say other than to say that every single bite of this ice cream was worth 5 stars.
These original flavors are made with such care! And the ice cream and desserts aren't the only thing sweet here - you get such sincere service! A hidden gem!

I love walking around downtown around lunchtime on a nice day. I don't work downtown but whenever I get to come downtown for lunch, I make sure to stop by Hello Honey for dessert!

The owner is a sweet little lady named Pook. She will let you sample anything before you buy it! She told me the salted caramel was her favorite but she warned that it was very salty. She was right! But I ordered one and ate the whole thing and it was delicious.

Great location and cute little shop. I will be coming to Hello Honey much more often to cool off from the 80 degree weather!

The last time I was in a committed relationship was back in the good old days when a Jr. Bacon Cheeseburger was a still a buck and the only Siri I knew was a Scandinavian pole dancer. To fill the void in my heart, I have been filling my belly with culinary happiness. That means courting girls like Wendy, Mimi, and Marie Callender (and yes, I also spent some time with with 5 Guys but that doesn't make me bi-curious it makes me bi-carnivorous (bad joke, I know. No wonder I'm single) : / 

When I'm not out running game on the ladies, you can usually find me out on the town getting my dessert on. In the past, I frequented hometown favorites like Graeter's and Aglemesis Brothers but now there is a new ice cream parlor in Cincinnati and I'm here to report it's as good as it gets.

Hello Honey has only been open for 4 months but already it's considered one of the best in the area. And that is thanks to amazing homemade ice cream offered in unique flavors like malted chocolate, butterscotch cake, salted caramel, and thai roasted coconut. But the excitement doesn't just stop there. For an additional charge you can have a homemade marshmallow square toasted on top of your ice cream (think campfire s'mores on top of excellence). 

It seems like this place is getting all kinds of hype but let me assure you, the hype is real. In fact, you can't over-hype perfection, so make your way down to Vine Street and see what everyone is talking about!

I am a life long lover of ice cream.  My mom has always joked that when I was born I was made 50% of soft serve and I guess it stuck. That said, ALL OTHER ICECREAM IS RAW SEWAGE compared to Hello Honey! You need to try this stuff if you haven't. Yes, their hours make it a challenge of you don't live directly in the city but make a special trip if you have to! The hand made marshmallows are one of the best deserts I have ever had and to put it atop this fresh and inspired ice cream makes a perfect paring. I would give them a dozen stars if I could. This joint is our new Saturday ritual.

Hello Honey! There you are my long lost love...

Finally a place where you can get modern, seasonal ice cream that is creative, fun, and so dang delicious it will leave you scraping your little bowl clean. 

Hello Honey is run by a fabulous young lady and her husband who have a passion for fresh clean ingredients. They have a menu that is always changing which I LOVE. With flavors like Butter Pecan Brittle, Lemon Mint, Lavender Honey, Butter Cake, and Mocha, there is something for everyone! 

I opted for the Butter Cake, as most of you know I am not a sweets person but it was salty, buttery, and had just the perfect amount of sweetness! And word to the wise, don't forget to get a home made hand torched TOASTED MARSHMALLOW added to any dish. Holy Cannoli! Out of this world, awesome. Actually I might even goes as far to say it's the best marshmallow I've ever had. 

Do yourself a flavor (haha. See what I did there?) and try this place out! You will not be disappointed!

Nutella Icecream and a fresh roasted marshmallow?! yes please!

I loved that all of the ice-cream is made there and it was absolutely delicious. I prefer fresh marshmallows so HH was right up my alley! 

The service and decor were right on point! It reminded me of my trips to sweet shops and bakeries in Asia. 

The only think I didn't enjoy was the green tea chocolate cake. I am a bit of matcha purist and I think chocolate ruins and overpowers that flavor. The chocolate cake and matcha mousse were not a pairing that I enjoyed so I ended up scooping the mousse out and I enjoyed it thoroughly! 

The menu is also developing and absolutely delicious combos are available so everyone can try a little bit of everything!
Hidden ice cream gem of Cincinnati. Trust me. Check it out next time you're downtown. Get the marshmallow on top of your scoops. Unique flavors. Hope to try that desserts next time I'm in.

Excellent ice cream and helpful service.
One of the best shakes I've had. Ordered a chocolate banana and I've never tasted a stronger banana in a shake. The desserts are melt in your mouth and rich.
My only complaint is a rotating menu, though the options are listed on the wall and I was told they rotate roughly every three days.

cashier was very friendly. very relaxed little atmosphere in the city. ice cream and cheesecake was amazing. disappointed that this place isn't closer to where i live. will definitely be coming back when i'm in town!
Honey lavender is the best !! Fresh ingredient and very refreshing! My banana honeycomb is recommended too!
This is my favorite spot not only is the ice cream amazing but you can get Nutella and a toasted marshmallow to top it off. The atmosphere is quiet and a great spot to people watch!

You are so spoiled to have this ice cream in Cincinnati!  From the exciting flavors to the freshly made waffle cones, it just doesn't get any better.  The owners are so nice and welcoming- open to talking about their craft.  I would definitely find myself here at least once a week...

How on earth can you be closed on National Ice Cream Day??? We were road tripping from California and visiting Cincinnati today hoping to patronize Hello Honey after seeing all the great reviews. So disappointed :(

Hmm~ I hate to be the downer among so many good reviews... Maybe it was because my husband and I came mid-day on a Tuesday, before their new tubs of ice cream were being brought out.

When we went, the owner was really friendly and offered us multiple times to try different flavors which was really nice but every time she opened the tubs of ice cream there was barely any ice cream left...Maybe enough for two scoops of ice cream in each! I just felt like the store didn't care to keep their flavors stocked up... And that we weren't getting fresh ice cream. This part was not too bad, because if I were to give them the absolute benefit of the doubt maybe their ice cream is just SO good that they're never stocked up! But regardless it started my experience on the wrong foot.

My husband, sister, and I shared a matcha green tea cake with a scoop of Guinness chocolate ice cream and I got a lemon meringue pie ice cream with their famous toasted marshmallow. Here's where my second disappointment came in... Our marshmallow was really small and granule-ey!!! The toasted part of the marshmallow was like biting a thick layer of crusted sugar. And parts of the marshmallow was melted and oosey but there were parts of the marshmallow that was not melted and again granule-ey!!!! I really don't know how to explain it other than by saying the marshmallow didn't have that puffy airy consistency all the way through... Parts of it seemed like it was a corner piece and the sugar hadn't melted or cooked enough in the cooking process.

She brought out the cake warm but because the place was so quiet we could hear her opening and closing the microwave to heat it up for us from the back... I think from watching kitchen nightmares I just don't like hearing and noticing that food service places have microwaves. 

The cake was blah, but the two ice cream flavors were really fun and delicious. The ice cream itself was good, but I was disappointed in my experience as a whole and in feeling like the toasted marshmallow was too much of a gimmick. I want to go back and give this place another shot though because I hear their ice cream flavors are always changing, maybe my experience will be better next time!

Ps: the place is also located in the heart of downtown so it's really hard to find parking. We ended up just paying at one of the nearby parking structures.
Awesome!  The sundae was super yummy.  All ice cream is homemade and they had a great choice of flavors.

What the heck have I been eating all of these years from those store brand ice creams or even Graeters??!! We came in on a warm day in February after hearing so much about this. We sampled so many of their flavors: salted caramel, brown butter, banana honeycomb, cookies and pie, etc. Everything was so good and creamy. Not too solid. We ended up getting a double of salted caramel and brownies and cream on a fresh waffle cone. I emphasize the freshness. It was still warm as we were eating the ice cream and had the fantastic smell of butter. The salted caramel was pure bliss. The brownies and cream was amazing as the brownie pieces were large, delicious and still soft like they had just been mixed in. I wanted another two scoops but my fear of how much fat I was ingesting kept me from going overboard. Needless to say, if you want to go on a diet, don't come here. Pretty sure one scoop is provably 600 calories on its own but totally worth it. We will definitely coming back especially in the spring when they have more flavors available

The espresso hazelnut is a dream on its own but absolute ecstacy with torched marshmallow goodness on top. It's like breaking into that crisp caramelized candy top of creme brulee to be delighted to find a puff soft white sweetness. Plus, there no risk in trying the ever-changing flavors because they let you try as many as you want before buying.

Incredible and delicious.  I really do not need to say more...but I will.  Organic house made ice cream with "to-die-for" flavor.  I had the German Chocolate Cake ice cream.  Every component was evident in the flavors.  Extremely knowledgeable staff made our first visit easy to navigate.  I just wanted more.  Portions were fine, but it was so good.

Best flavors and nicest people ever. You have to get the toasted marshmallow on top. It's a homemade marshmallow that they torch in front of you - so fun. My favorite is the peanut butter pistachio or any of the bourbon variations. Not crazy about the location just because we don't find ourselves there often but it's worth seeking out just for the ice cream!!
Best ice cream in Cincinnati. I really recommend this place for anyone likes ice cream.
Unique and Amazing flavors. Waffle Cones are made fresh as you order them. House-made delicious marshmallows.

Um, yes please. This cute little ice cream shop boasts of all natural, fresh, ingredients. The flavors range from more unconventional (lavender vanilla) to good ole chocolate. I tried the salty caramel and blood orange. Both were delicious. The part that really will make the package complete is the toasted marshmallow on top. Do it. They will put a healthy chunk of marshmallow on top of your scoops and toast with a blow torch. It's pretty fantastic. Good size servings for the price, too.

Also available but I did not try: crepes, cakes, waffles. Next time!

It's hot out today. Sweet lady behind the counter talks me into an éclair. Not really an éclair person. It was good. Pastry chef good. Chilled, with delicious custard filling. Real chocolate on top. Surprisingly refreshing.

 For dessert I had a raspberry lavender chocolate chip cone. I was trying to decide if it needed more lavender or more raspberry.... But then it was gone. House made waffle cone was perfect. Nice crunch. Not too sweet. If i had room for a second dessert, I would have tried the Green Tea cake.  The ice cream cone was about $3.75, but a large serving.

You locals need to keep this place in business.

I've written about the wealth of great frozen treats in Cincinnati, and for me, Hello Honey rules them all. It's a very tight race, and maybe it's my love for the underdog, but I adore Hello Honey.

As others have mentioned, it's run by a fantastic husband and wife team who is very happy to sit there as you ask them endless questions about flavors. 

Highlights include the toasted marshmallow, which I can't recommend highly enough (they seriously put marshmallow on your ice cream then torch it with a pastry torch. Awesome.) Though I haven't had it, I've seen them make fresh waffle cones, too, as in pour batter into a waffle iron, cook it, and make it a cone. How is that not incredible?

The flavors change regularly, and are all delicious, though as Samantha mentioned some are a bit less remarkable than others (go for a unique flavor rather than a regular flavor with unique things.) My personal favorites are the flavors sweetened by molasses, as it has a very unique flavor. 

Which segues into the biggest point - from what I understand the name comes from them actually sweetening their ice cream with honey. Amazing!

The hours aren't the best if you don't work Downtown. It's a small operation, so they can't keep the convenient hours of the Fountain Square Graeter's. What they can do, however, is offer more unique, interesting flavors, extremely high quality ice cream, and a very personal touch.

Love this place.

I was very pleased my first time visiting Hello Honey. However: I was very upset when my friends and I specifically made a trip downtown to have some ice cream on 04/21/18 and a sign on the door said they would be closed until 4 and would open then. We waited about an hour until 4 and we walked back and they were still closed. No update on when they would open and by that time there was a line of people out there. I lost confidence in the operation of the business and most likely will call next time before I venture downtown. Still the best though!

I love ice cream. I love it in all of it's various and related forms: ice cream, frozen yogurt, gelato, even a refreshing sorbet on occasion (but sherbet? please!). Hello Honey takes the classic ice cream form and elevates it with creative flavor twists for a decidedly delicious take on a standard.

Flavors are posted on a giant blackboard and at least some rotate on a regular basis. The person who took me was talking up the virtues of the bourbon ice cream (it wasn't a hard sell), but unfortunately they only have that on Thursdays and Fridays. Instead, I went with a scoop of Nutella ice cream and it was indeed the ice cream doppelganger of everybody's favorite chocolate-hazelnut spread. 

There are fun extras like a giant homemade marshmallow blow-torched on top of your scoop in front of your eyes or a freshly-made waffle bowl. If you want to know the rotating flavors before you go, they are posted on Hello Honey's Facebook page. Prices are reasonable for the quality and scoop size (1 scoop is $3.50 and 2 scoops are $5), but with all the awesome flavor options, it would be nice to be able to get 2 flavors within the 1 scoop size and price (and maybe they would, I think I'll ask next time!).

Hello Honey is a great, locally-owned ice cream shop.  I really enjoy their variety of flavors, and I hope they continue experiment with unusual ice cream ideas.  It looks like they've recently expanded their selection of desserts too, including waffles, crepes, cakes, etc.  

I've been here a few times, and would probably go much more often if it wasn't for their sparse hours.  I seem to always think about going later than 8 o'clock or on an off-time during the weekend.  The couple who, I think, own the business are incredibly friendly and sweet, and they encourage guests to try flavors before picking them out.  If you're looking for something a little different, give Hello Honey a try.  I can't recall my experiences here as either outstanding or poor-I've always had a pleasant experience!
I had the Caramel Pie and it was fantastic. It was delicious and light. Had the freshest flavors!!!! I work directly across the street! Great benefit!!!!
The bomb.  Period. Had the coconut with whopper and a toasty homemade marshmallow on top! Redic.  Get here before the hipsters overrun it and it takes an hour to get a scoop!

Amazing ice cream!  It's not your typical ice cream either.  It's all made from scratch with unique flavors which change every week or so.  The best part is the homemade marshmallow that is torched on top of your ice cream as well.  All our friends were blown away by how good it was.  We all sat in a state of bliss!  They also offer waffles that can be topped with ice cream or a waffle sandwich.  

The staff is very friendly. The owner remembered us from the last time we were there and even remembered what we had ordered.  She was so excited for us to try the new flavors she had we couldn't keep up with all the samples.  

They aren't always open for their posted hours.  I would suggest calling ahead to be sure they are open.

This is probably the best ice cream I've ever had. It definitely trumps Graeter's. It's sooooo creamy, like gelato! I couldn't get over how creamy it was. I got the brownies and cream ice cream with a torched marshmallow on top (of course!), and it was amazing. The bits of brownie actually tasted like good, fudgy, homemade brownies! None of those cardboard-tasting, flavorless brownie chunks you get in most "brownie" ice cream. I was SUPER impressed. My boyfriend's brown butter caramel ice cream was just as good! I could eat this ice cream every day. I know the hours are weird, but seriously, you have to try it! It's worth the special trip.

Their made to order waffle cones and bowls are light, fresh and delicious. The new and classic flavors are definitely unique and amazing. The toasted marshmallow topping almost comes off brûlée like. We've been 2x in 3 days! We'll be back soon!

I love their unique flavors such as banana chip, butter cake, lemon meringue pie. Everything is homemade, even the waffle cones which are made fresh and still slightly warm when served. I just wish that the chocolate chips in the ice cream are creamier and softer.

So. Effing. Good. I would trade one of the Jeni's in Columbus for a Hello Honey.

If you are there and see the Brown Butter Brownie, get it. Oh my stars. Also, the marshmallow.

I also loved the customer service. The lady helping us was incredibly nice and willing to go the extra mile to make sure we were satisfied, without us expecting her to do so. Good product and good service? It's a keeper.

Wow, all of this ice cream is essentially home made. I asked the owner the back story about how Hello Honey came to be and learned that she basically fell into it. She was making ice cream for friends and family and kept hearing people tell her to start a business. She and her husband were looking to work together and decided to go for it! Out came a beautiful gourmet ice cream boutique. 

The big selling point for me is that the flavors are incredibly unique. I got the impression that the owner creates the recipes herself. The staff is more than willing to let you try different ones before you make your final selection. I chose salted caramel and was in heaven!

I highly recommend stopping in and experiencing something you can't get any where else!

I will support.

DO:
-Fresh waffles topped with ice cream

DON'T:
-N/A

PARKING:
-Street parking

The price is good for the amount of ice cream you get. I would recommend getting the fresh waffle topped with ice cream. The ice cream was a bit too sweet and icy for my likings. But, I really hope this place stays in business for a long time and evolve into a 5 star joint. I'm thinking more on the 3.5 star end, but I will round up for encouragement. Go Hello Honey, go!

This place is so awesome as far as ice cream goes in Cincinnati. I actually prefer them to Grater's and UDF. So many flavors of homemade ice cream and then the toasted marshmallow is just a kicker on top. Now, with the additions of cakes and cookies to be used as well, it is just that much better. The name of this place is right, because when you walk in through the door, you will be saying "Hello Honey" for sure.

I'll give it a 4.5, but I'm feeling generous so I'll round up. The atmosphere is quite bland, but the ice cream is some of the best I've ever had. It is up there with fresh, homemade gelato I've had in Italy. I had Brown Butter Chip and I tasted Brownies and Cream (slightly less remarkable) and Salted Caramel.

I would encourage anyone and everyone to try it.

This ice cream shop is absolutely delightful!  Homemade ice creams in creative but very natural and palatable flavors, homemade waffle cones, and based on my experience with those items, I'm sure everything else is delectable as well.  Also, they strongly encourage you to taste ice cream flavors, which is wonderful for those of us who are decision-challenged.  

I know my way around the boutique ice cream scene in San Francisco.  (Yes, there is such a scene, and it's absurd and wonderful at the same time.)  If this place were in SF, there would be a line down the block waiting for their ice cream.  And the ice cream would be twice as expensive; I was shocked by how inexpensive our waffle cones heaped with ice cream were!  

In brief: go here!

I had the pleasure of visiting Hello Honey recently with a friend of mine. We went mid-afternoon and I was delighted to see how well the owners had redesigned the interior. It was very welcoming, minimalistic, and had bright, cheerful colors. The menu is designed well and easy to read. The owners are ADORABLE and very friendly. I felt welcomed.

I tried the vanilla and it was delicious! Hello Honey's ice cream was smooth and creamy, it held shape, and was reasonably priced. I also had the salted caramel and wow! It was FANTASTIC!

My trip to try Hello Honey was an hour drive and I'd gladly make the trip again.

This ice cream shop opened up near our office building just recently, so a coworker and I took the opportunity to go and try their wares during our lunch break. The owner makes all of the ice cream in the store, so its very fresh. They offer a wide variety of flavors, including the normal "boring" ones.

We agreed to split (it's definitely big enough to split) the honey toast (which takes 10 minutes to prepare) with the butter caramel cake ice cream. Unfortunately, we didn't plan enough time to eat in the store and had to request the item to go at the last minute, which apparently isn't recommended for the honey toast and the owner had reservations about serving it in this manner. She eventually put it in a box for us, and we ran out the door. We stopped briefly to taste our purchase and were more than pleased - the toast is warm, crunchy and buttery, and the ice cream matched it perfectly. I definitely hope to return and try some more of their flavors!

EDIT 1/2/2013:
Hello Honey is now one of my favorite locations in Cincinnati. I try to go in almost every day I'm downtown, and can't wait to try the new flavors every week. The absolute must have item with any ice cream you get is the toasted marshmallow. The marshmallows are homemade and will change everything you know about the sticky treat (I refuse to eat the ones from the store now). The fact that they're toasted in front of you with a blowtorch doesn't hurt either.

New items are being added to the menu all the time as well, so don't be afraid to try something new. I haven't had a bad trip yet!

I'm an ice cream fanatic. And this place was perfection. I've been trying for weeks to get here and finally did this Saturday. The wait was worth it. I opted for a weekly flavor - brownie and cream - in a dish. I was asked if I wanted a toasted marshmallow in top; when in Rome! (Answer: yes!) What a finishing touch to watch your fresh homemade marshmallow to be torched in front of you. The ice cream was rich, creamy, fresh, chocolate brownie perfection. But that marshmallow! The burnt sugary goodness with the chocolate creamy richness - insane! Saturday us officially hello honey day. I'd give 5 stars but those hours are tough to get there but once a week!
Best ice cream downtown. Fresh made to order waffle cones unique flavors that are changing all the time, great service,  house made marsh mellows toasted to order. Can't miss if you're downtown

Thank you for making delicious ice cream. I can not wait to go here again and again to try new flavors. Love that the menu is rotating so there is always something different depending on season and even maybe the week.

Hello Honey was referred to me by a coworker. We decided to venture about a block from work today to try this undiscovered ice cream secret. Let me tell you, it should be more discovered! The ice cream was to die for! I like it much more than a Graeters or Dairy Queen. The owner was extreme nice and let's you sample before you purchase. Flavors are updated weekly so there is always something new being featured. I tried the banana ice cream and strawberry sorbet. Both were excellent. It is definitely a repeat spot especially with summer fast approaching. I would recommend to all as this place is awesome!

I am a hometown Cincinnatian which is why it  feels almost blasphemous for me to say this, but this is the best ice cream place in the city. (Sorry Graeter's). I love the ever changing menu (every time I go in there's something new to love) and the homemade appeal to every item on the menu. The owner is very friendly and lets you try as many flavors as you like. I haven't had time to try the homemade waffle sundae, but assume it's delicious. The prices are good and the portions are generous. The only thing I wish is that they would extend their weekend hours as I would love to grab a late night dessert here. Overall however, this place is terrific and I encourage everyone to try.
Great place to treat yourself does not matter how cold outside is. Their serving will brighten you up! Love it!

It is hard to say anything bad about this place. Gone a few times with the family and the handmade ice cream is flawless and presentation is perfect. The staff is probably the most friendly in all Cincy. The only issue I had was the size and limited seating. With two or three groups of people there will be no room on the place. It is destined to be a classic of Cincinnati soon.

I love this small ice cream shop. Everything tastes so fresh. I tried a sample of salted caramel, but went with honey lavender. I don't think you can go wrong with any flavor they sell! If you're in the area, this is a must visit!!!

Homemade ice cream with delightful service.  Going to Hello Honey is always a nice adventure to try different, interesting ice cream flavors.  The owner is consistently nice and not in a rush.  I enjoyed eating here.
Best dessert yet! Hidden jem! Get the roasted marshmallow!!! So good!!!!!
Hidden gem! I wish they had more hours and were in Northside, but I love it anyway. Great people serving amazing deserts.

Hello Honey! Where have you been all my life?! I got espresso hazelnut and it was to die for. I think I could live off of that ice cream. It would be a short and sweet existence. I came near closing on Saturday and unfortunately they only had one marshmallow left. I martyred myself by letting my husband take it. Thankfully he was generous enough to let me have a couple bits. Oh my goodness. It was so good. I'm definitely going back!

This ice cream is incredible. It is so smooth and creamy!! The flavor varieties are great! The shop owner was so sweet and gracious too. The shop was very clean and I liked the modern feel of the decor.

Tried this the first time yesterday! Got banana chocolate chip (they were out of the toasted marshmallow). It was really good and reasonably priced! The flavors are definitely different than most other ice cream shops. 

The people working there were friendly and willing to explain the flavors to you, and allow you to try any flavor.

The downside is the hours, we like ice cream later in the evening so the only time we could really get here to eat was on a weekend during the day.

Hands down the best ice cream in Cincinnati!  Who else makes your waffle cones to order and can put a homemade roasted marshmallow on top of your ice cream?!  The ice cream is delicious and the texture top notch.  Sorry to all you Cincinnati natives who are set on Graters - this place puts them to shame.

INCREDIBLE little ice cream shop!!  SO many delicious looking flavors and options that I was almost overwhelmed (in the best way possible).  The woman behind the counter was very warm and friendly, and encouraged me to sample as many flavors as I wanted-- as a matter of fact, she was so accommodating that I'm sure she would have given me 100 samples if I had asked.  This trip, I sampled the Brown Butter Caramel, Salted Caramel, and another one I'm pretty sure was called "Banana Heartbreaker"-- and they all, needlessly to say, were TO DIE FOR!  I finally settled for a pint of the Brown Butter Caramel, which reminds me of those Worther's caramels with Toffee bits mixed in-- I will DEFINITELY be back and I recommend you do the same!!

One word... HUGE TOASTED MARSHMELLOW!  Okay so that is actually 3 words but who cares they have HUGE TOASTED MARSHMELLOWS!.  So one of the benefits of living and working downtown is that I can walk out my front door, aimlessly walk around and discover hidden little gems that seemingly pop up over night tucked away under bad/non-existant signage and homogenous and previous abandoned  store fronts. I saw this place a couple of months ago but did not stop for a visit (ice cream during winter never made sense to me) but I filed in my mind as a have to try.  So like a true cincinnatian as soon as the weather broke 50 i put on my flip flops and headed to Hello Honey.  It was so worth the wait.  The ice cream is so rich and a flavorful and the toasted homemade marshmellow is better than any cherry.  I will def be back.

I keep coming back for the new flavors.  The owners are nice and friendly, very patient for new comers.  Decor is a little on the cheap side and no easy parking.  Its okay to roll in and get something to go if you park out front (beware, can be ticketable!) They recently added some cakes and pastry items which are very delicious.

Banana Foster !!! OMG if your sweet tooth gets the best of you and you have learned to appreciate caramelized bananas this dessert is one of the best I've had in a while. Great work Hello Honey! I'll see you again !!!

Ok, this review is way overdue, but here it is! We had the special lavender raspberry ice cream with the Dutch chocolate, in a homemade, made-to-order waffle bowl.  Who makes the waffles cones to order?! Amazing, crispy yet tender and went perfectly with the ice cream.

Ice cream: lavender can be a hard ingredient to use as it can get too flowery, but the combo with raspberry was perfect. A nice hint of lavender without feeling like you're eating potpourri.  

We also took 2 slices of the homemade cake to go, green tea and orange.  So incredibly light and fluffy.

We were visiting from Chicago and honestly, I wish Hello Honey would move to our town! You get what you pay for (which is completely reasonable in the first place): quality, unique flavors, rich ice cream, as well as great small business customer service.

You can't go wrong with this place, LOVE IT!!!
They have the absolute best ice cream I've ever had. To top off the amazing ice cream, the owners are so incredibly kind and pleasant.

We love ice cream as a family and are picky about it, this is GREAT ICE CREAM! Home-made ice cream, home-made marshmallows (which they toast while you wait and then place on top of the ice cream), home-made everything. Awesome stuff. Not to mention the owners are great, and talked with us for a half hour even though we walked in a few minutes before close. As a man, I can honestly say my favorite flavor was honey lavender, I ordered it based on the owners recommendation and hope they have it again next time. All four of our kids ate and loved the brownie and my wife enjoyed the caramel with cake chunks in it.  After sampling every flavor (all of them we great) we decided we had to come back and try something different next time.

Hello Honey is FANTASTIC.  I personally think it blows Graeters out of the water.  It's more in line with the delicacies of Aglamesis' or Jenny's from Columbus.  My dad has been making icecream at home since I can remember, and the flavors that come with fresh ingredients and absolutely no artificial flavoring is so much better than the processed ice creams.

I sampled the Strawberry Sorbet, Brown Butter Caramel, and Pistachio.  All were really yummy.  The Strawberry Sorbet, which is what I like to get from Graeter's, was much fresher and tasted more like frozen strawberries than sugar.

I walked away with Salted Caramel ice cream with a homemade marshmallow on top!  They even torch the marshmallow to order!

I think the place could use a little bit more decor to lighten the atmosphere - I'm thinking like Yagoot, something fun and colorful, kind of funky. But the flavors and customer service are right on the nose.

Kudos to you for trying something daring in a city known for ice cream! Good luck with your venture, you definitely have one regular right here!

Love Love Love the butter cake icecream (which actually has cake in it) and the torched homemade marshmallow on top, I thought it would be too which but it wasn't. I also tried the lavender chocolate chip as a pallate cleanser (it was also great). Officially addicted
The best ice cream in Cincinnati! Small batches of unique flavors, I haven't found one I didn't like. Each one is better with a homemade toasted marshmallow. Love it!

Absolutely love this place and am never disappointed. My fav is brown butter carmel with a toasted marshmallow. I saw another review that hated on the marshmallow- I have no idea where that came from. The marshmallows are torched right in front of you and smooth and creamy. The "torched" parts taste just like the caramelized sugar on creme brûlée.  It's a must try!!!! The flavor combinations are ingenious. The owners are super friendly. A must try if you are in downtown Cincinnati.

The cutest little ice cream shop you'll find downtown. All handmade, there is always a plethora of new flavors to try along with the menu staples (and my favorites) such as Cookies & Pie and Brownie & Cream. They also have pints to go.
The ice cream is fantastic with a lot of unique flavor options. The only downsides are the coat and hours. The toasted marshmallow is a great treat also.

Customer service and personality go a long way with me.  My first impression of Hello Honey was positive because of those two aspects being made priority today.  I had been traveling for the first three weeks Hello Honey was open.  Finally back home, today I had a double scoop of dark chocolate, almond, & coconut paired with butterscotch cake.  The flavors were okay.  They were not spectacular, it was not memorable.  The texture was rough and icy.  Ice crystals were clearly visible in the dark chocolate.  In all honesty, I was not impressed with the product.  However, there are many menu options and I plan on returning to sample more.  The wife of the owning couple and one employee were present.  They were inviting, pleasant, and we carried a good conversation.  As a supporter and proponent of local, small business I don't want to blast this ice cream shop because I did not enjoy today's offering.  I recommend everyone try it once and form their own opinion.  I am glad to see another small business in the CBD.  And hey, even bad ice cream is better than no ice cream!

I went to Hello Honey as part of a Dish Crawl event, which is a new event in Cincinnati.  I had heard about it but typically do  not go to ice cream places, since I try not to eat it that much.  I had their sea salt carmel which was served with a brownie, I saw on their website they normally service it with a toasted marshmellow.  It was really good.  They stayed open late that night for the event, which I thought was great of them to do.   I would recomend it to others, they have some great varieties of ice cream and forzen yougurt.  They use alIl fresh natural ingrediants which I like.  I may have to break my basic thing about trying not to go to ice cream places.  We have some great gelato places around findlay market and we have a greaters downtown. Hello Honey is a great addition to downtown to have the variety and creatively of the gelato's places in OTR, but something that is downtown.  I hope during the summer they think about opening their place later at night especially during events.  Graeters did not do this for awhile after they first opened and when they did, they seem to do very good business.  Hello Honey is close enough to fountain square, I think they could do good business later on at night during the summer months.

This is the Cincinnati version of Jeni's Ice cream, and  I do not in anyway mean that as an insult to Hello Honey.   For years, I've made Jeni's a required stop whenever I'm in Columbus.  Now, Cincinnati has it's own artisinal ice cream shop and it is absolutely amazing.  I could not but sample five different flavors before making a decision and they were all delicious.  To top things off, you can get your very own, homemade, toasted marshmallow with your ice cream.
Great homemade ice cream and waffle bowls and cones. The waffle sundae is an experience. Also, everything here is better with a toasted marshmallow on top.

Awesome unique flavors. Have to recommend the Maple Walnut or Guiness Chocolate, but the kind owners have let me sample so many other favors that I can vouche for those as well. I enjoy that the flavors switch out every week and I have to say that the homemade marshmallow slab torched on top of the ice cream is so hard to resist once you've had it. Really hope more people in Cincinnati get out there and enjoy this. Only downside is its right next to my office building and I'm tempted every time I step out onto the sidewalk!

LOVE Hello Honey!! Best ice cream in Cincinnati! So rich and creamy! Went in today to buy a pint as a gift for a friend and walked out with that and a treat for me! Couldn't resist (even though it was only 30 degrees outside)! The Salty Caramel and the Espresso are my favorite flavors.....Malted Chocolate isn't so bad either or the Malted Milk.....maybe I have a few favorites!!! Come on in and support this wonderful local ice cream shop! Don't wait for summer!!!

Go here and eat their amazing creations and be happy!  We all eat too much bad ice cream, so do yourself a favor and have some that is amazingly fresh and all home made. I had honey vanilla covered in a strawberries and Pinot Noir reduction with just the right size dollop of fresh whipped cream. The two cherries on top were fresh dark red cherries!  Delicious.  My husband tried "party in your mouth" with a homemade marshmallow on top that my son loved watching being roasted with a tiny torch right before our eyes. My son had Dutch chocolate in a small waffle cone that was made on the spot when we ordered so it was still warm!  The staff was so friendly and helpful you wouldn't have known that we showed up just before closing time. Clean, simple modern look with warm atmosphere and very fair prices. Parking on the street was not too bad even on a Saturday during a Reds game.  We will be back way more often than is good for our waistlines and blood sugar, but hey- we need to try the ice cream sandwich they make with two donuts.

Since our favorite local ice cream place has closed down for the season, we've started walking here for our treats. My partner's son and I require gluten free and dairy free options so I was really excited to find out Graeters offers four safe sorbet options.

The flavors available are lemon, raspberry, mango and watermelon. We have tried them all and decided raspberry and mango are the best.  My partner always gets a black raspberry chocolate chip. His flavor would definitely win in a taste test. If only it was available in gluten and dairy free!

Service here is fast and feels safe. There are a few benches nearby to sit and eat. Or you could cross the street and eat while walking on Wasson Way.

Solid, awesome Graeter's. The only bummer is the weird parking lot. But inside you'll find the same amazing ice cream, of course. 

Over the holidays, hubby loves to get the egg nog and/or the peppermint. I think their cinnamon in the best of season. 

But my go-to flavors are the Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip and the S'mores. Sometimes topped with hot fudge, butterscotch and sprinkles. Yum!

If you've never been to Graeter's you gotta check it out. They have the biggest, best, most epically amazing chocolate chips you will ever find anywhere. Seriously, they will change your life!

Ok these chocolate chips are AMAZING. Any chip flavors are so rich. The classic flavor is Black raspberry chocolate chip. In my opinion, you don't need extra fudge or sprinkles or anything, just a scoop or two of an appealing flavor.

This is a new #graeters ice cream shop for me. I attempted to get one of their new seasonal ice cream flavors here about a month ago and they were closed. Then about 2 weeks ago I stopped here again on my way home from work to get two scoops of their very well received caramel macchiato chip. My daughter wanted me to get some for her as she and her family were out of town and sometimes these seasonal flavors are gone too fast like the black forest cake flavor. I was thrilled to see that they were open! Again I parked on the side street just across from the store by the bowling alley. I find this to be very convenient.                                                                   When I entered there was constant foot traffic but it wasn't too busy. #Covid19 precautions were in place including facemasks and social distancing. This store is similar in size to the #otr Vine Street location. All of the customers looked to be students at XU. I was next in line and was glad to find that the flavor was available. I ordered two scoops for myself & 2 scoops for my daughter in a cup that to take home and put in the freezer. There were three employees. I was quickly greeted by a friendly employee. The female student who helped me said that all of the employees there were Xavier students. There are apartments for the Xavier students just around the corner. I find it cool that #graeters is there to provide employment for the students. It took about 3 to 4 minutes to  be served and walk out the door with two cups with lids of the #caramelmacchiatochip flavor in a bag with napkins and spoons. I really like the location of this #graeters.                                   I eventually tried my 2 scoops. It was very good. It was creamy, cold and had more than enough chocolate chips! Until next time stay healthy & be kind to each other. @yelpcincy #graeters #icecream #summertimetreat #xavier #xu

Never been here and already gonna miss it lol. This ice cream is amazing. I had the coconut chocolate chip and man oh man. My daughter got a cookie dough chunk and she swears by it. I'm not a huge ice cream fan and I'd come back in a heartbeat.
Wow. First time here, and ice cream was great. Never seen so many variations of chocolate chip ice cream. Raspberry one is fantastic.

This is undoubtedly some quality ice cream. I sampled multiple flavors and they were all good. I especially liked the Banana Cream Pie flavor. However, I opted for a Carmel Coffee Frozen drink that was really disappointing. 

The drink is advertised as being caramel ice cream with a shot of espresso overtop - but it's really a kind of milkshake that is more milk and ice than anything else. I could hardly taste the caramel and I couldn't taste the espresso at all. The only flavor came from the caramel syrup on top. 

The service was okay - there was only one person working, though, so when I came in with my family (8 of us) he seemed kind of flustered. It made ordering and just being there in general kind of awkward - especially when other people came in. It was weird to me that only one person was working on a hot Saturday evening. 

I hope to come back and try some more ice cream but I'll definitely just stick with the basics.
The ice cream is good as it is at every graters. There was quick and friendly service. It's also nice and cool in there which is great since it's so hot outside in the summer.

Been wanting to try a Graeters for awhile, every time I've visited Cincinnati and always forget to do so.
 Yesterday finally tried it out and was very happy and pleased! I tried the Key Lime Pie ice cream, it was freakin awesome! Was like  I was eating a slice of pie!
 As for the staff, they were very friendly and this place is kept very clean. 
 So in conclusion, next time I'm in Cincy, Graeters will probably be a routine stop for me!
It was good, really good. It was clean, good service, and a great way to escape the heat, would recommend their malts.

I absolutely love Graeter's and our most recent visit was perfectly fine. My reason for two stars is one night we went closer to closing time, and the doors were locked and the girl cleaning the store just kind of looked at us and kept cleaning. The store wasn't even supposed to be closed yet. I know it can be a pain having people come in a little before closing, but you should serve customers until the time you are supposed to. We ended up going else wear for our ice cream fix.

Nothing in life is constant, but my Saturday afternoon ritual of visiting this establishment will likely not end any time soon.  Every time I've been here, the employees have been incredibly knowledgeable and patient. Go ahead: ask them what the difference between ice cream and gelato is. They would be happy to tell you. Not only that, but they actually encourage you to try different flavors. At other ice cream parlors, you usually get the impatient looks and frustrated sighs, but at Graeter's you just don't get that. 

With all that being said, I haven't even mentioned the product yet. So far, there hasn't been a flavor I didn't like, but my top recommendation is a waffle cone with a scoop of black raspberry chocolate chip and a scoop of mocha chocolate chip. Enjoy!

What is there to say? I love Graeter's and this one is in the perfect location for Xavier students. It's located in UStation and has free parking behind the store and street parking. The workers are always friendly and usually students. Accepts XCash for XU students and also has UberEATS pick up and coupons. They always have the flavors of the month right away. They're especially friendly to my friend with a peanut allergy and open a new tub with a clean spoon when she orders something. They don't have a Bakery case inside like some Graeter's but usually have some cookies. They have free calendars for the ice cream flavors of the month and are always in stock for the free rewards. They  can be expensive if you love cotton candy ice cream - which can't be bought in a pint  but they also do a lot of charity fundraiser and have the best decoration during the holidays.
Super clean, cute, cozy, and courteous staff! Very friendly staff, and fast as one can be serving up quality ice cream! We will be here weekly at a minimum!!!:-)

First time here.  Staff super helpful and friendly.   Many choices of ice cream desserts, and specialty items. Selected a sorbet. The raspberry sorbet was good.   Lots of college students here, but staff patiently waited and helped everyone.   Will go back when in Cincinnati.
This Graeters is great! Only downside is the location - hard to get into if you're driving on the other side of the road.

This is for the Greater's on XU's campus. It's always been a little odd, but tonight a grown woman who should probably be a bit more intuitive served my wife and I. When we walked in, there was a younger girl making something for a customer while the woman that would help us was ringing him up at the register - up to this point no issues. She eventually came over to help us after a fairly long interaction with the gentleman at the register. We were finally greeted. We asked to try a new flavor, and she continued to serve everyone else that had trickled in behind us. We actually had to TAKE our turn from her before she gave it away - weird, but still not a big deal, just rather inefficient and a little irritating. I asked for a single scoop and my wife got a "kids" scoop. Mine was VERY small. My wife's kids scoop was even smaller. The odd service and really small portions were not worth the $7.25 cost. This is the most convenient Greater's location to my home, but I may have to go elsewhere in the future.

As a side note: Greater's is a quality product. This review only reflects this experience.

The ice cream and sodas are great as always.  This location looks like one of the newest.  It's in the ground floor of apartments on the edge of the Xavier campus and there's parking around the back of the building with a convenient walk-through area to access Graeters.  
This location does not use the Graeters Rewards Cards!  Graeters is rolling out a new rewards program beginning here.  Points and rewards you've earned so far do carry forward to the new system.  The new rewards system uses a smartphone app called LoyalTree.  For those of us with smartphones it's really convenient.  Used to we had to keep track of our rewards receipts and turn in a receipt to redeem our reward because Graeters kept no record of rewards associated with our rewards card.  LoyalTree keeps track of everything, so no more saving receipts.
I don't know what kind of reward system there will be going forward for people without smartphones.  Hopefully Graeters has thought that through.

All the locals know Graeter's is the place to go for premium ice cream. Their sundaes rock also. I was excited to see this new location right next to Xavier University. We were visiting family there and decided to stop in. You cannot go wrong with any of their flavors that involve chocolate chips (or should I say chocolate chunks?).
